1.content:
She wasn’t going to last much longer. She had lived for thousands of years and now it was her turn to pass on the gift or curse to the next generation. The gift was called many things over the ages and before her time. The most common term now was ‘Vampire’. However, there was so much fiction surrounding it that there was hardly any truth to it. For starters she was and would be the only Vampire to walk the world while she remained a Vampire. There was not turning her victims and as long as she had this gift she wouldn’t be able to have children. There was no way to find companionship that would last as long as she has and did and that was what made this gift a curse. She had worked hard in developing a mythic and fictions base to surround her gift to protect whoever she handed it off to.

Her name was Isibelle and she was at the end of her long life. One could only be the ‘Vampire’ for a period of 2100 years before their flesh and bone turned to ash and the gift/curse would transfer randomly to the next life form, human or animal. For this reason she needed to find someone that was worthy of the gift. She had been watching someone ever since she knew this year to be her last. She was both dreading and eagerly awaiting her end. She had outlived countless lovers, husbands, adopted children and their families. She was tired but also hopeful for this new blood she had been associating with over the last few months and she knew that if there was anyone to pass the gift to it would be this person. Although young, the one in question was exactly what she was looking for to pass her gift and curse along.

This person is you but who are you???

Option 1) You are a young boy named Caleb, 12 years old. You had just entered Junior High at a private Christian school no more than 5 blocks from your home. Your family is a close and very loving family but also very strict morally. They have brought you and your 2 brothers and one sister up very well, according to other people that say how well mannered you are; going to church, helping out the elderly and you other relatives, and working for others for free to develop your character and work ethic. Despite not being very good at school and usually struggling to get a 2.0 GPA you and your family live happily and are content with life and loyal to each other.

Option 2) You are a young girl named Ashley, 11 years old. You had just entered Junior High at a private Christian school no more than 5 blocks from your home. Your family is a close and very loving family but also very strict morally. They have brought you and your 2 brothers and one sister up very well, according to other people that say how well mannered you are; going to church, helping out the elderly and you other relatives, and working for others for free to develop your character and work ethic. Despite not being very good at school and usually struggling to get a 2.0 GPA you and your family live happily and are content with life and loyal to each other.

Option 3) You are a young man named Broc, 17 years old. You are the Captain of the football team at your public school and Home Coming King 2 years in a row and hopefully making your junior year be the third. Your outside appearance is a very healthy, popular, prosperous guy that is out going and kind to the women in your life while rustic with the men. However behind the scenes your parents are grooming you to be the one thing that brings them out of their poverty. You are constantly beaten and thrown into activities that enhance yourself, sometimes more than you should. This makes you have a deep loathing toward them and hope to get away from your current life. However you are young and don’t really know what is in store for you. School is the one good thing in your life and your friends there are your life line, just as long as they don’t come to where you live you will be ok.

Option 4) You are a young woman named Andrea, 18 years old. You are the captain of the cheer squad at your public and very liberal school. You are in your senior year and, as far as school goes have a bright future ahead of you. Bright, beautiful, athletic, smart, outgoing, kind, and a sure winner for any bet one could make. However your home life is a literal hell hole. Your drunk father is always in his chair with a beer in his hand. Your mother constantly fills that beer in order to keep his hands off of you. However she feels you owe her for it so she lets you know in more ways than one. She knows you are looked over at school and is smart enough not to abuse you to make a mark that others can see. However that doesn’t stop her from abusing you in other ways and making an actual effort to make sure you don’t rise above what she has amounted to. Even to the point of sabotaging your school life, your one pride and joy. This area of your life has made you sympathetic to other kids that are down and otherwise picked on at school. While you are obviously popular and sought after at school, you make a strong effort to reach out and get to know the unpopular students that you would guess are in the same boat you are in but without your natural devices to get them out of it. It is just one of the many things that make you so attractive.

Option 5) This spot is for you to fill if you don’t see one you like above. However, since there are probably more than one option, make sure you leave at least one spot open for others to make a profile they can chose and write on.

11.content:
You are not really the most popular person around. In fact you were pretty pathetic socially and were clueless when it came to relationships and the opposite sex. However your loving family was more than enough to compensate for that. You were overall average and nice guy by many standards. Brown hair, average size, brown eyes, a thick German build (from your father’s side), skinny despite the average weight class in your family adults was 350 lbs and the children usually followed suit. You had glasses but wasn’t exactly a book nerd. In fact if you were than you probably would’ve gotten better at school. No you mostly worked with your father and your brothers with odd jobs for no profit at church, your multiple relative’s homes, charities that your family and church was involved in, and other people around your neighborhood. Because of this you and your brothers had lots of naturally strong muscles but not a lot of show like those in your class that were already lifting weights and getting a desirable figure. Your older sister was starting to rebel a little as she hit high school, as well as trying to get some boys to like her. It was always fun to see your father talk with the boys that called for her.

One of the things you did was mow the lawn and shovel for the entire neighborhood. And not with a snow blower or riding lawn mower, no those cost way too much. You and your brothers used three pushing lawn mowers for mowing the lawn and shovels for… well shoveling snow, and in Wisconsin you had a lot of it at periodic times. And of course after you got done with your neighborhood you still had your grandparents’ houses and the church to do. But for all the work you did it did give you a sense of pride at the end of the day, that you were able to get so much done and make so many people happy. You loved to watch people’s faces when they came to give you money for your hard work and you just told them that you wanted to do it and not for the money. They would first try to force you to take it but after you insisted not to they would look at you as if you were an angel in troubled times. Perhaps that is why your father made you and your brothers do it like that.

“Now we’ll have none of that young man. I insist that you at least get a nice cold drink for your efforts.” Said a pretty young woman by the name of Isibelle.

She was one of the people on the block that you visited more often, and as you grew older your family teased you for how young she looked. She had insisted the first couple times that you take something for your efforts as she didn’t liking being in dept. It took her talking with your father to have him rearrange your schedule to allow her to entertain you for your troubles. You don’t know what she said to him as he was usually unmovable in such things but now it was a weekly thing to go to her house and talk with her. You almost got the feeling that she was older than she was letting on but you didn’t mind as she talked with you about a lot of things, from philosophy to what girls you liked at school. She was like a younger version of your grandmother, on your mother’s side. You two had gotten very close in that regard so much that she would tell you things that you would think to be fiction, as you didn’t think she was old enough to remember WWII but the way she said it made you believe she was actually there.

“Thank you Miss. Isibelle.” You said with a smile as she led you into her living room with a glass of ice cold lemonade ready for you.

“How many times do I have to tell you to just call me Isibelle?” She asked.

“Well my Papa always said to speak to my elders with respect.” You answered nervously as she sounded like she was correcting you and you didn’t wish to be rude.

“Oh Caleb, you can call me anything you want. You’re such a polite young boy.” she said and hugged you to her chest. You were just getting old enough where you were beginning to shy away from such affectionate touch and she seemed to get a kick out of exploiting that embarrassing age and her good looks. However, again, the way she said it made you thing that she was your grandmother or at least that old. Only older people talked to you and your brothers like that. She let go and sat in a chair to an angle but still facing you.

“Uh, Miss. Isibelle?” you asked as you took a sip of your lemonade.

“Yes Caleb?” she asked back.

“I don’t mean to pry but you seem troubled today.” You asked as you noticed that, unlike her usual assertive nature, she was passive and reclusive today. She almost seemed like she was preparing to go away for a long trip.

“Well Caleb, I don’t suppose I can hide anything from you at this point can I? You’re such a smart boy and we’ve known each other a while haven’t we. Yes there is something I would like to ask you Caleb.” She stated to which you sat up and took a big gulp of your lemonade before placing it on a coaster and paying strict attention to her, trying not to look down her neckline or up her skirt. “W… what do you think about vampires?” she asked rather blunt but shakily.

“Uh… I don’t really know what you mean.” You returned.

“Well, what do you think about them. I mean, you go to church and stuff so you must think something about them. Plus you have a rather open mind so I was wondering what you thought of them.” she said. You knew that she also went to church and lately to the same one you and your family went to.

“Well Papa sais their fake… if that’s what you mean. But I guess if they were real... I don’t know. People at church say that they would be evil but I’ve never really read anywhere in the Bible that says anything against Vampires in particular. I guess it would be hard to say without knowing what one actually is like. I mean if they are really evil then I wouldn’t like them very much, but if they are nice like you then I wouldn’t mind meeting one. Actually I really like movies with them in it and sometimes pretend at home that I am one. It is fun to play with sometimes and I always dress up as one on Halloween.” You said as you rambled. But she seemed to really smile when you said you would like them if they were ‘as nice as her’.

“Caleb, do you trust me?” she asked.

“I… sure I do. Why?” you asked.

“Well I was wondering… Ok you have to promise me something. You have to promise me that you will listen and trust that I would never harm you.” she said. The way she said it made it sound like she was about to do something like shooting an arrow at an apple on top of your head. While you might’ve politely declined and excused yourself from other people’s houses you already did trust her quite a bit. Like you had thought, she was like a young version of your Grandmother.

“I promise Miss Isibelle. I won’t run away or anything. I will stay and listen.” You said as you tried covering all the points you thought she wanted to hear. She then leaned forward in the room and in her chair to address you more seriously. Something that you had rarely seen her do. She was you usually very playful and kind so this was rather strange and nerve wrecking for you. It was a side you had never seen of her before.

112.content:
“You see Caleb I don’t have much time and you are perfect for what I have in mind. What if I told you I was a vampire?” she asked as she partially rambled but looked at you with her blood red eyes that always fascinated you. From a distance they looked brown but when someone was this close they were unmistakably red. She seemed unusually serious and anxious as she asked you this. That made you wonder and almost accept that she might be one. You thought about it for a moment and she sat there patiently for your answer as the minutes went by.

“I… I guess I would have a lot of questions and be skeptical to say the least. Like I said Miss. Isibelle, I don’t know what one is like. So if you were one and you were evil then I would politely ask to leave or offer my life for you to spar my family in the future. But… if you were and you weren’t evil than… I would have to say… I would be a little… nervous and full of questions. I mean, I’ve seen you come out into the sunlight before and everything I’ve ever known or seen in movies say that sunlight kills Vampires so…” you answered as you stuttered and nervously tried to tiptoe around how you said it but you weren’t very good with words and more often than not put your foot in your mouth.

“Caleb… you really are a wonderful boy and will grow to be a wonderful young man.” She said as she was obviously hiding something at this point and you had both a fear and hope that is was her being a Vampire. But if that was the case then what did she want with you? “Caleb, I am going to be completely honest with you. I am a Vampire.” She said bluntly but segmented it so that you were ready to receive the information. The fact hit you and you braced against the chair a little. You stared at her wide eyed for a moment but then looked passed her as you processed what she said. You brought the option of her joking but her expression had been strangely serious all day. All the little details about her made sense if you threw in the Vampire angle. Perhaps it was because you were so young but you found yourself believing her and wanting to know more.

“I… M… Miss. Isibelle? If you are… what do you want with me?” you asked, obviously nervous and she could obviously see it.

“Caleb, I told you already that I wouldn’t harm you and that I don’t have much time.” She said as she put a hand on yours but you went rigid to her touch and wondered why her hand wasn’t as cold as you would think a vampire’s hand would be, granted it was colder than normal people’s but not freezing like in the movies. She retracted her hand as she saw it doing more harm than good then waited for you to respond. She put on a smile that she knew you liked despite the fact that she obviously didn’t like how you were taking it. This realization hit you and you calmed down a little, took a deep breath, then continued.

“I… I meant why you have me here?” you asked with a clear sign that you were wondering if she was needing you blood.

“Oh… oh that’s what you meant. No Caleb, I am not going to suck your blood. If it makes you feel better I am not evil. If I was, do you think I could go to church with you?” She asked.

“No, if you were evil that God wouldn’t allow you to go inside much less touch the Bible and other stuff inside.” You answered and became a little more relaxed now that she revealed that much. “Miss. Isibelle, I don’t wish to be rude but… can you show me? I am having a hard time believing it. I trust you but I… well you don’t fit hardly any of what I would expect from a Vampire. Like I said, I’ve seen you in the sunlight and you aren’t pale by any means.” You asked.

“Ok, I can show you a little.” She said. First she smiled then lifted her lip and her fangs shot out about an inch passed her other teeth then she retracted them as you reeled back a little but stayed seated. Next she held out her hand and it evaporated into ash then came back. Lastly she produced some fire on it’s palm then clenched it to put the flame out. “I’m afraid that is all I can do at the moment. You see, I worked hard over the years to put those conceptions of Vampires out there for the world to see. That way if someone were to say that I was one I could just walk outside into the sun and prove them wrong. I don’t have to drink blood and when I do it doesn’t have to be human. But blood is like gas for my vampire powers and I haven’t drank any for… about 20 years. So I am understandably weak at the moment.” She explained.

“Ok, but I must ask again; why am I here?” you asked, not sure why she was telling all this to you, a 12 year old human all her secrets. It was as if she could read your mind as she continued.

“Caleb, unlike the legends that I helped create, Vampires can’t live forever. I am not Immortal in that aspect. And I can’t infect others like the legends say. I am the only vampire and I can only live for 2100 years. Then, wither I want to or not, I will turn to ash and this gift will be passed to another randomly. The only way for me to ensure that the next vampire is one of my choosing is to pass on the gift myself to someone I deem worthy and I’ve chosen you.” She explained and the last bit hit you hard. You couldn’t believe what you were hearing. You had so many questions and so many concerns that you started to feel light headed. “Calm down.” She said in a voice that commanded your body to obey and you did as she commanded or rather your body did. It was obvious to you that it was one of her powers but which one?

“You… you want to make me… a… Vampire?” you asked in disbelief.

“Not a Vampire Caleb, the Vampire. You would be the only one as there are no others, just me and no way to change that. I only added that part to the legend to add another reason why I wasn’t one if one were to track me here. I know you have many questions but unfortunately I am running out of time. You see it will be 2100 years tomorrow and I have chosen you to receive this gift. I can answer your questions until late into the night but know that if you don’t accept I must find someone that will. I won’t force you Caleb.” She said with her usual kindness in her voice. You never expected her to be a vampire, and now that she was one you didn’t think she would be so nice and gentle. You had so many questions but she an answer or to find someone else very quickly.

1123.content:
“I can’t really say no can I? I mean I can but if I said no and you were as bad as the reason why I would say that then you’d do it anyway. On the off chance that you weren’t then I would be leaving you to die by yourself, and I couldn’t do that either. And if what you’re saying is true then if I don’t take this… ‘gift’ then it is possible it will randomly choose someone that might do what I am afraid an evil Vampire would do. So I guess I accept but I have some major questions that need answering before you… well make me a Vampire, the Vampire.” You answered. To this she couldn’t control herself and gave you a hug, almost squeezing the life out of you. But it was one that you had gotten before and you just, slowly, hugged her back. If you were really going to become a Vampire then you would want people to treat you the same and being afraid of a hug because of you or her proximity to your neck wouldn’t be something you would want. After about 5 minutes she let go and sat back down.

“I knew you were the right one Caleb, I just knew it. But you’re right, you should ask all you questions now because I won’t be around afterwards.” She said with a smile.

“You won’t?” you asked.

“No, when a Vampire gives their essence to another the thousands of years they lived are put into play, turning our bodies to dust. In a sense, this gift is the only thing that holds our bodies together after about 100 years. But don’t think you are killing me by accepting. Like I said, I die tonight anyway and would rather you get this gift than some random guy who may use it to commit great evil.” She explained.

“Ok.” you said as you looked down. You weren’t expecting that she would die as a result of this. But before you could dwell on it you were pulled into her so that she was holding you on her coach with a hug of sorts like a mother does to her child when comforting. How you got from your chair to the coach was beyond you but you had to assume it was another of a true vampire’s powers. “Ok, I better ask while I still have you here to answer then.”

“I suppose you should.” She said as she let you go and instead held your hand so you could talk while still feel her strangely calming touch to your skin. It was as if her very presence forbid you from panicking or feeling sad.

“I guess I should get this out of the way. What are the strengths and weaknesses of a real vampire that I have to watch out for?” you asked. She smiled as she saw your mind turning to the possibilities of what your new life would bring.

“Well, the only weakness we do have is silver but not in the way you think. Silver keeps me from using my abilities and you will find that I… we have a lot of them. I only ashed when staked by hunters to bring forth the legend that if you stab a Vampire in the heart or cut off our head we die. That isn’t true. The ONLY way for us to die is to pass on the gift. However, Silver will prevent you from using your new abilities, even the enhanced strength and speed you will receive. I sometimes wear silver jewelry to live a normal life for a few decades, but we still don’t age so it gets tiring but it is possible.” she explained.

“So all the sunlight, crosses, garlic, wooden steaks, burning,…?” you started.

“All lies that I’ve spread over the years to protect you. I didn’t always know you would be the one but with so many people already knowing, or think they know, what works on a Vampire it should protect you. Although the silver one is kind of a pain in the… butt.” She interrupted to answer your question but also censoring herself. “But I guess not drinking blood could be perceived as a weakness as well. You see blood, like I said before, is like our gas for the abilities we have. If you use too many of your abilities then you will find yourself craving blood to fill your gas tank as it were. I would recommend a dairy cow or something big enough to sink your fangs into, a human will only attract attention if you don’t know how to heal them afterwards.” She said.

“Heal them afterwards?” you asked.

“Don’t worry about it, you will receive the genetic knowledge of how to use your abilities when you fully turn. But I guess I could answer that on by showing you, if you will allow me?” she asked as she raised your arm. You nodded to which she smiled and brought it close to her mouth. “You see my, and your future, saliva acts both as an anesthetic and a minor healing agent. So we can feed on people in their sleep without them knowing, like this.” she said as she protruded her fangs and dug into your arm. You flinched as you expected to feel pain but instead it felt almost orgasmic. She only drank for a little bit, maybe a second or two, then removed her fangs and held your arm for you to see. It had some blood on it but not holes where her still protruding fangs had entered.

“You… that felt… why is there…” you stuttered as you wiped away the small amount of blood to reveal nothing where there should be at least an indent if not gaping holes where her teeth went in.

“You see, it acts quickly and yes it doesn’t feel bad at all, does it? Personally I think it feels as good as sex, especially on my end which is the last weakness we have.” She answered then licked what was left of your blood from your arm and put it back down, embracing your hand in hers. “You see, you will find that drinking blood is like… eating sex I guess. That is why I suggest you drink from something like a cow or something that has a lot of blood to start. The human body only has a limited amount. So if you give yourself over to your cravings and urges like humans do, then you can easily kill your meal while draining them of all their blood, and without you knowing it until they lay limp in your arms. I… it will happen to you eventually, it happens to all of us at least once. So if you remember anything remember that your kindness and care for humans will save you. If you don’t care about them then your mind won’t remind you in the middle of feeding. But if you care for them then your instincts will stop you or at the very least act as a distant voice for you to hear.” She explained.

11231.content:
“Oh Crap! I got to be home by 10 and it’s almost 9:00.” You say as you looked away for a second and glanced at the time by accident. She seemed to remember that as well. “Is there anything else I should know?” you asked.

“Right, um… I guess there is two more things other than you will gain that knowledge after you are completely change. The first that you will look normal, even under a microscope, so you don’t worry about people doing tests on you and stuff unless you actively protrude your teeth and stuff. The only other thing is that I am leaving everything I own to you, well when you get older. Your body will age until you are 21, then it will stop aging like mine has. When you hit 21, I have instructed that all my assets are to be given to you. My death tonight will be taken care of by the same people and you will be delivered home by the police from that group.” She said as she rambled things off that she should mention.

“Police?” you asked.

“Well yes, I am dying tonight so you being the last one to see me alive will cause them to suspect you of murder. However you will be out for a day while your body changes so they will take you home and say that you were attacked but are otherwise fine. I suggest you come up with a story to tell them. Perhaps someone was robbing this place and kidnapped you to get away but dumped you later. Anyway, you’re right we really should get started. I would hate to ash because of a 2100 year typo in time judgment.” She said as she turned more directly to you.

“H…how does this work?” you asked.

“Quite simple actually. I drink you dry so you have no blood left then push my blood into you. With it you will retain all my powers and experience, as well as the experience of those that came before me. Oh, you will get one hot body to boot.” She answered as she slowly forced you, almost seductively down until she was lying on top of you, grinding against you a little and getting you highly aroused. “That’s it, get excited.” She spoke as she planted a kiss on your lips then moved to the side and started trailing to your ear.

“Is this… necessary…?” you asked, more for future reference then for her to stop.

“The faster the heart beats the faster the blood flows and the faster I can drink. But there are more ways to get the blood flowing then just running a few laps in gym class.” She answered as she continued. It made sense that way and also why biting invoked a pleasure response and why vampires were said to scar people to death. As she said, there are more ways to get the blood flowing then just running laps. Your body was limp as you had never been like this with a girl before and definitely not a woman as hot as she was not to mention she was a Vampire.

“Will I ever see you… again.” You asked through your moans. “Miss. Isisbelle?”

“Perhaps in heaven, but will always be inside you and not just like they say in elementary school. I am giving you my blood so I will be quite literally part of you from now on.” She said seductively and something in your mind was preventing her from stopping anything she wanted to do. Just as you were about to explode and your heart beat reached its max she said.”Goodbye Caleb.” Then sank her teeth in and took what your body was using to fuel your stimulation and release.

You could feel your blood flowing out of you and strangely enough you could feel it running down her throat and pool into her stomach where it was immediately digested and fused with her blood. You felt your essence leave your body and felt yourself die, which was the strangest feeling in the world. But you weren’t dead as if your essence and spirit was attached to the blood that now was blending with hers. You could feel as it coursed through her veins and was pumped through her heart. It was like being on an orgasmic rollercoaster ride that never stopped. But then you felt cold as you were pushed into a cold vessel and it took a while to heat it back up. But by the time that happened you had separated from that feeling and was back to the feeling of you having a really nice dream. Your head rushed with images and memories of the lives the other vampires had. Some of them were gruesome, some were erotic, some were fun, while others were sad. Thousands of years were poured into your mind and understanding. You felt power as and strength then the feeling of Isibelle came through it all. The unmistakable feeling you got whenever she was around. You called out for her but she didn’t answer. You did this a few times but then was pulled back to consciousness to find…
11231.title: It is getting late, time to change.

112311.content:
“Caleb… Caleb… CALEB.” Came a voice that snapped you out of your dreams of searching. You woke to find a bright light in your face but in reality it was the light in your room. You were in your room, in your bed, with your family sitting around you. Your father, or as he instructed you and you siblings to call him, your Papa was calling your name in response to you calling out probably. You were breathing hard as you took in what you were seeing. It was a head rush of sorts as information piled into your mind from around you. You could hear the heart beat of every person within a one mile radius. As soon as you got your hearing under control your sight was impaired by the bright lights. You slowly came around to answer your father’s calling.

“Where… where am I?” you asked.

“You are at home. When you didn’t come home on time we got worried and went looking for you. They said someone had broken into Miss. Isibelle’s home and you were taken. We came home and prayed for you to return and just like that an officer brought you back. It must’ve been horrible for you, can you remember anything?” your father asked.

“I… I can’t remember much. I remember feeling a rush, maybe a blast or someone hit me. Miss. Isibelle covered me and… nothing. I thought I felt her just now and tried to find her and that is when I woke up.” You reported, weaving a tale of truth and lies expertly like your instincts were subconsciously helping you do. “Is she ok, is Miss. Isibelle ok?” you asked to which your parent sent the others to their rooms then shut the door to talk with you.

“Son, they couldn’t find Miss. Isibelle at her house. They only found what happened afterward. I hear that they are going under the assumption that she passed away and went to heaven.” Your Father reported, trying to break it to you in a way that didn’t make you that sad.

“She died?” you asked, this time it was for real. You were still halfway in denial as you did have strong feelings for her and even stronger now.

“Yes… I’m sorry dear.” Your mother said then had a look as though she didn’t mean to say it that way. You instantly recognized it as one of you powers. When you wanted someone to tell you something you didn’t need to do more than wish them to and they would spill their darkest secrets to you. You didn’t mean to use it just now and it was clear that while the blood running though you told you how to use your abilities and their specs, they didn’t tell you how to control yourself when using them. then it hit you, the reason you still felt her presence was that, as she said, she was actually inside you. Or at least her whole life, memories, and blood were at least. You looked at your hand as you looked into it and saw the blood flowing through your veins. You looked at it as if the blood would speak to you like she would but you knew that was ridiculous. Soon the large hand of your Father came into and closed around your hand.

“Get some rest Caleb. If you need it, you can stay home from school tomorrow. I know you’ve probably rested enough but just try so you can function tomorrow.” He said.

“Ok”. you answered as the generic response you were suppose to use when he said something it was more or less to communicate that you heard and understood him and you were trained to say it after he told you something to do. They stayed for a little bit as you closed your eyes and slowed your breathing and heartbeat to match a sleep like state. They eventually got up and exited, going back to their room. You immediately opened your eyes as they closed your door and turned off your light. As you suspected you could actually see better in the dark then in the light. As you thought about what was going on you started floating in the air without really thinking about it. When you realized you almost fell but caught yourself and made a note of what it felt like so not to do it around others while you were thinking. But for the life of you, you just couldn’t fall asleep. You tried counting sheep and even trying to knock yourself out. It appeared that the darkness gave you more power while the light was more of an annoyance but still you didn’t mind it overall.

Knowing that you had to get a handle on your powers as quickly as possible you started experimenting with them. You snuck around the house silently, first normally and second as a sort of mist like fog. You could actually seep through otherwise invisible cracks to get to places you never thought you could. You even went to your family dog, who woke from the different scent in the air. You quickly adjusted and he went back to sleep. You then wondered if you could really go anywhere like that so you entered Duke’s body through his mouth, nose, other holes just to see if it worked, and even his skin. You then wondered if you could feed like that and drank a little of his blood as you moved inside his veins. When you came out you noticed that he didn’t even wake up to your intrusion. You experiments lasted through the night but stayed away from your family as you didn’t want to suddenly get a craving for their blood. You had to keep yourself from draining Duke and you didn’t want to test it on something that instinct told you would be infinitely more delicious and satisfying.
112311.title: You're at home with your family around you.

choices: School is school but you just got better at it.
This is easy, Math was so hard before...
1123112.content:
As soon as you heard your parents get up you laid back in bed. Your Father usually got you and your siblings up with him, at 5:00 in the morning. Usually it bothered the stink out you but since you now needed very little sleep you got up right away and headed for the bathroom to shower. It was usually a race to get it before everyone else and if your sister got it first then it was occupied for at least an hour while your brothers left if an absolute mess. So you got in and took your shower. You noticed that you didn’t really care if it was extremely hot or cold so you took a freezing cold shower, brushed your teeth which ruined your tooth brush as your new fangs kept popping out and shredding it. Luckily you had some sort of materialization ability and fixed it. You then noticed something as you checked for zits and such on your young teen face. First of all you didn’t have any, which was weird because you usually had to deal with quite a few in the morning, and second you had in addition to your retractable fangs were the same blood red eyes that Isibelle had. With that little discovery you slapped on a towel, did your hair, and headed for your room.

“Caleb, what happened to you?” asked a drowsy Sarah as she almost ran into you on her way into the shower. She was looking at your upper half that wasn’t covered with a towel. Being the only girl in a house full of boys she had seen it all but what she hadn’t seen is that now you were completely ripped. Not overly so that it was bulgy but you were definitely and enviably toned and ripped. You didn’t even notice as you usually didn’t pay much attention to your own body, rather you usually got jealous of the ones at school that got them all the girls, or the staring at girls’ bodies in general as per your age and introduction to puberty.

“What do you mean?” you asked to which she looked too tired to take it any further and just walked into the bathroom to the dismay of your brothers, who now had to wait before they got their chance. Luke was only 13 months younger than you while Isaac was 5 years younger than you. While Luke was more popular that you, Isaac was the momma’s boy and more stylish when it came to his personal upkeep. However they were both too young to notice your obvious change and just scowled lazily at you for getting your shower in before they did.

You went to your room and got ready, inspecting your new body in the closet mirror you had. Isibelle was right when she said you would become ‘hot’. You messed with your hair and watched as it folded back to how you wanted it. You weren’t growing any facial hair yet so you couldn’t try out anything in that area but you looked at yourself for a few minutes as you flexed and looked at your shockingly toned and defined muscles. You put on your normal school uniform, dress code for a private school was strict at black slacks, and a various assortment of polo shirts with the schools logo on the left chest area and no black on black was allowed so you picked a red polo before slapping on some deodorant and grabbing your bag for school. You noticed that it was as light as a feather, despite you knowing that it had at least 30 lbs of books in it from your homework. You carried it down the stairs and put it by the door, ready to go like you always did, then walked into the kitchen where your mother was making breakfast and your Father was reading the Bible as he usually did in the morning before you the rest of you joined in for your family Bible study in the morning along with breakfast.

“Caleb, so you don’t need the day off?” asked Papa as finished his reading and looked up at you. Your mother continued cooking but also turned to see you sitting in your spot at the table.

“Yes, I think it would be best if I get my mind off it by doing so good old fashioned homework and studies.” You said with an obviously forced smile.

“Caleb, if you need the day off you can have it. We were about to call the school after breakfast to call you a sick day.” Mom said as she turned from just flipping a pancake. Your mother went to work in the day but not to support the family. Your father had bought part of Pepsi way back when he had the money and when their stock was low. Now that he was part owner he got a lot of money and more than enough to support the family. Although he never really used it, in fact he was one of the most tight fisted people you knew. No your mother went to work to have some extra spending money aside from that and because she enjoyed it, as she enjoyed being a Mom to not only her own kids but the kids that came home with you occasionally but mostly your other siblings.

“Luke, not until you shower.” Your father said as he came halfway down the stairs then went back up. Like any parent they could easily see what their kids were doing and instruct them before it became an issue, well mostly. There were times where you and your siblings got spankings and such but never to the point where it breached into the abusive area. Now that you were older, and definitely now that you had this new power, you silently thanked your parents for it and raising you the right way. After all, even selfishly, if they hadn’t Isibelle wouldn’t have ever passed this gift off to you of all people.

“It’s ok, I think I can handle it. If she were still alive I know exactly what she would say if I missed a day of school; ‘A young man like yourself should be in school this time of day, learning what you need to be a great man someday’.” You quoted and they smiled as they had also heard her say that to you and your brothers and a few times to Sarah but they never really got along so not as much, not to mention she never mowed her grass.

“That sounds just like her. Well then did you get all your homework done?” Papa asked.

“Most of it. All I have is a little left of my English paper due by Friday.” You answered. You had actually just finished it last night as you normally would’ve said the same thing but not done any of it until study hall at school. Although you found that all the usually really hard homework was a breeze and it only took up a small fraction of your night as you waited for morning and experimented with your new powers.

“Well you should get that done tonight and show me to be sure. Now that you are in Junior High you need to get good grades to make it when you grow up.” Papa said in a way that distinguished you as being older now but also that you had an added responsibility. For some reason your Father was always really good a controlling emotions. He could make you feel insanely guilty with a single look or insanely proud of yourself with a pat on the back for getting something done right or even just done at all. You knew that you now had that power as part of your new set of mind altering abilities but he had it and was just a human. No he was more than just a human, he was YOUR Papa, and like all kids you still thought your Dad was better than anyone else’s Dad.
1123112.title: Next morning.

choices: Wait until he is more open about it.
11231121.content:
“Caleb, are you ok? I notice you were distracted most of the day and you skipped lunch.” Asked Miss Bigler, your homeroom teacher. Since you were just in sixth grade they were just introducing the multiple class thing and as such you had a high majority of your classes in your homeroom with a select few outside, like elective based classes which included Gym and intro to different classes to be chosen for the next few years.

“I just had a headache and a little indigestion. Nothing a good night’s sleep won’t cure.” You said as you packed up your things from your locker. You had been avoiding eye contact with people and because you weren’t that popular it wasn’t that hard. However it was a relatively small private school and as such the teachers were more attentive to their students. She was right though, all day you were bombarded with new smells that you hadn’t noticed before. Every person that walked within ten feet of you was pretty much downloaded into your memory, not to mention you couldn’t really control the mind reading thing yet so their surface thoughts would randomly pop up as a loud distraction. On top of that whenever you thought of food you thought of the hundreds of throats around you and it made you sick of yourself. You didn’t know what you were doing and you really could use your Dad’s advice but was unsure of how to tell him. This was hard enough for a preteen to accept with a large imagination like yours.

“Well, I hope my headaches improve my learning skills like they have for you. I know you were struggling with your grades so I brought this to you myself.” She said and you could’ve sworn that she was flirting with you in her hand gestures and such. She handed you a spelling test that you had… a 100% on. You hadn’t gotten a grade that good for a very long time. Thing is you weren’t even concentrating on that test.

“Wow, I got that?” you asked, not really believing it.

“Yes, keep up the good work Caleb. You know I could… never mind.” She said as she was about to say something and you were so curious that you entered her mind to see what she was going to say only to find an internal argument going on as she walked away. “Why is he so hot today? It’s like he just sprouted out in all the right places overnight. I could just… no! that’s my student I can’t think that way. So why does he tempt me so much the closer I get to him and why does my heart flutter when he smiles at me?” She asked herself and turned as you were walking toward her but in order to reach the stairs that were behind her and next to her class. She smiled then waved a goodbye to which you did the same only for her to blush and quickly dart into her class.

“Hmm. That was weird.” You whispered to yourself. You knew that you had persuasion powers but you didn’t know that your natural appeal had skyrocketed as well. You didn’t know you had any outward appeal to begin with and to have so much that it was tempting a teacher in her mid 20s was both intoxicating and hard to handle. Good thing it was the end of the day and you were going home. Your brothers would wait for your mother while your sister got a ride home and you walked. You never understood why they had to get a ride when your house was hardly 5 blocks away, laziness you guessed.

You walked down the stairs and hall like normal and noticed that some of the girls that usually didn’t give you a second glace were following you with their eyes and hiding such a fact when you glanced their way. You wondered how far this attraction thing went and if you could turn it off. You didn’t mind the attention but it could very quickly turn out to be a bad thing or at least too much at some point. After all, you were a 12 year old kid, now Vampire, but still a kid and didn’t need or want the extra drama. The worst thing about the day though was Bible class. Your teacher was slightly distracted, as were you, but she taught on demons and used Vampires as a fictional example of one. Since you were THE only Vampire her teachings were like a sucker punch to you. She didn’t actually prove Vampires as evil, more just a socially acceptable example of a modern day demon. You were no demon and you didn’t like being called one, regardless if she knew you were the exact thing she was talking about, minus the evil rap that she was labeling them/you with. However per your kind and gentle nature you let it go.

Now you were walking home as you thought on how to break it to your family. You wanted to make sure you had a decent handle on your powers before confronting them and you achieved that, except your drinking of blood. You didn’t really know what to do about it. You were obviously craving it but felt… bad about even thinking to take another person’s blood and taking from a cow seemed like stealing. You really needed your Father’s advice on this but how can you ask your human father on wither or not you should suck people’s blood?

“Hello Caleb, have a good day at school?” Papa asked as he looked up from fixing one of the lawn mowers. You walked into the garage and handed him a tool you knew he needed. From working with him all the time you could read his mind without your powers and knew what he needed and when, as far as tools were concerned. At this point it was a reflex and you barely knew you were doing it.

“Yeah, I got an A on my spelling test.” You said as you tried to brighten your mood by brightening his. None of you, except your sister, was that smart book wise at least. However you sister knew she was smart and didn’t try at school, earning her just as bad grades as you did.

“Well that’s great!” he said with his uncanny ability to lift your emotions and make you feel proud. You put your bag down on a bench then sat by him as he worked and you helped a little, again out of reflex. You knew the others would be avoiding work and the garage was probably the most solitary place in that respect. No one came back unless they were getting a tool or doing a job for Papa. You were unusually quiet and distant, which caught your wise father’s eye. He stopped his tinkering and looked over at you. “Caleb, are you still thinking about Miss. Isibelle?” he asked as he tried to figure out what was on your mind.

“No, yes, kind of. I… Papa? Can I ask you a weird question?” you asked.

“Sure, you know you can talk with your mother or I about anything.” He said in a tone that indicated he was open to talk for a while if you needed.

“I… what do you think about… Vampires, other than that they are fake? I mean, if one really did exist and wasn’t evil, do you think it would be possible?” you asked in way as you dodged the fact that you were one. However, with the sun shining in the garage your father didn’t even suspect you were talking about yourself.

“You’re right, that is a weird question. Well, I guess I would have to meet him or her to decide if they were evil or not. If they turned out to be ok then I don't see why they would be a problem. But I told you before Caleb, Vampires are fake. I thought you knew that.” He said.
11231121.title: School is school but you just got better at it.

choices: Mom and Papa need to know more.
112311211.content:
“But what if I could prove that one existed?” you asked, still not looking him in the eye but seeing him ponder both the question, how he should answer, and why you were asking.

“Caleb, are you trying to tell me something? I admit I would be skeptical if you said you found one. Maybe all those Vampire movies were too much…” he started but you shook your head as if to say that wasn’t where you were getting it from. While it was well known in your family, both distant and immediate, that you like vampire things there was a seriousness in you that he hadn’t seen before, as well as an almost fearful gaze as you looked down and away.

“Papa, what if I was a Vampire?” you asked suddenly as you didn’t want it to go further off topic and were too young to know a more gentler way of asking it.

“Ok, that’s enough of this talk Caleb. Perhaps you need some rest then we should have a talk about this when you are feeling better.” He said as he stood but was almost forced down as you allowed yourself to float above him, still looking down and away from him. You didn’t go high, but just enough to look like you were sitting on air in relation to him. You stayed silent and waiting for him to do something rash. Your Father, like for most kids your age, was your whole moral center and life. Your Dad was better than everyone else’s Dads, he was always right and always knew what to do. You feared that the thing he would decide to do would be to treat you like a… well Vampire exclusively and not part of the family anymore.

“Papa, I am a Vampire. I know it is hard to hear, I’ve only been one for a day and it is hard for me to believe. I am having trouble with the changes and I’m scared.” You said as you buried your face in your hands. You hadn’t cried in a while, well outside of spankings at least. But the thought of what might happen was too much and you started to cry. You didn’t really know how long you cried and for how long you were floating or when your body had came down to sit like you were before but eventually a strong hand laid on your shoulder, your father’s hand, Papa’s hand.

“Is that what happened to Miss. Isibelle?” he asked to which you nodded. “Did a… Vampire attack the two of you?” he asked, probably not believing that he just asked that. But you shook your head. “then what happened?” he asked. You looked up at him and began telling him everything, how you came over, what she said about her making it safe and spreading the legends and stories, her death and gift, all of it. You showed him to small and hardly noticeable scars on your neck and by the time you were done he looked like he had just been told an unbelievable story, the kind of look you gave when Mom read you one at night with your brothers.

“Papa, am I evil now?” you asked. This seemed to shake him from his shocked glance to address his son, Vampire or not.

“No Caleb, don’t you ever think that understand?” he said as he gave a firmer grip to your shoulder. He shook you a little until you couldn’t take it anymore and just hugged into him, for comfort if nothing else. He was obviously both startled and comforted by this as he held you, his son, in his arms. “It’s ok, it’s ok, you don’t have to worry Caleb. We are your family and we’ll help you through this and figure it out, just like that superman show you watch.” He said. He could never remember the title, Smallville, it wasn’t really that hard to remember but he butchered it with his lack of media prowess.

“Papa, I promise I’ll be good. I won’t do anything bad, I won’t…” you started but was just shushed by him as he held you.

“Don’t you worry about that. We’ll talk about that later, ok?” he said as he pushed you just enough so that you were looking into his eyes, his deep brown eyes full of love. They almost shunned you for ever thinking he wouldn’t be able to handle it. “So can you still eat food? Cause that meal Mom is cooking smells really good doesn’t it?” he asked as he changed the subject to something a little more cheery.

“Yes, I can. I just need blood for my other stuff.” You answered with a smile and nod as you wiped away your tears from your cheeks.

“Well why don’t we both wash up and get in there before it’s all gone?” he said as he stood and you did as well, grabbing your bag and heading inside like normal, as if nothing happened.
112311211.title: Tell him now.

choices: Absolutely no human blood, unless extreme emergencies.
Humans are made for you to eat, go ahead and drink.
1123112111.content:
You laid in your bed as you looked up at the ceiling. Papa hadn’t let the news of you being a Vampire spread or even alluded that anything was out of the ordinary. Although he did observe as you ate your meal and, without reading his mind, you could tell he was wondering why and how you could eat normal food as a Vampire. You used your excellent hearing, even through the sound proof walls of your room, to hear Papa tell Mother about you. She reacted a little bit skeptical, like he did, but in the end she became both nervous and concerned but not scared. He told her the story you told him and you marveled as he remembered every detail of what you said.

The talked for a while but in the end they both calmed down and decided they needed to talk with you about it and figured, that if you were really a Vampire, you wouldn’t be asleep at night. You waited as they came up the stairs then opened your door. You closed your eyes to pretend you were sleeping but the simply closed the door behind them as they entered. One of your projects with your Father was making your room sound proof. Part of it was because you were such a light sleeper that every random noise usually woke you and the other was that, at the time, Luke had got a new drum set and you were being driven crazy. It was he quiet room in the house and you were now glad for it so you could speak with them openly without Sarah, Luke, or Isaac catching on or overhearing.

“Caleb, we are going to turn on the light.” Papa informed like he usually did when doing so. You sat up in bed with your back now against the headboard and after the sound of your movement stopped he did so.

“Caleb, Papa told me what’s going on. Are you ok?” she asked.

“A little scarred still and confused.” You answered as they both took the chairs you had in your room and sat on either side of you.

“I suppose you won’t be sleeping at night anymore.” Papa stated as he looked at your bed.

“I can’t really explain that well but the night makes me more powerful, I can do my… other stuff easier at night and although I’ve tried, I can’t force myself to sleep at night.” You verify as you stole glances at both of them but still avoided eye contact.

“Honey, what other stuff do you mean?” asked Mom, worried that you were talking about drinking their blood. Papa knew better but still was wondering about your other abilities.

“Miss. Isibelle explained it like this. While I still need food like a normal person to grow, the amount of energy required to live for me is significantly higher and when I use my heightened abilities it uses up more of that energy. Blood is basically the only thing that is like the gas for my energy tank… but I don’t have to drink human blood.” you explained, hoping the last point would make them feel better. It did but not as much as you were hoping it would.

“You don’t? I thought Vampires had to drink from other people.” Papa said to you shaking your head in response. “Then what can you drink?” he asked more openly.

“Well, I guess anything with blood, although it is like… food for me. I crave certain blood more and certain blood has more… energy in it I guess. While human blood is at the top there are more than enough blood in, let’s say, a cow for example.” You answered.

“Have you drank any yet?” asked Mom.

“No, I am not sure where I should get it. Other people are off limits but going to a random farm and drinking from one of the animals seems like stealing. But I can’t just go up to the farmer and ask to drink the blood of his animals. But I am getting really hungry.” You answered.

“Well we can’t have you starving in anyway. But won’t you turn those you… bite?”Asked Mom. She had always made it a point to feed you and never have her children go hungry.

“No, from what Miss. Isibelle said, I can’t turn anyone and there are no other vampires. Although there are apparently a lot of pretenders out there that thing shaving their teeth and sinking them into people’s necks make them a Vampire. But no, there is and only will be one Vampire and for now that Vampire is me. I wouldn’t be able to turn someone even if I tried hard to do it. The most I can do is drink too much or not clean up afterward.” You answered and this also seemed to lift some anxiety off their shoulders.

“Well that’s good news.” Papa responded as he must’ve been worried that their little Vampire had to be watched so you didn’t end up turning everyone in the school. “What do you mean about ‘clean up’?”

“Miss. Isibelle showed me how to feed before… turning me I guess you could say. She said that my spit can do 2 things. The first is to make the spot not hurt anymore, before biting. The second is to heal cuts and stuff like that, including the bite marks. I really wouldn’t have any control over it. If I bit someone you wouldn’t see a mark like in the movies. I mean, how can I bite someone without getting at least a little spit on them?” You asked as you explained.

“Well then we know that, if a pretender does show up that it isn’t you.” Mom said with a smile as if she just revealed a security to their sanity, and yours.

“But I do need your advice. What should I drink from? Perhaps I can use my mind powers to get blood delivered from the hospital but what if an emergency comes up? Do I find a farm or is it ok to… feed on people as long as I don’t overdo it? I don’t know what is ok and what is not.” You asked them. They both looked at each other. They obviously weren’t expecting that they would have to give you advice as to what blood to drink.
1123112111.title: Mom and Papa need to know more.

choices: Luke interupts and wonders what is going on.
11231121111.content:
“Well Caleb, I think that drinking from complete strangers isn’t and won’t be right. You’re right, that is at the very least stealing. I suppose it would be ok to do that hospital thing you were talking about and we can get a Refrigerator in here for your future… meals. As far as animals, there are plenty of wild animals you could hunt isn’t there?” Papa said as he thought on it and advised you.

“Yes, not so much in the city but there are a few deer running around. There is always small game but not blood in them.” you answered as you thought on what you had sensed today.”But if I can’t or shouldn’t drink from strangers then who?”

“Well, I think it would be ok if the person was willing but never so much as to kill them or drink them dry.” Mom verified as she also thought on it but then both of them looked at each other as your stomach growled and you blushed at it. “You’re hungry now aren’t you?”

“Miss. Isibelle hadn’t had any blood for 20 years and I am on the same schedule as her. So… yes, very hungry or rather thirsty. It was distracting all day at school.” You answered.

“Distracting, how exactly?” Papa asked, as he was astute when it came to matters of your schooling.

“Well, I can sense other people around and the blood in them. I can even tell you what blood type they are and how much they still have, wither they are sick or healthy, as well as their heartbeat and stuff like that. So a couple hundred students with delicious smelling and sounding blood in their veins all around me as I was so hungry was very distracting. One at a time was fine but… it was very tempting to just… I didn’t but it was tempting.” You tried to explain. It wasn’t really possible to exactly describe the feeling of seeing a couple hundred people and only recognizing them as meat and blood sacks. Nor was it easy to explain without sounding blood thirst, which technically you were.

“Well, I can’t believe I’m saying this but… you can have some of ours if you need it.” Papa said and your head shot up with your Mom’s in shock. You didn’t even want to consider drinking your family’s blood. What if you couldn’t stop? What if they died or were too weak because of it?

“No, I can’t do that. I… what if I take too much? Or what if I can’t stop? I don’t want to crave my family’s blood.” you said in rapid succession as you began to get worked up but with his hand on yours he calmed you almost instantly.

“Caleb, as your parents, we should really know what we are dealing with. I admit there are risks for us. However there were so many risks when you told me. I can see now why you were scared when you told me. You were afraid that we’d treat you differently or not love you anymore. Other parents might’ve reacted that way, most would actually. You trusted us and now we are trusting you. If we say it is ok to feed on something or someone we should really know what we are telling you to do from the other side as well. We really should be your first so we can understand.” Papa said to both you and your Mother. She was a little nervous and her heartbeat showed that as it beat a million miles an hour.

“So you actually want me to drink your blood?” you asked.

“Yes, just a little. Like you said it is important for you to show restraint and not take too much.” He said and you looked away from them in a form of preshame. But only felt the hand on yours to squeeze and it made you look back to him. “You need to start somewhere Caleb and we both trust you. But how about this, if we think you are taking too much we’ll say so and try to get you to stop.” He said. It might’ve been that you still thought him to be the best in the world but it did make you feel better.

“Ok, I guess I can just take a little.” You said then looked at them until your mother started removing some of the shirt cuff for you to dig in but you shook your head. “I don’t have to do it that way. The veins in the wrist are just as good.” You said, to her partial relief. She was still nervous about letting you do this but held out her arm for you.

You slowly took it and then grew your fangs. This made your mother’s heartbeat rise a great deal. You looked up at her as if to ask if she really wanted this to which she smiled in a calm way and nodded for you to proceed. You looked back at her arm and saw the blood inside of it, circulating and pulsing. You slowly put your mouth to it then, in one go, sank your fangs into it and sucking up the blood as she gasped and it rushed into your mouth. But you were determined not to give in to the pleasure of drinking it so you pulled out far before necessary. You let go of her arm and she took it back as she was short of breath and looking at you with actual desire in her eyes, something you really didn’t want to see in your mother, towards you. Your Father was almost eager to see what excited her so much and held out his arm. You did like before as you approached the same area and he nodded to which you mimicked the procedure. Oddly enough, when you were done with him, your energy was back to full. Maybe it was because of that but your body felt… alive and coursing with power, more so then before. You soon realized that the feeling was that of their warm blood digesting and adding its power to you.

“That was… not what I expected.” Mom said as she wiped away the residual blood on her arm to find, like you said, no wound. You covered your mouth as your tongue licked up any blood that escaped then retracted your fangs before looking to them. “That feeling was incredible, why did you stop so early?”

“Because it was hard to stop at all.” you admitted to which they changed from desire to concern ridden faces. “Apparently the pleasure you get when I bite is to help speed up your blood so I can get it out quicker and for you to… want me to drink you dry. If I had drank anymore, not only would I not have wanted to stop but you wouldn’t want me to stop either.” You explained
11231121111.title: Absolutely no human blood, unless extreme emerg...

112311211111.content:
“Did you get enough?” asked Papa as he recovered as well.

“Yes, I feel so powerful right now.” You said as you looked at your hand and flexed it then back at them. “Thank you for letting me… drink your blood.” you said and it sounded as weird as it seemed, after all it wasn’t a normal, everyday, thing one says.

“Well what else can you do? Now that you have eaten you can do all kinds of things, right?” Asked Papa as he wisely changed the subject. You responded by turning to mist big enough for them to see and traveled up and across the room until you reappeared in the air and in a sitting posture, smiling at their shocked expressions.

“Caleb, I thought you died for a moment.” Mom almost scolded.

“I can’t die. You never have to worry about me dying, well not for 2100 years.” You said with a smile and a slight amount of sarcasm. “Although, Miss. Isibelle said she used that skill to make it look like she did die when she was pursued by hunters and was building the Vampire reputation. That is why the legend says that Vampires ash when they die. I guess it is true but I simply can’t die until I pass this… gift at the end of my time.”

“Why did she build a reputation that makes you viewed as a demon?” Papa asked.

“She said it was to protect me, or the next Vampire. If all I have to do to prove I’m not a Vampire to someone is go out into the sun then it is easier than messing with their minds or killing them. She basically made it so that people think other people are crazy or something for even thinking such things. I mean you both thought Vampires were fake until today so I guess it worked.” You explained. “But it does kind of feel bad when I am used as an example of an evil creature or demon in school or Church. I know that they don’t know any better but it still hurts, even indirectly.”

“Don’t worry Caleb, we’ll be here for you to lean on when you need to.” Mom said and you both exchanged smiles. “So what else can you do?” she asked.

“Well that is a really long list. But none of it is magic or witchcraft. It is just abilities that Vampires have. I can lift a few busses if I need to, I can run just under the speed of light, I can hear a dog bark from a few miles away and smell blood in particular much further than that. I can affect the elements like fire, lightning or anything that can use my body and its energy to start itself, not water. I can teleport to premade points if a seal is there as an anchor point and take people with me. I can see on the microscopic level from at least a mile away and in different modes like heat vision and movement sensors or scent perception. Obviously I can hover and float but not really fly, jump and hover but not fly all by its self.” You said then paused as you were counting on your fingers but looked up to see there stunned faces at all the things you could do and there was obviously a lot more, they already knew that you could read and control minds if you wanted, via your confession earlier.

“With so many strengths do you have any weaknesses? Should I hide the silver and garlic?” Mom asked.

“I do have a few weaknesses. First, blood sucking is ranked a higher pleasure then sex, apparently, like I would know. Basically what you were feeling times 10. Also, silver does affect me but not fatally. It just makes me more normal. If someone shot me in the head with a silver bullet it would be like using a funnel to poor my Vampire powers out instead of a pressured fire hose. So it just makes me more normal. I could be restrained easily by a pair of silver handcuffs but, like I said, I can’t die until I pass on the gift. Light and the sun is like the opposite for me than it used to. When you go into a room you have to turn on the light to see. Well it is the opposite for me, when you turn on the light or I’m in the sun it restricts me and hinders my natural powers. Obviously not so much as I am helpless like with silver.” You said as you gestured to you still floating in a well lit room.

“Well Caleb, now that we know I think your mother and I need to talk about this alone for a bit.” Papa said as they both got up and you gently dropped to the floor with noticeably little noise. “I guess it is ok for you to stay up since you don’t need the sleep as much anymore but try not to listen in.”

“Ok.” you said as your Mom gave you a hug, realizing too late that she had just put her neck right next to the same fangs that already drank form her that night. “I love you both so much. Thank you for accepting me like this. I promise not to be bad.” You said as you hugged then let go as your mother smiled at your words and went over to the door.

“We know Caleb, we love you to, but we DO need our sleep so try to keep it down ok?” Papa said as he smiled and lifted your spirits even more then they were already.

“Goodnight Papa, Good night Mom.” You said before they closed the door.

“Goodnight Caleb.” They returned before closing the door.
112311211111.title: Change the subject.

1123112111111.content:
“Sarah, Caleb, Luke, Isaac; time to get up.” Papa called and you all yelled down your ‘okays’ to show that you heard him. You of course got the shower first but dressed in the bathroom and got ready in your room. Surprising enough you required very little cleaning. Your body regenerated so the smell that normal people had didn’t apply to you and what you did excrete as B.O. was actually an attractant. You guessed that it was to help possible hunting of prey, human or animal. But you showered and got ready out of pure habit then packed your things. You had run out of things to do in your room so you finished a week worth of homework and read your textbooks multiple times. But by the second read through you had memorized it. The level that your mind was working was making it almost boring. You went downstairs and put your bag by the door like always and went into the kitchen just like the previous morning but this time your father was already done reading and waiting for you.

“Good morning Mom, Good morning Papa.” You said before giving them each a kiss on the cheek before taking your spot.

“Good morning Caleb, you sleep well? Oh wait… you have a good rest, wait did you rest?” Mom asked. Asking if you slept well was just a habit from years of greeting you in the morning so it was slightly comical to hear her stumble on it while continuing to cook breakfast, eggs and bacon with some toast this morning.

“Kind of, I couldn’t sleep so I just did like a week worth of homework and read all the text books I brought with me. I didn’t think that I would get smarter with this new deal as well, I memorized all the books I read last night.” You said with a smile.

“Well then I guess we can expect straight A grades from now on?” Papa joked but was slightly serious.

“Well, I didn’t even try yesterday and I got perfect scores. Might have a little problem in Gym though.” You said.

“Why, that is a class you and your brothers always got good grades in.” Mom asked.

“Well I didn’t have to hide my skill before and Mr. Hale thought the Konel boys were going into wrestling so he likes us for that. That reminds me, do I have to pull out of wrestling when it comes around?” you asked and they looked at each other then smiled and looked back at you.

“No, you can stay in.” Papa said.

“With respect, won’t that kind of be like cheating and I could hurt someone?” you asked.

“Not at all, you don’t think it’s cheating for someone with naturally bigger arms or legs to compete do you?” asked Papa.

“No, but they can’t snap someone in half or lift a bus like I can. I mean, I want to wrestle but not if I’m going to hurt someone really bad.” You almost argued but it was clear that you were more concerned than argumentative.

“Caleb, that is why these sports are there. They teach you about many things besides beating the other person. They teach you, work ethic, teamwork, and in your case restraint. I think that being in a stressful situation like that and training your body to handle people like that will only help you in that. Your attitude of not wanting to hurt them will help you and is the reason why I think you can handle it. Besides, you can heal them if you hurt them, right?” Papa explained and you nodded at his question as you thought about it. “Good, now we’ve come to a decision.” He said as he was obviously talking about you being a Vampire and how to handle it.
1123112111111.title: Next day.

choices: They are all ok with it, but your extended family is having a hard time.
One of your siblings is jealous and doesn't like it.
11231121111111.content:
“We can’t hope to keep this from our family, even if we worked hard at it they would just feel distrust and betrayal rather than potential fear. Our family has always operated in the realm of love, respect, obedience, and trust. So that is how we should handle this as well.” Papa explained.

“So we are going to tell… everyone?” you asked, unsure about it.

“We’ll only tell those old enough to handle the information, except our immediate family. They should all know but as far as the rest, your Mother and I will have a family meeting about it and address them, making sure they know that you are not bad or evil but yes a Vampire. We can keep most of your abilities a secret as none of us really understand them to begin with but we they will know the basics. We’ll leave it up too you to expand on things. Although this may cause them to treat you a little more hostile and pull your cousins away from you. However I think that better than them finding out after the fact and without knowing that you are good.” Papa explained.

“Good morning.” Greeted Sarah as she came down and soon after Luke and Isaac. He silently shushed you as they came in but you didn’t need it as you understood. Each one of them came down, greeted the others in the room and gave your parents a kiss on the cheek. Sarah was beginning to get to that age where she was shying away from it but still did so out of habit that early in the morning if nothing else.

“Ok everyone, I have some good news. I called in and you have the day off of school today.” Papa said and almost was able to time the response as the all thanked him at the same time, as did you but for different reasons. You understood that telling them something like this then sending them off to school was not t good thing. “But we do have to have a family meeting and we must stay home all day.” He said and other than you Sister you were all happy with that as well. She liked going out in the evening with friends, and it was Friday so it didn’t help situations that much. Although staying inside also meant no working either so they were in the end more happy than peeved.

You all finished breakfast then went downstairs to the basement and into the family room, sitting down in your assigned chairs. You each had gone to the store with Papa and bought a chair or seat that you liked and would be ‘your chair’ when watching TV, having family meetings, movie nights, or whatever the reason. That meant if you spilled a milk shake on your chair than you couldn’t just leave it and use someone else’s.

“Ok, we need to talk with you all about Caleb.” Mom said in a gentle voice to which the eyes in the room snapped to you and your brothers’ were a little mocking as they thought you were in trouble and were rubbing it in.

“You all know Miss. Isibelle?” Papa asked the room.

“Isn’t that Caleb’s girlfriend?” Isaac asked as he had a rudimentary understanding of things at best but it still got you to blush and everyone else to laugh a little.

“Well, she went to heaven but gave your brother something before she died.” Mom said once the laughter had subsided. “She made him into a Vampire.”

When she said this the room became deathly silent. But that only lasted a minute as Isaac was the only one that didn’t really know what that meant if it was true, while Sarah and Luke were both in a combination of shock and disbelief.

“A Vampire! Caleb’s a Vampire, do you mean with long pointy teeth and can turn into a bat?” he asked excitedly. You slowly grew your fangs for them then retracted them to both his enjoyment and to snuff out any leftover doubts from Sarah and Luke. “That’s is so cool! Can I see some cool tricks?” he asked but was brought back to his seat by mother.

“Now, now, Isaac there will be plenty of time for that later. We need to talk about it for now.” Mom said and he reluctantly sat in his bean bag chair and watched you as if you would do a trick.

“You have to be joking, Caleb as a Vampire. For starters he was in the sun all day yesterday.” Sarah interjected as Luke followed her train of thought, although they still seamed hung up on how you could grow fangs if you weren’t one.

“Now we are telling you the truth as we do in this family. We will have all day for him to prove it to you. But he has already proved it to Mom and I so that is not up for debate.” Papa said in an authoritative voice that immediately purged all doubt from their minds and you helped push the rest out so they believed without doubt. “Now, one at a time you can ask us or him questions and we’ll answer them for you.” Papa said as he pointed to Sarah, as she was oldest, to go first.

“Are you like the ones in the movies with the crosses and stuff?” she asked.

“No, Miss. Isibelle helped make up those stories to protect her and now my secret. They are as fake as before and I am nothing like them.” you answered.

“You mean…?” Sarah started but was cut off by a grunt from Papa that indicated it was passed her turn.

“Are you going to suck our blood?” Luke asked rather bluntly.

“No, not for a while at least.” You answered to which you turned to Papa and Mom for help.

“He has decided not to suck the blood of people that don’t ask him to do it, but if he does he has to be careful. But don’t worry, he can’t turn you into a vampire.” Mom explained.

“Awe, so I can’t be a Vampire?” Isaac asked.
