“Sorry, I can’t even if I wanted to. It just doesn’t work like that. There is only one Vampire in the world and you’re looking at him and I can’t make anyone else one.” You answered to which he pouted but accepted the answer.

“Why can you survive in sunlight and eat normal food if you are a Vampire?” Sarah asked.

“Sunlight is just like night time is for you. I am weaker but by no means helpless… or dead. As for eating, I only need blood like gas in a car to power myself and any abilities I can do. As for the rest of the weaknesses, they don’t really work. You have to understand that everything you know about Vampires is pretty much garbage, made by the previous Vampire Miss. Isibelle to protect the future and herself.” You answered.

“What can you do?” asked Luke and so began the start of a very long family meeting as they went around d and you answered questions and did tricks for them. Papa told them the story on how you got your Vampire Powers and why you were the only one. It definitely was the going to be a long, tiring, but fun day as they seemed to be taking it very well.
11231121111111.title: Telling the family

choices: Good friends are hard to come by.
You become more and more popular.
112311211111111.content:
“Caleb!” yelled Papa from the garage. One thing your siblings didn’t mind about you being a super powered Vampire was that your parents, more specifically Papa, would give you most of the work, leaving them with less of it. You went out to him and walked in as he was trying to get the car up so he could change the tire. The jack he used was old and hardly worked, well as far as going up was concerned. Once it was up it didn’t have a problem, or when you went down. “Caleb, can you lend me a hand here?” he asked.

“Sure.” You said as you grabbed the van and lifted it up almost effortlessly while he eased the jack up to meet it. You then lowered it onto the defective piece of equipment but you could also fix that as you touched it and it repaired itself.

“Well that took less time than I expected. I needed to talk with you though. It has been a few weeks since you change and we had the big family meeting last Saturday and I thought you should know what they said.” Papa said, the first part made you feel good while the last part was preparing your for not so good a feeling.

“Did they think it was ok?” you asked.

“Well they did but they don’t think it is wise for you to hang out with your cousins that much anymore.” He said and you looked at him confused. “They just need some time to be sure you’re not bad. We are around you all the time, so we know it but they are still in shock from it all. As you said, the rumors and Legends about Vampires don’t help the situation at all. But they don’t hate you for it and are willing to keep it a family secret and tell their own kids when they reach around 16.”

“So can I still go to Christmas and stuff like that?” you asked as you wondered how far it was going.

“Oh, yes you can. In fact Grandpa and Grandma Konel are wanting to see for themselves and are actually quite excited, as are Grandpa and Grandma Lon. Don’t worry too much Caleb, they will all come around eventually. Our family may be a tad strange but we are all close and love each other. Sometimes we don’t like each other but we all love each other.” Papa said to your down cast eyes to the first part of his report. This little bit brought your eyes back up and smiled as you knew what he said to be true. Your family was loud, touchy, in everyone’s business, and… yeah weird, but they were furiously loyal and loved each other very much. The only danger you had was if one of you cousins had some loose lips and it came back to bite you.

“Thanks Papa, and for letting everyone get the tattoo.” You said. You had experimented with your teleportation ability and learned you needed to have a glyph of sorts to anchor your area. Other than that you could teleport in mist form or many other ways to avoid detection upon arrival. However you asked them if they would tattoo the glyph on their bodies somewhere, anywhere, so you could find them if they were ever in any trouble. The glyph was just a symbol fang that mimicked the ones you had. Sarah put it on her ankle and the others in areas on their bodies that could be hidden easily even with barely any clothes on, like at the swimming pool.

“It was a good idea. Now we just have to figure a way to call you and we’ll be all set. But maybe it is better if we didn’t. I mean that would be annoying to have all of us calling you all the time, maybe just to bring Luke a soda or Sarah her makeup.” Papa joked and you laughed at it as well. It could very well be used as a leash, something that you didn’t like the idea of.

“Caleb, can you help me with something?” called Mom. You smiled and Papa gave a nod that he was done with you for a while so you went over to help her out.
112311211111111.title: They are all ok with it, but your extended fami...

1123112111111111.content:
You never really had a lot of friends at school to begin with. Usually it was because of you lack of social skills and you naÃ¯ve behavior toward morals and personal preference that made you stand out and be pushed down by the others. Now that your body naturally attracted people they were being nicer to you but most people were far from kind or wanted much to do with you. After all, at that age, popularity was a big thing but not for you which made you, your Vampirism aside, weird. But you didn’t care that much back then and certainly not now. You talked most often with your teachers than you did with fellow students.

“Hey, watch where you’re going. Maybe you should go put your glasses back on, four eyes.” Said a kid named Brandon from eighth grade as he tried to push you out of his way with his shoulder, when you weren’t looking, only to fall over yourself. You would’ve chalked it up to your Vampire strength but your family never were pushovers. Naturally thick and strong you didn’t budge and he was thin enough to fall over but his excuse ran hollow as you weren’t even walking yet as you got your books out of your locker, but his bullying did get a good number of people to laugh at you. You simply shut your locker and went on your way, leaving the laughing students behind.

“Why are you sitting alone?” asked a girl that you didn’t know the name of but was in your grade. You were currently at lunch and partially enjoying a simple ham sandwich. While your taste in food had also changed you didn’t mind normal food at all and as such ate just like any other kid your age, actually a little more since your metabolism was so insanely high now that you could eat an entire buffet and still not gain a pound or be completely full. In fact, the only time you were full since you changed was when you drank your parent’s blood.

“I didn’t plan on it, I just sat down and started eating. It just so happened that no one else sat down at this specific table.” You answered. The tables were round and could seat 10 comfortably 8 with some elbow room but the curse or blessing of a small school was there is lots of empty space per class. The most in a single class at your school was 34 students and yours was 27.

“Well then I’ll sit here to, if that’s ok with you?” she asked to which you just smiled and she took it as a yes. She wasn’t the most popular girl because she was a ‘late bloomer’. Meaning that puberty hadn’t set in yet, well at least not the part where she could grow out in places that made the other girls popular. However, despite her thin frame and black hair she seemed strong and athletic. She had just made it on the Cheerleading team, and got really good grades. Her black shoulder length hair was wavy like as she was slightly Asian, but not enough to effect a high majority of her features. She had bright blue eyes and darker toned skin like she was tan all the time but she wasn’t. In fact she got lighter in the winter from the lack of tanning but still looked slightly tanned overall. Some girls teased her and said she was going to tanning beds to make up for not having any boobs like they did. But since you weren’t really popular you didn’t know her name as she had never came and talked to you, you two weren’t even in the same class, same grade and her slightly younger but not the same class. “I’m Kelsey Dremer by the way, what’s your name?” she asked as she took out her lunch, which consisted of an apple and juice.

“Caleb Konel, um… do you want some more food?” you asked.

“What? Why do you think I need it?” she asked in an offended tone.

“I… no. I didn’t mean it that way. I just… my Mom packs me so much and I saw you only have an apple and… well you used to have a juice.” You said as you tried to explain yourself and she drank her juice in one go.

“Well, did you ever think that a juice and apple is all I need?” she asked then took a chunk out of her apple. You obviously hit a button that you didn’t mean to hit. This was why you didn’t talk to girls in the first place. You never knew what to say and when you finally got something good you stumbled over yourself and made it sound like a monkey could’ve said it better. Not to mention you usually always said something that rubbed them the wrong way and you didn’t even know what it was. you were just trying to be nice and she was biting your head off for it.

“I… I’m sorry. I didn’t mean anything bad.” You apologized and took out a plate with a piece of apple pie on it that your mother made last night. It was a big piece and as soon as you took the cover off you used your contact ability to warm it up just enough to cause it to smell but not catch an eye. Even if you liked the smell of blood over everything else, no one could really hate the smell of fresh baked apple pie. You took a hidden whiff then took a bite. You kept your eyes downcast so not to offend her again but you could almost feel her staring at the large piece of pie you were eating. The apple she had only lasted a few bites and she was just sitting there but when her stomach growled a little, not loud enough for anyone but you and her to hear, she blushed as you looked up at her and pushed the pie over a little to her. “Are you sure you aren’t hungry? Because that sounded like your body was disagreeing with you.” you asked her.

“Not that my body is any of your business but…” she stopped herself mid insult as she looked at the still warm pie, filling her nose with its heavenly aroma. “… as long as you are offering.” She said and grabbed the extra fork you had. She took a bite and her eyes lit up as she tasted the little slice of heaven. Granted not everyone liked apple pie but she definitely did and your mom was simply amazing at cooking, as evidence to your overweight family. Luckily enough you had 2 milks as you were planning on drinking them both but it looked like she’d need something to wash it down so you put the milk in front of her plate so she could still eat.

“Looks like you’ll need something to wash it down.” You stated before drinking the other one. She finished off the pie and drank hers as well to which you cleaned up and crumpled it all up in the brown paper bag then tossed it into the garbage from your seat, granted the garbage can was only a few feet away but still.

“What store did you get that from?” she asked.

“None, my Mom made it last night. Actually she made 3 but we had some extras so she sent it with me. She always says that a healthy kid is a well fed kid so she feeds me and my brothers really good, but my sister is on a diet so I got her piece.” You answered.

“Then how aren’t you like a billion pounds by now? I’ll probably gain a few inches because of that.” She asked.

“Don’t really know, my whole family is really big and… well naturally fat from eating so much all the time. My Dad says I have a high metabolism and my body just burns it off really fast. He also says that it will catch up to me some day.” You answered. Not a few seconds after that the bell rung, signaling the end of lunch.

“Well, that’s us I guess. Is it ok if I sit with you tomorrow too?” she asked.

“I think so, as you can see, I get a lot of people sitting with me.” You joked and she just smiled at it then walked off. You took a little longer but also went off to class.
1123112111111111.title: Good friends are hard to come by.

choices: They run and you have to catch them.
They thank you and are grateful for your help.
11231121111111111.content:
“Hey bud, you want to give us a hand?” asked Papa as he came into your room late one night. You were just reading some stuff in your history book and marveling at some vague memories that the other Vampires had experienced. Greeks, Romans, and more than a few errors that proved true that history wasn’t always about facts but who wrote and recorded the ‘facts’. Either way, your family let you roam the house at night as they knew they couldn’t stop you if you wanted to and it wasn’t like staying in your room all the time would convince you to sleep, although on the rare occasion you did rest your eyes for an hour or two, but then be fully rested.

“Sure, what is it this time?” you asked.

“Grandpa and Grandma Konel were driving and rolled in a ditch after sliding on the road a little. They are fine aside from a few scratches and bruises but their car… the tow truck couldn’t get at it and they are going to ticket them if they don’t find a towing company to get it out of there.” Papa reported.

“I… yeah I can help, as long as there’s no other people around. They don’t happen to have the glyph we told them to hang onto do they?” you asked.

“Yeah, Grandpa has it in his wallet and Grandma in her purse. Why… oh I get it. Well this will be interesting, my first teleportation, how does it feel?” Papa asked.

“Not that bad, kind of like accelerating in a plane accept the air doesn’t come with you. Just hold your breath and it should be ok.” You answered as you located the glyph inside your Grandpa’s wallet and used it as a radar to see if anyone was around him. With the area located and accessed you held out your had to Papa. He took a deep breath then took hold of your hand. As soon as you got a good grip you teleported, second or two later popping up just behind your Grandparents on the side of the road.

“Jim, we just need some strong guys and a few trucks.” Said the large man that was your Grandpa.

“Papa.” Your father said, as he also referred to his father and your grandfather as ‘Papa’. Both of them turned around to see the both of you and almost fell over when they saw you.

“Peter, I… Where’s your van?” asked Grandma as Grandpa quickly finished things with your uncle Jim then entered the conversation.

“Caleb, come on and give us a kiss.” Grandpa stated to your delight. He was a very wise man and noticed your hesitancy do to some of the welcomes you got from your other extended family members. No one wanted your fangs anywhere near them and definitely not close enough for you to give them a kiss on the cheek like kids your age did to your grandparents, well kids in your family at least. Heck, it was probably where your Father got it from. You went over a little shy and gave them both a kiss and a hug, despite the smiles they were putting on you could feel their blood pumping and heartbeat increase. But it did feel good to be accepted by your Grandparents, even if it was currently forced on their end.

“It’s good to see you dear.” Your Grandma said after she got in on a hug, held it for a little bit then allowed you to back up a little so that they could get going on things. You were surprised that the police or emergence vehicles were gone but you weren’t going to complain when you preferred it that way, well now you did.

“Well, you’re here but where’s your van?” asked Grandpa asked this time as he already had chains laid out to pull their car out.

“Caleb teleported us here. That was why he gave you those glyphs, so he could find and teleport to where you are in order to help.” Papa said to them and they seemed to think about it while Papa looked around and saw no one around, neither did you at this hour. “Caleb, can you… you know?” Papa asked as he gestured you to get the car out.

“Yeah, shouldn’t be that hard.” You said then jumped down to where the car was. It was a dangerous slope and not one that people just jumped down for kicks. It was one reason why a tow truck couldn’t get at it, or more accurately wouldn’t. You grabbed it on the frame and lifted the car, flipped it right side up, then jumped up and past them. With a final bit of maneuvering you sat the car down and repaired it with what you and your family were calling your ‘outside regeneration’. It was as good as new but you fell over after you got done.

“Caleb! Caleb, are you ok?” Papa asked as he came running over, the other 2 to shocked to move. He got you to your feet but was holding you up. “I thought you said it wouldn’t be that hard?”

“Getting it out of the ditch wasn’t, regenerating it was more draining than I thought.” You said a little slurred and spaced out. Your fangs were showing as you were actively looking for something to recharge with, blood to be more specific. It was a good thing that Papa brought some of the bagged blood that you… convinced the hospital to donate. It was well over 2 pints of blood and he held the bag to your mouth. You immediately dug into it and sucked the bag dry in under a 10 seconds. “Thanks Papa.” You said as you regained your footing, full of blood and powered up. You licked away some of the excess blood before taking the old blood bag and disposing of it in a quick flame.

“Note to self, when asking Caleb to life cars and regenerate totaled ones, be sure to bring some blood with me.” Papa joked and you smiled at it.
11231121111111111.title: Grandparents acceptance.

112311211111111112.content:
“W…what did you… he just do?” Grandpa asked as he ran his hand over the new version of their old car until both of them were at the front with you and your Father. “How…”

“Being a Vampire may be complicated, but it has its advantages.” You said wearily as if wondering how they were going to react. It took a moment but, after silently consulting with one another they both turned to you and smiled.

“Caleb…I… we are so proud of you.” Grandma said and reached out for you but cringed a little as she held her shoulder. You looked into her body and saw that her shoulder was broken in 3 places so you gently went over and just touched her and she was healed, well it only looked like that. On the inside you injected part of your body into her, treated her injuries, then exited. You again backed away to let her recover.

“What did he do?” Grandpa asked as he was obviously out of the loop that she was hurt.

“I… I saw Grandma’s shoulder was broken so I… fixed it.” You answered shakily.

“It was broken?” she asked to which you nodded. “Well you’re just a wonderful blessing aren’t you.” she stated as she came forward and gave you a hug and kiss on the cheek.

“Thanks Grandma.” You said as she parted from you.

“Dear, what did we do to make you thank us?” she asked.

“You were just… being you. I know my new self is hard to take in for people. I like it when it doesn’t matter anymore and people are just being themselves again.” You answered with a smile.

“Well, do you mind if I get the 5 star treatment as well?” asked Grandpa and you nodded then went over and touched him in the same way, healing his wounds and headache before stepping back. But you didn’t get very far before he pulled you into a large hug, literally. He was easily twice or perhaps three times your size. It took a moment but you hugged him back. It was longer then with Grandma but eventually you were able to step back from them.

“Well this big guy still has school tomorrow so we got to get going.” Papa said.

“Can we give you a lift home?” asked Grandma as Grandpa went and started the car, waiting for Grandma.

“That’s ok Mom, Caleb is my ride. We’ll see you both later and drive safe.” He said as he waved then took your hand, took a breath, then nodded. You then teleported away and back into your room where you had started that evening, to see your mom on your bed waiting for you.

“And where have the two of you been?” asked Mom.

“Grandpa and Grandma Konel flipped their car in a ditch and we just went and helped them get out of it.” You answered.

“Oh, you did huh? That must’ve been interesting, what did they say?” She asked more Papa then you.

“I think that they finally understand Caleb, well as any of us can at this point. He was very good, got the car out of the ditch, repaired it, repaired them, and didn’t go blood drunk even if we did have to use a bag of blood to help him recharge.” Papa answered, giving you a proud pat on the back. Mom smiled then got up and gave you a kiss on the cheek, then followed it up with a giant hug.

“We’re so proud of you Caleb. You see, they can’t stay away from you forever.” She said as just last week you were wondering how long it would take for the rest to accept you, to which she just said to be patient.
112311211111111112.title: They thank you and are grateful for your help.

1123112111111111121.content:
“Can I sit?” asked Kelsey as she looked at you to which you nodded and motioned to the nearest chair subtly as you ate.

She sat by you that one time but immediately after that she was pulled into the ‘popular people’ crowd. You didn’t really care as you didn’t really have any friends at school anyway, sure everyone was nicer to you now but most had their little groups that did everything between just hanging out to doing the 3 big ones, which is what your teachers called ‘sex, drugs, and rock’n roll’. Even in a private Christian school it was segmented like that and things went on that ‘good kids’ shunned away from. You were one of those kids, although if you had to be honest, blood drinking would put you in one of the Vampire/goth groups that were around. Even with the strict dress code they still found a way to dress in all black. You never really got that, sure you liked black and the darkness but you could be wearing bleached white clothes and still sneak around just as easy.

“What you looking at?” she asked as she sat down and you finished up your lunch.

“You think that wearing the stuff they do and shaving their teeth makes them vampires?” you asked comically as you looked over at the ‘vampire table’ they drank tomato juice and at things that could be cooked but left a lot of raw meat in them, like steak or hamburger. They had some unhealthy things they did but not in school. Although the blood from their lunch sometimes enticed you, but never enough to condone what they did.

“Not really, but it makes them feel better so I guess, to each their own.” She answered. “You know they probably would take you in if you’re interested.”

“I’m just content watching them. Think it’s actually comical to see them acting like idiots and thinking they are real Vampires. I bet if they existed and saw them that they wouldn’t be to impressed. Well, they at least got the whole arrogant part down, movie vampires would be so proud.” You joked and she chuckled a little as well. “Can’t say that I agree with them not showering though.”

“Well, apparently, they think that taking a shower is the same as the whole running water thing. Running water would kill a vampire, if the existed so they don’t touch it. Well that’s what Emily says anyway.” Kelsey said.

“Emily?” you asked.

“She’s a girl on the cheer squad with me that is part of their little group. We keep telling her to take a shower, or at least bath but she insists that it would kill her because she’s a real vampire.” Kelsey said as she nodded over at the table with the Cheerleaders sitting at it and the one with black makeup was easily seen, not that the tomato juice and partially raw hamburger wasn’t a dead giveaway. You had to admit you were hoping she was one but her scent immediately gave it away that she wasn’t. Not that you doubted Isibelle or your genetic knowledge, but it still would’ve been nice to have someone else to share your life with that was more like you.

“Not that I mind the company, but why are you over here rather than with them?” You asked. She partially cringed at the question as she usually was at that table with the rest of the Cheerleaders.

“I know that I wasn’t very nice to you after the last time and you were so nice to me. They told me that I could come back to their table when I get a rack…” she said, the last part rather shyly.

“Does it really matter that much?” you asked.

“What! Of course it matters. All the Cheerleaders sit at that table and they won’t let me back over there until I… bloom.” She said as she gestured to her lack of bust but you didn’t dare to look where she was gesturing to. It was a trap that girls that age used all too often, get a guy to look at their chest then paint them a pervert.

“I don’t know what it’s like but doesn’t having… extra up there make it harder to do flips and stuff? I mean you have to be the most athletic girl in the bunch and my Mom said that late bloomers always bloom the best…” you asked and tried to compliment.

“You… you don’t care if a girl has extra big ones?” she asked.

“If that is all they have then it is kind of a turn off to me. I mean, and excuse my forwardness, if I wanted just boobs then I could get some honkers on a stuffed doll or something. For me, I like people that are real. Dang that sounded really cheesy didn’t it?” you asked.

“Yeah, it did. Kind of like my Dad.” She said and giggled at parts of what you said and your blushing to her response. “But it was sweet. I thought all you guys liked was girls with big ones. They’re right, you are kind of weird, but that isn’t such a bad thing. Hey, I know I said this last time, but is it ok if I sit with you during lunch?” she asked.

“Sure, why wouldn’t it be?” you asked back.

“Well aren’t you going into wrestling? And they have a table so…” She said in a way that allowed you to finish.

“Oh, I see. To tell you the truth I don’t really get into the whole sitting with the crowd thing. I mean, what is so great about sitting in groups to watch each other eat? Don't get me wrong, I enjoy the company but I don’t feel obligated to sit with them just because they think I should or that I’d be cool if I did. I’m use to not being popular so it doesn’t bother me… and this way the older kids can’t take my food.” You said, following it up with the little joke, getting her to smile.

“Well I’ll see you later.” She said as the bell rung and she was off to her next class.

“I hope so, this time” you said after she left. You walked out and was pushed aside hard by one of the people in that ‘vampire’ group as the whole table left the lunch room. You just shook your head and almost laughed. If they knew who you really were they would be bowing to you. But having that bunch of arrogant idiots bowing to you would only be a hassle.
1123112111111111121.title: friends round two.

11231121111111111211.content:
“Caleb, wait up.” Called a voice that you knew to be Kelsey’s. You did as you were opening the door to go home. More recently she had been walking home from school with you. Her parents usually paid for after school care so it was a big help that she could just stay at your house until she could be picked up. You got a lot of your chores done at night to fill the time so you could entertain her mostly but not that much. Mainly when you got home you would help you father with whatever he needed then do day chores like mowing the grass and stuff while she waited. There were times when you got done in time to see her off but that wasn’t too often. Mainly she just hung out with your sister and Mom while doing some of her homework.

“Hey Kelsey.” You greeted as you held the door open for her then headed on home.

“Awe… someone has a girl… friend.” Teased some kid named Nick that got Kelsey to blush.

“Someone doesn’t.” you shot back to get the bully himself to get laughed at by and including Kelsey and yourself as you walked away. You didn’t usually bully people, especially now, but you didn’t mind turning it on one.

“So I’m your girl friend now.” Kelsey lightly teased, causing you to blush a little as you both walked.

“Well kind of. At the very least you are a girl and you’re my friend. But it doesn’t have to be anything serious. I just get a kick out of making bullies like that seem idiotic. I mean what guy teases another about HAVING a girl friend when he doesn’t have one himself to brag about. Isn’t it usually the other way around?” you answered.

“True, but if it’s all the same to you, I’d kind of like to keep it as just friends for now.” She said.

“Sounds good to me. As you can tell, I’m not exactly the most popular guy in the school so having someone around helps a lot.” You said to her and she just smiled back. She did have a really cute smile, almost dainty but so innocent.

“So Wrestling starts tomorrow for you huh?” she asked.

“Yeah, they say it is going to be really hard but I doubt it. I mean my Father already has me work all the time. I have a feeling that it will be a breeze but then again he said that Wrestling is harder so… I guess I’ll just have to see.” You answered.

“Can I ask you, why Wrestling?” Kelsey asked.

“Well our school doesn’t have football and all the others aren’t physical enough. As you probably guessed, I was raised in a way that emphasizes being big, strong, and powerful… well physically at least. So I can’t really see myself doing a sport that gives me fouls or penalties for every time I touch someone. Sure the spandex may be a little weird but I think I prefer throwing people around rather than tossing a ball through a small metal hoop. No offense to the Basketball players, plus at our school the other teams pretty much suck. I mean name the last time one of the teams besides Wrestling has actually won a game or match.” You answered.

“Good point, plus I can’t wait to see you with your shirt off.” She teased and got you to blush again.

“I’m not that impressive.” You said nervously.

“Oh come one, lighten up Caleb. I’m sure you look fine under these things.” She said as she pulled playfully at your shirt but not enough to be suggestive. “So can I ask you something?”

“Sure.” You answered, a little curious to her sudden serious tone.

“When you get all popular and stuff, are you still going to have time for me?” she asked.

“Kelsey, I thought we already established this. I told you that true friends are more important to me then the fake ones that being popular brings. I mean, where are all those ‘friends’ you had when you joined Cheerleading? Plus, I bet you’ll be more popular than I will.” You complimented and she just hugged into you as the two of you walked.

“Well let’s make a promise, that we won’t forget our friendship if and when we become popular.” She suggested.

“Well, I don’t know about you, but I don’t think I can forget you Kelsey. I’m sure in a year or two you’ll blow right by me in looks and that kind of thing. Like I said, I’ve never been the popular guy at school.” You answered to which she just squeezed your arm a little as the two of you walked.

“Thanks, and I won’t go so far to forget you either.” She finished.
11231121111111111211.title: Somebody has a girl friend...

112311211111111112111.content:
“Ok, next. Hey the Konel boy. Step right up.” Coach Hale said as he operated the scale to weigh in everyone. Junior High sports weren’t as big as High School but they still taught everyone how everything was done and made a big enough deal about it to make the kids proud. You were already in your shorts and t-shirt then took a step up and waited for the scale to spit out a number. After it appeared to think about it, it displayed 145 on the screen. “Ah, big guy for so young. Go on and warm up in the practice room.”

You did as instructed and went into a small room that was usually the middle school Chapel room, where once a week middle school would come together like a mini and educations church service. But in the evenings it doubled as the wrestling room with the mats all laid out and such. You went in and put your new wrestling shoes on. You read up on wrestling as much as you could but in the end you still didn’t know what you were doing so you waited for someone to tell you.

“Hey new kid, don’t just sit there. Start running with the rest of us.” said a big eighth grader and obviously one of the big guys on the team. You did as instructed, warming up didn’t do much for you though. You could run all the way up north, a near 5 hour drive, to your family’s cabin and back within 20 minutes and still not break a sweat.

“Sprint!” came a call as you all continued running. This part was hard for you to. Obviously you couldn’t go too fast but you didn’t want to be thought of as slow or weak either. So you had to gauge a good jog, run, and sprint speed.

The rest of practice you made sure you were impressive enough to be noticed but not so much as to be considered abnormal, well no where near enough to cause suspicion anyway. A lot of the practice was conditioning though, lots of running, doing stairs, sprinting, pushups, sit ups, and pretty much every practical conditioning exercise the coach could think of. Afterwards you got your shower in and went home, not really impressed but felt more complete now that you were part of something like most other students. While the others on the team slightly looked at you in slight awe because of you now natural skill and athleticism they were far from treating like one of their own.

“I mean it, you could be really good.” Matt said as he followed you out. You had drilled a little with him and he immediately noticed your skill was higher than his but lacked the experience and move set to beat him, well not the way you were revealing at least. You could always force him onto his back and win but not under the realistic realm of wrestling.

Matt Malcame was a very large and very talented kid that was one of the few truly talented wrestlers in middle school, never losing a match before and wrestled 2 weight classes higher than you. He looked like a mini Brock Lesnar, with a very thick frame and just massive all the way around but not a giant as far as height was concerned. He was one of those guys that everyone you knew wished to be, including you… well you use to. Your muscle definition was now greater than his and your body fat percentage lower than his as well. The only thing he had on you was size, and from most people’s perspective that didn’t know better his strength as well. In wrestling he had massive amounts of experience compared to almost any other kid. His Dad was an All American but died after he joined the Marines and went on a mission. But his father’s wish was to see him in the sport and do well so that is what his family did, from 5 years old he was trained and was no slouch by any means. He could easily beat other guys at the 189 weight class in high school but was wise enough to not push it too far.

“No offense Matt but I’m not really into wrestling for the long term. But it is fun and I’ll train hard while in practice. Otherwise I can’t afford to go to these wrestling camps and strength training things. I work with my Father a lot and even if I wanted to he wouldn’t let me.” You answered. He was trying to convince you to go to a wrestling camp in Iowa. To be honest, the camp he was referring to was the one you researched when looking up moves and the rules before you joined. You knew it was an awesome camp but you didn’t really need to strength train or learn wrestling like most people. Well you did but, again, no like most people. You had resorted to teleporting up north to your family’s cabin and running all night as fast as you could in circles then digging a hole a mile deep then filling it back up and doing it again. You highly doubted that a human strength camp could push you to get stronger in such a way, especially if they didn’t know how strong you really were and why.

“I don’t get it. How can you have so much talent and strength and not be interested. I had to work hard for this.” he said as he gestured to his body.

“Most think I’m just weird. I don’t really care if I’m popular or not and, even though I eat more than most of my family, I don’t gain fat or weight like they do. I do the same amount of work and my muscles just retain more than my brothers. Although for our age none of my brothers are really weak by most standards. My family means everything to me and we are content with doing a lot for nothing. I mean we mow the lawn of our entire neighborhood for free and shovel in the winter. It is just the way we are I guess. So if you want me to go to one of those things then you only really have to convince one person, my Father.” You explained.

“Don’t you have a say in it?” he asked.

“Sure I do. But in my family, what my Father says is law. He isn’t bad by any means. But if he says jump I do it without question.” You answered.

“I guess I can respect that. I do what my parents say to. When my Dad was still here I never disobeyed him either. But you are at least going to stick it out at our school right?” he asked.

“What am I going to join, basketball?” you answered back. Normally, wrestlers didn’t play basketball. The muscles used just don’t transfer and well, if you ever see a normal wrestler that has wrestled for a few years play then you know why. While it wasn’t true for you, Matt knew this as well and smiled at the joke. Besides, with no football at your school, wrestling was the only ‘man’s sport’ that there was. Sure the others took skill but nothing that let aggression out like wrestling or football did, and sense football wasn’t there all the bigger guys that could take it were in wrestling… which in a small school wasn’t many.

“Ok man, see you tomorrow.” He said as you got to the doors and was about to walk out. You both waved and you went off to walk home.
112311211111111112111.title: First day at practice.

choices: Mr. Vance scolds you about the spider.
1123112111111111121111.content:
“So how’s practice going?” asked Kelsey as you two sat together on the bus. As part of the school’s attempt to strengthen the educational experience the schedule team building activities to bolster the grade’s participation in school centered activities. For 6th graders it is a retreat to a Camp for 5 days. Your parents were reluctant to let you go but in the end it was mandatory and they just fed you a few pints of blood from your hospital stock to be on the safe side.

“It is good enough I guess. The practices are pretty intense which I like.” You answered.

“That can’t be much worse than mine.” Kelsey stated.

“I couldn’t tell you, I’m not a cheerleader or have ever been to one of your practices. But the first hour is usually just condition; sprinting, running, doing massive amounts of pushups and sit ups, stairs, and bear crawls. Then we drill moves for another hour and a half and finish up with some more sprinting and running to calm down. Coach Hale mixes it up a little to keep us guessing but that is basically what we do.” You said.

“I take it back, maybe your practice is harder than ours. Damn, don’t you men know what the word overkill means?” she asked rhetorically. “Gosh I’m tired, do you mind if I sleep on you?” She asked.

“Go ahead, we got another hour or so before we get there.” You said to which she leaned against you and fell asleep, using your arm as a pillow as she clung to it. You smiled a bit then just watched out the window as the bus drove along. You knew this place as you ran up north a few times a week. You had to stop yourself thinking that this was transportation as it moved at a snail’s pace compared to what you normally traveled at. Instead you thought of it as a really long and usually quiet tour. You allowed her to sleep and sometimes held her with your mind to help her sleep peacefully. Other kids on the bus were sporadically noisy and would otherwise wake her up. But when you arrived you took your hold off of her mind and gently woke her. “What excellent timing, we just arrived.”

“Wow, I actually slept really good for being on a bus.” She said then covered her mouth for a yawn then stretched a little. You all shortly after got off the bus and separated to your assigned cabins. Guys and girls were obviously separate and took up a few cabins each.

“Hey, that’s mine. You get the top Caleb.” Stated one of the popular kids as he pushed his way and plopped his stuff on the bottom bunk just before you. You just shrugged and threw your sleeping bag and stuff on the top bunk. You had a poly hook that stuck to walls and stuff to put your bag just above you while you rolled out your bag and found a surprise latching onto the ceiling above your bunk. “Holy crap! That’s is a huge damned spider!” said the same kid.

“Come here big guy.” You called as you sat up and against the wall your bunk was against. They watched as you reached up to the large wolf spider that was right next to your bag. It had bolted there after one of them threw their shoe at it. You ever trusty scent calmed it and your natural attractiveness kept it following your orders as the spider crawled onto your hand and sat there looking at you as you pet it a little. Funny though, you use to be Arachnophobic but now you actually preferred spiders and rescued them whenever possible from your house and the other members of your family that were still scared to death of them, especially Sarah.

“Dude, you’re going to kill that thing aren’t you?” asked Nick, the kid from before. He obviously wasn’t a spider person either, nor was the other 10 in the room.

“Now that would be unappreciative of me. Who do you think keeps this place free of other bugs?” you asked as you pet your temporary pet. “Or would you rather get bitten by a couple hundred flies and mosquitoes.”

“I just don’t want to get bit by fang boy there.” Said Nick and being the more popular one he swayed the rest of the cabin as well. You thought about it for a while then saw a few spaces in the ceiling and walls that the big guy could effectively hide. You input the locations of these places to which he scurried over your body and out of a hole in the wall. “Hey, you let him get away.”

“Well of course I did. But I didn’t ask him to leave either. He must’ve sensed that he wasn’t wanted around here so he left.” You answered.

“He’s just going to come back and bite us.” Nick roared. “I’m telling Mr. Vance about this. If I get bit it is going to be all your fault.” And with that he stormed out and left you there in bed and thinking how much alike you were to that spider. All it took was them to know he was there to want him dead, and he didn’t do anything bad, in fact with him gone you saw some previously scared bugs coming in. Good thing you asked him to come back. You didn’t need it but it would be nice to not get eaten alive by mosquitoes at night.
1123112111111111121111.title: 6th grade retreat.

11231121111111111211111.content:
“Don’t even say anything you spider freak.” Nick had said when Mr. Vance didn’t back him up and told him that spiders were common and that you were to be commended for being able to handle a live one. So you laid in your bunk without receiving a wink of sleep. Luckily for you, your little friend came back and caught a good majority of any bug that approached you until they didn’t bother you anymore. From that point you let the spider sleep on your chest while you pet him. You heard slaps and rustling all night as blood sucking bugs like flies, mosquitoes, and nats were ruthless all night. It wasn’t as boring with a pet spider to pet as you waited for morning. You were allowed to get out of bed at 5 so you could go for a run, leaving the spider in your pillow that opened near the wall so he could escape if they decided to do something to your stuff while you were gone. An hour and a half later you came back and headed straight for the shower as they others were starting to stir. You took a short and cold one so they couldn’t accuse you of hogging all the warm water.

“Hey, you didn’t get bit up at all. That’s not fair.” Said Nick as he looked at your shirtless upper body. At first they were stunned at your impressive physic but then they noticed that you lacked the dotted spots that lined their bodies from head to toe, causing them to itch around.

“Sure it is, my little friend came back and helped me out last night. He caught every bug within a foot of me. I guess they figured that the rest of you were easier prey. Not my fault you didn’t want him catching all the bugs around here.” You defended as you slipped on a black sleeveless shirt, black shorts, and black shoes. Your shirt had a silver dragon design on the back and your glyph on the front. You then jumped up to your bed and whistled that brought you little friend out of hiding for you to pet. “Seems like the spider freak is the only one without any bug bites.”

“Whatever you freak.” Nick said and pushed his way into the bathroom for his turn in the shower. The others were obviously not liking this at all and approached you.

“You think he can protect us tonight to?” asked Scott, a nerdy kid with thick glasses but president of the card club at your school. The clubs at school had to be run and financed by the students but approved by the faculty.

“Perhaps if you all stop throwing shoes at him he can do his job.” You said and with a final pet you let him down and he scurried onto the ceiling and went about making more webs and eating a few bugs that were caught in the few that remained.

“How did you do that? I mean, doesn’t wild spiders like that bite people?” asked Alex, a pretty popular kid shorter than you with sleek dirty blonde hair that was just short enough to follow the dress code.

“Tons of practice and the experience to read what he is going to do and what his attack language is. If I were to just grab at him he would bite me without hesitation. Actually this one is well mannered as I was surprised it didn’t bite me anyway. But that’s just the nature of a spider, to protect themselves against big, scary, shoe throwing giants.” You answered then hopped down and headed for the door.

“Hey Caleb, did you take a run this morning?” asked Jacob, another popular person on the basketball team.

“Yeah, from 5 to 6:30, threw some pushups and sit ups as well. I told Coach Hale that I would at least go for a run in place of practice.” You answered.

“How do you get up that early?” he asked back.

“Years of practice, my Father gets my family up a 5 every morning so I’m just use to it.” You lied. While it was true, it obviously wasn’t the chief reason. In truth you hadn’t slept all night and didn’t need to for another week.

“But I didn’t even hear you get up at all.” he argued and you just shrugged as if to say that it wasn’t your fault that he didn’t, which again wasn’t true. It was completely your fault as you had made it a point not to make any noise. After that they didn’t have any more questions so you headed off to go about your day until your first scheduled event as a class which was…
11231121111111111211111.title: Next morning...

112311211111111112111112.content:
“Ok, now we have to work together to get back to camp.” Said Mr. Vance as the bus drove away. After breakfast your class was given their first challenge. It was a survival/teamwork exercise that involved the whole class going out into the wilderness, well the woods as it wasn’t wild enough to be considered the wilderness but still. From there the whole class would travel back to camp over the course of the next two days, or three if needed.

“Ok, pair up. No one goes anywhere alone and each has to look out for the other as far as food and shelter is concerned. This will also be your safety line in case something happens.” Mrs. Vance said as she stood near a pile of tents. Her and Mr. Vance were obviously married and were in charge of your class. People began pairing up and most of the popular guys got girls but there was only one girl that made an effort to be your partner.

“You’re mine.” Kelsey stated as she gave you a little punch in the arm then looked curiously at your lack of luggage. Most were told to bring what they needed, in which case they brought a whole pack of stuff. From flashlights to extra snacks they had relatively large packs. “Where’s your pack?” she asked.

“I don’t need one.” You stated simply as you were just standing there in your shorts and t-shirt with nothing else with you. She on the other hand had a small pack for what most people were carrying, especially the girls. “I’ll get the tent.” You said as you went over to the teachers, got a tent, tied it to your back like the packs other people had, then went back to Kelsey.

“But won’t you need a pillow and extra clothes?” she asked to which you laughed a little. “What?”

“I thought the point of going on a survival trip was to… survive not go on a vacation. Anyway it is good that you didn’t bring any makeup and perfume like the other girls did.” You answered. You knew that her parents didn’t allow her such things, yet. She was ‘too young’ as her parents put it and therefore didn’t wear or bring any, not that she needed it. Even if she thought she did, she had a natural beauty that most girls tried replicating with the application of makeup, and with them being so young they put way too much on and sometimes missed the mark.

“And why’s that?” she asked.

“You’ll see. Just don’t put any on from the other girls or you’re going to be batting away mosquitoes all day and night.” You said as you told her enough for her to partially understand.

“Hey Kelsey, I hope you weren’t planning on any help from your… partner. It doesn’t look like he will be good for anything except carrying that tent.” Mocked another blonde haired and tall girl named Carly that was with Nick as they both laughed at your group. Kelsey didn’t even have time to scowl as the teachers started to address the students again.

“Now that we are in our groups you can form larger ones to help as you need, but we will all be traveling as a group. It will benefit you to band together in order to do things that you couldn’t do by yourself.” Mr. Vance said to which the pairs around you started to band together but shunned you. It wasn’t as if they knew about your abilities but rather they just didn’t like you. For the guys you were a popularity threat with your body and by now perfect grades and for girls you weren’t very socially smart and they just thought you weren’t worth it, that and they didn’t like Kelsey very much for her natural beauty and lack of cupsize. In the end you two stood alone and she got worried.

“Don’t worry, my family does this kind of thing all the time. Most of you all are city kids so I will have the advantage, therefore you will have the advantage.” You said while giving her a sideways hug, making her feel better but it still bothered her that she was so unpopular.

“They hate me, I’m too ugly to fit in.” she whimpered.

“Hey, none of that. You are the most beautiful girl here and when they finally figure that out you will know which of them would be good friends and what they are like underneath. Don’t let them win by seeing their treatment of you cause you to feel bad like they want.” You said to her as you turned her and locked eyes. She had commented on your red eye before but she was always memorized by them. Sure you could just make her feel better and the others more accepting with your powers but you didn’t want to affect them like that.

“Ok, let’s get going then.” She said after she wiped her eyes and smiled at your words. The others brushed past you both to get in front but you held her back a little just so there was a good 10 feet between them and you two. “Why do we have to be so far back?” she asked.

“That’s why.” You said as you pointed to a boy that smacked his neck when bit by a large horse fly. “All the colane, perfume, makeup, and even deodorant is attracting all the blood suckers to them and none of us brought bug spray so if the scent of them is up there and we are back here the bugs will be attracted to them.”

“I see, you have done this before. I guess you’re right.” She said as she saw a few of them batting away small concentrations of nats and mosquitoes from them and smacking the occasional bite. She silently giggled at the hard time they were having as the two of you, the unpopular ones, were free and clear. “But why didn’t we travel ahead and with Mr. and Mrs. Vance?” she asked. The two of them were equally ahead of the group as the two of you were behind it.

“Wait for it.” You said then she smiled as someone went up to see if they had bug spray and the space was filled and the small amount they had with them was used up.
112311211111111112111112.title: A challenge.

1123112111111111121111121.content:
“You mind if we join you two?” asked Mrs. Vance as she and Mr. Vance came by your fire. You had all stopped for the night and your spot was further away from the soft grass the rest of the students had found. You had insisted on the harder ground under the trees and had your fire going before anyone else but they were all determined to make their own and not give you and Kelsey any credit. On top of that you had caught a turkey and was in the middle of roasting it over the fire on a makeshift spit, flavored with different things you found around the area. At first Kelsey thought it disgusting with the rest of them but now that it was almost done it was smelling and looking absolutely delicious. However the reason why they were joining you was that your fire and place was the only one big enough to fit multiple people and was actually going at a steady pace, as the others had run out of matches and attempts to start their fires.

“Sure, come on and take a seat.” Kelsey answered as she pat a log you found as a bench then made a circle around the fire at a safe yet comfortable distance. She tended to them in that was while you turned the turkey again as it slow cooked above the flames.

“Thank you, but why are you two so far away from the group?” She asked as they both sat on an empty spot around the fire so you were all facing each other.

“I wouldn’t mind knowing that myself.” Kelsey stated as she nudged you to answer.

“Well there are a few reasons. The first is that the reason why there is a rich set of grass in the middle of the forest is because it is a swamp of sorts. Sure it’s dry during the day when the sun is out, but when the morning due and precipitation come around it will get all wet and smelling like… well a swamp and all the animal droppings that have made the ground underneath it so fertile. That is why the fires went out so quick over there as well, everything’s wet. The second reason was that they are all too loud to hope of getting any kind of sleep tonight. Along with all the perfume, cologne, and other things that attract the bugs and small animals will make their night not so pleasant. Finally they told us to get lost so… here we are, about to enjoy a warm meal and nice night’s sleep.” You explained.

“You knew all that? Why didn’t you say anything to the rest? It is suppose to be a teamwork exercise.” Mr. Vance asked.

“I can answer that. We both tried to tell them about the perfume and Cologne but they just made fun of us that we didn’t have any. They laughed at us when we tried to tell them so in the end we tried but they just don’t like us.” Kelsey answered.

“Ok, time to dig in.” you said to changed the subject slightly, taking out a hidden knife that you kept in the sole of your shoe to cut a small piece and give it a taste. “Mmm, perfect. You two want some as well. We can’t have any left over when we go to bed.” you offered as you handed Kelsey the knife and she carved a little out for herself, dropping it into a small paper plate she brought with her then offered the knife over to them but Mr. Vance already had one out.

“Well that’s awfully nice of you. I think we’ll accept your offer. We have to keep our strength up to keep an eye on the kids. The whole sleeping with girls thing is usually a hard thing every year. There is always a few or you kids that try to make it a problem and we have to keep an eye out for that.” Mrs. Vance said to which Mr. Vance carved a little of the cooked bird out for him and his wife as you did the same on your end.

“If you don’t mind me asking. Why did you do it that way, guys sleeping with girls that is? Usually it is strictly a no when even considering it, the cabins are even sorted by the gender barrier.” You asked, as it had been a conversation stone for you and Kelsey as you walked together.

“It is about introducing to young kids like you that just because a girl and a guy are sleeping under the same roof, or tent in this case, that it doesn’t have to mean something bad. I admit it is a new way of approaching it but it works wonders later on in schooling.” Mr. Vance explained.

“So how do you know so much about camping?” Mrs. Vance asked.

“My family goes camping all the time and we have a cabin up north that we vacation at. It is a constant contest between our family when we go camping to see how little we can bring and still last the usual week we go camping. I do have to say it is a good thing we don’t have bears or some of the bigger things around here. Because for all the sweets it sounds like the others brought, it would attract many animals. The way it is they might get a couple uninvited visitors.” You answered.

“Sound of it?” asked Mr. Vance to which you all became deathly quiet and heard some wrappers open amongst the chatter and flashlight beams that glanced over your direction every once in a while. With no fire they had to rely on blankets and wrapped foods, not that they could catch anything like you could anyway. “I see, or hear what you mean. Your food was much better.”

“Yes it was, thanks Caleb.” Kelsey agreed. You all talked a little more after the bird was all gone, than were interrupted by arguing and shouting as the others were getting all antsy and probably tired.

“Well I think this would be a good time to send everyone to bed. Be sure to put out your fire before you two head off to bed, but it should be in the next little while.” Mr. Vance stated as both of them got up. You nodded as the both of you stood and you put out what was left of the fire. Kelsey took out her flashlight and shined it at the tent as Mr. and Mrs. Vance were off explaining the rules of the night like they had just talked with you two about.

“So… we both sleep together?” she asked as she looked more at the tent in preparation then at you.

“Nah, I like sleeping outside. That’s why I didn’t bring a pillow. Remember I’ve done this before so I am more comfortable falling asleep looking at the stars then I am in a potentially small and overcrowded tent.” You said to which she shined the light at you and you cringed as it hit your face, making her lower it in response but still on you.

“Then where are you going to sleep?” she asked, internally and vocally relieved for the news. You looked around then leapt up and climbed a tree to a thick branch above your spot about 20 feet. You sat with your back against the tree and your leg dangling down, clearly relaxed at the moment.

“This will do.” You said down to her as she looked up at you.

“You can never do things halfway can you?” she asked comically and just accepted that you were right at this point, entering the tent after going into the woods to relieve herself. You let her have her privacy but kept an ear for her as she settled in and fell asleep. You of course didn’t need sleep so you watched over the class as the teachers moved their tent but kept an extra close eye, or ear, out for Kelsey. Needless to say, you had a lot of time to think and observe throughout the night as Mr. and Mrs. Vance had to intervene at some points when they heard irregular sounds coming from only one tent, Nick and Carly. They, in the end, had to sleep with one of the teachers as they snored. The prospect of something similar kept the rest in line and sometimes as stiff as board next to their partners.
1123112111111111121111121.title: Dinner is served.

11231121111111111211111211.content:
A scream woke most of everyone as you got back to your tent. You had just came back after running and doing some exercise, then washed off in the small waterfall that emptied into a stream. You were in the middle of rubbing a nicely scented leaf under your arms when Kelsey burst out of her tent in response to the scream. It was only 8:00 in the morning for them it was pretty early but everyone was up now.

“W… what are you doing?” Asked Kelsey as she saw you shirtless and rubbing the leaf under your arms. Your highly fit and toned body gave her pause as she checked you out then looked up at your face as you looked back at her to answer her question.

“I was just getting done freshening up. I took a run and did a little exercise this morning, and sense there isn’t any showers around here I used a little waterfall that pours into that creak we saw yesterday. It’s a little bit in that direction if you want to freshen up as well. But, I’d hurry if I were you.” you answered as you finished then slipped your shirt on. She could tell you washed up because your hair was still wet.

“Why’s that, and what were you doing with those leaves?” she asked.

“The leaves are just really strongly scented so I thought they would do well as a natural deodorant, as for why you should hurry. Remember what I said about the swamp making people wet and smelly? Well they will all probably want to wash up as well. And if they see you going then they’ll follow you to that spot and you can kiss privacy goodbye. Anyway, Carly was the one that screamed when she tripped over a raccoon on her way out of her tent and got a face full of what’s left of their food when it goes through a the said raccoon.” You said with a smile, to which she returned one then shortly after went to the waterfall and returned, with her shirt on obviously.

“You mind if I get some of those?” she asked as she saw you had some unused leaves. You handed them to her to which she rubbed them over more parts of her body then just her underarms, you had turned so she could do so in privacy.” You don’t have to look away for this.” she said.

“All the same, I found out long ago by one of my cousins that are halfway decent looking and crazy about her appearance. That peeking at a girl while she is getting ready is not a wise move, even if it’s just rubbing leaves on yourself. I tell you, a few whacks over the head does wonders for a guy’s perspective and learning experiences.” You said, still looking over at the other students rather than back at her.

“I guess so. Well your family sure rose you to be polite. Judging from the rest of your family that I’ve seen, I wouldn’t want to learn a lesson like that more than once either. Made you smarter at least though.” She said then walked over to the side of you. “I’m done, you want some breakfast? I have some doughnuts and other stuff that I thought you’d like.” She offered.

“Save it for later. I have a feeling that it will take us the full 3 days to back it back, judging on how long they are all going to be there and getting ready themselves.” You said as you both looked over at the other students. “But we should probably get our gear all set so we can go and they don’t decide to make our stuff match with their wet and soggy clothes and tents.” You said to which she smiled and you both packed up your stuff, cleaned the makeshift fire bit away, and got ready to leave. By that time the other students were having a miserable breakfast and Mrs. Vance came over to you two as Mr. Vance helped the students take down their tents.

“Glad we took your advice and got to sleep in our tent before morning came. But… both of you look and… smell like you took showers.” She said as she got a closer look and smell of you. Kelsey beckoned her closer to tell her about the waterfall and the creek the both of you used, separately. “Then excuse me.” She said as she headed over to Mr. Vance, whispered something, then went into the woods in the direction of the small waterfall. By the time she got back and ready to leave they were all standing around, to proud to ask you where you both showered. But Mr. Vance wasn’t having any more of that so he called you two up to the front.

“Ok, now that we are on our second day it is about time that you all notice how well and easy these two have made it for themselves. They even got showers in, had a hot meal, and I do believe are the only ones here that still have food left and the capability to produce fire for tonight. Since we aren’t going to make it back by tonight we will be camping out again. Which means if you all don’t do some serious apologizing then it would appear that the next day and a half will be very uncomfortable for you all.” Mr. Vance said and each part of the speech hit each person differently. The girls were shocked that you both found a way to shower while the guys were enticed by the fact that you two were the only ones that could offer warmth and food tonight. The only ones that were reluctant but willing to push their pride aside were the two big shots, Nick and Carly. Nick was a mess and looked like he didn’t sleep a wink while Carly looked like she had a fight with a manure pile and lost. Her usually well kept blonde hair was mangled and had chunks of crap in it that was now smeared by her attempts to both straighten and clean her hair. Not to mention that all of their clothes were at least damp from the swamp land patch they just slept in, with their tents leaking water from their temporary resting places.

“Can you show me… us where to take a show before we go?” asked Carly. To which Kelsey looked at you excited. She always and still wanted to be recognized by the popular crowd.

“Go on, you show the girls first. We guys will wait for our turn.” You said to her. There was a collective sigh of relief from the group as the girls followed Mrs. Vance and Kelsey into the woods. You stood with Mr. Vance to which Nick finally approached you. He looked like a whipped dog and just as tired.

“You don’t happen to have any food do you?” he asked.

“Sorry, all we got left is what Kelsey has and she definitely doesn’t have enough to feed over 20 people. I can help with dinner, later on tonight though. That is if you’ll eat what I catch.” You said, the last part with perhaps a little more venom then the rest. He cringed at the words and the tone as he was now suffering from the aftermath of treating you and Kelsey so bad before, that and ignoring your advice that would’ve saved them this uncomfortable situation.

“Caleb, I’m sorry man. I really am. I was s… stupid.” He said, the last part was harder for him to get out that the rest.

“I know, I guess there is one good thing about this whole thing.” You said to which they/he looked at you confused. “Well, with all that smelly artificial stuff washed off you aren’t getting eaten alive by mosquitoes anymore are you?” you asked and they thought about it as they looked around.

“Is that why you… darn, I guess it is good when you look at it that way.” He said. You quickly glanced at Mr. Vance, who happen to be grinning from ear to ear as the trip was doing what it was designed to do. It was bringing you all together in a way that would never had happened otherwise.
11231121111111111211111211.title: Next morning.

choices: Back in a bed and the Cabin with new friends and an old one.
There's a complication and you have to risk exposure to help.
112311211111111112111112111.content:
As the day went on, you and Kelsey walked with the teachers and a few others would come up and talk to one of you. However the girls and guys insistency of putting on perfume and Cologne made you request they stay back as much as possible. They were significantly nicer about it but they still were city kids and wanted to be presentable to the others, regardless if their clothes were all still smelling like the swamp that soaked their stuff last night. That smell made their walk a little more livable, as far as bugs were concerned, but otherwise they were glad when you all stopped for the night. You had been asked multiple times to carry people’s packs, including Kelsey, but insisted on them carrying their own junk so they knew to pack less the next time, if there was a next time.

After getting your, or Kelsey’s, tent set up and showing the rest where to put theirs you made a fire then went out to hunt. Luckily you found a deer and was able to stalk it until you were close enough to use a mental persuasion of sorts. It was powerful enough to get humans to do what you wanted so, if you got close enough, it was child’s play for wild animals. You were able to walk right up to it and sink your fangs into the backside of its neck. Luckily the act of biting didn’t invoke panic and rather spurred the victim to want to have you finish. To that aspect you drank the deer dry then prepared it for a similar cooking job than before. In no time at all you had it turning over your fire and the students that opted to sit around your fire left at the current site. But you knew that they would be back later when it both smelled and looked good enough to eat.

“How you were able to hunt a deer without a weapon is simply amazing.” Mr. Vance said as you knew he hunted a little but not more than a week during gun hunting season. You had… persuaded the DNR to give you a pass to hunt all year round and not register the deer or other animals you take down. You were still bound by the endangered species list but otherwise could hunter whenever and wherever you wanted, well in Wisconsin at least.

“Thanks, I worked hard at being able to hunt like that.” You lied, while what you did was impressive it wasn’t ‘hard’ for you in the slightest. Your abilities made it unfair to anyone, especially whatever you were hunting.

“Well it seems you two are having less trouble getting along with the others.” Mrs. Vance stated as she had been observing the interaction between the class. You had to wonder if they did the same thing every year, as in the swamp and all but pushed that thought aside as it was irrelevant. The point of the trip was a current success. You were all at least talking with each other and they didn’t shun you or Kelsey anymore.

“That’s because you two are so cool.” Stated a young blonde girl, named Dixie, with an extreme amount of fascination as she and a black kid, named Brian, sat down at the fire. They were part of the newspaper club at the school. While the middle school newspaper wasn’t as big as the high school one they still took the job seriously, Dixie more than Brian. They did stories on anything and everything. They even did a few on the two of you and your apparent lack of popularity despite each of your athletic prowess.

“You really think so?” asked Kelsey as she beamed with excitement at the compliment.

“Oh yeah, no question about it. The two of you are easily the least popular kids in the school right now but do the best, or close to the best, in grades and sports. It is like the opposite of what usually happens. This little trip has offset that a little but it doesn’t change the fact that each of you are fascinating.” Brian complimented.

“If you say so.” You said as you turned the half cooked deer on the spit. It had just started to look and smell to the point that people were coming around to see if it was done yet.

“And with all the things you two can do, who would’ve guessed that Caleb was a cook to? Not me, usually wrestlers don’t cook, they let their Moms cook and stuff their faces after weigh-ins.” Dixie reported.

“Caleb, what’s wrong?” asked Kelsey after a silence hit the area and you seemed like you were distracted except for turning the deer every once in a while.

“N…nothing is wrong. I…” you started then stopped, hoping that they wouldn’t push much more than that.

“Caleb, we’ve been friends for the whole year. I can tell when something’s up.” Kelsey stated.

“Are you not feeling well?” Asked Mrs. Vance like a mother or nurse, hard to tell which one.

“N… no, that’s not it. I’ve just never had this many people actually want to be around me before. I mean my family is different because… well their family. But I’ve always been the outcast and never really that ‘cool’ as you two say.” You explained as you looked over to Dixie and Brian then back at your task. “I’ve never really had a friend outside my family before. Now that I have so many people that at the very least depend on me I don’t really know what to do. Acting like I usually act won’t cut it. I can’t just hide in the back of the room anymore. People actually want to hear what I have to say. It’s just not something I’m used to.”

“Awe, so you’re just confused, how cute.” Kelsey teased as she grabbed on and hugged your free arm as you turned the deer again. Your face turned a little red from this and she noticed and giggled as a result.

“Well it was only a matter of time Caleb. With how apparently talented you are, it was about time people crowded around you to dwell in the place of such talent. As for what you should do… it really is up to you. All the advice I can give is that you don’t forget to remember where you came from.” Mr. Vance said. It did feel better to have so many people looking to you for something good. It was almost the opposite of what you were expecting ever since you became the Vampire. But they didn’t need to know that about you, hopefully ever…
112311211111111112111112111.title: That night.

choices: Going home and finding a guest in your room that is... wierd.
Telling your parents about your trip and your spider eating.
1123112111111111121111121111.content:
“Man, I’m stuffed. Even though it wasn’t as good as the deer you made Caleb, it was still a lot of food.” Nick said as you all got back into your cabins. The deer was good but not big enough to feed everyone to the top. As such the morning was the same as before, minus an uninvited guest and soaking supplies. But in any case you all got back near dinner time and all ate your fill, except you. You were still full from the deer blood and combined with what you ate, or drank, before you left you estimated that you wouldn’t have to drink any blood for a while. So in a sense you were full, just not from the food that the camp now provided.

“Yeah, no kidding.” Said another kid as they all unpacked their previously soaked but now dried and smelly things from their packs. They each took turns at the washer and drier to clean their sleeping bags first, then the rest of their clothes. On top of that they all took long, hot, and relaxing showers. You suspected that the others and especially the girls were doing the same. After a cold shower the first night and no shower this morning the city kids were all suffering from a slight withdrawal.

“I’d check your sleeping bag if I were you. Sure it is all nice and clean but there are probably like a billion bugs in the thing.” Nick said as you hopped up to your bunk.

“Doubt it, you’re forgetting about our little friend.” You said as he frowned confused for a moment.

“Who?” he asked to which you whistled a little and a noticeable shadow branched off from the corner and scuttled across the ceiling, down the wall, across your bed, and into your hand to which you rewarded him by petting him gently. “Oh, right. So he kept bugs out of your stuff?” he asked as he nervously looked at the stoic creature of his phobia slightly moving in your hand and against your touch.

“Not just mine, he probably feasted good as our scents would still be here to attract blood sucking bugs to the area. If you let him, he’ll protect us tonight as well. Just don’t give him a reason to attack and he won’t.” you answered.

“Well if you say so spider… man.” Nick said, censoring himself as he almost called you ‘spider freak’ like before. When he talked to you after his and their little change of heart he had to rethink his words that came out of his mouth. He was so use to picking on you that saying anything else was a new experience for him.

“Well at least I don’t have to catch a deer tonight.” You said as you attempted small talk with them. Usually you weren’t good at that kind of thing but you were making an effort.

“Was it that hard?” asked Scott in an informative tone.

“Kind of. Most animals run from us so finding one is harder than the actual hunt. Then you have to kill it and with only a knife it can be difficult. After that I had to gut it, drain it, skin it, and prepare it for cooking so not to gross out everyone else, and all this far enough away so that the remaining guts don’t attract a bear or wolf to our camp. So yeah, it is harder than just going to the dining hall to get a meal.” You answered.

“You can hunt animals with just a knife?” asked Nick in a surprised tone. He knew you got the deer but obviously never hunted before. While he was confident that he could if given a gun and the opportunity he knew that doing so with only a knife was far beyond him or possibly whatever father figure he had in his life. Like you, most your age think that figure is the best and almost all powerful.

“It isn’t that hard once you get the sneaking part down. Thing is that the sneaking is the hardest part cause most animals are insanely skittish. A single twig snap is enough for them to run off. But I have a lot of practice so I can do it pretty easily. After that it is all downhill, having a sharp knife and the proximity to use it is all you got to worry about after that point.” You explained.

“But where is your knife? I saw you had one but, unlike Mr. Vance, you didn’t have it in your pocket. For starters you don’t have pockets, right now at least.” Nick asked.

“No offense Nick, but the point of keeping a hidden blade is to keep its location… well hidden.” You answered to which he smirked instead of the expected scowl at your refusal to answer his question the way he probably wanted.

“I was wrong before Caleb, you might just be cool enough to talk to.” He said.

“I’m sure there is a backward compliment in there somewhere, in which case, thanks.” You said back to him and you all continued talking about the survival trip and what to expect for your last day at the camp. Eventually they all went to sleep and your little friend was given free passage by most to catch his feast as he saw fit. But after a few hours the other bugs retreated and went to the other cabins, to which he came and sat on your chest and accepted a petting position. Although you could tell that it was too cold for him and his small life was about to end. But you didn’t want to think about it. He was like a pet now and you didn’t want to think about him dying.

However the spider didn’t seem to share your passive and distant point of view on the subject. Just like any other creature, he knew his time was up and that it was too cold for him to survive another night. Even IF he was able to mate with a female it would be pointless as she would also be dead or close to it by the time she was able to manufacture eggs, in which case he would definitely be dead after that. He seemed to notice where he was in relation to you, you being an actual predator of sorts and not some ignorant and oversized threat like the rest of the humans around.
