So after a few hours of your gingerly petting he started moving toward your face. This behavior would’ve scared you silly when you were still phobic about spiders but now it was just more movement. You had already allowed him to crawl everywhere on your body when you met that first night so you didn’t feel any type of bad feeling to him slowly crawling toward your face.

When he reached your neck he climbed the short distance then waited on and around your chin but just underneath your mouth. After a few minutes of doing nothing and you just observing what he was doing he tried to push himself inside. You didn’t know what to do to this. You didn’t want your pet to die and you sure as hell didn’t want to be the one to kill him. At your age you had a deep emotional connection to pets but your body seemed to react differently than your emotions were telling you to. Your logical mind was repeating the spider’s situation to you and what it intended. It wanted the superior predator in front of it, that gave him so much food and respect, to be the one to eat him in return rather than allowing the cold or age kill him in the next day. Your fangs grew at this new development and your slowly opened your mouth.

What would’ve been a nightmare to you before was now making you shed a few tears as your loyal pet spider, that you only knew for a few days, slowly climbed into your mouth. It occasionally scratched itself on your fangs as it entered then waited for you to finish as he had pushed as much of himself into you as he could, his back legs and tip of his thorax still outside the confines of your mouth. You had to decide what to do and decided your couldn’t bare reducing your little pet and friend to mush with the same fangs and teeth you used to suck blood from others. So you used your tongue to guide him back to the throat, impressively you didn’t have a gag reflex anymore, perhaps to keep new Vampires from gagging at the idea and feeding of their new life. Anyway it took the hint and helped you feed itself down your throat and in a couple of swallows your little pet was going down to your stomach. You had to admit that the feeling of something living going down and wiggling around in your mouth, throat, and stomach was amazing but you didn’t feel good at all at the moment. The moment it got inside your stomach you regretted not ending him quickly as your acids started working on him along with the remaining blood and human food. Unfortunately your power reserves were all at full so you couldn’t speed up digestion to fill them like your body could do if running low on power. So the pour thing suffered for about an hour trying to come up your throat, down to your intestines, and even started painfully biting the inside of your stomach. But in about an hour he slowed then stopped moving. You definitely felt bad about putting your small friend and pet through so much apparent pain and decided never to do it again.
1123112111111111121111121111.title: Back in a bed and the Cabin with new friends an...

choices: "...Brandy" she likes it but wants a nickname.
11231121111111111211111211111.content:
“So how was it?” asked Mom as she greeted you coming into the door. You had gotten back from your week on Friday feeling a little better but not by much, however enough to fool anyone to thinking something was wrong. Papa was up north working with Grandpa at the cabin with your brothers, which left Sarah, who was usually at a friend’s house on Friday night or out in general. That left only you and your Mom in the house. A couple months ago it would’ve freaked her out but not anymore.

“It was good, I got a bunch of new friends and we all had a really good time. The trip definitely did what it was suppose to. Should I go up north to help Papa?” you asked.

“Nah, Papa said that you should whined down from your week before you start lifting cars and tractors for him.” She said with a smile. You smiled back, talked for a bit about events that happened and the lack of exposure to anyone then went to your room. Once inside you laid on your bed, looking over a similar looking wolf spider that you were keeping in your room.

“Sorry.” You said to it, as it scuttled along the wall and into the corner. It made you feel a little better, as if apologizing to the digested spider’s family. Even if you knew it was impossible to do so.

“Sorry for what?” asked a little voice, barely noticeable and definitely out of a human’s hearing range. Your head turned slowly to find the source of the voice but the spot the voice had come from was empty.

“Who said that?” you asked quietly so Mom wouldn’t hear but whomever talked would.

“Oh my, you heard that. Please don’t squash me!” said a frantic female and small voice from underneath your end table. “Please don’t find me, please don’t find me, please don’t find me.” She repeated over and over again, as if willing you not to find her.

“I won’t look for you if you don’t want me to but at least let me see who I’m talking to.” You said with an equally small voice but very calm, allowing your natural calm presence embrace whomever was under your table. You felt just the slightest consciousness under it that you wouldn’t have noticed otherwise.

“You won’t squash me?” she asked after a very long pause in conversation and noise from her end.

“I promise that even if I want to I will allow you at least an hour head start to run away. But I will do my best to refrain from squashing you at all.” you answered.

“Ok, here I come.” She said then crawled from under your desk to on top of it. She was a spider, how strange that you had never sensed her before, because she was definitely sentient, not just by the fact she could talk but also you could sense she had a mind, unlike the thousands of spiders you’ve both killed and saved. She was like a mini tarantula. Very… hairy but pitch black and, by evidence of her movement, very fast. However she was currently no bigger than a quarter with her legs spread out.

“What’s your name?” you asked after you observed her for a moment.

“Why do you want to know?” she asked, still frightened and clearly ready to bolt at the slightest sign aggression from you.

“Is it so bad to want to know the name of someone I am talking to? Here, my name is Caleb. Now that you know my name, can you tell me yours? I can’t go around calling you spider now can I?” you asked, the second question rhetorically.

“I… don’t have a name. I was just born and have been chased here. I don’t even know my mother or father or anything. But I do know that everything just wants to kill me.” She cried to which you spat a sort of solid spit made needle that looked to be coming at her but just before she cringed to accept her fate a small screech was heard from another spider just behind her that was 3 times her size and ready to kill/eat her. The spit made needle stuck through its head and an outstretched arm that was about to touch her.

“Well that’s not good. Here, come on and I’ll give you a name.” you said as you placed your hand on the edge of the table. She looked at the dead spider behind her then figured that if you could do that to it then you could force her to come with you, or kill her if she refused so she scuttled over and onto your hand. You sat up in bed then brought her somewhat close to your face but not enough to openly scare her. “How about…”

112311211111111112111112111111.content:
“Eve? I… like it.” She said as she seemed to like the way she said it. However she still was looking like she was going to run at any moment. “Now that I have a name, what are you going to do to me? Because if you even think about squashing me I’ll make sure to bite you as many times as I can before I go. I already know that my venom can kill a dog, cat, and a horse.” She said in an attempt to scare you but was both calmed and nervous that it didn’t.

“I told you before Eve, I’m not going to crush you. No I think I’ll help you. Is there something you need? I could take you to your home if you remember where it is.” You offered.

“You… are going to help me. Why?” she asked skeptically.

“Do you really want to know? I would prefer not saying.” You said in a sad tone as you thought to your friend that was probably out of your stomach by now.

“Yes, currently there is no reason to trust you over any other human.” she said.

“Except that I can talk to you.” you returned.

“True, but I’ll ask about that later, for now just answer the why… please.” She first demanded but then remembered her vulnerable position and added the last word.

“Well, I just came back from a trip that I and a bunch of other humans went on. When I arrived I met this large wolf spider that everyone else was trying to kill. I know you guys do wonders for us humans in pest control alone so I saved him and in return he protected me from the nasty blood sucking insects. It was mutually beneficial as he got a lot of food and I got a lack of bug bites. He wasn’t sentient and ended up being my close pet by the end of the week. However… he was old and the cold was coming. He was going to die that night or at most the night after so he… fed himself to me. I didn’t want to but in the end I thought that biting him wouldn’t be nice so I swallowed him whole. But it was the opposite. I thought that he would just fall asleep when he arrived in my stomach then peacefully die instead of being crushed by my teeth. However I didn’t count on the you spiders didn’t need so much air. So he was slowly digested alive over the course of a few hours. I didn’t mean to but I caused him so much pain that if I can help you, maybe I can make amends for that.” You said with a tear rolling down your cheek that you quickly wiped away in an effort to hide your emotion from the small spider in your other hand.

“So that’s it. But I don’t get it. Sure that answers why you personally want to help me, a sentient spider, but why as a human do you even care. I mean you humans kill us all the time don’t you?” she asked as she had obviously seen such in many ways and places.

“I’m sorry Eve, but I can only tell very close friends that secret. I just like spiders, which is why I try to save as many as I can from my family, who are highly afraid and hostile toward spiders in general. But now that I answered another of your questions. Can you answer mine? Can I take you home?” you asked.

“I… I don’t know where that is either. I have been running and hiding for a week now. It was getting cold outside so I came in here a few nights ago and was amazed at all the spiders in here. Most tried to kill me while others just left me alone. But I thought that this was some kind of safe haven for my kind. I never thought that it was because of a human. I guess, if it is ok with you, that this can be my home?” she asked.

“You want to live with me? I guess that’s ok. As long as you don’t bite me or my family. From what you said, it would not be very healthy. We humans are deathly loyal to our blood family and similarly to our friends. But if you are sentient and want to stay in this house then it isn’t really up to me. I can take care of you but I need the approval of my parents so they don’t mix you up with the other spiders the crush daily.” You told her.

“But I’m poisonous, why would they let me stay if they kill normal spiders that easily?” she asked, worried that she would have to run again.

“Well, if you promise not to ever tell anyone, even another spider that isn’t sentient, then I can tell you.” you proposed.

“Ok, I won’t.” she returned in an urgency that defined her at the moment.

“I am not human. Well I was born human but I was turned into a Vampire, the only Vampire. I know very little about the world that I belong to but I am much more dangerous than any human and I drink and crave human blood. I can tell you about it later but that is why they would accept you. They still wouldn’t be able to hear you but if I asked them I think they would allow you to stay. Probably only if you stayed in my room. Like I said, they are all deathly afraid of spiders and will kill any they see. I doubt that even if they see you that they would notice it is you until it was too late.” You explained.

“Vampire, my genetic knowledge says that you are dangerous, very dangerous.” She quivered.

“You have that too? Don’t worry, I’ve only been a Vampire for a few months now. While I am really powerful I won’t harm you without a really good reason, like if you think it is fun to kill my family then I would stop at nothing that you joined them. But I don’t think that was you plan.” You said as both a statement and a warning.

“No! I won’t I promise not to hurt them.” she squealed.

“Then you don’t have anything to worry about. So do you still want to stay with me? You would have to stay in this room for a long while and pretty much be my slave. Well not a slave but you would have to do what I said for a while.” You told and asked her so she could make her decision with all the facts.
112311211111111112111112111111.title: "... Eve" she likes it.

Someone finds her and almost kills her.
1123112111111111121111121111111.content:
“You won’t kill me?” she asked to which you just shook your head. “But I would be your… slave?” she asked.

“Maybe that wasn’t the best word to use. It just makes sense that you do what I say, like staying in the room, not biting my family or family pets, not doing stuff that can kill you… that kind of stuff. But you won’t know what that stuff is so if I tell you not to touch something it would just be safer and easier if you just obeyed rather than me explaining why swimming in my family dog’s water dish is a bad idea.” You said to which she involuntarily chuckled. “After you get bigger and older I don’t plan on making you do anything. I don’t know how big you’ll get but as different things become no longer a concern then you can really do what you want. I didn’t mean it like I would force you to do anything. For appearances sake I would refer to you as a pet, mainly to those that don’t know about me being a Vampire or you being sentient.

“Ok, I guess that makes sense. Although with all of these other spiders in here I don’t think I’ll live to long.” She said worriedly, after looking at a rather large spider on the ceiling. You snapped your fingers and they all disappeared to which she looked at you as if to ask what you did.

“I just sent them to another place so they could continue living but far away from here. Now you are the sole spider of the room. Well if you want to stay that is. I can take you wherever you want. I won’t force you to stay.” You said as you looked down at her.

“I think I will stay.” She said after thinking about it for a while.

“Awesome, you know you’re my second friend. I have one at school but you are my second and I really like that you’re a spider. That means I don’t have to explain what being a predator means. But I guess I should introduce you to my Mom, and eventually the rest of the family. But I think we’ll wait for you to get a little bit bigger before doing that.” You stated but then came up with a question. “You don’t happen to know how large you’ll get do you?” you asked.

“I… I think I’ll be as big as one of those long metal things on wheels that I saw all those human go into.” She said.

“A bus! You can really get that big?” you asked.

“Only after a very long time I think. I don’t really know, this genetic knowledge is hard to search for an exact answer but perhaps a little smaller than that thing you called a ‘bus’.” She answered.

“Well I’m glad you’ll get so big. But for now let’s go see Mom.” You said as you got up with her still in your hand then walking out to see your mother in the living room by the front door.

“Hey Caleb, how’s it… Caleb! What did I tell you about bringing your pets out of your room!?” she almost screamed at the sight of Eve in your hand.

“Wait Mom she’s different, let me explain.” You said as you put up a hand to defend Eve if necessary but also to calm your mother down. She seemed to calm down but was still on edge as she looked at the slightly moving spider in your hand.

“It better be good Caleb. Just because you’re a Vampire doesn’t mean you can just bend the rules.” Mom said as she nervously sat down on the far side of the room from you and more importantly the spider in your hand.

“Ok, Um… she can talk.” You said.

“She… can talk?” Mom asked.

“Yes, not that loud and right now only I can hear it. But she’ll get bigger and soon you will be able to hear her too. But she is definitely sentient. I… we were wondering if she could stay here?” you asked.

“She can understand me?” Mom asked to which you nodded. “Then she better remember that any spiders outside your room are dead, including her. Maybe when she is big enough to talk to we can negotiate a little but until then she is to stay in your room. That way there is no confusion. If I see a spider it dies, well at least the ones outside your room Caleb. How many do you have in there?” she asked.

“There were about 30 but they were all trying to kill her so I sent them away into the forest in near the border. She’ll be the only one in there, well the only one until she gets big enough to protect herself. And she said she won’t bite anyone in the house and never a family member.” You said, trying to further convince her. Eve could see that you were trying to argue on her behalf and she more than heard your mother’s warning.

“Either way, just remember that I don't care who she is or how hungry she gets. She stays in your room.” Mom said.

“Of course, thanks Mom.” You said to which she just waved you off, mainly to get the spider away from her. You went into your room then went back onto your bed, putting your hand back at the end table for her to scuttle off. “That went better than I thought.”

“I thought she was going to kill me.” Eve whimpered.

“She probably would. Like I said, they hate spiders. I would hide if they ever come in here. Even if they told you to stay in my room they might still panic and crush you if they see you. And I have no doubt that they would kill you if you came out of this room. Please don’t, I don’t want you to die.” You almost pleaded the last part.

“Do you really care for me that much?” she asked as she saw this urgency to stay alive.

“You’re my friend, why not?” You responded and if she had tear ducts she would’ve been tearing up. She was at the very least whimpering but this time in joy of what you referred her to.
1123112111111111121111121111111.title: She'll stay.

11231121111111111211111211111111.content:
Thanksgiving went by without too much problem, well except that you weren’t invited. But when your family assured you that Christmas everyone was being forced to come, including you. Mainly because your Grandpa and Grandma were really liking you at this point and you were extremely helpful when they needed it. However a week or so after that, Sarah made the mistake of going into your room and saw Eve on the wall. She had gotten big enough to be considered a small tarantula, as she could stretch out and cover a third of a basket ball. Coupled with the fact that she was all black, moved fast, and your family’s natural phobia of spiders made them call an emergency family meeting about your new pet/guest.

“Caleb, when you told me that she could talk I just figured you had found a spider that you really liked. When you showed it to me it was no bigger than a quarter.” Mom said as she spoke.

“That… thing, was really that small?” asked Sarah.

“I saw her as well and she was rather small. Are you sure you saw a real spider and not a fake one?” Papa asked.

“No she saw Eve correctly. She has been growing due in no small part to the bugs coming in for the winter. But I assure you she is sentient, and I think she is big enough to speak at a level you can hear her, if you’ll accept it.” You stated and confirmed.

“She can speak?” asked Papa.

“Yes, previously she was too small to be heard by any human, but I have better ears.” You answered.

“Spiders can’t speak.” Luke said.

“You do realize you are telling a Vampire, that most people think is fiction; that a talking spider doesn’t exist right?” you asked rhetorically. It did sound rather ridiculous when you put it that way.

“Ok, why don’t we let… the spider talk if it can. As long as it won’t bite anyone.” Papa concluded but asked the last part.

“She already promised that she would never bite anyone in the family, even in self defense. Basically because her venom is really poisonous and a single bite when she was really small took down a horse in seconds. Should I call her or should I go get her?” you asked.

“Did you leave your door open?” Sarah asked with a little fear, both at the poisonous part and that the spider she saw might already be in the room.

“No, but she is strong enough to open the door if she needs to.” You answered.

“Please go get her and make sure she realizes that she is not to leave your person during this… evaluation.” Papa stated to which you went to your room and went in to see Eve retreating under the bed.

“It’s ok Eve, it’s just me. They are ready to see you now.” You said. It was a short pause before her form was seen scuttling out from under the bed and into your hands. She now felt safe there, in your warm embrace. You had to hold her with two hands to make her comfortable while carrying her.

“Are they going to make me leave?” she asked.

“I really hope not but they are really scared of spiders. You being so big won’t help matters. Just don’t make any sudden moves and they asked me to remind you to stay on me at all times. No running off if they startle you. You don’t need to worry, I’ll protect you.” you answered and instructed.

“Ok, I’ll try to make myself look small.” She said as she bunched her legs into and under herself, making a neat furry little ball in your hands. You smiled down at her then took her to the living room where they were waiting.

“Here she is.” You presented as you sat down and held out your hands a little so they could see, Isaac being the only one young enough to get closer than the rest.

“She looks like a furry ball.” Isaac stated.

“I didn’t want to scare anyone.” Said Eve’s voice but was small to them, about the volume of a whisper.

“Holy… she can talk!” Sarah burst out.

“Of course she can, I told you she could. But please don’t make so many sudden outbursts like that, it is hard enough not to move with all that is happening.” You defended as they all looked bug eyed at Eve.

112311211111111112111112111111111.content:
“Yes you did Caleb, she looks gentle enough for the moment.” Papa stated and the relatively calm voice brought everyone else back to the situation with some semblance of intellect.

“Her… your name is Eve?” asked Mom, catching herself and addressing her directly.

“Yes, Caleb has given the name to me and I am very grateful.” She answered.

“You named her?” asked Luke.

“She never met her parents and she was on the run as a child from… well everything that doesn’t like spiders, which is pretty much everything. So when she came to me she needed a name. Couldn’t go around calling her ‘spider’, that would just be rude.” You answered.

“So… Eve, if you don’t mind me asking, how big can you get?” asked Papa.

“I don’t really know, I grow in stages and over a long time. I will grown to maybe dog size in a year and human size in 2 years then stop near 3 times that in 5 years. The growing process after that point is a mystery to me, I could stop all together or keep going.” She answered.

“That big?” Sarah asked in shock and horror. She was going to be sharing the house with a giant spider.

“I’m sorry, is that bad?” Eve asked back.

“Yes… I mean no… Well it is a little hard to take in.” Mom said.

“Why’s that Mom?” asked Eve.

“What did you call me?” she asked.

“Well Caleb calls you Mom and I thought that was your name, is that bad?” Eve asked for the second time as she was worried she would be killed or kicked out into the cold and literally freezing weather.

“No, not at all.” Mom said as she seemed to take it in. Was she really going to get an unofficial, adopted, and arachnid daughter along with her Vampire son. She didn’t mind it from that stand point but she had to be either the luckiest or strangest Mom in the world at that point.

“What are your plans?” asked Papa.

“I would like to stay with Caleb. That’s it.” She answered.

“You mean you don’t have to return to your kind, whoever or whatever they/you are?” asked Papa.

“I don’t know my birth family and I have a suspicion that I don’t want to. All they ever did was try to kill me and I can’t even remember much of that. Caleb is as much family as I have anywhere. He protects me and helps me.” Eve stated.

“And what are your plans for food. I am sure Caleb mentioned that we and other humans are off limits, especially with you being venomous.” Papa asked.

“What!? I would never eat Caleb’s family.” She almost shrieked and spread her legs in reaction to her sudden spike in emotion. Her legs spilled over and connected to your arms and hands. “And Caleb has told me that I am not to eat any humans or their pets. I don’t need to eat more than once every 6 months anyway.”

“Well that’s good to know.” Luke said as he was the first to recover from her sudden change in look and movement, other than Isaac.

“What if one of us accidently steps on you or hits you without knowing it?” asked Sarah. “Will you bite us out of reflex or instinct?”

“Never. Caleb’s family is off limits, even for accidents.” She stated as if it were law.
112311211111111112111112111111111.title: They react well.

1123112111111111121111121111111111.content:
“Well it would be heartless to just throw you out when you are obviously a living a breath person and not a random animal or in this case bug or spider. As much as we fear you we can’t in good conscious do that to you, especially when you have nowhere else to go and in the beginning of winter.” Papa stated which got a slight cringe from the others in the room, knowing that meant she was going to be staying.

“Thank you Papa! Thank you very much!” Eve stated and he too was taken back by her use of such a intimate word to call him.

“However we can’t have you roaming free around the house. If for no other reason as to we aren’t that comfortable with spiders in general. I’m sure Caleb has said that we all have a rather large phobia of spiders in this family.” Mom stated.

“Yes, he told me. But you don’t have to fear me. I will never harm any of you.” She defended.

“Never the less, the fear still remains. How would you feel if you feared something and found one among many that would do you no harm? Even if you believed you would still have to worry about the rest of that of which you fear and the fear of confusing the two. It only stands to reason that if you were born like you are then there are others. What if we become trusting of you then reach out to a similar person that isn’t you?” Papa inquired.

“You would be killed.” She admitted solemnly. She didn’t know her parents but she knew from her genetic knowledge that they were no friendly to humans.

“For that reason you must stay in Caleb’s room unless called and accompanied by Caleb. Only he can truly tell the difference regardless if we become close to you. That way we can ensure that your presence and that of any… uninvited guests are easily distinguished.” Papa said.

“I can do that, if Caleb doesn’t mind being crowded when I get bigger.” Eve said.

“I definitely won’t mind.” You answered down to her.

“You know, this is getting weird.” Sarah stated.

“What do you mean?” you asked.

“Normal people don’t live like this. But so many not normal things happen around here that it is becoming more normal than anything else. Vampires, talking spiders, giant spiders, what is next?” she asked.

“Oh, don’t say that. It is like saying ‘what could possibly go wrong’.” Luke said.

“Huh?” Eve asked.

“It’s a human saying.” You explained to her. “Somehow, whenever someone says it something goes wrong. It happens so frequently that it is now a superstition that when you say it something will go wrong.”

“So I get a spider sister?” asked Isaac.

“It certainly looks that way.” Mom said.

“Can I hold her?” he asked that got the whole room to become quite. He had been looking at her since she came into the room and seemed fascinated with her. You both looked over at your parents and after a short thought Papa nodded.

“Ok, if she says ok and you are careful, both of you.” you instructed as you looked down at her. You could feel that she was just as nervous as the rest of the family, except Isaac who was still too young to understand why that was.

“Can I hold you?” Isaac asked as he got up and leaned down so his face was about a foot away.

“I… I guess so. Just please be gentle.” She pleaded. He smiled and went to grab for her but you pulled away.

“Awe, but she said I could.” Isaac whined.

“But that was very rude Isaac. You can’t just grab at her like that.” You defended and Eve was noticeably glad for it. “Just hold out your hands and let her come to you.”

“Oh, I’m sorry Eve.” Isaac said in response as you rose her back to where she was before.

“It’s ok, this is all really new isn’t it?” she asked back to which he nodded then held out his even smaller hands compared to yours. She hesitantly and slowly crawled onto the relatively fragile surface and both of you could sense Isaac’s heart beat race as she did so. Eventually she was supported solely by Isaac and you backed away, as did he, sitting back down with a plop onto his chair and gazing at Eve still fascinated.

“You’re really soft and feel nice.” Isaac said as he held her.

“I… thanks Isaac.” She said, not sure what to say to a compliment from him. “Thank you for being gentle.”

“Are you sure it’s safe?” Papa asked you as the two more or less bonded.

“I trust her. If she was wild then I’d say definitely not. Her venom is really poisonous and I can’t even cure it in others. I can barely take a bite myself.” You stated.

“She bit you?” asked Mom.

“Only after I asked her to. I thought it would be a good idea to become immune to venom and she has the most potent so I thought that she could help me in that area. Turns out I was right and I am getting use to it but I still wouldn’t be able to heal anyone she bit besides me. They would be dead in seconds.” You stated.

“That doesn’t really make me feel any better.” Sarah said.

“Oh just relax, this is no different than Caleb.” Mom stated as she saw Eve start to crawl all over Isaac and play with him. His laughter in this made her ease up. “Just because something is dangerous doesn’t mean they are evil or will harm us.”

“Agreed.” Papa stated as he took her hand in his while watching the large spider and Isaac play. You even saw a smile crack on his face, despite the danger.
1123112111111111121111121111111111.title: She can stay but never leave your room.

choices: Things go well and nothing bad happens.
11231121111111111211111211111111111.content:
With all the mess dealt with about Eve it was nice that something normal was happening that required your attention. Since you were still in middle school, there wasn’t an abundance of wrestling events set up. It was basically just an intro so that wrestlers were better prepared and trained for high school. But this was the big one for your team.

“You got to be kidding me.” You heard as you all weighed in for the event. You were taking the 145 weight class, while the only other person of note, Matt Malcame, was taking 189.

As was the case, most of the weigh-ins were done naked or close to it to allow referees to look over the contestants for skin baring diseases that would spread due to the close nature of the sport. While it wasn’t required to do so naked, some needed to shed that last bit of weight to just make the class they were trying for. Most of the kids were scrawny or fat as most middle school kids aren’t that impressive in comparison to their later high school years. However that didn’t apply to you and Matt. You two were highly toned and highly developed in the area most didn’t touch until college. The result being that you were each at your desired weight class with 2 or 3 percent body fat that only made your defined muscles stick out more. This was not a very welcomed sight to the ones opposing you two.

“I think their scared of you.” Matt said into your ear as you all waited for your turn.

“More you than me, after all, you are the bigger one and has more of a record by this point.” You returned.

“True that, but they don’t know your strength. But they will. Heck man, we both are real freaks for our age.” He said and it almost could’ve been taken as an insult but he definitely meant it as a compliment. If only he knew how true his statement was for you then he wouldn’t have said it. Fact is, you let him win in practice but not bad enough to suggest as your strength was hard to mask. So you pretended that your lack of experience was why he beat you all the time, which was kind of true, in a way.

“Well I sure hope you don’t switch schools on us. Knowing my luck I would be the one they pit against you.” You complimented back.

“No worries about that Caleb. I don’t think my Ma would let me leave even if I wanted to. Besides, who would I get to practice with if not for you?” he asked.

“Alright, but when I finally get my experience up I may end up beating you for a change.” You said back.

“Well then I better not slack off.” He retorted then smirked and pointed as your weight class was called and you saw what he was almost laughing at. The boys that were stepping up were not very impressive and mostly far or… well rounded, as their Moms liked to refer to it. There was one kid that looked like he was halfway decent and knew it. He smirked at the others until he saw you get in line with him. Unlike the others, you were no tub of lard and nothing he could push around on the mat. Finally your name was called to which you stepped up to the Ref then onto the scale.

“145 exactly, damn and built like a brick wall.” the Ref operating the scale said as he jotted down the weight and passed you along. You gave Matt a knuckle pound then went to change into your singlet and warm-ups. It didn’t take you long to which you were out and sitting in the bleachers with the rest of the team as you all waited for things to start.

“Good luck Caleb.” Came a voice from behind you. You looked back to see Papa as he landed a hand on your shoulder just as Matt was coming around. Your father wasn’t a giant by any means but at 6’4’’ 300 lbs he was very solid and recognizable and not for a mean or hard persona. Quite the opposite, he was calm and gentle but one of those people that you didn’t WANT to disappoint.

“Papa, I thought you had some work to do.” You said as you weren’t expecting him to show. Not that he wasn’t supportive but with all the work he did for other people he never really had much time for much else.

“Well it is my oldest son’s debut in his first tournament, I thought I should at least stick around for your first win.” He said.

“Thanks.” You said and he could see that even if you put a brave face on, you really appreciated that he was there. It made you feel like he was proud of you and it was a great feeling.

“Mr. Konel, it is good to meet Caleb’s father. You’re son is as strong as an ox, I can hardly stay ahead.” Matt said as he shook hands with him.

“Well you must be Matt Malcame, Whenever Caleb speaks about wrestling, you are in the conversation somehow. You must really be drinking your milk.” Papa stated and Matt laughed a little at the joke and compliment as he nodded. “Well it looks like it’s starting so I’ll leave you to it. Good luck, and be careful.” Papa finished but the last part was directed at you, even if Matt didn’t notice. You nodded to which he nodded back then went to take his seat.

“You’re dad is a cool guy.” Matt said, as if longing for someone like that for himself.

“He has his moments, as I’m sure all parents do.” You stated.

“You kidding? What could possibly be bad about him?” he asked.

“Well we work from sun up to sun down for other people and we do it all for free. I still get spankings from time to time, although I haven’t needed one in the past few months. Not only that but he is the best wielder of the guilt trip that I’ve ever seen, well maybe second to my Grandma, which is probably where he gets it from.” You answered.

“Well you seem to get along well enough.” Matt said as you both walked over to start warming up.

“Definitely, for all his faults I have never found myself wanting a different Papa before.” You agreed.

“Alright, we can discuss the meaning of life later. Time to warm up.” Matt said then you two joined as he leaded the team in doing so then stretches before the tournament’s start.
11231121111111111211111211111111111.title: Wrestling meet.

choices: Kelsey is there and gets a thing for you.
You have to hide from people as they wish to... pursue you.
112311211111111112111112111111111111.content:
For most that don’t know the people or things going on, a wrestling tournament is insanely boring. You wait around as the 4 mats are occupied by wrestlers for each match per weight class then gets restarted at different points in the tournament and at different levels. Not only that but every wrestler has to wait 45 minutes between matches. So even if you came to see one of the wrestlers you would have to wait at least that long then an additional allotted time for each round. However for you it was a learning experience. You watched, analyzed, and learned many new moves as they were displayed as well as possible weak points to them and ones you already knew.

“145 starting Ceritage Christian against Saint Joe’s military academy.” Called an announcement as you observed and headed over to the mat. You already had your singlet on and only thing else were your shorts and one of your t-shirts over the top. You met your Coach at the corner and took off the shorts and shirt then strapped up the upper half of the singlet and head gear. The cocky kid was first as you looked at them as he did the same. Although most that were watching took one look at your almost overly developed body and were whispering about it.

“Alright, this is your first match so go out and do your best.” Mr. Hale said as he gave you a pat and sent you on your way.

“Nice contacts.” Said the other boy. You knew his name was John but other than that he was just a big bully as evidence to the way he pushed around his own teammates when he could. His statement was an attempt to get under your skin as you both approached the table for the Ref to assign colors.

“They’re not contacts.” You said before the Ref assigned you as red and him as green. You thought it fitting but otherwise went to the middle, put on the ankle strap for the color, then got in your stance at your assigned line, marked by a red line. Your form and stance was irregular as most wrestlers, specifically at your level and age, would use more of a square stance but you had your legs more spread and angled than most. It was like a mix between a wrestler’s stance and a sprinter’s. Normally your coach would’ve corrected this but it was prime to how you normally started the match.

“Shake hands.” The Ref stated to which you both did. He tried squeezing your hand tight but when you didn’t react it unnerved him even more than seeing your now flexing body. Your muscles were preparing for sudden burst of action but also to restrain themselves. In fact you had to devote more strength to hold yourself back then to defeat your opponent and that would result in high stress on your muscles. But for now you were like a spring, ready to take off as soon as the Ref blew his whistle.

When the whistle blew you sprung before John did and caught him in a picture perfect double leg takedown. You were quick but not quick enough to arise suspicion. You were also strong as he tried to sprawl but your grip didn’t allow it. You lifted him then took him down as you were taught, careful not to injure him but hard enough to cause an opening for you to throw a half nelson in then turn him to his back with ease and more importantly in a believable fashion. In all it was a whole 6 seconds before the Ref hit the mat and whistled to call the match a pin for you. As the sound hit your ears you released him immediately then went to the center, taking of your color band as you went. The kid slowly got up as if he didn’t know what just happened. He probably wasn’t use to having to lose so quickly or at all.

He reluctantly went to the center to which you shook his hand and the Ref raised your hand in victory. It was only then that you listened to the crowd. Mr. hale rarely had to give you any advice in the match, and to be fair it was over before he could. The people in the stands were both cheering and admiring you. The feeling felt really good and it even got better when you saw your father standing with the rest of them and clapping to your win, a proud look on his face. You didn’t really care at the moment that you had just won, or that you had done so quickly, or that everyone was admiring you; the guys for your win and the girls now seeing your flawlessly sculpted body. That all was white noise to you as your reward was in his eyes as he nodded to your gaze and you felt like you had accomplished something beyond winning a simple wrestling match.

“Damn Caleb, that looked like a drilling practice session rather than a match.” Mr. Hale said as he handed you your clothes and you started putting them on and unstrapping your singlet and head gear.

“Well that’s why we practice it right?” you asked as if gauging if you did something wrong.

“Yeah but most have to really work hard to pull off a move as flawlessly as you just did in a real match. Good job and keep it going.” Mr. Hale ended as he shook your hand and went to advise the next wrestler. You saw a few of the girls that were there watch as you were now topless then sigh as you put your shirt back on. You then stretched a bit before moving back to your seat, where Papa was waiting for you.

“That was short but sweet.” He complimented.

“Thanks, I think I only hurt his pride.” You said as you both glanced over at him brooding his loss.

“Well I do have to get going now. These things tend to take all day but I just wanted to say that you did a good job. However for the sake of the others I would suggest you allow them to last a little longer. You will obviously win regardless so might as well make it fun for them as well.” Papa said. You were still beaming from his compliment so you just nodded. While you weren’t really a touching person he was so he gave you and handshake that pulled into a one armed hug then went down the bleachers.
112311211111111112111112111111111111.title: Things go well and nothing bad happens.

choices: Christmas break means extra snow removal services... by you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111.content:
You won all your matches as easy but not as quick as the first. You usually allowed them enough time to take a few shots before you pinned them in a variety of different ways. Papa was right to suggest such, even if Mr. Hale didn’t necessarily agree. But in the end you were winning and by a large margin, so he couldn’t really complain. It was similar with Matt but he had somewhat of a fan fair around him of girls and what not trying to appease him. If you had to think of one main flaw with Matt, it was that he didn’t treat women like he should. Even if he was raised by his mother, he had seen more of one minded coaches and trainers than he did of her. You didn’t really know where he got it from but he tended to treat women like pieces of disposable meat. Perhaps in their young minds it attracted some girls but to you it was pathetic. For a guy that had almost everything he was sorely lacking in morality of this part in particular. You had tried to tell him but he was older than you and the only thing you two had in common was wrestling so he didn’t really listen to your advice when he was, in his mind, doing fine with the ladies.

It was later in the day when the tournament was almost over and you just got done with your final match that you saw Kelsey show up. She had watched your match and you could almost feel her gaze as you strapped up then returned afterward. Since she seemed to be hiding you didn’t bother going over to her. You just went back to your seat to watch the rest of the tournament. However you had her scent on record and could sense her coming as she approached. She was trying to surprise you so you weren’t going to ruin it for her.

“Guess who.” Said a voice as two small hands covered your eyes.

“Hello Kelsey” You said, after you said her name she hugged into your back then slid into the seat beside you, although they were bleachers so she was technically all the same seat. There were a few eyes still on you from people that were either to proud or scared to come near. Their gazes turned into glares that shot holes in Kelsey, well if she noticed and it was near impossible to tell unless you read her mind. But you hadn’t done something like that for weeks, Papa had said it was too intrusive.

“How’d you know it was me?” she asked.

“You have a very distinctive voice, that and you have very soft skin.” You said as you tapped her hands as they retracted. You wisely left out the part of her scent. You had told her that you could smell her one time at lunch and she didn’t speak to you for a week. How were you suppose to know that she would take it that way, and it wasn’t even a bad smell to begin with. You found her scent rather… delicious actually but also calming. It was a different feeling when you were around her. While you still felt a large ping of loyalty, you also felt something that only resembled the content feeling that you got when Eve was on or near you, which was all the time at home. Kelsey only knew Eve as a pet, a very large, hairy, black, spider pet that she strangely enough didn’t mind holding.

At home you had actually moved out your bed and other relaxing furniture to allow Eve freedom in making her own specialty ones for you from her finest silk. You currently had a woven silk Hammock, that despite their bias against spiders your family did covet. She also made you a few seating areas that she could climb in and around. The webbing made it insanely comfortable while her constant maintenance made it always clean and the sticky parts caught what few things that felt it wise to invade your room. Other than her, Eve was the only bug and/or pest in your room. Kelsey sometimes got to your house and jumped into the webbed furniture since she didn’t have to worry about hitting something on the ends or hard spots. She would even get tangled in it so the Eve had something to do. Eve couldn’t communicate with her as Kelsey was still ignorant of your secret but they still had fun.

“Well thanks for the compliment.” She said with a smile then leaned into you.

“Something wrong?” you asked as you heard her sigh.

“No, nothing.” She answered.

“Kelsey, I can tell when you’re lying.” You stated. She stayed silent for a moment as she played with your zipper that was closing your warm up top around your body and over your t-shirt underneath.

“Why can’t you just be like the other guys and not notice or not care?” she asked.

“Then I wouldn’t be me. I prefer me and I think you do as well. But I could switch and take a serious approach if you want.” You countered.

“No thanks. You’re right, I like you the way you are. We are good friends aren’t we?” she asked.

“Of course we are, well I think so at least. I remember the last time I answered an emotional question for you. My arm is still sore.” You joked as she play punched you just like the reference you were alluding to.

“It’s just… I see how the others were looking at you when you were down there doing your thing. They will probably not admit it until later but most of the girls our age and some beyond were drooling over you while the guys were jealous of you. It won’t be long before you fly right by me.” She said, a little depressed. She must’ve had a rough day with her looks again. People were always picking on her for her lack of… development.

“Let them drool, it gets their pants and skirts wet.” You said to which she chuckled a little. “We made a promise, remember? No matter how popular either of us get, we’re friends. I don’t know about you but I’m going to hold you to that. Cause when you finally do… you know… you are going to make everyone’s head snap to you and zoom way ahead.” You said, trying to comfort her. Although you couldn’t help feel like she was hiding something from you. You weren’t going to pry or read it as you had your secrets so you let her have hers.

“You always say that.” She said, giving you another slug in the chest. She watched from her position as you looked out at a match while some girls walked by, trying and failing to get your attention. She giggled at the girl’s impartial reaction as they changed from you to Matt and the herm that followed him.

“What?” you asked down to her as she giggled.

“You really are clueless, aren’t you?” Kelsey asked rhetorically.

“About what?” you asked as you were missing what she was saying, as usual.

“Don’t worry about it. I like you that way.” She returned to which you shrugged lightly then returned your focus to the mats and the matches going on. If you had any clue about women then you would’ve seen she was dreamy about you. She had to in order to bypass Matt completely for you. Matt had even asked her out a few times as if in conquest, but she told him ‘no’. She seemed that, while she still looked at boys, she only had eyes for you. Again you were to clueless to see it but then again, that is the nature of hindsight.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111.title: Kelsey is there and gets a thing for you.

choices: They tollerate you for the most part and some accept you.
They are distant and stir the kids and others away from you.
11231121111111111211111211111111111111.content:
“Your room is locked right?” asked Mother one last time before people started arriving. It was determined that people accidentally walking into your room and finding the webbed surfaces would not be a good thing, and especially if they saw Eve. Like your immediate family, your extended family also had a deep phobia of spiders. Eve didn’t mind though as she liked the solitude but you apologized anyway.

“Yes, both with the lock and materialization. No one is going in without me being there.” You confirmed.

“Good, just in time.” She said as she went to the door in order to welcome the incoming guests.

Your Father was the most wealthy and as such had the largest house. The only reason no one came for thanksgiving and your family had to go elsewhere was because of you. However, your Grand Parents on both sides agreed that EVERYONE was coming for Christmas. The way it usually worked was that people would come in and visit for a while after putting presents they brought under the tree. When it was determined that everyone was there you would all migrate to the table and eat your fill of the wonderful dishes that people brought. After that the men of the family usually relaxed to let the massive amounts of ingested food to settle while the kids played games downstairs and the women talked while cleaning up from the meal. A few hours later you all would gather again for opening presents while drinking eggnog and listening to the Christmas story from Grandpa Konel. He had a deep authoritative voice that made it sound like a heavenly voice was reciting the story down. Afterwards the presents were handed out and a form of wrapping paper dodge ball was played by all until it was time to go. Usually someone always left something at your family’s house, so they were back within the week to collect it.

“Hello!” Greeted Mom as Papa sat in his chair but stood to his parents coming in. You stood off to the side, nervous at what might happen this year because of you. Kids your age and older, that could handle it, were also aware and you were wondering how they would treat you. You and your siblings stood in the room awaiting their arrival so they could go down the line and greet each other. You already knew they would accept you but weren’t sure about the ones coming in at their heels; Grandpa and Grandma Lon. They usually were the nicer of the two sides but also more opinionated. Things they didn’t like they made sure that other people were notified and understood, even if you didn’t want to hear it. They were like that when they learned of your old fascination with Vampires and like topics. But now that you are one you didn’t know how they would react.

“Oh, you all have grown so much.” Grandma Konel stated as each of you exchanged hugs and kisses with her but when she got to you she held you tighter than usual. “You make sure you have a wonderful Christmas no matter what.” She said as she hugged you.

“I will try.” You responded with a smile as you hugged her back, planting a kiss on her cheek. You were glad that your fangs were retractable as that would just be another level of awkwardness to deal with.

“Any of them give you a hard time, you come over and let us know.” Grandpa Konel stated as he bent down to give you a kiss as you exchanged one in like manner to Grandma. You marveled at how Grandparents could make everything ok with a few hugs and kisses. But now was the test as your other side came, the ones you hadn’t seen since you changed.

“Oh come her Caleb.” Grandma Lon said as she just grabbed you and hugged you tighter then Grandma Konel had. “Don’t you worry about a thing. We all love you here.” She said as she backed off after a round of quick pecks on the cheeks but held her hand to your face to comfort you a little.

“Thanks Grandma.” You responded to which she moved on for Grandpa Lon to address you.

“Got the girls chasing ya now I take it.” He blurted out. He was the blunt one out of all your relatives. One of those grandparents or relatives that you didn’t ask anything unless you were ready for a straight and short answer. If you were doing something he didn’t like he told you in such a blunt and obvious way that an infant would be able to understand. He also joked around about touchy subjects, mostly other people’s dating life or embarrassing subjects that no one will touch.

“I got a few I guess.” You responded with a smile as you were just glad he was acting like he usually did. You both exchanged hugs but no kisses. He was the Grandparent that wasn’t very touchy in the physical manner, which is probably where you got it from yourself.

“I bet, you staying out of trouble though?” he asked.

“As much as I can.” You answered to which he smiled and accepted the answer. Once they sat down it was ok for you and the others to do likewise, well until others arrived that wanted to go and play.

This was the most nerve wracking part as you waited for others to get there. With the whole of your heart you wanted them to accept you but you weren’t going to force them like you were able nor were you expecting them to. You knew that it was at the very least hard to understand. Although your Grandparents had spread around the good you had done, as well as your parents doing the same among family. But while Luke, Isaac, and Sarah were invited to sleepovers and parties. The invitations actually requested that you NOT attend. You just hoped that this would not show its self at Christmas of all times. If you couldn’t get them to show you at least a little understanding at this time then you wouldn’t bet on anything after that point.
11231121111111111211111211111111111111.title: Christmas and family problems.

choices: You tell Papa and Mom what was going on.
112311211111111112111112111111111111112.content:
“Hello everyone!” came a joyous tone as one of you Aunts and their family from your Mother’s side came in. This all took a predictable pattern as more and more came in the house. You had taken a spot to the far end of the room in order to give them space. However it didn’t stop them from almost glaring at you.

“Grandma, Grandpa, so good to see you!” came another voice as the kids from their family came in and rushed into their Grandparent’s arms.

They would greet the others in the room but when it came to you they were pulled, sometimes forcibly, away from you and told to go play with the others. They would look at you with a question in their eyes until you smiled and waved, which got them to go on their way more easily. Some saw this and appreciated your help, even if it was only helping them to distance you from those that didn’t know why. Those that were children and old enough to know what was going on went downstairs to play games with your brothers or into Sarah’s room to play with her stuff. The most over used trick that was done, even by the more passive extended family, was wearing sliver jewelry. You could always tell where Sliver was in something or around so you immediately sensed sliver specs in some of your favorite human dishes that they brought. You took note of the ones without for later.

“Hello Caleb, it’s good to see you.” said Aunt Carol as she came close to hug you like a few of the others. You could tell that she aimed her sliver bracelets toward skin and hugged you close to tell you something. “Just be sure to stay away from my children bloodsucker.” She whispered. All of them said something along those lines, well the Aunts did while most Uncles simply glared or avoided eye contact.

“Yes Ma’am.” You said back quiet enough for hardly anyone to hear but loud enough so you didn’t have to repeat. You had to force a smile to appear everything was still ok. But as you had been called everything from ‘blood sucker’ to ‘demon spawn’ it was wearing on you quite a bit. But you were determined to make sure everyone else had a good time so you didn’t give anyone a reason to fight over you. They would place their presents under the tree and each and ‘accidentally’ forgotten yours or got you something that reeked of silver.

“Caleb, can’t you come and play the new Playstation game I got?” asked your cousin.

“David!” whispered your Uncle to which he looked at you with a ‘sorry’ look as did most of the other cousins then went on their way. Most of the cousins that knew about it were eager to see something cool from you and were definitely wondering why they couldn’t hang around you so much.

“Ok everyone. Now that we are all here let’s eat.” Called Grandma Lon and like a locust storm everyone gathered at the table. You subtly moved to your spot between Luke and Sarah on your family’s section of the table. When everyone sat down it was unusually quiet until both Grandfathers prayed over the meal and it started, the food being passed around to everyone.

“Hey, you usually gorge out on the stuffing, what’s up?” asked Luke as he noticed you had random things on your plate. You could still enjoy human foods so most were surprised you had anything at all. But since there was trace amounts of silver in a good number of the dishes and ingesting silver would make you weak as well as show your fangs all day, you had an incomplete plate of food; mashed potatoes without gravy, Ham without rolls, no stuffing to which you usually grabbed extra of, and other things that obviously went together that you only took half of.

“Just not that hungry I guess.” You replied as convincingly as you could. No, it would ruin the whole thing if you revealed what was actually going on so you settled for what you were able to get and ate, despite their disappointment that you didn’t take any ‘silver dishes’. Most left it alone as they were shoveling their portions down and Duke was licking up things that were falling onto the floor from the little younger kids.

Conversation went on but no one dared touch the subject of you one way or the other with the smaller and younger children being currently ignorant of why things were as they were. Instead most just avoided eye contact with you while observing you when they could for different reasons. Eventually everyone was done and you excused yourself from the table and went back to sitting in the living room. Most of the day after that worked the same way as you just listened in on conversations. Papa noticed you not playing with the others but smiling none the less and knew something was fake about it. However he also seemed to save his objections for another time. As present time came each family would hand out presents to the others and of course conveniently forget yours or would have given you silver, the best thing being a silver chain with a ring on it from Lord of the Rings, or so was their excuse. However your turn finally came so you stood to address the room about your gift.

“I know a lot has changed and what I may give is not enough so I used my new… gifts to pay everyone’s mortgages off completely along with clearing all credit card dept. I… I hope it is ok that I didn’t wrap them. However I do have these that I can give. You can just call them my mark.” you stated then sat back down after handing each family a set of cards that displayed your glyph on them. You didn’t look any of them in the eye as you handed your cards out but you could tell by the silence that they were definitely not expecting it. The card was a type of spell but without the magic. As soon as the person’s skin touched the card the glyph was planted on their body but under the skin so not even they knew it was there. You knew that none of them would allow or choose to tattoo your glyph themselves, especially if they knew you could teleport to them because of it. However you wanted to protect your family so you didn’t give them the choice in the matter.

“Goodnight.” You said to your Grandparents as they left. There would be more to tell if there was anything to tell. After the gifts people were anxious to leave, both to get away from you and to confirm what you said. You still were closed off mostly from the events as things moved on and people itched to leave despite the protests from their playing children.
112311211111111112111112111111111111112.title: They are distant and stir the kids and others a...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
After all that you felt a little exhausted, so you gathered the few presents you received and headed to your room. The odd assortment of sliver trinkets and stakes jingled a little as you opened you previously sealed door, put the box of stuff in your closet then went to lay on you silk bed. With the door closed you were able to drop the act you were previously using and just lie there, looking up at the ceiling.

“So, how’d it go?” asked eve as she crawled from under your swinging bed to a spot on your chest. “It sounded like the party or whatever it was went fine but then again…” she started back up to you silence but stopped midway as she saw a single tear running down you cheek. “Caleb, what happened?”

“They… they all hate me.” You stuttered out.

“You… I thought you said your Grandparents loved you.” she argued lightly.

“They do, but they and my folks are the only ones. My cousins were shunned away from me, wither they wanted to or not. That whole box of gifts are silver trinkets that have no real meaning accept trying to expose the one physical weakness I have. Even the food they brought was laced with silver. They acted like me in the open but when they got close they said anything but nice comments and demands including; die you bloodsucker.” You answered back, another tear rolling down your cheek as you remembered the words and actions of the day. You were only 12 years old, so having a high majority of you extended family that use to love you say such things took its toll. “If you don’t mind Eve, I would like to get some rest.” You said before she could come back with anything worth saying. You turned slowly so she could get off your body. You laid partially curled up in the webbed bed facing the wall, trying to forget what happened that day.

When the door opened you didn’t notice, nor did it register that Eve was the one that opened it and left your room like she had been told not to. You could follow her movements but were too distracted to comprehend what she was doing as your mind observed but your body didn’t register it. She scuttled to the living room on the ceiling then to the wall near where your parents sat. She knew better than to get to close. As you did your homework and research she had been on or near you, learning with you as she had little else to do. She now knew a good amount of the world from a human education standpoint as well as what a lot of animals were like, including other spider types, from your science book.

“Papa, Mom.” She called from her spot on the wall. She was nearly plate sized by this point and easily seen when she revealed herself.

“Eve, what are you doing out of Caleb’s room. We thought we made it clear that it you’re not with Cal…” Papa started but she interrupted.

“He is the reason I’m out here.” She interrupted and they went quiet as she had always been passive and never intrusive, neither by nature or mindset. “I’m sorry for the rudeness but he is in there crying and I don’t know what to say to him.” She said.

“Crying? Why is he crying? I know that their welcome wasn’t necessarily that welcoming but I thought he had a rather nice day considering what could’ve happened.” Mom said.

“He said he only acted that way but won’t really go into details with me. I know I’m not supposed to come out but please speak with him. I don’t really know what happened but he never cries so I don’t know how to help him.” Eve said.

“I see… Thank you Eve for telling us. We’ll talk about it out here then go see what we can do. Why don’t you go back in there before Sarah sees you and shrieks so loud it breaks glass.” Papa said in a way that portrayed his thanks to her but also reminded her of why she needed to return to your room as quickly as possible.

“Thank you.” Eve said before scuttling back to your room. Again you heard the whole thing but it was like a security monitor that the guard doesn’t look at. It still records and stores the information but doesn’t cause any awareness, not immediately anyway. Shortly after Eve returned and went to a corner the door opened again. Papa and/or Mom rarely came in your room anymore, due in no small part to Eve and her webbing. Even if they knew it was safe it was still a phobia none the less. They hit the light dimmer so that it was just bright enough to see where they were going but not to the point where it would overly effect you. Soon they sat in silk chairs next to your bed and after wondering on the comfort that they provided they addressed you.

“Caleb, are you ok?” Mom asked. You knew better than to just blow off when your parents talked to you. At the very least you had to be formal about it. You turned while wiping your face but after crying for a while it is usually hard to get the effects free of one’s face. “My dear, why were you crying?”

“I… no reason, I’m fine.” You said as you almost told them about what happened but didn’t want to ruin a perfectly good day, for them anyway.

“Caleb, what did we teach you about lying?” Papa said in a tone and expression that forbid you from keeping them out of it. You looked down then sat up and sideways so that the swaying silk bed was now a makeshift couch of sorts. “Did you not have a good day? We are in this together Caleb so you need to tell us so we can help.”
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You tell Papa and Mom what was going on.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Well Grandpa and Grandma on both sides were nice. They were really working hard at making it a good time for everyone. So I didn’t bring any of the bad stuff up. For me, it was better if I have a bad time then everyone else. So I Just acted like everything was ok and that they were all accepting me like they wanted.” You started then waited for Papa and Mom to respond.

“Bad stuff? What do you mean ‘bad stuff’?” asked Papa.

“Well… I guess for starters I was told be pretty much everyone to stay away from their kids then mixed a racial slur for good measure; Blood sucker, demon spawn, little devil, abomination to name a few. They also were all wearing silver things like rings and bracelets that they touched to my skin when they hugged me and whispered their sentiments. The silver didn’t hurt, just like their presents, but it was not their intension not to harm me, which hurt more.” You explained.

“I can’t believe they would say such things. I was wondering why you weren’t playing with the others. I thought you were just trying to relate to your Uncles and Aunts.” Mom stated.

“What else?” Papa asked as you could see the wheels turning in his head.

“At dinner, I could sense something off about the food. There was trace amounts of silver in most of the dishes they brought, specifically things I usually ate a lot of. If I would’ve ate some then I would’ve gotten really sick and I wouldn’t have been able to retract my fangs for a month, making it impossible to go out or even back to school until they came back. Again, I don’t think they were too happy when I bypassed the dishes with silver in them. Then after the meal it was the same old thing from before. Presents came and I’m sure you notice how most of what I got was silver things that didn’t have that much of a purpose other than exposing me as a Vampire or sending hidden messages. The Silver steaks are obvious ones to interpret while the rings and necklaces are a little more difficult. That about sums up my day and what they think of me.” You explained, keeping it together until the end line to which you stopped and tried to hold back some tears. But as a 12 year old kid you were understandably bad at hiding such emotions once they had surfaced, relatively speaking.

“No wonder why they left us so much food. They… Caleb, why didn’t you say anything?” Mom asked.

“Christmas is supposed to be a happy time. I didn’t want it to be a bad experience for anyone else just because I had a few changes.” You answered.

“That is rather noble of you, more so than those you are suppose to be looking up to.” Papa complimented but also you could hear an edge to his voice when he referred to the others.

“Well at least they all have your glyph. You can track them all right?” Mom asked.

“Yes, everyone that received one got a glyph and no one was left out. I can feel them and if I press I can feel near 50 feet around them.” You reported, glad to get off the subject of their treatment of you.

“It was also nice of you to wipe all their dept. How did you do that?” asked Mom.

“Well I convinced the people at the banks to wipe the slate as well as the credit card companies. It took a while to find each of the companies and banks they were members of but I’m glad it worked.” You answered.

“With your mind control?” asked Papa.

“Not exactly. I don’t have mind control like Professor X on X-Men. It’s more of a persuasion, I am able to make them WANT to do what I need them to do. If it was mind control I would say walk to the living room and they would do it but not have the ability to open the door first. Personally I think it is much better. In this case I convinced them to wipe the dept so that it was gone by this morning and no later or earlier.” You explained.

“That is dangerous, would you be able to do the same to us?” Papa asked, concerned that there was another ability he needed to keep an eye on.

“Kind of, it works better if the person doesn’t know I can do it. So the less aware of my nature as a Vampire the better. But I can suggest things and make you more prone to doing them. I’ve only done it once though, to family.” You stated.

“When?” asked Papa, suddenly getting very serious.

“When I told each of you what I am. I could tell from hearing your heart rate that you were panicking. So I entered your mind and emotions and cause you to become more calm. Other than that I’ve not really done it to family. I thought it would be too much like mind reading, and that is intrusive.” You answered, you answer seemed to calm them down a little.

“So I take it that is at the heart of Vampire seduction?” Mom asked.

“Yes… and no. Apparently I give off a scent to all ways of sensing me; sight, sound, smell, taste, and touch that make me more attractive and appealing to… anything. I use that when hunting. If I can manage to get close enough to a deer for example, I can calm it and attract it. I’m sure it works different on humans but I can made a deer come to me and offer its neck willingly for me to drink. All that without entering the mind so I assume that if people still don’t like me then humans must be different in some way at the basic level.” You answered.

“Well, I’m proud of you that you don’t use your gifts on humans. I’m sure it would be much easier if you could just force people to like you. The fact that you don’t speaks volumes about you.” Papa complimented and you beamed with his compliment.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You did that, didn’t you?” You asked after your parents left your room.

“Yeah.” She said as she nervously came out or her corner and migrated over to rest on your chest again. At your age and her size she covered your chest and most of your overall torso. You brought one hand up to pet her as she relaxed in this position. “I’m sorry if I overstepped. I only meant to help. You scared me when you were all sad.”

“I scared you?” you asked.

“Yes. I’ve seen you angry and happy before, along with most of the emotions in between. So I know how to deal with them. However I never have seen you cry before and I didn’t know what to do. I didn’t know if you needed help or just to be left alone to cool off. But now I understand, you were crying because of an overload of emotion, the emotion being sadness.” She answered.

“I’m sorry I scared you Eve. I really am thankful that you helped out, even if you broke the rules.” You said.

“Really?” she asked, still nervous of the last part.

“Yes. Perhaps in time they will allow you to roam a little more free. They are all getting use to you, well accept Sarah but even she is beginning to accept a little.” You answered her. “However you shouldn’t push it. This time they allowed it but don’t think that their seriousness about the issue has weakened.”

“Of course Caleb, only when you are around.” She verified, glad that her actions were of help and she wasn’t being punished for it. You knew she was just trying to help and you were grateful now for it.

“But still, I do thank you for it. I really did need to talk with someone about it and you always being here helps a lot.” You said in a thankful expression as you looked into her many eyes and she looked back into yours. You continued to pet her gently as she laid on top of you.

“It was the least I could do. You stick up for me all the time and I do nothing to help you.” she almost whined.

“Hey, you do more than enough. Plus, you’re family now. It doesn’t matter to me if you do a little or a lot, as long as you are here. You being here is not a burden at all.” You interjected in a confirmative tone.

“Do you really mean that? I… You’re my family?” she asked.

“Of course, I’m living proof that you don’t have to be the same species to be family. Human, Vampire, Spider, or whatever, it doesn’t matter what you are only who you are.” You answered, gingerly petting her as she took in what you said.

“That feels really good to hear. Thank you Caleb for that.” She said as she fiddled a little with her mandibles. “Are you tired? Cause I was wondering if I could cocoon you, just for practice.”

“As long as you remember that I got to get up in the morning and when Papa or Mom call. Beyond that, I wouldn’t mind at all. It actually feels pretty good to be cocooned, but why do you need the practice?” you asked and answered.

“Well when I get bigger I am going to have to catch bigger game. Not humans of course but bigger stuff and I need practice wrapping bigger things to eat. Does it really feel good?” she asked.

“Yes, your silk is very comfortable and even if it gets a little cluster phobic it still is very soft, smooth, and insanely comfortable. I think it would be scary if you were going to actually eat me but as that’s not the case I can just lay back and take it in. It’s kind of like me petting you. Humans can’t really understand what it feels like but you say it feels good, really good when you don’t have to worry about the person squashing you. Same thing, kind of.” You explained.

“Oh, so it’s that kind of thing. Well I guess we just have to take each other’s word for it. Thanks.” She said then moved to start the process while you put your arm down to your sides to allow her to work. It wasn’t like you had a time restraint and she worked quickly when spinning web so you just lay there and let her do what she willed, having complete trust in her as she lifted, spun, heaved, and weaved around your body. It felt good as she wrapped you, her soft gentle legs pressing you at certain points and her similarly but silkier webbing wrapping you as she scurried around. Without worrying about her eating you it was a rather interesting and relaxing progress. The pressure from both her and her webbing massaged your body from its exertion. Her natural smell was very appealing, as was her webbing. You thought it was to help such a large spider draw in prey. But ether way it was an overly pleasing experience and you liked that she enjoyed it as much as you did, very similar to petting indeed.
