They want to all sleep in your room, just not cocooned while she works.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Time passed at a fairly quick pace. With the middle school wrestling season being so short you were out of it by mid January. However you still came in once in a while to help spar with the high school team, both to boost your experience and to give the person there a heavier work out. You didn’t mind, the High School practices were harder and more challenging and therefore more fulfilling at their conclusion. Matt of course was there as well for the same reason. However there was a slight problem shortly after spring break.

During spring break the snow melted in sudden hot weather along with record rain falls. The area was flooded in most areas and even though it was dealt with rather quickly the bugs and animals were fleeing into free areas. For animals it was further south of uphill in wooded areas. However the bugs found it easier to just accommodate the houses and buildings while things like mosquitoes and such bugs thrived in the sudden increase of mold and other damp based environments the aftermath of the flooding and the continued rain provided.

“Eeek! Somebody do something about all these bugs!” Sarah screeched as she ran from her room for the third time that day. School was closed for another week while the cleaned the mold from parts due to health department standards. The first time it was another spider, second was a centipede, and now you guessed something other than that as you and Eve sat comfortably in the living room. She was now near the size of a cat or small dog and therefore sat on your lap, protecting you from any invading bugs. She knew your blood wasn’t tasty as a Vampire but she was determined that the only ‘bug’ that was allowed to suck your blood while she was around was her, which she didn’t do. Your room was full of meals as it was already covered in webs for her and by her. It was safe to say that you and Eve were not doing that poorly when it came to this problem.

“Well they’re going to be around for a while. At the very least until the flooding goes away and it is more habitable in their normal settings. But the mosquitoes will be around more cause of all the mold.” You stated.

“Not that I mind.” Eve stated as she leapt and caught another fly that she eagerly devoured. Her sudden movements between you and Isaac got most to flinch but Isaac had grown to liking Eve’s presence even more for the fact she could catch all the ‘mean bugs’ around him. Isaac even slept in your room in a cocoon like you did. Eve had become really good at cocooning you and hanging your… bed like a self regulating hammock without you having to help her by moving in the slightest. You had even begun simulating struggle so she could get a better idea of what to expect in the future.

“Wow, nice catch Eve.” Isaac cheered as she caught a spider that was attempting to drop on him to take part in the feast like Eve was doing. However she was becoming overly protective when she could of her family that was your family. Not even other spiders were allowed a bite of one of you if the family member allowed her close enough to ensure it.

“My pleasure.” She said as she tickled his face with her leg then leapt to catch another fly.

“That’s totally not fair. Why do you get a bug catcher and we don’t?” Sarah complained.

“Hey, don’t rip on Eve like that. It’s not her fault you don’t like spiders. She did offer to help during the day but you told her to get lost as I recall.” You said in a protective tone to Eve that she always appreciated.

“He’s right Sarah. We that are hesitant to let her close can’t expect her to clean up for us. But I guess I wouldn’t mind a once over of our room and house before you all go to bed.” Papa stated and asked Eve.

“I… I can do that in about 30 minutes if no one stops me. But they will still come in so I can put a layer of webbing on your bedroom walls to catch a bunch of them if you want.” Eve offered. “Of course it would better if you came into our room so I could… sorry forgot you don’t like that.” Eve said, the last part as Papa and Mom gave her a look. The first time they saw you cocooned they almost freaked. You told them about what she was doing and the comfort it was so they let her keep doing it. As Isaac got bitten up by mosquitoes the first night of the bug raid they let her cocoon him as well in your room. The cocoon even helped when he wet the bed. It absorbed the urine and forced a webbed like sack for Eve to dispose of during the night and he slept better than he had in his own room.

“Thanks for the thought Eve but I think we will accept your house cleaning and web treatment. Perhaps the house cleaning after everyone meets in Caleb’s room.” Mom accepted.

“I can pump out some attractants so they all come for us and get stuck your webs.” You offered.

“That would be perfect. I can even put a web over the door to catch all the flying ones.” Eve said in an excited tone. “Oh if this keeps up I’ll be dog sized by the end of the month.”

“I wouldn’t mind that.” You stated after she leapt and got another fly then stroked her a little before she scuttled over Isaac to chow down on an approaching centipede. She could eat one of three ways. She could drain the victim of their bodily fluids, or she could cocoon them then produce and enzyme that breaks down the whole body into a soup to be drank at her convenience, or if it was small enough she could swallow the thing in her mouth. Her razor sharp teeth weren't very far rooted so she couldn’t tear things apart or chew but they could keep a partially swallowed victim from getting out.

“Me neither, you’re so cool Eve.” Isaac agreed.

“And you’re so cute.” Eve said back as she danced up to his head and leapt for another few flies, landing on your head like a circus act. “Ok, so what do you all want to do?”
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Eve's worth is proven in bug raid.

choices: Sarah wants to feel it, later.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“I think I’ll go with the option that keeps me from getting wrapped up.” Sarah blurted out.

“But it’s comfy.” Isaac protested as Eve continued to work around the two of you.

“That’s all fine for you Isaac, we are just not that comfortable with that kind of thing, no offense.” Mom explained to Isaac but targeted the ‘no offense’ toward Eve.

“None taken. Caleb lets me study with him so I more than understand why some humans don’t like me very much, or spiders in general. Although that girl that comes by named Kelsey seems to like me.” Eve said in understanding after swallowing a beetle looking thing.

“Ok then, since it is near bed time, let’s all meet in Caleb’s room so Eve can get to work.” Papa stated to Sarah’s displeasure. You all got up and went into your room. The usually white surroundings of clean webbing was wiggling with black dots and sometimes the occasional larger prey like a mouse or anything small enough to think that a house was more preferable than the woods with the other animals, mainly insects though.

“Ooh I’ll be eating good tonight.” Eve said as she scuttled around the room, biting a few of the bigger pieces of prey caught in her webs before returning to the door as you all were now sitting on the clean side of the bed, and silk made chairs. She then went to work on the outside of the door frame so there was a strong barrier of webbing at the threshold. “Ok Caleb, I’m going to go make a pass over the house so you can let loose you attracting thing.” Eve said as she gave the all clear and headed off to her task. You did and flooded as much attractant as you could that you usually kept down for obvious drama and complicated reasons.

“Wow Caleb, that really does smell good.” Sarah said as she sniffed the air but was brought back from the usual daze that people and animals had when letting the scent posses them. Her attention was brought to the door as the webbing wiggled with bugs trying to get in but getting stuck, some of them rather large. Soon the door was a literal black doted mess as bugs crashed into it.

“Thanks, I think. I usually use it for hunting but it still works to help Eve catch her prey as well.” you said with a matter of fact tone. Isaac however wasn’t as strong willed as the others so he came into your swinging hammock of a bed and cuddled into you and exposing his neck to you. “And this is why I don’t do it all the time.” You said as you gave his neck a pat then just brought him down into a firm hug where he settled then went to sleep.

“I… I have to admit this is very strange.” Papa stated as Luke was more distant from the feeling but Sarah seemed to be itching to follow Isaac’s example and offer herself to you. “I know you told us about this but I didn’t think it would be this strong. I actually find myself desiring for you to drink me dry.”

“Again, it is why I don’t use this all the time. But this isn’t even a third of what the scent is capable of.” You revealed to their shock, not that they didn’t understand it before but now it was more… real since they can feel the effects. “No offense but if I really wanted to drink a human dry, even if they have an advantage of knowing who I am and what I can do, I could get them to force my fangs into their neck and yell for me to drink. Suicidal almost insane levels of desire would follow if I didn’t oblige or knock the person out.”

“So that part of the legends is fake as well, the part of vampires drinking from screaming and struggling women?” Asked Mom.

“Not really. I can also use this scent to invoke fear and a host of the other emotions. Not directly but more of a presence that invokes fear… like this scent it is easier to feel then explain. Anyway, there are primarily two ways that a Vampire would get someone’s blood pumping faster; fear or arousal. Even if I can do it, making someone fell sad, depressed, happy, or glad is useless in a hunting standpoint and especially if I want them to increase blood flow.” You answered and they tried to accept what you said with varying levels of success, enough though to be aware of what your scent was capable of.

“Would you ever… drink our blood?” asked Sarah, half the thought came from before but she was too afraid to ask. But now with your attractant scent out that little hindrance was gone.

“Sarah! You shouldn’t even tempt him.” Mom stated. However she was also suffering from the effects of your scent and was wanting to experience you biting into her again, since she and Papa already had felt how good it felt.

“Don’t worry, she isn’t tempting me… well no more than usual. But my answer is, not now. Anyone that is too young doesn’t have enough blood in them to drink safely from. It is hard to stop drinking fresh blood so it takes a bit of self control to pull away for both sides and that usually is beyond the safe limit for people too young and what their bodies can handle.” You answered.

“So you would drink from us later?” asked Luke, partially disgusted but partly aroused again by the effects of the scent.

“Wait, that wasn’t what I meant… Darn this is hard to explain. It isn’t like it is bad but it isn’t good either.” You said as you scratched your head at a loss on how to explain this.

“No, he wouldn’t.” Papa answered for you and you were glad he was taking over and they could tell with a sigh from you. “He can and it isn’t a horrible process for either side, in fact it feels extremely pleasing. However he wouldn’t drink from a human or person without good reason or unless the situation was right, and even then not to drink them dry. It is like killing, a soldier can do it but we can’t. But both are killing so which one is wrong? It is a difficult question to answer and a very fine line. What Caleb can do is no different and holds the same weight.”

“Oh.” Luke replied. You could tell he understood the soldier reference better than anything since that was what he wanted to be when he grew up. Sarah on the other hand was smart and caught a few things that were said. However for the sake of your brothers she didn’t ask them. Truth was, her body carried enough blood to allow you a drink but she was family and as you had the no human policy she wasn’t tempting in that regard. Like a beer to someone that decided not to drink again. Sure they think it would taste good but they feel no compulsion to drink the beverage, even if it is right in front of them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They want to wait in your room for her to finis...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Ok, all finished.” Reported Eve as she cut and wrapped the webbing at the door then hung the cocoon of assorted meals with her enzyme working to break them all down for her to eat later. She went over to you then climbed up until she was attached to and around your shoulder facing front. When she said it you stopped emitting your attractant to which everyone began feeling normal again. Isaac however was still sleeping on your bed as it swung contently.

“All of them?” asked Sarah with disbelief.

“All that were around. Some more will come in during the night but I put bait for them to get stuck in so it won’t be so bad.” She answered.

“Did you also web up the walls of our room?” asked Papa.

“Yes, not sticky enough to have a human stuck to it but more than enough to catch anything mouse size and smaller.” She answered.”I can take it down in the morning, along with all the treats it holds.”

“Yes please.” Mom interjected as she was concerned about the clean up.

“Ok, will do.” Eve confirmed.

“Eve, thank you for your work. I know we may not act like it all the time, but we really do appreciate you.” Papa complimented which left her speechless for the moment. She had never been directly complimented like that before. She had heard you describe how it felt but didn’t understand why you worked so hard for just some words. Now she understood as she didn’t seem to have a comeback ready for this occasion.

“I… no problem… I…we… anytime.” She stumbled as she tried to respond to it.

“Why don’t you cocoon Isaac now?” you suggested to which she quickly took the out of her embarrassing lack of verbal prowess to respond to Papa’s compliment. The all watched as she scuttled over to him then started her process without waking him.

“I she ok?” Papa whispered to you.

“Yeah, she just isn’t use to being complimented by you guys. She doesn’t do really well with surprises and emotional stuff. She is actually really happy right now.” You interpreted for them as they watched her do her work. It was fascinating if you knew she wasn’t eating the person she was wrapping. She would wrap the entire body with a thin layer of silk then a thicker layer attached to the ceiling like links in a pulley system that she used to pull the person up, in this case Isaac, and move them around the room. After that she would have more room to quickly cocoon the person. If she was going all out she would cover the head as well but since she wasn’t eating him she left the head free but supported in the back and sides. All this was done without her waking Isaac.

“Well then, I think we’ll leave you with her and go to bed ourselves.” Mom stated to which they all left you with the working Eve. Each looked back at you as if forgetting something before exiting and shutting the door behind them. Eve worked quickly and in about a half hour Isaac was completely wrapped and snug for the night.

“Ok missy, just one more and you can feast all night.” You stated as you lay down on the bed she started Isaac off in. She started almost immediately as she was anxious to start her feast. Unlike humans, she could eat all she wanted and she only got bigger not fatter, well until a certain point. It went the opposite was as well. While she could eat a massive amount she could also survive for months on just a single fly.

“You were right.” She said as she worked.

“About what?” you asked as you placed your arms to your sides for her.

“Papa has that mysterious power when he compliments people like that. I can tell he is just a normal human but there is just something about how he says it that makes all the work and hardship worth the single bit of praise from him.” She answered.

“Tell me about it, I thought that he was some kind of hybrid after I knew that Vampires were real. I have to use my abilities to do what he does just with a look. But he was right, as he usually is, you did a good job. I mean I always know you do but now they can see it in real life scenario. Came a long way from when you first got here and being worried about being squashed, didn’t you?” you asked to which she stopped her work for a moment to think then started up again.

“Indeed I have, but that is all because of you Caleb. I mean any other human would’ve killed me and definitely not saved me the amount of times you have from other humans, your family, other bugs, your dog, and the weather to name a few. The creator must’ve had a plan when he sent me here.” She stated, referencing God in her own unique way. Your parents and had thought she was proclaiming a different religion when she did such but soon realized, along with you that it was just her way of referring to him. She even went to church a few times with you when she was smaller. That and you going to a private Christian school, she had learned so much by watching you study. Studying not only your scholastic courses but your Bible class as well.

“Don’t you start that again. You’re family and that is just what we do with family, take care of each other. Besides, we are beginning to switch roles.” You answered back, stopping her before she started getting to emotional for what she was capable.

“What do you mean ‘switching roles’?” she asked as she worked.

“Well think about it. I use to carry you around and use to be the big one to explore and protect you. While you are still smaller than I am for the moment you are getting bigger, protecting us from these pests and such. Eventually you will be bigger than us and it will be us clinging to you, well I will… probably not the others but even so. While I still will have the power of a Vampire, you will be stronger and bigger than the rest of them in no time. Maybe that is why you were sent out of wherever you were born. If you were evil you would’ve been dead a long time ago but if you find someone and grow to be worthy and capable of restraint you live and become a protector rather than a… demon. I guess that is similar to me and my power, now that I think about it. It was why Miss. Isibelle watched and did similarly with me, to see if I was worthy of this power. I don’t know how well I’m doing after the fact.” You answered her and spoke while Eve scuttled around your body, lifting and pulling you as she worked in her usual massage like fashion.

“Now my turn; none of that mister. You are a wonderful Vampire and kind person. Maybe you’re right and my family doesn’t want to kill me. I mean my blood family that drove me away. But if they ever made me choose between this family and them I would choose this one hands down… or legs down.” She joked as she didn’t have hands.

“Nice one. Well let’s both work towards being worthy… whatever we are.” You suggested as she now lifted you off the bed like she did for Isaac then continued.

“Sounds like a plan to me.” She said to which you both talked as she continued and until she started eating the massive amount of meals she had around in your webbed covered room, getting it clean again before morning and growing her to near dog size.

choices: Agree and do what they say.
Agree to the training but not the human feeding part.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Alright Caleb we are all here now we must discuss something.” Papa said as you and your entire family was in the room, including Eve who was sitting in your lap. When doing this she now had to condense her legs as she was a large dog sized.

“Ok, it must be serious if we are ALL at the family meeting including cousins and all.” you stated as you looked around.

“It is, but first I do believe that most of us owe you an apology Caleb.” Uncle John Lon stated as he addressed you and looked to have the backing of the rest. “We were terribly hostile toward you at Christmas and while we still have our reservations we assumed the worst and even after we made you feel so horrible as loving family should never do, you gave us such a gift as if it was nothing. If for no other reason we decide that we must repay you for it and that is why we all agreed to having a family summer up at the cabin, all of us.”

“A what?” you asked as you stopped petting Eve in shock then shook your head to clear it then started again.

“You have been training to remain human all this time as well as mastering your powers so not to harm us and we are all grateful in our own way. I think all of us are glad you aren’t the demon that legend says you would be.” Grandpa Konel said in a gesture of compliments to what you’ve already done.

“However we also are aware that you have not trained to improve your vampire powers. Even running up north and back a few times a day isn’t that taxing for you. I know that if something is truly taxing you would need blood to replenish you power and you rarely do so and if so never human blood from someone. We aim to fix this by helping you train while we are all up there.” Papa revealed as the others didn’t know how to say it quite as easily to you.

“I… why would you all want me to advance in Vampire power? I thought that would be a threat if I was too powerful or needed blood all the time.” You asked, confused why they were so insistent about you getting stronger as a more powerful Vampire rather than trying to kill you like some were trying to do before, no more than a few months ago.

“You don’t think you are the only freak out there do you?” Grandpa Lon said bluntly. You knew he didn’t mean anything by the word ‘freak’ so you were just taken back by his directness, but that was the way he was; blunt, obvious, and to the point despite popular opinion.

“What he is trying to say is…” Aunt Penny said as she took over for his explanation. “Your little friend there is all the proof we need that if there is a Vampire out there and talking giant spiders then some of the other myths and legends must be out there to. If nothing else, having a highly trained Vampire on our side in either case would be better than not. If you are part of our family then we aim to make you the family’s, forgive the term but…, freak project.”

“They have a point Caleb.” Eve said to their amazement. They had been told about her but actually seeing and hearing her speak was something else. “If I had a mother and father than at the very least there is a society of my kind out there. If they ever came for your family because of me then it would help if you were better equipped to handle them. Not that you are weak by any means but still. Plus your room is getting cramped and I wouldn’t mind stretching my legs in the forest.”

“Ok… I guess I see the point…. Wait, if I am going to need that much blood then where will I get it?” you asked.

“I thought that obvious.” Said Grandma Konel. “We are your blood sources. There is over 20 separate families at the uncle level with your parents as well as their kids and some of their families here. Even if we are able to run you empty every day and night, which I doubt, we will have more than enough time between individual feedings for our bodies to recover and generate more blood. We will be making hardy meals for you and ourselves to ensure this as well.” The idea caught you so bad that you sat there stunned.

“You can’t be serious. You want me to drink your blood, each of you wants it? You want to become Vampire food?” You asked in shock.

“In a sense yes, but also no. We are training your Vampire side so it is only natural that we offer you your main source of instinctual food that Vampires crave the most. We are not asking you to suck us dry but we are saying that we are willing and able to provide you with it. It also will help those of us that are still doubting you to know that you feeding isn’t a bad thing in the sense we understand it. That is a human response in face of our natural predator. The only difference is that you won’t be killing us either during training or feeding. Do you understand?” Grandma Lon asked.

“I… I just need a minute. You said as you thought heavily on this. You were worried about what they were suggesting. Sure you saw the benefit but you had been trying to avoid using humans as food and wasn’t sure about suddenly only accepting human blood. There was also the issue of feeding on children, would that be ok or was that not part of it. They weren’t telling you everything and if you agreed then you would have to if they told you to. You knew there would be lines but you didn’t know where these lines were. I mean how often is it that a family is doing this for a Vampire member of their family. Then again how can you refuse? They were right, you were a pathetic Vampire at the moment in word and deed. You didn’t have to be evil but you didn’t know the first thing about instincts in your new life and how to use them in a battle situation if one ever arises. What to do???
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Summer break and new exercises.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Fine, I’ll do what you tell me to do so I can get stronger as a Vampire.” You agreed with a sigh as you knew that it might be a mistake but if you couldn’t trust your family then you didn’t know who you could trust.

“Very good, we already have all our stuff we need up there. All we need is for you to teleport all of us up.” Papa stated as they all stood.

“What about my stuff?” you asked.

“Your stuff?” asked Mom with a cynical grin. “Caleb you don’t get any of your human things while training to be a Vampire. We are taking this seriously. Now let’s go.” She commanded as they all held hands and Papa’s hand was extended to you to which you looked at them as if wondering how much planning they had done to do this. If their stuff was already up there with all the kids and those that were missing then it must’ve been some major string pulling. You sighed then took Papa’s hand.

“Ok, here we go. Everyone hold your breath.” You advised to which almost all of them took a breath at the same time. To this you teleported them all Up North in front of the cabin where your glyph was. As soon as you got there you let go of his hand and caught yourself on the ground. You hadn’t drank any blood in the last month so the act of teleporting over 100 people over a couple hundred miles drained you.

“What, already?” asked Uncle Jim as he saw you heaving on the ground.

“Well he hasn’t drank any blood for about a month. Even back home where he doesn’t do that much, relatively speaking, he would need a pint of blood by next week. Teleporting all of us up here probably wasn’t as easier as he made it look either.” Papa said as they all looked down at you while Eve scuttled from your back to the ground.

“Ok Caleb here is your first rule. You are authorized to feed at your leisure on us as long as you follow a few rules.” Grandpa Konel started to which you stood up, unable to retract you fangs at this point. But the idea of blood at the end of this talking point made you pay close attention. “First; you must never suck anyone dry but you don’t have to stop at operational time. You can drink them until they are unconscious but not in mortal or will take longer than a day to recover. Second rule; you only get one free meal a day and after that you must use your persuasion and other powers to steal your prey’s blood as if we weren’t willing and we can stop you any way we wish, even steaking you with silver. Your free meal will be rotated so we ALL get a turn. Right now it is your father’s turn as he and your mother have already experienced it.” He said as Papa came over to you and you reached for his arm but got a shake in response. “The last rule is that you may only drink from a human’s neck as a proper Vampire would, or at least what we think a proper Vampire would. While in combat training you can do otherwise if desired in achieving your goal but not as your meals are concerned. This also limits you from animals, you can’t have any animals or human food; ONLY from a HUMAN’s NECK.”

“I… don’t know if I feel comfortable with that yet.” You said as the move to do so was rather aggressive and you weren’t sure about doing it to family. The wrist was more pleasant as far as human interaction was concerned. That and you had never drank from that spot before and were understandably nervous, ironically more nervous than the humans around you that were watching and would be your meals, your family. Instinctually your body was telling you to go for it but your human part was saying that you shouldn’t.

“They you don’t get to eat. But this time I must insist Caleb. We need you at top shape to start out.” Papa said as he bent down and offered his neck to you subtly.

“O…ok.” you obeyed as you hesitantly came in for a hug then in one move buried your fangs deep into his neck, causing him to gasp and fresh, hot, delicious, human blood flowed into your mouth and down your throat. You almost hit a blood haze before you remembered what they said and pulled out. It was near double what you took before and he was hugging your head in for you to keep going in his near dizzy state. “Any more and you will pass out or die.” You said as you licked the area of residual blood that hadn’t made it into your mouth. Through the bliss he was aware enough to understand and allowed you to back off and he was helped to his feet.

“Well, how’d it feel… both of you?” asked Grandpa Lon.

“Incredible, I didn’t want him to stop.” Papa stated in a more slurred speech as evidence to his new state. Mom was there to hold him a little.

“It… it was good, really good actually. Is it bad to say that human blood is the best tasting blood of them all?” you asked nervously, not sure how open you could be about this.

“Not at all, we want to help you Caleb and learning how and what it is like is all a part of that. I guess we are glad that we taste good and especially that we are the best. That means we can really train you like we said we would… as a true Vampire.” Aunt Anna answered and slowly they all agreed.

“One more thing Caleb. None of your abilities are restricted. We want you to mind read and fully explore the entire time. This is your time as a Vampire not as a human. Sure you are to follow rules of each exercise and stuff but other than that you are free to act within that. Using our desires and exposing them included.” Grandma Lon stated.

“You want me to read your minds?” you asked as you were always told that was rude.

“Again, like she said, this is your VAMPIRE training. So yes, we want you to read our minds. Well maybe not but we are saying do it anyway.” Grandma Konel verified
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Agree and do what they say.

choices: Next night after your free meal.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Ok, now that you’re fed we can begin, and we’ll start by describing the type of setup we will have.” Uncle Paul stated as he was the oldest of the Konel Uncles.

The others went to one side in front of the cabin. The Cabin was huge as it was made to accommodate all of our family plus some. The Sleeping area was naturally larger than anything else as there was over 300 rooms, small rooms and some that had collapsible walls but rooms all the same. That area was connected like a hotel to the main area that could house the people in those 300 rooms rather well and as it was a cabin it was more rustic with a wood burning stove for heat along with a boiler and other pieces of older things to make it what a cabin its size would be. There was of course garages and storage but the biggest part was the land itself. Over 500 acres of wooded land with the DNR on one side and a deer farm on the other. Your family’s connection kept the authorities out of the way if your family wanted to do anything besides murder people, which you could probably get away with. The area over top was a no fly zone and your Grandfathers’ military background allowed enough pull to keep people looking down from orbit. Mainly because your family allowed the military branches to train on your land as part of it.

“For starters you don’t get to sleep in the house. And the house’s main section is a free zone where you are not permitted at all this summer. However you are allowed in the bedrooms via your hunting while we sleep if you can. I guess you could sleep in one of the rooms but as you are not afforded a room we are authorized to expel you any way we want if we find you in there, and I do mean ANY way we want.” Uncle Paul said as he got the situation down for you. “You see we are also training so that we are ready for other freaks like you in the future. Eve will be on our side to make the odds a little more fair and help her train as well. It helps that her venom is strong enough to cause you some damage.”

“I can’t bite Caleb!” Eve almost shrieked.

“Don’t worry Eve.” You said as you gave her a pet. “I can’t die remember and you all need the training as much as I do. At least with you over there helping them they stand a better chance. Can’t imagine them being that good at sensing me right off the bat and it will help me train to avoid you. I promise I’ll be fine.”

“Well… I guess so. But we get some serious R&R after this summer. Oh what about my hunting?” she asked the others.

“We’re getting to that.” Uncle Jim said as it was his turn to explain. “During the night we will be up and training you on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays with hunting exercises where we set a goal like defeat us all without a sound, or transport us all to a prison of some sort. During this time we will provide resistance. At dusk, like it is now you will receive your fee meal Caleb as a sort of sacrifice if you will but not really. We need your power up high at night so you can thrive in your natural element and figure things out that you didn’t know before. One the off nights you are free to roam as are we. You can choose to hunt some of us, play with us, or whatever and likewise for our side. Don’t expect mercy if you are caught on an off day. Sundays will be the only exception as we will all be going to church but you are still not allowed in the house at that time. At dawn the bell will sound and we will begin athletic training and other things that we find useful like digging holes, balancing on top of a tree all day or whatever. But more importantly it is our time to sleep and Eve’s time to hunt the animals that are around if she wishes as long as she cleans up after herself, although I’m sure we won’t mind her leaving a web up if it captures you.” Uncle Jim finished.

“Oh, this is getting exciting. I’m already thinking of traps I can set for you.” Eve said to you as she scuttled in a circle.

“Is that all?” you asked.

“Basically, other than during dawn when we tell you what drills you need to run or at dusk when we tell you what hunting objective we are doing along with the activities themselves you are free to do anything more or less. Mainly we need you to be hostile toward us so we can train along with you. If you want to make one of us your slave as a result of your power than that is up to you. Like we said we want you to use ALL of your Vampire Powers so you can train like a Vampire. You know you are doing it right it you are needing blood every day. Understand?” Grandma Konel asked.

“I think so. It will be a little bit weird hunting my family but I think I can handle it. What about tonight?” You asked. It was Monday and it was dusk so you were wondering if there was an activity for the night.

“Tonight is a free night but you are to establish your domain and get a feel for your area. We will not tread in the forest tonight and you are to stay away from us until we meet tomorrow morning at dawn. After that your training begins.” Papa said as his body began to strengthen but not enough to look as strong as it usually did, just enough though to keep from tipping over and slurring his speech.

“Ok… I hope you all don’t feel bad if I win all the time.” You said with a final smirk.

“As long as you remember Caleb.” Uncle Matt said, catching your attention. “When we catch you, for whatever reason we have from then till the next scheduled event to play with you whatever way we want. And since you can’t die we can play out scenarios of torture and death without worry. So don’t think we hate you or are betraying you for doing it. After all, thinking up consequences for being captured for you, we will need to be more ruthless and sadistic than normal.”

“Got it.” You said after a gulp that got some of them to laugh. It was true though. Some might not do it but some were new to being nice to you and probably hoped to get the big bad Vampire to bleed. Some looked like they might do some other morally questionable things to you if caught. You could see each person’s minds turn as they thought of things they wanted in that situation.

“Alright now, it’s almost night time so you have to get out of here.” David, your cousin, said nervously to which you smiled and nodded then vanished from their sight. You had sped to the top of a tree and observed the crowd as they looked around for you in a combination of shock and concern. They had just told you that you could go all out so you let your natural scents and things you usually held back out. They were all yelling and such trying to find you, in case you were still around until the dark patch you knew as Eve directed their eyes to your figure at the top of the tree you were in. It was the tallest but bare tree in the whole place. She didn’t find you right away though but they were glad she helped so you said something you knew only she could here before disappearing into the night.

“Well I think you will be their Hero from now on. I’m sure they will all love you to death, no pun intended. Good luck.” You said as your last official compliment before starting that you knew she would like. The others were a little unnerved at how well you could disappear into the night like that but they were glad that Eve at least gave them a better chance and that made her all the more happy. This would definitely be an interesting summer.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Hard core survival training.

choices: Next night; more food, but more challenges.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You got a good layout of what the area was like but 500 acres was hard to explore and regulate. Luckily for you your body didn’t require sleep, or that much of it. But since you didn’t know how bad the next day of training was you practiced on using only a small amount of power so you had enough for whatever the exercises were. As it turned out they met you at Dawn and had you dig holes with no tools. Not small holes either. They were 50 feet deep by 100 feet wide then after you were done with one hole they would have you fill it back up and dig another in a different spot. At first you thought it ridiculous but you soon found that you could grow your nails like claws. In this instance it helped dig up the dirt from the hard clay underneath. Afterwards it was near dusk so they afforded you a little time to wash off in the river and get back for your meal. No surprise it was Mom as Papa was last night. You repeated the process, she came down to your level and you gently approached then sank your fangs in. It was a surprise that you actually did need the blood after the day’s events. You stopped at a similar spot as Papa so she was woozy but not incapacitated. Of course she had a little less self control than he and told you to keep going to which you had to enter her mind and force her to let go.

“Ok, now that part is done we all have 10 minutes to allow the other side to retreat into our respective elements before hostilities can be performed.” Uncle Mike stated to which you nodded and disappeared. You could see their flashlights glance the tops of trees to find you and they were right, you were in a tree observing them but behind the trunk and only showing one eye which they had no hope of seeing as they retreated. However you kept an eye on Eve, as you knew she would be your biggest obstacle in this new system. And you were right, about an hour later you saw her scurry into the forest. You avoided her for the most part as you observed the others.

“Got you.” she said as you stepped in one of her webbed traps she must’ve set during the day when you were training. You quickly used a bit of electricity to fry the webbing and move out of the way only a split second before her form came down in an attempt to get at you. Unlike at home, this time her poisonous and dripping fangs were poised at you as she descended. But she missed and you ran up a tree before she hit the ground, keeping a better eye on your footing. “Darn it, no fair.”

“Well of course not. You all did tell me to go all out. But I’ll give you props for an excellent trap. If I didn’t already know how to use electricity like that then you would’ve got me for sure. See we are learning stuff already. I learned I have to watch my footing at the most obscure times. Stepping on any one of your webs could be dangerous. But remember, I am free to attack you to.” You complimented and warned as your feet were connected to the tree by another power you just learned. Before you always used a combination of floating and static connection to attach to certain surfaces. You never thought that you might have a separate ability that allowed you to walk up walls and stuff.

“Thanks and I already know that Caleb. But you shouldn’t let your guard down.” She said just as you heard a snap and saw a log coming toward you. You leapt and attempted to spring off the end but the pointed end was just a distraction and it was also covered in webbing that got you stuck just long enough for Eve to scale the tree and leap to you. You both fell and she attempted to use her cocooning experience to bite and capture you. But you used a flame from the hand restraining her and sent her and her severed webbing to the ground.

“Damn, Eve are you ok?” you asked as you could smell some of her hair burnt completely off and the impact of the fall could break human bone. But as you neared her she sprung into action and took another leap towards you, fangs out and ready to sink in. This one got closer than the others and you should’ve expected her to play possum to get you. But you were on edge at this point and just barely dodged it so she sank her fangs in the tree and got stuck, but that was all the moment you needed as you pushed her body so she couldn’t retract her fangs and remained stuck. “Nice trick… This is going to be harder than I thought” You said as you caught you breath.

“Me too, I knew you were good but I thought that I could get you.” Eve pouted.

“You got closer than I even thought possible. But you really should have some of the others help. They may not be as good as we are but all you really needed tonight was a good distraction to get my eyes off you and you would’ve got me for sure. I definitely can’t overlook you. I guess that just means it is going to be just as fun as we thought it would.” You said.

“Hey, how do you know what I’m thinking?” she asked.

“Don’t get all moody on me. You all told be to read your minds. Anyway, you can’t say that you aren’t looking forward to this.” you retorted.

“I guess not, I’ll get you next time.” She said.

“Sure, but you also have another area you need to protect, don’t you. With you out here I can easily enter the cabin and get a few pints of blood for my troubles. But tonight I’m not really hungry. Even so this is going to be fun won’t it.” You stated but also asked.

“Definitely.” She said as you let go and disappeared again. She could only follow your movements a while until you lost her. She was stuck for about 5 minutes and after that went back to the cabin to report. Yes, very fun…
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Next night after your free meal.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Another day and another set of physical training. No one else came for you the previous night as you could hear them all talking to Eve about it both that night and the following day, what worked and what she could improve on, along with how you countered her moves. But finally after washing off the dirt from another day of digging, this time a vast tunnels system underground, it was meal time again.

“Caleb… be… please be gentle.” Sarah said as you approached her. Unlike your parents and other adults, you didn’t have to stretch to reach her neck, nor did she have to bend down for you. That and her neck was thinner than the two relatively thicker necks you drank from so far. Coming from a family that the average adult nears 300 lbs, thinner people weren’t in the majority and Sarah had been on diets this entire year.

“Don’t worry Sarah. It actually feels really good.” You stated as you put a hand on her shoulder. You could feel her blood racing as you approached her for what she knew was food, her neck. Unlike Papa and Mom, she never had an experience with you sucking her blood so she was anticipating bad things.

“How do you know? You do the biting, not the other way around.” She asked nervously, knowing that there wasn’t a way she could back out of this so she didn’t want to anger the Vampire that would drink her anyway.

“I had my blood drunk by Miss. Isibelle remember. But the feeling you get is only about… maybe half or less than that of what I get on my end. They weren’t joking when they said you won’t want me to stop.” You said and she nodded and you back to her as you hugged into her then brought your mouth to her neck, licking the spot first. Her flesh was different tasting than your Parents, perhaps it was because she was younger or something but she tasted and smelled more… pure. You could feel her heart beat increase as she felt this to which you tightened your hold on her and sank your fangs in. She reacted similar to the other two with the gasping and arousal but there was one main difference other than a better taste and less blood to draw from, her hand shot up to your head and pushed you into her neck as hard as she could. When it came time to end you had to force yourself out of her despite some moans to the contrary.

“No… come on, just a little more.” Sarah begged as you pulled away, to woozy to stand on her own, to which Papa and Mom caught her.

“Not that bad, is it?” Mom asked rhetorically to which Sarah looked up at her with a dreamy set of eyes before she passed out and Papa took her in his arms, taking her back to her room to rest then returned.

“So, what’s the activity for the night?” you asked to which the Uncles held up rifles as they loaded bullets into them as the others had silver striking weapons.

“We are having a multi hunt.” Grandpa Konel stated as he chambered a bullet into his rifle as well. “We are going to be hunting you and you will be taking us down. All of us will be wearing this red LED light on our wrists and Eve on the base of her front leg. It blinks so we know who is who and you are not permitted to acquire one to prevent confusion that could get us shooting each other. Since you can’t die, we will hunt you to the presumed death. You on the other hand have to take each of us down and transport us to that cage. Once inside we are not allowed to leave until the exercise is complete one way or another. However we can decide to attack you from inside so ridding of us weapons would be a good idea as well as transporting us there. Not that you need to but you are also not permitted to use one of our flashlights or lights in general, again, to prevent possible fatal confusion. Understand?”

“Yes. No restrictions on how I take each of you out?” You asked.

“Other than the loss of life than, no. You will also be healing each of us if injured at the conclusion of the exercise so keep that in mind.” Uncle Rusty stated as he cocked the hammers on his shotgun.

“Understood, when do we start?” You asked.

“When the sun goes down, so I’d guess about 5 minutes.” Grandma Lon responded. She was to frail for a gun so she had a silver charm and flashlight in hand.

“Ok, then I better get going. Good luck…” you said with a smirk than vanished from sight. You ran up to a tree like usual after running around a little and noticed some of the traps Eve set during the day. You watched as they organized in groups and such Isaac was in Eve’s group as everyone were ok with her but he was the only one that was comfortable with her to the point of turning his back to her without fear. A few more kids his age and a little younger were in bigger groups but there was another in his group, Dana. She always liked Isaac the most out of the Cousins and they were always together at family things. She wasn’t that sure about Eve but was getting closer to her as well. Either way that group was the #1 target with Eve in it. While the kids their age were only armed with at most a set of silver brass knuckles, Eve was the main threat among all of them but then there was the army, Navy, Marine, and Air Force trained people around with guns. You would need to be careful in approaching any of them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Next night; more food, but more challenges.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Alright, the person that takes him down gets a prize afterward.” Grandma Lon stated, which further motivated the crowd. Grandma Lon’s prizes were usually something personal and something deeply desired by the person so for her to offer it was not a small matter. They all moved into the woods like what you’d expect a horror movie would look like, with their flash lights and weapons out and ready.

The area was large so they had to spread out a bit in order search the entire thing. You were at a loss at who to take out first so you just went with your instincts and followed Eve’s group. Her’s was the smallest with just three and you needed to get her instinct out of the equation. Besides, on a more primal level you had never actively invoked fear before and this was a perfect opportunity to do it. You stalked them at a distance until they were alone for the most part, enough at least for you to make your move. You turned to mist small enough to fool Eve then brought it around them, careful to avoid the silver pieces Isaac and Dana had on them.

“I’m scared.” Dana said as she walked with them, jerking her head back and forth in the dark forest.

“Don’t worry Dana.” Isaac said as he hadn’t really grasped what was going on yet. “Eve is like the best hunter in the world. She can catch anything.”

“Oh thank you Isaac. You’re such a nice boy.” Eve said as she looked around for you. Her hair was on end and from this you could tell she knew you were close but couldn’t locate you. “Keep an eye out though. You never know where he could…” she started but then noticed that area around them was different as if the little bit of scent and fog that the humans couldn’t hope to see was staying away from their silver pieces like they were providing a barrier. “He’s here!” she yelled but you had already hid and attached her own webbing to her legs and in a single pull you tied her up into a ball which then fell onto the ground as lights responded to her shout and your form faded out of the mist.

“Run kids.” Eve said to which they did. The way you appeared stimulated their imagination as well as Eve’s helplessness at the moment. “So you got me.” She pouted.

“Not only that, I do recall hearing that I can take you in any way I want and the more… Vampire like the better. So…” you stated as you picked her up in the wiggling hairy ball she was in, still growing back the hair you burnt off the night before, then growing your fangs.

“No, you’re not going to…” she stammered as you brought her body up to your mouth.

“Afraid so, I didn’t really get enough blood from Sarah so for all the power I’m going to use I need a little more. Plus, I’ve never had your blood before. I’m curious to see how it tastes.” You revealed and with that you sank your fangs into her thorax and it made her spasm as you drank her black colored blood. As she wasn’t that big you only got a sip but it was enough for a taste test and she healed up nicely. Meanwhile the others got to the area so you raced into the darkness and appeared next to the cage you were to put them in. You had to admit that her blood wasn’t that bad.

“W… Wow, So that’s what it feels like. H… how did… I taste?” she asked as she came down from her version of mountain of desire.

“Not bad actually, a little tangy and understandably not as refreshing as human blood but I don’t think I have to explain about blood taste to you. Overall I wouldn’t mind a longer drink when you get bigger. But for now I have a few little children to round up and bring back here for you to look after.” You answered as you placed her down in the cage and sliced a key strand before backing out and getting on the outside before she could stop you.

“You’re not going to scare them that badly are you?” She asked as she stood up. You didn’t take enough of her blood to prevent basic movement but enough that she didn’t mind resting.

“Not that bad, but I’ve never really invoked fear before in people. Isn’t that the point of this exercise? To win like a Vampire would in the situation. I highly doubt that actual hunters would use little kids but even so a Vampire would probably not make it too pleasant if they did. But I’m just not use to being anything near sadistic yet so I won’t scare them that much. But with the main obstacle out of the way I can have fun with the rest of them.” you said with a smile.

“Well have fun.” She said as she made a quick web on the ceiling corner and rested there.

“You know I will.” You stated with a grin then rushed off.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You win.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You rushed into the woods and followed Isaac and Dana’s scent to another group and watched as they soothed them.

“He just… I didn’t even see him until he got Eve.” Isaac said with a whimper and Dana was shivering into the other shoulder of Uncle Fred, the more silent but relational Uncle of the Lon side. His group was his Family of Aunt Nancy, Amy, Tom , and Phillip as they kept an eye out for you.

“It’s ok, it’s just a game ok. Eve is ok and in that cage waiting for you.” he said to them. You felt kind of bad that you had scared them that much without even trying. So you decided that you needed to take them there right away.

Tossing a small rock on the other side of them made Uncle Fred and the others to look that way and put the two in question behind him as he leveled his rifle to the noise. You whispered in the wind so the children took a few steps back in fear then quickly grabbed both of them and teleported back to the cage, using your mist to rid them of the silver items they had and put them on the table next to the cage so the weapons you confiscated didn’t end up in the mud. Then put them in the middle of the cage via your mist so Eve couldn’t bite you as you entered. The whole thing took maybe a second but the initial grab got them to squeak and the end of a scream as they appeared in the cage.

“See, that wasn’t so bad.” You said as they looked around and noticed their change of scenery.

“You… where is Eve?” asked Isaac in a whimper to which you pointed at the approaching spider to which he ran and hugged the large spider without thinking about where he was hugging her. She didn’t mind though.

“Ok, I got to go now so be sure to laugh at the people I bring back.” You said with a smile and wave, then took off again and started watching the group you just left.

“That’s crazy, he just took them without us even seeing him. Who’s going to be next?” Asked Tom as they all scanned the deep and dark forest for you. However it was getting tiring to run back and forth to the cage every time so you had put two glyphs there on your last trip, one for the table so you could send their weapons there and one for the cage so you could send them there.

You waited as they all looked around and you threw another rock in a direction to which they all snapped to the tree it bounced off before realizing what happened you were able to grab Uncle Fred and send him and His weapons to their spots. You did the same to the increasingly scared and panicking family until only Amy was left. She was the same age as Sarah and although a red head it seemed like that all the kids were becoming more liberal and going on diets, however she had a rather large sweet tooth and you wondered if all that chocolate would affect her taste. You assumed Luke was tomorrow’s meal so she was free to take.

“Please… where are you?” she whimpered to which you decided to play with her a little. You rushed passed and sent all her weapons and sliver items to the table. She knew you were there and that you had saved her for last so she screamed and started running, alerting the others of what was going on. You watched from a tree as the lights from other groups snapped to the sound of her scream. “No, no, no,… I can’t stand for all this suspense.” She whimpered as she slunk down the length of a tree in exhaustion.

“Then I’ll be straight forward. I plan to drink from you.” you said from the darkness that got her heart to race even more.

“What? You already had your meal.” She said in a scared tone.

“Hmm, but I need more and was always wondering how you tasted with all that chocolate you eat. Sarah tasted better than the other two, was that because she was skinnier, younger, or something else? Either way, they told me to hunt and that is what I’m doing… my prey.” You said, the last part as you dropped in front of her and slowly stalked your way to her. Normally you would use your attractant to make her more calm and willing but you wanted to know what it was like to feed on her and more importantly on someone scared rather than aroused.

“No, you don’t have to.” She begged as you bent down over her and approached her neck with your fangs showing.

“No, but I want to.” You said as you pulled her away from the tree and sank your fangs in and started to drink. You were surprised that she tasted just as sweet as you thought she would for the amount of candy and chocolate she ate. Humans were such an interesting meal, each one tastes different and insanely delicious. She gave a scream as you did this but the heightened fright the plunge into high arousal rendered her unconscious. You drank enough but not as much as the others as you didn’t need it. Then licked the rest up so there was no evidence then teleported her to the cage with the rest.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Continue with the fun.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Most of the exercise was going as expected as you tracked, found, stalked, and took out each group. They had mostly separated in groups according to immediate family, including yours. You made a trip back to the cage once as you dropped off some of the smaller kids and noticed some of the weapons on the table were gone. It only took you a moment to find and turn to mist; taking them away again and locking the cage door. Something you should’ve done before as no one said anything about them having to stay in the cage. Finally you reached the last group. You had actually tried them before but Uncle Rusty was an excellent shot with the pistol he had and was able to get a hit on you. You of course healed right away, well as soon as you took the silver bullet out but still you healed while taking some of the other groups out. He also had found one of Eve’s large trapping spots so he and his immediate Family could be protected, his family being; Aunt Karen, Mitchell, and Teresa. They were the family from the Lon side that lived in California and were naturally in the best shape, probably because Uncle Rusty was the oldest on that side, Aunt Karen didn’t cook or serve as large of portions as the main family did, and of course California near beaches motivates the kids to be… well beach worthy and they were.

“I can’t believe you got caught.” Mitchell teased Teresa as she hung from one of Eve’s large webs that she put on ground level in attempts to catch you. She was trapped with her arms out and legs partially stretched apart, completely helpless and the others weren’t about to get stuck themselves but they were sticking around to protect her from you.

“Oh shut it.” Teresa said back as her prized straight and golden hair was also stuck in the sticky web.

“Both of you be silent. Caleb might be our family but he is also a Vampire. We pushed him away before because we were able to locate him. But we can’t with you all making so much noise and not paying attention.” Uncle Rusty said as he looked around. There was no way that you were going to be able to sneak up on them as they had a rather good line of sight. Two of them looking at the tree tops and the other two looking at ground level. From their minds you could tell they were looking for motion first and shape later, smart for the situation. You had already made fools of even Papa as he was looking for you rather than the effects your movement would have on things around him. That and the rest of them had long rifles to swing around while Uncle Rusty had his pistol.

Then you got an idea as you looked at Eve’s traps around the place. It hadn’t failed yet to cause a distraction and get the last one in the rear for your catch. The only thing was that the trap you were going to set off would put Teresa in the rear and you didn’t have enough time to take her and vanish before your Uncle would wheel around and shoot you. The next one would be Aunt Karen, yeah that would work. Sure Teresa would see you but she couldn’t do anything about it other than scream, which would only help scare the other two. With that decided you spit what you had now come to call a ‘saliva needle’ at the trap in question to which it activated and mad a log with webbing on it crash to the ground. If you had stepped in that trap it would’ve effectively knocked you out cold with the weight and sudden speed that Eve had put on it. But it did more than enough to wheel everyone to what happened and you made your move for Aunt Karen.

“Mom!” Teresa screamed but it was too late as you rushed passed Teresa, grabbed your Aunt, and took off like a shadow with the whole thing done in maybe 3 seconds. Enough for them to see it but not slow enough for them to do more than that. You sent her to the rest and her weapons separate from her then focused again on the 3 remaining.

You could hear laughter as she arrived. At first there were only screams but now when someone was deposited in the cage they laughed at how scared the person was. In Auntie Karen’s case you had first heard her scream almost louder than Aunt Anna but were very scared. Her scream was replaced with laughter. However the laughter was switched by a type of physic barrier that made it sound like the captured prisoners were being tortured or something but far enough away for them to think something bad was happening. It wore on their nerves nicely.

You saw them panicking a little and so you waited and got Mitchell as well as he ran off into the woods. Now it was just the two of them. You stalked them and whispered into the wind in order to freak them out even more, putting emotional attractants in the air to cause fear. You then was about to make a move when you stepped on a trap and had to dodge a webbed spike but you couldn’t dodge the few bullets that were fired at you while in the air. You knew now why Vampires were hit by silver bullets if they were faster than the bullets’ path, well in the past at least. As the silver gets closer the effect of weakening you becomes stronger and you become slower, not slow enough even with them inside you to keep from running away but slow enough to prevent you from dodging.

“Ah!” you yelled as you felt 2 out of the 4 shots rip into your torso as you vanished into the night. It was the second time he was able to put a bullet into you, and this time it was two bullets, one in your stomach and one close to your heart. An inch to the left and he would’ve pulled a huge upset in this game. But as he reloaded his revolver of a pistol you raced from behind him and dove to send him and his gun to their proper places. You were glad he only brought that as you didn’t have enough strength at the moment with the bullets deep in your chest and stomach to search him.

“Caleb… wait are you ok?” Teresa asked as she saw you lean against one of the trees facing her and panting like she hadn’t seen or imagined you could. She saw the blood flowing out of the bullet wounds as you breathed.

“Kind of. These things don’t tickle you know.” You answered as you took a deep breath and dug the first one out of your stomach and caused blood to squirt out of the wound until you did it again to the other one and threw the bullets away from you. You then let out your breath in a severe panting as she saw your body heal its wounds.

“Was that even close?” she asked.

“Incredibly close, Uncle Rusty was the only one tonight to put a bullet in me or stop me at all. Not only that but he did it 3 times and if this one would’ve been a single inch to the left you two would’ve won and I would be pretty dead until someone took the bullet out. At the very least I would’ve been weak enough for him to finish off or you could’ve if you didn’t get yourself caught in Eve’s web.” You answered.

“So you won huh?” she asked.

“You’re the last one but I need a drink.” You said as you stood up, a little wobbly and trudged over to her.

“Oh come on, you can’t just finish it already?” she asked as if trying to change your mind. You were now leaning on her body with one arm over her shoulder and around her back while the other was barely able to lift.

“Sorry, but I don’t even have enough strength to make you afraid or aroused.” You stated as you hung from her a little, to rest before drinking so you had more control.

“Aroused?” she asked.

“There is usually only 2 ways that a vampire gets their… prey to pump blood faster. Usually I arouse the person as it is the nicer of the two. But I tried the fear one on Amy earlier and it works really good to. But I don’t have enough energy to do either so… now I just… need.” You said and was going to finish but needed blood more so you lazily sank your fangs into her neck and as her blood flowed to nourish your body you became stronger but only took enough to get back basic power settings. After all, you still had all night to hunt them after they return. That and it didn’t feel as good without it gushing like when you really get their blood flowing.

“Uh! Please don’t stop.” She pleaded as you retracted and pulled away.

“You taste great Teresa but I think I prefer it if I can really get you excited one way or another. If I had to describe the difference I would say that it’s like a ripe and juicy grape verses a partially drained and warm one. So maybe later if you think you can handle it than come out here instead of going to bed. Of course you’d have to sneak out but then again I wouldn’t mind the free meal.” You answered and she seemed to understand the reason.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Continue...

choices: Some come out to you... free meal.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“I could make you a slave you know.” You said to her as you transported her silver things on her to the tables outside the cage.

“If you were going to make me a slave you would’ve done it without telling me you were going to do it.” She stated. Perks of being 5 years older than you meant she was mature, smarter, and wiser than you are, like most of the people around. The only difference between her and them was she was older than you and didn’t start out hating your guts.

“Yeah well I just said I could, not that I would. I COULD also feed on the family in the bathroom or shower as you wouldn’t be expecting it but I don’t think I will. I mean I still have my dignity and pride and I prefer my meals aware of what is happening.” You agreed and explained to which you touched the webs and shot an electrical current through them, effectively disintegrating them and she fell to into your arms to which you transported her into the cage and you just outside of it, going over to a bench just outside the cage to rest.

“So there you are, having a little fun before you finished?” asked Luke from the cage.

“If your definition of fun is pulling out silver bullets out of my chest then yes.” You responded as you unlocked the door from where you sat and it swung open. They all filed out and stood around you, now able to see the blood stained clothes and bullet holes in them.

“So let’s start with the evaluation of each other so we can get some sleep.” Grandma Konel said. “I have to say that you did a good job completing the objective and scaring the living daylights out of most of us. You used abilities we never knew you had and I truthfully expected no less from our first time trying to hunt you. But it does look like you have a weakness in dodging silver bullets.” She stated as she gestured to your ripped shirt.

“Question, if 3 bullets to the chest doesn’t kill you than what does?” asked David.

“Well I did have to drink some blood to recover the power I lost from the wounds. And like I was telling Teresa, as I was pulling the last 2 out, if this one would’ve been one inch to the left then Uncle Rusty would’ve gotten the win. It just barely missed my heart and I was lucky that Teresa was trapped by one of Eve’s webs or she could’ve finished me as well. I had barely enough strength to reach her and suck her blood, I definitely wouldn’t have been able to run or fight if she wasn’t trapped like she was.” You answered.

“Ok so now your turn to evaluate us.” stated Grandma Konel after they all looked at Uncle Rusty with surprise that he was the one that almost won the whole thing and buried all 3 of the bullets that actually made it into you.

“Ok, first is the grouping. You all chose groups by popularity and relation instead of what would actually catch me. I guess kids as young as Isaac and Dana wouldn’t be thrown into hunting parties in real life but you could’ve used them as extra eyes in another group. Even so, most groups were well communicated but not diverse enough to cause any kind of challenge. Next is the equipment; unless you’re going to shoot me from long range than a rifle’s long barrel and slower rank of motion is why I was able to avoid them being fired anywhere near me. Uncle Rusty’s pistol and his ability to use it made it difficult to approach and it took more than 3 attempts before I figured out a way to grab someone, and that was only when Teresa got caught. Lastly, you are all still scared of Eve. She is the biggest obstacle for me to figure around because she can sense me many times better than any human. Her many eyes can see my mist enough to warn you, her sense of smell can perceive when I am getting closer, her hearing has better tracking, and I could go on. She is the only other predator around and on your side, yet you distanced her from helping in any way that made sense. She is the most powerful asset among you, so use her and help her.” You lectured to which they all nodded and looked over at the bashful dog sized spider that was moving about.

“I never thought I would be mad that I didn’t shoot you.” Papa said with a little laugh.

“This was fun, hard, but fun.” You stated.

“Agreed.” Grandpa Konel said then they all began retrieving their stuff. “Ok, we all have 15 minutes to get where we need to be. After that we are back at protecting and hunting while we humans… and spiders try to get some sleep. We got a hungry Vampire out here so let’s not slack off.”

“Well said, I am rather hungry. Hope I can catch one of you.” you said then disappeared from view after a smirk that got some of them that you had scared especially bad, like Amy, to get worried and hurry themselves up. Others laughed and yet others felt a slight pull to just let you do it, unknowingly it was more of the your attractant effects than their own reason and desire.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Finish the event.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You were slightly glad that they didn’t come out to you. This early in your training it would only serve to complicate things on what was supposed to be a challenging experience. You waited about a half hour then observed them as they walked around the cabin. Mainly you kept an especially sharp eye on Eve as she scuttled around but she was still slightly shunned by those that had a higher phobia of her than you, at the moment. You decided to fix that.

“Eve, please clean up after yourself. You can’t just leave your webs everywhere.” Josi said, another of the girls in the same age bracket as Sarah from Uncle Paul’s family. They had been more difficult to take out that night but not hard enough to be any kind of challenge.

“But I thought it would be good so Caleb couldn’t just walk around when he snuck in here.” Eve asked as she stopped at her spot on the ceiling to address the girl.

“Just leave them out of my room.” she retorted then slammed her door. She had a few silver charms in her room but nothing that hindering to you. Most of the rest had asked Eve to secure their room and windows but she was more phobic that most. Some of the smarter people had brought silver nets that they put over the entrances of their room. It was a good idea but you could just use the cracks in the floor to come in if you really wanted, while in mist form. You watched as each went to bed as did Eve, although her legs were spread so she could feel the webs she placed as silent alarms for her use.

Josi was the only one that didn’t do anything to her window and even forgot to lock it. You thought that maybe she did it on purpose but a quick intrusion into her mind told you otherwise. You didn’t even need to change to mist to get into her room after she was fast asleep. You looked around and noticed the door locked as she seemed more worried about someone just walking in than what you were capable of doing.

“No, not yet.” You heard her whisper as she talked in her sleep. It was then you got an idea to help both her understand and Eve with her acceptance issue. You used a combination of mist and physic power to enter her mind more literally and input yourself into her dream. You found yourself stalking her in the woods while she ran, very similar to how you caught her the first time but less severe. Now you couldn’t have that if you wanted her to fear you more than Eve, well during this family vacation of sorts anyway. However, unlike in real life you didn’t have to stop at letting her live. You weren’t actually drinking her blood so you could take this a ways further.

“Where do you think you’re going Josi?” you said, again in her dream and you had to use your mist outside her body to keep her from talking or, for what you had planned, screaming in her sleep. She continued to run toward the cabin but no one was there.

“Where does it look like? You aren’t allowed in the main area of the Cabin.” She said as she reached the door that led into the main area where you weren’t allowed, again you were in her dreams so you could go and do anything. To that effect you altered the dream in a way you usually didn’t want but you were going for scaring her. So when she got in she slipped in the dark on something that coated the floor. “Hey, turn on the lights” she demanded and at the eerie silence she went to the light switches herself and switched them on, slipping on whatever fluid covered the floor. As the lights flickered on her eyes widened in horror. “No”.

The fluid she was slipping on was blood and she found all of the family scattered around the place with what was left of their blood dripping out and covering the floor in areas while some hung from the ceiling by their insides in a way that only you could pull off. She slipped and slid over to her immediate family than to Grandpa and Grandma of both sides. Every one of them had one thing in common, other than they were dead, which was fang marks on their necks. You even put the extra added recognition that you were the only one that could do this, which was technically correct as this was a dream and you were the only one that could mess with it. However, as you have explained before, that you couldn’t leave fang marks even if you wanted to but you just left that part out and let her stumble and slip around the blood covered room. Realistically the amount of blood on the ground was over 4 times the amount that they could possess, even if you decided to do it for real and not drink any. But realistic things are rarely supported in dreams.

“This isn’t happening” she said as she pinched herself to wake up but you weren’t allowing it. You needed her to lose her phobia of at least Eve and that meant she needed to take the threat you posed seriously. She slipped and did a face plant into her younger sister’s body, which made her scream in horror that she couldn’t wake up and therefore accepting this as real.

“Well I have a full belly of blood and a room full of dry husks that say otherwise.” You said as you walked in the door that she left open. You added some blood on your clothes and around your mouth for good measure.

“How?... How could you do this?” She asked in horror as you came closer and she got up and started backing away from you, tripping on the odd body or excess of blood but never taking her eyes off you.

“What a foolish question. I did this because I was hungry and I thought it would be fun. Ever sense you all sent Eve away I was waiting for this moment when all of you let down your guard and leave your silver weapons. Without her here you all don’t stand a chance, so thank you Josi, you were the one that drove her away and made all this possible.” You answered as you pressed her against the wall she had backed into. You ripped off her top and grabbed her by the throat while you explored her body a little bit, she was family so you didn’t go too far but just enough to allow her imagination to take over before you came back up to her neck and horror stricken face.

“No, don’t do this. I thought you loved us.” She whimpered.

“Loved your taste? Definitely and I have yet to taste you.” you said back as you held her rather roughly as you kinked her neck like her imagination dictated so her neck was exposes and you stated to lick it sadistically. “Mmm, I just knew it was right to save you for last.” You finally said as you dug into her neck, stimulating pain instead of arousal. Of course you weren’t actually drinking but you played along and let the dream version of you rip her throat out as you dug in and slowly drank her dry. Her eyes still worked as she died in her dream. “Mmm, perfect timing.” Your voice said as she woke with you on top of her.

It was perfect as she was so scared that her body was actually sweating so much it had soaked her sheets and clothes.
