It’s only happened once but if I were to get that low then my fangs would show and I would be passed out until some blood entered my mouth for my body to process. Before my Mom had to manually sink my fangs into a bag of blood before I could drink on my own again. But if you are asking of the danger level to humans… none, I won’t force myself on a human ever and obviously if they do allow it I will not drink them dry, even with them begging me to do it.” You answered.

“Caleb… that’s your name isn’t it?” Zero spat, still very hostile and not liking you at all and didn’t even bother waiting for your nod before continuing. “If another Vampire at the school were to attack a human, what would you do?” he asked.

“Probably knock them out. I’m not too into the whole killing thing yet, I’m only a year and half old vampire and turning 14 in general so too young for all that. But if I felt I could do something about it, regardless who or why I would try to make sure both were safe. Well unless…” you answered.

“Unless what?!” Zero shot back and the others following your answer intently.

“Well unless there was a legitimate reason agreed to by the human or what I think are good moral humans. Like when my family took me up in my first year to train. Basically they had me work hard during the day and we hunted each other at night. I got to feed on the ones I caught, wither they wanted to or not, and they got to go all out in killing me. Since I wouldn’t drink them dry and I can’t die it was fun, but potentially scary for the human being drunk from. If there was a similar situation here then… I guess I would have to trust the people I know that support it.” You answered.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: More questions.

choices: Meeting the rest of the Night Class.
Night class students don't notice you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Let me get this straight. Your family, your human family, let you hunt and feed on them?” Kaname asked in a concerned tone.

“Yes… well maybe not. The whole point was to train me in being a Vampire and them defending against Vampires. Plus they were having some acceptance issues that my Grandparents thought needed to be fixed. So each day I would get a free meal and a different one just so they could see that my feeding wasn’t necessarily bad if controlled by both sides. The hunting part was at night so both of us learned and that was the unwilling times. But I have never killed anyone or turned them, but I physically can’t do the last one so.” You answered.

“Well then, all that is left is to appoint you to the night class and give you your dorm clothes. I am happy that we have yet another Vampire here that agrees with my ideas of Vampires and Humans living together in peace.” Headmaster Cross said as he set a bag of clothes and stuff for you with another set to get changed into before you left. You went into the bathroom and changed then came out in your new white uniform. You quickly memorized it’s structure and incorporated it so you could mist with it and have it self clean.

“This way.” Kaname said after a round of thank you and a scowl/glare from Zero, as well as after the sun was out of the way. “I sense you have another question.”

“Boy that must be what it feels like when I say it. Anyway, yes I do. I notice that most of you are just letting out your normal attractants. I assume that most can’t control it but what is the limit in my case?” you asked.

“What do you mean?” he asked.

“Well we Vampires have scents that attract…prey I guess. I can control mine and limit it. Usually I have it off so humans don’t notice me but the way Yuuki was falling all over you it seems like it is less of a concern. However my normal scent projection could make all the humans slaves if I wished. So what is an acceptable level?” You explained and asked.

“Well why don’t you release a little bit and I’ll tell you when you smell right. Then it will be up to you.” he suggested and you nodded then started releasing it. “Ok there would be sufficient.”

“But if it is the same to you all I think I’ll keep it as low as I can. It was just good to know what was normal.” You stated.

“Very well, is that what you must do to live among humans?” he asked, referring to your family.

“Yeah, I don’t know if it makes sense to you but I can’t stand it when they treat me differently. When I have my scent out they’ll do whatever I want them to do in hopes of me drinking them dry. I want to be around my family, not some love drunk mind slaves. Does that sound stupid to you?” you asked.

“No, it is very noble of you. But listen, about myself. You’ll need to start referring to me properly. I will allow it to slide a few times but as a pure blood it is only proper. Please address me as ‘Lord Kuran’, understood?” Kaname asked.

“Yes, I’ll do my best… Lord Kuran. I’m sorry if I was too formal with you. I didn’t realize you were so high in this world.” You apologized.

“It is quite alright, I am not a tyrant by any means but I do require respect.” He said as the both of you walked toward your new temporary home while in this world. It wouldn’t be so bad and things were currently going very well so your spirits were up, even if that Zero guy still wasn’t liking you very much.

“Now I sense you have a question for me.” You stated as you noticed him deep in thought and glancing at you.

“How powerful are you, really?” he asked. He must’ve sensed your power as you had his. But in his case he would only be able to sense that yours was higher, not like you who had a level to relate to his for a more concrete calculation. You looked down for a moment as you walked.

“What you have to understand about that is that because there is only one Vampire in my world I have all the power they had. I have a sort of genetic knowledge and process with my power. All that is needed beyond that is the age and experience to use the power that the others before me have learned and passed down. When I pass the gift in 2100 years I’ll have added my lot to the mix as well. So I guess what I’m saying is I am not sure how powerful I am.” You paused for a moment as he looked at you and your eyes were down at the ground. “But as I am now and what I know… and what I sense from you. Forgive me for saying so but I am near 10 times what your power level is.”

“It’s ok Caleb, but let’s keep that little bit just between you and me. I don’t need the extra complication of those under me. Is there an ability that you don’t mind sharing with me?” He asked and it got you to look into his eyes with a slight smile then back to where you were going.

“I guess one that I don’t mind people knowing about it I can heal people of almost anything.” You answered.

“You can?” he asked as he seemed to be putting his mind to work on things that it could help.

“Yes, but like I said before. Every ability I have has to be powered by blood. So the more serious the injury the more power I need to heal it. A scratch is barely any trouble at all but healing Cancer or repairing a heart and other vital organs would take considerably more. The most I’ve ever done was regrow a limb for someone, but that took almost all my power. It does have other limits though, I can’t bring people back from the dead and I can’t mess with DNA to a certain degree. Which is why I wouldn’t be able to purge this world’s Vampirism from someone that got caught in the cross fire. I could destroy the initial bite and what was left of the… whatever you call it before it starts changing the person, but after it starts I can’t stop it.” You explained as you tried to give as much information to him as possible.

“That is an amazing gift. I am sure it will be of use around here. I am not going to ask what other gifts you have but I do want to know who blood crazy you get.” He complimented.

“If I’m starving then the craving is very high, but otherwise it doesn’t bother me at all. I can be right next to a vat of fresh blood and not care. Doesn’t mean I don’t know the value but I can more than control myself.” You answered.

“That is refreshing to hear.” He replied as you both got to the door to which you opened if for him with some invisible mist then followed him in.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Moving in with the night class.

choices: Most of them think of you lowly.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“So this is the new one, smells like a human to me.” Said a blonde haired boy from the group as you and Kaname approached and he went over to a seat. You simply looked at him for a while as he said this then glanced at each of them. Each of them were even weaker than Kaname.

“I’m sorry if I seem that way. But that is what I was going for to fit in.” You replied, not sure who you had to impress and who were scum.

“You have no reason to apologize. I believe he is a Vampire and that is all any of you need to know.” Kaname stated that got some of the mumbling in the room to silence. You gave him a light bow of thanks. “Caleb, you may take any room that doesn’t have a scent in it but class starts soon so be on time.”

“Yes Lord Kuran and thank you.” you stated then walked out of the main area, up the stairs , and down until you found one void of any scent then entered. It was a somewhat large room for just a bedroom. You put your bag that the Headmaster gave you down and opened the drapes to allow the sun in. You floated in front of the window as you thought on what to do. Kaname seemed nice but the looks you got from the other Vampires were a little cold, literally and figuratively. You closed the drapes then floated around the room as if laying face up in mid air with your feet propelling you around the room, as you strayed deep in thought. You already missed everyone. You hadn’t even got time to say goodbye to more than your parents and Eve. Eve was a little cross that you would be gone for a whole week, her time, but let you go without too much fuss.

“Whoa, you can fly?” asked a voice that broke your train of thought and you looked over to who it was. The same blonde haired boy from before with an orange haired one next to him. You straightened and slowly stood on the solid ground before answering.

“Yes.” You answered simply.

“I… Lord Kaname asked me to apologize to you but now I see why. I shouldn’t have been so quick to judge and disrespect.” The boy with blonde hair said then straightened to be more formal. “I’m Hanabusa, nice to meet you.”

“I am Akatsuki, it is also good to meet you. Also good that even if you smell halfway delicious that you are one of us.” the orange tinted hair boy said.

“I am Caleb, and it is an honor to meet you as well. I hope I can prove myself.” You responded with a light bow similar to the one you gave Kaname.

“It’s almost time for class and we usually all walk there together.” Akatsuki informed then left with the other with a clear instruction to follow, which you did. They didn’t seem very accommodating, as if you were some unclean thing or something. Not exactly what you were expecting from other Vampires.

“Did you find a suitable room?” Kaname asked as you joined the group. They were all putting on a good face but you could tell that inwardly they were doing it only to respect his decision.

“Yes, it will do just fine.” You answered as respectfully as you could. It was obvious from the actions of the others that he was a big shot in this world and you needed to keep that in mind. Sure you were here to learn but what you were going to learn was still up for debate.

“That is good, now let’s go.” He replied to which the whole group followed him out the door as if they were his private security force with happy faces. Although you were almost pushed to the back. As you went and then was observed but the massing Day Class students they would look at you as if wondering why you were there. Basically it was because you didn’t have the natural beauty they did but was far from unattractive either. They also let their attractants go and you held yours back, you accepted that they couldn’t control it like you could and left it lay where it was. As far as your attraction to the other Vampires, it was minimal at best. To be perfectly honest you had a giant spider at home that you adored and two of the Succubus that were leagues ahead of them, probably because that is what they specialized in as their ‘freak’ designation.

“You better know your place around here.” Whispered one of the female Vampires with pale brown hair. You were just out of the class room when she stopped to tell you this then went on inside. You did as well and the only empty seat that didn’t result in a deathly glare for sitting was in the back top row, furthest from Kaname as he sat. You had started placing invisible glyphs around so you place on here as well so you could teleport you and others around. Since fighting was apparently not allowed you would be able to teleport people away to other spots in exchange for it.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Meeting the rest of the Night Class.

choices: Kaname supports you in your belief, sort of.
Yes, that is what they think.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Just look at his eyes they don’t even glow like a Vampire’s” Hanabusa said as he took a spot right in front of you and looked into your face. You weren’t use to people being so close, strangers specifically. Family and close friends like Kelsey and Eve were ok but definitely not him.

“Why would I want to let my eyes glow? It only gives away my position in the dark to any prey or hunters that I am stalking. Out of habit alone I don’t show them.” you replied, not giving him any satisfaction for squirming. It was evident that the ‘Night Class’ didn’t do a lot of learning but were there merely to follow Kaname’s order or in direct respect of him. There was a few classes but with the heightened intellect in the room the daily learning was done in no more than an hour.

“What do you expect from a low level like him?” asked the one that you heard called Ruka. With a defiante huff Hanabusa moved away.

You sat there flipping through the text books, reading them and committing the text to memory. You were able to learn a lot of the world you were in, including the order of things. Apparently Vampires that use to be human were at the bottom of the social ladder while purebloods like Kaname were at the very top, both in social status and power. They were also one of the only things that could turn a human into a Vampire. It also seemed that sunlight was ok for them while not preferable but other things like religious marks, crests, and magical things effected them more so. They could also easily be killed in multiple ways and stay dead, turning to ash most of the time. You didn’t mind this as you could easily fake your death if you needed. You also learned of a thing called a ‘Level E’ that was void of all morality and almost dead. You prepared yourself for the idea that you might have to kill them as they were mostly dead already. It also explained why both sides were so hostile toward you. Apparently most human turned Vampires turned to Level E, more than enough reason to look down on you.

“You can go hunt now if you wish.” Kaname said as he addressed you before exiting the room. You took that as a sign that it was free time, more or less and nodded before finding a spot that was clear and teleported you to one and your stuff to the desk in your room. Of course you did so after they all left. You didn’t want them to know your abilities yet. You walked around the grounds and amongst the trees, placing glyphs where you thought would be good spots and explored the grounds. So you had a decent knowledge where you were. After that you stalked a fox for a while then as you were about to take it a rustle made it run away.

“What are you doing?” came a voice from Zero as he came out from the brush and trees.

“I was about to have dinner but you scared it away. Kaname said it was an ok time to hunt.” You answered as you straightened and faced him.

“Hunting what?” he demanded from you, looking to see if a human was near that he thought you would feed on.

“Well it was a fox but it ran off. Well if you’re going to be scaring everything off tonight then I might as well just go back to my dorm so I …” you started but your head snapped to a scent of fresh human blood in the air to which you vanished from his sight and raced over to find Hanabusa intimidating Yuuki, drawing a little blood from her hand with his fang. You were able to grab his arm in a way that allowed you to squeeze and force him to let go. “I thought it was forbidden to drink a human’s blood, especially if they didn’t want you to do it.” You said as you tightened your grip enough to cause discomfort to him.

“Ow, let go. How dare you…” he tried saying as your grip increased to his speech.

“Dare me what? I wasn’t the one drinking her blood. I can’t stand it when the strong bully the weak just because they can.” You said, glaring at him as your grip tightened even more and he was forced to his knees.

“You can let go now Caleb.” Came Kaname’s voice to which you did so immediately and Hanabusa slunk back with Zero now there and Kaname making his entrance as well. You then walked over to Yuuki to which she pointed a rod at you and Zero his gun.

“Can I see your hand? Please?” you asked in a calm voice. She hesitated but held it out to you. You slowly extended a finger and touched it, not thinking that grabbing it would be a good idea. With the touch you healed her scratch and bite like nothing was wrong in the first place then bowed to Kaname and vanished, teleporting to your dorm room before they could recover enough to bombard you with questions. You didn’t do anything that couldn’t be defended by Kaname so you left it to him. Besides you didn’t feel like being in the middle of such hostility. Perhaps that was one of the lessons you were to learn. However it just reminded you of how your family first reacted. You floated around for a while, trying and failing not to think about it but soon after someone was knocking your closed door. You opened it from your position as and looked to see who entered. It was the same three people from before. Akatsuki was there but didn’t do anything but the three came into the room to which you turned to look out the window from your floating and almost relaxed position.

“Is that really what Vampires are supposed to be like? I have been raised but Humans so I can’t really say what SHOULD be acceptable behavior. I was always taught that the strong defend the weak.” You asked as you gazed out the window, waiting for an answer. It was a question that was bothering you. What if this Vampire training left you feeling that Vampires should be above humans and should be served by them. The arrogance that the Vampire clan back home always had that you detested.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Most of them think of you lowly.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You had taken the cure from the others that you could dress down a little while in private and on free time, more or less. So you wore you favorite Black sleeveless and shorts with your boot like shoes like you did when relaxing at home. Eventually you dropped down to your feet and turned to them, waiting for their answer.

“We are superior to humans but we have our own beliefs in where we should be in relation to them. Some think they are merely cattle and no more. Some think them as slaves that should serve their betters, being them of course. I on the other hand think they should be treated as people. So you are meant to be what you choose to be.” Kaname answered, a little uneasy about what he had so far witnessed.

“I assume that isn’t a view shared by many.” You stated, looking at the two beside him as examples.

“We apologize, we were not acting like we should.” Hanabusa said with a bow to you, probably because Kaname was there and the other near him followed suit.

“Thank you for the thought. On my end I also acted to rashly. I assumed that you were drinking from her without permission, without asking. Even if that was the case I should’ve asked before acting. I just haven’t been around other Vampires before.” You replied back. “But…”

“Is there something else?” Kaname asked and the other two straightened to listen.

“I mean no offense by this Lord Kuran. However I still feel a very strong attachment to humans and particularly the ones that are being picked on by someone or something stronger than they are. I can’t simply stand by when I smell blood and I see someone suffering in anyway, like when someone is being fed on unwillingly. I’ve never taken a life before but if it were to come down to a choice between a Vampire’s hunger and a human’s survival, I would choose the human and protect them to the expense of any that are attacking.” You replied and to this you let your power increase and your eyes glow like what they were referring to before. That only happened when you were allowing your full Vampire side to emerge and that was only when you were readying for a large use of your power. The effects usually allowed your mist to partially come out and control things around you like elements and even gravity, making the whole area very heavy. One thing that also came out in this and you didn’t have control over was your fangs. They came out because your whole body was in full Vampire state and not hiding anything. But as quickly as you entered this state you ended it as well.

“What… was… that…?” asked Akatsuki as he got up. The only one that could remain on his feet was Kaname, the other two had fallen to their hands and knees.

“A small fraction of what I can do so any doubt in your mind is cleared. I am a Vampire and not a weak or pathetic one as you seem to think.” You answered, they still were breathing heavily as they recovered. You left your eyes glow their blood red color as they looked into them. “I apologize if I was too forward Lord Kuran.”

“Not at all, it was rather informative and I appreciate your stand and your previous protection of Yuuki, the one that I hold dear.” He answered to your apology then had to settle the others as they came in response to the power they felt. All they could do was gaze at you with your eyes still glowing until they were ushered from the room.

You then went back to gazing out the window as dawn broke and the sun’s light crept over the trees in a beautiful fashion. You wondered how things would play out and hoped it was better than that encounter. But knowing that it was a type of training you doubted it.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Kaname supports you in your belief, sort of.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Another day and another class. You were more accepted into their ranks as a legitimate Vampire of worth after your little display. You also stopped a few of them from pursuing a blood scent that ended at a human, well inside the campus anyway. As it seemed to be a high mode of conflict, you placed an invisible glyph on Yuuki so you could teleport to her without too much trouble. However, even with their acknowledgement of you, the other Vampires and those that knew about such things still weren’t really what one would call friendly to you accept Yuuki and Kaname, both for different reasons. Yuuki trusted you ever sense you healed her hand rather than drink from it, further protection over time had also solidified her stance. Kaname was the only one in the Vampires that you slightly connected with. Maybe it was because you had help protect Yuuki a few times or perhaps that you were so far ahead of him in power (that didn’t happen a lot). But either way he highly respected you and made it known as much.

Not long after class started and unofficially ended as the instruction part was over a scent hit you. Yuuki’s blood was well recognized in your senses and every time it hit the air you located her via your glyph and sensed the area around from the point. Sometimes it was just her scraping herself on a branch when out on patrol or something but it had become a habit. However when you checked this time you sensed Zero in immediate contact with her and almost sinking his fangs into her. Both you and Kaname had been waiting for him to make a move while the others just knew it might happen.

With that identified and no one else to help her in the area you teleported to them and was able to form a sword out of your blood. This was an ability you picked up in your free time. You could use your body manipulation and mist to solidify blood in weapons for multiple purposes. Before either of them could react to your sudden presence you sliced at pressure points in his arms that made them let her go and fling to the sides and his head real back. You then grabbed Yuuki and within a second had spit Saliva needles big enough to impale his limbs to the wall behind him while retreating Yuuki to the top of the stairs where the 3 of you were. Without missing a step and letting her balance herself you thrust your blood made blade into his chest, easily slicing through his shirt and entering his body. The whole action was faster than a normal human could follow but just fast enough for the approaching Kaname and Headmaster Cross to see.

“NO! Don’t kill him!” Yuuki exclaimed when she finally caught up with and comprehended what was going on. If you were really going to kill him it would’ve been done by now. No, you saw the bloodlust in his eyes and while your blood wasn’t very tasty to them it was more than enough to bring him fully out of that state, as if he had just drank a dozen humans dry. Your blood had a lot of power in it so it wasn’t surprising that it was capable but Yuuki and the others didn’t see that. All they saw was you impaling a pinned Zero with a sword blade made of blood against the wall he was pinned to. Yuuki was to shocked to say more than that while the other two that approached simply watched, preparing to deal with you if you had killed him or render thanks if you were doing otherwise.

They saw what you were doing when Zero’s blood lusted eyes came down and he came back to himself oddly more disgusted with himself than freaked out of the sword that you were now pulling from his chest. You quickly dislodged the blade from him and most were surprised to find no wound. You pulled the blood from the instrument in your hands back into your body then stumbled back onto the stairs, sitting down to cope with the loss of your blood that you had given him.

“What did you do to me?” asked Zero as he was still pinned but looked down, still expecting to see a gaping hole in his chest or perhaps hoping that was the case.

“I told you before. I am not ready to take a life yet. I merely stabbed my blood into your organs to use instead of continuing to bloodlust like you were doing. You know this would’ve been a lot easier if you would’ve just asked.” You answered and informed as you pulled yourself to your feet, your body now use to the loss of blood. You didn’t lose a lot but enough to need to hunt.

“How did you get here so fast, faster than I?” Kaname asked as he walked up the stairs.

“Well, I hope you don’t mind but I put a glyph on Yuuki. It is nothing harmful, more like an invisible tattoo without ink. The only function is to allow me to track her and teleport to her position if I need to. I apologize if I overstepped my bounds.” You answered, bracing yourself on the rail but bowing a little as he came up to tend to Yuuki who was in some shock and not really hearing you.

“No need for that Caleb. You may have saved her life. If it were anyone else I would have you gutted.” He replied then turned to Zero. “Did her blood taste good? Did you enjoy the thought of drinking from her?” he asked then carried her off and leaving the guilt ridden Zero with you and the Headmaster. He did nod another thank you to you before leaving your sight.

“Caleb, can you let him down now?” the Headmaster asked as the two of you talked on the top of the stairs.

“Oh, yeah. Don’t worry, no residual damage to the wall or Zero.” You said and quickly dissolved the needles into mist, healing what they punctured as they left, leaving no evidence of their presence and allowing Zero to fall to his feet. However in his state he crumbled to his knees. “With your permission Headmaster, I would like to go hunt. I don’t think I am the one he wants to see right now.” You asked as you both looked at the almost teary Zero.

“Perhaps you’re right, at least for now. Go ahead and use the rest of the night to hunt. It is a good feeling that I don’t have to say to leave humans out of your hunt.” He answered.

“Yet you said it anyway. Thanks for the compliment though.” You said then vanished, teleporting into the woods and starting a hunt for some of the animals you hadn’t drunk from lately. Yuuki had caught you about to feed on a rabbit once and asked you not to kill the ‘poor little bunny’ as she called it. You complied and had to catch 3 others to make up for not finishing them but as a favor to her you didn’t drink any of the animals dry either. It was definitely harder than just hunting but then again so was not hunting humans. Humans that didn’t know better were supremely easier to hunt. Heck even humans that half knew what they were doing weren’t much of a challenge if you really wanted to them. The biggest problem you had was when people like the other vampires would scare some prey off before you could enthrall it. But for now you just concentrated on finding something big enough to satiate you low power level. If you were lucky you would get a bear of deer, but lately with all the Vampires around you would be lucky to get something dog sized.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: More problems.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Mornings were different for you than the rest of the Vampires. Normally mornings for them were when they would be heading or already in bed. You on the other hand didn’t need the sleep and didn’t want to get in the habit of doing so when you would otherwise have to be up at home. So you worked out behind the dorm in the mornings. You practiced some martial arts that you had been trying after wrestling was over at school the past year. With nothing better to do you would raise you power level a little and if you were lucky got a sweat going. You felt good if you had a reason to wash off outside before coming in.

This morning you were slightly distracted by the previous night’s activities. You got a rare deer like animal to replenish from but it was still heavily on your mind so you were more or less just going through the motions as you worked out in your comfortable shorts and sleeveless shirt. Eventually you hit a stopping point and washed off at a small water spicket. You kept your short on for modesty but usually it was private enough to wash off without a shirt or shoes. In this case, about halfway into your usually quiet and secluded wash off you heard a gasp. With a sigh you knew you would have to cut your much deserved wash off to deal with whomever was behind you. You knew that no one outside the Vampire information circle could get into the night dorm or where you were so you stood from where you had to kneel to get you little slice of delight. With a shake the residual water that wasn’t in your hair shot off and you put your shirt back on then turned to see who it was.

“I know you’re there.” You said to the figure behind the tree near the entrance to the dorm. A squeak could be heard and you saw Kaname glance into the spot you were in from a window as Yuuki came out of her hiding spot. You were still steaming from the lack of cooling off and the water that was on your skin, under your clothes and on the exposed skin with your hair in its natural spiked position.

“So you really do like the sunlight.” She said, trying to break the uncomfortable silence as you looked for her to start.

“Besides all out hunts and raids it is the only time I can get a good workout. Plus being human for so long, I can’t really get use to the whole staying inside all day thing. I enjoy the feel of the sun on my skin, even if it is a little bright out here to be completely comfortable.” You answered as you stood there with your shoes in your hand. Your muscles were still tensed and strained from the work out you did and caught her eye. By this time Kaname had also picked up on your clueless nature with women, otherwise he would be having a talk with you every time Yuuki looked at you the wrong way.

“Do you always steam like that?” she asked as she looked at you.

“No, it is the effect of the water cooling my body down. Usually I would be under that spicket for another 10 minutes to cool off but I didn’t think that would be indecent with you watching.” You answered.

“Why do you feel different than you usually do?”she asked as she felt a strange draw toward you that she usually didn’t feel.

“My apologizes.” You said then turned your vampire abilities down again. “I don’t like people treating me different, mainly humans, so I seal my Vampire abilities from those around. I usually let them go a little when I train so I can get more of a workout. My attractant can be quite potent, again I apologize Yuuki.”

“Oh no, it’s my fault for coming back unannounced.” She assured that got you to feel a little better about it. “I just wanted to thank you for what you did, and didn’t do last night.”

“It was no trouble at all. But thanks for coming out to say so. I usually don’t get a lot of notice for what I do.” You answered with in turn brought any anxiety out of her like she had done for you earlier. “I hope it was ok to put my glyph on you. I didn’t mean to intrude, I just meant to help. You seem to find the most trouble so…”

“…No, that was ok, really it’s fine. I suppose I don’t mind as long as you aren’t spying on me in the shower or something.” She stated, part of it as a joke.

“Don’t worry, it doesn’t work like that. It is just a beacon that I can teleport to if necessary.” You returned with a smile to her slight joke and she smiled that she had succeeded and to your information on the matter.

“Oh shoot! I got to get to class.” She said as she heard the bell ring. You held out your hand to her. She looked at it then took it to which you teleported her with you outside her next class but remained in mist form so the people coming wouldn’t accidentally see you. “If you can hear me, thanks again.” She said then headed into class and you back to where you had just been. You then picked up your shoes and headed inside.

“Have fun?” Kaname asked as you made your way to your room.

“More or less, I assume it was you who let her back there?” you asked to which he nodded. “Thanks, I needed a little bit of Yuuki magic to lift my head a little. She is rather good at that.”

“You’re welcome, think of it as my way of thanking you as well for keeping her safe and untainted.” He said then headed off and you bowing to his leave.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Yuuki comes to thank you.

choices: Level E encounter and your first kill.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Your encounter with Zero made him slightly respect you more but not enough to address for you anything. He still had a natural bias against all vampires, despite him being one now. However there was one thing that worked your nerve with him. After a few instances Yuuki had offered to let him drink her blood. You apologized to Kaname for this but as was your standard you couldn’t do anything if she asked for it. He understood and it was now something between Zero and him. You still checked it out whenever her blood hit the air and healed the fang marks so she didn’t have to wear the bandages anymore. But that wasn’t your current problem. There was a new teacher that also happened to be a Vampire Hunter. Toga Yagari was apparently the top ranked Vampire Hunter in whatever organization he was with. He did seem more competent then most people you were used to dealing with that just pretended to be tough. However he did have his side that was confrontational.

“But before I go any further.” Yagari said and looked up at your class almost in defiance, egging all of you on to attack if you dared. “Hello Vampires.”

Being the ethics teacher was a little biased but he still taught it well enough for you to learn some things from it. A lot of what he said hit nerves in the room, most of them being straight at ‘Kaname Kuran’ as he called him every time he referred to him and even put in a possible assassination threat. However when his gaze got to you, you didn’t react like a traditional Vampire would. In this case the Vampires didn’t mind your strange behavior as it seemed to push the hunter’s buttons for not being able to mentally effect you like the others.

You couldn’t figure out if this human had a death wish or he was looking for an excuse to fight the Vampires he was teaching. A definitely strange teaching strategy but there was a part that you didn’t mind about his attitude. He didn’t treat you any different or rather he didn’t hide what he was thinking. Most people held at least a little bit back so not to completely offend you or the other Vampires. The man didn’t hold anything back and spoke like anyone would who had no fear of you. You kind of liked it, arrogant as it was it kept it a welcomed change from the usual Vampire teacher you had. Plus he kind of reminded you of your uncle Jim.

“Class dismissed.” He ended and started walking out but stopped to deal with a dagger that was thrown his way. But you dealt with it first a well placed saliva needle, pinning the dagger to the desk as it passed it rather than implanting into the book Yagari was holding to shield himself. He had enough experience to trace the trajectory back to you. “Much appreciated.” You finished with a tip of his hat to which you teleported away as class was dismissed.

You wandered in the woods for a little bit. You weren’t really hungry but it was a routine and you kept to it. You crept up to a deer then just enthralled it enough to lay beside you as you sat against a tree, looking into the woods and petting him. His fur wasn’t even close to Eve’s but you caught yourself petting animals before or after you fed on them in memory of her and anticipation of eventually seeing her again. You were starting to miss her a lot more than you thought you would. Plus the deer had antlers, large ones, but you just accepted it for the moment until a twig snapped and a rifle wielding Yagari appeared. You looked over at him then whistled a little to tell the deer to go off and be on its way. It did so to which you stood and turned to the Vampire hunter.

“I don’t like the feel of you.” he said as he had his gun trained on you. You could tell when you moved more into the open that he could more than hit you with a shot under normal circumstances. He didn’t even need to have it in normal firing position to establish a deadly amount accuracy. “You aren’t like the other Vampires, what the hell are you?”

“I’m a Vampire sir. If you want the specifics I suggest you ask the Headmaster. I am frankly too tired of repeating it over and over again. I don’t think I’ve done anything that warrants this behavior though… unless I did something without knowing it was a problem, did I?” you asked in a quizzical tone. It took a moment but he lowered his gun but still had it pointed in your direction.

“No, you haven’t. I just don’t like a Vampire I don’t understand. Stay in line or I’ll have to put you down. I have no time to discuss wither an attack is warranted. If you do something questionable I won’t wait to understand, I’ll just kill you.” you stated.

“Fair enough.” You answered. “Is that all Mr. Tagari?”

“Being so formal isn’t like a vampire either.” He answered.

“Well I’ve only been a Vampire for almost 2 years and still have my human family. So you can blame them for raising me to respect my elders. If it bothers you too much than I apologize but I can’t just appeal to your definition of what Vampires are like.” You replied.

“Never met a Vampire that apologizes to a Vampire Hunter either” he said. You felt like doing something to get him to shoot you. You had already figured out that Zero’s gun did nothing to you and wondered about this guy’s gun. However his little slice of peace was all that was keeping him from going into fight mode so you left it be for the moment. Besides, you didn’t need your new teacher against you right away. You had a feeling that it was better to have him on your side than not. “But I suppose for intercepting the dagger in class you deserve a little faith, but not much. Understand Vampire?”

“Yes sir.” You answered with a light bow to which he smirked a bit, obviously hadn’t been treated as such by Vampires too often. He turned and holstered his rifle on his back to which you vanished by the time he took a second look. Why was it that every time you wanted a little rest you were interrupted more times than not?
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: A new teacher.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Don’t worry, it I’ll try to be gentle.” A Vampire said as he broke from the floor beneath Yuuki to grab her. You had followed her after she went running after Zero. You had smelled trouble but wasn’t sure why. Now you were certain why. You had yet to encounter a Level E before. An old fossil of a Vampire came to the dorm but Kaname asked you to stay out of it. Showing you to the leader of the Senate of Vampires would only complicate things. You agreed, especially because you felt him as he entered the dorm and you thought he was far too arrogant for your taste.

“So this is a Level E.” you said as you teleported next to Yuuki and tapped the grip it had on Yuuki’s ankle with your foot, causing him to let go and her to leap up, grabbing her rod and face the impending Vampire. You were in you casual attire with your hands in your short pockets.

“Another meal? Another meal!!!” it screeched as it leapt from the floor and came toward you as you shut your eyes to blink. Too bad for him that it didn’t lower your guard at all. All it took as a few Salvia needles to sent him into a wall and pin him there with his arms and legs stretched apart with at least 10 needles in each, along the length of the limbs and into points to keep him from getting loose. To the observer it appeared you had made your mouth into a silent machine gun with them shooting out just as fast. It hissed and still tried to get at you from its position.

“Thank you Caleb.” Yuuki said as Zero came into the picture with Senri and Seiren coming from the other side with you and the needled Vampire finally shutting up with the situation becoming clear.

“You’re just lucky that I was board enough to play tag along.” You joked and she frowned in a comical sense then ended in a slight smile as the others came into the mix. “So what are we suppose to do with him now?”

“Both sides look like we’ve been sent on the same hunt.” Senri said in an almost monotone voice. To this Seiren readied a blood made whip and Zero his gun.

“Do we have to kill him?” you asked.

“Level E’s have lost all their reason and humanity. They are just a mindless feeding machine with no loyalty. So yes, he must die to stop his rampage and save whatever may be left of his doubtful level of humanity. In most cases no humanity or sense are left, like a Zombie.” Zero answered, taking aim with his gun. He still didn’t really like you but he did respect you enough and knew that you wouldn’t allow someone to kill another unless there was a hell of a good reason. So explaining it to you was the only real way to let this one die. You got the concept and saw that both sides wanted the kill.

“Then sense I stopped it I guess I should finish it. Not really my style though.” You stated and shot on last needle into the Level E’s head and turning it to ash. You had other ways of doing so but you didn’t want to show all your tricks and the Saliva Needle was one they all knew you had, along with your teleportation and strength/speed. “Now I’m a killer.”

“It needed to be done, you didn’t have a choice. It saved both him and all his future victims.” Yuuki said in an attempt to comfort you. The others weren’t expecting you to have a problem with it. You were so insistent on protecting humans to almost any cost that they didn’t think you would have a problem killing the most Evil thing that most would ever see in that world.

“Doesn’t make it feel any better.” You said in thought then shook your head to wipe it from your mind. “Any of you need a ride back?” you asked to which they accepted your offer and you teleported the group back to the academy.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Level E encounter and your first kill.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Oh, this is going to be fun!” said a voice from the front of class one evening. You weren’t out of your seat as you were ready for class to start, so you just looked up at her and observed the new girl. She was a Night Class uniform and if she was there that meant she was a new student. You would wait until she introduced herself but that was done by Kaname as she almost immediately started pushing internal warning and comfort buttons, jumping and gliding from place to place while doing so, doting on Kaname with a little extra brown nosing. You had the fleeting suspicion that she was merely acting as such though. You didn’t even need to read her mind to know that the mind inside the body wasn’t a match and sensed two minds inside, one possessing the other but the first not fighting it so you left it alone. You soon learned her name, or at least the name of the body that both were using, Maria.

“Oh don’t you smell scrumptious.” She said as she landed on the desktop in front of you, if you were a pervert it would’ve been easy to look up her skirt from your sitting position and her squatting and staring one.

“If you say so. Thanks for the compliment… I guess.” You said as you gazed into her eyes without flinching in the slightest.

“He’s a Vampire to.” Senri said in his impassive tone said from his position. The way he said in made a few of them chuckle a little. You however didn’t waver as you looked into her eyes, retrieving information from her such as what type of person was in there on top of this presumed Maria. She had the feeling that you got when you spoke with Kaname. It either meant she was overly ignorant or a pureblood.

“He is, then why does he smell like a tasty human?” Maria asked as she jumped one desk back and looked to the others in an innocent mask of emotions.

“Humans aren’t allowed in the Night Class.” Mr. Yagari stated as he came in. “Get to your seats, this is a class room not a amusement park.” He looked at Maria a little longer than was necessary for his teacher act but then moved on as soon as everyone did as he said. Although you saw Maria look back and up to you a few times, trying to get a reaction but when it failed she stopped.

You teleported away after class, not to keen on her impulsive and confrontational attitude, plus, you would only have a problem with her if she attacked a human at the school. Vampires could ask for you help but were usually too proud to do so and they were less helpless then humans were. You were in the at the end of a animal meal and letting it go off when she finally caught up with you. You turned to her midway through retracting your fangs and licking the residual blood off.

“How disgusting, you drink from animals instead of humans.” She stated in an almost arrogant attitude.

“Yes well it is better than nothing. I’ve yet to meet a human here that would allow me to feed on them of their own free will. Yuuki is the only one that might and she already satiates Zero’s hunger.” You replied.

“They are here for us to enjoy.” She retorted in a almost shy sense but still had that underlining arrogance that you detested.

“Well not around here they aren’t. I’m not about to debate the philosophy of feeding on willing and unwilling humans with you as it would be a colossal waste of time. However I am one of the people that protect the humans around here. I would advise you not feeding on them or trying to.” You said back, the last part more serious in an obvious warning.

“You think you could stop me huh?” she teased.

“You don’t want to test it Miss. Hio.” You said and her eyes narrowed at the named you used.

“What did you call me?” she asked, suddenly more serious.

“I did my homework and the only one that could posses someone and would as you have done with your personality was someone named; Shizuka Hio, a Pure Blood. Wasn’t hard after that to figure who you were. I guess with your point of view you should know that I don’t really care what you are, my warning still stands. Please don’t force me to do anything against you. If you are after a Vampire then you can go about your business. Most of the time they are too pride filled to ask for my help. But if you threaten a human while here, I don’t care if you are a Pure Blood, I’ll choose the human over you without hesitation.” You answered her eyes narrowing at your words.

“Those are dangerous words for such a low level Vampire to be saying to a Pure Blood.” she said with a glare at you.

“Take them as you will. You’ve been warned and now I can protect the humans without being morally conflicted in roughing you up a little if necessary. Other than that…” you said then changed postures and bowed like you did to Kaname. “… it was an honor to meet you and I will not spread your information unless Lord Kuran asked me to. Have a good night Lady Hio.” You said then vanished, teleporting to your dorm room.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: New girl.

choices: He talks to you with the group when Zero gets back.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You watched things progress to a great degree, making sure none of the humans got in the middle of the Vampire’s growing business. You even stayed out of it when Ms. Hio told Yuuki that she would help Zero if she offered herself to her or Kaname Kuran’s corpse. Ms. Hio was also watching you when she could. She watched intently as you trained in the day and your other activities. You could feel her eyes and as such you served as a perfect little distraction for Kaname. He only looked at you once to confirm both of you were on the same page and that was all you needed. The Ball was not much for you because your attractant was always down and no one even noticed you were there watching. However when Yuuki ran from the building and Zero after her you appeared next to Kaname.

“You want me to protect her? She won’t need it with Zero there.” You asked after he was alone.

“No, as much as I wish Zero’s end in his participation with Yuuki, it is necessary for him to face this and deal with it. I can trust him in that much at least.” Kaname answered, obviously not ok with her being in danger as more glass shattered behind him in due to no small part to his temper and ability. “However you did do well in distracting her for me without me having to tell you anything, I thank you for that.”

“It was her own arrogance that led to this. I did nothing more than I usually do, but I’ll take the compliment while I can get it.” You answered. “I would like to speak with you about something.”

“Does it have to be at this moment?” Kaname asked as he was looking to get moving for something.

“It can be on the way.” You answered as you walked with him. “Do you trust me Lord Kuran?”

“Yes.” Came a simple answer as you two walked.

“What about the others?” you asked.

“We all trust you Caleb, or you wouldn’t be afforded the privilege of staying here among us.” he answered then glanced over at you. “What is this all about?”

“I just don’t feel very trusted. I can clearly help in many instances. I understand that sometimes you shelter me as you know I don’t like killing people and I appreciate it, such as what you are about to do. I don’t know what you are going to do but you have that death feeling around you. But I can’t understand why in other instances I am excluded.” You replied, parts of the statement turned Kaname toward you but as you kept walking so did he. In the end he was content and ready to answer, more or less.

“While we trust you we do not want to get you involved in our affairs. It is our problems not yours.” He stated in a formal matter.

“With all due respect Lord Kuran that is full of crap.” You retorted and he was slightly put off by your forwardness. “I am already part of it until I take my leave. You can’t say you are looking out for my life because I can’t die. The only thing you accomplish by that is distancing me from what I am trying so hard to achieve.”

“And what is that?” he asked.

“Friends and family. I learned the moment I knew my life was changed that race and species don’t determine a family. I am trying so hard to connect with you as you seem to be the only, Pure Blood, that is halfway decent. I like all of you… minus Ms. Hio and that old fossil that visited the other day. But when you all push me away and not allow me to help I feel… unwanted, not trusted, and a burden to those I wish to help.” You answered. Kaname looked down a moment and was struggling to remain focused and also to think on your situation.

“Caleb, I will think on this later on tonight and later. If you will wait I will answer you but the task I am currently going to needs my full attention as does your matter. Allow me to finish this first?” he asked.

“Very well, I wish you well Lord Kuran.” You said then stopped and let him continue on to his objective. You stood there for a long while then teleported back to your dorm and laid in the air above your bed still thinking about it.

It was a constant pang on your mind. You were suppose to be learning from the other Vampires but in the end they kept you at an arm’s distance and never included you in anything. In a way you did it to yourself as you put a high emphasis on humans and such but you had got the feeling that they appreciated it, especially Kaname when it came to your protection of Yuuki. However even her wouldn’t ask you to heal her like you offered. You lay there awaiting whatever Kaname was up to, to end and he would address your concerns. It didn’t help that you were well rested and couldn’t just sleep until morning so you just floated there and dwelled.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Death of a Pure Blood.

choices: You find your answer after a while.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Caleb.” Called Kaname one day in class. It had been a while since that night and you had sensed one Ms. Hio expire and Kaname grow stronger. You could also smell his blood in Zero’s veins. To this effect you had let it slide but Zero had joined the class this time and the others, who had significantly increased in number, were now silent as he addressed you. The teacher was either late of this was now a private session and the presence of Zero almost confirmed that, as scorned as he may be by the others.

“Yes Lord Kuran.” You replied as you stood out of respect. But you were hoping he was about to answer your question to him.

“I have shared your thoughts with the others and thought about it a great deal. I have now figured out the main reason why we don’t depend on you for tasks.” He said and your attention grew with rasp focus. “You won’t kill.” He said simply.

“I don’t understand.” You answered as you had always thought that was a good quality.

“As noble as our company is we are above humans and at odds with others that think as both you and I hate. However we all know that even if you were facing down a level E you would try to find a way to save the person that is already lost. You told me that you were sent here to learn from Vampires and this is what you might be needing to learn. Vampires must be able to kill without hesitation although the reason for killing must be found as well. But once that reason is reached the Vampire must not falter.” Kaname answered you as the others looked on in agreement.

“So I can’t be a proper Vampire as long as I don’t kill?” you asked in disbelief.

“As a race you are no doubt a proper Vampire but your actions as a race point toward your human mindset. You are still human at heart and until you learn this we can’t give you more than what we think you can handle. Which is why I am charging you with the human’s safe keeping at this academy. Hopefully in your completion of your task you will find your reason for killing.” He ordered.

“My reason? What reason could I possibly have?” you asked.

“That is up to you. Most of the arrogant ones we both hate do so out of just that, arrogance, believing themselves better then all else. Some think that all life under them should be taken for their pleasure. Some do so to serve, some to have fun, and some to protect. You need to find your reason and make it yours and part of who you are. However when the time arises you should feel no ill feelings about carrying the sentence of death out. Do you understand?” Kaname asked.

“Yes, Lord Kuran. I’ll protect the humans at this school and in so doing find my answer.” You replied after a long thought. “Does that mean I should leave the protection of you and the other Vampires to you?”

“Yes, you are only responsible for the humans.” Kaname answered to which you bowed and Zero exited with that being decided. One thing that was in his mind. Even if he didn’t like Vampires, despite him being one himself, he had grown accustomed to you protecting the humans already and knew that this only solidified things.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: He talks to you with the group when Zero gets b...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Enough!” you boomed finally as you looked down from a flight position above Rido on the roof. As per Kaname’s instruction you had been protecting the humans but had yet to find a true reason to kill, until now. You had watched this Rido Vampire since he possessed Senri’s body and was at a loss at how someone could be that emotionless about taking so much life, even the innocent lives of his family and their children. You just didn’t understand but from that understanding you found your reason and now floated above the scene as he ordered his… followers and such to attack and feed on your Vampire friends while he was preparing to feed on Yuki, use to be Cross but now Kuran.

“Ah, you finally arrived you pitiful excuse for a Vampire.” Rido stated and the others laughed as they continued to do as they willed.

“I said enough.” Your voice was ominous as your power spiked and the effects from it doing so were in full swing. Howling winds that blew at your violently while the elements around you took effect. Gravity increased while winds blew at the Vampires as you got closer. Lightning was branching from you while your eyes glowed and your body looked to be radiating heat, as small flames and static were just barely rolling over your skin. With your touch down on the roof all the hostile vampires that were attempting to feed on your friends, with the exception of Rido, were turned to ash. You had been taught Kaname’s trick and didn’t mind using it as it cost lest then running around and slicing their heads off.

“You… you killed them.” Hanabusa said. “Does that mean you have found your reason to kill?”

“Yes. I have chosen that I will only kill those who take life themselves. Any that take life one way or another are legitimate targets but my personal moral choice will be to those that do so to me, mine, and to those who have yet to take a life. Such as this piece of garbage.” You answered then glared at Rido as he held Yuki.

“You’re so useless. You can’t do anything while I have this one can…” he started until a gunshot was heard and he was forced to let go by a bullet from behind. This allowed Yuki to use her rod and escape and use it to bring Zero under control.

“You think I’m a fool?” you bellowed in your current ominous voice, void of its regular kindness and passive vigor. Instead the area around you seemed to shake and light up with energy, both dark and light as they swirled around within a 200 yard radius. It didn’t damage anything you didn’t want but it was far from pleasant. All the level E Vampires that were still out there and hostile Vampires were turned to ash, well those that were in the confines of that area anyway.

“Impossible, no Vampire has that much power.” Rido declared as if wondering how he could obtain it. But before he could finish that thought you zoomed forward and underneath him in a position to knock him with a charged uppercut.

“I’m not here to impress you. I’m here to kill you.” you said as he recovered from the small shock of you being within striking distance so quickly.

It was so quick that there was actual indent and uprooted stone from your sudden decent then more when you brought your fist up and sent him into the sky with a resounding ‘THUME and CRASH that could’ve been easily mistaken for the lighting that was discharging around the campus. But you didn’t stay where you were for long as you were far from done with him. You flew with like quickness as before and struck him again, and again, and again. Your goal was to break every bone in his body while playing a Vampire pinball with his body up in the air with your strikes, wither it be a kick, punch, or what have you. As the hits became more intense parts of his body were evaporated as the separated from his body. You made sure his non essential parts were first then moved on to other parts and saved his head and heart for last. Even pounding his skin and other organs apart separately until you split his being and he was pounded and ripped down further than the ash you had rendered the others to so easily. There wasn’t even a trace or smell of him to shower down to the people observing. All they could do was watch as their enemy was reduced to a voidless pulp without the mess.

With his demise the sun started coming up and you were starting to lose some of the power that was making your current action easy. So as you floated down to the roof again you used your dwindling power to fix everything that had been destroyed by the whole ordeal, including what you destroyed. By the time you were done you dropped onto the roof in a slump the rest of the 5 feet as the sun hit you and your power and effects from it was gone from the area, minus your severely drain body as it laid between them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You find your answer after a while.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You woke with blood flowing down your throat. It took a little while to realize what was happening and what you were doing. You found that you were being held up by someone as your fangs were buried in their neck. They must’ve forced your fangs in as you sure as hell didn’t have the strength previously to bite anyone. Another spike of energy coursed through you as you were getting more than just blood, you were getting power. Not just the power from feeding either. You were getting a boat load of new power. Finally you were able to stand and react to a Yuki in your mouth, well her neck anyway, and her blood flowing into you. You took her gift and drank but stopped well before than you had to and you could tell she was liking it, perhaps too much. But finally you pulled out of her and opened your eyes to her looking longingly into your eyes as you had come to expect from feeding on people, now you were holding her as she recovered.

“Yuki, you… Thank you Lady Kuran.” You said as your fangs retracted. Strange, for how much you drank you would normally need ten times that much to replenish like she had done for you. Perhaps it was the extra power from drinking from a Pure Blood. You ended your embrace by taking her hand and holding it properly, bowing then backing off.

“You’re right, that felt… really good. It felt nothing like the Vampires of this world.” She admitted as she touched where your fangs came in then you both were forced back to your surroundings but the people around. You were in the courtyard with Kaname, Zero, The Headmaster, and of course Yuki. You then looked at a side glance from Kaname to see Mr. Vale.

“Caleb.” Kaname called as he came closer from where he had advance to Yuki’s side. “I am glad I was able to help you find what it means to be a true Vampire. I am also at a loss to thank you for what you have done for us after you found your reason. It was a sight both horrifying and awe inspiring at the same time.” He said in his usual tone when addressing you.

“It was an honor Lord Kuran. You have all taught me what I needed and I find that to be more than a fair exchange. I am glad that the Vampire before me had put this world in my path to learn from.” You responded.

“Master, your family awaits and Eve is very instant that I bring you back immediately so she can have some R&R with her. Lady Kelsey has also expressed a desire to have you back as soon as possible.” Mr. Vale stated and you smiled at the thought.

“So you do have girlfriends at home. Can’t believe even humans in your world would actually fall for a Vampire.” Zero stated in his normal biased tone.

“First of all they’d kill you for saying that. Second they are not humans, well Eve and Kelsey aren’t at least. Eve is a sentient spider that I helped when she was really small and now as a 3 foot tall spider she is just part of my family. Kelsey is a really close, similar to my relationship with Lady Kuran but more involved, nothing romantic. Although she is a Succubus so we do hang out a lot at our human school. Humans in my world are just as ignorant as here, except my family.” You stated.

“And I thought our family was weird.” Yuki stated with a blank look on her face with the rest of them at the things you just rattled off. They would ask if you were kidding but they never really saw you kidding before like that. That and it was just too crazy to be a lie.

“Headmaster Cross. Thank you very much for allowing me to attend your academy.” You said to him with a bow.

“You can’t stay?” he asked in his carefree tone.

“Afraid not. My Mom would rip me a new one if I missed our family vacation.” You joked back, it was even funnier to them because it looked like the Vampire that just did what they just saw was actually afraid of the human woman in the world they couldn’t follow to. “Ok Mr. Vale, let’s go home.” You stated and he accompanied you in walking away from them.

“Goodbye Caleb!” called Yuki with a wave that you returned in a pleasant manner without looking before you stepped out of their world and back into yours as if stepping through an invisible and undetectable door.

“You’re back!” a voice said as you were shot from your feet by a large hairy ball with legs you knew to be Eve. You floated back to your feet and held her.

“Yes I’m back.” You said as you looked down at her many eyes as they gazed up at you from just below your face.

“You smell different.” Eve said as she whimpered.

“I agree. Where the hell have you been?” Kelsey asked in her Succubus form, obviously cross that you hadn’t told her before leaving her for a whole week. She wasn’t as possessive as Eve but with you being the only other ‘freak’ she could hang around with at her age it did effect her.

“How about story time to make up for it. I’ve been through a lot in that short time.” You countered to which Isaac jumped up and down with anticipation and they all agreed. Nr. Vale had already disappeared before you could thank him, as was his way. You sat in the air as you started.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“So, you have fun?” asked Mrs. Dremer as you teleported into their home to drop off Kelsey after the Family Vacation. It went remarkably similar to the previous year, even as far as hardness factor. You talked with them about the lessons you learned but you didn’t need to. The whole experience was captured on a single copy of overwritten series. You watched both the original and the one you were involved in to see the difference but they were proud of how you handled things.

“Oh, I had loads of fun. I even killed him a few times.” Kelsey stated as she embraced her mother, very glad to be home.

“Never thought you would be so happy about that.” Mrs. Dremer stated.

“Caleb was right, it is rather fun. He can’t die and he doesn’t kill any of us. Eve and I were like awesome and were able to help turn the tide more than once.” Kelsey stated.

“Very true, last year my family only had Eve to help them from the instinctual side. With two predators or ‘freaks’ on their side it was a lot harder for me and more rewarding for us all. That and she really got along well with my cousins and family.” You agreed.

“I’m going to have to come up next time to see what the fuss is all about. Did you…” she started as she nudged Kelsey to which she blushed then nodded. “So how did she taste?”

“Oh, she tasted wonderful. To be honest though… not as good as humans. I think that Humans are just Vampire’s natural feeding source. But that by no means made her taste bad at all. A full blooded succubus is definitely a rare treat to have.” You answered with a little bow, something you were use to from your little time with Lord Kuran.

“And what on your end, is it really…?” Mrs. Dremer asked Kelsey and she nodded with an even deeper blush that almost made her completely red. “I hope I can work up the courage later, if you wouldn’t mind another succubus snack.”

“Oh, I wouldn’t mind that at all. But I don’t think of anybody I drink from as a snack. I have seen how Vampires that treat others like that are and I strongly dislike them.” you answered.

“I didn’t mean anything by it Caleb, was just teasing you.” she said in return. She was insanely good at covering herself and without reading her mind she had at least a hundred years of personal experience over you to make it believable. Although you could see a little tell that she was glad you made that distinction.

“That aside, I think a few of my family have a crush on you.” You said to Kelsey.

“Damn, it must be really bad if you noticed it. A few of your cousins were really flirting at the end there.” Kelsey agreed.

“But we had the flirt patrol out at least.” You stated to which you both laughed.

“Flirt patrol?” Mrs. Dremer asked with an eyebrow raised.

“A few of the younger more mischievous cousins pulled pranks on the guys that were to forward with Kelsey, or in their terms were getting to ‘gross’; pulling down shorts, tying together shoelaces, blowing air horns, giving them laxatives to name a few. Between Isaac, Samuel, Dana, and a few others it was rather comical to watch.” You responded after you and Kelsey were slowing the laughter down.

“Well I’m glad you had fun. You need some blood before you go? I got a few slaves you could drink from.” Mrs. Dremer asked.

“Thanks for the offer but I can’t. Remember? Not unless they are themselves willing. Your slaves can’t think for themselves anymore so I can’t drink from them.” You stated, again with a bow that got her to smile both in appreciation and in growing understanding.

“See you later Caleb.” Kelsey said after a hug from each of them. You waved then teleported away to finish up the rest of your transportations.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Caleb!...” called Papa as you did some of your chores. You quickly finished the ones that you had planned to take your time on then headed in. Only a week to go until school started so you were getting ready for that as well.

“Yes Papa?” You asked as you came into the house from the back and into the living room to see some Police Officers, one of which you knew from church.

“Caleb, how’s it going?” Doug Sag asked as he held out his hand and you took it.

“Well enough, getting ready for school and all that.” You reported and noticed a little tension in the air. “So what’s up?”

“Well Caleb, Doug just got promoted to Police Captain and was telling me about the whole Vampire Clan problem. Apparently it has gotten worse than we thought and I told him you might be able to help… if you wanted to.” Papa said in a cryptic tone that indicated you telling him about… you being an actual Vampire. Having a Police Captain on your side in case of legal trouble could be useful.

“They have been a royal pain in the butt. Are they really that bad behind all the scenes?” you asked.

“Yes, but I can’t say much outside of the office. Do you have some kind of relation or connection to them?” Doug asked as he wondered how you could help.

“More indirectly and very distant. Quite frankly not more than thinking their irritating but more than enough to cause an impact if I wanted to. Papa, can I… work on this with them for a little bit?” you asked.

“Well I did say last year that you should wait a year. I’ll trust you to do what you need to do. It is your decision on all the rest, we trust you.” Papa answered.

“I get the feeling that this is something that should be discussed somewhere else.” Doug stated to which you just nodded. “Ok, you ok with riding in the back of a police car?”

“Sure, never been in one before.” You said with a general intrigue to which you all said your goodbyes and last bits of cryptic advice before them driving you off to the Police Station and Doug escorted you to his office. It was definitely a neat experience as people came and went. You were glad that you didn’t wear shoes with hidden knives anymore. It would’ve just been strange and suspicious with the metal detectors and whatnot. They didn’t bother checking you for weapons as you still only had on your usual black shorts, black sleeveless with the silver dragon on the back and glyph on the front, and black running shoes that replaced the old boots with the knife you use to wear.

“Ok, why don’t you start by saying how you know the Vampire Clan.” Doug said as he closed the door to his personal office. You looked around and saw the camera was on. He noticed this as you looked at it then at him. He in return looked at you with a questioning glance.

“Most of what I can say with other people listening and watching is not very informative.” You stated and he narrowed his gaze a little. “It isn’t anything illegal or bad like that, just not something I can have too many people knowing, and definitely not on any record. I promise you that it is worth only you knowing.”

“Ok, I’ll trust you on this one. We have been in the same church for all your life and your Dad has mentored me a lot. Which is why I am so high while so young.” He said as he unplugged multiple surveillance systems and locked the door, as a final precaution after closing blinds and anything else that people could use to spy or gain intel on what was said in the room. You also materialized things so that people outside couldn’t ‘accidentally’ overhear or see. “Ok Caleb, what is this big secret.”

“Ok, this is going to be really hard to believe but I promise you it is true and that I can prove it.” You said then thought carefully about it for a little while then, with a loud sigh, continued. “The reason I can help is because I AM a Vampire.”

“Huh? Come on Caleb, are you going to tell me or not?” Doug asked as he got up but you did as well but in a way that made him fall back into his chair. You floated up in a relaxed position along with slightly dimming the lights in the room. You also turned your eyes red and protruded your fangs. He looked up at you then at the case he placed his gun then back at you. But you lowered yourself again then retracted all the theatrics along with teeth and eyes. “Caleb… you are… please explain.”

“I became a Vampire near 2 years ago from the last one. Without going into the true history and what is B.S. for a few weeks I’ll just answer what you need to know. Yes I am a Vampire, no there is not anymore, no I am not officiated with the Vampire Clan, no I can’t turn anyone, no I can’t leave fang marks when I feed, and most of what you think you know about Vampires is B.S.. However this is what your current situation is. You have the only Vampire of this age offering you his services, as long as this remains our little secret.” You answered and he seemed to be in ‘Police Captain mode’, listening and archiving everything you said in order to perceive what to do next. You just hoped it would be an option that didn’t make you do anything drastic.
