1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“S..ss… So you are a… real Vampire?” he asked to which you nodded. “Wait a minute, it is the middle of the day and you aren’t turning to ash or anything.”

“Well, like I said, most of what you know about Vampires is B.S. You see the Vampire before me created those stories to protect herself and the next one when she passed the gift on to me. Basically it helps that all I have to do to disprove someone saying I’m a Vampire is to walk into the sunlight.” You responded.

“Well… You’re right, it would take a very long time to get up to speed and I have a feeling that you aren’t too thrilled about people knowing in general.” Doug stated to which you nodded in agreement. “So the question remains, why tell me?”

“The first reason is I really am getting irritated by this ‘Vampire Clan’ that is making me look bad. They are so annoying and are really starting to push my buttons. Second is that it would only help if I had a friend this deep into law enforcement to help if there is ever a misunderstanding between me and something I do. Not to mention the talk of some of my nonhuman friends.” You answered, that last part catching his utmost attention.

“Wait, I thought you said you were the only one.” He almost demanded.

“The only Vampire, definitely, the only predator or what my family refers to as Freaks, no. Currently I have a 5 foot tall sentient spider at home named eve and a Succubus. Before you ask, they both are good people and while they both have their moments they don’t cause trouble. Eve, the spider, stays in my house and never leaves… for the moment.” You answered for him.

“Caleb… I can’t really say that I can just roll over with this. If what you are saying is true, then you all are huge security risks. I also don’t like the idea of me being your scapegoat.” Doug said in a stern voice.

“Oh, I don’t mean it that way. It just would be helpful if someone accuses us of something or we help someone that we have someone that can vouch for us doing exactly that. Those of us that aren’t human… it is hard enough to remain defending humans without the ones we are trying to save turning us into lab rats or something. It would also require you to actually ask us if you think we did something so we can explain ourselves. Such as; the fang marks on the murder victims that I hear about on the news. I have multiple reasons why I had nothing to do with it but without someone like yourself to buffer hard line accusations I wouldn’t be able to explain myself before we both did things we wish we hadn’t.” you tried to explain.

“I see… That makes me feel a little better. Even so, now that you brought it up, can you prove that it wasn’t you?” he asked. You almost felt offended but, like he said, you did bring it up.

“Well for starters I was up north all summer. The other reason is… well my saliva is a healing agent amongst other things. Even if I wanted to I can’t leave fang marks on anything. I would show you but I don’t think you would let me bite into you just to prove it.” You said to which he held out his arm after rolling up his sleeve. “Huh?”

“I am the Captain. If I am going to vouch for you then I need to know for sure. Now hurry up while I still have the guts to do this.” Doug stated as he held out his arm to you with obvious anxiety about it. You took the arm then bit into his wrist. Then started the normal reaction base that people had with you doing so. You only drank a little but he got the picture as you separated then he wiped away the excess blood to see no fang marks. “Wow… not what I was expecting.”

“I get that a lot. But it makes sense when you think about it. The bite itself stimulates arousal so that blood flows faster and increases the willingness of the… prey I guess. But only I can make it feel like that. These others from the Vampire Clan are just pretenders and feel the same as if you bit yourself. They can’t even drain a body properly.” You replied.

“So you’re willing to help with this little problem?” He asked as he regained his composer and cleaned himself up a little.

“Yes. As a friend, I’ll help you when I can. But understand that asking me to do something that takes a considerable amount of power will require me to drink some blood. In a sense, blood is like fuel for my Vampire powers so if you want me to clear a building of terrorists while not drinking from them then have something I can drink. Usually Papa grabs a pint of packaged blood that we get delivered from the hospital when he needs me to do something overly strenuous… or lets me drink from him.” You replied to his question, making sure you were clear that you doing this as a friend not a dictator or slave.

“Your Dad allows you to drink from him?” He asked in shock.

“Of course. You felt what it feels like. Sure there are limitations but they really don’t mind. My whole family knows what I am and we all help each other. I help them get cars out of ditches and what not and they let me drink their blood if I want. Actually, some actually beg me to do it, which is a little weird to say the least.” You answered.

“I am guessing so. Forgive my rudeness, this is just hard to take in.” Doug said as he thought about it for a while. You didn’t interrupt as he seemed to be deep in thought until he sat up again to address you. “I will accept your offer. I will be the only one in the station that knows for sure. Others may become curious but I won’t formally tell anyone without you here. That goes for your… friends as well, well the nonhuman ones at least.”

“I understand and thank you Mr. Doug. Now…”

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Uh… yeah, take a look at these.” Doug said as he recovered from the little information overload to bring the conversation back to what this was all about in the first place. He handed you a folder to which you opened it on the desk. You flipped over pictures of the presumed leaders, their locations, and photos of crimes linked to them. They were very horrid pictures indeed, even for your eyes. “As bad as this sounds, I can’t do anything about this. This Clan may be annoying to you but it has infiltrated and has ties with almost every agency in the country. Even if I started a campaign against them I would be out of here before the ink dried on my order. It would be fine if it was a halfway decent group but these people literally get away with murder while I have to just sit here.”

“I see, so who’s their leader? Maybe I can talk with him about it. I don’t really want to reveal myself to them but. Perhaps I can appeal to the pretenders as the being they are attempting to be. Either that or I have to deal with them.” You suggested.

“Well anything is better than what we got now. Even if you stop them from just murdering one person it would be a start. To answer your question though, their leader is named Dracula.” He said and got a comical face from you. “I know, but with how powerful they’ve become it has failed to be a laughing matter. Apparently this leader is the head guy and is like the DON for their group. While he hands down orders and responsibilities, whatever he says is what happens. One time we saw all of them stand on one leg whenever they went anywhere and found out he ordered them to do it just for kicks, and they all did it without question.” Doug finished as he flipped the folder in front of you to the picture of the man. He looked like a modern day giant. You wouldn’t know until you met him but the stats said he was over 8 feet tall and weighed 400 pounds, and by the looks of it there wasn’t any body fat on the man. His demeanor was rustic but also arrogant like one would expect for a someone in his position and someone who watched too many Vampire movies. His suit didn’t have the traditional long collar or cape but it was all black with the lining being red. Finally his eyes were red, but you could see a sliver of brown where the contacts were too far over, and his fangs that were obviously surgically implanted. They were actually a little longer than yours if you had them out.

“So this is the guy.” You said as you analyzed the image. “You don’t happen to have a way in do you?”

“Well… yes we do but it is not something I would normally recommend. You see we send people to him from time to time in order to retain some diplomatic relations and control over him. But lately they’ve rarely came back in anything more than a body bag… of course with their throats dug out by fang marks.” Doug reported.

“How do you go to them?” You asked more directly.

“This building is where Dracula resides. He doesn’t even bother hiding that fact anymore.” Doug answered as he flipped to a skyscraper with dark colored glass around it. It was abnormally designed in a clear attempt to keep sunlight out. You had seen the thing being built in record time but didn’t think that the Vampire Clan was the one doing it. If they had enough pull to make such a loud proclamation then they could obviously do some nasty damage. “It is a place that we, or more specifically I, can’t go. The amount of money he brings in to the city even has the Mayor and the Governor protect him from their positions. If you can do something about it than I beg you to do so.”

“No need to beg. Like I said, they are getting insanely annoying on my part. That and as a friend I don’t really need a reason to help out.” You answered him to which brought the first genuine smile that you had seen on him since this whole conversation started. He was obviously under a lot of pressure from people all around. “One more thing, here.”

“What is this?” he asked as you gave him the magical card that implanted your glyph in him like your family. He looked at the design and realized it was the same one that was on your shirt.

“It’s my symbol or ‘glyph’ as I like to call it. Once you touched that card it was magically transmitted into your body. It is nothing more than an anchor to teleport to if you are in trouble. I can’t spy on you or anything. I just give them to my friends and family so if something happens I can be there in the blink of an eye… well as soon as I find out something is wrong.” You answered.

“Thanks Caleb, I think…” he said as he looked at it then put it into his desk. “Now, do you need anything for this? I mean like supplies to help or anything. I may not be allowed to help you directly but I can donate something to a friend in need.” He asked as he verbally sidestepped in a way that could help you with things if you needed.

“Nah, wouldn’t want you to get in trouble. I can handle it. Thanks anyway. I was really nervous about sharing my secret, always am in fact. After all, it isn’t exactly the easiest thing for people to take in. It helps a great deal that you are ok with it… perhaps not comfortable yet, but ok.” You answered as you stood and shook his hand while taking the darkening effect you were still doing out of the room, along with the materializing and sealing things you were doing to make the room secure. As a final precaution you closed the folder and moved it with your abilities to where he pulled it from the filing cabinet. “I’ll stop by to let you know how it went.”

“Just be careful, I don’t want you getting into a bad situation. I’ve lost too many good people to this bunch.” He said with a legitimate concern as he finished shaking your hand.

“Don’t worry about it. Remember, I can’t die.” You said with a smile that he returned.

“I am guessing I’ll be awed by your abilities more times than not. I better get use to it.” Doug said as he started plugging things back in. You heard the whir of motors inside the devices as they powered up and started doing their jobs. Then he straightened with a smile. “Thank you for your help Caleb and I hope to see you again soon.”

“You can count on it.” You said with a sly wink as he opened the door and escorted you out. You could now feel the eyes of many people on you. You couldn’t tell if it was people that were Vampire Clan plants or officers that didn’t like their Captain having a secret conversation with you. Either way the crowd was somewhat hostile and you hailed a cab to take you to the V.C. (Vampire Clan) building. He shook slightly as you told him this but punched it in and started to it.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
As you got out of the Cab and it sped away, almost before you paid, you looked up at the massive structure before you. On the outside it looked to be made of sheer black glass. If there wasn’t any lights around a human could easily walk right into it without seeing it. You tapped the ground with your foot and the vibrations told you that there was a large complex underneath as well. But your eyes weren’t deceived as you could easily see inside and cameras watching you as you walked toward the entrance and entered the building. Inside it was dark with a red glow around. You almost chuckled as it seemed very cheesy to you but once the door closed you found that it was quite ideal for your preference of color and light range. The sun was still up but almost over the horizon so the woman at the desk shielded her eyes until the door closed.

The area in front of the door was wide open with people in offices buzzing around, some of the glass walls were tinted or becoming that way. You thought it was really cool as you saw someone observe your entry as someone brought a young woman into his office and he dimmed the tint so people outside couldn’t see what he was doing. You didn’t like what he could possibly be doing but found it interesting how such a see through wall could offer such visual protection to those that willed it. The Woman at the desk glared at you as you took a moment to look around from your spot then walked up to her.

“What do you want human?” She almost hissed at you. Despite her very attractive, secretary type figure, her persona was easily recognized as was her smell. As the others at your school and such, she didn’t take traditional baths or showers. Although you did sense that she was clean, just not washed. As if she had substituted a diaper wipe for her much needed shower. You could also smell the hint of old blood on her as if she had spilled some on her and didn’t clean it off.

“I am here to see Mr. Dracula.” You stated as politely as you could with a smile.

“And what makes you think that he wants to see you?” She asked coldly.

“I fail to see how that matters. If I am an inconvenience he can just deal with me like any other human. If I am worth his time than he will want to see me too. Either by food or worth there isn’t really a reason why it would be a bad idea.” You answered, using your attractant a little to make her more compliant but not overly so to be obvious.

“I see even a useless human has a point from time to time. Ash, take this meat sack up stairs to Lord Dracula.” She ordered to which a blonde and slender version of the attendant behind the desk quickly got up and just motioned you to follow her. You could feel her look at you as you glances around. It was evident that she expected the looks she probably got in bulk from the others. But for you it wasn’t that impressive, heck you had two Succubus women at your disposal if you wished it. This Vampire wannabe wasn’t even in their league.

“I catch you looking at my ass and I’ll drink you dry.” She threatened as she ushered you into an elevator then stood in front of you and the door as it rose. The Elevator was also glass but the reflective kind from the inside. It was probably like that so that people outside wouldn’t be the ones surprised by those that came out. The woman in front of you seemed slightly put off that you weren’t even trying to notice her body. Perhaps that is why she said what she did but either way, compared to what you were use to, she was nothing. Her scent didn’t improve things either in the small box as it rose to the top floor before the few roof floors. You quickly wondered why there were 5 floors labeled for the roof but left it there for now. “Out.” She stated as she got off and stood aside to command you out of the elevator then led you into the room.

It wasn’t like the other rooms. This one was just one large space with a clear floor that you remember being black from the bottom. As evidence to the man fitting Dracula’s description at the far end of the room with a twirling chair that was looking over the city at the present moment. The dark glass kept the sun out while not impeding hit view. As you were brought forward you noticed a guard on the perimeter every 20 feet. They looked like ninja or something, each with a different weapon; some with swords or like weapons and some with guns. There was even one large guy with a Rocket launcher strapped to his back as he stood at attention like the rest. They stood so still that if you couldn’t sense the difference you could easily mistake them for statues. You looked down again and noticed that the floor had a zoom feature of sorts and you could see all the way to the front door without using your Vampire sight. You guessed it was Dracula’s way of keeping his people on their toes and honest… well with him anyway.

“My Lord, a human has come baring your name.” the woman said after kneeling and bowing. She glared at you as you just stood there but didn’t move while the man not more than 50 feet away now turned in his chair to look at you. One of the quieter guards came up behind you and forced you to your knees and put your head down. You could’ve easily stopped him but the room was dark enough that a normal human wouldn’t be able to see it coming and that was what you were disguised as, so you let it go.

“That’ll be all my child.” Said the deep voice that easily targeted the man as he stood. The woman backed away in a bow then quickly left into the elevator. You waited for her to be out of sight range (for them) before standing again. “What insolence, humans kneel before me.” You saw now that the profile picture wasn’t lying as he stood 8 feet tall and was rather intimidating looking without losing the whole arrogant Vampire thing that established most people and ‘Vampire Clan people’ like him.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You are able to see Dracula right away.

choices: If you become my willing servant.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“And why do humans have to kneel?” you asked with a comically curious face.

“Are you stupid kid? Because humans kneel before their Vampires and I am the leader of the Vampire Clan.” He answered then waved his hand to which the guards came toward you. They didn’t see the need to draw any weapons, big mistake on their part. You mimicked his motion but used the ability you gained from Kaname to forcibly restrain the others and send them against a glass wall, locking them in place.

“You’re the stupid one. You work so hard to become something you’re not and are blind when what you are trying to become is standing right in front of you.” you said as the sun went all the way down and you let your eyes glow in the relative dark, of course all this was done after you disrupted the surveillance systems he had for recording your antics.

“What… are you?” he asked in almost shock.

“That should be obvious. I am an actual Vampire, not this fake version that you humans have come up with.” You answered as your voice became ominous in the large space. Your heard the ding of the elevator as it was about to open again but pinched with your fingers to meld the doors together, locking the dozen guards inside of it. “Now, let’s talk Mr. fake vampire.”

“Talk? Fake Vampire?” he asked in a combination of anger and shock.

“That is unless…” you started then lifted him up then brought him closer to you as you took to floating to his eye level. “… you want to fight.” You stated as you slowly grew your fangs so he could easily see them you then put a finger to one of his fangs as if to test them as he was held suspended in the air. “Cute.”

“I…I… I’ll talk with you.” he almost whimpered to which you dropped him to the floor and stayed hovering there above him for a little bit until he backed away then you went back to standing properly. “My Master… I apologize for my forwardness.” He said in a kneeling bow like the woman before him had done.

“Unlike you, I don’t require people to kneel or bow in such a manner.” You stated and used your power to lift him to his feet. “Where you got the idea of resembling a frog to impress someone of your loyalty is beyond me.”

“Yes Lord…” he responded with a slight bow but realized that he didn’t know your name yet.

“My name is Caleb and I’ll be rather angry if it is spread that I am what I am. Both I and the one before me has worked hard to establish an aura of secrecy about us. It pains me that I have to reveal myself to you to keep you in line.” you answered him.

“Yes Lord Caleb.” He responded.

“Why don’t you just stick with ‘Master’ so my name isn’t common knowledge.” You stated.

“As you wish Master.” He corrected. It wasn’t a designation you were happy with but with Mr. Vale already calling you that it was just easier to incorporate and hear. “If you forgive me for saying so Master, I have waited my whole life to meet you.”

“I suppose you want me to turn you or something like that. It amazes me how little you know about what you proclaim to be.” You stated.

“Master?” he asked and you looked at the large man towering over you as he bowed but looked at you with longing eyes. It would be quite comical to see as even with him kneeling like before he was still taller than you were. However he obviously didn’t get what you were saying.

“You see I knew from the first moment that you weren’t a real vampire because Vampirism can’t be passed on. I wouldn’t be able to give the gift to you even if I wanted to, which I don’t. It is given every 2100 years to the next person if the current Vampire deems that person to be worthy. I was given the gift 2 years ago by the last Vampire so you see it isn’t possible for you to be one as I am. The fact that she didn’t pick you means that she didn’t agree with your image that you plastered over her and neither do I.” You answered as you walked past him and stood in front of the window after pushing the bound guards to the side without a thought on the matter.

“I see.” He responded.

“However it was her that spread all those rumors, legends, and myths to protect me. So I guess I should thank you for keeping her work alive, even if it has gotten a little out of place.” You responded then let the guards go from your grasp to which they all stood at attention awaiting orders but were unsure who’s orders to follow.

“Master, if I may be so bold as to ask. Even if I can’t be turned, can I at least satiate your hunger?” he asked in a weird sense of duty that you had expected but not really wanted.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You are able to talk with him.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You don’t seem to get it Dracula. I am not here because I think you are doing a good job. I am here because you’re being a royal pain. I was content watching your little fan club work as long as it didn’t cross any lines but now you are just making me look bad, even if no one knows I am THE VAMPIRE. It has gotten to the point where I am highly annoyed.” You revealed more bluntly as you continued to look out among the city with your arms crossed and listening to him, trying not to smell him.

“My Master, I… I can remove myself if that is what you wish.” He stated, obviously thinking of killing himself.

“That is the type of thinking that I am annoyed with.” You stated that got his heavy breathing to slow slightly. “I can’t stand the taking of innocent life. I was ok when your people were just taking on other gangs and such. While I still don’t like taking of life, it is well within my own definition of taking it.”

“And what is that Master?” he asked curiously as he wanted something to hold onto in order to legitimize his role.

“I only kill those that have killed. I only search out and kill those that kill those that have yet to take a life, either by killing them or robbing them of their dignity. I definitely don’t make my feeding a spectacle on the news and have never drank someone dry before.” You answered then paused for it to sink in before continuing but turned to him as you did so. “But you people kill and feed on people and make it public. Sense when does draining an infant of their blood make anyone worth anything? You people disgust me and I am about this close to slaughtering all of you. Sure another would take your place after a while but at least I would have a few months of peace from such idiocy and blatant disregard for life.”

“Master, I am sorry for the disgrace we have brought on you. If you wish I will disband the entire Clan.” He offered.

“And how would that help? You would still have random pockets or people unwilling to disband and it will just turn into a plague of a trend that sweeps the country with its filth.” You asked and he didn’t know what to say about it. “No, I don’t actually mind the Vampire Clan as an idea. If you people want to drink blood and fight other gangs fine, that is up to you. Your little club is actually bringing stability when it isn’t stealing people’s lives from them.”

“Then what do you want me to do?” he asked as he was done trying to figure out what to do and getting it wrong.

“I want to be able to take my sister or human friend on a walk without them fearing they’ll be mugged for her blood and life. I want to hear how my human family’s day went, not how they were almost grabbed by a member of the Vampire Clan. I want to go to Church without them thinking I’m a demon because of your actions. I want to turn on the news and not see that there was a record amount of murders in the city last month. I want to go into the city on a date without smelling the overflow of blood and death. That is what I want.” You said as you turned back to the city to look at the object as a whole. “I can hear them from here. The crying of a woman that just got her baby stolen, the scream of a teen that was just walking her dog, and the officers slaughter for attempting to regain order between a man and one of your members. I don’t care who any of you are or what you think it means to be a Vampire, this definitely isn’t it.”

“We will get better Master, I swear on my life that we will. Just give me a chance to prove it.” He almost begged you but didn’t take the begging posture. Either way it was probably comical for the guards to see if they were allowed to laugh.

“I’ll give you a month. If I don’t see some major changes then I’ll come back and mow down everyone until I find someone I think would better suited for the task. Oh and one more thing. Please put showering and bathing back on your to do list.” You stated.

“Yes Master, I won’t fail… but doesn’t running water harm you?” He asked as he noticed the last part was a request and not command.

“Not in the slightest, I take showers every morning. In the past the only reason the Vampire of that age didn’t shower was because we don’t necessarily have to and it multiplies our natural attractants to attract prey. You people on the other hand…” You said as you sniffed the air. “I wouldn’t drink from any of you if you all were the last humans on earth. I can’t get within a foot of you people without wanting to hurl. If you don’t want to use water than do something. You don’t have to smell like a rose garden either just please work on it, that is a request not a command.”

“As you wish Master, I do believe most of our ranks will be happy for that development. And I will not rest until the innocent murdering stops… If you don’t mind me asking, how did you come to know about so many that I wasn’t even aware of?” He asked.

“I have a friend from church that is a Police Captain and is close enough for me to share my other side with him and only him. He showed me and illuminated what was happening. Of course he could’ve been lying so I took a nice long drive in a cab just to be sure. To be clear on that, he is a close family friend and is not to be touched. He did me a favor by telling me of this and having a friend that high in law enforcement will only help me, understood?”

“I see, and yes Master. I will be sure to send him a sizable thank you gift. I assume if you want your nature secret then you also want your involvement with us secret as well.” he stated but also left it open for you to answer.

“That is correct. And I won’t say what about your club is fiction based as it works wonders for people suspecting me. That and I don’t mind the press on you rather than looking for me. I will be in the shadows as my kind has always been. You can take the spotlight if you wish.” You answered.

“But how will I contact you if something requires your attention?” He asked.

“You won’t, not until I feel that I can be proud of what you’ve accomplished. Even after that point it will be your Clan, not mine. I will be back more formally in a month to decide if I should have an alias at the top or whatever. Maybe it’ll be like one of those cheesy cartoons with the masked leader that no one sees. But, again, that all depends how well you do by the time I return.” You replied.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Not right now.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Master, I swear on my life that by the time you return that you will be impressed by the progress we’ve made. I will do so in the hopes that we are recognized formally by you and perhaps you may lead us, even if it must be from afar.” Dracula said to which you looked back at him and his eyes met yours with a fierce determination. The whole conversation was a little weird as you didn’t expect him to roll over so easily.

“Very well, I will go now and make it so only you remember my visit. You will be the only one in the Vampire Clan that knows about me. I’ll leave you to your work, I’m sure you have a lot of it.” You said as you reached out with your hand to the guards to which they all fell over as you purged their minds and those that saw you enter and leave. As you did this you started turning to mist but got one more word in. “Don’t disappoint me Dracula, I am putting some trust in you. See to it that it isn’t wasted.”

“Yes Master.” He said in a low voice before you were all gone and teleported to Doug’s office as he was putting on his coat. His blinds closed and you turned off all the security cameras, now that you knew for sure where they were.

“Hello? Caleb, is that you?” Doug asked as he couldn’t open the door. You appeared in the shadow of the room then walked to him.

“I’m glad I caught you before you left. I just had a rather long and interesting talk with Dracula. I thought you would like to hear the results as soon as they were made.” You stated in quiet but still audible voice.

“Ok Caleb, go ahead.” Doug answered and you told him the entire conversation and what you had told Dracula about possibly leading the Vampire Clan. Doug just listened to the information until it’s completion.

“So that’s the whole thing. I hope it was ok, for now at least.” You said, a little unsure if you did good and he could see it.

“Ok? Caleb that was much more than I was expecting. I am slightly concerned about this ‘gift’ he is sending as most of them that he sends tend to explode. But from what you’re saying, it seems like he has a deep longing to please you as an actual Vampire. It will be interesting the next couple weeks to say the least. Thank you very much. If this works it will be a very good thing. Of course the credit will probably be passed to other people above me.” Doug responded as he put a hand on your shoulder to solidify his thanks.

“Well it doesn’t bother me to get a back seat to the spotlight. That kind of stuff never really appealed to me anyway, especially now.” You returned to which Doug just gave you a pat on the back as he went again for his coat and the door, waiting for you to allow him out. “I guess I should get going to, see you later.” You waved as you teleported out and put everything back the way it was suppose to be, except obviously the footage of your visit. Just as a precaution you stayed until he opened the door, which wasn’t that long it at all.

So off you headed home to tell your parents and family what happened.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Go report to Doug.

choices: It is a trap and you have to deal with some of them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
School was pushed back a few weeks because of a change of stature. Apparently the Vampire Clan was more influential than you thought. It was about to incorporate a separate faction inside the Education system that allowed the Clan students more freedom. But with your little chat with Dracula he immediately took it out so the schools had to adjust before starting the year. It must’ve been a huge change to get a couple week waiting period. You watched more intently with Doug and your family as things around started changing in that respect. For one, it smelled much better as they all were ok to take showers and baths now. You would hear or sense the random feeding or something every once in a while but nothing like the thick sense that was there before. Instead of hearing of murders you heard of some actual help that surprised many people. While it was still known that no one picked a fight with the Vampire Clan there wasn’t that much if any senseless killing like there use to be. Slowly it spread and was well on its way through the countries factions within the month you gave him to work on it.

“You think you’re going to have to kill them?” Eve asked as you were getting ready to go meet with them. You had delivered a letter on Dracula’s desk with your glyph on it that you would be coming tonight and to put the glyph wherever it was secure enough or whatever. You would be wearing something covering if he wanted to do anything special but other than that you left it open.

“I hope not. Besides, we all agreed that he did a good job in the short time I gave him right?” You asked as she looked down at you from the ceiling of your room to you dressing an tweaking a suitable outfit. She was pretty big at this point so the days of her riding on your head or chest were over. In fact, more often than not Isaac rode her around the house. She gave Doug a heart attack when he formally met the family along with Kelsey and Eve in the fashion of discussing what he would do for you, due in no small part to the positive change that he was getting credit for.

“Yeah I suppose so.” Kelsey chimed in as she was helping you pick out something that didn’t look too cheesy. It was common place by now to go around your house with powers showing and what not.

If anyone ever walked in unannounced then they would think they were walking into a fiction book with Kelsey as a Succubus walking around with wings and tail out while Eve helped clean around the house. The rest of the family got use to it and it was more weird when no one was there and ‘boring’ anywhere else. Sure your family went out to movies and Sarah was trying to go out on dates. But for random fun stuff they just had you teleport them somewhere then pick them up if they wanted to go out. Your cousins loved coming over; Isaac and Dana in particular loved playing with Eve while some of the other cousins sometimes came over just to see you do something cool or feed on them from time to time. It was also more accepted that you could just grab someone and feed off them. If they had a reason for you not to, even if they just didn’t feel like it, then you honored that wish. But otherwise they trusted you to not take too much and leave them enough to be productive in their own day to day lives.

“So how does this look?” you asked as you presented yourself to them. It was simple as it was an all black getup. Your normal clothes were covered with a thin form fitting armor that was strong enough to deflect or stop armor piercing bullets, courtesy of Doug and his connections along with Grandpa Konel and his Military ones. The armor consisted of a pair of boot like shoes with a few hidden surprises in them then a pair of tight but not skin tight armored pants utilizing this new fabric. On the top was formfitting and semi tight long sleeve shirt made of the same stuff with gloves on the end. While they were separate pieces they came together in a way that made them so air tight that it could stop vapor from coming in through the seams. Finally the whole formfitting and extremely dark black outfit was covered by a separated cloak that honestly reminded you of the Batman cape and how it could go around your body completely but be taken off easily, but you had a slightly long hood that covered most of your face and what didn’t you covered with a little mist to make is to that even if you shined a light to see underneath you couldn’t make out your face, but the person still could see basic shapes like your fangs or it you decided to make your eyes glow through the shrouded cover.

“Well normally I would ask if you are going to a Halloween party but… I guess that’s the point. You do look intimidating enough and fit the part so I think it is a good look for your Vampire alias.” Kelsey said as she looked you over.

“Yes, that is the right one if you are going for scaring the crap out of them.” Eve agreed as she scuttled around the ceiling to look at all sides. “And you can hide it right?”

“Yep, I don’t have to worry about people finding it because I just do this.” you said as you broke down the outfit like the others you had on file for your body to change into when it needs to, kind of like a partial materialization wardrobe. You stood there for a second in your usual relaxing outfit then went back to the Vampire Master one that you just made. “All secure and everything.”

“Yeah, yeah, very cool but isn’t it time for your little meeting?” Eve said in a joking tone as you all looked at the clock and saw that it was almost midnight.

“You’re right, I should get going so I don’t miss my own party.” You said as you readied yourself.

“Hold on, you should drink a little before you go.” Kelsey advised and you looked at her, although under your hood she couldn’t see well enough to fully know your expression, even from her new spot up against you.

“I guess I am a little hungry but not so much as to drink.” You said but more asked in a tone to have her explain.

“But you don’t know what will happen there. What if you have to fight them all. You’ll need a full tank of gas… or blood in your case. Just take a little bit.” She said as she kinked her neck for you and gently pulled your head to a spot you had used a few times.

“Alright smarty pants, you win.” You said as you embraced her and held her as you licked the spot then sank in your fangs into her tender neck. You didn’t know what it was about her type but the smaller more fragile necks were always more enjoyable to you. You drank a little bit as her warm blood flowed down your throat. You took longer than usual to bring the blood out so she could bask in the feeling for a little longer until you were done and retracted yourself. With a final bit of licking to clean the spot off you helped her to one of the silk couches. “As delicious as always, thanks.”

“Hey, no fair.” Eve pouted to which Kelsey just smiled at her mock jealousy. Eve had now gotten just big enough for you to drink her blood in more the quantity that you did the others and liked it just as much as they did.

“Oh I’ll get to you when I get back.” You said lovingly as you pet her hanging form as she address the two of you.

“Promise?” she comically pouted.

“Yeah I promise.” You agreed then with a tender stroke you vanished to your meeting with Dracula, hoping that it would go well.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: A month later.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“It’s almost time.” Dracula said as he passed around the room with a bunch of people from the clan there. They all looked like high ranking people from the Clan as they all had that look of superiority to them but was nervous from what might be their last day on earth. What worried them even more was their usually fearless leader was passing and sweating bullets. You of course scanned the area before teleporting then appeared before them.

“Dracula, it is time.” You said simply in your ominous voice. You decided that using your normal voice would render your outfit pointless so you chose to use that one in relation to your Vampire alias. He slowly turned to you as you had your arms crossed and head covered he wasn’t sure it was you so you flashed your eyes at him, removing all doubt.

“Master.” He greeted and as he bowed the others followed suit.

“Dracula, it is time to impress me like you swore you would, time to prove that my trust was not misplaced.” You stated. “Oh, and I do appreciate the upgrade in scent.”

“This can’t be, he’s just a little kid.” Said a skinny but old man that looked the definition of slyly arrogant. He obviously thought very highly of himself. “Is this why our great leader changed his ways, for this little brat?”

“Hold your tongue Slier.” Dracula almost growled.

“Not this time. We’ve been going along with your new ideas to impress the real thing. But this is going too far. This… this is the person you are so afraid of? I told you all before that I should be the leader. This oversized brute or his pet brat has no place in the most powerful and fast growing organization in the world. I think we should…” he ranted to Dracula’s almost horror. He obviously was hoping to make a good impression and this man was bashing that possibility but perks of being who you are and would be, you didn’t have to put up with it. Only one person knew your face in the room so you didn’t have to worry about consequences of acting a little more aggressive. So mid sentence you interrupted the man by putting a little force on his throat and lifted the man up with you mind power. If you ever saw Kaname again you would have to thank him. While your other powers were more potent this one was insanely useful. You searched his mind for what he did and apparently he handled small time finances for the Clan in one of the Minor branches. He, unlike the others, was just power drunk and still secretly fed on young unwilling boys. He disgusted you as he was one of the people who also drank from infants and even if he didn’t for a while he fully intended to do so.

“Objection noted.” You said after splitting the man in half many times and throwing his remains into a trash bin sloppily so the others could hear the squishing as the pieces were dropped in the small container. “Any more bits of useless power hungry wisdom before we continue?” you asked to which they all remained silent and not showing their horror stricken emotions. They now joined Dracula in their deathly respect for what and who you were, even if they didn’t know your face. Master was all they needed to know and that you were the real thing. “You may continue.”

“My apologies Master.” He said with a bow then brought your attention to a sliding glass screen to your left and their right. “The red lines are what we used to be like as of a month ago and the green what we are now. While there are still some rogue factions as you predicted most of the Clan’s have ceased any senseless murdering outside of territory disputes and your rule on killing innocents has been accepted, if not forcibly enforced by the rest of us. We have established ties with multiple law enforcement groups and corporations and now provide them with intelligence when we have it. We are growing and soon the individual factions will follow suit. We retained our loyalty to each other without condoning violence on innocent. That has led to taking our direct grasp on education out of our agenda. Now if a student gets into a fight for something meaningless it is on their head. In order to justify a killing the offending party or situation must be approved by the overseers and if a previous killing isn’t approved then they are handed over the police or law enforcement agencies, in the worst case we deal with our own if it is too delicate elsewhere. We also help with promoting a bias against murder and like crimes under the threat of our rule and punishment system. Because of this there hasn’t been a single murder in the cities we have the most influence and it is spreading as we do.” He reported as you looked at the corresponding numbers. When he was finished his report as he went into more complicated and minor changes he retracted the screen and bowed to you, awaiting your decision.

“As evidence to the idiot I just dealt with it is safe to say that not all your Clan supports this new vision. But I do.” You stated, the first part almost made Dracula shake in fear but the last part stopped this motion and made him slowly straighten. “Consider me impressed, not satiated but impressed none the less.”

“That means?...” Dracula half asked.

“Yes, I will allow you to remain the head of this Clan.” You responded to his unasked question.

“Thank you Master.” He returned with another bow, obviously relieved to hear so.

“M..Master?” asked a very attractive looking woman in her 30s maybe younger.

“Speak.” You responded to her as she straightened after a like bow, following the example of Dracula.

“Will you be leading us?” she asked.

“I will be your overseer but no I will not be leading you. That honor will remain with Dracula until I find him unworthy or another more worthy. I will among the people with my human family observing you, all of you. Only the Leader will know my face and name. That will hopefully ensure that you treat every person with respect. Remember this, if even one of my family is fed on I will know about it and will make sure you wish you never laid a finger on them.” you answered.

“But how will we know?” asked a man but shrank back as he noticed it was probably to forward of a response.

“You won’t. I could be the woman next to you or the bum on the street. My family is not a small one they aren’t all human either. This is my way of keeping an eye on you. I am not all powerful but, as the idiot in the trash can prove, I am no weakling of fool either. You all have been warned” you answered.

“Understood Master.” They all said at once.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: It goes well.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Master, is there any other instruction or wishes that you would like fulfilled?” Another young lady asked. Like Dracula, you had the distinct impression that she wanted to get her blood drunk. The group in front of you must’ve had either a high level fetish or desire for the Vampiric world. If they couldn’t become a Vampire, a true Vampire, then they wished to be a part of one… well most of them anyway.

“Only this, to portray Vampires as you have been. I will not say what parts of the myth are true or false. I only addressed the water rule because I couldn’t stand the smell. My predecessor created most of the stories and legends about Vampires to protect me and future Vampires so I won’t say what is true or not. But having her legacy being upheld and spread is a sentimental plus for me on your part.” You answered.

“Master, if we are suppose to be Vampires then why not make us as such?” asked a young man this time. He wasn’t as power hungry as the other man was but he clearly was hoping for the change.

“Because I can’t. The type of Vampire I am doesn’t allow me to spread out the gift in such a fashion. I can only spread the gift to one person at the end of my time, as my predecessor did before me. This is done so that each Vampire of the age can be carefully selected and chosen over the course of the current’s very long life. That is all I’ll say on that matter and I trust that it will not spread beyond this room. As I have said, I wish the previous Vampire’s legacy to continue.” You answered and as much solemn emotions were running there was an equal amount of resolve to be that person for you. You didn’t want to tell them that it would be close to 2100 more years before you had to choose another.

“Do you still want us to act as we have been, as far as acting like what we know as Vampires?” asked an older man near the idiot’s age but more kept.

“That is up to you. If you want to drink blood, wear black, get fangs, live in the dark, or whatever you decide then I won’t stop you, as long as it is within what I have previously said and following the instructions I give to your leader. The only rule besides murder that I have revoked was the no bathing and showering rule and for good reason.” You answered back.

“Not that I’m complaining but, what reason is that?” asked the first woman that spoke.

“Simple, the only reason Vampires in the past never showered was because we emit an attractant of sorts to…well attract and ensnare our prey or people in general. Taking a shower of bath would wash off the concentration of attractant and its multiplied effect for leaving it sit. So when we don’t wash ourselves it makes us more enticing. However that is the opposite for humans. Your scent doesn’t have to be like mine, as it is impossible to do so, and it doesn’t have to be a garden of roses either. But making every possible person in the area shrink away from you from the smell alone is the opposite of what should happen.” You explained for her and they seemed more pleased by this little insight.

“Before you go Master, can we smell it… your scent?” asked the other woman.

“Very well, I will let go my scent to 10% so you understand.” You agreed then did like so. You could immediately see the desire in their eyes and the pull they had to suppress to remain professional and respectful. You let it linger for a moment then retracted it.

“I see, so that is what it is… I… thank you Master.” The woman said as she was censoring herself from saying something she might regret.

“Is there anything else?” You asked in a formal manner to Dracula.

“No Master, I will continue to work to make this Clan into one that you can call home eventually. Do not hesitate to ask if you need anything from us. We live to serve you, even as meals if need be.” Dracula stated in bow. You would’ve snapped on him for following that train of thought yet again but you also understood he didn’t mean anything besides a deep longing rather than a dismissal of soul to you. Going to church and being in an all Christian family and school made you a little off when people talked like this but a quick peek into his mind revealed he meant it as a sign of loyalty.

“Very well, I’ll leave it to you then. Well done.” You stated then when they looked up you teleported out so they could see the vanishing act and further pull any doubt from them. You popped back into your room to find that Kelsey had went home, it was rather late and the start of school was tomorrow, and Eve in the corner but now awake as she was in contact with the webbing that covered the room. You immediately changed to your normal clothes with a yawn.

“Tired, well it has been a while since you got any sleep.” Eve stated as she came over and lifted you so you were laying on her underside as she hung from the ceiling with her mouth and fangs by your head so she could more whisper to you.

“Yeah, only had to kill one of them. The rest were strangely respectful, although they all wanted me to turn them. But now they are all… well mostly straightened out. Still have a few things to work on but pretty good overall.” You said as you snuggled into her and you remembered your little promise to her before you left.

“Well that’s good.” She said and usually by now she was well on her way to cocooning you.

“Well, time for a little snack then sleep till the morning.” You stated and you could hear her get excited with anticipation. Her eyes being on the top side left her completely vulnerable like you were now, despite you not grabbing her or anything. It was the way she liked it so that she could gain the full experience. You moved your head to an open spot the sang your fangs into her. You heard her gasp and almost fall from her perch as you drank from her similar to how you did for Kelsey but more since she didn’t have school tomorrow. “Tasty as always.” You complimented as you both just stayed there for a moment in your own daze like trances. She for you feeding on her and you for your fatigue, it had been 5 months since you got a good rest.

“Have a good sleep, I’ll wake you if you’re not up by the morning.” She offered as she started her process of gently cocooning you.

“Thanks Eve, you’re the best.” You said before nodding off to sleep.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: More talking.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The new school year started and went on just like usual. While you had put the Vampire Clan in line the student faction of it acted the same. However, without the backing and the fear from the teachers and what not, they couldn’t just push their weight around anymore. Kelsey made quite a few of their jaws drop, both metaphorically and literally as they tried to force her to date them. As an eighth grade student you were not that bad and you family life was as usual, except your chores were easier to do. So at times you helped Doug out with whatever he needed. Helping out the Police wasn’t the most rewarding job, as the only person that knew about it was Doug, but it did keep you busy and from getting board. Usually all you needed to do was spit a saliva needle at a tire of a getaway car, or make all the guns jam. While people didn’t know why or how, it was known that if you did something that involved the Police Captain then it was pretty much over. But some people still pushed the limit from time to time.

“Hello?” you asked as you picked up the phone. You had finally got a cell phone. Your Father had finally cracked under the pressure to get the whole family their own phone. You were now officially on a leash as people could call you for any number of different things. You would have to eventually talk to them about that. You just didn’t have the time to go get someone’s purse from home in the middle of school or hunting. More than a few times they called while you were hunting. Some of your cousins were the worst in that respect.

“Hey Caleb, this it Doug. You got a little time?” asked the voice on the other end. “Yeah, just chilling at home, be there in a sec.” you answered then hung up.

“Again?” Eve asked as she was about to spend the night with you and Kelsey, watching a movie with the family.

“Yeah, I’ll hopefully be right back.” You said as she got off your lap. She liked laying on you at times, even if she was getting to big for it. It reminded her of old times and all that. For now she served as a blanket for you and Kelsey.

“You better, movie starts in an hour.” Kelsey stated in a matter of fact tone. You liked how comfortable you all were with each other. She no longer feared or was shy of your touch and you never thought that her Succubus side would dictate her to take the friendship you two had any further. And Eve, well she was… Eve. A very large and deadly spider that was more like a living stuffed animal with a gentle mind and heart. She even babysat kids and infants for the family. The parents wouldn’t overreact when they came back to their kids cocooned and hanging from the ceiling as they slept.

“Yes Ma’am.” You said then teleported to Doug, who was in his car and you now occupying the seat next to him in your V.C. attire. You both found it easier to hide your involvement like that. That way, only a select amount of people would know who was helping and even fewer would know who was underneath doing it all. “Alright, my movie starts in about an hour with the family so what you got?” you asked

“Thanks for coming.” Doug said then pointed to an old building and you didn’t have to wait long to hear a lot of gunshots and an explosion. “There are some well armed Mercs that hit a local bank in there. They’ve already killed a few of my men and are very well armed with military grade weapons. I would’ve called in some SWAT units but they did their homework and got my Family and a bunch others as hostages. Now they are demanding that I come in within the hour to ‘negotiate’ with them. I can’t imagine them being too honorable about it, as they’ve already killed two hostages on a whim. Thought maybe you could accompany me inside and if things get hairy then, well do your thing. We got the usual empty cells ready for you if it comes down to it and you can get a little snack while you’re at it.”

“Ok, I’ll come with you. But let’s try to get this done quick. Like I said, my movie starts in an hour and Eve will be all moody if I miss the start.” You agreed to which he smiled and started to drive to the building. You turned to mist and surrounded him in a light enough coat that you couldn’t be detected, even by Eve if she was there.

“To think that a situation such as this and neither of us are even the slightest bit worried about it. This would be a nightmare for anyone else’s mind, body, and career.” Doug said as he pulled up to which you just chuckled a response then turned silent as he put his hands up and walked to the front door. You could feel a few eyes and guns trained on him. With your mist so thin and spread out you could feel everyone inside.

“Careful, I’m sensing something wrong in there. I still got your back but just be careful.” You said to his mind as your mist was being repelled by something. An area or person that either your mist wouldn’t touch or something that was actively pushing it away. The only things that did that were fellow Predators/freaks or silver. Since you usually got a sick feeling from silver you were both curious and suspicious of what laid inside this place. Whatever was repelling your mist was dangerous enough for it not to get any closer. But the level wasn’t quite at the level of Eve. So all that remained was to find out what it was and deal with it, one way or another.

“This way.” Said a gruff man in full body armor. For the surrounded situation he was in, he didn’t seam all together very concerned. Doug followed the man as another shut the door they opened, readying but not raising his gun. This was either really good or really bad. Whomever this presence was had enough pull to effect the Mercs like this. It either had a slave system like you or had a way out. “In there and mind your manners or they’ll eat you.”

“They’ll what?” asked Doug in surprise, for the first time in a while. But the man walked away and no one was within a few feet of the door. The guards were at least 10 feet away and shaking slightly. “Caleb?”

“Yes?” you answered in his mind as he asked in his.

“What did they mean?” he asked as he was obviously asking what you were wondering.

“I’m not sure. All I know is that whatever it repelling my mist is coming from the other side of this door. It is being repelled like Eve or Kelsey would. My mist doesn’t get closer to prevent detection. But because of that and that I haven’t smelled this scent before, I can’t tell you what is beyond it. Only that it is probably a predator or freak like me. Doesn’t feel as powerful as Eve but that isn’t saying much as she is no slouch either. I still am well above this level though.” You answered and assured him.

“OK, well let’s get this over with then.” He said as he pushed open the door and stepped into the room. You looked along with him at a…
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Helping out Doug, again.

choices: They want her back now. Immediately.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“This is problematic.” You stated in Doug’s mind as you looked at two very large spiders that were easily 30 feet tall. The room was covered in a thick layer of webbing, not unlike your room in fact with the hostages hanging in partially constructed cocoons on the ceiling so they could still interact on a verbal level but not much more than that. You could sense a good number of spiders of all sizes around the two of you but very few that were anything more than a bigger wolf spider.

“Finally, we were getting tired of waiting.” Said one of the large spiders with a female voice at the far end of the room, granted the room was relatively small for them but it was still near a basketball court size so Doug could walk forward and the doors could close from the work of two dog sized spiders before disappearing into the maze of webbing.

“I apologize for my late arrival.” Doug stated with a polite bow. It wasn’t usually his thing but he had talked with Eve and knew how to compliment her, so he hoped they would react in a similar way. You both were on the same wave length to think that these might be Eve’s blood family. If that was the case then you didn’t want to harm them if it could be avoided.

“Finally, a human with some manners.” Said another female voice from the other spider. Now that you looked around you noticed there were very few males in the area. You made a note of it before turning you attention back to the pressing matter.

“I have come as requested. What do I owe the honor of such a summon?” Doug asked as he glanced at his family and was relieved to know they were alright, relatively speaking. They were cocooned with spiders crawling all over them but weren’t dead.

“Our daughter, where is she?” demanded one of them.

“Your daughter?” Doug asked.

“Don’t play with us human. We have been told and now know for ourselves that you reek with the scent of the royal blood. We are the queens of this area you humans call a ‘State’ or ‘Wisconsin’. We know you have her, our question was… Where?” the other spider asked, the last word in a clear threatening command as she crept slightly forward in a pose you both new, well you more than Doug, as when Eve got slightly angry or emotionally compromised. Eve never let it out but you knew the signs; hair bristled, subconscious movements, chattering of her fangs and/or mandibles.

“I only know of one like you, if she is what you say. I don’t know if she is the one you are talking about though. Please, can we talk about this? Just a moment ago I thought this hostage situation with my family was random idiots. But if you are Eve’s parents then… I owe it to at least her to try to help both her and you see each other.” Doug answered, raising his hands slightly to try and calm the situation down.

“Eve? Is that the human name you have given her?” asked the other one as they did partially move back from the escalation that they were just on.

“Well… yes that is her name but I am not the one who named her, nor am I the one she lives with and takes care of her.” Doug responded.

“Then who?” the two asked almost at the same time but close enough to sound like one questions.

“Uh… that is complicated. I can have him here in seconds but he is a little… shy I guess you could say. With so many people he wouldn’t show his face.” Doug answered.

“You think us a fool? You are trying to get us to release these other humans. This is where that thinking gets you.” said one of them to which she snatched a cocoon of a man and almost pierced the cocoon before all you teleported them all away along with wiping their memories. You only had one place to put them so you teleported them, without their eight legged captures, to the holding cell. You did this just in time as the fangs of the large spider went straight through the cocoon.

“That… was a very poor move.” you said out loud in you designated ‘Vampire voice’ you used with your little disguise as the spiders chattered and searched quickly for both the disappeared humans and the source of the voice. Doug only smiled as one dog sized spider lunged at him and was pushed back along with a few small ones that thought they could sneak their way onto him.

“What trickery is this human?” one of the two demanded.

“That would be the person I was telling you about. I am not doing any of this and it definitely isn’t a trick.” Doug answered

“Where are you, show yourself!” the other said to which you came together beside Doug. “You dare do this to us?” she said then lunged like Eve does at you. However, unlike Eve, this one was not use to attacking you. A front attack never worked and you proved this by raising a hand, catching her in midair, allowing her to float there for a moment then threw her back into the wall. She was back up shortly after, strafing a little but not daring to get closer until she could determine what you were doing and how you were doing it.

“So impatient, Eve use to be like that to. Now I know where she got it from.” You said as you lowered your hand.

“You have her? Give her back!” said the other but didn’t risk any more than that.

“Give her back? I never took her. I only saved her and gave her a home. She is part of my family now, not by blood obviously, but I have never held her against her will. If she wants to come here than she can, I’ll even bring her here. However, that is only if SHE wants it.” You answered.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Little predator(s).

choices: She wants nothing to do with them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“What are you talking about human? Why would one of the Spider Queens want to stay with a family of humans?” Asked one of them mockingly.

“Oh, I don’t know. Perhaps it was because took her in and we gave her a home. Or maybe it was that we have shown more love toward her than her own kind.” You returned.

“How dare you imply that we don’t love our own children. You will pay for that with your life.” Stated one of the spiders.

“Captain, I think things are going to get a little rough. I’ll send you back to your office if you wish.” You said over to him and to his nod you touched him, teleporting him back then sealed the door so the humans outside couldn’t interrupt. “Now I can talk and fight without risk”

“Who are you human?” Asked a strangely male voice that got the others that were ready to attack to become silent. It was an immediate transition as the once chattering and scampering sounds came to a deathly quiet. You looked on as a 20 foot tall spider came from one of the webbed tunnels in the room. You immediately recognized him as Eve’s father from his almost identical figure, minus the gender differences. Same silky black hair on his body, the same eye configuration, and a bunch of other things that you would only know.

“The point of this outfit is to hide my identity from the world. In doing so I secure my family and others I love from ill effects of the answer to that question. However, for the Father of Eve, I will amend that decision.” You stated then changed back to your normal relaxed wear. “My name is Caleb Konel.”

“How do you know I am her father?” he asked.

“Sir, you look just like her. Minus the obvious gender differences and size, you are an exact copy of her. I knew the moment I saw you that you were her father… although I’m not sure about the mother.” You said with a bow at first but ended with looking the two others over.

“You don’t seem as frightened of us as most humans are. Why is that?” He asked.

“Before I answer, may I know what to call you? A name or something, I don’t wish to be rude.” You asked.

“You may call me Arium.” He responded after a few moments to think about it.

“Well, to tell you the truth, I am slightly unnerved. I am not exactly a spider person. However, living with Eve does tend to enlighten the mind. We have been wondering if she had any blood family and where they might be. But I suppose it is also because I am not human.” you answered.

“Then what are you?” asked Arium rather directly.

“No offense Mr. Arium, but why would I tell you that. Being Eve’s father gets you a very decent amount of recognition and respect from me but I have yet to confirm if I can trust you yet.” You responded.

“So my daughter hasn’t been living with humans then?” he asked.

“She has. It is complicated where I live. I have an entire human family and we take care of each other, Eve included. However I do have another nonhuman friend that hangs out with us. In fact, before I was called here, we were about to have a movie night.” You answered.

“I see, that is rather complicated. However we must speak with her about her place here.” He replied to which you looked down and thought about it for a few minutes then looked back up at him.

“The most I can do is ask if she wants to come here and talk. As long as you agree to abide by her decision. I won’t have my family be bullied or targeted by any of your kind. I know full well that it would be death sentence for them. Is that agreeable?” You asked. You weren’t sure how many were like Eve. But if even a few more were like her or even half of what she is than they could wipe out your family in a single night. After all, it would only take a single bite from Eve to put you down for a few days.

“I can’t say that we will agree with her. However I can forbid any involvement of humans in this, wither directly or otherwise.” Arium replied.

“I guess that is good enough. I’ll go see if she wishes to come here.” You said then drew a glyph on the ground. “This is an anchor point to get back with her. Please stay clear of it as I’ll be back one way or another and don’t wish to harm any of your children.”

“How are you bringing her here?” he asked with a concerned tone.

“Teleportation, I can teleport anywhere that has this mark. Now, I’ve got to get back and talk with her about this. I’ll return with her or her answer within the night.” You responded then disappeared from their view.

“You’re back, and time to spare.” Kelsey said as she patted the cushion next to her. But both of them noticed your face as one that you needed something and/or had something heavy on your mind. “What is it?”

“Eve, we need to talk.” You stated.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They calm down.

choices: They try to force her to stay.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Ok, you need us here for it?” asked Papa as they were also in the room, ready to start the movie.

“Well… yeah I guess it would be better for everyone to hear this.” You answered to which they all sat up and Eve moved to an open spot. She could no longer solely sit on someone’s lap. While she sometimes acted as a blanket for you and the others that were that comfortable, she needed an actual spot on the floor to talk seriously.

“This sounds serious, is it a family thing?” Kelsey asked, wondering if it was something she should be apart of.

“Yes, so you should be a part of it.” You said then sat in your chair next to Eve and Kelsey. “Doug just brought me along for a hostage situation. I freed them but the people that took them only wanted one thing, their daughter back.”

“You got to be kidding.” Eve stated.

“Nope, the others I saw there were a little hard to believe. But I met a your father and he looks almost identical to you, bigger and a male but still almost a carbon copy of you. They said you are some kind of royalty or something. Now I’m not accusing you of anything but we do need to get this settled.” You replied back.

“Wow, Eve’s family. Can I see them?” Isaac asked innocently, in wonder of a bunch of spiders just like Eve.

“Unfortunately they don’t share the same value of human life. When Doug spoke out of turn, one of the large females tried to sink her fangs into one of the cocooned hostages. I of course teleported them all away but they could do some nasty damage. They already tracked Eve’s scent to Doug and if they come here…” You started but didn’t have to finish as they all seemed to understand.

“Can’t you just tell them you’re a Vampire and they’d leave us alone?” asked Luke.

“I left that up to Eve, if she wants them to know. I would like it if we keep the people that know to a minimum. I told them to wait for your answer Eve. They would like to speak with you. But if you don’t want to then I’ll make them understand and if worse comes to worse I’ll have to deal with them.” You revealed.

“So we are dealing with an army of Eve’s, sort of speak?” Mom asked.

“No, from what I saw there were only a few that were near dog sized and only 3 that were above that. The three were; Her father who I am guessing is just as potentially deadly as Eve is except about 20 feet tall, then two females that are about 40 feet tall but look really different and have the venom of about a wolf spider. I am guessing what makes Eve so special is what makes her of ‘royal blood’.” You answered.

“That big?” Sarah asked, freaked out that there were huge spiders out there besides Eve that WOULD eat her if they had the chance.

“Yes, but like I said, only very few were that large. The others were maybe plate size or smaller, lots of them but most smaller than that.” You returned but then looked over at Eve as she twitched and thought about what decisions were in front of her. You put a hand on her leg as it moved on its own. She quickly put it down but you didn’t remove your touch a she turned slightly to you. “You can meet them then decide if you want. Any way you want I’ll support your decision. You are still part of my family no matter if you decide to live elsewhere for a while or whatever. We owe you the chance to at least see your blood relatives.”

“True enough.” Papa agreed and they all gave smiles to her as if to solidify the point.

“But if you do, you better come and visit.” Kelsey teased to get some of the edge off.

“Thanks, you all are so wonderful I don’t want to leave. But maybe I should learn a little, like Caleb does with other Vampires in that thing Mr. Vale brought over. Only difference is I have them here, in this world. I just don’t know yet.” Eve said as she thought about it then straightened a little and announced. “Ok, please take me to see them.”
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: She comes back with you.

choices: She accepts and "allows" you to leave.
She declines and is... convinced otherwise.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
There was a jitter of movement as you came back. They had scurried over the spot after you left but with you returning with Eve they scurried away. You appeared in the room with Eve, your hand still on her leg but she sprung out in a highly defensive stance as soon as she was aware of her surroundings.

“Ah, so you finally arrive… my daughter.” Said her father as he remained in his position. To his sight and words Eve looked at you. It was hard to tell when a spider like her was looking at you in relation to a response but you had got to know her quite well so you could tell when she was doing so.

“You think I was kidding? He looks just like you… just bigger.” You replied and she turned slightly too fully address him but she paused for a while but you nudged her that got her out of her deep thought. It also made her cycling body spring a bit. But she was use to you as much as you were use to her so she didn’t attack you. “Go on, I’ll step in if you need help. Go say hi.”

It was clear that some of the others were struggling not to act as you addressed her in a fashion that they probably didn’t like. But she sighed and walked forward to address the room without you next to her. This was something she wanted to do on her own as much as she could.

“H…Hello… father.” She finally spoke as she looked up at the spider in front of her that was many times her size. She was quivering but it was unclear wither it was of fear or being anxious and perhaps both.

“No need to be shy my dear. You are royalty and as such the only one that can speak to me in such formality. I would think you have many questions.” Her father said as spiders surrounded you. They didn’t come to close but still was obvious that they weren’t about to let their guard down while you were there. “Human, you have done what you have said. Will you allow my daughter and I to talk in a more private setting?”

“No offense but neither of us know you. Being her father gets you far but neither of us know if can be trusted… yet. So until she feels safe I must remain. It is her choice, not mine and not yours.” You responded, which got a few hisses and scatters around the room but were silenced by a simple low hiss from him.

“I see you are very protective of her. I suppose I should be grateful for that. After all, it probably helped keep my daughter safe. And now that you have brought her here I can’t complain about the same attitude that allowed her to live this long. But be warned, humans don’t last long when referring to us higher status spiders with such familiarity.” Her father replied. You bowed your response then the focus shifted back to Eve. “So, my dear, will you allow your human to live and leave us to talk amongst ourselves. She almost responded with an outburst. But with a shake of your head you told her silently that you didn’t want them to know about your other side unless they had to. In such cases she knew you liked to be considered as a human, weird human, but a human none the less.

“First answer a question… father. Why did you leave me alone? Why did I have to look to humans to find acceptance over my own kind and family? Why did you abandon me?” She asked in multiple ways as she couldn’t find a single way to ask the question. It was a question you knew she struggled with. You had tried talking with her about it multiple times but it still bothered her.

“My daughter, you have no idea what it takes to give birth to a full blooded member of the royal family. Hundreds of spiders have to give their life for the chance. I am your father but out of 300,000 spiders these two and I are the only ones left alive from the birthing of the batch of eggs. All their essence, including my wife and former leader of our race, was absorbed and shot into these two. We all added our life force and wills along with the normal breeding procedure to create an egg sack full of millions of spiders. So the odds of you being what you are was not very good. Then when the eggs hatch you were all sent out into the wild. This helps keep the competent solders and family alive while disposing of any that would betray us. It also teaches each of you how to grow and survive. So in short, there was no way to know you were among them. But don’t mistake our race’s way of life to be abandonment. We do love you and we gave a lot for even the chance that you may be born. Don’t take that sacrifice lightly.” Her father explained. This was a scenario that Eve wasn’t ready for. She had assumed that they didn’t care about her and just cast her aside without a second thought. Such a revelation made her slightly emotional. You felt like comforting her but you didn’t want to add any more pressure to the situation.

“Did you say the leader of our race did as well?” Eve asked.

“Yes, it is customary for the leader to initiate the birthing process because the stronger the source of the birth the stronger the offspring and chance to produce a queen or royal spider. The strongest female is always the one that survives. What we didn’t know was that her age had made her weak. She hid it so well that we didn’t know until she was dead. Since then we have been hoping a queen was born from her sacrifice and here you are. Because she died in your development you will effectively be the strongest queen in history. All her essence would’ve been imparted to you rather than a fraction of it like normal birthing.” He explained.
