“But aren’t you the leader now?” Eve asked after she thought about what was said then continued.

“I am only a steward. Our race has always been led by a queen. But since I was suspected to be the only royal family left, I was chosen to lead until a miracle was given. You are that miracle and are the sole heir to our race’s throne, in human terms of description. We need you, my daughter, my queen.” He ended with what looked like a formal bow that all the others duplicated. It was a very strange feeling as they and you waited for her answer.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They start talking.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“I… I don’t know what to do.” She said as she thought and quivered. “Can I do whatever I want, as queen?”

“Yes, but you also have certain… duties to perform. We are not the only sentient spiders. Each territory has their own governing force. We are by far the purest and strongest. But we are by no means immortal. If not managed correctly, an invading force of other tribes or even other species can do much damage. We also help out the humans by feeding on the pests that invade their homes. It also allows our informants to gather information. That was actually how we found you. The humans call our territory ‘Wisconsin’ and we are pretty secure. So, you have more room to settle in than most times.” Her father said in a formal matter.

“So… can I still live where I have been?” she asked.

“You can. If you wish.” He replied but she didn’t seem to understand what that would mean, you did.

“See, I don’t have to leave.” She said to you but saw your look and was concerned. She knew it as a look when she wasn’t thinking correctly. “What?”

“You fail to see what living as a queen would be like. Do you really think they would just leave and leave you unguarded? You are their Queen, they would have the highest concentration of sentries and guards, with the more lethal potency protecting you. Not touching my family’s obvious phobia about spiders accept you. What do you think would happen if Isaac were to jump on you like he does now? Or what would happen if Kelsey were to tease you with her pheromones again. Or one of my cousins squirting you with water. At the very least, our home would be a den for your new… kingdom and its subjects.” You explained. With each question she understood more, and she began to see what you were talking about as you were only talking and they were almost offended to the point of attacking.

“So you don’t want me there?” she asked.

“When did I ever say that?” You asked in a tone that she knew you used on her when she was assuming too much… or little depending on the situation. “I WANT you there, but we both know I rarely get what I want. Besides, having a… well me as an ally could be helpful. I can come and visit and bring others with me. I know Isaac will miss you a lot as will many others. Not to mention they won’t stand a chance on family Vacations.” You answered and concluded with a joke. She giggled a little at it than was sorrowful again.

“I don’t want to lose you all. You may not be blood related but you are more than worth the family title.” She said as she started to whimper out a cry. None of the others were getting close to her so you did. They didn’t like it but you didn’t give them a choice as you held them back with a telekinetic barrier. You finally reached her and put a hand on her. She snapped into a half hug. She was getting to big to clamp onto your whole body with hers so her mandibles and front legs grasped you as she hugged you into her. You pet her along her eyes to sooth her, using your calming mind probe to help her do just that, calm her down.

“Hey, my Uncle Rusty lives way out in California. You don’t see us thinking any less of him do you? Just because you got a new life ahead of you doesn’t mean we are forgetting or shunning you. But you are growing up and we will be happy for you. Sad to see you leave, but happy that you are getting on with your life. Like I said, I’ll be around… if you want me to.” You comforted.

“Of course I want you around. I never want you to leave. But I wouldn’t be able to force you to stay with me all the time. You have your life to live as well.” She said after a while.

“We can keep him here if you wish.” Stated one of the female spiders from before, the big ones.

“No, you wouldn’t be able to. Even if I ordered it, which I won’t, none of you would be able to do more than piss him off. I prefer him as an ally, friend, and family over anything near an enemy, prisoner, or slave.” She said as she let you go and circled around. “In fact, that will be my first command and wish. His family is off limits no matter what. Even if they are attacking me, you are to do nothing to harm them in any way. If I find that they are distressed by any under me, than I will be more angry than I will know what to do with.”

“As you wish.” Said her Father but you could tell he was not understanding why.

“Can you stay, for a little bit?” Eve asked, or more accurately begged.

“Ok, only till the morning. I’ll just contact everyone silently to let them know of your knew status and responsibilities.” You answered, to which she brushed up against you then looked over at her father.

“Is it ok if I have this night to myself?” she asked.

“You may. There are some things you really should take care of. But one more day won’t hurt.” He replies then escorts her… and you, to an area. You both talked about things and you spent most of the night comforting her and getting her ready for her new and sudden change. In the morning she didn’t want to let you go, but you had convinced her to do so and concentrate on her task. If she was going to be a Queen, than she should be the best damn Queen in history. If nothing else, you had her back. That calmed her more than anything.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: She accepts and "allows" you to leave.

choices: Another world to visit after school.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“What’s the matter?” asked Kelsey as you two walked to your next class. Of course you had to watch out for the Vampire Clan and some of the other upperclassman but that was kind of natural by now.

“Huh? Nothing, I’m fine.” You said in a default answer. But the fact that you added the ‘huh?’ in there was not a sign that things were fine.

“Now I know things aren’t ‘fine’. Caleb, you’ve been distracted all day and a little since Eve left. It’s been a few months and we all are accepting of it… except you.” Kelsey said.

“I guess that’s true. I just miss her I guess.” You stated.

“You really like her, don’t you?” Asked Kelsey, as usual the slightly jealous and pouting sense of the question alluded you.

“Of course I like her. I like her just as much as I like you. Let’s face it. Being around humans all the time can get tiring and… stagnate. With you and Eve it was something more special. I value you two a lot and I’m sorry if I never said it. In the back of my mind I know that your duties with your kind will take you away as well. I will miss you a lot as well.” You admitted.

“Oh, you’ve said how much we mean to you on more than one occasion. That’s not what I…” Kelsey started but remembered your inability to have children as well as limited immortality. She induced that dangling that situation in front of you again would not be a kind move. So she quickly became more sympathetic. “I’m sure she’ll have more time later. She has to get the hang of the whole Queen thing and it may take a while. Knowing her, I’m surprised she hasn’t sent a hoard of her little… subjects to get you. She has always been attached to you, sometimes literally.”

“So, how has popular life been treating you?” You asked as you both sat down in class. I was a free period instead of the usual study hall. Because of some changes there was no homework. Even when there was some, the teacher that was in charge of it knew that the both of you got done with your work very fast. So, as long as you two were relatively quiet, you could speak. But since it was usually quiet in the room it was difficult to speak about sensitive things. Today however, people were more noisy.

“Kind of annoying. You would think that being in eighth grade would help, but it just makes the guys hornier and the girls more jealous. It helps that I have the hottest guy in the school as a friend.” She answered. “What about you.”

“Well, it helps that I keep my attractant down. People treat me normal because of that. Sure I get a few looks every once in a while. But they just go right past and go for the guys that will notice their… lack of decency. What is it with girls and showing as much skin as possible?” You asked in a board tone. Normally it would be a mute question but Kelsey knew it was an actual one. She didn’t know if she should be aghast at his lack of interest in such things or impressed.

“So you don’t like this?” she asked as she draped her neck line down with her finger perhaps more seductively than was necessary. Once again, the suggestiveness went right over your head. You looked at her, what she was doing, then back to observing the class passively.

“Like I said before. If all I wanted was a body I could just ensnare a Playboy chick or any of the women around. Heck, your Mother even offered. Without the person it would be little difference than you seducing one of your servants.” You answered.

“That would be rather boring, wouldn’t it?” she agreed. “Did I mention how special you are?”

“About as often as I say it to you, many times.” You answered with a smile at her.

“So things like that doesn’t interest you either?” she asked, but more joked, as she directed you vision to Carly. She had a habit of wearing border line dress code skirts then jacking them up when teachers weren’t looking. She currently was sitting on the study hall table so that over half the class could see up her skirt without strain. Not much different could be said for her other clothing. As strict as the school was in dress code, there were obvious holes in it, that she used every day.

“Please, she’s a Junior High girl that is trying to compete with a Succubus. She isn’t even in your league. I half expect her to be pregnant before senior year. I bet that will shut her up a little. Changing in her hard worked slim figure for a baby and a dozen extra pounds.” You answered, complimenting Kelsey and securing your stance in her eyes.

“Some how I doubt that. She has a big mouth. She probably would still try to fit into those clothes, even with a pregnant belly sticking out of them and rolls of fat in other places.” She joked.

“You’re probably right.” You commented then you both shook the image out of your heads. With your overweight family you weren’t against those kind of people. But Carly already was wearing clothes a few sizes too small. The sight of fat rolls starting to rip the seams of the clothes while the billowed out and her trying to seduce someone with such a look was a little much.

“So, you getting hungry?” She asked.

“Not yet. I had some… of Sarah about a week ago. Not a lot to do since then and Doug hasn’t had me do anything strenuous to need more. Why? Volunteering?” You asked as you playfully licked your lips to which she blushed.

“Not… well… maybe… My Mother also wouldn’t mind. You have to know she’s been craving it ever since you fed on me. She feels kind of left out.” Kelsey stated.

“I suppose. How about this. Tell her that you convinced me to feed on her the next time I get hungry. I don’t mind you taking the credit.” You offered.

“Really? You don’t mind?” She asked.

“Sure, now that I think of it. Mother’s day is coming up. Why don’t I stop by then? It can be your gift.” you suggested.

“What about your Mother?” she asked.

“Oh, she doesn’t really get into the whole sensual side of feeding. Sure she likes it like everyone else but she prefers little trinkets and stuff she can keep and look at to remind herself of us or something. The way I see it, feeding on your mother will allow me to materialize something awesome for her. Last year I got her a heart chest made of gold with sliver trimming and diamonds around it to keep all her jewelry. Papa asked me to keep it down this year so that the others had a chance… including him.” You revealed to which her eyes sparkled at imagining it. The rest of the class was used to talk about other random stuff.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: School.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It was draining on you that Eve hadn’t even contacted you at all. You saw a few spiders around and asked them. But it is hard to have a conversation with a spider when they don’t have a mind to do so. They just scurried off or at most hissed at you. You knew they were forbidden to bite you or your family but it was getting to the point that you were tempted to seek her out to see if she was ok. But either way, the summer was coming around and you were waiting for Mr. Vale to come. Summer Vacations were subtly dismissed. Not that most of them didn’t want to do it. It was just getting harder to convince their jobs and lives that a few month vacation was needed. So you agreed and just went to visit them. Running to California or New Hampshire and back wasn’t so bad in the area of exercise. Not only that but they almost insisted you do so on an empty stomach so you could drink from them during your visits. With Kelsey’s Mother joining the group of people you drank from, it was becoming a literal blood family. Although you made sure they knew they weren’t just there to feed you. You had gone on a blood fast a few times when they indicated such. Finally you caught the scent of Mr. Vale at the door before he knocked at it.

“Hello? Oh, Mr. Vale. Caleb has been waiting eagerly for you.” Your Mother stated as she invited him into the house.

He nodded in a polite manner but stayed silent as she escorted him down stairs to the meeting room where your family was enjoying a movie. You had to adjust your eyes to do so as the light from the new HDTVs bothered them slightly but it was possible. You even made a game at trying to replicate the special effects that the movie produced. Sometimes you could, other times it could end up with a weak version. Yet it was entertaining none the less. Kelsey was around most of the time. She preferred it and her Mother, after a long talk with you and securing your inability to have children, allowed her over as much as she wanted. It wasn’t like you would be sleeping with her or anything. For starters you couldn’t sleep. But in either case she like the nonservant oriented atmosphere of your house. Papa and Mom were just glad that you had someone else in Eve’s absence to confide in, more specifically in the area of your Vampire side. As hard as they tried, they couldn’t pretend to understand. Kelsey couldn’t either, but she was closer. Suffice to say, the room perked up when the long expected Mr. Vale came in.

“Mr. Vale, it is good to see you again,” you replied as you stood to address him.

“You are too kind Master.” He responded with a bow. Kelsey nudged you comically at the ‘Master’ word.

“I assume you are here to escort me to another world created by Miss. Isibelle?” you asked in a form of verification.

“Yes. I hear we have more time than before. Is that correct?” he asked.

“Yes. As much as it helped, my family have their lives to attend. It was a great help while it lasted but I assume none on the rising level of challenges that you will be affording,” you responded.

“As you say, my Master. Are you ready to depart?” He asked.

“I suppose as ready as I’m going to be,” you replied after getting an affirmative nod from Papa and Mom then getting a hug and kiss on the cheek from Kesley.

“Then, out of respect for your human family I will present you with two options. One is slightly more adult in content and the other is more childish. While they are both challenging in their own rights, I understand that at certain ages things shouldn’t be allowed. However the other that you don’t choose must be visited next year in accordance with the carefully created guidance Mistress Isibelle has created.” Mr. Vale stated then pulled out two series and put them on the table that was currently in the center of the room. The two you had to choose from were…
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Another world to visit after school.

choices: You quietly observe as you enter their world.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“So you won’t be helping in this one?” You asked as you walked down a crowded street. You were wearing your usual black sleeveless with the silver dragon on the back and glyph on the front, black shorts, and your special black shoes with the knife hidden inside. You didn’t need the knife but it was there none the less. Kelsey was having a hard time letting you go so she insisted you fill up on blood before you left. It left her weak but satisfied that she helped in your new venture. Either way, you were at full power, had a pleasant taste in your mouth, and was about to separate from Mr. Vale. You knew little of this realm as well but your parents insisted that you not go into the Blade realm until next year. Being in a series that killed hundreds of people, wither they be Vampires or humans, could wait another year.

“I helped in the last one because it was your first. Now that you know the volatile and unknown nature of another realm it is best if you figure it out by yourself. It is just another form of experience training.” He replied as he stopped just before the main streets of the city you were about to enter. “I will come and get you when you have learned what the realm was meant to teach you. Try to learn from the Vampires like you did in the previous one. They will be able to teach you much but be careful whom you trust. That is all the advise I am allowed to give.”

“Very well, thanks and see you later,” you replied, then with a wave he disappeared. You wondered it that was a power you would get eventually or something only he had. Either way, you could see why Miss. Isibelle kept him around. He seemed insanely loyal and useful. One had to wonder what she did for him to follow her instructions so much like this. “So… if I was a Vampire, were would I hide?” You asked comically.

“Hello,” greeted a boy with blonde haired boy. His fangs were easily visible as was his scent. What intrigued you was that he was out in sunlight. Were the Vampires of this realm immune to sunlight like you were?

“Well that was easy,” you said then bent down to meet him on his level. You felt he was old in a deceptive way. Kind of like you in that you were young but the power inside was extremely old. But, unlike the Vampires in the other realm, you felt no hostility in him or evil for that matter. “Hi.”

“You kinda look weird. Oh, my name is Kotaro,” the young boy said.

“You think so? My name is Caleb and it nice to meet you. If you don’t mind me asking, why are you out here all on your own?” You asked as you tried to figure out how the world worked. In the last one you visited it would because they were a level E. If that was the case than… you really didn’t want to think of killing this young boy.

“My brother and I were on our way to the Special Zone. But we were attacked by soldiers and got separated. He said that he would play decoy while I got away.” He answered.

“Well I’m new around here. What is the special zone?” you asked.

“Wow, you must be from REALLY far away if you don’t know what the special zone is. Everyone does… wait, do you know what Vampires are?” He asked as if he was determining how clueless you were. But his own nature seemed to amplify this feeling of ignorance.

“I am, and yes I know what Vampires are. Not sure everything about them but I know some of the basics. But I assume from your fangs that you are one. Do all Vampires around here have the ability to be out in the daylight?” You asked.

“I don’t know. I don’t think so. My brother can’t but there must be others right?” He answered with a smile. However it vanished as he saw some humans dressed in full armor. “Oh no! I got to get out of here.”

Maybe it was out of impulse or whatever but he grabbed your hand and led you along with him down alleys and through streets as he ran. You didn’t know where to go or what to do but this young boy seemed pure enough to trust… for the moment. He finally stopped as he tripped over a bottle and into an alley to which you met a pair of people, also Vampires but older and one was carrying a wounded one. The stench that reeked from the wound was undoubtedly silver and you could see sun burns on their flesh. Evidently Kotaro was right about the others not being immune to the sunlight. After a bit of persuasion that you allowed him to take the lead on, he agreed to travel with them.

“You are free to come as well. But as a human your freedom in our camp will be limited at best.” The man said.

“I understand.” You said at the same time as a woman from behind you. She wore a blue uniform and had brown hair as well as catching her breath like she was just running.

“Mimiko!” Kotaro exclaimed as he ran up and gave her a big hug. You were now surrounded by people you didn’t know and over half of them were other vampires that you didn’t have the specs on. But for appearances you kept your cool.

“You are also welcome to come along.” The man stated, after taking a minute to think it over. You didn’t like the grin he had but followed him with the other two. In a way you were learning a lot. You learned that at least these Vampires couldn’t sense you. That either meant they were too weak or they couldn’t. Either way, you had no real reason to show them otherwise.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Black Blood Brothers

choices: Wait until something tells you who is on the good side.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“So who are you?” asked Mimiko as you sat with her at a table. For a while you played with Kotaro along with her, making little paper things and what not. But before long they went to play with the other children and you were sitting with her and a woman named Kelly Wong.

“Uh… That’s tricky,” You answered as you scratched your head, trying to figure out how much to say. The last realm you were in was able to handle it. But something told you that it would be harder for most to accept. Heck, most people in the other one that already knew better still didn’t believe. They accepted but weren’t willing to believe it. A strange mindset to have but still, it did warrant a certain amount of caution. “Well my name is Caleb.”

“Yes, we figured that much out by Kotaro’s speaking with you. It appears you aren’t from around here.” Kelly stated as if telling you to explain.

“You could say that. I just arrived and bumped into Kotaro. He kind of grabbed me when he was running so I just went along with it,” You replied.

“You just let a child grab you and pull you along. Then you followed the said child into a known Vampire den just for kicks?” Mimiko asked.

“Not exactly… well I suppose that is what happened but not my reasoning. I suppose there is no getting around it. I am a Vampire as well.” You replied.

“You are? You smell like a… well now that you say it you do have a tint of a Vampire scent on you. But your overall scent is human and… something else.” Ms. Wong responded after subtly taking in your scent.

“Yes. Where I come from, I am the only Vampire. I was turned by the only other one before me. Kind of like a village blood line secret. Anyway, when my type turns another we die so I was given mine about 3+ years ago. Relatively speaking, I am a new Vampire. I worked hard to live among my human family safely and peacefully. But admittedly, I know little about what it is to be a proper Vampire. So my family sent me here to learn from other Vampires. When I saw Kotaro I could sense his pure nature so I just stuck with him. I don’t know anything about what most of you are talking about. Being raised by humans can do that,” you replied as you addressed as many of their questions as possible without saying too much. You wisely left out the whole them being a Anime series thing.

“I see. If what you are saying is true, than we’ve been really rude. Is there something I can get you?” asked Ms. Wong.

“No thank you. One of my close friends let me drink from her before I left. She said it was her way of making sure I was safe. So I’m full at the moment.” You replied.

“So all this talk about Kowloon children and things must be confusing huh?” asked Mimiko.

“At first. But believe it or not I have heard about such things before. Just not in relation to the terms you are using. To be honest I am glad it is only that,” you stated back.

“What do you mean?” Asked Ms. Wong, slightly confused at your referring to an obvious crisis they have with such complacency.

“Where I come from there are major organizations known as the ‘vampire clan’. Just a bunch of humans that want to be vampires and try to act like what the movies depict them to be. I do say that it is quite annoying. I must say, that I prefer a setting where the bad people are known in such a black and white sense. Back home, I can’t really do anything about my problem. I mean they are humans, idiot humans, but innocent humans none the less. I don’t kill or feed on innocent people. So… Like I said, I’m glad,” you clarified as you looked out the window.

“Well, maybe it is a human thing, but I am glad you don’t feed or kill innocent people,” Mimiko stated with a smile.

“As am I,” Ms Wong said but noticed the rare gleam of sunlight hit your face and not do anything. “I’m sorry. Not that your story isn’t believable, but you don’t seem like one of us. You mind showing something?”

“Not at all,” you replied as you turned back to her. First you protruded your fangs before retracting them. Then you let your eyes flash for her and finally allowed your Vampire scent and attractant out in a minimal setting then retracted that as well. “Good enough?”

“How can you hide so well? Sunlight doesn’t even effect you,” Ms. Wong asked.

“It is something only my type can do… well as far as I know. Kotaro seems to be able to survive in sunlight just fine. Like I said, I was sent here to learn from other Vampires. I met a few I learned from about a year ago but now I came here,” you answered. However, shortly after a chopper appeared above the house and started shining lights that Ms. Wong fled from and you got to your feet as if not sure what to do.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Talking with Mimiko.

choices: Jiro accepts you to travel with them.
You are accepted into the Special Zone but must part ways with them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Wait!” Mimiko yelled as she followed after her. You never understood why every single character in every show that was slightly important expected other people to wait on them. Did it even occur to her that Ms. Wong would die if she waited in, what appeared to be, a ‘sun lamp’ light? Either way you followed after them but was just in time to see the doors get blasted open and Mimiko on her knees like she just fell. You reached for her to help her up but got a shot of pain in your arm for your efforts. Before you could do much else your body was littered with bullets. You weren’t expecting them to shoot without warning. Not only that, but the silver bullet in your arm was slowing down your speed. But soon about 40 more rendered your body motionless and sprawled on the ground. You thought about trying to get up. But knowing your luck you would just get pumped full of more holes.

You could vaguely hear Mimiko scream and a somewhat large commotion going on. You waited to you were alone before you used your mist to rid yourself of your silver passengers. You got your bearings back and wondered to the courtyard where the commotion seemed to centered. You didn’t have much time to think as you saw Kotaro being held by the man you had seen with Ms. Wong. But by the look of it, they were no longer on the same sides. Along with some well placed and overheard words, you ascertained they were this ‘Kowloon’ that you heard so much about. They sprung away before you could do much as you were still suffering the effects of the silver for a few moments as you limped into an entrance.

“I have no intention in apologizing at the moment. But when this all over you’ll have my gratitude.” Said a guard as you entered the area.

“Oh come on. Can’t I get a little sorry or something? That silver hurt like hell,” you stated as you leaned on a wall then throwing a bullet you missed from your body.

“Caleb!” exclaimed Mimiko. “But you were shot, many times.”

“Yeah well… I told you I was different. Although I would’ve preferred not being shot at all,” you replied as you stretched your body a little and your visible wounds, and shirt, healed back to normal. “It looks like you are about to go get Kotaro back. Mind if I tag along?”

“If you can keep up. We can’t afford to waste any more time. Why do you want to help?” Asked a very powerful looking Vampire in a red outfit.

“Well I hate people that assault little kids, especially Vampires. Seriously, they couldn’t pick on someone even half their size?” You answered then twirled your arm as if to work out the kinks then did likewise with the other as you walked and into the open more and off the wall. “Plus Kotaro seems like a good kid.”

“Let’s go.” The Vampire in red stated. You noticed he had a sword that looked… very dangerous, even to you. Judging by the guy’s scent, you could tell he probably could use it in more than a skilled fashion. He also seemed personally attached to Kotaro. You thought you heard him call him his brother but now wasn’t the time to worry about it. As he jumped into the night at an insane speed you followed. But you found that you weren’t as good at jumping and flying as he was. So you stuck to the strait stretch of a road that led to the bridge.

You didn’t have time to have fun with each of the Vampires that got in your way or in the way of the Vampire you were apparently allies with. So you used your saliva needles to take them out. It was obviously not something they were expecting so they didn’t bother dodging. That ended up being a fatal mistake. One shot to the head and they ashed just like a fictional Vampire would. You let the others catch up so you weren’t stuck in a situation you knew next to nothing about. But as you closed the gap you shot to saliva needles into the legs of the running Vampire, well the one Carrying Kotaro anyway. This stopped him and you sped between him and where he was going, shortly followed by the other three that were chasing him.

“You should’ve told me you were one of us. I would’ve gave you a place by my side.” The Vampire said that was holding Kotaro, as if trying to entice you.

“Let Kotaro go, or I’ll kill you.” you demanded in your ominous voice that you used when your emotions were slightly forward in your decision making. Kotaro wasn’t really having that big of an effect. I was the fact that this ‘Kowloon child’ had thought it wise to destroy a child’s life and attempt to replicate the pattern.

“You would let them into the Special zone?” the Vampire beside you asked, as if trying to gauge your intentions. It had only been at best an hour since he met you, so it was understandable. Especially if Kotaro was his brother.

“I know next to nothing about your apparent feud with these ‘Kowloon children’. So I don’t know enough to hinder anyone from anything. That conflict is up to the two of you and I don’t have a problem with either outcome or side at the moment. What I do have a problem with is Vampires that think it is ok to feed on, kill, and use children for their own gains as if they were trash or tools. Innocents are bad enough, but kids… that just pisses me off,” you replied then glared at the Vampire in question. “Time’s up. Release him, or die.”

“You think you can order me around? I don’t care who any of you are. I do what I want and will…” he started but was interrupted by the Vampire beside you increasing his power. This made him drop Kotaro. “That’s impossible! He’s using the Hide Hand.”

You waited as you saw the Vampire beside you rush forward. You had learned something new and Kotaro wasn’t in danger for the moment. So you let things play out. This ‘Hide Hand’ seemed useful. It was like a telekinetic power that effected things as its wielder willed. Applications began flooding your mind but your attention was still on the situation at hand. You watched as the Vampire commanded the little girl he had turned to be a blocker for the sword coming at him. But she was shot by Ms. Wong. You searched her mind and saw her intentions and deemed them understandable.

“Ha ha. You shouldn’t let your emotions get the better of you.” The other Vampire said but Kotaro was having none of that. He pushed off with his feet, giving him a good shot considering he was hogtied at the moment. “Ah! That’s it!” he said as he went to kick the bound and still squirming Kotaro only to have his foot caught by you.

“I thought I was clear. Let Kotaro go and you get to live,” you stated then squeezed his leg hard enough to sever it halfway up his calf where you had your hold. He tried to crawl towards what you assumed was the special zone but you flipped him over so he was face up and shot a series of saliva needles into his body, pinning him to the street. As he only had 2 out of the usual 4 limbs left he wasn’t hard to restrain in this fashion. The red dressed Vampire finished him off with a single sword plunge to which the impaled Vampire turned to ash as your needles went away.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“I am afraid that would be a little too much,” the Vampire you had now come to know as Jiro, aka Silver Blade, stated upon your request to travel with them. Mimiko had invited the three of you into the Special zone. You were surprised of the strength of the barrier surrounding it. It would take almost every drop of energy you had remaining to break in if you wished to do so. Much easier to just get invited in. But now it looked like his cautiousness on Kotaro’s behalf was dictating his preference away from you.

“Awe… does he have to go?” Kotaro asked.

“I’m sure I could hold one more person in my apartment if we had to.” Mimiko stated but you didn’t wish to cause them any trouble. That and you were grateful that Jiro had put you on the no kill list. Honestly you didn’t know if you could win in a straight fight. He had already demonstrated a few skills that you had no knowledge of. It was quite possible that he and his hidden allies would be more than a match for you. Heck, you were only a 15 year old kid and a 3 year old Vampire. There was no way you had the experience they did as being centuries old.

“No, it’s ok,” you interjected to prevent another round of arguments between them. You knelt down to Kotaro to address him more directly. “Thank you very much for your company. I really did learn a lot from you. Even all tied up like that you still got a shot in on that other Kowloon guy. It was an honor and pleasure to meet you. I’m sure we’ll bump into each other again in the future.”

“You sure?” He asked.

“Yep, I have a feeling that it will be sooner rather than later.” You replied with a smile then stood before things could get to drama filled. “Thank you for your help and tolerance. I hope to see you soon.”

“As do we.” Jiro stated to which you nodded to each other in somewhat of a fake smile that you both put on for Kotaro. With that done you waved to them as they left and went to explore this ‘Special Zone’.

Walking around a place that was supposed to be a safe haven for Vampires wasn’t as glamorous as you thought it would be. Even as the day came to a close and the night came you didn’t really find anything worth gawking at. You found yourself wishing you had stayed with Jiro, Kotaro, and Mimiko. At least things were interesting with them around.

As you wondered aimlessly you observed a few things that you weren’t took keen on. You witnessed a few kidnappings and a few Vampire Feedings. But once again, you didn’t know enough about the realm you were in to help one side or the other. But there was one instance that you found yourself interfering, as you knew for a fact that the girl in question didn’t want to die from being fed on and the Vampire cornering her did want to drink her dry.

“No, please just let me go.” The girl begged. She was a small little thing maybe about 14 years old. Maybe there was something to the fact that she looked strikingly similar to Kelsey, just less… well succubus like. That and if she was Kelsey she would’ve clobbered this idiot by now… or enslaved him. But for now this girl was in trouble and obviously trembling in fear. One of many ways that even you preferred your meals. Though you only scared the person before drinking when you were up at Vacations. You just weren’t cruel enough to do it any other time, as if you would drink from a complete stranger like that.

“Ah, my dear. Don’t be afraid. I promise that your last moments will be filled with nothing but bliss.” Said the Vampire as he cornered her in a dead end alley. She tried to strafe from side to side in order to find a gap to run through. But the more she moved the more hopeless she saw the situation. The only thing you learned from this little incident was that it apparently felt orgasmic to be bit in this realm, just like with you… or close to it.

“I can’t say the same about you,” you interjected as you made your presence known as you leaned against one of the walls that lined the alley. You stood straight as you were done observing him.

“What do you want human? You do realize what serious trouble you’re in right now, right?” He asked. You wondered if your technique of hiding your Vampirism was really that effective so they couldn’t tell you were one. But Jiro seemed to be able to tell so you induced that they were just arrogant… or weak… or both.

“Funny. I was under the impression that, here in the special zone, Vampires were forbidden to drink from unwilling hosts,” you stated.

“So you know about us huh? Does that mean your with the Company?” asked the Vampire as the girl behind him was moving to the more open area he wasn’t blocking in order to escape.

“Not at all. I just arrived in the Special Zone this morning. But I more than know about Vampires. Until know I’ve been observing. But this girl obviously doesn’t wish to be drank from. That and I have a permanent bias against Vampires that such blood from unwilling hosts, specifically the innocent ones,” you revealed.

“Is that so,” he said then looked at the girl as she had almost made it past him. She froze as she fell under his glare. He looked to be on the verge of either backing off or doing something sadistic. His wicked smile at her almost made you act but you gave him the benefit of the doubt for now. But your muscles flexed with preparation to rush to her defense if needed.

What does he do?

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The alley was narrow to begin with so he had more than enough room to grab a hold of her and put her in between you and him. He held her body against his as he looked over her shoulder so that he was teasingly close to her neck as his arms both pinned her arms as well as groped her into his body. The way he was holding her, he could easily use her as a shield of get a few gulps of blood in before disposing of her by the time you could get her away from him. The girl screamed at the sudden position change but then only whimpered as she stood groped in his arms. She was terrified and the emotion showed as he chuckled at his accomplishment and position.

“She must be your girlfriend of something. In that case, I’ll let you join her once she is in hell,” he stated then licked a section on her neck, reveling in her quivering and whimper.

“You are mistaken. I have never met her before. But if you don’t release her I will not hesitate to kill you,” you responded to which you only got a sadistic laugh and another pleasure lick to his future feeding area. “What is your name human?”

“Andrea.” She answered with a quiver but also almost out of breath. She was in pain from his groping and in horror at the prospect of being drank dry by a real live Vampire.

“Andrea, I promise that everything will be ok. You will live through tonight.” You assured with a content smile that was lost on her at the moment. You could tell that she just hoped it was true.

“You shouldn’t make promises you can’t keep.” He said as he laughed to which he grew his fangs in preparation. She grew bug eyed as she saw the deadly fangs with the corner of her eye.

“I don’t.” You said. With that you used your abilities, compliments of Kaname, to crush both of his arms and push him back from Andrea. She screeched at this and ran a few steps before noticing that she was actually free. She looked behind to the howling Vampire as he fell back into a wall, now armless. The sight and experience was too much for her so she fainted. You rushed forward, catching her and laying her against a wall before turning your attention back to the loud and threatening Vampire that now had two less limbs.

“What have you done? Do you know who I am? I am part of the Coven, the most influential group in the Special Zone,” he boasted proudly.
“Hmm. Somehow I doubt that. Even if that were true, then I would be doing them a favor by ridding them of an unruly member. Either way, I did warn you what would happen if you didn’t let her go.” You replied back as you stood over him. You weren’t that big compared to him but everyone would seem tall if the person being compared was sprawled out on the ground.

“But she’s alive, isn’t she?” He said as he seemed to realize that it was butt kissing time. “I was just going to scare her. I wasn’t actually going to drink all her blood.”

“I have a suspicion that you are lying through your teeth,” you challenged.

“Me? Lying? Never. I am and always will be a man of my word.” He defended to which you knew that it wasn’t true.

“I suppose you deserve a chance. As you’ve said, she is alive. I will allow you to leave under the condition that you go to your master and tell him what happened. If you wish you can leave out the part of you scaring young Andrea almost to death. However I expect some kind of confirmation by tomorrow. Understood?” you asked.

“Y-yes.” He stuttered then took the chance of limited and potential freedom to run. You weren’t too eager to kill in general so you let him go. You were lost and board anyway, so having some big wig address you might be of some use.

But for the immediate future you had this young girl to look after. You couldn’t just leave her there. So you picked her up and leapt onto a tall platform you had seen before. It was on the back side of a tall billboard and had about a 20x70 foot area behind it and out of view. Because of the loud city underneath it was confined enough to hide a scream if necessary. So now you laid her down against the wall so she didn’t roll off or fall off upon awakening then stood on the edge, looking over the city.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You stood over the city, well most of it, from your perch. Listening and watching too many things as they unfolded. You observed that there was not as much ‘peace’ as you thought there would be in a city so dedicated to establishing such a goal. On top of that you smelled an overflow of blood like you hadn’t smelled before. It was almost intoxicating as its unmistakable scent was carried to your nose. Not that it was a bad smell. Like any Vampire, you greatly enjoyed the smell of fresh blood. But the concept of why it was there was what made you despise the smell at the moment despite its effect of making you crave the tasty liquid. You didn’t know what made you sicker. The smell of so much death or the fact that you felt yourself, or more accurately your body, be so attracted to it in a primal desire to feed. But it was this realization that kept you in check. You doubt that if you hadn’t been thinking about it that you would’ve been able to catch yourself in acting on those instincts and urges. The only good thing you observed was a few more people using the coveted ‘hide hand’ that you were currently seeking. From this your observations you were able to direct your body’s instincts and thoughts to figure it out. In a way it was like an extremely advanced version of your telekinesis technique that you had picked up from Kaname. However it also used almost double the amount of energy. Perks included making a mostly impenetrable kinetic shield around you or where ever to stop hold or direct projectiles. Most commonly you saw it increase natural abilities and catch bullets. But now you understood why the bridge you were on with Jiro almost ripped apart when he did it. It was a very powerful technique. Another weakness it had was that it lacked the preciseness of Kaname’s technique. So while useful, it didn’t replace your other abilities and you still needed to practice it.

“Uh…” came a moan as your thoughts were brought back to Andrea, who was waking behind you.

You felt that she may react better if you weren’t smothering her with attention right off the bat. So you kept looking over the city. After all, you were near her age and, even with your enhanced physic, still looked your own age. Hopefully giving her a little space would help her remain calm despite her previous condition. You also hoped you wouldn’t have to force the issue. You heard her heart race as she realized and confirmed where she was and who you probably were to get her up where she was. But her heart beat slowly calmed down as she started to process her situation. At the very least she was alive and that had to get you some points.

“Um… Excuse me,” she stated to get your attention. You turned and looked at her as nicely as you could but still in a stance that signified some amount of power, enough that your defeat of her previous… host would be more than believable. You thought about showing your eyes but decided against it. “Thank you for saving me from the… that was a Vampire… right?” she asked as if not believing what she was remembering but enough to ask, hoping that wasn’t the case.

“Yes, he is a Vampire. So am I. But while he seemed to force his way on young girls like yourself, I find that behavior disgusting and insanely immoral. Are you ok?” You answered than followed up with a question on her well being. You hoped that it would signify you weren’t like probably the only other Vampire she had been in contact with.

“I… yes, I suppose I am ok… for now.” She answered as she checked herself for injuries and whatnot. She more than once checked her neck for any sign of teeth marks. But her answer was clear that she was not really trusting you. As you had just confirmed yourself as the same type of being that almost killed her, she wasn’t sure what you wanted. “So what, saving me for later or something?”

“Not exactly. You just look like someone I know and care for very much. So when I saw you cornered by that other guy I couldn’t just let him have his way. As you can probably imagine. Saving everyone in a city this big is not possible. Lately I was just observing and seeing if at least some of the Vampires here were honorable. Apparently there are laws that dictated their actions. But as the saying goes, rules are meant to be broken. Hate to say it but they break laws just as often as you human do. Go figure, for all their self righteous arrogance, they are no different than those they belittle.” You answered and ranted a little before pausing then looking at her more calmly. “I am sorry you were attacked like that.”

“Well it wasn’t you, I suppose. And you did save me from the Vampire that was going to kill me. But won’t he just come back?” She asked.

“He might. But I took off his arms. If you can’t defend yourself against a no armed Vampire than, no offense, but you are just asking for it. Plus a no armed man of any stature should be easy for you to spot.” You replied in a joking manner to which she cracked a smile.

“Does that mean you’re not going to… you know?” She asked as she gestured to her neck, asking you if you were going to drink her blood.

“Not unless you asked me to. Even then it would be a rare instance of acceptance. I would never force you to do it. Even if you said it was ok but your heart was going the other way I would refuse. You don’t have to worry about me, I would sooner starve than drink from someone that didn’t wish it,” you replied in a tone that made her accept your words.

“Well that is a load off. So… if you don’t mind me asking, what are you going to do with me now?” She asked rather directly.

“I would take you home, wherever that is, when you were ready. Or at least a street corner you felt comfortable with. I didn’t think it was a good idea leaving you in that alley. Even if that other Vampire wasn’t around, an alley isn’t exactly the most pleasant place to wake,” you responded back.

“Just like that?” She asked.

“Of course. I needed the break anyway. Watching over you for a few hours wasn’t that big of a drain on my schedule. Did you think I was going to charge you for my efforts or something?” You asked.

“Well, I don’t really get a lot of free stuff. People generally want something and rarely do something for nothing.” She replied back. “Being a Vampire I thought you would want some blood or something like that for your payment.”

“Nah, not unless you were offering and were content with it. I can tell you would sooner jump off this platform than let me drink from you. So shall we?” You answered as if it didn’t even matter to you.

“Shall we what?” She asked as she looked at your outstretched hand.

“Well I assume you want to spend at least a little bit of the night sleeping in a bed, preferably your bed. So let’s go. You can direct me wherever you want. If you don’t want me to see where you live that is totally understandable. Although I could just follow your scent if I really wanted to track you down. Even so, I know you might feel better if I didn’t pursue you in any way, much less know where you live,” you answered.

“I can tell this is going to be a long night,” she sighed as she hesitantly walked over and took your hand.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You teleported her down and took her to a well known hub. She thanked you before riding the bus elsewhere and you assured her that you wouldn’t search for her. It was a strange thing to promise but if you were only in this realm for a short time than it would be unwise to stay too attached to a random person. Be she did help you in a way. You were able to establish and learn the hide hand while watching over her as well as state your stance to an underling of whomever that other Vampire was.

There was something about the packaged blood that you found around that you didn’t like the smell of so you just settled for a deer you found as well as a few dogs, but of course left them alive. You didn’t need some kid crying that their dog died. But something told you that it would be a good idea to remain as close to full power for the time being. Soon you got tired of seeing the same old thing on every street corner and alley so you just relaxed near a river as you soaked up the sunlight. You figured that you could get a little nap in but was interrupted a half hour into it.

“Excuse me, sir,” said a female voice that made you open your eyes and look at the source. “I believe you spoke with an associate of my Master. I am the personal assistant to Zelman Clock. Will you follow me please?”

“Very well,” you replied as you got up to address her.

She didn’t speak much as she led you to a street, in a car, and through a mansion. Finally she opened a door for you but didn’t follow you in as the door shut. You looked around in the dark until your gaze rested on a figure reclining on a couch.

“When I sent for the person that reduced my subordinate’s arms to ash I wasn’t expecting someone so young,” said the figure as the candles around the room ignited on their own. But you were no fool in this respect. You could feel the power increase as he caused the fire to do so. He was another that you felt an unusually high power from and wasn’t sure if you could defeat in a straight fight. “However what he didn’t say between his ranting was that you were a Vampire.”

“To be fair, I didn’t tell him I was,” you admitted openly as you stood as politely as possible.

“Even so, for a child like yourself to get the better of him and he not even able sense something as simple as this, it is pathetic. However I do find it odd that I was blind to your presence until this point as well. What bloodline do you come from?” Zelman asked as he reclined on his seat.

“I’m not exactly sure. Were I come from I am the only Vampire and I only know the Vampire before me. Her name was Isibelle if that helps. She had her servant escort me here to learn from other Vampires. Truthfully I’ve only been a Vampire for a very short time, 3 years in total so I still have a human family.” You explained.

“You say Isibelle was the one that turned you? Are you sure it was her?” Zelman asked, turning a shocked face for the first time since you saw him. Granted you had just met him but it didn’t seem like he was surprised too often if at all.

“Well that was her name. As the only Vampire around where I grew up and the one that turned me, she isn’t exactly someone I’d forget.” You replied.

“Then I owe you something.” He said as he got up to face you more formally. “Please come with me.”

“Ok,” you replied as you followed him in another series of walking and car rides you were brought to another room. You heard him call a sort of meeting before he arrived so you were greeted by a room filled with very powerful feeling individuals. The strongest one by far was a small child looking person. But somehow you could tell he held a great power inside him.

“Zelman, this had better be good.” Said a large Vampire from a seat next to the one he was taking, leaving you alone at the end for them to observe.

“Indeed, this one claims that the one that turned him was Lady Isibelle.” Zelman stated to which the grumbling and whatnot stopped to leave a deathly quiet room. But why was it silent was the question buzzing in your mind. They obviously knew Miss. Isibelle. But you had learned a while ago that it wasn’t always a good thing.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Drop her off and on with your business.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Is it true young man? Are you the forebear of Lady Isibelle’s bloodline?” asked a human man on the far end.

“Assuming that we are talking about the same person, than yes. How do you know Miss. Isibelle?” You asked back. Deep in your blood and mind you found them familiar but as if whatever happened a life time ago, which might be very accurate if Miss. Isibelle’s knowledge was really inside you.

“We were hesitant to believe it when she came to see us,” said the kid to your left. He paused before continuing. “She came to us and told us she created us. While the general reason was to record our actions and have it be sold for entertainment we were also given a task from her.”

“First you must prove you are who you say you are. There is one way to be certain.” Said the large man. The little kid nodded than an enormous amount of energy was released to which a light enveloped your body. It almost instantly started disintegrating you.

The pain was unbelievable as you fought the effect of this attack. You used almost all your energy to just stem the tide but when that was gone you had nothing to which you were turned to ash. The ash turned to mist and started regenerating your body. You didn’t know how long it was taking but you felt like someone had just removed all your energy and just got done torturing you, leaving you understandably drained and weak. You didn’t know what to think at the moment. Why did they or he attack you? But in either case, it wouldn’t matter. You were too weak to do anything about it. As strong as you thought you were you still had a long way to go. To think that Miss. Isibelle was so strong that all these people you were under in terms of strength were created by her. She would have to have those abilities to pass them to these people. You realized that there was much you didn’t know and that you were far from the strongest person. Before you thought you were so you had to limit yourself for other’s safety. But now you were literally hit with the truth that you were far from such a high standing. Slowly you woke as your body came back but was unable to move. Your energy and strength was sapped from you so all you could do was open your eyes as you lay on the floor. You were still in the company of those that you had just left for however long you were out.

“I’m sorry for harming you so. It is really the only way to be sure you are who you said you were,” the child looking person said. Your attractant was fully deployed as you couldn’t restrict it as well as your eyes, teeth, and other Vampirism traits.

“Here, take this and recharge,” said someone that must’ve been a servant or something. He dropped a human by your face as he said this. You were getting back some of your strength. Not enough to do much or even move at any lengthy amount, but more than enough to turn your head away from the unconscious human they had provided.

“What is this? You refuse to eat?” Asked the voice of the large Vampire from before. You couldn’t speak at the moment so you just hissed back in a Vampire like sign of refusal and anger. There was more emotions running through you at the moment. But you had made up your mind on this already. You would rather starve than take from an unwilling host and never to drink dry.

“I understand you may be angry with us. But we needed to make sure you were truly of Lady Isibelle’s bloodline. Please eat, we need to address you on what she assigned us to do,” pleaded the boy that attacked you in the first place. You had to admit that his logic made sense. You were the only one that literally couldn’t die. So turning you to ash and having you reform would be something only you could do. But they weren’t getting why you weren’t eating. Sure you were cross with them for causing you so much physical pain but that wasn’t the reason why you wouldn’t and couldn’t eat.

“He must be tired from that. He is only a few years old by our standards. Perhaps he can’t move. Would explain why he isn’t talking,” Zelman stated.

“But he took the effort to look away from the meal we provided. He must only eat certain meals.” The large Vampire induced.

“That makes sense. He took the arms off my subordinate when he tried forcing himself on a girl. Maybe he only eats willing people.” Zelman agreed.

“In that case, it would be an insult to give him anything other than that. Bring someone who is willing at once.” The little kid looking person demanded to which there was a bunch of moving and whatnot to his order. It was obvious that whomever he was that he was in charge and the most powerful. Zelman didn’t seem the type to cater to a demand by any less than a true superior in both power and status. Perhaps that was another lesson to you. Things are not always as they appear. People can to really bad things in an attempt to do something good and the opposite as well. Not only that but this little kid was the weakest looking from the outside. You doubted if he was even out of diapers. But it was clear that he was the strongest and most honored one in the room. You heard the door open and the sound of heels until they stopped next to you so you could see her ankles as she addressed the room.

“You summoned me sirs?” a voice asked.

“Yes, our friend here is starving and only drinks from willing sources. On top of that it looks like he doesn’t even have the energy to properly feed or even lift his head. Would you be a dear and help him out?” asked Zelman.

“Yes, of course.” She said, a little fluster in her voice.

She knelt down then laid beside you. Following that she pulled your body on top of hers and your head in prime position to her neck. If there was any consolation or question that she wished to be drunk from, it was demolished when she pushed your head into her neck gently as if she was feeding a baby… kind of. You strained to open then close your mouth into her neck. Fresh blood filled your mouth and you readily gulped it down. You felt her heartbeat rise and your attractant made her pull you in to finish what you had just started. Sure your attractant had a lot to do with her willingness to help and lay next to you in such an informal fashion. But adding your feeding it was not likely that she would make your or even suggest you to stop. Your body was so drained that it barely touched your stomach before it was instantly digested and fueling your body. For some reason, this woman was filling you up more than you would think she could. You felt full enough to be at full power well before you usually stopped. So you when you were able to take control you held her in her position as you drank very slowly from her. You wanted to reward her for what she did so you allowed the euphoria that came with your bite to pleasure her more so than usual. Her nails dug into your back and your head as she held you tight but eventually you had enough and pinched a nerve to render her unconscious. Following that you retracted your fangs and licked the spot clean before getting up.

“Did you have enough? She still has a good amount of blood in her.” Zelman asked as you looked up and glared at them. You had no intention of hiding yourself at this point so you left your Vampire features out and present. The only one you retracted was the attractant, so the humans in the room could think clearly. With a wave you levitated the bodies of the unconscious humans on the floor away and against the wall, safe and secure so you could speak with the room without stepping over bodies.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“I understand you may be angry but…” started the large Vampire again but was interrupted as you had enough of their arrogant, one way, and single minded attitude.

“Angry? Anger doesn’t begin to touch what I feel right now. You want me to condone your positions and status while preaching how high you value humans than in the same conversation ask why I left the ones that gave their blood freely to me alive? What the hell is wrong with all of you?!” You exclaimed, obviously furious of what they were doing and treating you.

“It is only natural for us to feed on those under us.” Zelman stated as if you should’ve known.

“You arrogant fool. Humans aren’t under us. They are what keep us alive. How long would you last without humans? While I can drink from other sources I know you can’t. What would happen if you had NO access to humans? You need them, a heck of a lot more than they need you. Yet you spit on the actions of those that willingly give themselves to us so freely. They deserve our protection, not the other way around.” You said back to him. He glared at you as you spoke in such a high manner to him. He obviously didn’t agree with your way of thinking. But you weren’t about to change because of him.

“Zelman, hold your tongue!” declared the little boy in an ominous voice that actually got him to quiver and relent on his thoughts of continuing his declaration. Shortly after getting his point across he returned to normal to address you. “I am deeply sorry for the pain I caused you. If it makes you feel any better, Lady Isibelle told me to test you in that way.”

“She did?” You asked, wondering why she would want to cause you so much pain.

“Yes, something about readying your body to receive what she left with us to give you.” He replied but looked to stray off for a moment as he continued. “I am glad to see that the one she passed her blood to treats others in such high value.”

“Very well. I do trust her. She gave me this gift so I will receive what she has intended for me, even on the heels of pain.” You replied. You didn’t know where your new vocabulary came from in that instance but that was a minor concern at the moment. “What is it that I am receiving?”
