1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The apparent child and leader reached under his shirt to bring out a vial that he had hanging around his neck. It was like a long very tuff test tube that was filled with blood. He took it from his neck and personally walked over to you. Everyone else stood as he did. He eventually stood in front of you and held out the vial to which you knelt down so that you were eye level with him but didn’t take it.

“I see you are still cautious and I can’t blame you. This is what she left us. She left this blood for you to drink. Once you do, you will understand and gain all our powers. She gave them too us after all and we have more than mastered them. This blood is the origin. While we and what we have mastered will remain, you will gain all our power and experience in wielding the power. One of many reasons why the Kowloon children are enemies is because their King tried to take and drink this himself. It was made for you and only for you. Please take and drink it. But do know, that it is suppose to bring great pain. However, since your body just regenerated it will be easier… according to lady Isibelle,” the boy explained.

“Very well. I will not waste any more time.” You replied as you took the vial. He bowed, with a surprise and replication from the others as you stood and looked at the vial. You figured this was the time where a bad guy would show up in a series so you hurried and drank the whole thing. You used every ability you had to make sure it was all in your stomach before digesting it then the pain came, just like he said.

Someone was going to catch you as you fell over but energy and the abilities you were absorbing and learning were randomly coming out and to the surface. They had to actually run as soon the whole room they were in was breaking apart but you were in no position to stop it. Good thing it was on the top floor of whatever building you were in because it blew off the ceiling and shot up to release the pressure. By the time you were done you were, again, in no position to move. You realized that the previous pain of being ripped apart by the boy was indeed a preparation for this but even so you couldn’t remain conscious as your mind had to learn and comprehend the things it had learned as if you always knew it. Therefore you were left limp and relatively defenseless in the middle of a demolished top floor of the building you were in. You sincerely hoped that was the last time you had to feel such pain and whatnot but doubted it.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You receive power and understanding of all thei...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You were finally out of pain for a little bit and started waking up. But you had little time to adjust. As you woke and put your bed in an escalated position, you began hearing noises of a battle. You looked around to find that they must’ve moved you to a hospital. First time you had been in one as a patient so you weren’t sure of what to do. But you assumed that the gunfire and battle noises weren’t suppose to be going on. However, some of your new powers awoke and you were able to sense almost every person in the building. Sure you could do that before but not to the degree you were able to at this point and not all of them at once in such a high level. You looked at a little tube that was been fed down your throat, depositing blood into your stomach. You removed it carefully then set it off to the side. You were now fully healed again and… definitely more powerful. You weren’t sure what was going on but you sensed something was wrong. So you got out of bed and left the room you were in just in time to dodge a bullet that kept going and hit a vampire in the head, turning it to ash. You then got what was happening. Those Kowloon Children were attacking, and a hospital to boot.

“You, watch out!” said the human you recognized as the officer that you saw before. He was obviously high ranked and was referring to the few Vampires running at you from the other side, you blocking either side from attacking the other.

“Why? Am I in danger?” You asked, but as the Kowloon children were in bite range, having no intention of stopping, you let out a light that plunged the entire inside of the hospital with deadly (for only that type of Vampire) light. It burst through every crevice, effectively eliminating all of them in the building.

“I guess not.” Said the human. “We originally were sent to guard you. But when they started attacking we were couldn’t do as good as we thought we could.”

“Guard me? Why’s that?” You asked in a confused tone.

“Lord Dragon said you wouldn’t need it but it was the thought that counted. He wanted to make sure you woke in relative peace. Looks like we failed in that respect.” He said, lowering his head as if he failed a mission.

“Well seeing as I didn’t wake with fangs stuck in my neck, I think you did just fine. Besides, they earned no points by attacking a hospital. Before I was hesitant about wiping anyone out solely on their origin. But these Kowloon Children seem to be anything but morally sound and have no concept of mercy or honor. I could condone attacking a police station or a military base, but a hospital with children inside? That is just a new low,” you replied, the first part toward him to which he smiled thankfully with a slight bow. But you could see his fighting strength was limited by his broken arm. So you walked toward him and reached for hit but he backed up to avoid you.

“What are you doing?” he demanded.

“You can’t seriously tell me that you prefer to fight with a broken arm, can you?” You asked, then with some hesitation but overlapped with honor and duty he let you touch the damaged limb. You didn’t waste any time as you healed it then ripped off the sling and light cast. “There, now I can leave things here to you right?”

“Yes, thank you.” he said then grabbed a two handed weapon now that his arm was free. You had a feeling that was all you were going to get out of him so you turned to mist and headed off to the top of the building to assess the condition of the city. Soon a golden light appeared from beside you to which the boy stepped out.

“I see you are awake. I apologize for the rude welcome yet again. But you decided to help anyway, not even a second thought about it. Will you help some more?” He asked.

“Well I suppose it would be a good way to test these new abilities I have.” You agreed with a smile then looked down at him as he did the same. “I will thank you as well. Despite the pain corresponding with the duty, you upheld your end and was more than accommodating. Most would’ve jailed me but you helped me recover. I suppose that was one of many lessons Ms. Isibelle wished me to learn while I was here. Things aren’t always what they appear and there is always someone stronger.”

“Indeed.” He answered before heading back through the apparent golden doorway. That would be a glamorous trick to use later but you had more than that to experiment with at the moment. You flew off, now knowing more so how to control it, then started wiping out the Kowloon Children with different ways. The Eye Ignite ability was a little much but useful. But you had to put out many fires that it caused with the collateral explosions so you moved on to hide hand, powering up, and a few other moves that you were testing. In the end you had cleaned out a good majority of the city that was not heavily occupied by otherwise competent forces able to deal with the problem. But you did see the girl you rescued before being cornered by some Kowloon so you landed silently behind her as she backed into yet another alley.

“Please just stay away!” she screamed as they stalked her but back up a little when they say you appear behind her. However you had yet to see one of their kind run from you so they attacked to which you used another light attack to take out any in the area, only being about 20 in the broad and energy expensive attack. She could feel you behind her and the light you used didn’t deter her vision. It only made it seem like there was a golden light originating from whomever was behind her. Perhaps it looked more angelic than you intended but you could worry about that later. Either way, she wasn’t harmed in any way by it, sight included. “Am I screwed?”

“I hope not. That would be really awkward.” You answered to which she spun around to see you, only a foot away. You had put your vampire features away for the moment but the golden light was still radiating a little as it dissipated from you.

“You… you killed them. Why would you kill your own kind? For me?” She asked, stuttering slightly but as much as she wanted to move away she couldn’t get her muscles to obey the command. You saw this and decided not to push her any further in that regard.

“Don’t take this the wrong way, but I didn’t do it for you. I also would appreciate you not comparing me with them. They are as different from me as you are, as evidence to you still being alive. They are… I guess like sentient zombie versions of vampires. As you have witnessed, they don’t really have a code of honor or anything like that. Heck, they even attacked the baby hospital wing. No, I was asked by some of the leaders around here to help and I just so happened to come across you. But really, this is the second time I’ve had to save your hide from a feral Vampire. Ever think about bringing a silver knife or something along?” You notified.

“I… I’ll remember that next time. Um… can I go?” she asked.

“Sure. But so I don’t have to save you, again, take this.” you said and tossed her a silver knife you thought she could handle. “Slice a vampire with that and he’ll think twice about coming around for a second date.”

“T-thank you. I-I’ll be going now.” She stuttered to which you just nodded and she ran off, grasping the knife. You could feel you were a little late to deal with any of the bigger threats so you went back to work on ridding the Special Zone of all the small pests. It may take all night to find all of them and the sources but you were actually having a little bit of fun at the moment. Plus the thanks you got from those you saved helped a lot.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Help them with the trouble.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Can’t you stay a little longer?” asked Kotaro. Mr. Vale had come to get you after the battle was over. Jiro came to see you as he too knew Ms. Isibelle and had long since apologized for his rudeness. But now you had to leave the realm to which they were not getting any time to meet with you at all. Perhaps that was another lesson or maybe just an unintentional one. But you looked at Mr. Vale anyway to see how much time you had.

“We have little time to waste. You friend Eve came calling when you were away and is… insistent in your return as quickly as possible.” Mr. Vale responded to your silent question. A smirk went across your face at her reaction but you were sure she knew your schedule by this point as she had lived with you prior for a while. But with her ‘insistence’ in the wind, you didn’t dare keep her waiting. But as she would never harm anyone of consequence to get what she wanted, at least to you, it was slightly entertaining to think of what she could be doing.

“Sorry Kotaro. I have a life and people that care about me at home. I was only meant to stay here for a limited time. I can’t, in good conscious, keep them waiting,” you replied in a pleasant way so it hit him a little lighter.

“Still having trouble picturing you, living with a community and family of humans,” Jiro stated.

“Well being the only Vampire in my realm helps but there are other people that help bridge the gap a little. Plus, even for a Vampire, my Mom’s cooking tastes amazing,” You returned. Most of them smiled at the last part.

This realm wasn’t like the other one you went to. You didn’t have a couple years to get to know them. But you were stoked about getting Ms. Isibelle’s present. You definitely wouldn’t mind practicing your new abilities and if Mr. Vale was here it meant that you learned what you needed or what was intended. So, with a final wave, you and Mr. Vale went back to your home. You were barely through the portal when you were tackled by Kelsey in a fierce hug.

“Dang, it’s only been a week,” you said as you caught and floated in midair.

“But you got hurt, we saw. They hurt you really bad and we all were worried,” Kelsey replied.

“How did you see?” You asked then was shown the series and it was paused with you leaving their realm. You should’ve known better but now you knew and calmed the emotional Succubus down. “As flattered as I am for being the source of all this attention, you should know by now. I can’t die, so you don’t need to worry… but thank you.”

“We’re your family, it’s our job to worry,” Your Mother replied with a more calmed persona than Kelsey.

“Hey Caleb, Eve wants to see you… really bad.” Isaac blurted out.

“She does? I suppose it has been a few months. Did she stop by and visit or something?” You asked.

“Not exactly,” Kelsey responded. “She sent us an invite to a place close to your family’s Cabin area. Thankfully she remembered your family’s… phobia for spiders and cleared the way for us while we were there. But we did meet her Father. You were right, he looks just like her. Anyway, she was rather upset that you weren’t there but remembered about your training with Mr. Vale so She… insisted that you come to her when you got back. She still has her Queen duties but she wants to see you really bad.”

“Well, I suppose I should…”
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Time to go.

choices: Sure, always room for new friends.
Do you really need more giant insect friends?
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It wasn’t like you had much of a choice in going to see her, as if you had to be pushed. They say that, no matter where you are, you are always within 5 feet of a spider. As many holes as there are in that saying it did stand applicable in this case. You couldn’t get more than a few feet toward your room before a large wolf spider reminded you of Eve’s wish to see you. It wouldn’t be wise to keep her waiting. Knowing her pushy nature, she wouldn’t be limited to sending a whole army to get you. So you easily caught her scent and went to the entrance of a burrow that was almost moving with all the spiders around it. As you stopped in a rare clear spot you waited for one of the larger ones inside to come out and address you. You didn’t want them to get any funny ideas so you had a barrier like the last time around you, one they couldn’t touch.

“Who are you, human?” asked a male voice from a large car sized spider that came out of the hole in the ground.

“My name is Caleb, I do believe Eve is expecting me. Well at least that is what the spiders near my house and my family said,” you answered back.

“You may enter. Follow me and don’t stray. A stray human in a burrow of hungry spiders is not something you should test.” The spider instructed to which you bowed an affirmative then followed him. He led through a maze of tunnels, a small army of spiders of all sizes were following and observing you. Eventually you were brought into a larger chamber that looked almost human in its construction. Kind of like a royal ball room from those old movies you saw… come to think of it, if Eve was the one to design it than that is where she probably got it from. But either way, it was surprisingly empty. Like the room was off limits to the general hoard that had stayed far from the door. The spider that brought you there only lingered for a moment until he too dispersed from the room.

“What is this? A human, in a spider’s burrow? Do you have some kind of death wish?” asked a voice from a passage off to the opposite side as the main entrance you used. In a short time there was a Scorpion the size of a truck entering the room. You weren’t sure but you were fairly certain that spiders and scorpions didn’t see eye to eye, sort of speak. But if this was some kind of leader among his kind than at least they shared the whole Queen Ruler thing. As you weren’t an authority on scorpion bodies you guessed by her voice that she was female. You also silently commended Eve for taking you secrecy seriously. If no one knew than you had at least a little chance of a relatively normal life. But as spiders were forbidden from attacking of even accident biting your family, you guessed this new entry wasn’t under such restrictions.

“Hmm. What is a scorpion doing in a spider hallow? Seems just as ludicrous as a human being here.” You asked.

“True enough. I am Drade, Queen of the Wisconsin territory of scorpions. Granted our number is comparatively small compared to other territories further south and most of us die out in the winter but we are still here. I am here at the request of the Queen of the Spiders. She has been most hospitable. Now it’s your turn.” The scorpion Queen answered then threw the ball in your court while advancing and circling you a bit. It was as if she was trying to work on your nerves… or see if she could make a game out of you.

“I am the one that found her when she was a newborn. My family and I took care of… the Queen, until her kind became known, as was her position in it. She invited my family here a few weeks ago but I was not available at that time so I was asked to come by when I had the time, and here I am. So I guess we are both waiting on her. Can’t imagine it will be too much longer though. As soon as she catches my scent she is going to…” You replied but was cut off by a very distinctive but louder voice.

“Caleb is here?!” Came the voice from a passage behind the area of the throne spot. Obviously there wasn’t a seat for the throne but it was big enough to hold a very large ruler.

“There she is.” You said as you took your eyes off Drade and saw the black flash of scuttling hair and legs come at you. You could see her just fine and noticed she was a little bigger. She was near car size now and as such easily picked you up with her mandibles as she grabbed you and scurried around until she was on her throne again. “Whoa! Missed you to.”

“I was so worried that you didn’t like me anymore when you weren’t with your family.” She almost cried out as she squeezed/ hugged your with her mandibles. To be fair it was the only area of her large body that could correctly hug you now.

“Don’t be silly Eve, how could anyone no like you. I was a little lonely and put out with you no longer at the house. But I’m glad you seem to be doing good. I can’t imagine you had an easy time learning all this stuff,” you said in a way that calmed and cheered her up. “Besides, I learned all kinds of cool tricks from my training with Mr. Vale.”

“Thanks, you’re the best family and friend I have. I don’t know what I’d do if you ever started hating me.” She said, finally letting you down after a few strokes from you amongst her eyes to further sooth her. “You’ll have to show me some of your new tricks later.”

“Will do, I plan on burdening you with my presence for at least a week.” You joked and she was almost shaking happily and gave you a joking push with one of her legs. She knew her hair was soft so you just leaned into it before a clicking sound came from the slightly ignored scorpion in the room. You suppose that it was her way of loudly coughing to make her awkward presence known. “So she’s an interesting addition to your circle. Didn’t even know there was scorpions in Wisconsin.”

“Did she try to hurt you?” Eve asked, instantly serious.

“No, perhaps she was thinking about it. But then again a lone human walking into a place like this and being presented in front of her, I can’t fault her from having some predatory thoughts, can you?” You answered.

“I suppose not. But either way, maybe you wouldn’t mind sitting in on our PRIVATE meeting so you can get to know her and maybe make another ally… or friend.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: "...Go to her right away."

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You have a spot where we can talk… without all your subjects listening in?” You asked as if you were still deciding. To be fair, your tone was accurate as you weren’t sure if revealing yourself to someone new was a good idea. Even so, it would only take one small spider overhearing your status to let millions perhaps billions of others know.

“Of course. We had a little trouble fine tuning it but there is a special room that is more than capable and big enough for many of larger size to fit. That room at your house was such a good idea that it was one of the first additions I made to this place.” Eve stated as she addressed it.

“Ok, lead the way than.” You agreed, at least to the talking part.

“Wait. The human is coming with us?” asked Drade, slightly insulted but curious enough to not act on it.

“We’ll get to that later. But we can’t talk about it with so many of my children listening. For such a big guy, he’s pretty shy.” Eve explained but put the word ‘big’ in there to indicate there was something about you she would like to know. Of course her slight bit of teasing on you ended with a light push with one of her legs before you stoked it and smirked at her still remaining sense of limited humor.

“Very well. I suppose any that a you allow this close can at least listen in.” Drade accepted to which Even ushered you and Drade down a few tunnels and through a type of barrier.

Through the traveling you sensed the escalated tension from the scorpion behind you. Her pinchers would snap or one of her many legs would fall on the ground to hard. Very rarely would you hear her stinger scrape on the ceiling as her body subconsciously reacted to your constant presence. You doubted that she ever let a human get that close and walk away. You smelling so much like one at the moment only made the instinct more relevant. Finally you all entered a room that was just a very large open space covered in webs that acted as instillation, from the weather and sound. It also made the room look white, despite the dark grey of the rock that the room was carved out. When the three of you were facing each other, and Eve had quickly made a silk chair for you, it was time for the speaking part of the meeting.

“So, what is this matter you wish to see me about?” asked Drade as she formally addressed Eve.

“Well, I know from my father that our kinds don’t really get along. Suffice to say it is a great gesture of trust to come here yourself. I would like to make a treaty of sorts. Nothing big, but big enough to allow an understanding between spiders and Scorpions, one that would allow you and your children to both spread out and survive in greater numbers.” Eve answered. You seemed to realize that while humans referred to those they ruled as ‘subjects, slaves,’ or a bunch of different titles, at least these two referred to them as children. As if to add an additional level of security, familiarity, and loyalty on those they ruled. How they were willing to sacrifice so many for seemingly tedious tasks was still a mystery to you but you at least picked up the vocabulary.

“A treaty? I suppose this would be an idea you got when living with humans so long.” Drade spat out but continued before it could be combated. “However the selling point intrigues me. Why would you give up territory to me? Even if I would uphold the treaty, the ones after me probably wouldn’t.”

“I know that. Which is why I asked you here, for your thoughts and hopefully a solution to this. Caleb being here may help as well.” Eve replied back.

“Why do we have to involve a human?” asked Drade, partially in disgust. She obviously didn’t like humans or like beings too much.

“Because he can tell us what things to avoid. It would be pointless to allow your children into houses that my children occupy if they are only going to sting the occupants and cause them to exterminate both sides in retribution. A simple insight into how to go around would not be such a bad thing. While the odd child will act out or die at the hands of a human or against one, it is better than alerting them all about your presence and making an extermination campaign about it.” Eve answered.

“I don’t see why we have to. Down south we survive just fine with humans knowing about us. What would make up here so different?” Drade asked in argument.

“For one your numbers aren’t self-efficient like they are down there. That and people up here aren’t use to dealing with scorpions. Spiders are accepted, not at Eve’s size but they are not hunted for where they MIGHT be like you and your children would be. You don’t necessarily have to act like spiders to, but crawling in a boot up here will never end well.” You responded to which Drade’s temper seemed to flare up as she probably wasn’t welcoming your input, especially in telling her what to do in any fashion.

“You talk too soon human! I wasn’t asking you!” She flared at you, her body and tail rising in anger at your intrusion.

“Hey, don’t talk to him that way. He was only trying to help. I would also strongly advise you to not threaten him.” Eve interjected.

“Why’s that and why do you like this human so much? They kill millions of our children each year.” Drade almost roared, getting angrier by the second. “What can be so good about him that you need to protect him so much?”

“Protect him? I admit his family needs a little bit but he doesn’t. If you want to attack him than… well just know that I warned you and I am not about to get in his way if he wants to deal with you at the conclusion. I was only being hospitable in telling you not to threaten him. Unlike his human family, he can more than retaliate in a fashion that gets even me to sweat.” Eve answered.

“Ah, you do know how to flatter a guy, Eve.” You joked then looked to Drade. “But I don’t think I am liking you suggestion too much. What would I do with an ally like her?”

“Caleb. Please don’t give up on this just yet. I really would like you to be ok with this to. It is the first really big thing I’m doing and I would like you to be a part of it. Can you just hold on for a little bit? Please?” Eve asked.

“Alright, but you owe me a drink later.” You answered. She almost jumped with joy at the condition. She was obviously looking forward to it.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Sure, always room for new friends.

choices: She wants to stay and make it work.
She deceptively agrees, you are not fooled...
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You still haven’t told me why I should tolerate this… human to be part of this.” Declared Drade. Her emotions were obviously going high as her poised striking position was becoming more prevalent.

“You should…” started Eve but you cut her off as you were ready to reveal yourself rather than have her give an excuse. This was Eve’s first big command so you would make her look as impressive as possible. As you had said before, having you as an ally was a good thing.

“Lady Drade. Forgive me but you keep calling me a human. Funny, I’ve never once actually said I was one, nor has Eve.” You stated cryptically with a glare at her. You increased the glare until her form fell back to a more steady position.

“What are you talking about?” She asked.

“I am taking part in a treaty negotiation. Obviously Eve knows something about me that she would like to involve with the treaty. As a human I would be considerably useless in such a situation. You really think Eve would waste your time in such a serious decision with the opinion of a human that she can see you don’t like very much?” You asked, trying to steer her thoughts in the right direction.

“When you put it that way… I suppose not. I did think it rather strange that you were down here.” Drade agreed.

“Don’t get me wrong. She is on good terms with more than a few humans. But until she was sure they were safe around you she wouldn’t endanger them by parading them in front of you.” You added, making sure she was clear that Eve liked humans but also that she was considering Drade’s emotions and preferences in dealing with her. “No, I am a predator above most. My previous training has revealed that there is always someone better but I am not anywhere near the bottom. More than enough to combat other predators. I allow Eve, as a friend, to share what territory I have claimed. If she were to ask, I would expel your kind from her territory all together. But she wants to make this work so you are under her graces at the moment.”

“Enough games, what are you?” she asked, not being able to take the unknown any longer.

“A Vampire.” You revealed to which you could sense her body go ridged. Unlike Eve, she probably knew a lot more about her history or yours… well your genetic history at least. Even Kelsey and Mrs. Dremer had said that you were highly feared by all for one reason or another. But unlike humans, they knew there was just one of you and that you were VERY dangerous no matter the circumstances. With this new information she took an involuntary step back.

“P-prove it.” She stuttered out after shaking and thinking for a little while. You didn’t have any trouble doing so as you powered up to your escalated vampire body. Your red eyes shined while your teeth protruded and did a few other things including removing your scent so she could smell you better. But the severity of the increase made the room creak. When you were sure she understood you dialed it back down.

“Good enough?” You asked.

“Wow, that was a lot more than before. How much stronger did you get?” asked Eve.

“A bit more. You know that Lady Isibelle put things in each world for me to learn. Only makes sense she makes me ready with each one. But you’re one to talk. You got a lot bigger as well.” You answered and teased back. Unlike humans, saying how BIG she is turned out to be a compliment, one that you had to be careful not to repeat to others in your life. Kelsey was still ripping on you for the time accidentally gave her the same compliment. How were you supposed to know she was going to take it the wrong way? “So was that enough ‘proof’ for you?”

“Y-y-yes.” Drade answered, continuing her stuttering as to the realization of who and what you were. If nothing else her presume life expectancy had either drastically increased or decreased. “I apologize for my words before. I had no idea.”

“Of course you didn’t, that was the point. I don’t go around broadcasting my biggest secret everywhere. Even among the Spiders only Eve knows. If you were able to guess what I was that I would be a really poor Vampire in terms of disguise at least.” You revealed in a way that made her know that you weren’t angry about it.

“Thank you, my lord.” She said as her body cringed back on itself to be more invisible, hoping that your wrath wasn’t warranted.

“Look, now you made her all scared.” Eve scolded.

“Well that wasn’t my intension.” You replied and looked at the cowering scorpion. “Please don’t be afraid. There is only one reason I will kill, that is if I see the person ending the life of an innocent. Sure I may be more likely to think you as one of those people for attacking people like my human family or Eve but I am by no means a hot tempered individual. If nothing else, you have gained Eve’s respect and so you have gained a bit of mine as well.”

“Why would you waste your time on me? My kind is very small influence in this territory. I couldn’t possibly be worth such a privilege.” Drade asked and stated.

“Have you heard nothing? Eve seems to like you so I do as well. I really don’t care what you are or how powerful you are. It is WHO you are that interests me. I am a new Vampire still with my very large human family with an adopted succubus and spider family members. I would love to have a scorpion like yourself join the mix, provided that I can trust you. No point just giving you free rain if my little toddler cousins see you or your children and they end up as food. That would make me understandably put off. I wouldn’t mind in the least if you joined our very large and growing family.” You answered.

It seemed like she was thinking about what you said. Emotions were conflicting and her instincts were also up in the wind with multiple signals. You wondered what path she would take. Sure it would interesting for her to be around. If nothing else you would have a lot of introducing to do. But on the other hand you now had your family on the platter. Knowing your scent she could easily track it back to any of your family. Whatever she did would probably involve you for a bit of your future. You just couldn’t help but hope she would be direct about it so you didn’t have to guess.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You both make it sound like I have a choice. While I suppose I do have one, it isn’t much of one. If I don’t agree than you will probably see me as a threat. I don’t want to be on the wrong end of either of you. If I accept however, my children and I will have relative safety in this harsh land. If I go into another Scorpion Queen’s territory I would be killed so I don’t have the option of running. Are you serious about including me into your… family?” Drade asked.

“Under 2 rules. The first is that you don’t harm innocents. While I know that predatory instinct must be upheld, it will not say much about you and your children if I promote you just for you to kill anyone that calls me on that confidence. On the other hand, if a human or spider attacks you than you should have the ability and permission to protect yourself. The second is, NEVER harm my family. I take my family’s protection very seriously. The way it is, my little brother can jump on Eve with no fear of her attacking him or killing him. I also have arachnophobic family that attack her and kill her children more times than I can count. But they never attack back. If I can’t trust you with them, even under accidental circumstances than I can’t allow you near them. If you follow those two rules than I will be more than happy to welcome you into the family.” You answered.

“So… I can’t fight back if attacked by your family?” she asked.

“Caleb’s family is really nice,” Eve started in answering the question. “They are just very loyal and… well human. He put that rule in there because of accidents. If one of our kids are running across the floor and one of them step on them. Our instinct is to attack the impending attacker, even it was accidental. While we may survive the encounter, they wouldn’t. For that reason, a no tolerance policy is in effect. It also makes us more aware to avoid such instances.”

“I see. I suppose, after a while, we could have a few of them be friendly to my children as well,” Drade induced.

“I am sure there are a few that will welcome you right away.” You started. “No offense to Eve, but my family isn’t exactly spider people. They like Eve but squash any other they see, regardless. My sister in particular would be happy to have you around or get to know a sentient one of you children.”

Drade seemed to like this and the rest of the day involved making rules and conditions of the treaty. Things that had them working together and things that didn’t. Such as, if someone like Sarah doesn’t want spiders around, then the scorpion can kill any that approach announced. But with them gone, they would have to take over the bug management and be hospitable to any messengers that may come. Drade was not to take offense it some of her children are killed and the spiders would help them during the winter to survive and grow in number. It was a strange alliance but a good one. Drade was really liking it by the time it was all over. On top of that, now both sides would come together when different territories came to take over theirs. A army of spiders were less likely to invade if they had to deal with not only other spiders but also Scorpions as well.

After that, the 3 of you spent the week together on unimportant things. You told them about your adventures and showed of some new abilities while they revealed what their lives were like. You never would’ve guessed that some of the most dangerous predators in the world would be in your growing family. Now all you had to do was introduce Drade to your family. Well… no need to rush.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: She wants to stay and make it work.

choices: They all want it and get ready.
They don't or can't do it right now...
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Caleb, so who is this new member you want us to meet?” asked Grandpa Konel. You had gathered, and obviously transported, all the family and people that knew about you up to the property to meet Drade. Papa and your immediate family already knew the base minimum and Eve’s presence was there, along with millions of her children, to make them feel a little safer. Kelsey and Mrs. Dremer was also there, including Doug. All of them had an enormous amount of respect for you but you were still just a teenager, about to start your freshman year in high school. In either case, they needed to meet any nonhuman members that you knew.

“Drade, please come and introduce yourself,” you requested as you stepped aside, near Eve and the other predators.

Some thumping could be heard as her footfalls were more pronounced. You had her do this so they could warm up to her rather than worry about suddenly seeing her. She could be almost as quiet as Eve when she wanted to. But little by little, the family witnessed as the very large Scorpion came into the open area they had made among them, like a crescent moon shape so all could see but she could approach and the spiders taking care of defense after that point.

“An honor to meet Caleb’s family. I am Queen Drade of the Wisconsin territory of Scorpions,” She greeted with a version of a bow. They wouldn’t otherwise know what that looked like if they weren’t already used to Eve doing it. They all knew Eve’s new status and knew that such an act wasn’t a little thing in their society.

“Let me get this straight.” Started Grandpa Konel. “You want to join this family, as Eve has done?”

“Yes,” was her rather blunt answer. You had prepared her for your family and she was ironically nervous. One would think, with a Scorpion the size of a small bus, that the humans around would be the ones nervous. However they were so conditioned to predators that they didn’t even bat an eye at her appearance.

“Caleb, will we be safe with her around?” Asked Papa.

“I don’t know her as well as Eve. But with a deep check into both her mind and being around her for a few weeks, yes. I wouldn’t bring her to you all otherwise. Truthfully, there aren’t many of her kind in Wisconsin, to cold. But she gained Eve’s support before mine and has yet to disappoint. I would warrant the same caution around her children. But she has earned my confidence.” You boldly stated as you stood by her as formally as you could, closer than you would if you were embellishing it

“What of your… children?” Grandma Lon asked. She asked both as concern for them but also the danger they posed.

“I have instructed them in the same way Eve has. I also, accept that they may be some lost just like hers are at a very large amount of times. I suppose the good news is with not so many surviving the cold, that there aren’t as many consentient ones that would otherwise act on instinct. Even those are under a no tolerance policy for your family… our family. If one stings anyone here, it won’t be my children.” She answered.

“I suppose that is good enough. At the very least you have Caleb’s confidence, so you will have ours as well.” Grandpa Konel stated to which the tension in the group was reduced.

“Eve!” called a few of the little kids as soon as that was done. Before anyone could stop them, Isaac and a bunch of the younger cousins ran over and started jumping on her. Some might be better at expressing it but all of them missed her, even if they weren’t too keen on her children. You could see Drade looking at them surprised that they could or would just do that. Then it turned to a little bit of guilt at nothing she did but that there must be something that prevented such a reaction to her. She looked to think that maybe she was incapable of such things.

“I got an idea.” You said as they all were mingling around. They were a little hesitant to approach Drade and most swarmed the remaining predators. You weren’t going to have them keeping their distance. They all turned silent as some settled on top of Eve. “Since we can’t have a full on Vacation this year, why not just a single hunting match, with a few extra predators on the human side. Drade would be a huge help and you all get to know her. That and Mrs. Dremer hasn’t participated yet, neither has Doug.”

“What is this ‘hunting match’?” asked Drade, she was the only one that hadn’t at least heard about it.

“It is an event we do when we had our family vacations. Basically, I use all my power to hunt everyone and achieve a goal decided before the match. Only thing I can’t do is kill the people playing. I have to heal any lasting damage at the end, so there isn’t really any danger but an insane amount as well. On their the opposite side, they have to hunt me and prevent the objective from being completed. Since I can’t die, they can do ANYTHING to get me. Chopping my head off, shooting me, biting me, or in your case stinging me. After the match, all hard feelings are left there and we use any left over aggression for next time. Keeps us wanting to do it every time and it trains both sides while putting my abilities on record with family, as I use all of them. The upside for you this time is to bond with them. They will need all the help they can get and in such a situation they can’t afford to be picky. Put it this way. They would rather have you next to them, helping them out, then another human. Each of the predators in our family are vital, and that will include you this time.” You explained as you stroked a leg that was near her.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: The family needs another Vacation to accept Drade.

choices: High School, a whole new experience.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It wasn't long before you all were on seperate sides and ready to start. Sure there was a bit of apprehension about Drade, and the her to them, but she was not someone to be ignored in this type of exercise. Mrs. Dremer and her got off right away, as the two that hadn't actually competed before. Eventually they split up into groups and started. Doug, had access and skill with more advanced weapons, so it was fun to say the least to watch them. Even if it was in the middle of the day, you still were determined to make them have a good time, and have Drade be a invaluable part by the end. So it started.

"Got you!" Drade said as she stung a tree that you were hiding behind. You narrowly escaped the point of her stinger as it easily snapped the tree in half and occupied the area you were once in. She didn't relent though, she followed through with a few grabs with her pinchers and another jab of her stinger, before you were forced to enter a portal to get away. True, you were out of your element in the middle of the day but you were suprised that she had caught on so quickly.

"That was amazing!" complimented Sarah. She was going to give her a pat but thought better of it. However she was pretty close so it made the sudden vocal pattern make Drade spin around and check for hostiles. Sarah froze at the sight of her in prime striking position. She was waving her hands in an obvious submissive stance. "Sorry, I didn't mean to upset you."

"No need for appologies child." Drade said, as she dialed back a little and was more receptive. "I, however, need to do so. It will take some time for me to accept you humans as... ah... family, and not enemies. I didn't mean to scare you."

"Don't worry, you didn't." Sarah said to which Drade moved in curiosity.

"Explain," she almost demanded. She didn't know if this human was bluffing or serious. How could she not be afraid of her?

"You forget, I've lived with a Vampire, a giant spider, and speratic intervals of Succubus. After a few mornings of waking to Eve's fangs being over my head... it kind of spoils any attempt at intimidation or fear from predator positions. I knew you had enough control to stop so I wasn't scared." Sarah replied.

"I suppose you all aren't like normal humans... do in no small part by your brother. Living with Caleb has really changed your life, hasn't it." she more stated than asked.

"You have no idea." Sarah answered.

"Even so, most of your family is a little distant. Why are you so close to me? I could accidentally sting you or sheer your body in half you know?" Drade asked, still a little confused.

"Well, to tell you the truth... I really don't like spiders. Eve is the only one that I am halfway ok with. Even her I have smacked out of my room on a few occasions. I was... well... I was hoping that..." Sarah started as the group started moving again. Sarah was getting a little red with blushing as she was attempting to ask for what she wanted. You watched sliently so that you could see Drade's progress.

"You were hoping that you could keep a few of my children around instead of Eve's?" Drade asked in return, hoping she was interrpereting your sister correctly. She had a lot to learn about humans that she didn't know yet. Things that she never actually wanted to know.

"Yeah..." Sarah answered bashfully. You never would've guessed it but she was really into Scorpians. You had thought that she would like them better than spiders, but not actually LIKE them in general. The other family members around her seemed equally interested in this conversation.

"I suppose that would be ok. I have a son that is more receptive to this whole thing. Maybe the two of you can learn from each other. He is pretty big though, near 4 feet long, without counting his tail. You think you can handle that?" Drade asked.

"Yes!... I mean I would love that. If you don't mind me asking, without webs, how does your kind catch bugs and stuff like that?" Sarah asked.

"Easily... I am sure that Alex will show you. He actually is quite fond of humans. Was always teased by his siblings for it in fact. You two should get along fine." Drade answered.

With that done, you decided to get their attention again and started the game in ernest. Eventually they all regrouped and was harder to take down. It must've been Drade's escolated experience in hunting, but she was really good at fending you off. She even scored a hit a few times. But the lack of silver made her easy to get away from. Lastly, she was introduced to your bite, when you caught her. She suprised that you could penetrate her hard outside and equally so that it felt so good. It was safe to say that you all grew closer. By the end of the time, she was giving rides to the kids and letting them use her body as a jungle gym. Later, she thanked you for the whole thing and you responded by welcoming her, officially to the family. A position she took with great pride as she organized with a few, including Doug, of some of them that would want her children around.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They all want it and get ready.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Get out of the way, freshy." Deek commanded as he pushed you aside arrogantly. He was a senior and head of both the Vampire Clan at your school and the popularity scale... which was basically the same thing. It wasn't worth getting in an altercation with him for many reason. One of which was that you kept your secret a secret for a reason. You didn't need it being known that you could SOMEHOW beat the crap out of the 'Vampires' and get away with it. People could be thick but they weren't that dumb. So you played the socially awkward card, which wasn't that hard, as you and Kelsey had already done so during Junior High.

"Sorry," you appologized as you moved further out of the way, out of the path he and his bootlicking followers that were taking up the majority of the hallway. Sure they weren't as bad as before, but they still had an extremely high pull in even something as small as high school popularity. That made them THE people to know and hang with in high school.

"You ok?" Asked Kelsey as you recovered and started walking to your first class.

"Same old, same old," you answered with a shrug.

"Yeah, pretty much the same here. Boys with too many hormones and no idea how to use them," She agreed.

"I take it that you made the Cheerleading squad?" you asked almost rhetorically.

"No contest. I'm telling you, it is actually harder to hold back than it is to practice. That and to not knock out Deek's girl, Breeona. That girl is SOOooo full of herself that it makes me want to snap her in half." Kelsey vented.

"She that bad?" You asked.

"Well it helps that you made them bathe again. Which you get some neck juice from me later for. She just flashes her fake fangs out whenever she can and is pretty much like Carly was on the 6th grade retreat, but with more... body to show," She answered and pushed you a little at the 'neck juice' line, as you both went to class.

"Did I hear you talking about me Bitch?!" stated a voice before an almost pale white arm came into view and slapped Kelsey so hard she went falling into you to which you held her as she recovered but also to keep her from retaliating on raw predator instinct. By the time the owner of the arm was talking again she had the persona of a scared Freshman that 'didn't understand' and was, more importantly, hurt by the slap. A ruse that was particularly hard for her to play out. You actually had to restrain her wings from coming out with your arm as you held her in your 'protective hug'. "So your boyfriend is going to fight your fights?"

"Breeona, you're done right?" You asked. To all but Kelsey it seemed like you were pleeding with her. Only Kelsey knew that you were using your suggestion to control her to your will.

"Yeah, see you at practice Freshy Boobs," Breeona teased then went down the hall with her 'followers'. You used your ability to calm everyone around you so you two could continue walking.

"Freshy Boobs?" You asked after you two were out of earshot of the 'Vampires'.

"It's their way of teasing me about my boobs and being a freshman at the same time." She sulked.

"Don't worry about it. She's just jealous," You returned to which she just smiled and leaned into you as you both continued to walk to class. As usual, her forward behavior and her awkward reaction to the possiblility and insinuation of you being romantically involved with her, skipped your mind.

"So, pretty odd likelihood that we are in EVERY class together. Had anything to do with that?" she asked, probably already knowing the answer.

"I might've... talked with a few people about... tweeking our scheduals," you responded.

"Well I'm glad. What about you're home stuff?" She asked.

"You mean Drade's children that Sarah opted for instead of spiders?" you asked.

"Mhmm." Kelsey confirmed. It had been interesting to say the least with Scorpions showing up in Wisconsin in more numbers than people even thought exsisted in the state. A few had joined in Sarah's room as a secure place to be in the winter. More and more of them were finding how fruitful their new alliance was.

"Well, they didn't get along with Eve's children at first. But a good yelling from my Mom about a couple hundred dead bugs all around the house straightened them out a good deal." You answered.

"A couple hundred? Isn't Drade mad about that?" Kelsey asked.

"Not really. She was actually proud of her Children for giving their lives or something like that. Honestly it was a little weird to have that kind of number of dead and to hear both her and Eve just brush it off. Must be a bug thing." You answered back.

"OK EVERYONE." said a voice as you both took seats in the back of the room. You liked being able to see all the people in the room, as did Kelsey. It must be a predator thing. The voice that spoke was your first teacher of the day, Mr. Winter, a math Teacher, THE math teacher. Sure there were others, but Mr. Winter was the one that was like your Grandpa. He didn't give a crap who anybody was or anything like that. And if anyone was caught sleeping in his class... they were woken up in a variety of interesting ways that he was more than infamous amongst the students for. "I know how much you all LOVE math and freedom. So I'm going to give you both in this class. But they go together. If you mess with my math than I mess with your freedom, RIGHT!"

The last word he said he emphasized by slamming a pack of papers on someone's desk with an audible "SMACK!" that made his point infinitely more clear... and loud. This was high school. Despite what remained the same, everything was differnet.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: High School, a whole new experience.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It had been bothering you for some time. You had been raised in a Christian home, went to Church, went to a Christian school, had Bible studies, and had what even amounted to you as faith. However, while doing these things you had been lying through your teeth. Most, if not all, relgions painted Vampires as demons and such. At best they were a fictional representation of a society liberalism. Your teachers preached it, despite some of their taste for movies like Blade and a few that you've actually spent some time in. But biggest yet was your loving Pastor preached it. Your father was a part of the Church and as such had you help out with repairs. You, in a sense, was the biggest hypocrytical person in the place.

Your family shared your pain at such things but didn't know it like you did. You weren't evil in any sense, but that was what was being taught. Despite their support, your family couldn't really understand your pain. The only one that could was Kelsey. Most traditional stories and tales of the Succubus was that they were actual demonesses. Here for the sole purpose of sucking out souls and damning them to hell after consumption. But if either of your fictional backgrounds were real than niether of you could go to church or touch a Bible for that matter. The secret was bound to come out sooner or later, with you working at the Church so much with your family.

"A little higher..." Papa said as you lifted a rather large section of the roof for him to repair. It had blown off during a particularly bad wind storm. The roof needed some work anyway so it was convienent timing. So there you flew, on the underside of the cieling while they secured it when the inevitable happened. Papa had locked the doors to the inside so no one could see you. But there was one person who was higher on the latter in the church as far as humans were concerned, the Pastor. "... good, just hold it a little bit longer while we secure it."

"Got it." You replied as you liesurely held up the ton or so amount of wieght while just floating there in midair. You had come accustomed to trusting in certain things. Safety in the Church was one of them. Sure you couldn't do things out in the open, but you helped. From someone's sore throat during worship service to cutting the grass. No one but your family knew how much you did. Even they stopped trying to keep track. You were too powerful at this point to be tracked by them.

"What the..." said someone from underneath you. You froze in your relaxation to this. No one was suppose to be in here. You slowly turned your head to see Pastor Bill there, looking at you with astonishment.

"Uhh, Papa?" You called.

"Yes you can let go." He answered, thinking you were asking if you could do so.

"We got a problem Papa." You informed to which you sent him a mental image of the Pastor's current look of shock underneath you. The hammering stopped ubruptly. You heard a few instructions to your brothers then came down and around to the sanctuary in which you were floating. You didn't dare move in fear of jogging the Pastor's fight or flight emotion. You could've just knocked him out and explained at your leisure, but you didn't think that wise if you wished this to come out without the demon title. In a few moments Papa came in and locked the door behind him again, so you both had time while your brothers continued on the roof... probably with one of your uncles at this point as supervision if nothing else.

"Caleb, can you come down here please?" Papa asked to which the Pastor snapped out of it as you slow decended until you stood on the platform he usually spoke on, with Papa arriving as well. The church wasn't that big in comparison to others so the space was relatively small but still comfortably sizable for this fragile notion. Pastor Bill had his back against the back wall as far as placement but not literally as Papa and you formed an unintentional triagle with him.

"Peter? Caleb? What is going on? Where you just...'gulp'... flying?" Pastor Bill asked in a confused tone and persona. It was a good thing he didn't feel caged at the moment.

"Well technically I was floating." you tried to joke, but was shot a look from them both. From the Pastor of further confusion and Papa of instruction. "Sorry, bad joke."

"Pastor, it seams we have something to discuss." Papa stated.

"Yes, it appears we do. In my office, both of you." He almost commanded to which you both complied.

'Should I calm him a little?' you asked in Papa's mind to which he just shook his head to which you left it the way it was.

Soon you were all in a sound proof office with the Pastor turning to secure the door as locked before pausing, then turning slowly and taking a good look at you. He then walked to his desk and slowly lowered into the chair but you and Papa continued to stand.

"Do you want to start with how or what?" Pastor Bill said finally.

"Do you want the long verson or the short verson?" Papa asked.

"Tell me everything." Pastor Bill, again, almost commanded. To that effect, Papa recited the entire series of events without leaving out a single detail. To his credit, Pastor Bill was taking it all in without interupting or running of screaming. He was either in denial or extremely understanding. Finally Papa was done and waited for Pastor Bill to speak.

"So... Vapmire?" he asked you in confirmation to which you nodded, in almost an ashamed feel. "But not evil?"

"If I was, could I do this?" you asked as you picked up the Bible and began reading for a few moments before putting the Bible down and showing him your hands to proof that you suffered no ill effects from doing so.

"How can this be?" He asked.

"Pastor Bill please..." you started but was cut off.

"NO!... Just let me think." He said, the first bit stung a little but he hadn't lost his kind nature that you knew from years of being around him. If there was one person you admired close to your Father, it was him. "Why did you not come to me sooner?"

"We had a hard enough time having our own family accept Caleb for who he is. We weren't sure how people outside our family would react. He is only one person and Miss. Isibelle's work didn't really leave a good taste in people's mouth when it comes to Vampires." Papa explained.

"And what do you think about this Caleb?" Pastor Bill asked.

"I... I wanted to tell you. Every time I worked up the courage to do so you seamed to come out with a sermon about something close to demons and such. One of your main socialogical examples are Vampires and how EVIL they are. That... I just wasn't sure if I should burden you with this. I had questions over these few years that I wanted to ask you, but... I was too afraid." You admitted.

"How do I know you aren't messing with my mind right now?" he asked.

"You don't, I guess. If you don't believe that I am good than no matter what I say it won't matter. I could always show you what it feels like so you know it isn't happening. But then again you would need to trust me on that as well." You answered.

"Have you killed?" he asked rather bluntly.

"Yes." you answered equally as blunt.

"For food?" he asked.

"No." You replied.

"You can watch the series with him in it if that helps. Caleb had to decide when it was ok to kill and not have it be murder." Papa defended.

Pastor Bill seemed to be on the edge of your status. Either he would recognize you as good and allow you to remain. Or he would let years of supposed insight guide him to determine you were an evil being to be cast out... of his presence at least. In that case you would have to wipe his memory. You didn't have any intention of killing him or such things. Either way, this would be difficult for both him and you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Church and the truth.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It seemed like you were standing on ice at the moment, just waiting for it to stop cracking and fall through to a deep, dark, and lonely depth of no return. You kept a tight control of your powers, as if a single move or unknown effect could cause him to reject you on uncertainty alone. You wanted to trust him. He was one of the men of consequence in your life. But you couldn't bring yourself to change him to be more receptive or even more calm in his decision. You wanted HIM, not an altered version of him. Finally he breathed deep and let it out in a rather large sigh of frustration.

"I hope you two, and the others that knew, know what an uncomforable position you put me in. Worse than preaching wrong is preaching in situational ignorance. Preaching something false that the Bible doesn't back up with evidence to the contrary right in front of me. I understand why you kept this a secret, but for me to demean you Caleb, right in front of you without knowing, is not easy for me to accept. I feel like I punched you in the gut without knowing I did." Pastor Bill started then seemed to give the two of you a chance to talk.

"I'm sorry." You said. As a kid, vampire aside, you still had a limited version of situational prudence. You had been taught to appologize at like times. If others were to arrogant to appologize than that was their buisness, but it wouldn't filter in to your mind as well. Even if what you had to appologize for was minimal, it was still worth saying.

"I got throw one in there as well Pastor. I know I was just protecting my child. But I should've trusted that you were capable enough to handle this. As big of a secret this is, you should've been told." Papa added.

"I understand. I can't imagine I would've reacted as well as you Peter, in your shoes. You've always been one we can look to to be of solid character and example. But you don't have to do it alone. Don't worry either. Other than my wife, your secret is safe with us. I just have to find a way of telling her and keep her from blowing a gasket." Pastor Bill said with some thought.

"I don't know if it's to soon, but I can help with that if you want." you suggested subtly was you could.

"How?" he asked, concerned.

"Well, I can alter people's minds to an extent. In this case, make her more calm." You revealed.

"Did you do that to me just now?" he asked.

"No. Papa and I thought that you should be you when you decided. If necessary I would've had to take steps, but they weren't." you responded as non-confrontational as possible.

"What steps?" Pastor Bill asked.

"Well this is a big secret. If it gets out... well it could get really bad. That is why I haven't dispelled the Vampire Clan or the fictional stories. So people can't or won't suspect me for what I am. So if you would've started condemning me as a demon or something like that then I could've erased your memory so you could continue living without doing damage to us, yourself, or others." You answered as carefully as you could.

"I see. Well I guess I shouldn't get upset about things that didn't or won't happen." Pastor Bill said then thought for a minute. "I suppose you have the capablity of doing a lot of good around here... like lifting part of the roof. Is there anyone else I should know about?"

"Uh... yeah. But It really isn't our place to tell you. But they don't pose any danger to anyone." You answered.

"If you don't mind Pastor, I think I'll step out and get that roof done. You probably have a lot of questions and Caleb knows more about that world than I do." Papa more asked than stated.

"That must be strange as a parent." He joked, which was a very good sign of communicational fresh air that got all of you to smile for one reason or another.

"More than you know. I just do the best I can. Caleb has already made me very proud. I just try to keep up." Papa joked back then stepped out the door. Pastor bill was going to lock it again but you thought to indulge a little and lock it from where you were already. He looked in awe as the dead bolt locked on its own, then looked at you.

"You do that?" he asked.

"Yes, I can do a lot of things. Harder to do them in daylight but not that bad." You answered kindly as possible.

"So... why can't you tell me about these others?" Pastor Bill asked.

"It really isn't my place to do so. I am kind of like a young leader but not really. Apparently they all obey me but I am far to young to rule them, nor has the vampires before me have done such... apparently. I still have a lot to learn. I can't really forsee the consequences for telling you some of the stuff I've learned that, in short, humans shouldn't know. Some of it is rather messy and most is not something I can put into words." You explained.

"I see. What can you tell me? About you and other Vampires." He asked.

"Well on that I can say more. We weren't lying. I am the only one. Miss. Isibelle was the one before me and I literally CAN'T turn anyone else. My powers and limitations are too long to say in a short conversation, or even a long one. Basic stuff though is I can do cool stuff and I don't die from sunlight." You tried to explain.

"What about... wait a minute. It was you that helped us out when we were a couple hundred short a few months ago wasn't it?" he asked.

"Yes. I was rather persuasive with the Bank about the Church's status. I have my ways of saying a lot but also saying nothing." You answered with a little smirk.

"What else have you been doing around here that I don't know about?" He asked, more interested than confrontational. In which case, you felt more than eager to share.

"You know that cold you had last week?" You asked.

"You're kidding... you cleared that up?" He asked.

"Well yeah. Pain in the butt to make it seam natural. I also made it cooler in the summer and comfortable during the winter. Helped a few cases of early cancer, broken bones, and emotions that needed mending. Referbished the pages of the Bibles in the pews, not to mention helping with repairs and magically cutting the grass to name a few." You listed off on your fingers in a comical fashion.

"I assume you also had something to do with the Vampire Clan's sudden turn away from typical cult status." He more stated than asked.

"Yes. Showed myself to the leader and told him I was not please. I did have to kill one person in that meeting. Not really something I wanted to do but it was necessary. His mind was... well, if minds had a sewer system, he would be the scum. Anyway, I am an unofficial leader of it. I let them do as they wish but told them I would be 'keeping an eye one them'. Only one person over there knows my face and no one over there knows WHO or WHERE I am." You explained, being noticably down about the killing issue.

"Is what your father said true? Is feeding actually a good thing?" He asked. It was obvious that your Q&A session would last a while.

"If you think about it, it isn't that hard to believe. My... Venom I guess... works to stimulate the body to give everything quicker and easier. Pain tends to make it harder so pleasure is the next up. Faster the blood is pumping, the faster blood flows out. So it does feel good, but that can be very bad. If neither me or the person I am feeding wants me to stop, and we don't, the person obviously would die. So it is basically on me to hold back. As of now, I have yet to drink anyone dry like that. But Miss. Isibelle said it would happen eventually, at least once. Other than that, there is absolutely NO bad side effects to it. Not even a scare or puncture wounds." You explained.

"So how tough are you?" He wondered. You got the feeling like he was asking if you had a weakness. You already told him, or Papa did when he was explaining things. But you owed it to him to answer his questions, multiple times if needed.

"I am immortal, I can't die for a very long time. Biggest thing is Silver though. It really is a pain in the butt. It is the only thing that COULD hold me down if caught, even a minimal amount in some rope or something. For that I have to sense it and avoid. Sure I can still do things with silver around, but it is like running with hundred pound wieghts on a normal human."

And so came your long nigh with the Pastor. He asked you questions well past midnight and into the morning. You indulged him in biting him a little bit, then took him home via teleportation. He agreed to ease off on the demon calling in church for you, as well as understand that there were some secrets you needed to keep. After a demonstration on the Hide hand and flesh stripping, he agreed that there were certain things humans shouldn't know or couldn't deal with like a Vampire could. You hoped that this decision wouldn't bite you in the butt some day. Pastor Bill was fine, as was his wife. Other people in the church thought... not a good idea.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: He accepts you.

choices: They got someone and are ready for you... more or less
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Caleb, have you heard?" asked your Mother.

"About what?" You asked back, seeing her exasperated face to dictate that this was more or less urgent.

"Sarah was kidnapped on a Vacation to Florida. Some terrorists took her and some others and are demanding a ransom." She responded. Sarah had won a Vacation on one of those phone in 20th caller things. Your parents let her go with some friends, as it was spring break at this point.

"Do they know anything else?" you asked, suddenly serious in this situation.

"I don't know, you could talk to Doug and maybe your buddy Dracula for more information." Papa suggested as he entered the conversation. "Caleb, please bring her home."

"Of course. They have to be either the dumbest or truly ignorant terrorists ever to kidnap one of MY family." You responded, keeping the conversation short. With a pat from Papa, you teleported off to see Doug first. You used your usual mode of entrance into his office. He knew you were coming and looked to be ready.

"Caleb, thought you would show up. We must be dealing with the worlds most idiotic terrorists in the world. Even if they don't know why, most criminal organizations know that your family is highly protected," Doug greeted.

"What is the situation?" You asked in a dialated tone that was calculating everything you observed. He flinched at this new behavior. Sure he had seen you hunt and fight before, but never with this amount of concentration. He secretly felt sorry for the people he was about to send you after.

"The group retreated immediately out of the country, onto a large boat, just out of the United States border. Officially we can't do anything. The whole negotiation thing, or lack there of, with terrorists. Anyway, they have a couple hundred hostages along with your sister. However they seamed to be promoting her on their video messages and ransom requirements. They either know about you, or they think someone as protected as she is would be worth something." Doug explained as quickly as possible.

"Not a very healthy attitude. How much time do I have?" You asked.

"You had 24 hours since they sent their message..." he said as he looked at his watch to determine the amount of time that had come and gone since that point. "... which was recieved 5 hours ago."

"What has been decided?" You asked, obviously referring to the government's plan on getting a few hundred citizens back.

"The OFFICIAL plan is to wait them out and try to send in seams of seals to secure things. But I don't think you have that kind of time. They were threatening to kill Sarah at the 24 hour mark. Even if they don't I don't think an ordinary seal team would be able to do anything." Doug informed, again, as quickly as possible.

"What do you mean by that?" You asked.

"Not to knock on the seals, but... I have a strong feeling we aren't just dealing with humans here. Either that or they are so dumb that they would kill Sarah anyway. If they are at all prepared as to kidnap YOUR sister and openly provoke the Vampire Clan, they must have some... nonhuman calling the shots." Doug answered.

"Doesn't matter. Either way, if I don't do something, she's dead." You stated and was about to head off when Dougs hand caught your arm, to which you turned your attention to him.

"Just be careful. Act smart. Assume they are expecting you or you might be the one being hunted." He almost pleaded. You nodded. He was a little off at seeing your eyes now glowing, meaning you were letting go your true Vampire power and nature. However he let go and nodded back to you. It was a good feeling to have him both respect you and fear for you. Not that you needed it but it was still nice.

With that done, you fanished and zoomed across the land toward the glyph you had on Sarah. The closer you got the more you could feel around her, like a sensory verson of radar. As you read you annalysed the ship and the situation to determine what was going on. Doug was usually right about things like this. You didn't want to involve the Vampire Clan with this as you didn't want them to have actual proof WHO you were in relation to the family you had requested to put protection globally around. So they were either running with a nonhuman or they were a bunch of dumbasses.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Kidnapping your family, really?

choices: Sarah is able to get the truth out of her.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You arrived in mist form, as you didn't want to alert anyone in any fashion. You were both relieved and surprised to find that there was no freaks or monster like people in control. The large boat was filled with people though. There was about 40 terrorists and a couple hundred hostages. Obviously the Terrorists had guns and had Sarah in a locked cell of sorts... as if she was in a hostile version of a VIP room. Currently they were just getting done roughing her up a bit. You waited until they left the room and was out of audible range.

"Sarah..." You called from your mist state inside the room and around her. She was slouched on the chair they had left her in. But she was far from pleasantly content. You could see multiple cuts, bruises, and evidence of rough play. You repeated your call until her eyes started adjusting. You helped her health until she was healed but still didn't show yourself, yet.

"Caleb? Is that you?" She asked as she stood up and looked around then at her newly healed body. She knew it was you, but just needed some support.

"Shh, they are coming. I will protect you, say what you want but try and find out why the did this. Ask to speak with their leader and I'll follow around you." You replied to which she quickly sat back down and smirked at your presence. She knew, with you there, that she would be ok... and the kidnappers wouldn't. With little time to spare, the door slammed open and in came some burly looking men. They wasted little time in grabbing her, and dragging her out of the room in a rough but directed manner. 'looks like they are taking you to their leader anyway' You said to her mind.

'Are you just going to let them drag me like this?' she asked back in her mind, knowing you left your link open to speak secretly with her.

'Kind of. I need you to talk to their leader, whomever it is. Be as sarcastic as you want. Besides, I am dulling the pain and effects of their handling you. There isn't any pain is there?' you replied back.

'I... I suppose not. What do I refer to you as? I can't let these idiots know you are my brother right?' She asked and agreed.

'Just say that you know me as the leader of the Vampire Clan and that you're LIKE family. Might as well throw some threats in there as well. I am currently knocking out each of the Terrorists and placing them in a cell like the one you were just taken from, near the bow of the ship. I am actually making it look like a horror movie. You know how I do that taken in the darkness thing.' you explained. What you referred to was something she, and the rest of the family, had seen you do more than enough times. Simply it looked like you were pulling the person into the shadows of the room. What you were really doing was pulling them into your mist and teleporting them as you pleased and where you pleased. However, unless they were looking straight at it, there was no way to notice it happening to people around them. And to people that didn't know better it was like being in a horror movie. 'By the time you get there I should only have the area around the room you are in and the leader to deal with. So don't worry about anyone else either.'

'OK'. she thought back then concentrated on what was happening to her.

It wasn't long before she was shoved into another chair in a room with a desk at the far corner, a rather attractive woman was sitting in the chair. She looked like one of those russian secret service women as she looked over Sarah and dismissed the others from the room. Once the door was closed you took them away as well, before resting solely in the room the three of you were now occupying.

"So... it seams your government nor this 'Vampire Clan' will be paying. That is unfortunate, because is no one pays, you die. You don't have any way to persuade them do you? It is your life after all." The woman said as she stood and walked to the other side of her desk so her lane to Sarah's chair was clear.

"Why are you doing this? It can't be just for the money." Sarah stated.

"Why not?" the Woman asked, obviously hiding something.

"Because you don't seem that stupid. Your men are idiots but you seem to have another reason for doing this." Sarah replied, trying to get your answer. Sure, you could just read her mind, but this way was more illuminating.

"I don't need to explain myself to you, Brat..." she stated then took a step and slapped Sarah across the face. "You will do what I tell you, move where I say to move, and talk when I say to talk."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Stupid is as stupid does...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"So you did all this, for money?" Sarah asked. She obviously didn't like the whole slapped in the face thing, but was dealing with you for your sake. It also helped that you took away the pain.

"Yes. When I am done, I will be able to by many buildings and be as powerful as the vampires." She said, strangely enough, with a great deal of pride. You read her mind just to be sure at this point. She was just a stupid woman with an unhealthy drive to gain wealth and power. Unfortunately, she didn't have the smarts to pull it off, as evidence to her kidnapping Sarah.
