"I got to be honest, that is the most idiotic thing I've heard. You know that the leader of the Vampire Clan is a really awesome and insanely loyal guy right? Odds are he will come here himself and ruin this little party you have going. He isn't the type that can be successfuly bribed or threatened." Sarah warned.

"Ah, so you do know him. That will make this even more interesting. Maybe I should ask for more..." She said, as if she just realized your connection to Sarah... or at least the part of you knowing her, not so much that you both were siblings.

"Right, I think we've both heard enough lady." Sarah interupted. The woman wheeled around to probably smack her again, but fell over as you stood behind Sarah, with your 'Vampire Clan Outfit' on. Sarah saw this reaction and turned her head to see you. "Well it is about time. Seriously, this broad just ruined the entire trip."

"Guards!!!" She screamed but none came. You had long rendered them incapable of responding. You moved in front of Sarah so you could more formally be in the conversation.

"But I bet it will be an interesting story to tell for most of them. You may have gotten use to this whole thing, but this will probably be the most they'll ever experience." You offered. She seemed to think about it until she jumped at the sound of a few gun shots. You used a simpe hidehand to stop the incoming projectiles without even turning to legitimize the shooting as a threat. For starters, it wasn't, they weren't even silver. Sarah just smirked at this before looking you in the face. Sure it was hidden and pretty intimidating as you looked now, but you were her brother, and not a threat... to her anyway.

"I guess you're right. Does that mean I have to stay here and get back the old fashion way?" she asked. She registered an incoming sword attack at you both but trusted you would take care of it. You didn't disapoint, as you used one hand to deflect her attack and transfer her safely, unconcious, and unarmed to the same sell the others were in. Again, all of that without registering or turning away from your conversation with Sarah.

"Sorry Sarah, but if I took you home right now I would have to clean up for at least a month. Wiping people's memory is a more tedious task that it looks like." You informed. Now that you two were alone, you changed out of your Vampire clothes and into your normal ones.

"Well... thanks for coming Caleb. Even if it is accepted at this point, it was still nice to know that I would be ok, and that you would be here to take care of things." Sarah replied back.

"You're welcome. You're my Sister, that's what families do." You responded back.

"Ok, enough with the emotional brother sister talk. Not really our style anyway. Are you going to need a recharge?" she asked in a clear question if you wanted to suck some of her blood. She probably wanted you to, but for now it was just a question.

"Probably shouldn't. You'll need all your strength to figure out how to tell everyone that you were able to release a gas capsle and confine them all." You answered and hinted at a prepared cover story for her.

"Well then, I better get started." She groaned to which you both smiled and you left. Teleporting next to Doug.

"You know, I'm going to have to get use to that." Doug stated as he flinched at you sudden arrival. You simply smirked and nodded at his comment before he continued. " I assume this to mean that you took care of it?"

"Yep, left Sarah there as the hero. Turned out they were just stupid, money obssessed theives. Not even propper silver... silverwear to worry about, on my side at least." You reported.

"Well that is a relief," Doug said with a sigh to which you looked at him quizically. "I am just glad that there isn't another non-human group out there that is causing trouble for us. We got enough with the Vampire Clan, Spiders, Scorpions, and Succubus. It is nice that this one was just pain, old fashion, stupidity."

"I see. I guess it is a refreshing pace. Hope it lasts." You said with a bow then teleported to your concerned parents.

"Caleb, you're back. Is Sarah ok? What happened?" they asked. At this point you all knew that questions about your physical well being in such a situation was not necessary. So you didn't take offense when they didn't ask how you were doing in the same series of concerned questions.

"Everything's fine. Got there, no problems, took care of things, painted Sarah as the hero, and got back. No aftermath to worry about... well unless Sarah chooses to oversell her hero angle. Then she might bring home a fan club." You reported with a smile. Your Mother just hugged you tightly as Papa smiled and nodded his evergrowing approval. Both felt good, really good, no matter how many times they did it. You suspected they knew it and was part of the reason they still responded so well to everything helpful you did, regardless if they knew it was no challenge for you. "Although, if you don't lighten up on the death grip, I might turn blue."

"Caleb, you are just... wonderful," Mom said as she laughed a little then let go. Maybe it was the fact that it was the family you protected this time, the whole 'precious daughter' thing. But the relief, gratitude, and love they usually had to fake was insanely real and amplified this time. It made you feel even more happy and content then usual. It may have been born out of stupidity, but you would have to thank those thieves and kidnappers for this wonderful feeling... eventually.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: There isn't anything else.

choices: Vampire Clan needs you for a summit of sorts.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Hey man, how's it going?" Said a kid named Colin.

Over the first few months you had stressed a desire to have some normal friends. Ones that you would've gotten without your new abilities and status. A simpler way of saying it would be, you wanted some human friends. Kelsey didn't really understand, neither did Eve, Drale, or any of the other nonhuman friends you had. You didn't know if it was left over human emotions or an instinctual balancing act. But you couldn't shake it. So you started connecting more at school, like a normal kid would. Of course, Kelsey was at your hip most of the time. She didn't have the same urge but she did like hanging around you, probably more than she should.

"Nothing much, just chilling." You answered back as Kelsey intensionally bumped you, "I mean, I was hagging out with Kelsey."

"You two aren't making out or anything right, cause that is really unfair." Said a kid named 'Tou' prounonced like 'Two'. He was... and interesting guy to be around. Unlike the more direct and loud Colin, he was more... 'sly' about it. He could get away with stuff like walking out of any class and entering another. The only reason people needed was saying 'Tou is Tou', then moved on. In fact, Kelsey had you double check to make sure he didn't have a compelling agent. However, he got a kick out of teasing you and Kelsey. She was probably the hottest person they or you would ever meet. So the fact that she always hung around you provided more than adequete ammunition for some teasing. Thankfully, Kelsey had a realtively good sense of humor.

"Yeah, like they would tell us." Came the last of your new friend group. His name was Dani. He was a little more secluded, like you, which made the two others balance out the group. One thing about this group was the relative moral standing. You all got tired of the whole drug, sex, fight,drama, idiot thing that people were doing. The only drama in the group was the internal secrecy that you and Kelsey had. You wanted them ignorant for a while... and free from suggestion. They were good old fashion friends that you both would have to work to keep, as humans.

"Here, now I'm telling you." Kelsey said as she leaned up and planted a soft peck on your cheek.

"Hey... where's mine?" Tou joked, Colin would've said something, but this time Tou got it out first... and he was closer. Without really thinking about it, Kelsey just turned her head, took a step, and planted a similar kiss on his cheek.

"PDA! PDA!" Colin yelled obnoxiously to which you all smiled or chuckled at the thought. Most girls Kelsey's age wouldn't give something like that out so casually. If it was, than they were giving it ALL in accordance with high school drama stages or status. But being that she was a Succubus, it didn't even register to her as a sensual act, and the way she did it, it didn't seam like one to your group either.

"Hey, is it cool if I get your help with math?" Dani asked Colin.

"Nah, man. I didn't do it yet. Got that English paper to write." He answered.

"KELSEY." they both said at the same time as they glanced over at her. It was either you or her that was asked with help, mostly her.

"Jeeze... that was predictable." She sighed with a smirk, as if she was annoyed but obviously wasn't. However, she was already holding out the Homework they needed. She made a small game out of giving it to them until they were able to snatch it. She may not have understood why you needed the human interaction on this level, niether did you for that matter, but she was far from bored.

"How's Wrestling practice, and cheerleading?" Tou asked both you and Kelsey as the other two hurried to get their Homework done. In the grand sceme of things, you supposed, that cheating on Homework didn't rank very high on the bad behavior list, especially when pitted against things that the Vampire Clan did.

"FINE" you both said at the same time, looked at each other, then chuckled/giggled. You gave a motion that she coulg go first as you ate some of your lunch.

"The Seniors and the Vampires pretty much run the show. I just try to not get in the way." She stated.

"You kidding? You're way hotter than they are." Tou said, but he didn't even try to hide the suggestive meaning behind it. Again, Tou was Tou, and it was fine for him to say. Besides, Kelsey liked the compliment, as evidence to her sudden but not very long blush.

"Yeah, that's the point. They don't like that I outclass them. They are the 'big, bad, and hot girls'. Anything that threatens that they crush. So... they put me off to the side. I'm lucky they haven't tossed me out yet." Kelsey finished/ answered.

"What a bunch of noobs." Colin said before Dani brought him back to what they were supposed to be doing.

"What about you Caleb?" Tou asked you.

"I got it a little bit better. I think it is because I helped out a bunch in Junior High, but I still get a little bit of that to. Mainly the whole Vampire clan thing. Even if I beat them for a wieght class, they push their apparent superiority and whine till Coach 'asks' me to step aside." You answered.

"That's B.S. man." Colin said, as he was half listening to the conversation. This time Dani finished. "What? You're done already?"

"I wasn't the one only paying half attention." Dani shot back, but more in a competitive teasing way, almost gloating that he was done and Colin still had work to do. "Dee, Dee, Dee"

You all laughed as Colin got all comically flustered then raced to get his Homework done before the lunch bell rang again.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Starting on more human friends.

choices: Birds of some kind, speaking for a larger combined group.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It was an interesting day to say the least, but in a irritating way. You had been keeping more than an eye on the Vampire Clan. So you noticed right away when they got flustered that they couldn't contact you. Most of the time you were glad about this. You also had an assortment of Eve and Drade's children keeping even closer tabs on them. From what you and they gathered, Dracula was running things like you had instructed but still expanding. Lately, in this regard, you had let your personal observations go a little laxed. You liked your new life with your human friends, as partially fake as it was. Even Kelsey had to admit it was a refreshing change than her usual predator/monster/freak filled life. That was what annoyed you most about this coming situation. It almost literally ripped you from your relaxing vacation of sorts to deal with something you couldn't care less about at the moment. Currently, you were in Dracula's office with only him and the cameras turned off.

"I am sorry to bother you, Master, but this is a serious situation." Dracula started.

"As is everything with you people. Everything from the executive decisions to the color of the drapes. What bit of emergency was so important that it DEMANDED my attention?" You asked, in an obviously annoyed tone. You were standing near the observation window as Dracula paced around the room nervously but not so much as to be rude in that regard. Mainly to a stack of papers on his desk with information, than back to a more neutral position, and back again. At this point he was also sweating bullets. Last time he saw you, you did kind of rip a man apart with your mind in front of him with no effort. You couldn't really fault him for being nervous.

"We recieved a... challenge I guess you could say. Usually we deal with such things in our own way, but this one was... out of our league. We call ourselves Vampires here, and I for one am grateful you allow such. But rarely do we encounter another species that wishes proof of such claims, a group that isn't human." He explained. You almost instantly understood what he was telling you, minus specific details.

"I see. You all have been calling yourselves Vampires, and another group of predator class beings have challenged your claim. I did warn you of this did I not?" You asked, as if to jog his memory.

"You did, Master, but this isn't just a request of proof." He said as he held up the note in question.

"I would guess, whomever sent it, is thinking to wipe you all out. That was what I would do." You guessed without taking the note.

"Master?" He asked, in a very concerned and confused tone. He seemed afraid you were going to replace him at last.

"If things had progressed like before, and you all proved that it was a mistake to let you go about your buisness, I would've... dealt with you, ALL of you. This group lacks the information from the inside, or wants the influence you have to disappear. Either way, I don't see what concern this is of mine. I warned you that this might happen and it would be up to you to appease or conquer your foes as you see fit. But such battles can always go with you being on the losing side and that part is also your responsibility." You both informed and asked.

"So you will do nothing?" He asked before he could stop himself. He started to sweat immediately after his outburst as he saw your eyes flash their red glow. To further emphasise his appology, he bowed his head awaiting your response.

"I did not say that. I asked a question, and I expect an answer. If this is a human problem, I will not interfere beyond my own ends and ammusement. Convince me this is a predator problem, and I MIGHT help you." You clarified.

"Then, please read this." He said without lifting his head. He only lifted the note to you once again. Even though you were a few feet away you were able to grab it and bring it over to you. As soon as you saw the mark on the waxed seal, you knew this was not a matter of mere human interest. Such a sign could only belong to...
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Vampire Clan needs you for a summit of sorts.

choices: He tries to fight you again, but indirectly this time.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You looked at the letter and saw the indent in the wax, that once sealed it, had a wolf head howling on it. You were far from aware of ALL the predator/monster groups out there. But if there was sapient spiders and Scorpions, then it only made sense that there was some kind of k-9 presence as well. You took physical hold of the letter then opened it to read the note. It was a serious bit of text. It stated, in not so few words, that they would wipe out the 'Vampire Clan' and any the associated with them. However, they also presented another way. If the Vampire Clan would serve them, then they would all be spared. This was the part you latched onto. Sure you cared for human life. But, like you said before, they had dug their own grave, perhaps quite literally. But the thought of those under your authority being ruled by another in spite of you... it was not a welcome feeling. You couldn't really describe it. The closest thing you could think of it was a threat to your predatory territory, but that wasn't entirely accurate either. Any way you wanted to put it, they had your undevided attention now.

"I assume there was a person that delivered this piece of trash?" You asked in a suddenly serious tone that Dracula was both grateful and fearful of.

"Yes. We have him in a luxury suite. It is actually MY room if I want to be completely honest." He answered promptly.

"Take me to him, now." You ordered. It was a good thing you were already in your Vampire Clan gear, because you weren't in the mindset to change your outfit. You didn't know what this new feeling was, but you both welcomed and shunned it. If you weren't careful, you might do something you regret. Dracula led you straight there.

"Does this mean you are going to help us, Master?" He asked but you pinned him to the wall for his question... or more how he said it.

"You listen well Dracula. If you are asking if I am going to clean up YOUR mess, then my answer is no. I simply am responding to a threat to me and mine. I am in no mood to entertain your incompetence or human afairs. Afairs that you should've handled by youself. If I were any more angry I would replace you. Good thing for you, I am only annoyed at the moment. Don't push my very limited, remaining, patience." You boomed at him then tossed him in the direction he was originally walking.

"Yes Master! My appologies Master!" he said as clearly as he could with a raspy and recovering throat before he hurried to get you to your destination.

You didn't know what was wrong with you. Sure he deserved it, but it wasn't like you to just snap like that. You did an internal check to see if you were just tired or hungry... Nope; you had just fed on Kelsey and Sarah before coming, and you had taken a small nap two days ago. So why were you so tense? Just as you made it to a huge oak door, that looked like something Dracula would design, and that had a definite dog smell behind it, you realized what was bothering you. Wither they meant to or not, these... people had threatened all your domain and people you were in contact with. All your family, all your friends, and everything in between, including innocents. As if to intesify your sudden urges, the smell of human blood and death was now flowing into your senses.

"Why do I smell human blood, more so than usual?" You asked, still in a visually poor mood, which your tone reflected easily.

"He has, demanded fresh meals every day since he arrived. With respect Master, I don't think I have to tell you what a Werewolf eats... or how they eat." Dracula answered then opened the door. He then led you into the room to which even he was disgusted by its state. The furniture was strewn about and little was left of the softer things, like pillows and the bed. There was half eaten corpses of young women and men in heeps around the room, the blood staining what remained of the room that wasn't trashed. The older corpses were beginning to decay and stink. Lastly, you saw the brown werewolf laying leasurely in a broken chaire that faced the door you just entered through.

"Perfect timing, I was just going to send for another." The offending werewolf stated as he continued his reclining position, waiting to be served. His voice was gruff and lacked any polite concern. This... arrogance did not play well with your already foul mood.

"Leave." you said flatly to Dracula, to which he hurried out the still open door then bolted it closed behind him. You adjusted your gaze to the rest of the room before settling in a glare on the werewolf, your eyes were glowing, but it looked like the werewolf couldn't care less. Ignorancy was bliss for him... for the moment at least. You didn't trust yourself to initiate the conversation.

"Well, are you going to just stand there glaring, or are you going to feed me?" He asked then seemed to notice your glowing red eyes. "What's up with your eyes? Went all out on the Vampire thing? Maybe your family would be worth hunting after I am done here."

That was the last straw for you. You started to walk straight at him. But as he made a clawed grab for you, you grabbed him by the neck and threw him into the wall hard enough to make him bounce off it with an audible "THUD!!!"

"What the...? Do you know what I am?" He tried boasting and threating at the same time. But you didn't give him a chance to further annoy you. With another series of steps, you landed a fist in his gut, then grabbed him by the nose and thew him over your head and straight into the floor. With that you kicked him across to the opposite side of the room. This idiot was pathetic. You had to hold back to an insane amount or risk killing him. Although you already broke a few bones.

"You threatening me? Little furball." You hissed out. He shook his head as he looked up, then tried to attack but ran into your arm in a devistating clothesline of a punch.

It was obvious that this werewolf would require some extra stupidity medication. You didn't mind, as you pummelled him around and into the room. At one point you made him puke up his last bit of undigested food. Unfortunately for him, it had a skull in it. That only infuriated you more. By the time you were done, he was running away from you.

"Oh no you don't." you said, then grabbed his tail and yanked hard enough to flip him onto his back then you landed on his chest, making him suddenly cough up a decent amount of blood.

The offending werewolf had long given up on speaking, after his third broken bone and nose. A majority of his famed teeth were also shattered. He would never be able to rip into a human again. A side effect that you didn't regret in the least. But that reason also stopped him from doing anything but whimper up at the apparent human that stood on his chest. Yes, he was big enough for you to stand on his chest. He was near 20 feet tall, maybe a little shorter.

"You are going to take me to your leader. If I so much as see you glance at another human or make a move I don't like. I will ensure that the ONLY way you can feed is from a straw and you'll be pooping out in a bag. Understood?" You asked in a very serious but bluntly suggestive tone. Because of your hood, he couldn't see your face clearly, but then again, he only needed to see those glowing eyes to nod slowly. "Good, now get moving. We don't stop till I am in front of your leader." you informed as you lifted him and threw him through the door, breaking it off its hinges.

Dracula stood to the side of the door that now held the mangled werewolf as it got up and cringed away from him. He didn't know what he liked about it the most; that such a large beast was acting that way from him, or that he was mangled from your beating. He bowed respectfully as you passed and the werewolf quickly started to lead you. He would be an absolute idiot to distract or bother you at your current mood.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Wolves, Werewolves, or like creatures.

choices: They become allies, they didn't mean to challenge you.
They become enemies, some come to you to form a seperate friendly faction.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It took a considerable amount of time to get to your destination. You allowed him to change to human form, if for no other reason than to take a plain rather than walk all the way to Kansas. However, you more than a few times let him know you were still keeping him on a short lease, no pun intended. People looked at you a little wierd but never really knew what it was all about, as such never addressed it. Finally, you both arrived at a large cave of sorts. You could sense the sheer number of dog like things around, including some that confused you. If you weren't so pissed off, you would've been insanely curious about the new scents being observed. Your... guide... had to transform again to enter and that is where you started your entrance, officially.

"Stop. What is your buisness here Ralph?" asked another werewolf, this one was over 10 feet taller than him, at near 30 feet tall... and had a considerable amount of additional muscle. He actually made 'Ralph' seem like a newbord puppy in comparison. However, you were in no mood to entertain any kind of arrogance on their part. To this you hissed/growled a little bit. Being as they had better hearing, they both heard it. Only Ralph shivered at the noise. "And why are you so injured?"

"This is the envoy for the Vampire Clan. He is here to see the council and Royal Family to offically begin negotiations." He almost whimpered out. Now that he was surrounded by more powerful beings, he seemed to lose his former confidence.

"And your sorry state?" The other werewolf almost growled, obviously not a fan of repeating himself.

"I... They..." He started then felt you squeeze his spinal cord with your mind like you had done a few times during the trip to ensure he knew you were still a hair away from killing him. He stiffened a yelp before continuing. "I... fell. Got drunk on blood and did something stupid."

"Dumbass puppy." He scoffed then looked directly at you. "As for you, human, I hope I am the one to eat you. If I even smell a hint of a threat from you, I'll feed you to the hellhounds and tell them to rip you apart slowly."

You didn't bother doing anything but glare at him. He growled at this but there must've been an order to leave you alone, for now at least. Ralph on the other hand was sweating so much that his fur was damp. He wasn't sure which of you two he was scared of more. As he looked at you, he saw that it would only take a very small touch for you to start on a rampage. For that reason he chose to deliver you to your destination and leave as quickly as possible.

"Go." the werewolf guard growled as he stepped aside more for the opening to the cave.

It was a maze of sorts. Hard to believe, but there was a full scale city in this mountain and cave, but obviously not made for humans. You saw everything from poodles, dressed all fluffy and neat, to what you assumed were Cerberus hounds; three headded, monsterous size of dogs, easily over 60 feet tall. Some of the dogs/wolves, were in the middle of devouring meals, which included one another in rare cases. But there was so many that the rare case was common enough to be observed by you. You even saw large wolf like creature chew up a small werewolf. Either way, at the scent and sight of you, they turned to observe. Some took close swipes at you. If they only knew how short your temper was, then they wouldn't have been teasing liket that. Most followed as you were led to an enormous stone structure and eventually a huge stadium style room, with the stage and immediately surrounding aread made to resemble a royal court of sorts. The crowd following joined the already observing crowd. There must've been hundreds of thousands of Cainine breeds in the room, all making corresponding noises.

Gathered in a half circle facing the crowd, was an assortment of impressive looking creatures. At the center was a HUGE black wolf. It must've been a hundred feet tall, nevermind how long and wide. Your deep instincts told you to be careful and didn't even attempt to hide why. He was a Amarok, or in myth, a 'wolf god'. You figured that, like you, his kind's power and status was overplayed. But that didn't deter the warning that your blood and former Vampires were giving you. Next to him was another one, but looked more gentle, if that was possible. This one was female and a head smaller than the one you assumed was the King of this court, making her the queen. Next to them were an assorment of mythical beings of different sizes and types that you were hard pressed to believe exsited. The impressive display were in hot debate about something and the interuption of your arrival was not welcomed with anything less than full snarls from them all.

"Who dares command to see our king?" Asked, what looked like, a 20 foot tall fox with 9 tails near the end of the half circle of established Cainines. He could obviously read minds to know the situation already, as well as your command to Ralph... who suddenly ran off into the crowd, to get away from you and the eye of his leaders. Snarls and growls surround you until a very low and very powerful sounding growl silenced them all. It came from the large Amarok as it gazed down at you. You were in the middle of the half circle at this point as you glared at him directly.

"That is none of your concern." You responded back in an ominous voice. "I asked to see the leader, not his lackies."

This caused a round of barks and ferocious snarls. This was again quieted by a louder snarl from both the King and Queen, showing teeth this time.

"I'd start explaining if I were you, human." Said another of what seemed to be a royal council of sorts. This one came from a large werewolf, white and feminine sounding this time. Her voice had more compasion in it. But you, again, were not in the mood.

"If you still think I am human, than you all are dumber than I thought. It should be obvious at this point. I am not human, and I am not happy. I wear this ridiculous outfit to protect my identity and that of those I associate with. People you all have threatened." You said as you held up the letter they had sent to the Vampire Clan, then threw it so it was in between you and the King. "I care not what you do to this 'Vampire Clan'. I do however do no take threated to me and mine lightly. You have unknowingly threaten and waged war against me. I have come here to allow you to tell it to my face or withdrawl part of your declaration."

"RIP HIM APART!!!" said the extemely low and powerful voice of the King Amarok. He wasn't even doing more than a whisper and his voice carried that much power. You were right to be weary of it. However, you knew that, if it came down to it, you could more than hold your own against him... and all in the room. You just couldn't affored to let them have any form of advantage, like sneaking up on you or catching you by suprise.

To his command, two dogs around the 40 foot mark leapt from the ends of the stage, along with a mass of other things. You assumed by the black fur, that had actual flames attached to parts of the fur, that they were hellhounds. But threatening you with fire? The only element other than silver that you couldn't control that well was water. So, when they reach striking range, or in their case biting range, you lifted your foot and brought it down. There was an audible "THUME" then all was still. Using a combined bit of your power, you caught all of them and easily repelled magic that was coming at you. They were silent for a moment as the once attacking just floated in midair. Then, with a wave of your hand, you sent them back into the stands, crushing any the fell on. The quicker ones got out of the way, but there was still a few that were massively injured from the weight of the bigger breeds falling on them.

"If you want me dead, do it yourself. I will not hold back on the next attempt." You said as you released your full Vampire form.

Nothing in the room you currently were worried about harming. If there was captured humans, or friends than you would be forced to protect them. One good thing about being surround by ONLY enemies. You didn't have to dodge any innocents and people you cared about. You could just let loose. Perhaps if they made allies you would need to restrict yourself, but for now... they were nothing but white noise to you, as you floated up to eye level with their King. You could feel everything within a few hundred yards of you. Nothing was going to interfere with you or sneak up on you. The effects of you being in an unrestrained vampire form were in full swing. You had yet to use this much power. You had seen the 'Dragon King' do it but had yet to find a time to do so, till now. Everyone in the room were straining and whining with the incredible wieght you were putting on them. Some of the smaller dogs were passed out and drooling. Any more and they could die, and this was just you idle Vampire release. You had yet to exert yourself yet.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You arrive with no complications.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Vampire, he's a Vampire!" came one of the council members, dealing the intense pressure more easily. You could tell though that she was having a rough time with it, as evidence to all her tails lighting up to probably power a spell to protect herself. But you still had your glaring eyes resting solely on the King. He was now on all fours at this latest bit of information.

"Where is Master Isibelle?" He asked in a louder voice than he used before, his talking voice probably. The expression on both his and the Queen's face made you pause in your almost bloodlusted mindset. There was a definite aggression but not out of feral behaviour. You sense, loyalty in connection to the question.

"Dead. She gave me the gift. How do you know her?" You answered, a little less confrontational than before but still not trusting they were on the good side of knowing Miss. Isibelle. Your instincts were just telling you to still be careful.

A sudden change in their behaviour was evident. It was as different as light and dark. At hearing your words, they went from snarling and almost feral in their limited movement, to a submissive whine. This change was not one of the things you were especting as far as suprises. By the time you notced your hesitation it was evident to you that their lack of exposing such a weakness was saying something about them. But you still were going to be cautious, and you still were in a more than foul mood. Not more than a few minutes ago, this Amarok had ordered your death. It would be foolish for you lower your guard yet. However, this change did cause you to ease up slightly on your power, but not much. This aura of silence was maintained for a time before the King realized you were still waiting on his answer.

"S... She raised me." He said simply but also with a noticale whine in his tone. The news that she was dead must've been like a punch in the gut for him. You could understand the feeling. You only knew her for a relatively short amount of time and you were still sad with her death.

"Why should I believe you? You threaten the Vampire Clan, me, my family, and directly order my death. You expect me to believe you are loyal to her?" You ask but also demand and answer.

"Please..." Started the Queen. Unlike the male, her voice was almost angelic in compaison. Sure it still had the gruff of a wolf voice but not the insanely deep and power laden voice of the King. Her voice invoked a single emotion set; loving Mother. If you had to guess, it was a true assumption for a good number in the room. Either way, it was not a confrontational voice. It was more... motherly, pure, but still slightly seductive. As if years of experience dealing with the King and her children had shaped her... beautiful voice. "... let us speak peacefully. We need not be at each other's throats."

"I was not the ones that bit first, or tried to. I find no reason to trust you right now." you replied, still with the same tone, an ominous, powerful, and angry tone.

"You must know a child of ours. Perhaps a family dog or something? Please..." She pleaded, obviously tring to like thier behaviour with the loyalty of Duke, your family's dog. Your anger was interupted by the sight of Duke; Loyal, trusting, happy, content, obediant, and loveable. If these were even a fraction of what he is, then you could at least let them speak.

"You are correct. Be careful of tredding on the trust of our Family dog. I trust him with my life, I can at least let your words be heard." You warned then brought down your power and body until you were standing where you were before. You still had your fangs and other effects out. But the insane weight of your power was sealed, for the moment. They could recover properly. None dared growl at this point.

"Thankyou." She finished as she recovered and layed down so that her proper posture would be closer to your level. The others did the same. However, the King was already grief ridden and sprawled out in a laying posture. It took a few minutes to bring his head up to allow things to progress further.

"HOW?" he asked as soon as he was composed enough to do so. His voice was back to its calm state as it still rumbled the floor. However, the volume didn't impede the noticable emotion in it.

"It was her time. She chose me of all people, and I accepted." You replied simply.

"A.... and you are ok with this 'Vampire Clan'?" asked the side head of one of the council Cerberus hounds.

"What does that have to do with anything?" You asked.

"That is why you are here, is it not? We threatened to destroy them because we thought they were dishonoring the Vampire name. It is the reason we sent that document and in turn angered you." Said one of the Kitsunes (Fox looking with multiple tails).

"I suppose you have a point." You relented. To this, you scaled back your powers even more, until it was barely noticable. "To answer your question... yes, I am OK with them. I am not particularly thrilled but Miss. Isibelle put a lot of work into creating the image of what Vampires are. So them spreading that legacy is the one redeming quality and why I've allowed them to remain. Nobody actually believes they are REAL Vampires and have no idea what one actually is capable of. This group ensures that. However, I am not assoctiated with them. If you want to wipe them out, that is your decision and their problem to deal with. A human mistake in dealing with you is not my concern, even one the more or less worships my kind."

"Then, why are you so angry about it?" asked the other head of the Cerberus hound.

"I don't let my identity known for a few reasons. Besides the obvious, I make is so that people never know where or when they will encounter me or those I care about. If you have to worry about harming me or mine, then you shouldn't be doing whatever it is that you are doing. That was the first thing. You threatened my entire family with being ripped apart. Indirectly or not, it doesn't matter, I take the protection of me and mine VERY seriously. Second reason why I was angry; Miss. Isibelle has me learn things from situations she set up. One of those things was NOT to harm innocents. While predators will inevitably slip up in this, I do not delight when someone threatens innocents. You did this as well." You revealed, letting them think on it for a second before continuing. "To tell you the truth, I have no idea why I got so angry. I have never snapped like that before. If I had to guess, I would say I responded to the threat of pain and death to those I love and are connected to, something instinctual perhaps. I am still new at this. Also, seeing... Ralph was it?... eat so many humans and expect more out of arrogance might have pushed me over the edge a little as well. Espiecially since I used to be human and my family is still human. I could honestly see one of you eat one of my family out of ignorance and be happy about it. Not a very good emotion to add to my already worsening mood at the time."

"HE DID WHAT?!" Boomed the King.

"Oh, so you all don't make it a habbit out of eating humans?" You asked, trying to figure them out.

"HABBIT? NO, WE EAT MORE THAN OUR FAIR SHARE. BUT WE HARDLY IN THE HABBIT OF HUNTING THEM. MOSTLY, WE ARE DRIVEN TO SERVE MANKIND. TO DEMAND A MEAL OF ONE OUT OR ARROGANCE IS AGAINST ONE OF OUR HIGHEST LAWS." The king explained. He was still grief ridden but far from incapable of thinking clearly.

"This is one reason this coucil exists in the first place." Said the male Kitsune from earlier. "We must descide what is acceptable and what is not. The guise of not messing with a pack of wolves, human or not, is out there for good reason. But how and why we attack or hunt is in constant flux. Especially for those of us who crave human flesh, despite our need to serve them."

"I hope you don't mind me saying that your justice system is dizzying." You said commically and with the firest grin or smile that you had since this whole thing started. It seamed to put them at ease, that you were at least willing to trust them enough to do so. As they said, they had a drive to serve you and humans. Although, you had a feeling that their loyalty to the Vampire of the age was much stronger, bordering on absolute. Which you make the fact that you didn't trust them a very serious and burdening thought.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They become allies, they didn't mean to cha...

choices: You return and continue life, they send someone with you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Will you consider trusting us?" Asked the Queen.

"Possibly. I've voiced my concerns. If I can't trust my youngest family with you, than I can't say yes. I am currently in contact and trust the Wisconsin territory of Spiders and Scorpions. I also know a few Succubus. Each of them has gained my trust. While I don't expect you to change and play nice with my othre allies, I can't trust you if I can't leave you alone." You answered.

"How are we suppose to know who you are if you don't reveal yourself? We may be loyal to humans, but we are also high predators. If even a young boy were to get lost in the woods with a pack of nonsapient wolves, nature would do its thing. Those of us that are sapient restrain from taking of innocent life like a boy. You've probably heard of some wolves leading hunters or kids out of the woods. They say it is just 'man's best friend', but we do know what we are doing. The only way to ensure a confusion or mistake is not done is to have your scents known." Explained a Kitsune in a very believable and captivating voice.

"I suppose you have a point. Your kinds aren't the same as spiders and Scorpions. I don't have to worry about people of consquence finding out. That and my Vampire instincts are telling me you are all good to your word. Dangerous if not allied to you, but trustworthy. It seams Miss. Isibelle did actually love you very much." You said, the last part toward the king.

"HOW CAN YOU KNOW THAT?" The King asked.

"Because not just her power and abilities were passed along but also a genetic knowledge of all the Vampires, including memories, instincts, wisdom, and emotions. It is difficult to put into words or understand, but I can tell she had a great emotional attatchment to you. If she can love you that much, I suppose I can trust you. Even if the other Vampire's instincts are telling me that it is safer to kill you. I think I'll take her word over theirs." You answered back.

"Are you saying... that she lives on through you?" the Queen asked for the staggering King.

"In a manner of speaking. I can't talk to her and her spirit is gone, but I can access her memories and what made her who she was. In that way, yes, I suppose she does. She also had to inject her own blood into me to make the transformation complete. Her blood in my viens I suppose you could say." You answered. You didn't want to give a false impression but it didn't seam to matter to them. They had heard what they needed. You were a little suprised when the King shot forward and put his nose inches from your body, sniffing your scent deeply. Great tuffs of wind went threw the massive nose as he did so. It took him a while but eventually was apparently statisfied.

"HER SCENT IS IN YOU. THAT IS GOOD ENOUGH FOR ME." He stated then hesitated for a moment. He seemed conflicted on what to do. You didn't really know what he was waiting for or debating internally. You thought about reading his mind, but held off. He then went slightly to the side so one of his eyes could see you. "I AM SORRY MASTER. NO EXCUSES. I ORDERED YOUR DEATH, AS YOU'VE SAID, YOU BUT NEED TO ASK AND ANYTHING IS YOURS, EVEN MY LIFE."

This statement seamed like a common and agreed statement among the many in attendance. He moved so his deceptively soft fur brushed against you. It was probably the closest he could get to nuzzling you. The sensation wasn't at all bad. Despite being so close to a set of teeth, the smalles one being larger than you, you felt completely safe. You... liked that feeling. You basked in it for a minute before his fur seperated from your touch.

"Calling me 'Master' would already give me power over you all. So there is very few things I desire from you. I suppose, protection and friendship for me and mine. I don't need slaves. I'm sure you understand the unappeal of having ONLY slaves and no friends or family. But if I can trust my family will be safe with any of you and that I can confide in you if needed, as a friend, or possibly family, that would be the greatest gift I could recieve." You answered, thinking as you spoke. The King backed up into his spot again as if to get in a proper position.

"Is that all? You are sure you don't want anything else? We are willing to help you conqure the world if you asked. All you want is... Friendship?" Asked the Queen.

"Is that too much?" you asked, not sure how they ranked the request. You hoped it would be ok.

"Too much? It was what we wanted. We didn't think it was what you would ask for. We are not like the territorial spiders and other creatures. Sure we have individual packs and territories, but we are one family. The whole world of Cainines will accept this. We already will serve you, whenever you command. Our King and Queen has given you an extra boon to ask of us." A white Kitsune that set next to the King informed.

"I want for nothing else." You said back.

"VERY WELL. NOT THAT IT NEEDS TO BE DECLARED BUT I WILL ANYWAY. YOU AND YOUR FAMILY IS NOT TO BE HARMED, NOT EVEN A SCRATCH. WE WILL OBEY YOU AND YOU ALONE IN ANYTHING YOU COMMAND. WE WILL KEEP YOUR IDENTITY A SECRET AND ALWAYS BE READY IF YOU NEED ANYTHING. YOU ARE FRIEND AND MASTER TO US ALL. LET NO ONE FORGET IT." The King commanded then joined the entire population in a single howl, as if solidifying the command to each other. The whole earth seemed to shake as they all did this at once. You could feel magic and might combine into one as they did this then somehow bind them to this decree. When it was done they all seemed exhausted and started panting to the effect. "YOU NEED NOT CLARIFY WHOM IS YOUR FAMILY. MAGIC AND OUR HONOR HAS BOUND US. WE ARE NOW INCAPABLE OF HARMING YOU AND YOURS. WE COULDN'T EVEN IF WE WANTED TO, WHICH WE DON'T."

"That is good to hear. Wait, did you say every wolf or cainine like creature in the world is now bound to this?" You asked.

"Indeed he did." The Queen confirmed.

"Then, if it is ok, I would like to stick around for a day? I need to leave after that, but I would like to get to know you, the King and Amarok that Miss. Isisbelle loved so much. I wouldn't mind getting to know about as many of you as I can as well. I know next to nothing about many of the creatures in the room." you asked.

"You don't need to ask." A Cerberus hound said again.

"Apparently not. But, like I said, I don't want slaves. I would like to know if it is ok, not as your master but as a hopefully growing friend." You replied back.

"WE WILL BE HAPPY TO!" The King answered with a toothy smile. It would be a frightening sight for anyone else. Even some others in the room were nervous around the large jaws new and brief look. But you were excited to learn about them. Dog was truely man's best friend, and now yours as well.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Continue to talk.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Alright Brad, take it easy." You said as you walked with, what looked like, a young man to your front door.

Of course you were in constant contact with your family. They knew he was coming, and they had gathered in the family room downstairs, even Kelsey. Drade and Eve were elsewhere but got the short and ugly version of it. You on the other hand had spent a day and night learning all you could about your new friends and allies. In the end the sent a Kitsune council member with you. Currently you knew two things about the Kitsune, other than the whole multiple tail magic thing. First was he was old, knowledgeable, and wise. Second was that he liked to play tricks. He was wise enough not to take it too far, but there it was. Currently he was in his human form. He got a kick out of you marveling at this. It wasn't even two days ago when you were angry and... well, much more impressive than he is. But his loyalty to you curved his desire to trick you.

"Not my fault that girls find me irresistable." He almost bragged. He was very appealing with his silver hair that matched his almost glowing silverish white in his fox like form. His eyes were light ocean blue and very evident, with a miami beach surfer body. If he had attractants, he would probably be the Kitsune equivilant of a succubus, but male.

"Yeah, yeah. Eat it up furball." You sighed as you escorted him into the house then down to the basement.

"What is with all the... bugs?" Brad asked as he both sensed and saw scorpions and spiders in the open, some larger ones even on the table and couches.

"I told you, we are basically family with the Wisconsin spider queen and deep friends with the Scorpion one. They keep it interesting and relatively bug free. Even keeps flees off of Duke." You answered as you gestured to your family dog that was being cleaned by a scorpion and a few spiders. He noticed the both of you and stood immediately. Brad barked and Duked went back to what he was doing. "Will having him around be a problem?"

"No. Like King said, we are all connected. Sure we have territorial fights and things. But the Royal court and your Family are set above the rest. He will be like... a person attendant I guess. Not a slave but still... I suppose a pet would be a good continual discription." He answered.

"Good, Papa would be a little put off if we had to get rid of him. He's raised Duke since before I was born." You revealed as you got to the stairs.

"How is he still alive?" Brad asked. Golden retrievers usually didn't last 30 human years.

"I negated his aging, and the ill effects. As long as I'm around to monitor it, he can live indefinitely." You said. You heard a gasp at this but just smiled. "I am guessing we both have suprises to reveal to the other. I haven't even drank your blood yet."

"Caleb!" came the voice of Kelsey as you opened the door, followed by an instant hug from her. You carried her while you walked so Brad could get into the room, shutting the door behind him.

"Good to see you to Kelsey." You greeted then put her down so she could observe your new... friend. He was a little quiet do to your last statement but must've figured you'd explain later.

"It is good you are back." Papa started as he stood to address you two, to which Kelsey went back to the general spot she usually used when sitting in on these family meetings. She was in full Succubus form at the moment. Not that it mattered, no one even gave her a second glance to that part of her anymore. It was actually less normal for her not to do it around the house, like when Colin, Dani, and Tou came over. The 'bugs' had to hide for things like that as well. But they were all smart enough for you to trust with keeping hidden. "Duke has been acting a little strange. We were hoping you and our new arrival could explain."

"Strange?" You asked.

"Yesterday he just got up and howled like a wolf or something, then he suddenly got very obediant. I mean, I trained him, but he was always a little independant. After his little howl, he did everything we said without hesitation. Even got Luke a soda from the fridge." Papa explained.

"Yeah, it was awesome." Luke reported.

"Is that bad?" Brad asked. Some of the females in the room were still oggling him a bit, mainly Kelsey and Sarah.

"Hey, do you mind changing? I would kind of like them to get all this figured out without constantly reminding themselves you aren't human. That, and I doubt they've seen a Kitsune before, especially one as powerful as you." You requested. He bowed his head as if to say 'of course' then started glowing a bright blue and sliver until it faded and left a large nine tailed fox the size of a large dog in the room. His change didn't get him any less stares, but it did get their mind off hormone related things. "Thanks."

"No problem, prefer this actually. However, not a lot of times I can just relax like this. Usually only in council meetings." He answered back.

"Wow! the big fox can talk!" Isaac exclaimed with star struck eyes.

"Fox?" Brad asked.

"He doesn't mean anything by it. He is still in that young ignorant face that humans go through." You explained. Your family looked at you as if to ask you to explain. "Oh, most higher ranking Cainines, apparently, don't like to be called anything other than what or who they are. Pride, honor, loyalty, and all that. Calling him a fox is actually a very rude slang, like calling black people the 'N' word." you said, sensoring yourself a little but explaining for your new arrival. You had to guess that other humans had probably died for being so rude to him in the past.

"We'll need to work on that then." Mom said.

"Thank you, I appreciate it." Brad said, with a bow of his head, his tails moving with his moods. You pet him a few times to which he pushed his head into your hand until you started scratching a spot between his ears and behind them as well. "Oh, that feels good..."

"So you don't like Isaac's nickname but DO like being pet? How does that work?" Sarah asked. A question than ended his blissful moment in favor of the current situation and conversation.

"Still part of the Cainine species. Regardless my brain power or breed, I still like a human's attention." Brad replied.

"Ok, that is interesting. But I think we'll have plenty of time to give you attention and you us. How about the Duke issue. Can he think and talk like you?" Papa asked. Brad could see that Papa did have an emotional attachment to the domesticated dog, like you had told him.

"No, most aren't Sapient. It takes Royal blood of one of the council breed types to have an applicable and reasoning mind. The change in your family companion was an ancient ritual of spreading a single command accross all of the Cainine population, binding ALL of us at the same time. This time it was the command that our King gave on behalf of our new Master and his family. No Cainine of any kind, Werewolf, dog, or even hell hound can harm you, not even a scratch, and they must obey our new Master, Caleb." Brad answered.

"If he only needs to obey Caleb, then why did he obey my orders? I am obviously not Caleb or even human like his blood family is." Kelsey asked.

"We don't see things that way. Sure we can tell what and who you are by just the scent, but the order was not to harm his family. You may not be blood related, but anyone he thinks of as family is added or subtracted. As for obedience, we wish to please our new Master, and we know that is something he would want. If a command you give goes against one he gives, we would pick his command." Brad revealed.

"Damn bro. Spiders, Scorpions, Succubus, now ALL of the dogs? No offense." Sarah started, the last part to Brad. "It is starting to become overkill."

"I suppose so. You should see all the types of Cainines there are. I actually met a Armarok, their King and their Queen. You thought Eve and Drade was impressive? You should meet them sometime. Brad is also insane, little bit of a shameless flirt though." You aggreed then teased as you tried to lighten up the room a little.

"Ok, if you would Master and Family, do you mind answering a question for me?" Brad asked to which you nodded as did they. "You said you would drink my blood. Is that a punishment for something I've done?"

"What? No. It was an example of something you don't know about me. I would never drink from someone innocent or even partially guilty without them being ok with it. Believe it or not, it isn't a bad experience. But don't worry, it took Kelsey about a year for her to let me do it to her." You answered, forgetting that you had left that comment out there for his imagination to work. "Sorry if I worried you."

"It seams like you are right, I have a lot to learn about you, and you about me." He replied almost sheepishly.

"Mr. Fox?" asked Isaac. Brad gave you a look and you just shrugged an appology.

"He'll understand eventually." you sighed.

"Yes, what is it young one?" Brad asked.

"Can I ride you?" he asked bluntly.

"I'm not sure if that is safe." Brad stated.

"Don't worry about it." You said as you could see both of them wanted to do it and your other family members were ok with it. "I trust you. Besides, he isn't going to let this go until he satiates his curiosity."

"Very well, thank you Master." Brad replied and thus began your family relationship with the yet another predator group. By this rate, you all were going to need a bigger house.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Spirit week in high school. It was a time to dress and act 'hyped up' for sports and school spirit. It started out with each grade getting to design a hallway to fit the theme. Next was dressing up. Each day was something different. One day was oldies day, dressing in a previous decade of clothing, like the 50s. Another day was dressing in the school's colors, ironically enough being red, white, and blue. Last day of the week though was dressing up as a mythical character. This day was more or less to attempt a connection with the ever constant Vampire Clan. It was obvious what they would dress up as, but some were pretty good. You even saw a dragon of sorts, made of foam and colored clothes. You and Kelsey cheated a little. Being actual mythical beings, if was easy for you two. You also helped Sarah into a Kitsune outfit. She may have been hiding it well, to her eye, but you all knew she was attracted to Brad. Not suprising, he had 300 years to perfect his look the way he wanted.

"Nice contacts." Dani stated as he saw you and Kelsey. You had your eyes glowing just enough to get those comments. Your teeth were also out and you were dressed in a movie typical vampire getup... minus the cape at Kelsey's request. Instead you went the armored route. No weapons in school obviously, but still, very intimidating and recognizable as Vampire armor. You even had an old picture of an old history drawing for anyone that inquired.

"Thanks, you are a...?" You asked, looking sideways at his costume.

"He's a ghost rider." Colin blared out comically. "The only way he could wear full biker gear."

"Got it. Looks good on you." Kelsey answered as she flexed her wings.

"And what are you, sex godess?" Tou asked and joked. She blushed at this a little but not so much as to stop her from whacking him playfully for the comment. She had to pick a more conservative style of clothing. Most things her kind wore to flaunt didn't leave a lot for the imagination. She was in a staggard white and black dress that was just barely school appropriate with her wings and tail having straps attached to look like she made them and strapped them on. The straps were designed into the outfit so she didn't look like a tacked together attempt but quite believable.

"Actually, I am a Succubus." She corrected.

"Right, an evil sex godess, much better." Colin teased to which she whacked him as well before they all started laughing. Colin hadn't said it in a tone that put an emphasis on the word 'evil'. He more highlighted it as an upper asset to the guess. Besides, that was exactly what the myth said about a Succubus.

"Ok, what are you then?" She asked comically, looking sideways at his outfit. Tou was obviously a leprican, with the green getup and all that, like he had pulled them from the Lucky Charms guy. Colin on the other hand had green facepaint on and wierdly placed teeth with rugged clothes. "A strange version of the Hulk?"

"Ha, ha. No, I'm an Orc, like from the Lord of the Rings." He said. He twirled around so you all could see him.

"Dude, you totally missed the mark. Maybe you could pass as a troll's foot victim." Tou teasingly contimplated, this time it was the group's turn to laugh at him. It wasn't long before you all got to your classes. You recieved a few angry looks from Vampire Clan members but most were interested in Kelsey. She did look like they had said. Being an actual Succubus didn't deter the allure that he look presented, or her ability to keep the outfit on, unlike most of the rest, as their costumes lost some degree of paint or whatever thoughout the day.

"They're all staring at me." Kelsey noted again, as you both sat through a more roudy study hall than usual. After all, there wasn't any homework on spirit week. So a Study hall this week was kind of underused for its intended purpose. She was doing well with not moving her wings or tail in a life like manner, but she still had almost every guy, teachers included, staring at her at one point or another.

"What are you expecting? You know how good you look in that form. Even without attractants, you could ensnare every guy in here." You answered and complimented.

"Except you obviously." She sighed. She didn't even noticed that she said it till it was out already. She then blushed and looked away.

"That is hardly fair. We're already friends." You answered, she sighed in relief as you, once again, missed what she was trying to say, or let slip. She knew you couldn't have kids and would not deter her from falling in love with another person that could help her with her child obligation to her kind. Not that she dredded it. Even at this age her instincts were driving her to that goal. She just knew what you were going threw as far as limited to no children future. Regardless who you fell in love with, or wanted a family with. They would all die before you, even your immediate family. You eventually would be alone, and she didn't want to remind you of that. "Don't those heels hurt though?"

"These?" she asked as you both looked down at her shoes. She was wearing extremely revealing and high heels that maximized sexual appeal and exposure. Oddly enough, they were the most conservative pair of Succubus heels her family owned. But if your family's females complained about slight heels, you had to guess that these were murder in comparison. You nodded to her question as you looked at her expertly balancing on them. "Not a bit. You forget, my kind are made to be uncomfortably seductive. My body can bend and curve in ways you've never seen. Part of being an versitile 'sex godess'." She explained, using Colin and Tou's description yet again.

"You really liked that didn't you?" You asked.

"They may be humans, but you're right. I enjoy their ignorant compliments more than I thought I would. Didn't like being called evil any more than you do, but I know they didn't mean it." She answered.

"What about dressing up like this in public? I didn't think I'd like it as much as I have so far. But it seems strangely... soothing." you asked.

"I agree. Sure we could get them to let us do this and pretty much worship us if we wanted. But being able to relax like this in the open without too much fear, is quite freeing." She responded, both of you breathing in the relatively free air.

"Caleb." Someone called to which you both looked at an approaching 'vampire'. You had to admit, you thought it would take them shorter to demand something of you for wearing a vampire getup without being one of them.

"Yes?" you asked in a curious tone, as if you didn't know why he was addressing you. He was a few grades higher than you or Kelsey so you didn't know his name.

"Take them out." He demanded.

"Huh?" you asked to his very broad command.

"Your fake teeth. Take them out, or we'll knock them out." He threatened.

"Oh come on." Kelsey whined in a seductive tone that usually got human men to fold to her requests. "Just for today. We were having so much fun."

"I... I guess..s... so. Uh...?" He stumbled as she batted her eyes at him, literally. Especially being she was in full Succubus form, she could effect men's moods with a meer gesture. She wasn't that powerful originally, but she was getting better at it and your family was also becoming more immune to like effects. But these teens... didn't have a chance. The poor kid couldn't get much more out. Especially when she 'innocently' directed his attention to the slight valley of her breasts that her dress left at certain angles. He turned quickly, covered his newly bleeding nose, and scurried off still stuttering.

"You enjoyed that too." You observed.

"Not my fault they are all lightweights. Not going to have them ruin our relaxation day." She answered back as she leaned into you as if ready to take a nap but really just getting comfortable while you both continued to observe the class and talk about Brad. She had yet to make him even blink twice at her, no matter how much attractant she flooded his way. You had said that he was ovvr 300 hundred years old as a good excuse. But that just made her want it more. If she could ensnare him, even for a second, it would boost her pride as a future first class succubus. As she said it, seducing humans was relatively boring.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Mr. Vale, it it is good to see you." You greeted as Sarah brought him down to the family room for you.

"You as well, Master." Greeted Mr. Vale then looked around at the faces in the room, his eyes falling on Brad.

"Who's this?" Brad asked, still hadn't met a majority of the people you were in contact with. Most of the time, he was in his Kitsune form, like he was at the present moment. If someone outside the family came over he merely changed the amount of tails so he looked like a large fox pet. In cases of freaks and/or predators he just relaxed. Not many 'freaks' would pick a fight with a nine tailed Kitsune. Besides, he loved getting pet, and Sarah was his main source of attention in that area.

"This is Mr. Vale. He was a servant of Miss. Isibelle. She helped construct realms diquised as movies for me to visit to recieve training, Vampire training to be more precise. He brings me to the realm and picks me up afterwards, when I've learned what she intended," you explained.

"Thus the word 'Master'." Brad induced.

"Does this mean he has to leave now?" asked Kelsey.

"I'm afraid so Ma'am. This realm will take a considerable amount of time. You do remember what realm we are going to...?" He asked.

"I do. I am entering the 'Blade' trilogy. How long will I be gone on this end?" You asked as Papa and Mom entered the room, as well as the rest of you standing.

"It will take 3 months. The time in the other realm covers over a decade of time. You will learn and experience much in that time. For that reason, I suggest we leave as soon as possible, to avoid an absence from your education," Mr. Vale answered respectfully.

"That is the whole summer vacation!" Kelsey exclaimed.

"Mr. Vale, how many more realms is Caleb required to go to?" Mom asked.

"This is the last required one Ma'am. The rest can be done any time... or multiple times if the Master wished. The last thing I must teach the Master is how to generate the portals to theses worlds. For visiting or future training. Either way, this is the last one that I was ordered to have him experience." He answered.

"Well that is good," Papa sighed then turned to you. "Not kicking you out or anything, but you better get this over with," He said to you and pulled you in for a hug that your Mother joined.

"I know this one is a little more violent, but don't overdo it, ok?" Mom asked as she gave you a kiss goodbye.

"I'll do my best." You answered with a smile, flashining your eyes comically that made her laugh a little at the relatively childish behavior.

"Can I go with you Master?" Brad asked.

"Sorry, these tests are for me to do. No point in them if I have someone else doing my training. Just keep my family safe while I'm gone." You answered and gave him a pat on the head to which he nuzzled your hand and gave it a final lick as you passed of to Kelsey to which she hugged you, with her wings as well.

"You come back soon, got it?" She asked. She always got emotional when you went away on these things.

"Don't worry, I can't die remember?" You asked back.

"That's not what I'm talking about. This time it will be years. Longer than we've known each other, for you at least," she started then seperated and gave you a picture of the family, the whole extended family including Eve and Drade, and her single picture on the back side. "You could easily lose your mind in there. Just remember who you're coming back to, alright?"

"How on earth could I forget you?" You both asked and answered. You finished with a hug from your sister and knuckle pounds from both your brothers. Then you turned to the portal Mr. Vale just opened and nodded to him. "See you all Later..."

With that you and Mr. Vale were off to the Vampire world of the 'Blade' triliogy. It was night time and Mr. Vale only stayed long enough to close the portal on this side. You were in a currently unknown city with no idea how to find people that you wanted to meet. Mainly, Blade...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You decided that tracking the Vampire hunter would be both inadvisable and pointless on your part. It was far easier to track Vampires. So you put your time into finding the 'Blood Bath' that the first movie started him out in. It took a while and a few dead Vampires to get there but you finally figured out where it was and, thankfully, that Blade hadn't been there yet. So you decided to enter quietly, so not even the popular Deacon Frost could sense you. Then you simply waited, in the corner, at every event. Any that asked you simply... persuaded to turn their attention elsewhere. It wasn't completely bad. Even if they were all arrogant idiots that were little better than ordinary humans, the blood they gave away kept you fed and fully powered. You even helped a few of their human 'guests' get away. But all the relaxation ended when you recognized the human that the Vampire chick would bring in. You sat up as he walked in, knowing that your waiting had finally paid off. Blade would be arriving soon.

"Hey, get your hands off me!" yelled the human that they had brought in as you grabbed him from the floor and forced him down in the corner bench where you usually sat.

"Are you an idiot?" You asked as you shoved him back into the corner as he tried to get up.

"What are you talking about?" He asked back, figuring out he couldn't force his way past you. Some of the other Vampires were speratically glancing your way but your aura kept them from gazing too long.

"You really think they call this place 'Blood Bath' because they thought it was a cool name? What do you think they do to people in this place? Think about it, a butcher shot with hanging humans and blood everywhere... You really are just going to dance with them until the drain your blood too?" You asked, using your powers to open his eyes where you wanted.

"Oh my... Damn, I got to get out of here. Please, don't kill me." He started begging.

"Right, I saved you so I could kill you. That makes perfect sense." You said sarcastically as you grabbed him and led him to a vent in the wall. He started to be less resistant as he figured out you were at least pretending to help him, and that was better than what he was getting before. "Take this vent. It leads to the street."

"Thanks man, I owe you for this big time," he said before going in.

"Yeah, yeah. Just don't follow easy girls into butcher shops again and we'll call it even." You said as you pushed him into the vent and sealed it behind him.

By this time the sprinklers were about to open up with blood. You could smell the blood in the pipes. It was just beginning to drip and the music was beginning to beat to a very familiar beat that you had heard at least a dozen times at this point, in previous events. With the climax starting the Blood started flowing and you siphoned some of it to keep you at max power. But you didn't need to get all messy to do it. You just brought it over to the dry corner you had returned to, to watch the long awaited Blade show. You had picked your spot well. Out of his way and that of the sprinklers, but not out of sight. You leaned against the wall now as you watched them dance and him enter. Soon it all stopped and the fragile silence took over. The calm before the storm, as Blade waided into the see of hostile Vampires. You were glad he was here. They were beginning to digust you enough for you to almost ruin this moment.

"Come on day walker!" yelled one to end the calm and start the storm. They began panicking and started to either run or fight. You just stood against the wall, only moving when another wall was clear so you could observe them peacefully. You knew how to fight, but this guy... it was just amazing. The movie didn't give him justice. Without your other powers, he would definitely kick your ass. His movements were so fast and precise that you almost lost what he did a few times. He never even got hit by a stay bullet, and they had not been skimpy on the ammo when fighting him. Then he took out his sword and OH!!! the ownage he dealt. But something was different because you saved that human. Instead of the end being with the other human, it ended with a Vampire threatening him with a gun pointed at your head.

"Don't move or I'll put a bullet in his head." Said the Chick that originally was going to terrorize the human you let go. You didn't even move as you watched him.

You didn't need to move till something touched you. However, you did have the body of a freshman in high school. So the little innocent pull was there, not to mention you had your scent more tuned to smell like a human's than their kind of Vampire. Honestly you didn't want to be like them. They had so many weaknesses. A simple snap of the neck would kill them, turning them to ash. Sure silver was still a pain to you, but they're reaction to it was pathetic. So you just stood where you were with your arms crossed, paying the threatening Vampire no mind as you watched his interaction with her. The other Vampire that he set on fire was still screaming and they could both hear police officers starting to enter in response to the massive amounts of gunfire.

"Drinking from kids now?" Blade said, ripping on her obviously.

"Shut up! Shut the F### up!" She shot back then went to grab you. You didn't make a move till her hand touched your arm. With deadly speed and precision you whacked her arm away, grabbed the hand with her gun in it. Then you pulled her to the side and let go so the same arm was free to grab and snap her neck, turning her to ash. This caught Blade's attention more than the previous situation.

"Mr. Blade, thought you'd never show up." You opened before he could say anything. He was going to say something but both of you heard the doors slam open and police rushing in. "Ask me later, I'll be around."

With that you vanished from his view. You used a teleportation to get out and started to follow the black coated man. He seamed to feel you watching as he looked your direction more than once. But you never let yourself be known, as you knew he still had work to do. However, you weren't going to just lose him now that you finally found him. So you tracked him, keeping your distance till there was a stopping point.

That stopping point being...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You waited for a while. Mainly because you didn't know what would happen if you killed Quinn before he was suppose to die. Unlike most of the other realms you went to, this one you had watched before and knew more than just a little about. So you waited till he was in their little hideout and Dr. Jenson was resting from her treatment. You were going to just appear before Blade, but thought that would be too confrontational. Then you were going to try Whistler but that also would've been a bad idea. So you decided to do the polite way and just knock on their front door. Truthfully you didn't know which one they considered the front, but you just used the human sized one with the 'DO NOT ENTER' sign on it. You knew it might take a few knocks so you did so in loud but polite intervels until you got the desired result. You hear a few locks being undone, a gun cocking, then the door opened to the infamous Whistler standing there, his left arm behind the door frame... with a double barrel shotgun in hand. You also chose this entrance because it was bathed in sunlight at the present moment. That took a visible edge off of him.

"Hello, what do you want?" He asked in not so polite of a manner. He obviously didn't care and, in fact, shunned visitors. Understandable, judging by what and who he had inside.

"Uh, yes. I am Caleb Konel. I was wondering if I could have a moment of your time Mr. Whistler?" You asked. His serious face began to harden back up at your mention of his name.

"How do you know my name?" He asked back. By this time you could sense Blade moving around and observing.

"Sir, I don't want to lie. I would have to it I answered that question out here, where the occasional easedropper could listen in. I mean you no harm. If I know you have a shotgun behind the door. You can kill me if you find me a liability. No one knows I'm here... except you of course." You responded nervously. You stood there fidgetting with your fingers as he thought about it. You heard a noise from inside but didn't react to it. Whistler looked inside then back at you. If you had to guess, you would say that it was Blade, telling him to let you in. He obviously remembered you from last night. You surviving in sunlight probably peeked his curiosity. He might've wrote you off as a rouge Vampire kid. Technically you were exactly that, but not his definition of one.

"Come in." He said as he pulled the door open, revealing the leveled shot gun pointed at you. You got in and he sealed the door back up. Then escorted you to sort of seating area but not really. Truthfully it was probably a weapon training area for blade, wide and bare. But then again, it was a pretty big place. You continued till he told you to stop then turned to see him and Blade, with his sword, facing you down. "Now answer my question butter cup."

"He's the one from last night that I told you about." Blade informed to which Whistler trained his gun more properly on your head. You didn't take offense to it.

"Yes sir, that was me. I appologize if I tredded where I wasn't suppose to. I was looking for you, Mr. Blade." You answered then looked at Whistler. "As for how I know your name... You are the infamous Whistler. The old man Vampire whooping machine with turbo boosters. I... I'm a little star struck actually to meet you both."
