"Infamous? Who else knows we are here?" Whistler asked, worried about their secrecy and safety. Blade seemed to get a kick out of your description of Whistler.

"Oh, no one. I just... uh, I come from a realm where this one is a movie. I was sent here for training. I... that didn't come out right. I didn't mean to imply you aren't real. But in my realm... this one is just a movie. That is how I knew who you were. I just didn't know where to find you at first. I only arrived about a month ago. That club was the first seen in the movie, so I just waited, helping humans they captured when I got the chance." You explained rapidly, changing speeds and rythm as they reacted to different parts of your story.

"You expect us to believe that?" Blade asked as if playing on a joke.

"I suppose not without proof." You sighed. You looked down for a moment, as if thinking, than looked up at them.

"How about we start with how a kid can slay a Vampire like you did last night." Blade proposed, or more commanded. You were glad he picked another question to direct your thoughts. But the answer also was giving you pause.

"No way around it I guess... I'm a Vampire as well. Just... a different one. In my realm, I am the only one. I was given the gift less than 5 years ago." You answered, this got Whistler to train his tired arms and gun to your head again.

"Gift huh. Curse more like it." Blade stated.

"No, not where I come from anyway. It wasn't what you are thinking. I agreed and she... she died to pass it on. She was kind and gentle, didn't even know she was a Vampire till she told me. She didn't drink for 20 years." You tried to explain.

"How can that be true? You think we are would just believe that? Vampires are... not like that." Whistler stated, probably the kindest way he could've explained it under his current state of mind.

"Yeah, what about you, Mr. Blade? Aren't you a Vampire to. Sure daywalker aside, you still crave blood right? What about how I came here. It is in the middle of the day and the door I came in was bathed in sunlight. That has to tell you that I am not normal in that regard. What can I do to convince you?" You asked. Blade seemed taken back by your knowledge of him. They both looked at each other than at you.

"I, we did see that. You're a Vampire?" Whistler asked. You slowly, very slowly, let your eyes turn to glowing red and protruded your fangs then put them away. "Do you drink blood?"

"Yes, kind of. I... my type can't turn people, even if I wanted to. I do drink from humans, but only if they are truthfully willing. Most of the time I just drink from animals. No point in killing them, so I usually have to drink from a few." You answered, visibly nervous. "I know you two don't like that kind of thing. But I don't have a choice in the matter. While my type of Vampirism has it perks it also has its downsides. I can't feed off of synthetic blood or any kind of syrum like you do. I need blood that has been in something living. People, animals, even other Vampires. Obviously dead sources like Vampires taste like crap but it is better than starving."

"I assume these 'perks' include immunities to sunlight, garlic, and sliver?" Blade asked, trying to gauge your strengths and weaknesses.

"More or less. Free on the sunlight and garlic, silver is still a pain in the butt though. As for strengths... that is a VERY long list. I would tease you with a few, but I have a feeling it might just earn me a bullet in the head... at least till you can tolerate me around. I came here fully realizing that you wouldn't just let be leave. So I guess I can stay, chained up, if you wish. Until you can determine if I can be trusted or not." You offered. You didn't really care if they wanted to do it. If a few weeks of confinement meant that they would trust you for the next few years, than it was a price you'd be willing to pay.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: After they get back to the hide out.

choices: Dr. Jenson finds and frees you.
They leave you until later, much later.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"That is quite an offer. I suppose, if you are telling the truth, you are in no hurry," Whistler finally said as he lowered his gun.

"If a few weeks restrained helps you trust me, than I'll stay chained up till you decide to let me go, no hard feelings," you agreed.

"Then let's get this overwith." Blade stated. You didn't know if having you around was making him anxious or if he was just cautious at the moment. He didn't look like he was threatened. Then again, he had more battle experience than you did. He kept his sword arm relaxed but poised to go into action at the slightest wrong move. You could tell that he was actually itching for a good fight. Didn't know if it was instictual or just him and you weren't going to potentially ruin your new relationship by reading his mind. For such a useful ability, you didn't use it much.

"Cross your arms." Whistler commanded. He probably was wondering how willing you were to do this for them. You didn't argue and did as he requested. He then started wrapping heavy chains around you. He would finish and hook an end to a metal beam then start on another. By the time he was done, there was perhaps too much chain on you. You had to guess that he stopped trying to get a reaction out of you when it became idiotic to continue with more. "Do you need to eat... or rather drink while you are all tied up?"

"Nope. Though, if you could have a bag of blood ready when you release me it would be appreciated. From the hospital or from an animal, doesn't really matter to me. You can just leave me here or talke to me to see what I can do and my limitations. I won't lie to either of you. But there is one thing." You answered then added.

"What is that?" Blade asked, expecting you to add a condition.

"These chains won't hold me. You have to use silver, even a small amount of it. Silver restricts my power. A collar or hand cuffs is usually enough to hold me. You could also sprinkle silver dust on the chains, depends what you got on hand." You revealed. They thought about it then Whistler went to get something and came back with a clamp of sorts. You could feel the silver from where you were. He came over and clamped it on your neck. He was nice enough to make sure it didn't draw any blood but it was far from comfortable. Well, to be fair, silver was always a pain and you suggested it.

"That enough?" Whistler asked.

"Yeah, that should do it." as you strained a little. The chains rattled with the attempt until you slumped, letting them hold you. The amount of stress you put on them was noted. "Obviously not the most comfortable position, but it works just fine."

"That was either really dumb of you or really trusting." Whistler said as Blade took his leave. He grabbed a chair by a desk so he could talk and work as he desired. Right now he probably figured that an interogation was in order. You had agreed to it after all. But it was evident that you had lost a certain strength since the silver was administered. So much so, that he looked to believe at least that part of you.

"That was the idea. I know it may be a pain now, but it is well worth it if you two trust me later. It also helps that you haven't shot me in the head yet." You said and joked the last part.

"Would that even work?" Whistler asked.

"Not really. Silver would knock me out for a few days, at least until my body pushed the bullet out. A regular bullet though... minor annoyance," you answered. It was now evident to you that the clamp wasn't processed that well. Some of the silver was making you a little more lucid than you'd like. "Ah, this silver is going straight to my head. You could probably ask me anything right now."

"Well, that makes this easier," Whistler returned. "Your family still around? You said you were turned around 5 years ago, that means you still have human family right?"

"Yeah, their back home. But not all of them are human. My blood relatives are obviously human but we got some others around the house." You said plainly, as if just shooting the wind with Kelsey. It was a good thing you liked him and you didn't have anything to hide in a manner of speaking.

"Others? You mean more Vampires?" Whistler asked.

"No. I'm the only one in my realm. That is why I visit other realms. With no other Vampires to learn from, I have to learn what I can, where I can. Most of the time the Vampires I meet are too week, but they do teach me certain things that I could only learn from another Vampire. That is why I want to be around Blade so much. I figure he is a good guy to learn from, especially compared to those arrogant idiots... like that Deacon Frost guy. What a self rightgeous panzy." You answered. Whistler seemed to like what he heard. He wasn't sure if he believed it yet but it was nice to hear, especially if it was true. You could also tell that Blade was listening. You didn't know for how long but he was, for the moment at least.

"So if not Vampires, then what lives with you?" He asked.

"Uh, well Eve is a really big and really poisonous spider. I think she's near a van size at this point. Drade is a Scorpion about that size, maybe a little bigger. Both of those live with their kind though. Kelsey comes over all the time, she's a Succubus. Then there's Brad. He's the new guy. He's a Kitsune. Also know a Amarok that the last Vampire raised, a few Cerberus hound, a few Werewolves, and a bunch of Hell hounds. That last one is a little harder to strike a conversation with though. That and they tend to burn through the couch. Papa doesn't like them in the house." You answered.

"You old human family is ok with all them?" Whistler asked, looking like he swallowed a bug at you calm and sudden revelation.

"Not right away. Took them a while to accept me. But the rest of them were easier to accept after that. Kelsey is my age, so that helps. The dog ones though I just met. Papa doesn't really like the Hell hounds and the others are usually too big to come around that often. But they all like Brad, the Kitsune that lives at our house," you answered.

And so began yet another Q&A session. You didn't know how long you would be restrained but it wasn't the worst thing in the world.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They chain you up, but not with silver.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Days blurred together as you waited for them. They offered to let you go and just keep an eye on you, but you were instant that they not do so until they trusted you. You even stopped Dr. Jenson from freeing you when she thought you were being held against your will. But with the questions, silver, lack of food/blood, and demonstrations you clonked out after a while. You didn't mind though. Hopefully the next time you woke would be a different story. So you were delighted when you started to wake, hoping for a favorable outcome.

"Hey, rise and shine sleepyhead." Said an annoying voice, especially since it belonged to someone you really didn't want to suffer through the trouble of meeting. You were free and you came to with a strong hunger for blood but didn't say anything as your sight came back and you looked around. You were on a bed while Dr. Jenson, the woman you knew as Blade's Mother, Deacon Frost, and Quinn. There was also a knocked out human on the bed next to you that you glanced at but then diverted your attention to them. "Go ahead, drink up."

"How do you know?" You asked.

"What, you being one of us? Your lovely friend here was nice enough to fill us in." Deacon stated as he refered to Dr, Jenson.

"I didn't know you wanted it kept secret. They..." She started.

"Yeah, yeah. They captured you to lure Blade and killed Whistler. I don't blame you." You answered then glared at Deacon Frost. "As for you, I don't feed unless the source is truthfully willing. I chose to be confined to gain Blade's trust and you killed the other person I was trying to impress. Not a very good start."

"What a load of f***ing crap." Frost stated. You had forgot how much he seemed to love that word in the movie. You didn't let him finish as you rushed forward and punched him so hard in the gut that he went flying into the wall.

"No, I'll tell you what is crap. I just spent most of my power and time doing something just to have you ruin it. I am tired, hungry, haven't had a pee in a week, and have to listen to your foul language to add to the already building headache." You almost hissed out to which Dr. Jenson backed up from your form as you had just pelted the person next to her into the wall. You looked at her with the same expression you did before when they asked you questions. "You don't need to fear me. I wont harm you."

"I try to be nice, and this is what I get." Frost stated as he got up, holding his gut with his hand. "Take him."

This sprung everyone else into action and you moved back so Dr. Jenson would be relatively safe. You knew she'd be ok, relatively speaking. But you were too week to do much, and the last thing you needed was for them to know you were a daywalker too, agian, relatively speaking. So you put up somewhat of a fight and smacked Quinn once pretty good. But you tired quickly and was falling over before they actually hit you. With that advantage on their side and your secrecy they easily knocked you out again. The next time you woke you were in a container with Blade and Dr, Jenson on your way, you assumed, to the blood god thing.

"Need serum..." Blade mumbled as Dr. Jenson explained her not so cure, for him, cure.

"Join the club." You mumbled out.

"You're awake?" Dr. Jenson asked.

"Obviously." You answered bluntly. You really didn't have the energy to be polite right now.

"Can't you bust us out of here?" She asked.

"Out of energy. Need blood for that." You revealed. You had told them about how your powers worked. It looked as if she was going to offer her's, but the space you were in stopped and you all were promptly taken to suffer a speach from Frost then split up. You went with Dr. Jenson, but they had to carry you and throw you down there with her. It wasn't long before she came over to you and helped you sit up against the wall.

"Here, you can take some of my blood and get us all out of here." She offered as she put your mouth near her neck.

"No, Blade needs it more. I can make do with your friend over there." You stated as her friend she thought dead, the asshole, was walking around. She got up, not believing her eyes as she addressed him.

"Curtis?" she asked.

"Karen? Karen!" He called as he noticed her over his incoherant rambling then came towards her. She tripped but, because she helped you, didn't fall next to a useful bone club. "Tell me Karen, did you ever have second thoughts about us?"

She starred up at him from her position with obvious fear until she saw you stumble behind him. You used the last bit of strength to grab him and sink your now protruding fangs into his neck. You held him toward you so she could crawl out from underneath him. He yelled and hit at your head but subsided as both your bite and his blood loss started effecting him. Unlike living things and good things, you didn't have to hold back. So you kept drinking the foul tasting liquid from him into you. Dead blood, especially from someone like him that was actually worse than normal vampires, was horrid tasting. But you couldn't be picky and so you finished and didn't leave a single drop in his veins, him turning to ash at your conclusion. You fell but caught yourself as your body began do process and digest the meal you just got. You panted for a minute from your former exertion then was done with the whole thing, including cleaning the blood off you, to which you looked over at Dr. Jenson.

"You ready to help kick their asses?" You asked as you held out a hand to her.

"You... are you going to...?" she asked as she stepped closer. Figuring there was no use running down here.

"I already explained this. I will not drink from an unwilling source... unless they are evil like this guy was. If makes you feel any better, his blood tasted aweful. I hate dead blood, so disgusting. Like eating rotting meat for humans." You said, sticking your tongue out to further illustrate your displeasure. You then sniffed the air as you smelled Blade's blood hit the air. "Come on, the ritual has started. We need to get up there before Blade dies."

"Ok. I'm trusting you on this." She said as she took your hand. You didn't waste any time as you teleported to Blade's general area. Sure you didn't tell him that you had placed a glyph on him when he touched you before. But you didn't need to tell them at this point.

"See, that wasn't so bad." You stated as she retracted her hand and looked around. She just nodded in agreement to which you pointed your thumb to the thing Blade was in. "That's where Blade is."

You twisted your hand to open it with your power. The door flew from the hinges and the straps ripped apart. Blade began to fall and was caught by Dr. Jenson.

"I'll leave you two alone for now. I'll just take care of any guards that would interupt." You said than walked off. You didn't know what needed to be done but you didn't want to mess with it that much. You took out perimeter guards then watched as the vampires and Frost did his thing. You actually found it amuzing as they were like barking dogs, trying to inimidate each other. So now you waited for Blade to get done with fighting his Mother and drinking from Dr. Jenson.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They leave you until later, much later.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You watched as things unfolded as you killed the guards that were within sight of you on the upper levels. It was some time before Blade leapt from the top and went down to ground level.

"FROST!" Blade blared as he landed.

"Kill him." Frost commanded and as they were about to you appeared at his side. He glanced at you but you could tell he wasn't in a particularly welcoming mood.

"Don't get in my way." Blade instructed.

"How about I get all the weaklings and you get Frost?" You offered.

"Fine." He answered bluntly then stepped back but was still ready in case one of them decided to attack him.

"Don't go too far, this wont take long." You advised.

"F*** you!" exclaimed Quinn as he juggled a knife then charged you.

You almost forgot that he had Blade's shades on. So you rose your hand and snapped you fingers, making all those in the area, except Frost, turn to ash. The momentum made a sort of ash cyclone and tossed the shades to you, with you caught, very carefully. You looked over to where Blade had just retrieved his sword and got his attention. No words were necessary as you nodded his way then threw him his shades. You almost laughed when you were reminded how he loved his shades.

"What the F*** are you?" Frost asked as he came into the circle you were in and Blade was walking up as well. You once again was annoyed by his affinity with that word. Really, what was the point in using it every other word. For a Vampire who's been alive a considerably long time, you'd think his vocabulary would be more... diverse.

"I'm... Complicated." You teased then lept up to the wall in which you sat on a broken part to watch them. Blade seemed to get the memo that you were keeping your word and wouldn't help him, not that he needed or wanted it at this point. This was the Vampire that was too big a part of his misery to let someone else have the satisfaction. That and there was the whole Vampire, predator, territorial, revenge thing to take into account. Either way, they both started their sword fight. A few times one of them would look up at you, seeing if you were still there. Sometimes you waved comically at them. But finally it was coming to an end with 'EDTA'.

"Some Motherf***er is always tryin to ice skate up hill." Blade said as he threw up his last dart and kicked it so it shot right into Frost's head. Why Frost didn't use his new speed to dodge was beyond your understanding. But either way, in no time you all were topside and you in particular was enjoying the sun.

"What about you, what will you do." Dr. Jenson asked after asking Blade about the cure and agreeing to make a better serum for him. They both didn't even touch the whole trusting you thing. But you didn't need an appology. You were just happy that they trusted you now, which is what you originally were hoping for.

"I think I'll hang with Blade, if you don't mind?" You asked.

"You still want to?" Blade asked, which might've be what little guilt he had to show, or general curiosity.

"Like I said, I am here to learn from Vampires. If it's all the same to you, I would prefer to learn from you rather than somone like Frost. Do you think you can handle having me around? I do have to drink actual blood you know. Granted it doesn't have to come from humans but it can, at times." You responded and asked.

"We'll figure something out. Meanwhile, I got a feelin' that you could help take out more suckheads than I could by myself." He answered to which you all looked at the sunrise.

"So... I don't mean to be selfish, but can you... you know?" Dr. Jenson asked you as she pointed to her neck. Sure she had a cure, but it would be easier if you just healed her.

"Sure." You answered as you touched her with your finger. She gasped as you retracted the virus and wounds instantly healed. Even her scars were gone from her neck.

"Thanks."

"Anytime." You answered back.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You both go Vampire Whooping.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Nice." Blade Complimented as you sliced another vampire up the middle with a blood sword or yours. He had loosened up a little ever since you two were hunting together, although the only thing both of you hunted like that were Vampires.

He gave you strict rules to follow, since his serum didn't work on you. You showed him that your feeding COULD be harmless. But he insisted that you not feed on humans unless an emergency came. You didn't mind. He let you have human blood from hospitals and blood vats that they kept in some of the Vampire hideouts you all went to. He knew you could kill all the Vampires in the area with minimal effort, but he was teaching you more things so he had you run like him. Although you could never pull off his look. So you used your Vampire Clan outfit, although now it sported silver stakes and a gun. You had grown conditioned to having silver around. Sure it restricted you, but it wasn't an instant take down like before. Kind of like working out your muscles, except it was a weakness tolerance instead. Either way, it also kept your power within slightly trackable perameters. But you two got even closer when you were able to help find Whistler. It had been hard to say the least, even for you. You weren't use to tracking other Vampires but you learned.

That wasn't the only thing you learned. Since you were moving from place to place so much. You had a working knowledge of a few languages. Not enough to hold a believable conversation, but enough to listen in on one. The biggest one you learned was, what your genetic knowledge said, the traditional Vampire Language. Since the others knew, it was easier to pick up than most. Blade also helped you with driving, instinct, and a wide style of matial arts. He referred to it as 'kick butt' style of martial arts, since it spanned from multiple sources for one goal, killing vampires. A bit later you two found Scud. They thought they were so clever in getting him into your group. Blade easily figured it out, even without your help. He did have you read his mind, just to be sure.

"Too easy." You commented as you both started moving again. He merely smirked as he knew most things were for you.

"Then put that thing away." He advised to which you let the blood go back into your body. As you both chased the Vampires there were a few doors that you promptly backhanded off their hinges, not even missing a stride. At times Blade would tell you to hold off so he could have some fun. At other times he instructed you so you could improve in different areas. Eventually you both were on the street with the two on bikes. He took out one with an insane jump and you grabbed the other you were both looking for with a clothesline, making his still moving bike crash into the wall. You desposited him on the ground and waited for Blade.

"You want to talk to him or for me to read his mind?" You asked.

"We don't have time to have him jack us off in the wrong direction. Get it out of him." Blade almost commanded, and you couldn't blame him. You two were really close to finding Whistler. So you entered his mind not to gently as you searched for where he was. It was buried especially well but you were able to rip it out of him with minimal difficulty.

"Done," you noted then took your foot off his chest that you had been holding down with previously.

"You can decide what to do with him. You still need to eat right?" Blade offered.

"Yeah, but do I really have to have this for my meal? I told you how disgusting Vampire blood is right? Granted some is better than others and definitely better than completely dead blood but still, I prefer animal blood over this crap." You asked back.

"Well we won't have time to go hunting later. So you better take it where you can get it," He answered.

"Fine..." You groaned as you grabbed the Vampire on the ground and ripped off his helmet. You shook in preperation, like holding your nose when eating something undesirable, then dug into the neck of him before he could stop you. You drank him dry and let the ashes fall, wiping away the access blood from your face. "... YUCK!!!"

"Let's go." He grunted to which you both went to his car and you directed him toward the place. You didn't need the Vampire like the movie did. You just kicked down the door and so began you and Blade's cleansing of the place. There was only a few of them, so it didn't take more than a few minutes. The real shock came when you both stood in front of Whistler. "Old man, what have they done to you?"

"Don't worry, what you're thinking will work," you revealed to which he looked up from his position holding the freed Whistler.

"I thought you said you wouldn't read my mind," Blade said.

"I didn't. This is just the start of the second movie in the series. I know it is a little anticlimactic to tell you before you do the whole memory brooding thing but whatever. Let's just get him back and treated before something changes." You answered him. He nodded and picked him up. Blade insisted on carrying him. He wouldn't admit it, but you could see that he thought of Whistler like a father. You didn't mess with that, or wouldn't.

Putting him in the trunk was a little degrading in your opinion, but the rising sun was more than enough reason to do so. Especially given what his current state was. It was a long quiet trip home. It usually was, but this time it seamed like the end of a journey. It was a whole 2 years that you both had been looking and fighting for this moment and you both just needed time to come to grips with that, Blade more than you.

"Ladies and gentlemen, the dark knight and the demon returns." Scud said as his weird form of greeting. At first you didn't really like the nickname. But since it was Vampires that was saying it and it brought out fear to them when they spoke about you by that name, you let it go. Besides, Scud knew better than to call you that seriously to your face. "You found him... and you didn't kill him?"

"Just open the doors," You said as you helped Blade get him out of the car. Blade was now the tired one, so you carried him in while Blade got the cure ready. You sat him in the special cell you all had at the place you went to. It was made to hold Vampires and the blinds could be opend to let sunlight in at that expense. Scud was sent from the room when he said a few off color comments about him. "I'll leave you alone with him."

"You can stay," Blade said as you went for the door.

"Thanks for the offer, but this is your thing. I may like him and deeply respect him, but I'm not the person he's been holding on to see. I can wait," you said back then left before he could argue. It had took a while for Blade to fully trust you. He knew as well as you did, that bringing Whistler around wouldn't be any easier, probably harder in fact.

"Dude, sorry about the crack about the old man," Scud appologized as you shut the door enough to give Blade some privacy. He knew that Whistler would come back because of your revelation into future events, so he stayed with him.

"I'm not the one you need to appologize to. You did cross a line you know?" You answered.

"I know, still, sorry man." He finished to which you nodded. "Hey, can you... you know?"

"Sure," you answered. You walked over to Blades car, lifted it up, and put it on a rack for Sud to work on. He always marveled when you did stuff like that and this time was no different.

"Damn, that never gets old." He complimented to which you just smirked and patted him on the shoulder, then went off to take a rest... which meant for you a long session of sitting on the roof, watching the sun rise or fall. There was just something soothing about doing that to take the edge off a night hunt, for you at least.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Next movie.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You didn't mind that you weren't at the top of Whistler's to do list. He and Blade had a lot of catching up to do. It also gave Blade a chance to talk to him about you. You could use the extra help in that regard. So after you watched the sun rise you came inside and observed from a dark corner of the cieling. It was slightly comical to see Scud interact with Whistler. Old badass VS. New know it all. But just when it started to get good the alarms started going off. Now that you thought about it, they were right on schedual. It was good to see that you being there wasn't changing that much. Then you saw them drop down and something hit you that you didn't think you'd feel, not yet at least. When the Vampire got the gun away from Whistler, as soon as he pointed it his way you became territorial again. You forgot that they weren't there to harm anyone, yet. You just didn't want Whistler to die. So, in a flash, you appeared by them and and punched the gun and the Vampire hard enough that the gun shattered and he went flying into the space Blade was now occupying. The other one tried to attack you with her swords but you caught her arms and threw her over by her partner, away from the two humans in the room. Your haze went away at this and you came more back to yourself, then looked to a sprawled out Whistler.

"Need some help sir?" you asked as you held out a hand for him to grab. He hesitated, which felt strangely bad for someone you hardly knew, then grabbed it and pulled himself to his feet.

"Blade said you were still around." He said as he got another gun from the wrack and pointed it over that way. This time they were already fighting with Blade, so he couldn't shoot them. You were glad for that, so you didn't have to enter his mind as someone that kept him from shooting at a Vampire.

"Yes sir. He's been helping me learn quite a bit. We... had some relative fun while hunting to find you," you said back. "I told you he'd kick your ass."

"Yeah, yeah." Scud said back to you. Whistler got that you were talking about and Scud's little... misunderstanding, then smiled.

"Aren't you going to help him?" Whistler asked as you all got to a better position to watch the fight.

"You know Blade, he likes his exercise. He's be pissed for a week if I did that," you answered to which Whistler silently agreed with a shrug. "Besides, they are not here to kill us. Looks like Blade knows that, as he seems to be having fun with them."

"How do you know why they are here?" Whistler asked suspiciously.

'Because it is part of the second movie,' you spoke to his mind to which he braced for and was about to ask something but you spoke first... in a manner of speaking. 'I haven't told Scud about the movie thing or most of my abilities. I wouldn't invade your mind any further than to talk to you... without them listening in.'

"Nevermind, it doesn't matter," Whistler said after nodding to you that he understood. Luckily Scud was too intent on watching the fight that he missed the whole silent exchange. Eventually the fight was over and you all were coming over.

"Where were you?" Blade almost teased.

"Just chatting with Mr. Whistler. Didn't want to spoil your fun." You answered to which he just smirked then you turned to the other two, looking them over.

"Would you stop with the 'Mr.' talk. It makes me feel old." Whistler asked to which you bowed an affirmative to his request.

"Blade, and the Demon..." started Nyssa, one of the assassins/messengers. "... you two have been our worst enemy. Now there is something worse on the streets, something worse then the two of you."

"Let me guess, the reapers?" You asked rhetorically. You didn't have your gear on at the moment, so they were seeing you as the kid you were for the first time. Obviously it wasn't top on the list to have you talking to them like that.

"How did you know?" Asad asked.

"I know many things, like why you are here and what your end goal is. But, for the moment, you are telling the truth... other than the worse than me part. But I am not about to explain that one to you. That would just be stupid." You answered back, using the first bit to tie their tongues to any more questions. Nyssa might've been ignorant, but Asad wasn't. Blade reluctantly agreed to go then the four in your new and expanding group gathered to prepare. Blade was gearing up but, with you there, left out the explosives. No need to blow himself up if you could do the same amount of damage without him being blown to millions of pieces.

"Can we trust them?" Scud asked. You marveled at his acting. If you didn't already know about him, he would have you completely fooled.

"For now. Right now they need us. But later... we better keep our heads on straight." You answered, more to Blade and Whistler than to him.

"You ready to go if they do anything stupid?" Blade asked, knowing more about your abilities than anyone in the room.

"Fueled up and ready to go. One thought and they'll be ash before they can blink." You answered.

"You can do that?" Whistler asked, which you nodded an answer. "How?"

"Telekenisis." You answered simply, moving your gun from the table to your hand effortlessly, then putting it in its holster. "You'd be suprised of how fast you can kill a Vampire if all you have to do is think, 'pop their head off'. Saves on ammunition too."

"I suppose it would." Whistler commented as he got himself ready. It would be an interesting day, or night as it were. You liked that Whistler wasn't really star struck by every move you made, like Scud was. Eventually you all sat in the chopper and was drawn to the conversation that Nyssa and Scud were having.

"What's so funny?" Scud asked Nyssa.

"I've heard of Blade, the Demon, and the boogyman. Frankly, I'm disappointed." She answered as she looked over at you then out of the chopper.

"Hmm?" Scud asked, as if to ask her to explain herself.

"You all agreed to come so easily." She answered.

"You hear that B? She's disappointed." Scud asked as Blade smirked at it. "Come on Big D, show her. Come on, pretty please?"

You smiled then looked out the window so she could see your eyes glow. Then a bright flash erupted outside the chopper that looked like a mini nuke went off. 'You got to love the eye ignite ability', you thought to yourself. Then you ended the attack before it cause any more alarms to go off, in the chopper or in the city below. Her eyes were glued to the rapidly disappearing fireball, then moved to you as she tried to remain in a calm posture.

"Still disappointed?" Scud asked to which she looked away and gave a small smirk of her own, as if her effort and imagination was proven right. It was a wierd thing for you. You'd expect to see a little fear or concern for people she was taking you to meet. But this new behavior made you curious. Curious enough to take an interest in her from now on. You knew her emotions were saved for Blade, and his for her's, but she was intriguing to say the least.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Intruders!!!

choices: Blood pack test for you to.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
After a relatively short helecopter ride you found youself walking into their headquarters, or what you thought was their headquarters. Their leader was here, so you assumed that it was so, or at least a residence of sorts. Either way, you weren't suprised or disappointed as you saw the system they had up close. Sure you had watched the series, but actually being there gave you a new sense of what it was like. You actually got some ideas for the vampire clan back home. But you kept that train of thought hidden. For now you all reached a very large and thick door. Even you would have a hard time breeching it, not that hard of a time, but more than enough to register as high grade.

"The true power of the vampire nation rests here." Nyssa said as the door accepted their given invitation and access, allowing your group into the inner part of this seemingly gigantic place. They led you all to a room where you saw the old relic of a Vampire.

"Blade, this is Overlord Eli Damaskinos." Asad introduced. You didn't really know why he discluded you, but you understood why he didn't with the other two. They were human and as such lower then they were, in their minds. So you still being in your 14 year old self probably warranted some lack of recognition. You didn't mind, for the moment. As for the Overlord, he was strong, not very nimble but you could feel his pressence. Wither it was a glimer of what he used to be in his prime or just his age was unclear to you. But you could tell that he was very old, very knowledgeable, and more powerful than any other in the room, minus Blade and you ofcourse. But he was definitely weakening, perhaps from age, or unuse, hard to say for sure.

"Father..." Nyssa started but was shushed by him raising his hand/finger. You latched onto this. She was HIS daughter. Great, royalty. You had almost forgotten that part. Truethfully, you didn't sense the connection. She looked nothing like him. For starters, she wasn't blue. But remembering the movie, you knew it was true. He spoke some of the ancient vampire language before addressing the room more initmately.

"It has been said; Take pride in your enemy and share in his successes. In this way, we thank you." The Overlord stated.

"Thanking me, for what?" He asked as another person came into the room. You could tell he was a human by his scent.

"Taking care of Deacon Frost, you did us a favor," the man said as he moved forward to shake Blade's hand. "Karel Kounen."

"You're human." Blade stated in a way he wished for him to explain.

"You needed to his mark to figure that out?" You teased, which caused both of them to look over at you. "Sorry, backing off..."

"Hardly..." Kounen started as he took back his hand and addressed Blade again. "I'm a lawyer, Europian Health Consortian."

For a little bit they explained the situation, to which you remained silent. Not a lot of people in the room were to into taking the advise or speach of a relatively pint sized vampire like you. Those that did, were too on edge to want to hear it. So you just leaned up against a wall as they spoke, for a little bit.

"So let me get this straight..." Blade started in a more confused and pride baised disbelief. "You want me to hunt them, for you?"

"When they are done with us, who do you think they'll turn on next?... Your precious humans. Not one of them will be left." The Overlord stated almost sarcastically. Sure, he can make jokes, but you can't.

" For the last 2 years we've have trained a small tactical team called the Blood Pack. We want you to lead them," Nyssa revieled.

"2 years???" Asked Blade as he caught on that the training start was longer than the Reaper's assumed existance.

"We've been training them, to hunt you... and the Demon." She answered, looking at you as you observed them.

"What do you think about all this?" Blade asked, finally bringing you into the conversation.

"I am... curious to say the least. I knew they would be training to fight you. But I didn't know they would be working on me as well. If they can't even handle this minor annoyance, then I am curious as to see how they would train others to face us, a greater threat. Easy to see why they asked though. If both sides die, or mostley die, all the better for them. They get two enemies weaking at the same time. But... it should be some fun," you answered, bouncing around the different points.

"You think you are more deadly than this reaper threat?" The Overlord almost boomed.

"Sure. I already know a decent amount about them. I saw one on the street when you flew us here. Ugly little things and a pain in the ass, but handlable. No sense trying to convince you of this. My guess, you don't have much use for a young and pint sized Vampire like myself." You answered calmly.

"Indeed." The Overlord stated then left, agitated.

'Are they really that easy?' Blade thought to you.

'For me, yes, for you... not so much. They are immune to silver and garlic. They are more like vampire versions of a zombie than anything else. Even slicing them in half won't work all the way.' You thought back to him. He knew better than to react to your inside information in front of everyone. He just nodded for you to follow them as they left. They probably wanted to get you and Blade out of their midst as quickly as possible. The 4 of you laughed at this.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Leaders and the Blood pack.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The ride back was uneventful. You shared a little bit of what you knew about what was happening. But not so much as to effect the story line. Blade went to go rest before meeting the Blood pack, he also needed to take his serum. You on the other hand needed blood and thought it best to keep fully charged when surrounded by enemies like you would be for the next little bit. Blade agreed, but forbid you from drinking human blood. So, you had to make do with animal blood... way better than undead or vampire blood.

"What are you doing?" asked Whistler as he came into the room as you finished drinking from a large dog and a tiger that got loose from the local zoo. You had compelled them to come to you and to leave safely. You would probably need them to return in the near future, so you kept their minds obediant to you.

"Just got done with lunch," you answered as you wiped your mouth of any residual blood and sent the calm animals out again.

"You are just going to let them go and turn later?" he asked as he saw them leave out the window, staring at the tiger a little longer than the dog.

"You forget, I can't turn anything, even if I wanted to, which I don't. Blade said I was not to drink human blood at all, but vampire and animal blood was fine," you explained and he nodded. It was clear he didn't completely trust you but he was getting better. "What's up?"

"The blood suckers are ready to meet us," he said not too favorably.

You nodded and walked with him to meet them. The room went quiet as you two entered and didn't really get up in conversation until Blad came in and did his little bomb in the back of the head thing with one of them. Honestly you didn't care to remember any of their names, except Nyssa and 'Snow man'. Some of the others were ok, but they were still way to arrogant for your taste.

"What about him?" asked one of them as they pointed to you.

"He is fine, he is coming with." Blade answered as they were about to leave to 'The House of Pain', to hunt the Reapers.

"He's just a kid!" said another, making the group grunt and whisper in agreement.

"A kid I trust, leave it be," Blade more commanded. After his leverage of the bomb in one of their heads, they thought it unwise to challenge him. You smiled at this briefly. He had never said it out loud before. Not surprising, Blade wasn't one for long conversations. Never the less, hearing that he trusted you was not heard on deaf ears for you. It felt really good. So you all set out for this safe house that they were leading you all to. You rode with Whistler, as the others didn't really like you. Heck, if they didn't like Blade, they hated you. Maybe that was why Whistler started to like you more, despite the blood drinking aspect of your life.

"What do you think?" Whistler asked as they all got ready and he explained the weapons he brought along for them.

"They are close, careful. Keep those UV lights handy... and there is the blood smell." You said after sniffing, noticably on edge with the last part.

"That bothers you?" Whistler asked.

"Of course it does. Innocent human blood is never a good smell. That I can smell it from here makes their lack of respect for life even more evident. Arrogant idiots. Wish I could just go in and slay them all. It would be simple that way, but Blade said no," you answered, the last part in an almost pouting persona.

"But you said human blood was the best. You can tell the difference between innocent and guilt?" he asked back.

"Sure, in a way. I can sense the emotions around this place. Only death and fear from humans around here, and arrogant joy from the vampires for inflicting death on humans. A bit of hightened sensual tension from the feeding act as well. I can hear a few screams from victims and not one human laughter. This is a den of dumbass blood suckers... oh, excuse my language." You responded.

"Excused. Sometimes I forget you are just a kid, Vampire aside." Whistler replied then you both joined in with the others. Whistler was told to stay back but Blade wanted you to come along.

"He won't pass for one of us." Said one of them.

"He is coming, get over it." Blade commanded then looked to you beside him. "You better mist up and stay hidden. I want you to be out of sight till the action starts... and stay with them, tell me anything off."

"Very well, you're the boss," you said after a sigh then burst into mist. This caught the others' attention.

"Did, you just...?" Nyssa asked as she approached Blade.

"Just what???" asked Blade.

"Kill him, he just turned to ash. I thought he was on your side." She more stated then asked.

"He is not dead, right Caleb?" Blade answered and asked.

"First they don't want me, then they get mad that you told me to hide. Uh, what a pain in the butt." you said from around them. Nyssa looked around to find the source, as did the others. Blade was just smiling at their reaction. It occured to you that he was just having some fun with them. "Very funny Blade, real original."

"Let's go," he commanded to the group as you all headed for the entrance. He was smirking at their unease to where and what you were. You hadn't told them what exactly you were. Heck, only Blade and Whistler knew and they were having a blast keeping it hidden from the freaking out Vampires. You had to admit it was comical to watch.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Blood pack test for you to.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"You are about to enter our world. You will see things... feeding... just remember why you are here." Nyssa said before you all were led into the club. "Both of you."

"We haven't forgotten." Blade answered for the both of you.

The rest of them were still on edge from what they saw you do before. They knew you were there, just couldn't sense you at all. They were beginning to see why you were called a demon by them. 14 years old or not, you were still dangerous. You could sense some of them shake as they thought about it. Unlike Blade and Whistler, you weren't restricted from reading their minds. You could clearly see that they were more nervous of you than they were of the reapers.

"This place stinks," you observed. Your ominous voice only made them more nervous, except Blade, who was getting a kick out of their discomfort. To be fair, he used to be just as uncomfortable when you used this ability. He got used to it, but knew what they must be feeling.

"J-just don't do anything rash, demon." Nyssa more asked then commanded.

"Fine, whatever." You answered with a little shake of the surroundings as you hiss/growled a little.

They walked to the large security door and opened it.

"You got to be kidding me..." Blade said as he saw the sea of Vampires inside. For the first time since Blade had met them, Nyssa was the one to smirk in response to Blade, instead of the other way around.

You all spread out, except you. You were already dispersed around the room in your mist. None could sense you, but you could sense almost everything in the area. You observed as Blade and the others made their way around the club. The music was a little better than the typical vampire clubs you had been to. Then again, all of those were cut short from you and Blade's hunting activities. You heard Blade talk with Scud over the radio as he placed remote cameras around the place, and played with a few of the blood pack. little bits of teasing. The others seemed to be concentrated too much on their search and relatively relaxed atmosphere to remember you were near and watching, like they were worried about before. But all this calmness had to come to an end eventually.

"Caleb, you stay in here. I am going to look in back and s... stuff." He commanded, censoring himself in front of you. You smirked at this. You were a kid after all, so using foul language was still an issue... or at least one that he held.

'You want me to babysit the one's in here?... great...' You sighed to him in his head.

"Caleb..." he almost scolded.

'Fine, go have fun. I'll wait in here.' You relented. You knew he liked his fun and challenges. Not that you had to worry about his safety. He is Blade after all. 'By the way, they are here. Watch yourself.'

"You going to tell them?" he asked as he was heading off.

'Heck no. Just because I have to watch them and play with them, doesn't mean I have to hold their hand.' You answered to which he smiled and went about his buisness.

You knew that certain things would happen this time. But you wondered if saving one of them would be a good idea. The one known as 'Light Hammer' would be bitten but not die. 'Priest' would actually die this time. You liked Light Hammer better, strong silent type and all that. But Priest was a little more understanding and honor bound. Sure he was a blood sucking and arrogant Vampire, but he had his code that you liked more than the others in the Blood pack. Another factor was that Light Hammer would be outside the place Blade told you to stay.

Who to save?
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Babysitting Vampires.

choices: Changes nothing, except his death time.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You decided to go with Priest. In fairness, Light Hammer would be around until the battle where most of them die anyway. So you could do what you could with this idiot. Maybe he would play a bigger role later on, or not. But that was for later. For now you watched as they went about what they were doing. When the reapers finally showed themselves you made an ominous shudder that freaked the vampires so much that they started running for the doors, well almost all of them.

"What was that for, Demon?" asked one of them.

"They are here." You announced, and not a moment too soon. They began to see them attacking almost as soon as you said it.

Just like in the movie, they were having trouble but not overly so... except Priest. He was getting his butt kicked. You observed a few things and helped a few escape then turned your attention on your change in plot experiment. You watched to see if slightly warning them did enough to turn the tide for him, it didn't. The only thing that was different was that he got a few shots in. You waited until the reaper was about to bite him. You then turned solid and back handed the reaper off him and through the closest wall. You looked down at the broken Priest. Even if you saved him from being turned and bitten, the reaper did a number on him. You kneeled down next to him, to which he started scooting back.

"Calm yourself." you commanded. He was, at this point, to frightened of you to disobey. You put a hand on him and began healing his injuries. It didn't take much, but you got him healthy enough to fight and heal the rest on his own. He jumped up after you were done and examined his wounds. "Now I have more to do than babysit you all day. I trust you can look after yourself from here?"

"I will manage." He answered, still shaking but noticably in a different attitude toward you. You had made a blood sucking fan, just great.

"This won't be happening again," you warned then grabbed the incoming reaper and threw him through another wall and into one that Snow Man was cutting up. The fleeing and half skewered reaper continued up the wall while the one you threw recovered and he readied his sword to deal with him. "Hold up, this one is mine."

Snow Man nodded and sheathed his sword, though still warry of his surroundings. You jumped into fighting position with the reaper. Sure you could destroy him with Kaname's ability or hundreds of other ways, but you wanted to get a work out and have some fun. Maybe Blade was rubbing off on you. Either way you taunted the reaper a little until he attacked. You dodged and jabbed at him. It was like a dance with a really ugly partner. You were also showing the others what he was made of. Blade entered halfway through and watched as well. Since he didn't have to kill Priest he could just watch. At one point you cut half his head off, as you knew they needed to see how it worked even without being attached to anything. But finally you used a massive uppercut to make a hole in the ceiling and cause sunlight to rain in and engulf him, bursting him into flaming ashes.

"Well that took longer than usual." Blade mocked.

"Was just having some fun," you said with a shrug.

"Missed some," Blade pointed to the piece of the head you sliced off. Its eye was still roaming around. Your eyes turned red as you made it burst into flames. They already knew about the eye ignite ability, so it was no point to hide that one. "Nevermind."

"You could've done that the entire time?" one of the Vampires asked and you just nodded comically. "Then you put us in danger!"

"Shut it!" boomed Priest. "He saved my life. I won't let you badmouth him like that."

'When did the fan club start?' Blade asked to your mind.

'I don't know. I guess it is better than him treating me like a human meat sack. Little annoying though.' you answered to which he smirked at you.

'We could always tell them about you being a Vampire...' Blade teased.

'Come on, you said that they didn't deserve to know. Only you and Whistler knows, and you know why... oh, and Miss. Karen,' you responded. You knew it was teasing, but you also knew this was one of Blade's ways of telling a joke. So you played along.

The others started verbally fighting a bit until Whistler and Scud came by and he showed everyone the captured reaper he found. You didn't need to know about it. You already knew everything about them. You just went to relax for a little bit, hopefully in peace for a while. In the back of your mind, you wondered if saving Priest would change anything. He already seemed as loyal as a dog to you. You would find out soon enough.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Priest.

choices: Whistler drops you in a tank of human blood.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Demon." called Priest as he came looking for you, again.

"What is it?" You asked as you got up from your post. It was clear you would get no rest for a while. Strangely enough, you were beginning to get use to being called 'demon'. It used to bother you to no end. But now it was understandable.

"Blade and the others are gathering for the mission," he informed.

"Very well, I will be down momentarily," you answered. He left to join the others in getting ready. You made your way to where they were and sat near Whistler.

"Demon." called Priest again.

"Yes...?" you sighed.

"Are you not going to get ready for the mission? You aren't even packing a gun," he asked.

"Why would I pack a gun when they are immune to silver and garlic? Unless you invented a UV bullet in the last few hours," you answered to which he stopped, thought about it, then went off to revaluate his armament choices.

"Looks like your new friend is very attached," Whistler observed.

"Yeah, annoying little pest. Even tried to give me a bag of human blood from a hospital. The thought was nice but I don't know where he learned about that. I thought only you and Blade knew around here." You answered.

"Must be a spy somewhere around here. Either that or he could've sensed something when you healed him. Either way, if he knows, odds are the rest of them knows. Probably didn't tell you they did so they can find a way to kill you," Whistler replied.

"I suppose so. Damn, now they are going to want my power to... and tempt me with human blood when they get the chance," you said back, half thinking as you spoke.

"Hey, keep the human blood option to yourself while we humans are around you," he commanded. He was actually very strict about this. You thought he was joking until you saw his face. He obviously didn't like even the idea of a Vampire drinking human blood. The fact that you were a Vampire and he was a human meant that it made it even more personal for him. But even so, usually people got aggitated or mystified about it, not scared or angry. That meant he didn't really trust you yet.

"Sorry, won't talk about it again," you appologized.

"Better not," he said bluntly then walked over to the table of weapons. You sat where you were a feeling a bit guilty for talking that way around him.

"What's the matter with you?" Blade asked as he walked up to you.

"I don't think he likes me that much," you said as you glanced at Whistler from where the two of you were.

"What makes you say that?" he asked back. Luckily no one was close enough to hear your conversation.

"Because he hates Vampires and I am one. That and I have to drink actual blood. I don't think he likes that part in particular," you answered then looked down. "Not like I try to be a monster."

"He is just a hard nut to crack. He'll come around, just like I have," Blade responded as he put a hand on your shoulder.

"Not going to hold my breath," you said back. It looked like he was going to say something back, but the group was all ready to go.

"Ready, Demon, let's go." Priest said as they went to the mission.

That ride you stayed away from Whistler. He didn't seam to care and only Blade saw this. He began to talk to the old man, but you had no desire to listen in. You had enough to worry about to add an old man's hatred of you to thee mix. Finally you got there and looked down the opening to the Reaper's next.

"I'll go first." You volunteered then jumped in without any care. You didn't have to worry about dropping that far. You just wanted to get this part overwith. You took a look at the area. "All clear."

They all got down there and all were being quiet for once. Blade could see the tension between you, Whistler, Priest, and the others. He silently seperated the teams up. The teams were what they were in the movie, except you and Priest were one as well. To be fair, other than Blade, Priest was the only one that was willing to go with you. So you both searched the tunnels. It was going slow because of him. You could do it in minutes if you didn't have to wait for him. You knew they were down here, but taking them on was another story.

"Where are they?" Priest asked outloud. As if to answer his question, one jumped out of a doorway at him. You kicked it midair so it went down a dead end and splattered on the wall it hit.

"You just had to ask," you sighed.

"Sorry Demon, I just..." he started but the fun was starting and a hoard started coming down a tunnel at the both of you.

"Let's go!" you hollard as the fighting started. You could hear the fighting of the others start as well.

The fight began and you used a good amount of effort to both fight and keep Priest safe. You wanted to keep as much secret as you could. So you just used enhanced speed, strength, fighting skill, and eye ignite ability to do what needed to be done. You alse allowed him to gawk at the blood blade you made. You fought and all that until Blade called for the regroup. You both got down to where they were.

"Where's the bombpack?" Blade asked.

"Down that tunnel." one of them said.

"I'll do it. Caleb, you stay here and help them," Blade ordered to which you nodded. You knew he just meant Nyssa, and you would do just that, as much as you could. "Now give me a hole."

With that you used your eye ignite to enflame all the reapers in close proximity and down the tunnel he was going. They were ash soon and off Blade went, and so did your group. You all would need to get a fair amount away from the bomb. The only one's that could survive that thing was you, Blade, and Whistler. You knew, from the movie, that Whistler would be ok. You just didn't know how other things would be. Things had already changed because of Priest. So your group went down the tunnel. You used your sword most of the time. You almost cursed yourself for not feeding before the mission. This was getting exhausting. You only had a few more eye ignites left before you were on zero. You would have to make do with your blood sword. That wasn't that bad. Most of the time, whomever was before you lost their head, literally.

Eventually the bomb was activated and you all saw it coming. WIth what was left of your power, making your fangs grow and eyes glow, you used a shield to deflect the energy from the group you were in charge of protecting. But the nitro vacume must've enhanced the blast more than you thought. Even with your shield and your power, you came up short of what you needed to cover them completely. They dove into water to help just enough to survive. But unlike the movie, youre shield helped more than enough in that regard, but made you gasping for air, and blood. You had never been so thirsty in that regard. They looked at you as you panted on your hands and knees, looking at them. You were restraining yourself from drinking them dry, all of them. That and you doubted you could've forced them anyway, not all 3 of them anyway.

"Priest, now!" said the one you didn't like. Didn't even know his name, or refused to know it. But as he said this, hot silver pumped through your body. The Vampire you saved in this realm was betraying you, after saying some rather embassingly loyal things and sticking up for you against them. He was unloading sliver bullets into you. The last few went in your head, knocking you out.

Now that you thought on it through your unconsciousness, hanging around all that silver all day and not feeding after being in mist form was taxing in itself. It wasn't overly suprising, even through your training that you would be this weak at the moment. You kicked yourself as you should've known better. To make it worse, Whistler also hated you for wanting human blood. If he saw you with your eyes glowing and fangs out, you had no doubt he would be repulsed by you. You didn't know what to do if/when you woke up. The only one you knew wanted you around at the moment was Blade. You hoped that would be enough.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: It does change something.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
(Outside of your body as you remained unconscience)

You were brought into the same room as the others. They could tell you were still alive from your breathing and heartbeat. They just dropped you onto the floor. If you were awake you would've been eyeing the tank of blood not more than a few feet from you. But for now, they were examining you while the others came around and asked their questions.

"What about this one?" Asked the Overlord as he touched around your skin. The others around picked you up and put you on a table so he could take a look without bending over. Others came near as well. "You are sure he is a Vampire, Priest?"

"Of course I am sure. When he healed me I could sense it. But also he has many bullets in him and isn't dead. He also has these..." Priest answered as he lifted your lips to reveal your fangs that were more than visible.

"This is the thanks he gets for saving your life?" Whistler asked as he saw them playing and observing your body as if it was a toy of interest.

"You have little room to talk," Priest said as he turned to Whistler. "At least I made him feel valued when I was sticking my nose up his ass. You, on the other hand, didn't give him much more than a second look. Blade wasn't the only one that made our work a hell, and desimated our kind to find you, a human. This one was right along side Blade, and spoke nothing but praise for you when I was around to listen. You, on the other hand, made him feel like a worthless pile of crap. At least I made him feel good for a few days."

Whistler was going to say something but was caught by his own thoughts. He was going through what the little Vampire on the table was to him and Blade. How much he remembered you wanted to impress him and Blade. A boy like you, Vampire aside, killing thousands of times, vampires and humans, just to rescue him. That had to leave a mark. And just like kids your age, you just wanted a little appreciation for your efforts. A sign that you did good by him. Even a simple head nod would suffice. But treating him like a vile enemy was not the story book response you had imagined.

"Did you also see his eyes my lord?" Priest asked as he went back and lifted an eyelid so the glowing red eye was visible. But your body's reflexes were still operational. When he opened the the eye and looked into it, your body automatically sensed a hostile Vampire and reacted. Your gaze pushed him into the air and toward the ceiling at such a speed that when he hit it, it showered what was left of his body all over the room. Your eye closed on its own, as if sensing that its work was done for the moment.

"What was that... WHAT WAS THAT!" The Overlord asked to the others.

"Like we know that. He is obviously unconscience. What he does in that state is news to us." Blade answered. "He rarely sleeps to begin with. Maybe this is why."

"That makes his study all the more important," the overloard stated as he stroked your body like before, but more gently. "Take him away and learn his many secrets."

(Back inside your body)

You were in a see of blackness. You had been here before many times when your family had killed you during family vacations. The only difference was a single instance where a white light protruded in, as if someone was looking into you, then a rush of power, followed by darkness again. You were glad for this. When you were "dead" like this was the only time you got to completely relax like when you use to sleep as a human, except you didn't have dreams. Either way, it was a good time to relax. You thought on things like Whistler, Blade, and your family. You missed them a lot. You had been so busy that you had not thought on them for a while. Kelsey, Eve, Drade, Papa, Mom, Sarah, Luke, Isaac and all those dogs you just met. The king Amarok, you wished he was here to tell you about Miss. Isibelle while you waited, or to eat some of these people that imprisoned you. You remembered Kelsey's warning and promise that you not forget them. You spent the rest of the time remembering all of them. You started to actually cry as you realized how long it had been. Crying wasn't something you did. But this was something in your mind that you had little control of.

You started to wake as a familiar feeling of blood rushed down your throat. They must've drained you pretty good for you not to feel it going down in the first place, until some was already digested. As soon as you could move you were gulping down huge quanities of the blood. It was good, really good. All of it was pure, warm, and delicious human blood. You were swimming in it there was so much, literally. You could start feeling people and things around you. There was someone else in there with you but he just got out. So it was clear to drink it all if you wanted, which you did. Your power unsealed and skyrocketed. Whatever pool of blood you were in exploded up and you created a siphone to suck up all the blood you could, like a funnel tsunami. Your body was all too eager to put its newly found fuel to use to repair and refuel its drained body, as well as put some on reserve for later. For the first time, you were stuffed, utterly stuffed and felt so powerful you thought you could split the world in half, but that one you couldn't do even if you wanted to. You finally came to rest in the now empty pool and looked around.

"Thirsty?" Blade asked. It looked like he was super ready to fight, but as shocked as everyone else in the now full room about what they just saw you do. To that fact you were still licking your lips and fangs of residual blood.

"All filled up. Uh, haven't felt this good in a long time." You answered in a blissful smile as you walked up and joined him looking over the room. It took you a second to process what was happening. "Hold up, I thought you said you didn't want me drinking human blood, and how did I get from being shot in the head with silver to being bathed in that much blood? Sure as hell wasn't them that threw me in there."

"Not my idea. Was Whistler's doing," Blade answered as he pointed up at an old man on the balcony. He looked like he had just went through a torture session and broke his back lifting something. "He dropped both of us in there. Crazy old man."

You looked up at him. Your eyes were glowing red as your Vampire features were all out and making most in the room sudder under its weight and pressure. You shielded your allies out of habbit so Whistler and Blade were free to move unhindered. As you looked to him he looked back from his laying position. He was trying to recover but had limited movement at the moment. Even through this he took the effort to throw Blade his shades and nodd an approving nod to you. You couldn't help but smile ate this. The fact that he was the one to give you to Human blood was overshadowed by this little movement or recognition and approval.

"I got these guys. You can go get the top dog," you said as you brought your attention back to the room.

"You sure?" Blade asked, clearly wanting some of the action. He even had his 'don't f*** with me' shades on.

"Come on, I need some fun too. I got all this power and need some place to vent it on. You can have the big boss man and I get all the whimps... just one thing, where's Priest? I believe I owe him one." You answered as he began to relent to your request and focus on his task. the question however made him smirk.

"He tried to open your eye when you were out and well..." Blade answered, pointing to the cieling where Priest's body still decorated the area.

"Well that explains that," you said as you looked up then back at the room of soldiers and vampires. You snapped your fingers and a golden portal opened up. "Here, just step through and you'll be in the room with the one you are thinking about."

"Really?" asked Blade.

"Yes, now come on," you answered. Using the dragon king's ability was easy enough but also unspecific. If someone else got through then you couldn't stop them on route. Blade seemed to figure this out on his own and walked through with his sword. The one good thing about changing the storyline. He didn't have to fight for his sword. How he got it was unclear, but you could ask him later.

For now, you had some fun to enjoy. You sealed the exits so they couldn't escape and went to work. Wasn't hard to defeat them. They weren't even using silver, they stood no chance against you. You made sure not to feed on them though. Whistler might've let you have human blood once, but feeding on humans directly probably was too much. Luckily they were stupid enough to think they could win. Saved on time chasing them down. You were surprised they could move under the pressure you were releasing, but them moving and fighting meant more fun for you. Within a few minutes they were all dead and you were satisfied, both physically and your hunger. This feeling was rare and you basked in it for a while before you came out of it and helped Whistler. You were tempted to ask what changed to have him drop you in human blood. But you didn't ask and he didn't tell. Although you did retract your vampire traits to make him more comfortable as you healed and helped him. You both arrived just as Blade was taking the dying Nyssa out to see the sun. You both stood silent as Blade dealt with this strange loss. This was a day of many firsts, one of which was Blade grieving a blood sucking, full blooded Vampire that he had kill so many of over the years. You also knew this would be the end of the 2nd movie and the 3rd was some distance away. But you kept your Family in your mind, taking out their picture for the first time since you packed it away. Yes, you will remember them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Whistler drops you in a tank of human blood.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
(A few months ago...)

"So you want me to leave?" You asked as Blade and Whistler asked. You were unsure why they were telling you to go. You all had gotten super close and this wasn't on your radar at all.

"Yes. There is too much happening for both of you to be in the same place. Blade can look after himself and so can you. There is no reason why both of you should be dealing with the same small fry. Better to spread out and take care of twice as many. Since Blade can't materialize weapons like you can, I will be sticking with him." Whistler explained. You were silent and pacing back and forth for a while as you thought through it. He was right, as usual, but...

"I don't know if I've learned everything I can from you two and... I like being here with you guys." You replied back.

"We have our fun Caleb. You know you roll like a pro and outshine me on occasion." Blade started. You knew that he would never openly admit you were better than he is. THAT was as close as he got to saying it. "It won't be the same around here without you."

"You know we will feel the same as you do. You are like family at this point. But there is nothing more to teach you. Plus, there is a favor I would like you to do for me while you are out there, if you would?" Whistler agreed and asked.

"Anything, you know I would," you responded.

'Good, I appreciate it.' he said in your head, which meant he didn't want Blade in on it. He did this every time he wanted to talk exclusively to you about things that would otherwise upset Blade. You didn't mind as it showed how much he trusted you, not more than Blade but differently. 'Ok, Caleb I have a daughter, and her name is Abigail...'

(Present time...)

You had been on your own for a while now. Whistler had asked you to keep an eye on his daughter and to come to Blade's aid if anything were to happen to him. You didn't bother argueing about this, especially sense it was for the best. He would be dead shortly and if you remained with them you would be compelled to save him regardless of what happened to the realm. So you searched and found his daughter. He had mentioned she was already trained as a Vampire hunter, not as skilled as Blade but still pretty good. For this reason you observed unless something bad happened. In those cases you helped just enough so she learned and got better. Things like blowing a bullet off course slightly or ashing a Vampire sniper that she never knew was there. Although, to your relief, such instances didn't happen much. So you were able to watch her grow, which was its own reward in a sense. Of course you gave her privacy when needed, but kept a constant watch on her.

It was one of these instances that you decided to help more directly. Maybe it was because you were in the realm but there was more enemies in this scene than there was in the movie. You had went over this scene in your mind over and over again so you could remember it when you saw it, the start of the 3rd movie. Unlike the movie though, there was at least a dozen kids trying to get her. How they thought her and her fake baby's blood would be enough to satisfy all of them was news to you, but she was needing help at this point. You also knew that she would have to see you in the very near future, and you would be leaving this realm soon as well.

"Ah!! Garlic!" screamed one of the kids that was looking at the doll. They all looked over to see the effect. Abby was able to take out 3 of them before the rest held her firm.

"You are going to pay for that bitch!" Said the one you thought to be the leader. He reared his arm back to punch her but you caught it before it went forward. From their point of view, you had just appeared. You also smelled like a human. "What the..."

"That isn't very nice," you said then kicked him into the path of the oncoming train, making him a very dead vampire.

"Get him!" yelled a few of the others as Abby watched, trying a few times to get free but only earning a fist in the gut or a slap to the face for her reward. You moved slow enough for them to see but fast enough to be obviously not human. It didn't take long for you to snap the necks and otherwise kill all of them in a variety of ways. Ways that you had learned from years of hanging with Blade, and other realms. Finally only Abby and her captors remained, very fearful and panicking captures that were obviously intent on holding her hostage.

"Don't move, or we'll kill her." One said as he held her throat.

"You plan on killing her regardless. But if you let her go now and leave while you can, I won't kill you... today. Make a move to kill her, and You'll see just how fast I can be. Your move," you answered with an intense glare. They looked around at the disappearing ash of thier group then at you. They were sweating bullets and Abby could only watch you as you glared at them.

"Go to hell!" one yelled then began swinging a knife at Abigail.

"Bad move." you said and turned them to ash with Kaname's ability. Once again you were praising and thanking him from afar. That ability was insanely useful and effective. With that you rushed forward and caught Abby as she was dropped to the ground. She lay in your arms and you started to heal her. You did it slow so she could see it. First you put your hand on her chest and protruded a light to heal her broken ribs and punctured lung along with other cuts and bruises, then her throat to heal her partially collapsed throat and obvious bruising side effects, and then her head to help her concussion and any other injuries. "Are you ok Miss. Abby?"

"Uh, yeah... Thanks to you I assume" she said as you helped her up to her feet. You were still a little kid, in size and shape. So you were shorter than her and obviously younger in looks.
