You also made it a point to remain in that mindset, polite little kid that is. You had a life to get back to eventually, so you needed to hold onto what your projected age would say.

"Yes Ma'am. It is really nice to meet you Miss. Abigail," you answered.

"Right, you know my name and you would be...?" she asked.

"My name is Caleb," you introduced with a bow.

"And you have been what, following me?" she asked.

"Yes."

"Why?"

"Because your father asked me to," you responded with an innocent look. You didn't have your Vampire Clan outfit on, just your casual wear, so you looked more kid like and nice.

"He did? Wait, how do you know my Father?" She asked, obviously confused.

"Uh... well that is a long story," you said nevously.

She sighed and went over to sit on the bench and patted the seat next to her.

"We got all night, so let's here it," She answered. You nervously sat down. You didn't know why you were nervous. Other guys would say that it was because you were talking to a very hot woman. But you had access to a succubus at home, two of them in fact. It wasn't her status or power level. You didn't know, you just were nervous.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Third Movie

choices: She calls you before getting Blade.
Blade comes and he asks them where you are.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Right, where to start...?" You said outloud. You thought about how to tell her you met her father and Blade. There was really no way of getting around you being a vampire yourself. "... I met him when I was looking for Blade. I was sent to... find him and learn. It took a while for them to trust me, but eventually I was accepted and trained with them. I learned a lot but your father thought that having me and Blade in the same area would be too much. So he had us seperate and asked if I would look after you when I could. I suppose that is the short verson."

"You aren't nearly old enough to have met him that far back." Abigail said

"That... that is because I am... older than I look. Kind of like blade in that I am a... well not human." you said, visably nervous.

"That makes you a vampire then?" she asked as she scooted slightly away. You followed her movement and sighed at her sudden distance before nodding. "What do you mean like Blade?"

"Daywalker for one, in a manner of speaking. Immune to galic, can eat human food, but we have our differences. I have to drink blood, but it doesn't have to be human. Blade used to have me drink from Vampires... YUCK!!!"

"You got to be kidding me. My father would never ally with a Vampire that drinks blood!" She stated as she got up and faced you.

"Yet here I am. Please Miss. Abigail, I don't want to harm you. If I did, why would I heal you, and tell that story? You already saw I have enough power to do so if I wanted. Though you do smell really good." You added, trying to go for a compliment.

"Like I would trust a Vampire, even a little pint sized one." She almost growled at you. You got up at this, but slowly and started walking away. "Wait, where are you going?"

"I don't know. Probably just around some place where I can keep an eye on you. I get that you are too much your father's daughter to take me for my word as a vampire. I can still keep my promise from the shadows. Sorry if I intruded," you responded then turned to mist slowly, so she could see that you were turning into something rather than the ashing like appearence it usually had. "Call my name if you need me, I will hear you."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Story time...

choices: Early ending for the story and departure for you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You watched her again. You also helped deal with Vampires as you traveled. But that was just simple stuff. Out of respect, you didn't drink human blood as you did this. You knew that Blade didn't approve, and if you judged the time right, Whistler was dead at this point. You watched as Abigail told her friends and others about you and what you said. They settled on the thought that you were some kind of spy, using her father's name to get close to her. You didn't like being labelled like this, but you understood it was the only logical thing they could do. Either way, you had to stand aside as they rescued Blade. You knew they wouldn't need your help. So you just followed them until they made it back to the hideout and were talking about things.

"So where is he?" Blade asked, after they got done with explaining about Dracula and arming for thier hunt.

"He?" asked Hannible King.

"Yeah, the kid. The old man told him to watch you. So where is he?" Blade asked, looking around for you.

"Wait a minute, you mean that little vampire kid was telling the truth?" Abby said, not believing it. Blade just answered by looking at her. "We thought he just was a vampire plan to get past our guard."

"What you tell him?" Blade asked, catching on quickly.

"I sent him away. I... my father really did send him?" she asked.

"Yeah, but you sent him away. You got no idea what you have done." Blade replied.

"What's so special about this kid?" King asked.

"If this whole Drake thing is true, only he and I can do anything about it. He's got crazy mad skills and has got kick ass abilities." Blade explained. Someone else might've explained a little better. Blade was never one to talk much.

"He said I could just call him if I need him." Abby told them. Blade just looked at her again. It was amazing what the dude could say without doing more than looking at someone. "Alright... Caleb, are you there?"

"I have always been here." You answered from around them.

"You doing that mist thing again aren't you?" Blade more stated then asked.

"How else am I suppose to keep an eye on them without them knowing," you answered. You paused for a moment then proceeded. "Blade, I know about Whistler... sorry I wasn't there. Maybe I could've..."

"Can it. You know the old man wasn't one to die easily," Blade responded, which was as close as he got to a comfort response to you in such a situation. It was hard to read him, but you had gotten a hold on it, barely.

"Ok, where is he?" King asked after pointing his gun every which way as you spoke.

"I would show myself, but I really don't like being shot. Mind putting down the gun, or holster it?" You answered.

"That is him asking nicely." Blade informed. He glared at King until he holstered his gun and Abby did the same, though still highly on edge. To this you started to thicken and combine your mist so they could see you reform. You figured it would give them a chance to see something without you having to explain in detail. "About time."

"Nice to see you to," you said commically.

"Who... are you?" asked King.

"My name is Caleb. Vampires also call me 'Demon'. Don't really like that title, but it scares the crap out of them, so I don't mind," you introduced and bowed while doing so.

"H-how did you...?" asked the pasty white guy named Hedges that was usually in charge of the weapons and more nerdy stuff.

"I can do a lot of things." you said with a smile. Again, you weren't in your Vampire Clan outfit. You didn't see the point at this stage. This was the last movie and so you didn't have to worry about staying around afterwards.

"You ready to roll?" Blade asked, bringing everyone back to the topic of hunting and taking out Dracula.

"Sure, you haven't gotten to soft have you, or do you need a cane?" you asked comically to which he just smirked at the ego jab.

"Wait, he's coming with us?" Abby asked.

"Yeah, got a problem with that?" Blade asked.

"No, I just... he's a vampire right?" She asked, trying to voice her concern.

"Get over it." Blade answered. She looked at you and you shyly glanced at her as if to say sorry on his behalf. He may have been blunt, but you weren't. "Let's go."

"Don't swet it kid, she's hated vampires for a while. I think it is hereditary." King joked as you let them go ahead of you. You forgot how he liked to say bad jokes.

"You may be right about that. Took a lot for Whistler to trust me too." You said back.

"Oh, I didn't mean it like that... I'll shut up now." King responded, noticing that it was bothering you a good bit.

'Finally,' Blade thought to you.

'You really think that chatterbox has run out of things to say?' You thought back.

'That sucks. What's up with you and her?' he asked as you all got into the truck and she gave you a death look while you were visibly nervous.

'Don't know. I'm just really nervous around her for some reason.' You said back.

'Maybe you got the hots for her.' he offered.

'Not really. Don't get me wrong, she's hot, for a human. However, I got women and girls much hotter than her at home. Succubus are naturally that way. Whatever it is, I am not sure why I am like this around her, so it hurts that she doesn't like me very much,' you replied.

'Not easy being you is it?' Blade asked in a rare form of concern.

'I suppose not.' you replied in an internal tone that indicated that you were not wanting to expand. He didn't mind, he was normally quiet to begin with. So you stole one last glance at Abby then gazed out the window as King drove you all to your next destination. They eventually stopped and started hunting and tracking familiars, but you were barely breaking a sweat. Blade was content on killing them, but you weren't.

"What is this one thinking?" Blade asked as he held a young man to you. You glared at the man and looked deep into his mind. It was easy to penetrate his mind, as he had no mental defenses.

"Dr. Vance is the head dude." you said as you pulled out of his mind.

"How do you do that?" Abby asked but with a tone that indicated that she thought her mind was also a target for you.

"I don't know, I just can read people's minds, if I want. Was hard to control at first, but it is useful and easy against people like him. He doesn't know how to guard his mind. Just like searching on google or opening a book." you answered then Blade tossed the man off the building. You used your ability to have him land safely but still out like a light.

"You going to save all of them?" Blade mocked.

"Can't help it. The moment I say humans can die that easy is the moment I condone drinking one dry, which I don't." You answered.

"Whatever..." Blade ended with. You hated people that killed innocent people and he hated familiars. In some ways, you two balanced each other out.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Blade comes and he asks them where you are.

choices: Family time, and R&R with Kelsey.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"What is that?" Abby asked as you all drove to Dr. Vance's office. She was referring to something you had been looking at since you got into the car.

"I... it is my family," you answered in a tone that made it obvious that you missed them, a lot.

"Where are they?" she asked, probably expecting you to say that you killed them all.

"They are waiting for me. When I am done here, I will be going back there. I haven't seen them in over 10 years, though for them it will only be a few months. I miss them," you responded, actually petting the side of the picture as you looked deep into each face.

"How long?" Blade asked.

"Depends on how long it takes to kick Dracula's butt. If I let things play out, it will be about a week. But if I don't, I'll be done today. Both has their downsides," you answered in a contimplative tone.

"What downsides?" Abby asked in a lighter tone. WIther it was to get you out earlier or because the news of your family was working on her was unclear.

"If I wait and stay longer than Blade will deal with him and vengence is dealt with like is should. But if I kill him today and give the blood to you all then you don't. Either way, all the vampires are destroyed at the end. The downsides are if I wait then more innocent people die. If I do it right away then the legacy passed on to Blade is passed on to me instead, making me stronger and leaving you all with not that much. Selfishly, I like it here, but I want to go home. I guess we will see," you responded. They listened but didn't reply to you. Blade seemed to be thinking on it as were the others, in different fashions.

It wasn't long before you all were there and heading up to Dr. Vance's office. The security was pathetic and you all made it without breaking a sweat. You sniffed as you all entered the room, smelling blood. You were face to face with your choice now. Drake was standing right there. The Dracula in your realm was a joke, this one wasn't and Kaname's trick wouldn't work on him.

"Remember me, time for some payback." Blade said as the formed a triangle with you next to Blade.

"That isn't Vance," you stated as you glared at him.

"What? Looks like him." Abby said.

Before Drake could do anything you lifted a hand and swiped it. This made all the obsticles in the room, even the drapes and paint, turn to dust. The only things that remained was you 4, Drake, and the recently dead Dr. Vance. As you did this, Drake went back to his normal sealed form. The other two formed up by Blade and your side. Abby wasn't keen on having you so near her but she was more worried about Drake.

"Ah, the hunter they all fear, and the Demon. I had a feeling about you two," he said.

"Blade, this is that moment I was talking about. We either let him go, or I kill him. You know where I come from, and know that I won't be coming back. So what do you want to do?" You asked, although not taking your eyes from Drake.

"Take him now." Blade said. Mr. No nonsense, you should've guessed.

"A child is going to kill me? I think not." Drake said as saw you walking toward him.

"You of all people should know that things aren't always what they appear." you said then rose your arm and sprouted a blood sword. You let your eyes glow and made a barrier around the place so he couldn't get out. "I am sorry Drake, but this is where your story ends."

"What are you?" he asked, a bit bewildered. You could tell the others, except Blade, were wondering as well.

"Imagine if ALL the vampires and all their abilities you have ever heard of and were ever born were all combined into one... that is what I am. I am THE Vampire. Now, I know you will not believe me so I will skip the argument. Goodbye Dracula," you said.

Before he could do much more you rushed forward and cut off his head like nothing. The move was so quick that it looked like you just appeared on the other side, even from his eyes. He stumbled forward as his head tumbled, hitting the ground by his feet before his body dropped as well. It was considerably harder than you made it look. Most you could just tear with your mind, even the ones in Kaname's world. He was immune to like attacks and it took a good amount of effort to get the blood swory through his neck. Either way, you summoned the blood from his body and began filling viles with it and drinking some as well. Most of it though was in a few viles for them to take.

"Here, this should be enough for your bio weapon and..." you started then made a movement to seal the head back on Drake's body, just for appearences. "... that should be enough to keep the Vampire's busy until you use it."

"So that was it? That's all it took?" Blade asked.

"You were expecting something longer? Sorry Blade, but I am really home sick. I couldn't play with him at this point," you replied then they reacted to a new presence in the room. "Hello Mr. Vale."

"Master, you completed this realm and test earlier than expected. Lady Isibelle would've been proud." Mr. Vale said as he got up from bowing.

"Who is that?" Abby asked as you let your eyes go back to human eyes and the barrier was released. She was dumbstruck till this point and now was full of questions.

"He is the man that is here to take me home. Don't worry, you won't see me again... at least I don't think you will." you said. She backed down, but had a bit of a guilty face on. She wasn't ready to be attached to you, but you had just beat their enemy and was attached to her father. Her open hostility toward you might've been too much and she was just beginning to see it. You still didn't know why you were so nervous around her. Maybe you would see her again. You never know. One thing you learned since becoming a Vampire, anything was possible. You looked from her to Blade. "It was an honor Sir. Thank you for putting up with me all this time."

"Was fun kid. Go and do right by your folks." he said and held out his hand. This suprised you. Sure you two had been cool with each other and trusted one another, but he never had done anything more than a nodd to you. Shaking hands was a huge thing. You hesitated, but he waited, until you finally brought your hand up to meet his. His words were standard, but this was a good send off. You looked over at King, who had fainted from shock and smirked.

"Alright Mr. Vale, time to go." You said as you seperated from Blade and walked over to where he stood, towering over you. He was, after all, a very large man.

"As you wish Master." He said and darkness took you again, but not before you were able to share one head nod with Blade before he was gone. But then you were held in the darkness with Mr. Vale. "It is time."

"What do you mean?" You asked.

"Master, it is time for you to gain the portal ability. The same one Lady Isibelle gave me to help you. With it, all your power will be unlocked and you will be the master of your own path." Mr. Vale said.

"Ok, going into different movies and realms could be really cool, and creating them too. How do we do this?" You asked.

"By drinking me dry." He said. The solution and words hit you like a ton of bricks.

"What?" You asked, still shocked after a good 10 minutes of just standing there trying to process it.

"It has been an honor serving you, Master, but this is what must happen. I have lived a very long and very full life, first with Lady Isibelle and then with you. But... SHE was my love of my heart. I long to join her after centuries of living and loving her, to be without her is too much... and this is the last task she gave me, to ensure her chosen successor was trained right. I have been waiting for this day, to finally be at peace." He explained.

"This can't be... wait, you said you lived centuries with her, and you both loved each other. I thought only a Vampire could live that long. How did she take you with her for so long?" You asked. You had not only the shock of what you had to do, but also the shock of not being alone like you thought you would have to endure.

"It is a gift you can only give once. Normally it is given at the end of a Vampire's life. But if given any time before that, the person given this gift is immortal and has the portal ability at their disposal, along with whatever power the Vampire shares, until it is taken. You must be careful if you are planning on giving this gift to someone. A thousand or more years can be as much of a curse as it can be a gift, as you will find out soon enough. But this brings us to this moment. Please, Master, set me free and allow me to join my Love in Heaven." He said, kneeling down so he could look you in the eye. Yeah, he is that tall.

"T-thank you, Mr. Vale. As a favor to you and Miss. Isibelle I will do as you ask. Tell her thank you from me when you see her." You said.

"I will, Master." He said then closed his eyes.

You really didn't want to do this. You had worked so hard to NEVER lose control and drink a person dry, unless they were those already dead and insanely evil vampires in Blade's realm. But this was someone you cared about. But you had to do it and he was begging you to do it, without you compelling him to do so. So with that decided you leaned in and took hold of his neck. Then with a quick motion you bit into him. You worked fast so you didn't lose your nerve. You had never drank a human dry before and you hoped it wasn't going to be something you would be compelled to do again, because it felt really good. You kept drinking until he turned to ash. But this wasn't because of you. It was the gift leaving him. In the end, he died just like Miss. Isibelle, or should you say, Mrs. Isibelle. With that done, you readied yourself, opened the portal to your realm and walked through, ready for the rest of your life. Remarkably enough, you didn't feel bad, you wondered why... but for now, you were going to see your family again.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Early ending for the story and departure for you.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
September 4, 2004, it will be a day that would be cemented into your mind for as long as your immortal life would live. You had gotten home early and spent some much needed time with each of your family. Most noticeable was Kelsey and Eve. They were always your closest friends and they were quick to remind you of that. Although, they quickly backed off when they were reminded that YOU were the one gone for over 10 years. For them it was only 2 ½ months. So they helped ease you back into it.

For now, you and your immediate family were Up North at the cabin. Your Grandparents were deciding to move up there for retirement in the near future. So Papa was recruited to help make it ready for them. Sure the cabin was nice, but it was not for long retirement staying, especially for old people, and since your father was working on it, you and your brothers were to. You had offered to help them get things done faster. But Papa had insisted on working alone side his sons the normal way, well close to it anyway. Struggling with a farm tractor and grater to plow a field was one of these activities. But this day wouldn’t be remembered for a well completed job. Something else, that would mark you forever after…

“How much further?” Papa asked, as he backed up the farm tractor to the grater.

“More…” Grandpa started, as he guided Papa back. “…more, more, there!”

“Alright boys, get the bolts in place,” Papa instructed as he observed.

“Papa, I can’t get mine.” Luke said, as he struggled with the bolt.

“What’s the matter? Caleb already has his side in,” Papa joked with a warm smile.

“Yeah, like that’s fair,” Luke joked back, making you all laugh a little bit. Papa helped Luke and had you straighten the piece, as it was at an angle. Then attempted to heave himself back up to the driver’s seat of the tractor.

“Stink…” He said as he came back down. It looked like he was playing on his running old and overweight joke, like he always did. Groaning while walking up a flight of stairs was part of this. So him backing off and saying something like that got another smile on your faces. But when you expected him to end it and get back to work, he didn’t.

He was right in front of you and you had your hand on him as if steadying him if he needed the extra push to get up there. You became concerned when this ‘joke’ went on to heavy breathing and labored pulse. But the turning point for all of you was when his usually upright and working shoulders began to slouch. He was facing you now and you were holding him up with one hand on his shoulder.

“Something isn’t right.” You said as you looked at his extremely labored breathing. The others seemed content to run with the joke as long as Papa could keep it up, that is until they heard you say this.

“Caleb, let’s get him in the open,” Grandpa said, first to start moving as he told Luke to go get help. You effortlessly lifted him and laid him down on an open part of the ground.

“Caleb? What is going on?” Mom said as she looked at you observing him, and Grandpa doing the same. She went by his head to hold it as more people came out. She, along with everyone else, now saw that things were bad. “Help him.”

“I… I am trying,” you said, as you healed everything you could find. “I can’t find what is wrong.”

“What?” Grandpa asked, first to be able to talk after you said this.

“I have healed everything and more already. He should be able to live till 150 on the things I healed. I don’t understand. Everything is healthy, why won’t he wake up? He…” You said as you frantically healed places and they could see your desperation and truth behind your words.

“Ma, call 911.” Grandpa instructed. After that, you all tried everything you could. They even tried CPR, as if your attempts weren’t enough. Mom looked past his vomiting and such to give him mouth to mouth, when he wasn’t breathing. 45 minutes went by and there was no change. At this point, you were crying and healing him so his heart would beat a few times then stop, or his lungs would work then stop as well.

“Come on, Caleb, you need to stop.” Mom said, knowing that the EMT’s were mere yards away, getting out of their ambulance.

“There has to be something I can do!” You cried as you sent another healing energy through his body, but to no avail.

They grabbed you with silver in their hands to restrain you and pull you inside. You didn’t fight them, but without silver, even your default motor skills were too much for them. They put you on a couch inside while Mom stayed with Grandpa and Grandma to explain to the EMTs. They left Luke inside with you. You had many friends, family, and such that you loved very much. Each had their little thing they did best. Kelsey and Eve were high on that list. But Luke was your brother. He was always the more populat and, if not for your vampire abilities, more athletic. He was the ‘cool’ one. But he was also the only one to reach you like this. There was just a bond that only a sibling that close to your age could have. He understood you. While your Vampire side was more than he knew, your mind and heart were known to him better than anyone else.

“Caleb, is… he?” Luke asked, both scared of the answer and wanting it.

“He’s gone. I don’t know why I couldn’t heal him. What…” you started, whimpering as you spoke. This caught Luke off guard as well. You had been through a lot since the change and he had never seen you cry or was this emotionally compromised.

“We all know you did everything you could,” Luke said, putting a hand on your shoulder.

“Why? What is the point of all this power if I can’t save the people closest to me? At least my family.” you asked and ranted. “It is my fault. If I was stronger maybe I could…”

“Caleb!” Luke almost roared and whacked you over the head with some silver brass knuckles he kept around. You looked at him as he looked at you. “Don’t you ever say that! You are the best son and brother in the world and more powerful then… I don’t know, but you are not bad and you are powerful. You tried your hardest to heal him. As far as I know, only God has a higher healing ability than you. It is NOT your fault. I am having a hard enough time dealing with this without seeing my Vampire brother freaking out in front of me. We need you, we all do. Sure blame will be passed around for a while. But if you couldn’t heal him, with all your power, then the Lord must’ve been calling him home. We need to trust in that. He is more perfect and strong that you. So you wake up and help us deal with this already! We need you!”

Your eyes were locked for a while. Luke was something else. He always knew what to say to you, to kick any mindset in the butt. He could look into your red Vampire eyes and talk you down easily. The only person that could do it better was… well he wasn’t there anymore. But you needed to help. Papa might be beyond your abilities, but not the minds of the people around you. You needed to help them deal with this.

“Thanks Luke…” You said as you wobbly got up. You braced yourself on the wall for a minute. You weren’t ready to go out there. But this was one time where you could never be ready. Not for this. Not to see your Father dead…

"Just... please help. Help us now, especially Mom." Luke begged.

"I will." You answered then entered his mind. Entering the minds of your family and friends was a lot harder than anyone else. They were use to mentally defending mind attacks. But for their sakes, you did it anyway. You helped him calm then went with him to help those outside.

This was not easy for you. The moment you came around the corner, you saw the white sheet over your Father's body. The ground shook slightly as you looked. Those that knew what they were feeling looked at you, as you entered the area. But you went straight over to Mom and sat on the log with her. She grabbed you and hugged into you. She was in shock and pain. You then realized, that no matter how much you were hurting, there was someone that was hurting more. Your mother had lost her Husband, her life partner, her Love. You embraced her and entered her mind, calming her in a way that didn't tread on her memory of the day. She didn't need to forget, she needed to accept it in the right light. The others watched as you helped her respecting it, in shock themselves, and secretly hoping you would hurry up and help them too.

This was a very dark day for you. Your Father, first to accept your condition, moral center, most reasonable and loving person you ever were to meet, and friend was out of your life forever. But for the calm that you were trying to pass out, you dared not shed another tear. Not when they took his body away, or offered their condolences. You had to help, you could deal with your own grief later.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: A dark day.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Word traveled fast about Papa's passing. One of the things your family was good at, was being nosy. Within hours of his death, everyone in the family knew. Before the week was out, everyone else that was ever connected with him was also notified. The funeral was so large, that the population capacity of the church was doubled, and those were only the people that could make it on time. As for the non-human family other than you, they paid their respects as well. King even came in person, but only when all your family was Up North, spreading his ashes over the river. Everyone was dealing with grief in their own way. You Mom was the most worst for wear. Made sense when you thought about it. He may have been your father, but he was her loving husband for more years than you'd been alive. You offered to help calm her, but she insisted on doing this part without supernatural help. She just wanted to give Papa the time and respect he deserved.

You on the other hand were reclusive at the moment. Unlike your brothers or Sister, you couldn't react by moving away with a guy or breaking a wooden chair. You had to be careful. Extra emotion would not excuse you from doing something foolish, something that you couldn't come back from, or the person you did it to. You decided to handle it in a way that he would want, as far as losing you temper was concerned. It also helped that you had wonderful family and friends. Although they could all see that you were not showing your true feelings. Eve wasn't there all the time, as she had her kingdom to run, but she did refrain from asking for your help in dealing with wars with invading insects like she had been doing after you got back and before Papa's death. Kelsey was the most supportive though, her Mother tried but wasn't good at feeling bad for a dead human yet. So many years not caring had conditioned her. Although, even she had to admit that the world was a darker place without Papa in it.

"Caleb, wait up!" Kelsey said as she joined you in walking to your next class.

"Hi Kelsey." you said with a smile.

"You seem to be doing well today. How you holding up? If I were in your shoes, I would've taken the month off they were offering you." Kelsey asked.

"Yeah, well if he were still here he would expect me to be on top of my grades. Can't let him down with that. Plus, School is one of the few normal things I got left. I can't jip on that." You answered, trying to do so and joke at the same time.

"Why do you do that?" Kelsey asked as you both walked.

"Do what?" You asked innocently.

"Brush off your feelings to protect others. It is ok to feel sad you know." She said with care. She didn't want' to seem too forceful, but she did want to be there for you and get you to open up a bit.

"There are more important things on people's plates than worry about me and my problems. I don't want to add to people's worry," you answered.

"And how will you feel if you bottle it up for all that time, then it comes out when you don't want it to?" She asked.

"You think I'll lose control?" You asked, both confused and almost hurt that she thought you had that little self control.

"No, that isn't what I meant. Everyone has their way of dealing with things like this. You have to let those feelings out somewhere. I just want to make sure you do it where it is safe and where I can help. I want to be there for you, Caleb, but you have to let me. If you a human, I'd just force you to do it. But I can't, you have to help me help you." Kelsey explained, genuinely worried. You looked at her for a moment as you both sat down on a free spot. No one was around, you made sure, so you could talk.

"Truth is... I am scared. Like really, crazy, can't sleep, shaking scared." you said, after a long pause to think on it.

"You... scared?" she asked. Of all the things she thought you were going to say, this was not one of them. You were a Vampire, one of the most powerful of all night creatures and assumed monsters. You tended to scare other people, not get scared yourself.

"I know, it is strange. I thought I was losing my mind at first. But I am," you started then paused. She was just listening to you. When the pause went on long enough, she just put her soft and silky smooth hand on yours as if to tell you to keep going in her own little way. "Papa was the first person to accept me when I turned. He was and is my moral center. When I was unsure what or who to feed on, I went to him. When I was pondering when to cross the killing line, I asked him to help guide me. When I was being treated like a monster by my family, he was the one that helped everyone see that I had not changed underneath it all. He... he was my core. I don't know what to do without him. What if I... what if I go bad without even realizing it? Without him here to guide me, like only he could, I fear I will slip and fall and not be able to get back up. I am so scared Kelsey, unbelievably so..."

She didn't know what to say at this point. Sure Papa was special. Even the non-humans had to admit that he was more than the ordinary person. Many had thanked him for raising you in a Godly and right manner. Teaching you and helping all of you. But those that knew about you, wondered how he did it. Raising a blood sucking vampire couldn't be easy. Especially one that could kill everyone in the room with a simple blink of an eye, and craved their blood. Even knowing all of this, she didn't know how much of a value you put on him as well. How would she help you get passed losing such a crucial part of your life. She even owed her life and that of her Mother to Papa. He was the one that came up with how they could live, even though they tried to kill you and threatened your entire family.

"Caleb... I am not sure what I can say to help. Jeepers, it would be so much easier if I could just kiss you and be done with it." She started, trying to lighten your mood with a joke... it wasn't working. "But listen, you have a huge loving family, including me. You all welcomed me in to your huge and obnoxiously nosy family with open arms. I know none of us can replace your Father. I am not going to even try, cause he was very special. But from one mythical being to another, you will make it through it and I will help. Even if you need to vent on me, instead of someone weaker. I will be there, cause Lord knows I will need you when I face a similar position. My arms will always be open to you."

"Even if I do something bad? Like really bad?" You asked, not knowing if she could handle something like that. Kelsey was this beautiful being that was, in some cultures, thought to be sex goddesses. You didn't see her embracing you in wake of a mistake that ends in lives lost, many lives lost. Before she answered she pulled your arm and didn't stop till she held you in a very tight hug. If she was hugging a human, the person would have a crushed spinal column.

"Even if you are covered in blood from people you kill, I will still be here to hold you until you are ok again. And I will help you stay centered, remembering where you come from so you are less likely to do that. I will be here long after your human family joins your father. I plan to hold you and help you for all of that time, if you let me," she answered.

"Thank you Kelsey," you said as you hugged her back. This simple pact of friendship and responsibility wasn't enough to heal your fear all together, but it was a significant start. And perhaps, in time, your inward grief would also be healed. But for now you hugged Kelsey, your Succubus friend, family, and helper. "From the bottom of my heart, thank you."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Back in school.

choices: It is a boy, using a spell of some kind.
It is a trap, designed to lure you two there.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You sat with Duke, just relaxing with your Father's dog. Life was still hard without Papa, and you were still scared, but you all supported each other. Kelsey was right, you would make it through it. But for now, you and Duke were enjoying each others company. Sure he wasn't sapient, but he was still a k-9 and as such was completely loyal to you. You wondered 2 things as you pet him. Those were; if dogs and such in other realms would be required to obey you, and at what point you should let Duke go. For the first point, you would have to wait and see. But the second one, that was a little deeper. You had extended Duke's life and he now flirted with his 20s, and not in dog years. That was pretty old for a Golden retriever. You didn't know if you were doing good or not allowing him to finally rest. But you weren't too distressed by it. You would figure it out eventually, and you both didn't want to think on the bad side of this situation. All at once, Duke barked at an approaching scent.

"Yeah buddy, I smell it too," you answered and sent him inside the house. The scent had been around for a while. Just wafts of it and not imposing. But it was a scent you had not experienced before. You stood and walked out into the front yard to allow the wind to pass around you and bring in the scents from around. You didn't know what it was about this scent, but it was a very strange one. Seeing as you had experienced some pretty strange things over your life, so far, this did not go unnoticed. You stood still, eye's closed for the better part of a few hours.

"Caleb, what in the world are you doing?" Luke asked as he got home from... well wherever he was previously. It was a more teasing question, as he didn't even try to guess why you did some of the things you did. You came around to his question.

"A strange scent in the air, again." you answered.

"You sure it wasn't just Ryan?" Luke asked. Sarah had been seeing a guy named Ryan Snowball. Yes, his last name was Snowball.

That started after you left for the Blade realm. Your parents were worried at the time. But when you got home, you could confirm she was safe and sound. However, she was pregnant. As far as morality was concerned, your family didn't like that she did this out of wedlock. But your Mom needed something else to dwell on. Strangely enough, Papa's passing brought a little responsibility to them. They were planning on marrying, soon. It was the first addition into the family that no one except Sarah thought he should know about you. But Sarah being your sister made it a touchy issue. You didn't like him, his silver tongue was useless on you, as you could more than read his intentions. However, you... tolerated him, only because Sarah asked and your soon to be born Niece would need a Father, no matter how screwed up he was. That and Sarah loved him. Mom couldn't wait for the baby. It was a source of many jokes around the family, and Sarah knew not to tell him about you until they all approved. She didn't test that part, as she knew you were stronger than any argument she had to tell him. literally.

"Yeah, I can smell him to." you joked back. "But no, this is different. I've been picking it up for a little bit now. Strange thing is, I don't know what it is. Usually, I can at least determine if the scent is alive, dead, human, or something else. But this... it is off my radar completely."

"Something you can't detect?" Luke asked, suddenly on guard. He knew, that if you couldn't do something, then it warranted supreme caution.

"Exactly. Duke can smell it to. Don't worry though, I don't think it is hostile. But best to be careful," you answered.

"Is that why you are out here, just standing around? You are... what? Picking up the scent?" Luke asked.

"Yep. Letting the wind bring it in. But I have yet to locate the source." You answered.

"Couldn't you just ask Eve and Drade to help?" Luke asked.

"If it was an emergency, sure. But this isn't a clear threat. It is just my curiosity. I don't need to spy on everyone in the state just to cover that," you answered.

"I suppose so. Just be careful Bro." Luke said as he turned and went in the house. You nodded to him in an affirmative then stood again, trying to find and track the sent.

"You know, it might be faster if we just take a walk?" Kelsey suggested, as she saw you and came close.

"I suppose you've sensed it too?" you asked.

"You think? Worst part is, I think my Mom knows what it is. But she said that I should find and deal with it the first time without her help. But she never said I can't bring you..." She answered with a smile.

"True. Let's go for a walk then," you relented.

"So, you beat the crap out of those 'vampires'?" she asked. The Vampire Clan had teased you at a weak moment about Papa. You soundly defeated them, but had to erase their memories or suffer a publicity storm. You left in that they were not to tease you about such things again.

"Yeah, but patched them up again. So brittle, and tiny, those people are," you answered.

"I could enthrall them if you want." she suggested.

"If you did that to every human that was an idiot, your house would burst with idiots. Besides, don't you want useful people?" You asked.

"Yeah, I guess you are right." She returned calmly. "Besides, not like I want to kiss them anyway. Such closed minded idiots don't deserve to touch these lips," she finished as she brought her hand up and lightly caressed her lips.

"And way to young. What possible use could you have for a High School pimple popper like those guys?" You asked, keeping the joke running as you both followed stronger wafts of scent.

"I could entertain myself for a few minutes. But they aren't nearly as good as someone with more power and experience." She said back.

You both continued talking about different things that ranged from predatory preferences to your school work. Your human friends were also a topic, wondering if and when to let them in on your little secret... and hers. She didn't really see the point in letting random humans know. Although, she was getting increasingly fond of them. Unlike most in the school and your graduating class, they were a little more together. She even thought about letting them kiss her, when they asked. But she stopped herself, she liked them as friends, not as love slaved humans to her will. Although, as she matured, you could tell that the level of difficulty in restraining her body's urges were getting harder.

"Holy stink! That is definitely it. That was like getting blasted by the scent." Kelsey stated as you were both hit hard by the scent you 2 were tracking.

"Agreed, we are getting close..."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: A Treaty with Magic.

choices: Confront the boy, he is on the edge anyway.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The two of you searched the area. It was a type of park. Large in size and with many forms of recreation. There was a jungle gym, swings, and that sort of thing for little kids. Paths and benches for romantic walks and what not. Not to mention plenty of trees and cover in between. More than a few times there were people who partook in questionable activities in the cover of the park. But you didn't know what you'd find. Because of that, you two stuck together. You both had your senses fine tuned, so every heavy wave of this scent hit you both like a semi truck. It took a few hours to find the center, and it was well into the night. Good thing to, or the source would've seen you two coming. But with the dark aiding the two of you, it was simple to move and not be sensed.

"This boy is the scent?" Kelsey asked, as if confirming what she was thinking. She was speaking in voice barely ranking as a whisper. Only you and other high ranking predators could hear her.

"Not the boy specifically. I can pick up his scent. HE, is most definitely human. But he is radiating the scent. If it goes on like all day, he should show us what he has been doing to produce such a scent very soon," you answered. Kelsey nodded as you both settled on a branch that overlook the small area the boy was in, but well hidden even from a predator's eye.

The boy must've been no older than Isaac. Maybe 9 or 10 years old. He was panting heavily, as if he had just got done working out. You could smell the sweat, but not the grime that usually accompanied such an activity. You two observed as he got in a proper sitting position again with his hands out in front of him. He closed his eyes and began to speak in apparent gibberish. Even with all the languages you had heard, you had never heard this one before. Traveling to the realms and inside them, along with around the world and in classes at school, you didn't think you'd be completely baffled from communication, by a child no less. Then again, you were pretty young. You searched inside yourself to see if your Vampire instincts were telling you something. They didn't have anything either. Not like King, the Amarok, that your Vampire instincts told you to be extremely cautious about. Whatever and whomever this was, you didn't have a clue. Then something popped into your mind from movies...

'No, that isn't possible. If something like that existed, one of the former vampires would've seen something about it... unless they are doing the same thing Kelsey's mother is doing. In which case, they know, but is letting us find out by ourselves. I must be careful, we must be careful,' you thought to yourself.

You listened to the words he was saying. Never being so lost in all your life. Both your eyes widened as a blue light emanated from his hands and began to shine over his body. His body rose from the ground like a levitation trick. Although, he was obviously not doing all that just to rise up a foot or so. As you both watched, you saw other things around the boy lifting as well. Then they began combining and separating until the wood, logs, leaves, and other things formed a new and fully intact tree in front of him. All the debris that one normally found on the forest floor, was gone. It had all gone to create this new tree.

"I did it!" The boy said then crashed down to the ground, as he lost is concentration. "Ow, that hurt. But who cares. They all said I was too young. Secret training complete and I proved them wrong. Magic isn't that hard."

With that, he quickly got up and ran off excitedly from the spot. Leave the two of you, dumbstruck.

"Did you just hear...?" Kelsey started.

"Yeah," you responded before she could finish.

"Did he just...?"

"I think so..."

"Am I dreaming?"

"Don't think so."

As if compelled, you both made sure no one was around then went down to look at the tree the boy had made. You both circled it. It was by far the most healthy looking tree in the place. It was almost done with fall season, and this one was still in the midst of its green cycle. Not only that, but it smelled right to. Just a small hint of the scent that, apparently, was the scent of the kid's power.

"So... what we were smelling was...?" Kelsey asked, still stunned.

"Magic energy? Is that even possible?" You answered and asked.

"I guess. If Kitsune can do a form of magic then there should be a breed of humans that the mage myth come from. But why is this such a secret? My Mom didn't say anything, she seemed afraid to do so. Your former Vampire knowledge also kept you in the dark." Kelsey asked.

"I don't know. But I think we should at least see where this kid lives. We can confront him or his family later, when we know more. First step, see who and what he is... carefully." You stated and both of you nodded and left the magically made tree where it was, following the boy's scent. This was a lot easier than trying to follow his magic scent.

Within a few moments you both were on his trail. You both kept back, inhumanly so. You didn't want whomever he was tied to finding you. If a small boy could do that, you shuddered to think what the others could do. Your Vampire side never said you were the biggest kid on the playground. Maybe, these magic humans were a threat so powerful that your Vampiric powers would be useless against. After all, if they could create a living tree, something you couldn't hope to do, they were likely to be able to do much, MUCH more. So you both followed him. The boy turned every once in a while. He seemed to sense you both were there, which was also bothering you. Did he know you were there. You, a Vampire, Ruler of the night by some, were detected by a little kid? But he was either too young to know that he was being followed, or he was just paranoid at being found out by whomever said he wasn't suppose to do that outside. Well he didn't say that. But it was obvious by the fact that this kid was the first scent of magic you had sensed.

Eventually he came to a huge mansion, went in the gate. Kelsey was about to follow over the wall but you grabbed her and pulled her back far enough so you could both talk.

"What you do that for?!" She asked, confused and irritated.

"I can sense something open and close when he went in the gate. I don't know what it is, but I don't want to take a chance on it being some kind of barrier that could, at the very least, alert them that we are here." you answered.

"Barriers? That is just..." she started to which you just looked at her. "... right. If magic exists, then why not magic barriers to. We at least know where the little dude lives. We should be careful. Let's go figure out what to do next."

"Good idea. But don't say anything to others." You agreed and suggested.

"Why not?" she asked.

"For whatever reason, they aren't allowed to say anything. On the off chance that they are in danger to that command, I don't want to put any pressure on them. We are meant to discover this by ourselves. That is what we should do." You explained.

"Learned that in the realms I suppose." Kelsey stated while crossing her arms.

"Had to learn something while in there..." You returned.

"Ok, let's go figure out what we are going to do next.

choices: They let both of you go, after preaching to you again.
They dump you both, leaving you two for dead.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You both thought about what you should do. After following the boy around, you both saw that their family went to your school, and even had a sister in your grade. Beth, she was actually in the locker right next to you. You had never sensed anything abnormal about her, and she never hinted she suspected you at all. But even if she didn't know something was up with you, she was hiding this magic thing so well that even you couldn't pick up on it. But either way, you thought it unwise to corner one of them at school. That would not put forward a very good image of you or Kelsey. So you decided, after a few weeks, to go to the mansion. If they were potential allies, then you needed to meet with the parents and leaders, not their children. That could happen afterward.

"You ready?" Kelsey asked as you both stood outside the main door. You both had entered past the barrier. You both took extra care to suppress any abnormal things, so both of you were very human at the moment. You could feel the strange aura scanning you, at least that was what you thought it was doing.

"Yeah, let's just get this over with," you answered, still nervous.

With that knocked on the door firmly. There was no answer, but you could hear movement inside, so you knew they had to be doing something. But you couldn't use a bit of mist to investigate. Well you could, but you didn't know how they would react to that. You already knew that a small child of this house could do things you couldn't. What if they had more dangerous surprises in store for supernatural visitors. So you both waited patiently. Finally, the large door opened and you could sense another barrier lifting just from the entrance. You had to guess that there were charms, or something like that, over the house. Mainly to prevent things like you from getting in unannounced. The man that stood in front of you now looked like a butler of sorts.

"Good evening, how can I help you?" He greeted with a formal bow. Yep, definitely a butler of sorts.

"Uh, sorry for intruding, but we were wondering if we could speak with Mr. Kohler... or Mrs. Kohler. We have concerns about their son, Tim." You stated, bowing back to him. Kelsey did likewise, but more so smiled at him.

"They asked not to be disturbed at the moment. However, as it involves Master Tim, I will inquire again. Please come in." He answered, opening the door for the two of you. He led you just inside into what looked like an area used to hold people waiting for the people inside to permit them access. "Wait here while I inquire."

You both did as you were told. You might've been curious, but you had no intension on making these people angry, just because you couldn't follow simple directions. Kelsey seemed to be on the same wave length. You both just glanced around the room, but didn't move from the spot the butler left you two. You both could hear his footsteps as he went about his duty. Eventually, you heard footsteps returning, more of them. It was then that you sensed more people observing you, but not directly. It was a weird sensation. It was like the feeling you get when you just know you are being watched, but slightly amplified. Perhaps another form of magic.

"Good evening young man and young lady." Greeted an older man. He looked very distinguished but perhaps a bit arrogant. You hoped that wasn't a peek into his true nature. "What is your names?"

"Caleb"

"Kelsey"

"Well, Caleb and Kelsey, you have my attention, but I am understandably a very busy man. But I always make room for matters of my family. I am told you have concerns about my youngest boy, Tim?" He asked as he stopped in front of the two of you in a proper but concentrated posture.

"Yes, we do. Um... how to put this... We were in the park a few weeks ago and we saw him do something rather... strange. Good, but strange.... actually it was quite beautiful to be honest. But we understand that if it caught our attention, you might want to know about it." Kelsey stated.

"What did you see?" he asked, very attentive at this point. You were getting a bad feeling about this, and you could feel the strange aura get stronger around the two of you... well 3 of you.

"We aren't that sure what it was. But we can say what we saw." you suggested, he merely nodded for you to continue. "We... well we were attracted by a bright blue light. We, followed it until we saw a young boy, later to be know as Tim, he was... well floating in midair. We thought that was strange to say the least, but then everything else started to float to. It all came together and made a most beautiful and healthy tree. At first we thought we were seeing things. But the tree was real and blooming, not like the falling nature that the rest of the trees were doing."

"You must've been drinking. Really, at your age?" He stated in a quite arrogant tone.

"No sir. Neither of us drink or do drugs or anything." Kelsey defended before you could stop her. The man had given you two a way out, and she just bashed it.

"Then what do you think it is that he was doing?" he asked, glaring at her, then you, and back to her.

"I... We, hesitate to say, but we thought we were seeing Magic. We waited a few weeks just be sure we couldn't think of any other reasons that could work. We didn't want to just show up and accuse your son of doing something without exhausting all other options. But the more we thought on it, the more sure we were that it was magic. The tree still stands in the park. You can see for yourself if you wish. It is the only one still green in there." Kelsey continued. She didn't seem to sense the increase you were feeling or notice the narrowing of the man's eyes as she explained herself. It was a respectful was of bringing it forward, but if they were as bad as the feeling you were getting, then she was just digging a deeper hole.

"Then it seems we have a problem, don't we?" he asked as he looked at the both of you.

"Look, we came here to tell you that and to..." You started, trying to manage the situation before it became to bad, But you, all of a sudden, were plunged into pain. Searing pain that gripped your whole body. You hadn't felt anything like this since that kid in the other realm almost killed you, to test you. But this wasn't destroying you, or stopping. "Ah!!!"

"I've heard enough of this, out of you two. We do not suffer those underneath us. We rule over them, and you." He stated as he chanted something then you and Kelsey's pain filled bodies began floating and moving. You both were still in unbearable pain, but he closed your ability to speak for the moment. You felt like releasing your powers to stop this intrusion, but your decision to be so human for this visit was backfiring. Whatever he was doing was keeping you from resisting him. It was clear though, that even with your full power, it would be hard to fight this guy. Magic, who knew that it could be this powerful, and harmful to you. But your concern was more so for Kelsey. Tears were streaming to deal with her pain. She must have been unable to change as well. "You two will learn why it is very important that you NEVER speak of magic or its relation to us, EVER."

At this point he brought you both down into a dungeon type place. You two were hooked up to machines and magic devices that stimulated painful points you never knew you had, especially as a Vampire. You now knew why your knowledge was sealed, and Kelsey's Mom was so scared. These people were overpowering you both without that much effort, and they weren't even using silver. If you ever dealt with them again in a fight. You would have to be completely released and sense the magic aura to anticipate attacks. But for now, many arrogant magic users came and tortured you two. Over the course of a month, you two were put through unimaginable pain, but not so much as to leave any evidence. They even cut off one of Kelsey's arms, then magically healed it, and did it again. That right there was enough for you to not want anything to do with them. They were spouting the entire time how superior they are in the world and the supremacy of magic over anything else. What was worse, they were nearly right. You were powerless and fading fast. You didn't know how long they could keep this up. But one thing was for certain as your perception dimmed and blurred. You were beginning to HATE magic, and magic users... but also fear them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Go to the mansion properly.

choices: Afterwards decisions need to be made.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Caleb, you should never have come here." said Beth.

It was strange. Everyone in their family was required to help with this. You didn't know if you should be even more repulsed or impressed. But for now, they had all tortured both you and Kelsey. Even little Tim did a little bit. He was restricted away from cutting or blood activities, but he still helped. All of them were very different than what you remembered in school... well Beth at least. She was on the Cheerleading squad with Kelsey. Sure she was always jealous of Kelsey for her looks, but she was otherwise smart and nice. Loads better then most of the other people in your grade. But here, she was just as arrogant as her father and family was.

There were only 2 relatively good things about this situation. The first was that they hadn't discovered what either of you two were. You had a feeling that letting them know would only secure more torture and death. Kelsey seemed to be on the same thought pattern. You both also faked being brainwashed into what they were doing. Saved on torture time. The second was that you saw and filed each of her family. It wasn't as large as yours, but still decent. Thankfully, if you ever got out of there, you'd only run into Beth and possible Tim at school. The rest were in jobs and businesses around the state and country. This little incident also cemented your view on magic users. You wondered when you first thought about them if they could teach you magic. That was before all of this happened. Now, you didn't want anything to do with them.

"Why do we have to do this?" Beth asked another woman that were taking you down from a rack of sorts, then doing the same with Kelsey. They started dragging you two out of the room.

"Because we got the worst practice scores." said the other. You were paralyzed at the moment and Kelsey was either in the same position or worse. You thought worse, because you could hear how labored her breaths were and other things in her body.

"Like that should matter. We get stuck taking out the trash. Why can't we just kill them again?" Beth asked. They were letting you two go?

"Because the would cause a murder investigation. This way, they are afraid enough never to bother us again, and never to tell anyone. Don't worry, this isn't the first time we've done this." The other said as they packed you two roughly into a van and drove off.

The cold metal floor cut into your skin. You had a feeling that if you could, you would be passed out by now. Never thought the not sleeping perk would be a downside at any point. They continued to talk about how much of a pain it was and the fun they had with you two over the past weeks. But as the van stopped and you two were taken out, you began hearing a most welcomed sound. Howling.

"Isn't it strange how all the dogs have been acting?" the other said as they dragged you and Kelsey to a hill.

"No kidding. Every dog and wolf in the state has been acting weird. Father says that their leader must be missing or hurt, something like that. I didn't know they all had one leader." Beth answered back as she dropped you on the ground by the hill, the other doing the same with Kelsey. It was a steep hill that they must've used before. It was perfect for dumping bodies. steep enough to force a roll, but no enough to outright kill the people being dumped. The bottom was right next to a small road, ensuring that someone would find the people... eventually.

"I think that is load of crap. Something is just around that is spooking them. Maybe it was Tim's little training." the other stated.

"True." Beth agreed, then looked at the two of you as they were ready to push down the hill. "Not that either of you two can hear me but... serves you two right."

With that they both kicked you and Kelsey down the hill then drove off. You couldn't do anything, yet. Their magic still lingered, but you could hear Kelsey tumble as well. The sound of her rolling bad and snapping one of her limb bones was heard at least twice and then a thud as you both came to a stop. You so wanted to go to her and heal her. The ordeal was over, and you both were alive, barely. Kelsey was in bad shape. Your head was facing her and you could see her once smooth face riddled with new cuts and torture makes. Dirty and bloodied from this whole thing. You were too weak to turn away, and too week to look. This image of her like this did all the situation needed to make your view of mages as bad as it could get. But you were about to sleep, finally. But right before you could you heard the howling and barking get closer until you could see a few wolves around, and hear more than a dozen in the area. A few came by and started sniffing around then whining at your position, but not sure what to do with Kelsey. You had to make sure she was saved. They were wolves after all. While they were sworn off of you and your blood family, and as close as Kelsey was, her scent didn't show a blood connection to you.

"T..." you started but was heaving blood as you spoke. This caught their attention. The largest one laid down and put his head close enough to you that his fur was touching your face, listening with rapt attention to what you had to say while the others seemed joyful that you were alive. "T-take... us... home...p-please."

That was all you could push out as, what seemed like, buckets of blood was pouring out of your mouth at each word. You would need to drink when you awoke, assuming that the spell wore off. Your last thought was the relief of hearing an affirmative howl from the wolves present. This meant that the ordeal was over, and Kelsey would make it home safe. It was a good day when you decided to spare and make friends with the k-9 nation. Speaking of which, you knew exactly what you would be doing when you woke up. Brad, he was going to be teaching you magic to combat these mages. You couldn't justify slaughtering them. But you would be damned if you were caught by them again. That, and they had made it clear that they wanted nothing good with you. That was ok, cause you wanted nothing to do with them either.

It took a while, but you eventually woke up, slowly, with a group around you. You were still weak, but you could feel your power again. You never thought you would be so eager for feeling your power again. You painfully moved your head to each side to check what was going on. You were in the basement of your house, in the meeting room, with you and Kelsey on beds, with your immediate family, her mother, Eve, and Brad there. They were all both relieved and worried when they saw you move.

"Oh, thank the Lord you are ok." Mom said as she grasped your hand.

"Here Bro." Luke said as he put a long plastic straw in your mouth. You knew what it was, a straw to one of those hospital blood bags. You took it gratefully and started drinking . Most of it was gone as soon as it hit your stomach. You had loads of wounds to heal after all. But it kept coming and you kept drinking. It was human blood, and it was good. You kept going until you were both satisfied and healed, allowing you to sit up.

"Uh, before we go any further." Kelsey's Mother said and looked to her daughter. You could feel she was on the edge of death. This got you even more angry at the Mages, but for now you nodded and got up. You knelt down by her and started healing her as well. You had a bit of leftover blood in your stomach, so it was all used up in this endeavor. Soon she gasped and shot up. She looked around frantically then at you. Before anything else she just pulled you in and clung to you.

"Is it over?" she asked through a new fountain of sobs.

"It is. We hare home, and we are safe." You answered her, hugging her back. She seemed to be just as stiff as you, as she protruded her full Succubus form as she embraced you.

"Ok you two." Said the voice of Eve. She was huge and took up over half the room. Brad must've had to use magic to get her in there in the first place. But she was the closest predator to you and Kelsey. So you assumed she insisted on being here when you woke up. But you both could tell she was far from peaceful right now. "Tell us what happened."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They dump you both, leaving you two for dead.

choices: You want to see a Reaper, just to be sure.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You two were suffering some ill effect of the past month or so. Mainly in what you should tell the room of concerned people. You had teleported everyone to King's area, so you could talk with him as well as bringing Drade into the mix. You didn't need to tell everyone, just those that were present. Besides, you had some questions for them. You and Kelsey laid out what happened, including little Tim's activities and the scent that had drawn you both to him. You told them about your vampire side not saying anything and your new hatred for magic users. You of course left those of them present that could use magic, like Brad and King, but you were visually upset about what and how these... people tortured the two of you. More so Kelsey. You could handle if they just tortured you, but Kelsey was another thing.

"So, that is where you were?" asked King. His huge deep voice rumbling those in attendance. This was Mom's first meeting with him, so to was most of the others.

"Yes, perhaps you could explain a few things King. Like why I was so helpless against their magic and not against yours or Brad's. Or why they seem to be more powerful then I am. And why no one warned us about it. Finally, how I can fight them if the push me again." You asked, still heated about it.

"That is simple to answer. They are not more powerful than you are." Brad started, everyone looked at him except King. "Perhaps I should start with the order of things. You see, whomever is the Vampire is the most powerful in terms of raw power and accumulative abilities. However, the Vampire can't learn magic. It is nature's way of balancing it out. We couldn't teach you magic no matter how well we tried. And as such, you are extremely vulnerable to magic, more so than silver. But it does have its limits. Any of your abilities are stronger than a magic version. So if they were to throw a lightning bolt at you, and you shot one at them, yours would be leagues stronger. Same for the rest of your abilities. But they have many spells that you don't have abilities to counter. As to why theirs worked on you... it was because you weren't at full power. When you are at full power, you have a magic defense that is made by the effects your power is having on the area. NO magic can be used inside that area. But it tires you out when at full power, as you know. As to how you can beat them without going full power... you must strike before they can utter a word of their spells. If they do, you are screwed. Unlike me, they must use verbal enchantments and spells. But this also means they are stronger when cast. I could do that to, but the language is only known by those that have their particular magic aura. I wouldn't even understand it. As to why we didn't warn you..."

"It was because we didn't see the need." King stated, to which you looked at him very seriously. "The Vampire of the age is never targeted if they are known. Not even mages are stupid enough to do it. Not because they can't defeat you, as you found out, they can. But because of the Reapers."

"Reapers?" Kelsey asked. The others in the room were listening with either rapt attention or angered guilt.

"They look like a robed monster that's skin is almost stretched so thin around its skeleton that it does little to hide the bones. They smell like rotting flesh, because that is what they are. They are not sapient, only an instinctual creature drawn to their need to feed. And they only feed on one thing." King stated. Brad seemed to afraid to even speak about them. "They feed on the life force of any that have magical energy. If they start feeding, only a withered barely alive husk is left. At that point, it is a mercy to kill the victims. Worse of all, they are impervious to abilities and magic, and almost all physical attacks. People that don't have magic energy can't see them. They are magic's enemy and mage's worst nightmare. That is why they are so well hidden. If a Reaper catches even a hint of magic energy, they swarm to feed on any and all that have magic in the area. They hunt and feed until none are left."

"Ok, I am actually starting to like these guys. But what do they have to do with me?" You asked.

"Simple," started King. "A Reaper has no weaknesses except one, Vampire energy. If you were to even touch one, they would wither and die, turning into dust. So to any of your abilities and aura. That is why so many mythical beings live so close to whomever the Vampire is. A Reaper won't come anywhere near a Vampire and the moment they even catch a whiff of your scent, they tell the others and will go to the other side of the world as fast as they can. Not even stopping to eat or sleep. They are deathly afraid of you, literally. Meaning, that they are also deathly afraid of fallback. Any they feed on that are connected to you is more of a chance for you to hunt them. So any that they even think you are in contact with, they will steer clear.

"So, if I would've told them what I was...?" you asked.

"They would've begged you to forgive them. They still might if you reveal yourself," Brad answered.

"I am glad you didn't." Eve stated to which you looked at her. "The Mages have always been like that. If you had told them who you were, then you wouldn't have seen what they are like. Sure they could easily defeat you, Caleb, but they wouldn't dare. If they had succeeded in doing lasting damage or sealed you, Reapers would've sensed you were not protecting them and had a feast. They may be afraid of you for that reason, but the force their will on everyone else. Only thing stopping them from taking over main areas are the attracting Reapers and the Vampire's command."

"Master." King said to which you looked to him. "Your spider friend is right, but also to revenge based. Being linked to you, any k-9 in the pact with you is safe. It is obvious to me that you don't truly hate these people. If you were, Reapers would sense it. You think they would miss a chance to feast on people you wouldn't mind them eating. People with such an abundance of magic energy. They would swarm in the thousands if you did so. No, and I request that you not commit genocide because of this experience. They may not be your most valued group right now, but they do balance things out. If they weren't there to hinder rouge predators and monsters, we would have a much different and bloodier world."

"You are saying I should protect them?" You asked, obviously not liking the idea.

"NO." King answered with a little more volume than was necessary. "You need not protect them. If they use their power, they should expect Reapers to be drawn. That and they should know what a mistake they have made. Blindly attacking you, it is nearly unforgivable from all of us that rely on you. I can assure you that they will feel many factions move against them for this. The may be powerful, but not all powerful. While you are weak against them, some of us out there are not. Hell hounds for example. They repel magic. If you EVER are in need of them, you know how to summon them to you. We will also have them watch your family. But they can be outnumbered and beaten by the mages. Either way, you don't have to protect them like you do for us. But you shouldn't hate them so that they are free game either."

"I see..." you stated, walking around as you thought on it. You had heard of Reapers in games and TV. Now it made sense why you had seen so many mythical beings so soon after changing. They were sticking around Mrs. Isibelle for protection. The Vampire clan also made sense. The Reapers wouldn't attack if they even expected a Vampire nearby. So having an organization like that protected a larger area of people. Also made sense why more creatures hadn't destroyed them yet... and why every one wanted to be on your side when they knew who you were... or what you were. It wasn't because you were all powerful or vastly more powerful than anyone else. The last month had made that painfully obvious. But at least you knew now that you didn't have to fear them either. In fact, even though they could kick your butt, they still feared you. "What do you think Mom?"

"W-well..." She started. She was a little nervous with so many high powered creatures looking to her. She was advising you on such a topic. They nor her took it lightly. But that was the way you liked it. You had done that a few times. Putting a vastly powerful creature's life in the hands of your human family. Made them more respected and honored. Even werewolves that hated humans had to brown nose your human family. "... wiping them out, even indirectly, wouldn't be right. Papa would say for you to forgive and forget, just like the Bible says. But I know they went too far. While you should still try to do that, you should also allow them to deal with the consequences of their actions."

"You good with that Kelsey?" You asked as she was the target of their recent torture and she was clearly still shaken by it.

"As long as you are there to protect me, I will be ok." She said, hoping that the Mages saw the connection from her to you, as a Vampire.

"Ok then, none of you will tell them who or what I am. Let them figure it out by themselves. I will not kill them, but I will not protect them either. The will need to find and apologize before I will come to their aid." You stated, they all seemed to agree that this was the best choice.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Afterwards decisions need to be made.

choices: They can't take it and come to you for help finding the "one that told you".
The bluff works and you have a more peaceful school year.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You felt a little better about things. You thought that going back to school would only be a bad thing if Beth and her brother were still there. But if you truly were that value, and that you had Hellhounds at your command, you didn't have anything to worry about. Mrs. Dremer however, had decided to pull Kelsey out of school. She was still in the area, and she was getting homeschooled, but they both were to afraid of Mages to openly be exposed to them like Kelsey would be at school. Regardless of your feelings about them, this did not to the Mages any favors as far as your attitude toward them. You had been convinced not to hate them, or wipe them out, but you were even less likely to come to their aid now. You still didn't want anything to do with them. So you were torn as you walked to your locker. It was right next to Beth's. So you would have to put up with her. You half wanted to see her face when she saw you without the obvious scars that her family left you. If you hadn't healed, you'd be out of school for a while and covered with burns and cuts... not to mention they torched your hair off. But you were no different then before, and only a day after. But the other half of you didn't want to be anywhere near her. She couldn't do anything to you, and you were tempted to just tell her how big of a mistake she made. But you decided against that. She was insanely smart, she would notice something was up. If not right away, then when you summoned Hellhounds to protect you. To top it off, you had sped over to where you heard a Reaper was.
