It was as ugly, smelly, and frightening as they said it was. But it also was as fearful of you as they said. As soon as it smelled you, it didn't wait to finish its meal, it just took off as fast as it could with a horrendous scream.

"What the..." came a voice as you walked. There wasn't a lot of people in the school that would talk openly with you. Most of them weren't there yet. So you turned to see who it was. But when you saw Beth gazing in shock at you, it didn't need any more attention than that. You just turned and walked away, leaving her to stand there shocked in the hallway.

"Where were you man?" Colin asked as you got to your locker and opened it.

"Oh, sorry. I was visiting someone for charity work and it lasted longer than I thought." you answered. You knew that telling any more people about magic would only put them in danger, wither you were there or not. You didn't want yet another of your friends to leave school because of THEM.

"Was Kelsey with you?" Colin asked as you got your stuff and walked away before Beth could get there. You packed everything you needed, leaving the locker empty. You didn't want to deal with her in any fashion. But you knew she would be listening in on your conversations to make sure you didn't tell anyone.

"Kind of. But her Mom pulled her out of school. It was a little drastic but that is what they decided." you answered.

"You mean our group is without a hot girl, again?" Colin asked, obviously bummed. You smiled at the compliment and made a note to let Kelsey know when you saw her.

"Looks like it. She might still come over by my place though, but not as often as before." you answered, this time with a little bit of a sad note. While it was safer, you didn't like that the one person that made a normal human day at school tolerable, was gone. You knew you could handle it, but it would be more draining without someone there to help. Maybe you could carry around a spider, no, that would be too weird and potentially problematic.

You got to class and started your day. Thankfully, you only had one class with Beth, Gym. But she was on the opposite side and had no real way to interact with you while in that class. But seeing as the gym outfits showed your flawless body. You could see the confusion building. As you thought, she was a very smart girl. She definitely noticed that there would have to be a supernatural explanation for you not having any evidence of what her and her family did to you. But your avoiding her wasn't making it any easier for her to get answers. She tried to get close to you for some reason, but you would walk down busy halls just out of her sight line then teleport so she couldn't find you but got you to class. She must've had some rules, like not doing magic in the open. As you didn't sense her aura at all. You saw her waiting for you by your locker. Unfortunately for her, you had already emptied it earlier. You just dematerialized your supplies in your bag. So it would seem like you always had what you needed, despite the small size of the bag.

When she saw you bypass her without giving her so much as a glance, she followed you. There was nothing you could do about that. On the way home, there wasn't any sudden corners you could lose her in. So you just walked normal and left her to ponder things. You weren't going to let her know you were watching her. That would only be seen as you being nervous around them, and her.

This type of day continued for a while. At times, some of her family would join in watching you, at wrestling matches and such. You could feel them watching you and hear them talk about how something was wrong that they needed to discover. But you gave them no opportunity to see anything worth gawking at. It was wearing on Beth in particular. Sure Tim had come up to you and kicked you in the shin, but you didn't react to it. You just turned and walked away. You found that the worst thing to do to people like them, was to ignore them. Worst for them at least. You were nice to everyone else, and submissive at times. Like when the Vampire Clan did their thing and you did just enough to cause them to move along. But with them, you ignored them in a very cold fashion. Not so much as a glance in their direction. Some of your human friends noticed this, but they didn't really like her to begin with either. She was too popular, and even how hot she was, they thought of her as fake. Nice on the outside, and bad on the inside. If they only knew how right they were. But eventually she ran to corner you before the exit stairs after a wrestling match, where you were alone and she could talk more openly.

"Caleb, we need to talk," she commanded.

"Why?" You asked back, not letting emotion into your tone of voice.

"Does it matter? I said we need to talk, and you have to do what I say. Or do you want us to torture you again." She threatened. This was obviously her way of getting what she wanted from people their family had done this to. That got you to wonder how many people that was.

"Leave me alone," you sighed and walked the other way, toward the crowd of people from after the match. Usually you liked walking alone afterwards, but anything was better than this.

"Or, I could always go after that loving family you have..." She tacked on. This made you stop in your tracks. You didn't turn to face her, just stood there. If she had seen your face, she would've seen how mad you were getting. You needed to cool off before she made you do something you'd regret. "Good. Now tell me, how did you heal so quickly?"

"Find out yourself." you answered then started walking then stopped, catching a thought as you felt a magic aura start to form and her start to say a few phrases. You knew you had only a few moments to stop her before her spell was complete. You weren't about to expose yourself and you couldn't summon Hellhounds this close to normal humans. But you thought of another way that should scare her pretty bad. "But the person that did told me something about you people. Something that, he says, will protect me from the likes of you and your family. He said, their are Reapers in the area."

You heard a gasp and a sudden retraction of her magic aura. You were once again glad that you weren't turned around. Otherwise she would've seen your smirk. There was a Reaper in Wisconsin, but it was far enough away. So you told the truth, just not all of it. But that was enough to scare her so bad that you smelled sweat forming on her.

"How do you know about Reapers?" She asked, whimpering as she spoke.

"Not too much. He just said that with one so close, that your family wouldn't dare use your... gifts outside a shielded area. So as long as I don't go anywhere near that house of yours... I shouldn't be worried. But your family should, whatever that meant. Apparently whatever this "Reaper" thing is... it means something pretty bad for you and your people." You responded. You could feel her shaking. Wither she was out of self preservation, or for concern of her family, that was uncertain. But you didn't mind in the least.

"Who is this person?" she asked, on the verge of crying scared to warn the others.

"Like I would tell you that. Go on and deal with whatever this is by yourselves. I guess I am glad I can't do whatever you all can do. If this "Reaper" comes by. It will only be doing me a favor. Then Kelsey can come back to school. Good luck with that." You finished then started walking again. She burst out the door and went off crying. For what reason, it was still up in the air to you. But you were glad she would leave you alone, for now.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Back at school.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You almost laughed when you saw the Kohler's new attitude. Your little bluff actually worked. You didn't think that arrogant family would believe such a thing. They must REALLY be scared of Reapers. You couldn't really blame them. If those things were hunting you and you couldn't do anything about it, you would be pretty freaked out as well. But for now, you liked the space they were giving you. Beth tried to question you a few times. But you just told her to get lost or leave you alone. You might've talked with her, if she wasn't demanding you to answer her questions. She was nice to other people. You didn't know why she couldn't just suck it up and ask nicely. But no, she had to keep her pride. Probably got that from her Father. Oh, you were waiting for the day that they figured out what you were. But for now, you were dealing with something else. Something you put way higher than the Kohler's survival. To be fair, lots of things made that list.

"Please Caleb." Sarah begged. You had helped with her wedding. She was now Sarah Snowball and almost ready to pup out her kid. You had already offered to help with that, if she wished. She said no, and you agreed. That would just be too weird. But right now she was wanting to tell Ryan, her husband, about you and the family secrets.

"You do understand how much danger you will be putting him in right? If he knows, he will be opened to my world. Worst of all, he will be a target for abnormal attacks. Since he doesn't share the Konel or Lon blood, those allies that we know may still harm him on accident, or in an attempt to keep their own tower of secrets." You warned.

Most of the family didn't like him very much. He had a silver tongue, but he did nock up Sarah before marriage. But most of the family tended to leave it up to you if you wanted to tell more people about yourself. But they were NEVER to make that decision for you. If they wanted to tell someone, they had to approve it with you . While you were their family, and they trusted you, they knew that you were a Vampire with connections to multiple mythical beasts with different temperaments that protected you in strange ways at times. This was made obvious when one of your cousins told someone at school and a werewolf tore the throat out of the person. You took care of it for them, but it was just common place to have you decide such things.

"Yes. He needs to know. If little Cassandra needs your help, he needs to know that we should call you rather than the hospital. Plus, he is already wondering why I have so many scorpions around. I can't have them stink him, or him seeing a large one without him understanding why." Sarah explained.

"Fine, bring him down." you relented. She kissed you on the cheek then went upstairs. She had to be careful with her 8 month pregnant belly, but she was doing well. You were downstairs in the meeting room at the moment. You had previously planned on finding a realm to visit over the summer. The TV was on and you had a stack of series to watch, but now you had to deal with Ryan. Soon she brought him down and they took their seats, after Sarah shut the door. Luckily no one wanted to sit through another one of these with you, especially with Ryan. Sometimes they got a kick out of people finding out about you and their reactions. "Hey Ryan."

"Hey Caleb. Sarah said you could explain the scorpion thing?" he asked jokingly, but with an aura of seriousness to it.

"Scorpion thing?" you asked.

"Yeah, I almost got stung this morning by a 2 foot long scorpion when I woke up. I almost called 911, but she just yelled at it and it went away. That was a bit weird to say the least. I said that she had to explain and she brought me to you." He answered.

"Yeah, Drade would be cross of I said anything without your or her say so." Sarah explained.

"I agree. Last thing you need is getting on her bad side." you answered with a smirk then looked back at Ryan. "What I am about to tell you is not to leave this room."

"I understand." he said with confidence.

"No, you don't. I mean it. This is very dangerous stuff. It will trump your little incident this morning by a long shot. If you so much as breathe it to anyone, dying will be the least of your worries. That is not a threat, it is reality, and one I can't protect you from." You pressed.

"That sounds like a threat." Ryan argued. This was one of the silver tongue moments your family didn't like about him. He could guilt people into doing things.

"You can think what you want. But this is not up for debate." You stated very seriously. He hadn't seen you use that tone before. Sarah was getting nervous but Ryan backed down. To be fair, he had no chance against you, in body or mind. "Ok, what if I told you that we converse with mythical beings?"

"Are you serious?" Ryan asked. You simply looked at him without flinching. He looked at Sarah who nodded that you weren't kidding. He looked back to you to answer. "I guess I would ask to see one, as proof if nothing else."

"You already are seeing one." you stated. He was obviously not getting it. You nodded for Sarah to move away from him. She did so and sat apart so he could deal with it. She would've helped him, but neither of you wanted to endanger the baby with his reaction. With the extra room, you turned full Vampire for him. He fell over and sprinted for the door. But you held it with your power. "Calm yourself Ryan. If I wanted you dead, you would be."

"What are you?" He asked in shock.

"Really? You can't figure that out?" You asked back as you reclined and waited for him to respond and calm down.

"He's a Vampire Ryan." Sarah stated in a calm voice.

"That's is impossible." Ryan stated, not believing it.

"And you said you could handle it. I could wipe your memory, but Sarah was begging me to let you in on our little family secret. In case you were wondering, I am the only one and no I can't turn you or any of them." You answered.

"You can't wipe his memory." Sarah protested.

"I said that I COULD, not that I WOULD." You clarified to which she backed off. You then retracted your Vampire look so he wasn't staring.

"And that scorpion was what, your pet?" Ryan more accused than asked.

"Actually it was closer to Sarah's than mine," you answered. He looked at her the back to you as if for one of you to explain. "I am friends with many mythical creatures. Including the queen of the Wisconsin territory or spiders and scorpions. Since they are friends of mine, some of them are friends with my family and protect them. They obey my family because the respect me. Sarah doesn't like spiders, so she opted for having scorpions protecting her. You must've done something for them to think you were a threat. But in order for you to be completely safe from them, you need to actually meet Drade, their queen. Sarah is on good terms, but if you react like this with her, she might sting you herself."

"Why can't we just get a dog or something?" Ryan asked, trying to deal with the strangeness.

"Then who would be on bug patrol?" Sarah asked him to which he looked at her with a questioning look. "ALL the spiders are gone from around our place. so if the scorpions weren't there, we would have quite the bug problem. Plus they are the ultimate security system. If a robber ever came in... not good for them."

"I guess so, but why not a dog?" he asked.

"For one..." you started, so he looked over at you. "... I am also in control of all k-9 species. Because of that, they would require my sister to be well protected. Scorpions are one of a few predator species that can defend against many things at once, superhuman or not. If you got a dog, they would require a werewolf or something to watch over her as well. Trust me, you may be nervous around Drade's children, but at least they don't hunger for your flesh... unless you prefer the werewolf option...?"

"Caleb, stop teasing him." Sarah scolded as she saw his almost horrified expression.

"Sorry, just having a bit of fun." you said with a smirk then back to the task at hand. "Usually, the requirement for this secret is for me to suck some of your blood. But I don't really want to do that right now. Unless I need to prove something to you."

"Please don't. I don't want to die or be turned!" he exclaimed, or more begged.

"Jeepers, this is going to take a while..." you sighed.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: The bluff works and you have a more peaceful sc...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It took almost all night to explain things to him. It didn't help that he freaked out at every little thing you did. Eventually Sarah had you suck her blood, just to show how safe it was. You brought some other people in; a few of Eve and Drade's children and a Hellhound. He needed to understand in case the Kohler's attacked them, what would happen. Eventually, with Sarah's help, he started to calm down and understand. At the moment, he heard and understood most of it... alone with why he needed to know and keep the secret. Sarah was back at his side, holding his hand and helping him deal with what he just found out.

"If it makes you feel any better. The family took a while to except me when I was made the next Vampire." you added.

"I have to admit, your bite does feel good." He relented. He just couldn't believe that your bite was a good thing. So you bit him just on the wrist so he could see for himself. But it wasn't long. He wasn't exactly your favorite person. You didn't want him craving you to do it again. He was stupid enough to let you drain him, or beg you to do it.

"Now you get it," Sarah agreed and leaned into him. "Now you also know why we all hold Caleb so highly."

"I suppose it makes more sense now," Ryan agreed.

"Ok. You should probably meet Drade. Just so she could tell her children to leave you alone. The probably wont follow your commands, as that is a respect only for my blood family." you added as you stood and stretched. You had been sitting to explain this to him for a decent amount of time.

"Why can't you just ask her?" Ryan asked.

"Because she has to have your scent to pass on to her children." you answered, as if it was the most obvious thing for them all. "Now let's see if I can get her to come here. Or we will have to go to her den. That might be a bit awkward for you."

He nodded dumbly. He didn't really understand like Sarah did, but he sure as heck didn't want to be surrounded by lethal insects like he would in a scorpion's den. You mentally linked to Drade and had a quick conversation with her. She agreed to come and you held out your hand, drawing a portal for her to use. Ryan's eyes seemed to dazzle as you did this, but widen with fear as Drade started to come through. She barely fit in the room in front of him.

"Ah, this room is too small Caleb." she complained.

"Sorry about that."

"So is this him?" She asked as she snipped her pinchers as she inched forward.

"Yes, that is Ryan, Sarah's husband." You said as you moved to a neutral position next to her and them. Sarah was helping to keep Ryan from backing up.

"Why you humans need only one husband is beyond me." She started. "Sarah, are you sure about this one?"

"Yes, he is nice and caring. Not to mention a good father for my little one on the way." She answered. Ryan seemed to calm when he saw her talk with her so openly.

"I know that humans have a harder time giving birth, but have only sapient children. Congratulations." She said then put her conversation back to Ryan. "I will say this quickly, human, so I can get out of this tight room as quickly as possible. I will have my children spare you and protect you. But you will not be in control of them unless they themselves like you. Cause I don't. But while you are connected to Caleb, through his sister, you will not be harmed. Break her heart and we will have a feast. UNDERSTOOD."

"Y-yes!" he stuttered as Drade put a large pincer by his throat. She backed off when Sarah gave the appendage a whack.

"Good. Now, Caleb, not that I am distressed in seeing you, but please send me back. This room is too small." She requested.

"Very well. Thank you for taking the time out of your day." You answered as you opened a portal behind her so she could back out.

"Any time. Always a pleasure." She said as she moved back into the portal. "Remember what I said human."

"Are all the mythical beings you are allied with like that?" Ryan asked.

"Pretty much. To be honest, they don't really like you that much. Bluntly, nocking up Sarah was testing their tolerance. You see, they are very loyal and like to protect their friends. So you threatening one under their protection... not a good move. But while you are connected to Sarah, they shouldn't give you trouble." you answered as you sat back down, he did so as well... more like fell down. It was a lot to process at once.

"What about our children?" he asked.

"They will have my blood in them, through my sibling, Sarah. Any with that distinction will be similar to Sarah in their safety and status with them. They can even play with scorpions, spiders, and all them and not be harmed. They will even be very good babysitters for you if you wish. Hard to beat protection from them. They will NEVER harm them. However there are rogue factions. But they end up dead quick enough" you answered.

"This is going to take a while to get used to." He sighed, finally relaxing a bit.

"Yes it will." you and Sarah said at the same time then started laughing. Even if you were a Vampire, it was obvious that you two were still sister and brother.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: After the whole explanation...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Cassy, your new niece, was an awesome little ball of fun. Ryan was somewhat reserved about you to say the least. But a few demonstrations of why you were useful and helpful was all he needed to at least think of you as friendly. Particularly when Cassy was having a hard time, you were able to teleport over and calm her in seconds. That helped Sarah and him out immensely. She seemed to like you. And, as you predicted, she was playing with the scorpions in the house. A scary sight to anyone that didn't know she was safer with them than she was with almost anyone else. She was too young after all to know they were dangerous. She could spend hours trying to chase them around the floor. When she was crying they would tickle her or scuttle around in circles to make her laugh. Despite the largest one, around 4 feet long, scaring Ryan at times, he found them comforting with her. Sarah was also grateful for the help.

In either case, it was summer time now. To be honest, you were wanting to get away. There was one good thing about the whole magic and Kohler threat. It kept all your minds off of Papa's death. This helped the grieving process along quite a bit. So now you were deciding where you were going. Unlike before, you had to pick rather than Mr. Vale picking before. You had watched hundreds of movies, shows, and such that some of your family had accompanied you with. Without Mr. Vale's help they wouldn't be able to watch you this time as you went in the realm. But they couldn't help but talk about how you would impact each one, or what you COULD do in each. Some were cartoons, some were full of drama, and some were too short to last all summer. You wanted to be gone for a majority of the summer. If not, it would give you too much time to think on the last year... and too much time for the Kohlers to find a way to get back at you. If you weren't even in this realm, then they couldn't do anything to you. You had to assume that they had some rule against attacking innocent people, even if they were your family. But, just in case, you ordered the Hellhounds to carefully watch ALL your family. But you couldn't decide where to go. So you left it up to your family. They had the room covered with the different titles you had watched. You could always go to the others they didn't pick later. But they were deciding now.

"What about the Twilight series?" Dana asked.

"Would be interesting, but a lot of drama. Plus I would be tempted to kick all the vampire's teeth in. I did just spent the last summer helping out Blade you know?" you answered back.

"But they have werewolves in there to." Luke suggested.

"True. Always wondered if the realms were controlled by the same obedience factor that King put into play in this one. He said it would, but then again he never went into a fictional realm before." you answered.

"That reminds me, you think we could meet him again? He was really cool." Luke asked.

"Maybe, but he doesn't like being disturbed. That one has a temper." You stated. You were being truthful. King was the one in that part of your life that was big, powerful, and influential enough to take a snap at even you while in one of his moods. He knew it wouldn't kill you, which is why he might do it. As for your family, he could keep them alive no matter what he did to them... well almost anything. So bothering him with small matters was not something you wanted to test. It was pushing it to have all of them meet him after the magic thing. But he let that one go. "Though, I'll pass on your compliment next time I see him."

"Ok, what about the Vampire Dairies?" asked Amy.

"If Twilight has too much drama, that one is going off the cliff. But it is up to you all." You answered, showing your dislike for it but also your acceptance if they picked it.

"Ok, what about one that isn't Vampire. Like... the Avatar movie?" Luke asked.

"That could be cool. I wonder what their blood tastes like...?" You stated as you thought about it then thought about something else. "Then again, maybe not. If the point is to learn from other Vampires than it would be a bust."

"You could always do Hellsing." Luke put in, as he held up the other one he was holding.

"That one would be cool. Hard part would be that they all kill Vampires on sight and Alucard could probably kick my butt." You answered. Strangely they liked that part of that one.

"Teen wolf?" Sarah put up.

"No Vampires, but lots of werewolves to order around. Might work." You said. Granted some of the series they were putting out you only watched a few episodes of, so they could have more to them than what you were thinking. Which is why you were leaving it up to them. Between all of them, they should be able to pick a good one. Knowing your luck though, they would pick one that exposes clueless nature with romantic things.

"Lord of the Rings?" Isaac asked.

"That would be cool." You said to make him feel like he came up with a good one. But the others knew that one didn't have Vampires or Werewolves in it... and it had magic. In retrospect from the rest of the year, that might not be a good choice... then again, maybe going full Vampire mode and slaughtering thousands of enemies might be the outlet you needed.

They went on for a while, talking about each choice and the perks. Sometimes they would think about how fun it would be to see you beat up some annoying person in a series or help out some of their favorite heroes. They seemed to forget that their "heroes" might find you as a threat that you would have to fight. You were still far to the good meter. But you couldn't predict what they did on the others side. Like the Blade series, more so at the end, you could end up changing the realm all together. So they continued until they found one. They showed you and you opened a portal. They all said their goodbyes. Kelsey gave you a little kiss on the cheek. She felt guilty for not being at school with you and now not being able to hang with you during the summer. So you promised her to spend time with her when you got back. She didn't like you leaving any more. But understood you needed an outlet and a break from the things you were going through. Unlike her, you didn't have another Vampire to help you get through things. For that you needed the other realms.

So... what realm did you end up going to???
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Summer time...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content: Yes, I know how much we LOVE option chapters. So just pick on and move on.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Options tree 1

choices: James' group comes by and you have to "talk" with them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Really?" you asked, hoping that they would change their mind. They just had to pick a drama and romantic realm for you to go to.

"Oh come on. You'll have a blast, and to top it off... there is no magic or silver." Luke stated, not to into the first argument he put on. But knew that the no magic and silver option would make it better.

"Oh, if you get in the way of Edward and Belle than I'll kick your butt when you get home." Kelsey stated, spoken like a true fan. Although you had a feeling that if she were going instead of you, she would be the first to hit on Edward or one of the other "hot" boys that the girls screamed over. She was a teen after all, succubus aside.

"Right, like I need more reason to leave drama alone." you answered with a fake pout face on.

"Have fun!" Isaac said with a smile. He was getting older and saying things that were actually intelligent now. But still missed the hard parts of going. But the smile was appreciated

"Yes, have fun and come back." Mom agreed as she gave you a hug and kiss on the cheek. "I know this one won't really be a challenge for you, but that is the point. I just wanted you to be able to have a break from all the stuff going on around here. So make it a nice long vacation."

"Will do, love you Mom." You returned. Sure you loved the rest of your family. But she needed to hear it more than them. Unlike them, she was your Mother that just lost her husband. She needed all the "I love you" phrases as you and your siblings could push out. She returned the sentiment then you turned to Brad. "You sure the werewolves on the other side will be bound like over here?"

"Yes. The pact our kinds made with you isn't stopped by dimension. It translates to all of them and any that will be made in the future. You need not worry." Brad stated. You had stated that you didn't want to kill any werewolves on the other side. If you did, it would make you more likely to see the werewolves on this side as hostile. You didn't want to kill one on reflex and start a rift with them. "Although, their individual attitudes and personality quirks will still be open. While they have to obey you and not harm you, they may be able to verbally assault you if they want. In a sense this isn't that bad. Otherwise they would know you right away when they start talking with you. Unless I miss my guess, you want to be disguised as a human for a little bit right?"

"Indeed." you agreed with a smile. He smiled back. Regardless how old and smart he was, he was a Kitsune and wanted to please you. Like any animal, smart or not, he liked to please his master. Pride and all that. King would never admit it with others, but he liked it when you thanked him as well. "Alright, I'm off."

"Goodbye, have fun." They all said almost at the same time as you disappeared from view.

It was your first time traveling and doing this by yourself all the way through. So you were glad when the other end opened up and you stepped out into the well known town of Forks. Well for you anyway. You had just got done watching the whole series. Sure there was blind spots, but you got a hold of them quick enough. You didn't want to attract attention, so you severely restricted your scent and put a block up over aspects of yourself. You knew there were certain aspects that other people could detect. Specifically Vampires and Werewolves. So you made yourself a very convincing human. Not that you had anything to be afraid of in this realm. No magic and Silver wasn't a known weakness. Not to mention you could just walk into the sun to disprove any suspicions. But you didn't want to rock the boat too early either, relatively speaking. You walked around the town for a little bit before going to an real-estate agent. After a little hit and miss you were able to find a house in the forest that was far enough out of the werewolves and Vampire feeding areas. Well not really, because they unofficially owned it all. But a spot that was as good as you could get without drawing attention, or any more than you needed. As soon as you moved in you felt a few wolves come around and check you out from a distance. You almost told them to get lost. They didn't even let you hunt. So you had to go back in town and get an unrestricted hunting license. That was good enough for now. You just had to hunt them the human way, for now. Finally you enrolled in the school and made sure to be in the main story plot class. You just needed to keep an eye on Belle. The Vampires could take care of themselves. But SHE was always getting in trouble. So you thought it wise to watch her. Of course they wouldn't know about it. You could watch her from across town with a mark you snuck on her. With everything set, you just lived and observed.

"Hello there buddy." Said a police officer that had come by to make sure you were settled. aka Charlie Swan. Figures that it would be him.

"Hello sir." You answered back as you invited him and a man into your house.

"Damn you work quick. Last time I was out her you only had the framework up. It is almost all furnished at this point." He complimented.

"Thanks, I worked hard on it." you stated. You were glad they allowed you to live alone. Like they had a choice in the matter. "So what's with the visit this time?"

"Thanks," he started as you offered him a freshly brewed cup of coffee. It would look to suspicious if all you had was raw meat and blood around the house. So you gave what you could to other people and of course drained the blood for your own use. You had to be careful so the other nose sensitive people around wouldn't be able to smell it, along with the safe of hospital human blood that you kept in a safe and buried deep in the earth. You could just bring it up without any effort and it was way more secure than letting people see a huge safe and wonder what was inside it. For extra measure you ate regular food in front of them. It wasn't like you had to force yourself to eat normal food. You did it plenty at home. But you had loads of food at your home for you and others that came by. He accepted the cup and offered cookie. "This is Billy Black by the way."

"Hello son." he greeted with a hand out. He was in a wheel chair at the moment. You smiled and shook his hand.

"Pleasure to meet you sir," you responded then offered some other things before sitting down at the table with them, drinking some coffee and eating a bagel for good measure. Billy seemed to relax when he saw this. Yep, worked like a charm. "So what's up?"

"Well, you've heard about those animal attacks haven't you?" Charlie asked.

"Yes sir. I have been careful when hunting. Always keep an extra round or arrow to be sure." You answered and nodded to a wall where a hunting rifle and bow were held with any and all ammunition, including a few side arms that you had picked from your Blade days. They were low key enough to keep out in the open. Unless someone looked close, they seemed like ordinary, but impressive, handguns. "Can't be too safe."

"True. But this thing has already attacked a few grown adults already. I meant no disrespect son. Just checking on everyone, making sure you all are safe." He responded as Billy took a longer look at the weapons than back at you. He took a longer look at the bow. It was a good thing he didn't ask to see it. It was ordinary, except that the pounds were set at an inhuman difficult of pull. You wanted to make sure it could got through a Vampire. But this realm's Vampires had basically diamond skin. So it wouldn't really work. But perhaps the recoil would send them back.

"It is comforting that Forks has Officers like you that care so much. I am glad I moved here." You complimented to which he smiled. A well place compliment never hurt.

"Ha, I like that. I really should introduce you to my daughter." He joked and Billy smiled at his friend's joke.

"I think I already know her... that is... we are in the same class at school." You said in a way that made it seem you were agreeing and running with his joke, making him feel accomplished. In the back of your head you felt a few of the Vampires come by, see the police car, and leave. But you didn't let it show on your face. You had been keeping tabs on them so you knew what the story line was at that point. Also, you didn't want to confront them, so you had just enough interest to keep werewolves coming around. Kept them from attacking. Didn't want to kill them right away. Belle and Edward still had to bond with this whole thing, and that was a while off.

"Anyway, Billy also had a quick question for you." He stated than turned things over to him.

"Yeah, usually we don't want people hunting in the area and all that. We are ok with a few deer and what not, but the amount you are doing, is bit much. We are hoping you would tone it down. We know with that unlimited license you can hunt everything on your land. We were just hoping you would be willing to tone it down a bit. Maybe 2 or 3 a month?" Billy asked. Now you understood. Between you, the other vampires, and the werewolves it was getting a little too much to divvy up.

"Sure. I am sorry for taking too much." you answered.

"Thanks son. We appreciate it. You are a very nice young man." Billy responded with a happier attitude.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Twighlight.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You were getting in the swing of things. Belle didn't notice you much, although she did notice when they mentioned that you also "transferred" to that school. The only other person in the small rainy town that was new was not overlooked. But, compared to her, you didn't get a lot of attention. You might've had something to do with that, but not much. you couldn't use a lot of your abilities under threat of people finding out about you. Belle was just... well a hot girl. Sure you were hot to. Came with being a Vampire, and ripped. But you tried not to stand out. You knew that Edward would react if he couldn't read your mind. But you didn't really care. After all, you didn't smell nearly as good as Belle. Sure you put your scent at a human level, but not in the same league as Belle's. Even you had to admit, she was... mouth watering. So yeah, compared to her, you were almost invisible.

Currently you were doing some work on your roof. It was constantly raining, and when it wasn't it looked like it would rain. It really stunk that water was one of the only elements you couldn't control. Made it hard to do outside work on your house. It wasn't like other places you'd been to where you kept training equipment outside and worked out in the sun to get a better work out. You had to build a shed for that. But it wasn't all bad. Anyway, you were making a perch point, kind of like a small patio on the top point of your house. On the surface it was a complicated spot only big enough for 5 people with a small roof to keep rain out. But there was no walls, it was completely open to the elements with benches that could swivel and retract so you could stand or sit in any direction with minimal things in the way. People got to it by a ladder from inside the house. What you were doing was waterproofing the door so it didn't leek into the house. It was then that you caught a scent of the other Vampires. They were buzzing around for a while, but for some reason the werewolves were elsewhere and since you were at the peak of your house, your scent could carry for a while. You had made the spot with that in mind. Well it was supposed to be so you could catch scents while not looking like you were doing it. But it worked both ways. They knew you were there, and you knew they were there. You wondered what their play would be. You weren't scheduled in the movie. So would they try to feed on you, or move on? Your question was answered as they started getting closer, faster.

"Hello up there." Said the dark skinned one. You didn't care to remember his name when you were watching the movie. What, they only said his name like twice, so you didn't really pay attention. But he was the one that was the more sensible of the three. Maybe this was a game for them. But you tended to believe that they weren't stupid enough to attack you were your blood scent could travel to the wolves that they were avoiding. Which is why he was probably being so civil. Otherwise they probably would've bulldozed through your house to get at you. Another perk of your perch that you hadn't intended.

"Sorry, didn't see you there. I'll be right down." you answered with a smile as you waved. You went like a normal human as the three of them waited where they were. You could read that they couldn't believe how "easy" this was. You almost laughed as they were about to find out how true that was, for you that is. You moved like a normal human, so they could hear you in the house. Then came to the door with 3 hospital bags of blood. You closed the door and locked it. The walls and doors looked normal to the eye. But everything had a think layer of titanium reinforcing the structure. Even you would have a hard time getting in. They looked at you strange as the saw and smelled what you were holding as you crossed the yard to them. When you were in the front yard, sort of speak, you tossed them each one. "Took you long enough. Those are for your trouble."

"Strange, it seems like you already know why we are here." The dark skinned one said while the other two observed you, James most of all. He had more of a play hunt face on. They looked at the blood sacks then dropped them, James stepping on his. You looked at it and gave an annoyed face. "What?"

"It isn't the easiest thing in the world to get those without looking suspicious. Plus, now the whole area smells like human blood. Thanks a lot." You responded, again in an annoyed posture. "Really, would it have been that hard to just toss them back?"

"When we have a fresh source in front of us?" Victoria stated in a antagonistic seductive voice as they got closer.

"Yet you seem to miss the point," you sighed as you figured one of them would've figured it out by now. But they were driven by blood and you did smell like a human. Maybe you could play the Vampire hunter card. You had watched and fought with Blade enough to pull it off. Even with faster versions like them. Their diamond skin would make it harder, but you had a few tricks you could use.

"And what would that be?" James asked as they got within striking position of both you, as a human, and them. But they were more curious than thirsty at this point.

"Let's see. I know what you are, offer you human blood that I just happen to have laying around, and am not running away. You can hear my heart beat. Does it seem like I am bluffing?" You asked as you spurred the conversation. You could see their minds start working on it.

"You must have something on your side to help you." the dark skinned one said. You pushed for his name in your memory and found it; Laurent. "But is it the false assumption that the werewolves will be back by the time we are done, or something else?"

"Excellent question. How about I prove that I at least am competent and know who I am dealing with... Laurent, James, and Victoria. And you expect me to tell you if I have an edge before I use it? I am not that stupid. You make a move on me, and see what happens." you said, the first part was calm, the next was a clear challenge.

"Ok." James said then shot a hand forward. You saw it coming from a mile away. But you had to be careful. You didn't want them to know, of all people. You had to do this as a believable human. So you moved at a human speed as you fed his arm passed you and used his momentum and a kick to the leg to flip him. While in midair the other two attacked. You deflected their blows in directions that had them hit James in places that hit pressure points. Allowing you to pin him on his stomach with them a few feet away. As you settled you drew your gun and aimed it at a point at the back of the neck. Sure they had tough skin. But the concussion of the shot would hit nerves that would render him paralyzed if you shot. You made your move obvious so they knew you had just beat them.

"Wow, that was overly predictable. If I shoot right now, sure your skin will deflect the bullet, but from this distance it will paralyze you long enough for me to ignite your body on fire and kill you." you stated as he stopped trying to get up under that threat. "You idiots really think I would be stupid enough to come out to meet you without a way of leveling the odds in my favor. I am a well trained Vampire hunter and your three aren't even in my league. With all your speed and strength, you have way too many faults, arrogance for one. Now, should I shoot and kill all three of you, or would you like to clean up the mess you made with the blood and leave, while you still can?"

"You could be bluffing." Victoria stated to which you flicked your thumb and cocked the hammer on the gun, finger twitching on the trigger, ready to fire. "WAIT!!!"

The stand off lasted for a little bit as they looked to each other. You didn't use any amount of strength, just a steadfast gaze and steady hand to drive your point home. Perhaps they thought you would start straining and move a little bit to give them an edge if they waited long enough. But when you didn't they had to think of something else.

"Fine." James sputtered out.

"You break your word and I'll kill you." you stated and backed off, still having the gun trained on the spot as you backed up. When he got us and joined the others you still had the gun trained on him. "I do believe that the wolves will be back pretty soon. FYI"

"We wont forget this." James stated then raced off, the other two following closely behind as they heard howls coming closer.

"Huh, didn't even clean up. When they were out of range you had seconds to clean up the blood and the smell before the wolves were in range. By the time they came sniffing around you were back on your roof, working. They weren't confident enough to come into the open. "They better no forget."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: James' group comes by and you have to "...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Hey," came a voice you didn't think you would be addressed by. It was Belle who said it and sat down in front of you. You had taken extra car not to stand out. More so to be sure that she developed the correct feelings for Edward. But you supposed that time had came already. She was now in love with him. Unlike him, you could still read her mind.

"Hi?" you stated, not sure why she was talking with you.

"Sorry to just plop down by you, but I needed a break and they say you just moved here to. I haven't seen you make any friends. Why is that?" She asked. You didn't know why she was talking with you. Not that she was a bad person or anything. But you never thought of her as one to just strike up a conversation with someone like she was doing. Maybe she was drawn to greet you as the Vampire from another realm, wither she knew it or not.

"Well, I like being alone." you answered.

"No you don't." she stated then continued before you could say anything back. "Look, I usually like that kind of thing to. But even I got depressed if NO ONE came to talk to me. No one to share your life with. That has to be hallow."

"It can be a little draining at times." you agreed. "So you just came over because... you know what I am going through or something?"

"Kinda, yeah." she answered. She was rather clumsy with her hidden emotions. Even if you couldn't read her mind, you could read her body language. "Not that we are the same or anything. But you shouldn't be sitting here by yourself all the time, day after day."

"What are you suggesting?" you asked.

"Well how about you stop eating alone. Come sit with us." She suggested and gestured over to where she and Edward were sitting. At this point she had to have learned his little secret. Maybe that was part of why she was being so casual with you. Or maybe she just had an instinct with Vampires. You weren't sure about exposing yourself to the Cullens yet. What if you made them biased against you? Well she was offering, and by the way Edward was looking at you, he already noticed your unreadable mind.

"Are you sure it will be ok? I don't want to bud into your time with Edward." you stated.

"Honestly, he didn't really like the idea. He doesn't even eat lunch or anything." She started. The way she said the last bit made it obvious that she knew about him at this point. Then again, the movie didn't share every hour of every day with you. It was even possible that she suggested this whole thing because he said something about not being able to read your mind either. "But I can't just leave you over here."

"Alright. It appears you don't give up on things like this very easily. If you two need some time though. Just let me know. I don't want to get in the way." You agreed. You grabbed you lunch and headed over with her.

"Edward, this is Caleb." she introduced. Funny, you didn't tell her your name. You peeked into her mind and just saw that she remembered it from the teacher's role call in class. "Caleb, this is Edward."

"Good to meet you." you said as you stuck your hand out to shake. When he just looked at it you put it back down. You knew he wouldn't shake your hand, cold skin and all that. The point, for you, beyond being normally polite, was to show your flush hand. This would work in your favor as far as appearing normal. You sat down and took out your lunch. Nothing big, just a sandwich and chips with a milk bought at the cafeteria. You started eating politely. Edward seemed to be heavily observing you. You didn't give him anything to gawk at except a perfectly normal human... one that could repel his mind reading. "Thanks for the invite."

"Yeah, no problem." Edward stated.

"So, Caleb, where did you move from?" Belle asked.

"Wisconsin, you?" You asked.

"Arizona." She responded back.

"Huh, hot and cold. No offense, but it looks like I came from down there an you came from up north." you stated in a clear joke. You didn't want them to think you were making fun of her. That would be a bad rep to start with.

"Yeah, I've been getting that a lot." she said a little bashfully.

"I sure they mean well." Edward stated, wanting to get in on the conversation.

"They do." you and Belle said at the same time. You just looked at each other comically then laughed a little bit.

"So you live on your own?" Edward asked, Belle's attention was peaked at this new form of question.

"Yeah. My family couldn't follow me here. But they really wanted me to come. So they call every once in a while to make sure the school and stuff is ok. But they leave me be most of the time. I got a place right next to the reservation. Actually had a few of them from the Reservation come by. They were tracking that animal or whatever that was attacking people. You dad comes by to make sure I am ok to, Belle. He is a good guy, your Dad." You answered.

"Yeah, he is." She agreed. "So... what do you like to do?" She asked. It was like they were trying to find out things about you. You didn't mind.

"Well I was really into outside stuff. Working, athletics, hunting, and martial arts. The last one is more of a hobby than something I like doing. But it does come in handy." you answered.

"You mean like Karate and all that?" Belle asked.

"Sure, but more like mixed marital arts, but more formal." you answered.

"What if the guy is like insanely strong or fast. Does learning that stuff matter?" Edward asked. Perhaps a more pride based question.

"Sure it does. It doesn't matter how big, strong, or fast they are. They still weigh the same. Even if the guy could lift a truck, they still have weaknesses that martial arts can help find and exploit in a fight. I am not a master by any means. But I can hold my own well enough." you answered with a smile so that Belle didn't scold Edward for asking a more pointed question. They you all were interrupted by the school bell. "I guess that is our cue. Is it cool if I do this again, eat lunch with you guys?"

"Uh, sure. I said it would be right?" Belle answered.

"You did. I just wanted to make sure. See you both in class." You replied back then went off with a wave. You could hear them talk about you as you got out of range. I was good they didn't think you could hear them.

"Are you sure he is different?" Belle asked.

"Maybe not. I mean you can block me to, and you are a normal human." Edward returned. "But we should still try to get some answers out of him."

"I guess we did just invite him to sit with us indefinitely." Belle stated.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Talking with Belle

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You knew that the first movie wouldn't last much longer. You could either let things play out, or help when you could. Of course you wouldn't get in the way of Edward and Belle. That was basically the constant drama in this whole thing. But as far as communicating with the other vampires, you weren't sure if you should wait or bring it up. There wasn't really any way of saying it without them telling you to leave. After all, once they knew, you would be stuck with whatever they decided. Maybe it would be better if you save them from something. So you waited for when James was hunting Belle. It was pain staking, but they didn't mess with you anymore. Laurent actually came by and apologized, which you weren't ready for. But either way, you were watching them in full vampire hunter gear. You knew that traditional silver bullets wouldn't work. So you loaded them with explosive rounds and made sure to bring the sword. Just in case of situations like this, you made a very strong sword, that could definitely cut through these Vampires and then some. So with everything set you headed out.

You had kept pretty good relations with both Edward and Belle through the "friends" title at school. Even if all they were doing was gathering information. It was impossible to talk all the time without having some genuine feelings of friendship. You made sure not to tread on any Belle issues that would anger Edward. You also kept a good relation with some of the tribes people in the reservation. Even Jacob came around. Mainly because you both had a level of friendship with Belle. It wasn't much, but you were able to get him comfortable around you... well as comfortable as a few meetings could get you, and most of them were with his dad. Either way, you were on good terms and ready to intervene as a Vampire hunter, later as a Vampire, when they were ready to talk to you about it.

You followed Belle as she left the hotel and went to go meet James to save her mother that James had for the lure to his trap. Though, you knew, he never had her to begin with. You hid in the darkest corner with the best view and watched as things unfolded. You watched as Edward got there and started fighting. But when it got to the point where James was about to bite her in the arm, you weren't going to let that happen. So from one side of the room you shot a round and hit him smack in the forehead. The explosive round went off and pushed him back with a grunt. They all looked to see you as you came into the light, gun trained on his head.

"Didn't I tell you to not do that?" You stated then let loose your fully automatic pistol. He smiled as he thought they wouldn't be much effect and just let them come as he bent down to get at Belle again. But that was his mistake as the explosive rounds impacted and made him go flying across the room and into the wall. Normally a vampire of their type would be strong enough to resist it after a few hits. But you aimed at him so he was off the ground and so each one sent him flying, without the ground to stabilize himself. Belle looked at the action then back at you in shock as you got closer. Not firing anymore, but still having both of your guns trained at where James had landed. Edward rushed over to her, not sure if he should thank or attack you. "Hey guys. Funny the people you run into out here isn't it?"

"Caleb? W-what are you doing here?" Belle asked as you stopped by them, Edward still highly defensive but trying to hold Belle. That was something you didn't get. He had to sense James was still able to attack and he lowers his guard. Stupid boy, and he was older than you, much older. You responded first with a sigh as you holstered your guns.

"Gee, tail you and blast a vampire in the face to keep him from biting you and that is the thanks I get." you said comically with a smile.

"You were following me?" She asked.

"Duh. That guy isn't as nearly good as he thinks he is, and you always seem to be hip deep in trouble." You said, again comically then snapped your head to an approaching James. Edward hissed at him, protectively holding Belle. "I got this."

"Do you even know what you are dealing with?" Edward countered.

"I'll take that as a dumb question. No, I got no idea. I just happen to have fully automatic pistols loaded with explosive rounds and walked into a room full of vampires by mistake." you answered sarcastically.

"Explosive rounds, is that what you used?" James asked as he faced you. You had moved a little forward so not to get Belle and Edward involved with your fight.

"Yep. I know perfectly well that normal bullets don't do more than tickle you guys. So, I packed a something with a little more kick. It worked quite well to separate you from Belle. But to finish you, it requires something a little more lethal," you answered. To that you pulled your sword from your back sheath. Katana in shape and design with a little Vampire help in its construction. You stood in a ready stance facing him.

"Are you crazy?" He asked as he started to move closer.

"Come and find out. Or are you afraid of the weak human? Here, I'll make it easier for you." You stated then cut yourself and threw some blood at him.

It just missed and went onto the floor. But it was enough to get him excited. By this time, the other Vampires just got there. But it was too late to stop him from bolting toward you with his hand ready to enclose around your neck. You still moved at a human speed, and he didn't dodge when you swung at him. Granted, a normal sword would've snapped like a twig. But it wasn't, so when you made contact you sliced him completely in half. He split and laid on the ground, in shock of what just happened. One moment he was attacking a human, and next he was in two pieces. You went over to him and flipped him over. You threw a lighter that Blade helped you make at his lower half. Like the one he used in the first movie of the Blade series. His legs erupted his lower half. you then looked at him with your sword pointed at his throat.

"Made the same mistake as before. You want to know what your big fault is? You Vampires are too arrogant. How could a little human defeat you. That sword will snap in two. Well, evidence to you in two pieces, you aren't that good. Your arrogance killed you, I was just the tool." you stated and made a slash as he tried to get at you, cutting his arms off and head in one slice. Then you started walking over to a very stunned group of vampires. Casually tossing another lighter over your shoulder that made James' upper half pieces burst into flames as well. You flicked your sword to get any gunk off of it then sheathed it. You didn't stop until you were directly in front of Belle, the rest were standing over Edward as he held her. "I assume you are the good guys right?"

"Uh... yeah, I guess." Said Alice as the others were to stunned to do more than stare at you.

"That is good to hear. Sorry to hog the fight. Didn't think you all would mind. But I didn't leave any of the fun for you guys." you said with a smile but the last bit with a slightly worried look. You didn't know if they wanted some retribution for what he did.

"No, that was... amazing, for a human." Carlisle answered as he gained his composure and smiled like he usually did.

"Well if you liked that, you are going to love this," you stated then knelt down and looked at Belle. "With your permission?"

"What are you going to do?" Edward demanded for her, he was still a bit protective, understandably so. Adding the whole drama angle and he was like a powder keg ready to blow.

"Nothing bad, I promise." you assured. "If I wanted to do her harm, I could've just let him bite her, or shot her instead of him."

"Go ahead." She said to which you smiled a little then reached down to her broken and bleeding leg. She winced as you put a hand on the skin.

"This may sting a little, but only for a second." you warned. She nodded then you got to work. They watched in stunned silence as she winced while her bone mended and her wounds started to heal like nothing had happened. You did it slowly so they had time to observe. Otherwise you would be plagued with even more questions. When you were done you stood and backed up a little to give her room. "Sorry, nothing I can do about the blood loss, stains, and ruined clothes."

"How did you...?" Edward started before helping Belle to her feet. She still had to deal with the blood loss. But at least she wasn't in any pain.

"Maybe later. That took a bit out of me. I would like to get home and get a good rest before divulging in a game of 20 questions." You suggested then looked at Belle. "Plus you look like you are about to fall asleep. Blood loss can be a pain can't it?"

"Yeah." she answered, not sure what to say after that.

"Well, do you need a ride home?" Carlisle asked as the others tried to coupe with the whole thing.

"That would be nice." you answered. You had shown them enough to get their feet wet, but weren't sure about showing them more. So you followed him as he led the way. You read that they at least accepted that their questions would come and be answered later. That was good enough for now.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Meeting more of the Cullens.

choices: Prom, you are forced to go.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
They took you back to their house instead. You were too tired to argue. While you didn't use a lot of power, you were running kind of low to begin with. You had kept it down so that it was easier to seal your powers and scent. But now it was getting a little tiring. So you allowed them to drive you to their place and slept on their couch for a time. It felt weird, but you felt safe there. Usually you didn't feel like that with strangers.

"Breakfast!" exclaimed Alice as she brought in an omelet and set it on a table that was next to the couch you were waking from. In your sleepy state you accepted out of habit.

"Thanks." you said and ate the egg dish. You were surprised at the taste. It was... rather good. "Mmm.... those were great, thank you very much. Didn't know you all could cook like that."

"We learned a few things over our years. Between all of us, we were able to make one." Carlisle said. You glanced around for a moment and he guessed what or who you were looking for. "Belle went home. She needed to deal with some things with her Father."

"Yeah, I guess she does." you sighed as you placed the plate on the table and sat back.

"That was rather amazing what you did." Edward stated as they sat to talk with you. Jasper was a bit on edge, like he usually was.

"Hmm?" You asked, not sure if he meant your fight or healing Belle.

"We've never met a human with such abilities. How did you attain them?" Rosalie asked, more forcibly.

"Neither have I." you said after a little pause. They looked at you in a strange manner. "While everything I did was well within a human's abilities, if they train, I myself am not human."

"Uh... you smell human." Emmette said bluntly.

"What about now?" You asked as you let go your Vampire scent. You saw them react but knew that your scent was different to any of the Realm's vampire scents.

"What are you?" Jasper asked, now gazing at you with rapt attention.

"What do you think?" You asked rhetorically. They were still not getting it, so you reached into your attached canteen and unscrewed the cap. They could definitely smell the blood and you chugged the whole thing in 4 seconds flat, licking some that escaped. "Ah... much better. Haven't drank anything for... 4 months."

"This can't be." Rosalie said in shocked awe.

"How is this possible?" Edward asked.

"What? The drinking blood part. Real simple, in the mouth and down to the stomach. Why, it works different for you?" You joked. It took a moment to catch before Alice burst out laughing. They seemed to join in a little bit as the tension started to lift. You guessed that if Alice didn't see anything in the future for them to worry about, then they tended to relax. So getting on her good side was evidently a must have.

"You really one of us, a vampire that it?" asked Esme.

"Yep. Got me there. But also a little different, as you probably guessed by this point. To start, I have a tan." You answered casually.

"Uh... yeah, how do you manage that?" Emmette asked.

"Easy, sit out in the sun for a few hours then there you go." you answered.

"You are hilarious, a total riot." He said back.

"I try. Look, no offense, but you aren't going to understand most of what I can and can't do. You'll just have to trust me on that. Also trust that I am here to help and not to cause that much trouble." You said back.

"Try us, we might surprise you." Carlisle responded as they all sat back down from the shocked stances they were just in. You guessed that being vampires lessened the shock a bit. A couple hundred years under their belt probably also helped.

"Ok, you asked. Here's a few; I can walk in daylight with no visible effects, I can fly, I can bite people and not turn them... uh more accurately I CAN'T turn them even if I wanted to, I have healing saliva to help heal feeding holes, retractable fangs,... uh, should I continue?" You asked as you saw them try to take in what you were saying.

"Retractable fangs?" Alice asked.

"You can fly?" Emmette asked almost right on top of Alice's question.

"You are incapable of turning people?" Carlisle asked a second after them.

You showed your fangs then retracted them to answer the first question, then floated a little before settling on the couch again. "Now to answer the other question. That is correct. My bite is different. It actually feels good. Good enough for the prey to want me to drink them dry if prolonged, but I wouldn't be able to leave teeth marks or turn them, even if I wanted to, which I don't. Downside is that I have to drink actual blood. No synthetic stuff. But I can also drink from animals and stuff."

"It feels good?" Rosalie asked with obvious doubt. You just held out your hand. "What?"

"I can drink from vampires to. You want to see what it feels like, I can show you. Your diamond like skin may be a bit tougher than I am used to, but not the hardest thing I've bit through." you offered. She retracted then looked around then thought about it for a second before giving you her wrist. You slowly brought it up, grew your fangs, and dug in. Her head threw back with ecstasy and immediately pushed your head into her arm. But you let go and force past her grip. She looked like she was going to overdose on blushing as he body dealt with your bite. Her white skin turned a shade of red in parts. The rest of them didn't know how to react. "Told you so."

"That was... it was..." she stuttered out before wiping some blood away from her arm. They didn't have much, if at all. But you could suck up other things all the same. You didn't have to. The sensory projection was the same, so she still felt it all the same.

"Jeepers, you react worse than humans do." you almost sulked.

"You feed on humans?" Carlisle asked then looked to Rosalie again. "She is going to be ok right?"

"She will be fine. My bite stimulates all the pleasure receptors in the body. The longer I bite, the more they want me to continue. You saw how she held me to continue. As far as hunting is concerned, it is to help the blood flow go faster and cooperation of the prey, animal or person. As for feeding on humans, only if they are truly willing. I NEVER force it. Since I can't turn them and there are no scars, the only downside is a lack of blood." you answered.

"Well I am not sure what to do about you." Carlisle said to which it was your turn to give a confused look. "You seem safe enough to have around, if not very useful. Having you on our side would be a good thing, both as allies and friends. Problem is that we have a treaty with the..."

"Werewolves right?" you finished for him. They looked at you as if to ask how you knew. "Not that hard do figure out, and even easier to smell them. They don't know about me yet. For the near future I can just pass as a human. Already had a few of them over and they haven't suspected anything. As for later, when I introduce myself, that wont be a problem."

"How so?" Carlisle asked.

"Let's just say I have an understanding with a VERY powerful k-9 that keeps me safe from any and all dog like creatures, mythical or not, including werewolves. I can't really say more, yet. But end result, they won't be a problem for me." You answered casually.

"You are right." Alice said then paused before finishing. "You don't make any sense."

They smiled and laughed. Conversations started and finished about them and you. You refrained from letting them know their realm and its relation to you. But you were free to talk about other things. They were particularly entertained when you told them about Kelsey, Eve, and Drade. You sidestepped the magic topic though. No reason to bring it up if there wasn't any here. That and this was suppose to be vacation for you. Away from all that.
