You are asked to do something you don't like.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"No kidding, you can really do that?" Belle asked as you, her, and Edward walked through the woods. It was her birthday and was really not liking all the attention. Since you had a little more insight into what was going on, you understood what was bothering her. But you just materialized a protection disc for her. You made it with a considerable amount of fire energy in it. It turned the otherwise clear diamond into a flame designed ruby in the shape of a silver dollar in size.

"Yeah, all you do when a hostile vampire grabs you is stick that on their skin and want them dead. They will burst into ashes." You answered to which she fingered it. "So if Edward ever gets on your nerves..."

"Ah, don't even joke about that!" She exclaimed but knew you were joking, along with Edward. She slugged you in the shoulder.

"Ow, careful, I'm fragile." You joked.

"Careful, I might think you are hitting on my girl." Edward chimed in.

"Yeah, like that is fair. Even if daffy duck came over here and started whacking you with his mallet, you'd still be first on her list. Eternal love and all that." you said back. They both seemed to like that. You all went on until you all saw a wolf, not one of the werewolf packs. Both of them stopped. "Don't worry, he's not here to harm us and not anything we should worry about."

"Yeah, speak for yourself tan boy" Edward stated.

"Yeah, it isn't like I can tell him to heel or anything" Belle added.

"You want to?" You asked as the wolf rose its head and looked at you 3. It growled at Edward.

"Huh?" She asked.

"One of the things I control is ALL k-9 like animals. There are some really cool mythical ones out there. See watch." you answered then whistled a short burst, kneeling down to call the wolf over. It heard you and happily came over without question. Both Belle and Edward shrunk back a little as it came back. Edward wasn't scared, he just didn't want to start something with the werewolves. Smart, but this was obviously not one of them. The wolf was a completely white one and really quite beautiful. It came right next to you and leaned into you to give it some attention. "Good girl. See, no problem."

"Is there anything you can't do?" Belle asked as she kept her distance. You saw that they weren't going to get anywhere near the wolf, so you gave it a few pats then sent it on its way.

"Sure, loads of stuff. For starters, I can't do squat with water. You already know I can't turn anyone. I may have perks, but there is downsides to." You answered as you rid yourself of the dog scent. "The impressive one here is you Belle."

"Me?" She almost coughed out, obviously not believing it.

"Yeah. You are surrounded by all of us and rather than judge us, you just accept us. You got to be the most hospitable person I know... well other than my mother. Anyway, not a lot of humans say, "Yeah, that guy can suck all my blood out. I should hang around with him." You are one in a million Belle." you stated as you walked over to her.

"Yeah, but even I will wither away." She said, obviously still pushing the whole turning her thing.

"Are you really worried about that right now?" You got a few years before you need to worry about such things. But I'll make you a deal. I may not be able to turn you. But if you get to the age of... say 25, I will use my power to stop you from ageing. How does that sound?" You asked. This offer caught them both off guard.

"What! You can really do that?" Belle asked.

"Sure. I could turn you 80 years old right now if you wanted. Personally I think you got a little more filling out before you should hit he stop button. A few more inches taller and other features would do you some good. That and if they end up turning you when you look that much older than Edward, you get to pull little boy jokes on him." You answered in a casual manner, ending in a joke to smooth things over.

"So you could just keep her from aging? There is no reason to turn her if that is the case." Edward stated.

"No, I can keep her from LOOKING older. She will still get older. Regardless of how she looks, sapient species can only live so long. Her mind will start to go and there is nothing I can do about it. She would be an old woman in a young woman's shell. That and I won't be around forever. No, the only way to have Belle stick around for more than... say 100 years is to turn her to something that lives longer than that, Vampires being one." you answered. "I just offered so that her aesthetic appearance doesn't go further than she wants."

"Well, thanks. I probably will take you up on that offer one day." Belle said as she thought about it.

"But hey, the point of that little offer was to keep you from worrying. Today is your special day. So have fun." You interrupted.

"That's right. We have to be at the house in a little bit. Caleb, do you mind taking us to the car?" Edward agreed, latching onto the Belle subject, and making her happy the way she is. With that you just held out your hand. They had been through your teleporting a few times and knew just to hold your hand. They did so, in a second they were back to their cars.

"That is never going to get old." Belle gasped. You smiled at the compliment as they took their hands back. You all made your ways to the house where Belle's part was happening. It was a good time, until Belle cut herself, making a few things happen in quick succession, ending in belle being thrown out of the way and caught by you.

"You alright?" you asked.

"Yeah, thanks for catching me." She replied as Jasper was taken out of the room... or house to be more accurate. "Well, maybe you could stop this cut from bleeding?"

"Sure." you responded then licked it. She retracted her finger as if fearful. "Sorry, was quicker that way. No reason to waste energy on the healing aura if a simple lick could do the trick."

"Yeah, sorry." She said as you two separated. "Guess it is just habit with everyone else."

"Just try to keep her blood outside of your body." Edward almost commanded.

"Hey, you know I would never harm her." you battled back.

"Yeah, I'm sure." Edward responded then led Belle away. You looked after them then looked at the only other person remaining in the room. "What I do this time?"

"He is just a bit touchy. We all know how good she smells. Tasting her blood is like kissing her, to him at least." Carlisle explained.

"Why does things have to be so drama filled?" You asked out loud as you rubbed your head.

"Just the way things are. But it was good that you were there to catch her. You are really great to have around." He responded back then went on to console the others. You just plopped into a chair, utterly confused. You knew this realm was full of drama, but come on...
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Next movie.

choices: She just wants to talk to a... not normal person.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Did you really have to destroy her like that?" You asked as the Cullens came to your home to talk with you about leaving Forks. He had just told you about what he just did to Belle. Of course you knew what he actually said from the movie.

"I am protecting her, from us, and those after us." Edward stated.

"Yeah, like that will work." you said sarcastically.

"What do you mean?" Carlisle asked.

"First off, destroying her mentally is just the same as doing it physically. There were loads of better ways to say it and you know it. Second, if they really wanted to hurt you, they wouldn't attack your group in blind rage. If I were doing it, and I was as weak as they are, I would attack Belle so you notice, then kill you when you go off to morn in your own way. That would destroy you and get revenge at the same time. They might even get lucky and you'd take your own life. As in love as you two are." you explained.

"You saying leaving is a bad idea?" Emmette asked.

"It is up to you. Not a horrible idea, just the way he handled it could've been better. As for the age excuse, that is a cop out and you know it. But I won't float around this with you guys. If you think the best way is to leave, then do it. I'll stick around here and protect her like I have been. I probably should go retrieve her from the forest. Knowing her, she probably ran after you and fell over in a drama filled hysteria." You answered.

"So you are going to stay here?" Carlisle asked.

"Yep. I moved here for a reason. I'm not about to just leave. Plus, I still have to introduce myself to the werewolves. I'll probably do that while you all are gone." You answered in a tone that indicated that they shouldn't press it any further, cause you weren't going to budge. They had already said their peace on you conversing with the werewolves. But you stood firm and told them to back off when they got heated... except Carlisle. Although reserved, he was more ok with it than the others.

"And you'll not go after her?" Edward asked. You knew he meant romantically speaking, not for her blood, which you knew not to touch all to well.

"I won't have to." you answered and he looked at you intensely. "Pardon the aesthetic observation, but she is pretty good looking and you know it. She is in high school and is friends with Jacob, a pretty good looking guy as well. You think so to, or you wouldn't have reacted when they are just talking. So, you really think that she will have a hard time finding someone else to keep her company. You have my word that I will not "pursue her" and I will protect her from harm... well the lethal kind anyway. But as for her love life, that I stay clear of."

"Fine, but what are you talking about "lethal kind"?" He asked, catching that part and knowing you were right about the other parts... but not wanting to dwell on or admit to it.

"Well everyone has to learn things for themselves. That and if someone else is protecting her and will save her from something, I'll let them. As long as she isn't going to die or lose a limb, I'll back off a little. She needs to live her life, not a sheltered version of it." you answered.

"We thank you for that." Carlisle budded in, knowing that Edward was getting worked up. He wanted things HIS way. The fact that he could push his way on you wasn't a good feeling for him. Drama, what are you going to do?

"Of course. She's a friend to all of us. I wouldn't want anything happening to her any more than any of you. Still wouldn't hurt for you, Alice, to keep an eye on things. With all my abilities, yours isn't one of them." You replied.

"No offense, but I was going to do that anyway." She replied, nervously playing with her fingers. "I worry about her."

"We all do." Edward added in, needing to get his little say in the whole thing.

"Very well. Now, I should probably go find Belle. Her father probably already called a search party for her. Hope you all have a wonderful trip, and be safe." you ended, then waved as you walked off. They were needing to go as well. They waved back and off you were to find Belle.

It didn't take you long as you had your glyph on her and so you just teleported to her. She was unconscious and just lying there, crying in her sleep. You carefully picked her up and headed to her house. The way you figured, it didn't really matter if they found her or you did. So you sped back, avoiding the werewolves easily and slowing down near her house so the wolves observing didn't get suspicious. You pretended like you didn't see them as you carried her. Finally you broke out right where they would've. You didn't even have to say anything, as they saw you coming and carrying her.

"Belle!" Mr. Swan exclaimed as he reached for her and you passed her off.

"She's alright, just unconscious." You reported.

"Where did you find her?" Jacob asked as Mr. Swan nodded his thanks and immediately started carrying her inside. You didn't mind, he was rather worried, and her father. You wouldn't fault him for seeing to his own daughter rather than thanking you properly. Besides, a thought and a head nod was all you really needed.

"Well, you know I go running in the woods. I found her at the end of my run path. Don't know why she was out there, but she was already out cold. The spot was just as far from here as it was from my place, so I just brought her here. Didn't know she was gone long enough to warrant this kind of search party though." You answered as you glanced around him to look at the people that had gathered. "You know she does go out in the woods often? Not like she didn't know where she was going."

"Then how did she end up alone and knocked out?" Jake asked sarcastically.

"Ok big guy. I didn't mean anything by it. I was just saying that her being in the woods for a day isn't abnormal. But you are right, something must've happened to her. Not many scratches on her, so not attacked. Maybe mental. We wont know till she talks about it." You relented, making him feel like he had thought of it. He did, kind of.

"Yeah..." he ended with, looking into the woods at the wolves. Most couldn't see them, so you didn't react. But you knew he was looking at them. You thought about waiting for him to emerge before saying anything to them about you. But that was for later. For now, it was Belle management time.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You stay in forks when the Cullens leave.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
The normal plot line must've had a stronger pull than you thought it did. You were a pretty big change to the whole thing. Having a Vampire she could talk to should've helped. But she never accepted even your glance. She just wanted to be alone. That and, you were right, Edward had messed with her pretty good. It didn't help that she was the other side to the drama. But you had come up with all these. excuses why you were still there, why he left. You couldn't just tell her that he was coming back, eventually. Because if you did, then she wouldn't do all those dangerous things, and Edward wouldn't figure out he had to come back in the end. Not to mention she wouldn't have figured out Jake's little secret. You still didn't know when you were going to talk with Jake and his people. Just showing up would be possible, but not very polite. Then again, being so deep in their territory was not polite either. Either way, she progressed like she did in the movie. She stayed away from you as she hung out with Jake and did the Bike thing. She went on her little date with him. You were still watching her. But with Jake and the wolves around, there was no way to do it from location. You had to use the glyph as a radar of sorts. All things considered, you weren't expecting to have her coming to your house one night. You went to the knocking door, opened it to find Belle standing there.

"Hi," she said, looking a little guilty.

"Hey, didn't think you wanted to hang with me." You replied, but not in an angered tone, more a questioning one. She looked away then back, as if she thought of something and decided to just stick it out. "I'm not going to read your mind Belle. So, you want to come in and talk about it?"

"Yeah," she said to which you ushered her in and shut the door. You led her to your sitting room. She knew her way around your house, from being there with Edward a few times. She sat on your couch and you sat next to her. "You know Jake right?"

"Yeah. He and his dad come over every once in a blue moon. Usually to check on me or address something I did wrong on near their preserve and "on their land", stuff like that. Jacob is a cool guy, if a little infatuated with you." You answered.

"Well, me and him were hanging out for a while. Just keeping my mind off of... Edward and all that. The reason I didn't come by you was... well because you being a... like him. It was just too much of a reminder." She stuttered around.

"I know. I wasn't going to push you," you replied back. "So, you saying the "were" word in there means that Jake ditched you to?"

"How did you know that?" She asked. You almost forgot how sensitive she was about people prying, despite being the one who pries the most.

"Remember that glyph I have on you? Well, I can use it as a radar. I still feel like keeping an eye on you. But watching you directly was definitely to intrusive. I can't see everything like I would if I was there. But I still can sense other people around you and all that." you answered.

"Ok, I guess that makes sense. Well as much sense as any of the other things you do." she joked which brought a smirk to your lips. "What is with me and hanging out with guys that leave me with the connection that they SHOULDN'T ever see me again? He said we shouldn't be friends. Same thing, more or less, that Edward said."

"Yeah, I don't touch that drama stuff. But you are right. You do have a knack for that kind of thing. You also have a knack for meeting non-human friends. Do you have a troll at home that I don't know about or something?" You joked back, looking under her coat comically, as if looking for a pixy or something. She whacked your hand away with a little laugh.

For a little bit you just let her vent on you. You offered to help calm her down. But she said she needed to deal with this. You were glad she said that. Even though you could use your powers on her. It was kind of like doing it on Dracula, from Blade's realm. It was insanely hard compared to others. You had to assume it was her shield ability. Yet another ability that you couldn't do to save your life. But, like the other abilities around here, it wasn't able to hamper you to an amount that qualified as effecting you. Edward's mind read couldn't get you either. You wondered about the other Vampire's abilities. But you would find that out soon enough. For now it was about her. She vented about Edward, her letters to Alice, Jacob, her Father, her being alone, her treatment of you, other people's treatment of her, Her age... again, and a few more drama filled topics. Eventually she told you about being able to see Edward when she was in danger. That is when she pulled something on you.

"Hey, could you do me a favor?" She asked.

"Depends what the favor is." you answered back. Since it came right on the heels of being in danger, you didn't like where this was going.

"Could you drink from me?" She asked.

"No." you said rather bluntly, that of which caught her off guard a bit. Even if you said something serious you had allways spoke with a gentle or otherwise positive tone and feel. That answer didn't have that.

"Why not?" She asked, obviously wanting you to get to a scenario that she could see Edward again.

"For one, I promised both you and Edward I wouldn't. Even if he isn't here, I keep my promises. Second, he knows I wouldn't harm you. So your little plan wouldn't work, because you wouldn't be in danger. Third, I don't like being used as a peep window to see someone else. If you want to be around me, please at least act like it." you answered and requested. She thought on your answer before responding. Her little idea not working out for her. "If it makes you feel any better. I gave Edward a lecture when they came to get me."

"They came fore you?" She asked.

"Yeah. They thought that having ANY vampires around would put you in danger. But I can cover my scent rather well. So their arguments were hallow. Carlisle seemed to understand. In the end that was enough." You responded back.

"Well then, that does make me feel better. At least someone gave him a tongue lashing." She said after thinking on it for a little bit. "Thanks for talking with me... and not sucking my blood too."

"No problem. Now, I know you have a few ideas about how to get a rush. Just promise me you will TRY to be careful?" You more requested then asked.

"I will try. But the point of it isn't to be completely safe." she agreed.

"No worries. Not like I would let you die anyway." You said back.

"Aw... you like me that much?" She teased.

"Yeah, yeah. Keep it up vampire girl." You teased back. She whacked you for the shot while smiling a little bit. You knew that she wanted to become a Vampire. So calling her one was just a comical jest on your part. You both hoped she was better, and hoped you hadn't screwed up the story line that much. But looking at how the story seemed to self fix itself all the time, you doubted you could put that much of a dent in it, unless you really put some effort into it.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: She just wants to talk to a... not normal person.

choices: Continue before meeting up with the others.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You didn't really know when you were going to talk with the werewolves, still. But fate rarely falls upon us at the moment of our choosing. You were observing Belle as she went to go talk to Jake after his little visit in her room. You were tailing her after that. Which was harder to do and not have the wolves notice you. She knocked on their door and Mr. Black came to answer her. Typical Belle, she barged in wither she was allowed or not. She must have a homing device for super powered secrets. She got pissed about the whole Sam pack thing. But she was blind to what was right in front of her as she confronted Sam and the others. She was handling it just like you knew and saw she would. But when she punched one in the face and he transformed, despite Sam's order to calm down, it caught your attention. She began running and Jake appeared, facing him off. Belle was there just watching in horror. You were hesitant, but decided to bud in. A quick teleport and you were right next to Belle.

"ENOUGH! Be silent." you commanded. There was definitely a difference between when you spoke to k-9 type things and when you were ordering them. This was the latter. They all cringed as they had no choice than to obey you. You stared them down, and gave a glance to Jake then helped Belle to her feet. "You alright?"

"Yeah..." she started then looked over at the wolves, some transformed, some not. "How did you...?"

"I told you already, remember?" You asked as you stimulated her memory in the right direction.

"Them to?" she asked.

"ALL means ALL. Don't worry, I've been trying to figure out a time to meet with them anyway. I did say I'd protect you right?" You assured and answered and brushed some hair out of her face. "I got to go talk to them now. They give you any trouble, let me know."

With her nod you separated from her and went over to them and went in front of Sam, then looked at Jake more directly, then back.

"Who are you?" Sam more demanded then asked.

"This conversation is better had without such an audience. You and Jake should do." you suggested. He huffed for a few breaths then ordered the others to take Belle somewhere else. You nodded to her to go. You needed to speak with them. When the three of you were alone, and Jake was back to human form... with some shorts on, you continued. "My name is Caleb. I do believe you guys have been watching my place for a while."

"Fair enough, now how are you able to command us, and appear out of thin air. I am the Alpha here, not you." Sam asked forcibly. He obviously didn't like his authority being challenged by anything or anyone.

"I was given the authority and protection by King, an Amarok and ruler of all k-9 races. He said ALL would be effected, wither they knew him and me or not. Guess he was right. As for how I appeared, I teleported to Belle's side when she was in danger." You answered.

"Teleporting?" Jacob asked skeptically.

You teleported behind them to prove it. "Yeah, teleporting."

"How do you do that?" Sam asked, spinning around to face you.

"I can do a lot of things. Then next part will get you pretty defensive, so just be cool alright?" You warned. He took a breath, as did Jacob, then nodded in that way he usually addressed other people "lower" than he was. "I am a Vampire."

"You are what?!" He recoiled as you said it.

"A Vampire. You know, blood sucker, long teeth, red eyes, and all that. Jeepers, I though you guys were suppose to have good hearing." You joked back. It helped a little, but not so much with Sam.

"You stand there rather confident, seeing as what you just admitted to, and knowing what we do to the vampires that aren't Cullens around here." Jacob stated, a noticeable hostile tone in his voice.

"Right, like you guys could do anything against me anyway. Even if you could, King had decreed that NO k-9 like creature will harm me and will obey me regardless on their feelings on the matter. I could kill you and order you to just take it if I wished. But that is not why I am here. I am here to introduce myself. Granted I planned to do it in a more peaceful manner, but I can't allow Belle to be harmed." You answered back. They weren't too keen on the whole supremacy thing. But they seemed to gauge and understand it, for now at least.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Wolf meeting.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"So... no turning?" Jacob asked as you all went to where Belle and the others were. You had just got done telling them your story. They particularly liked the Vampire hunter part.

"Nope, even if I wanted to I physically can't." you answered with a shrug.

"But you still hang with the Cullens?" Asked Sam.

"Well yeah. They are one of very few vampires in this realm that are halfway decent, particularly Carisle. He seams very sensible. He would have to be, to keep his head working at a hospital. Plus, no need to burn bridges." you answered him.

It was at that moment that you all reached the door where everyone else was. They looked you over when you entered, last. Belle was still standing as she was talking with them. But they all stood when you entered the room.

"Oh come on, I don't smell that bad, do I?" You asked, as you knew this realm's vampires did smell a little bit worse than normal ones. Kind of like a rank version of sterile, it that was even possible.

"Compared to, THEM, you smell amazing. But your Vampire scent still sets off some alarms." Sam informed as he hugged Emily. You looked at her, then at her scar. "She doesn't like when people do that."

"My apologies. I was just... I don't suppose you would want me to... heal that, or is it to early to suggest?" You asked. All of their jaws seamed to drop. "I mean I would understand if you don't want a Vampire doing anything to your all. I was just offering. Being me may be complicated, but it has its advantages."

"Y-you could?" Asked one of the others in the room. They had only heard part of your story, but even Sam who had heard it all was in shock at this news.

"Sure. Shouldn't be too hard. Of all the things to heal, skin is by far the easiest." you answered with a smile, trying to smooth things over.

"Caleb, are you sure you should've suggested that?" Belle asked, sensing the difference of moods in the room. This whole werewolf thing was new to her, so she wasn't sure if this change was good or bad.

"Not sure, to be honest. I was just trying to be nice, but they might've not appreciated a Vampire wanting to alter someone they know and care for, even if it is just healing." You answered softly to her, knowing full well that they could hear you, but said it softly enough so they thought you didn't know.

"Will it really work?" Sam asked, after talking with Emily.

"Yeah, watch." you answered as you pointed to your own face and distorted it worse than her scars then back to your normal look. "It feels a little weird, but it is really easy."

"If you can help, would appreciate it." Emily said, after Sam gave her a nod. She walked over to you with Sam and was shaking a little as you rose your finger up to her face.

"Don't worry, It wont hurt at all. Just feel a little weird. Like an ant crawling on your skin." you assured then touched her. She closed her eyes and quivered a little as her skin began to move and heal. Sam seemed to go bug eyed as he saw her face going back, and even reducing in age slightly. When you were done you removed your hand and finger from her face. She took a minute but then opened her eyes. "See, didn't hurt a bit did it?"

"Actually, felt kind of... good." She revealed, but she got a new face when she turned to see the other's reaction to her newly healed face. Saying that their jaws were dropped would be an understatement. She was then worried and went to fetch a mirror from the counter. She held it up and almost dropped it as she glanced at herself. Her hand went up and tears rolled down as she felt her unblemished face. She was a beauty to be sure, and even though she didn't blame Sam for the scars before, something could be said for its return to its glorious and kept state.

"I hope that means I did a good job?" You asked as they stared at her, and for the first time in a while, she didn't mind the staring. She went back over to you and just hugged you. You joked and coughed as if she was squeezing the life out of you. But the joke was obvious, turning everyone's shock and stunned faces to a smiling and partially laughing one. She then let go and hugged into Sam, burying her face in his chest. "I guess that is a yes then."

"Correct, that was a yes." Sam clarified but took Emily into the other room to be alone with her. Jacob caught Belle's attention and they went to go talk with each other while leaving you with the others.

"So... you mind if I join you guys?" You asked as they dumbly kicked out a chair you could use. You sat and sighed.

"That was amazing." Paul stated and the others agreed. "So... we heard you were a Vampire slayer?"

"Eavesdropping were we?" You teased then continued to their mischievous smirks. "You wolves and your sensitive ears. Anyway, yes I use to be a Vampire Slayer."

"How many did you kill? Bet we have gotten close," asked Embry prideful.

"13,456... I think. There might've been a few more, but I can't count the assists." You answered after comically counting them on your fingers as you thought about it. Again, their jaws dropped.

"Never mind, we will never touch that." Embry admitted, to which they all cracked up laughing and the conversations started in earnest. Some demonstrations and some stories on both aspects of you them and you. Maybe it had something to do with King's decree, but it had turned out incredibly easy to gain their confidence. Healing Emily might've also helped a little.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Continue with the others.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"You know, if I do this, I will no longer be a secret. I will have to drink more blood, and I will probably be a source of conflict. After all, they can't just ignore a Vampire like me. One more powerful than they are." You answered as Alice and Belle came to your house. They had asked you if you would help them save Edward. You were tempted to just have her call Edward. That would save a whole lot of headaches. But then future events wouldn't be preserved. Showing yourself to the Volturi would be the only way at that point. Since they don't allow humans to know about them and just get away.

"I know, I just..." Belle started but stopped as you waved her to do so.

"I didn't say I wouldn't. I was just giving you one last chance to back out if this course of action. The way it is, I will have to power up to just get you there. I've never teleported across continents before... well not at this distance at least." you said, looking at her then at Alice. "This is your world to, what do you want me to do?"

"As much as I would like to keep your identify a secret, saving a life must come before secrecy, don't you agree?" She asked, knowing your answer. After all, you had told them about your rule on taking life.

"Fine, just a sec." you answered and went to a sealed fridge you kept some of your human blood. You grabbed a few packs and started drinking from one right away. You burned it as you finished, holding the another while the rest went in your pocket. You then held out your hand to them. "Let's go..."

"Thank you Caleb. This means a lot to me." Belle responded as she put her hand on yours.

"Yeah, I know. I guess it wont be the most terrible thing in the world to rip on some arrogant vampire leaders. They are always fun to screw with." You answered as you waited for Alice to join her hand. They seamed to smile at your comment. Normally Alice would probably advise you on how dangerous it would be to do so. But then again, she had been told how powerful you are, shown, and she could see the future. "Hold your breath." you said and as soon as they did you all were off. It was quite a trip and you were right to assume you needed the extra power. If it was just you then you wouldn't. But doing it for so long and safely for both Vampire and Human was not a picnic. So you drank the blood you had in your hand, as well as an extra on the way. For them it was a few seconds and you were all in a city full of red robed people. They were about to thank you when you ducked behind a building, gasping for breath.

"Caleb? What's wrong?" Belle asked, a little bit nervous. Alice was also concerned but not as vocal about it. They found you digging into the remaining blood bags you brought with you. For a second your eyes were their glowing red and your fangs had protruded. The intense nature of your full Vampire form wasn't something they'd seen. Like that, it was near impossible to look nonthreatening. They drew back at the sight, but it was only a second as your features went back to human, wiping the residual blood off your lips and licking that up as well.

"My apologies. I didn't think that would happen. Maybe that was the birth of the traveling over water weakness legend puts on Vampires. That took a whole lot out of me." You said then stood straight and stretched a bit. "All better now, all the same though, we should take a plane on the way home."

"Yeah, no argument here." Alice agreed as they relaxed. "Now, we have someone to talk down, don't we?"

"Yes, let's go." Belle agreed.

To that you three moved through the crowd, Alice leading the way. Since you all weren't cutting time, there was a little more time to play with. More than enough to make it to the door Edward was just walking out to expose himself. When he opened it, Belle lost all self-control and dove into his arms. They did their little drama thing while you and Alice came in and locked the door behind you. You made it a point to appear human. No need to make waves, if they didn't. Ironically, things happened just like the movie. Strange how that pull was still active. You were a pretty big anomaly in this plot point. But you were all led through the halls and into the main chamber by Jana all the same. Conversations continued on topics like they should. You didn't really care until they started threatening Belle. Their threats to you weren't even noticed, and you didn't react to them. But unlike the movie, Edward didn't attack as soon as they started threatening.

"I'm sorry, what is the point of threatening us?" You asked in a comically manner. One Edward didn't necessarily approve of.

"Why not?" Aro asked as they already seamed to have already decided to kill you both.

"Well, for starters, you really think Belle will remain a human when in love with Edward? Come now, you all aren't that blind to such things are you? First love, then protection, then doing stupid stuff for each other.... like Edward's insistence to kill himself if she died. After that they get joined in one manner or another. How long do you think the age topic will come up and the fear of being separated will last before they fix that problem?" You asked as you drew out the logic of such a relationship clearly.

"I promise, she will be one of us. I have seen it," Alice said as she came forward in the conversation. "Even if I have to change her myself."

She held out her hand so Aro could see the future with Belle being a Vampire. Afterwards he drew back and looked intently at Belle, then at you.

"What an immortal your abilities will create..." Aro stated to Belle then looked to you. "But what of you?"

"What of me?" you asked plainly.

"Young Belle seems to have a future with us, but you have yet to describe why you will. Have you also fallen in love with one of our kind?" He asked.

"Nope. I am just here to make sure no one harms Belle. If you will allow, that is all I need say." you answered, stimulating a sense of honor in their minds but not sure how well it would hold. They could decide to attack, in which case you would have to show your nature. Or they could take hold of your influence and accept you as a support for Belle, a future Vampire.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Going to save Edward...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Unfortunately, we can't allow a human to have such a knowledge about us. You say you have no intension of becoming one of us?" He asked in a confrontational tone.

"In a manner of speaking..." you answered then looked to Belle and the others. "You guys might want to leave now. Your business is done here and I would rather you not get caught up in this."

"Uh... right. We'll see you outside then?" Belle agreed and asked.

"Of course. I just need to explain things to them. The short and sweat version should suffice for them don't you think?" You asked back with a smile. They smiled back and left, with the Volturi's blessing. You followed them until the door slammed close then set up a very strong barrier around the room.

"Now, what were you going to explain to us?" Aro asked as if taunting you, a pretty accurate assumption. "Sending away your only protection, that wasn't the smartest move you could make."

"You really think I need their protection. Not that it would be much use anyway. Two vampires verses all of you, while protecting Belle and me. Not a very fair fight on their part. I would rather they not be touched by this little situation we have here." you answered with a default smile on then got into a serious glare at Aro. "But if you think I willingly surrounded myself by you all and not accounted for this.... and a way out, then you are dumber than you look. I would choose your next moves and words carefully, Sir."

"How, interesting." Aro replied as he recoiled slightly from what you said. It was clear that he liked being in control, but even more so informed about everything. While you appeared to be a normal human to his eyes, you were right. Even if it was a bluff, to his eyes, the uncertainty was not something he enjoyed. He turned and walked a distance away then turned to address you and the room. Turning to the two young looking ones... "Jane, would you be so kind?"

"Pain." She said simply as she gazed at you. You felt something happening to you, but your blood blocked it away. It seamed there were many abilities in this realm that you would never be able to do. But your pure vampire blood also acted as a shield that they couldn't touch. Kind of like it was an intense flame and their abilities were dried leaves. They could still use them against you, unlike the werewolves, but their attempts didn't even register before they were burned up before getting anywhere near you.

"Ah, you must be the pain illusion girl. I am afraid you will find me harder to entrance than anyone you have ever faced before," you stated at a leisurely pace and tone then looked at the three that were on the steps ahead of you. "That was your free shot, next one might cost you. But you can try, as long as I have your word that you will keep the Cullens, Belle, and the fine people of Forks out of your sights because of me."

"Not that we need your permission, but we will agree to that, as a last request." Aro stated then looked to someone behind you. He came rushing toward you with a pretty insane speed, aiming a hand toward your head and/or neck. At the last second you stepped to the side and put an arm out, effectively clotheslining him. While he remained airborne you gave him a spin kick that Blade had shown you, sending him crashing into a wall on the other end of the room, settling in a calm posture like before glaring at the 3 surprised vampires that made up the leadership.

"Not bad, he was very fast, even for one of you. But not fast enough I am afraid." You said, turning from your serious demeanor and going to a sarcastically smiling tone instead.

"What are you?" Marcus asked timidly.

"Why would I tell you that? It is so much more fun letting you guess," you responded.

"Very well then..." Aro replied then gave a signal to which 10 Vampires came at you. But you were visibly not worried. If you and Blade were able to take out a couple hundred in one night, 10 was barely felt as a threat. They reached you all at nearly the same time. You thought about how to defeat them. But the simple way would be just to use Kaname's power. So you rose your hand and brought them off their feet as well, letting them float there for a few seconds, then sending them into the walls. You didn't need them dead, just educated in how futile their attempts were. At that point, a black fog like power enveloped you. You sighed at this, which seamed to amuse them.

"This power of yours is troublesome. But what making me unaware of my surroundings is dangerous, for you that is. What if I miss and hit someone I shouldn't?" You asked as you shot a little static bolt in a random direction. You didn't need a full on lightning bolt. For a show, a thick static one was good enough. The fog dispersed immediately and you saw your bolt had got mere inches away from Aro's head, melting the stone behind him.

"How is this possible? No human can do these things." Aro stated, freaking out a little bit.

"Funny, I never said I was human. You just assumed that. So far, I have restrained from seriously wounding any of you. Can't say my patience will last forever though." You replied then let loose your scent and a little bit of your power, making a vortex of power to surround you. You also used some flames to mix and cycle in the mix, making you look like a DBZ character powering up. But you weren't that powerful, it was just aesthetic that you hoped they wouldn't push. "If you are through playing at a low level, I can get serious."

They braced back and took out a few things to protect themselves. One of them took out a sword, which you used your energy to slice in half from that distance. Some pulled out a pipe or knives, same thing happened. You just stood in the center with your arms folded in boredom. To be fair, this was a little less than your idle power level. They seamed finally scared. Maybe your protruded fangs and glowing red eyes had something to do with it.

"We yield!" Exclaimed Aro as none could do more than brace back, and definitely didn't think about attacking, after seeing what you did to the weapons they took out. With that you reduced and retracted your power, appearing like you did prior to the display.

"That is good. I would hate to have to start fighting you all. I'm not to into taking people's life if I can help it, human or otherwise." You answered with the same sarcastic smile you were using with them from the start.

"Why did you not tell me you were one of us?" Aro asked, confused... and frightened.

"Because I am not one of you. I am a different type of Vampire all together." you answered then sliced your finger so blood could come out. "See, for starters, I can bleed. Yeah, not like you at all, but I am a Vampire so..."

"They will you join in our feast?" he offered. You knew, even without reading his mind, that he was referring to the humans outside the door right now.

"Unless you are offering your neck with them, then no. I said it before, but maybe you need me to say it again. I don't enjoy taking of sapient life. Vampire, human, werewolf, or whatever else. But if you would like me to change, then perhaps you were volunteering?" You asked to which he took a step back with an obvious "no" answer. "Didn't think so. While I will.... tolerate your habit, don't expect me to follow your example or rule, or condone it. Now, if there is nothing else, I would like to get going before I am tempted to do something foolish."

"Yes, go with out blessing young one." Aro agreed as he gestured for the door and you took down the barrier. You bowed to them then turned and walked to the door, but stopped when they were about to open it, to which the flinched and stopped. "Is there something else?"

"Just that... I will be keeping you to your word about harming the Cullens, Belle, or those at Forks. Break your word in any manner and will break you." you warned then pulled the door open with your power and walked out, allowing the light to hit you and show how different you were before proceeding past the waiting humans and toward the door where Alice, Belle, and Edward were waiting. You kept going until you met up with them. "Ready to go?"

"You are done? They let you go?" Edward asked, surprised.

"We... talked about it." you answered.

"That was fast." Alice commented.

"I left out the complicated parts. They will leave me and us alone. Now, how about we get home already?" You answered and suggested.

"Sounds good," Belle answered and followed Alice as you all made for the airport. She was definitely a strange one. She was in a building full of vampires. Her best friends were Vampires, humans, and werewolves. Then again, you had little room to talk. But at least you could hold your own if you needed to. She was just... vulnerable, very much so. You were admiring her strength for this reason. She was even better with weird stuff that you were, which was saying a lot.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They attack.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Jacob wasn't too happy to say the least about Edward's return. But you stayed out of it. Even when he asked. Their romantic triangle thing, yeah, that was not something you wanted to be a part of, even indirectly. As long as they didn't kill each other, you didn't care that much. And you knew that Belle was more than capable of keeping the two sides. In her own way, she was more valuable than any of them were. Not only for her relationship with Jacob and Edward, but for her ability to be a neutral ground between the two sides. No one wanted to hurt her, so no one fought each other seriously in that respect. But now was a meeting about changing Belle. She had called the meeting and they went around the room voting on it.

"Well...?" Belle asked you, as you were the last one to say your piece. Edward seamed to be begging you to say something against it.

"I find this pointless." You answered to which they all seamed shocked for different reasons.

"What are you talking about?" Carlisle asked for them, as he was the first to get his voice back.

"Edward wants to be with her forever and she feels the same, only way that will happen is if she gets turned. Each of you have a desire to keep her around one way or another. Even if there is something to be said about turning people in general as far as morality, it is overruled by the fact that SHE came to you about it, and not as a spur of the moment thing. She isn't going to change her mind, and that is painfully obvious. She didn't turn against you all when she found out what you were, what Jacob was, what you all do, and the danger she is and will always be in. Even if she must remain a human, she doesn't look like she will leave in anything other than a body bag. Even if that were to happen, I am sure she would find some way to haunt the people that harmed you all and to still be with Edward. She is one stubborn woman." You started to which she smiled at that last part as your tone was more comical than anything. The others were thinking about it and nodding at your points. "Personally, other than the first little bit of rejections, becoming a Vampire was the best thing I've ever done. Sure there are downsides but nothing that would make me regret it. As much evil a Vampire is capable of, we also have an almost endless amount of time to do good as well. I can tell, that Belle, you will be a vampire even if you have to force one of them to bite you. In that light, no point arguing about it. If she is going to become one, the only way to influence it, is to agree and take it one step at a time. There is no rush. You will have all of your very long life to dwell and you are not even close to being over your prime yet. SO.... pointless. She will become a Vampire. What you need to decide is how she will."

"You make a good point." Alice stated with a smile. Belle seamed to be smiling ear to ear. She already knew, from her visions, that Belle would be one. Perks of being her.

"Thanks a lot." Belle said as she gave you a huge and a kiss on the cheek.

"No swet." you responded as she went over to an emotionally conflicted Edward. He didn't know if he should be glaring at you or nodding his thanks. "But Belle, Edward is right about a few things. Being a Vampire, while exhilarating and far lasting. Your love will last and all that, especially since you have the feelings as a human. They will amplify as a Vampire, when you turn."

"That is good isn't it?" She asked.

"Not really. Imagine how you felt when he was going to die. It is obvious that either of you will give your life for the other. But the level you will be at when you turn... if he were to nobly give his life for you. Wither it be tomorrow or a thousand years from now, you will be utterly devastated. More so than anything you can imagine as a human. And IF you survive your depression, which is unlikely as evidence to what Edward was willing to do when he thought you were dead, you would have to live out your whole immortal life without him... which is a VERY long time. On top of that, your predatory instincts will almost force you to desire your human family's blood. If you were to take a human life in that light, you would be burdened with that guilt for the same amount of time. One thing that will increase along with everything else is your memory retention. While that means your loving moments will be forever with you, it also means you anger, sadness, guilt, sorrowful, and miserable moments will be to. THAT is one of many things why Edward is not too keen about it. He wishes to shield you from harm and pain, especially the everlasting kind. I know you will be turned anyway, but you should think of things in reverse as well. Would you doom someone you love to a life of potential pain and regret for as long as their long life would allow because you wish to extend your love?" You lectured. This mode of conversation was more up Edward's alley, but he wasn't short sighted enough to not take what you said earlier into account. But now Belle know what it meant to him.

"I... I guess not. But I really want this, to be with you forever." She answered, the last bit to Edward directly.

"I know that Belle. Caleb is right though. A Vampire's life is not all roses and butterflies. There are bloody battles, wars, death, and sorrow. Many things that I don't wish you to be hurt by. However, living without you... I know that is also a form of death for me." Edward said to her.

You endured more drama talk between then until the meeting was over and they went to talk more. Seriously, how much could they talk about the same drama filled things over, and over, and over again. You didn't get it, but what else was new. You never had a firm grip on the relationship scene.

"Thank you, that is what they needed to hear. I sometimes grow weary of playing peace maker." Carlisle sighed and shook your hand in thankfulness, a large smile gracing his lips.

"Well, I know both sides rather well. Sure Vampire life can have its bad sides, but I've never scorned the one who turned me. Then again, I had a choice and she was rather nice about the whole thing. Not all that are turned can be as lucky, and I hear the way you all bite people is not like my bite, or the one I received. So... I can see both sides in more recent detail. She just needed to have her eyes open to both her decision and his feelings. Edward is not very good at describing things that he knows in his heart from a century of experience. It makes sense to him, but doesn't really know how to express it into words," you replied back as if you were looking into your past.

"Who was it that turned you, if you don't mind me asking?" He asked.

"Sorry, I don't wish that to be part of the knowledge base around here. Although I will say that she died in doing so. She knew she would die if and when she passed her.... gift. And she did it for me, in a way that I will never forget but went out of her way to make it a very good experience for me." You answered, giving him a little but not enough to tell him everything.

"I didn't realize, I apologize for bringing it up. She must've been a magnificent person." Carlisle replied, noticing that he had stepped on a touchy subject. He had enough tact to know not to push such topics.

"She was, thanks."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Vampire meeting about changing Belle.

choices: They ask for you to help with the battle.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Couldn't you just find and kill her?" Asked Jacob as he ran with you in your morning exercises. It was a little touchy, but you were able to keep good relations with both the Cullens and the werewolves. Each asserted their own view on the other and tried to sway you over who was the most just. But you usually cut them off before they could do too much preaching. As you put it, 'you didn't want any part of Vampire/wolf drama'. However, in this particular instance Jacob was talking about Victoria, who had just come into the territory of both the Cullens and the Wolves. Amidst their territorial fighting had let her escape.

"Sure, I could do that. But she hasn't actively harmed anyone in forks, which is pretty much were the majority of the people I care about. Until she does, or openly threatens in a way that I must act, she hasn't done anything wrong to me and mine. Until she does, I am not about to start any fights. At my level, that would just be bullying and not my way at all." You responded as you rounded a path with him. He was in wolf form, but that didn't stop you from understanding him. Even without reading his mind, he could still talk to you in wolf language. Must be part of the internal language base, or perhaps King's decree... either way, you could flawlessly understand all of them, which came in handy to say the least. "If it makes you feel any better, I am looking out for her."

"You are???" He asked, almost tripping in both shock and curiosity. But being a wolf and running on four legs has its perks.

"Yeah, she is a main source of my interest in this place. Not in a weird sensual, love triangle, or food way. I just want to protect her as a really good friend." You answered, answering some questions before they caused a problem. You knew, by this point, that any unexplained lines of dialog that hit anyone wrong could blow up in a huge drama filled situation. You had no desire to enter the Love and protection triangle that Belle, Edward, and Jacob were in.

"Yes, but how. Sure you see her at school and when she stops by your place, but other than that, you are the furthest away from her most of the time." Jacob asked in labored bursts. You had reached the home stretch of your little morning jog. It was the point that you would sprint back to your house. He had to really huff it and borderline unhealthy assertion to keep up. Well you had to slow down too, but it was an excellent workout for him... that could only help later on.

"Remember that Glyph I told you about?" You asked.

"Yeah..." he said then you both waited until you were back, as he was too distracted to have a intelligent conversation at the moment. When you both got back and got some water and blood (for you), you two continued.

"Well I can use that glyph as a sort of radar if I wish. When I sense something hostile about to do her harm, I simply teleport to her side and... solve the problem. Otherwise, when I am not looking her way, sort a speak, I have a nose out for her blood. If her blood hits the air, I immediately check on her to make sure she is safe." you explained. As you spoke you could tell he was having different emotions for each part. But the end one was relief at the news that nothing would get past you, if they failed at some point. He had been with you long enough by now to know that NO ONE was stronger than you are, well at least no one they knew. You thanked God for the fact that there was no magic in this realm.

"And Belle is ok with that, having the glyph on her all the time? I would thing she would want some privacy at some point." Sam asked for Jacob as he and some of the other pack came into the clearing.

They didn't have to worry about changing to human for you to understand them, so they just stayed like that. They knew that all manner of things could come and see you. As long as they didn't start anything bad, you didn't mind them like that. You all sat in a small area and you got them a good portion of meat from a deer you had hunted recently. The first time you had offered them something like that, they had refused. But now they knew that you hunted only for the blood and for company. Otherwise you let the animal live as part of your hunt. So they ate the provided meat without thought to it, other than to thank you.

"She was a little hesitant at first. But it isn't like I can see her with my eyes when she is bathing or going to the bathroom, stuff like that. So she just accepts that I won't abuse it. She is very good with weird." You answered back.

"That she is." Sam agreed between bites.

"Ok, but I do have a bone to pick with you guys." you stated after they had finished eating.

"Are you talking about the red head thing?" Paul asked.

"In a way, yes. I don't care if you keep them out. Heck, I don't care if you hate their guts. But what gets me is that you both tend to blame each other for something you caused. You blame them for Vampire things that happen, and when they are willing to help catch one, you refuse, even at the cost of letting a hostile one get away. I am sick of being in the middle of such things. Both sides handled it wrong. Bottom line, I you mess up then take responsibility for it, not a pride based blame game, and sure as heck don't expect me to support either side." you lectured. You felt a little weird lecturing people that were older and so different from you. But they seamed to take it well.

"Couldn't you just order us to do that?" One of the others asked. He was new and didn't know what if felt like to be ordered by you.

"I could, but I prefer to ask as a friend rather than demand such things." you answered.

"Thanks for that." Jacob responded.

"Of course." You replied back with a pleasant smile. After that you all proceeded to hang out and have a bit of fun. After all, there was things you could do to help them, even with training the younger pack members...
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Wolf management.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“So, the Big guns have arrived.” Emmett Said as you showed up for the ‘training’ that they were doing to fight newborns. Jasper was right, they all needed some education… and so did you. For instance, you hadn’t watched the series long enough to know that, even with ripping off their head or slicing them in half, they are still not fully dead until they are burned. You would have to think of things to combat that. Therefore, you would need just as much training as they did.

“Yep.” You comically answered as you did a muscle flex to pun off of his statements. Some smiled and some laughed at this. Belle was there and she didn’t see the point, but you all started.

It was comical to watch them practice, to you, basic combat skills. You were insanely glad that you had already been in realms to help with such things. Jasper had told you to try, and he was on his back before he could do anything else. Suffice to say, they didn’t doubt your physical stature and accomplishments after that point. But then, after their session, instead of returning home like in the movie, they all stayed as it was your turn to ask questions and get figure out better ways to fight.

“So, what do you need help with?” Asked Jasper. Like everyone else, he was slightly confused at what he could do to help you.

“Well, I wanted to know what works on your type of vampire, that I can do. I have a few tricks that would be useful, but pointless if they don’t finish them. You have said, that fire is the only way to kill them for good, right?” You revealed and asked.

“Yes…?” He answered, wondering what you could do that wouldn’t work or would. Both sides seemed to intrigue those that were watching all the more.

“Ok, then unless I want to make a huge mess, possibly alerting humans in the process, then I should find ways to end it quickly. Is that fair to say?” You asked again.

“Right again. Although you might want to avoid anything too overly flashy. I’ve seen your flame tornado. That would not be anywhere near subtle.” Jasper returned.

“Ok, see that is what I need to know.” You replied back then walked to an open spot in the middle of all them. “I am going to perform a skill and you tell me if it is useable.”

They all nodded and you started by using Kaname’s ability, moving a log, shaping it as a Comical Vampire figure, then bursting it into a milliong pieces. You then looked over at them for their analysis. It took a few minutes for them to recover.

“Ok, didn’t know you could do that.” Jasper replied then thought about it. The others were talking amongst themselves. Sure they could’ve interacted as well, but this was Jasper’s thing and they let him handle it. As he was the most educated in this anyway. “I don’t know what would happen if you did that to a Vampire like us. But, since there wasn’t any flame involved… the Vampire in question might be able to come back one day, with a heck of a grudge.”

“Ok, good to know.” You replied back then did the same thing with the a log and turning it into a Vampire practice dummy. Then you shot first a saliva needle at it, then a fire needle. It didn’t burst into flames, but it was burning. “Two separate attacks.”

“Yes, again, didn’t know you could do that. But the first one, although able to penetrate us, will be useless because we can still move and function afterward. The… fire one, it would be a good distraction, but not much more than that unless you riddled the entire body with those things they would just remove them and continue, harmed but not killed.” Jasper said, again after the recovered. They did so quicker this time but still had a ways to go.

For the next hour, you used a good number of your abilities. The best one was your blood sword that you, under his suggestion, modified to have the fire element infused. This made it easy to slice a Vampire in half and burst them into such intense flames that it looked like slicing through a Vampire from Blades realm. Best of all, it was the option that cost the least amount of energy from you. It wouldn’t be the only tool you had, but it would be the favorite for slicing and dicing up Vampires in this realm. The Werewolves and the Vampires seamed both delighted and scared of this new weapon you had. However, they liked when you told them about the little thing you gave Belle. That way, even if they did reach her, she could still more than defend herself.

With that done, you all went your separate ways to rest and hunt. After all that show and tell, you needed some blood…
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: They ask for you to help with the battle.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
There was more drama to follow, as this was a drama filled realm. You were just getting to a place where you could not get caught in the pointless stuff. They started to understand your place and that certain things they had to figure lots of that stuff by themselves. So you continued to train with them. However, with your abilities tweaked and you ready for the fight, they used you for a practice dummy of sorts. Of course you agreed. You were the only person that could be ripped apart and brought back together again. That tended to train them better, and the Wolves could partake in the event as well, in a more feral war like aspect that they couldn't do with Vampires that they shouldn't rip apart. Even so, they each apologized after each training session to make it clear that they valued you and wouldn't ever think of actually killing you. The point was always answered with a joke from you, basically saying that they wouldn't be able to even if they tried. The pride based joke got them in better moods and strengthened the bond you all had. The two sides still were very wary of each other and there was obvious tension, but it was far better at this point.

"Ready?" Asked Emmett, as you all stared down the field, waiting the Newborn army.

"You remember who you are talking to right?' You joked. Most of them, despite the impending battle, smiled and/or laughed at this.

You will leave some of them for us right?" He asked back, a 'concern' also held by the wolves.

"Maybe a few. Here they come." You said with a wink. The last part as your attention then suddenly shifted to the opening, as they were now entering the area.

It would have been better if there was a little time to talk them down. Alas, there wasn't. They came into the clearing at a straight run. You all move into for the clash of sides. Halfway to them, you cut your finger and made the blood sword come out. This peaked the new Vampires, as they were still blood drunk. The Cullens and Wolves had gotten used to it. These ones... not so much. You could tell that they were now solely focused on you, unaware to how dangerous that Blood sword really was.

With a clash, the sides met. The newborns were stronger than most of your side, but your side had the experience... and you. As you met the opposing line, you began dispatching them with ease. However, as fast as you and they were, you ended up killing at least one with every swing of your sword, sometimes multiple Vampires in one swing. Your blood was confusing them enough to give everyone else an edge as well. But that was not the only thing you did. You took it upon yourself to protect them. When they ganged up on a Cullen of a wolf, you used your abilities to remove the threat and end them in unique ways. In very little time, the battle was over and all the Vampires were dead. Unlike in the movie, your blood had spurred the little girl vampire to fight as well. You found it slightly sad, but you knew that she would've been killed anyway. So, with all of them dealt with, you all just stood around.

"Do you want to go get them? It would be faster..." Alice asked.

"Sure!" You responded, then teleported away to where Belle, Edward, and Jacob was. You knew it would happen, but they were in the middle of a battle. You let them bond for a little bit. However, when it can time for Edward to almost die and Belle to cut herself, you used your powers and separated each one of them. One side knew exactly what it was, the opposing side however, were all fighting against the invisible force that held them against their will. "Why is it that, even with the best laid plans, you two always get into trouble?"

"Yeah, like we go looking for it." Belle responded back comically. You put all of them down to which they gathered into two groups.

"You should know though, Victoria..." you started, getting her attention. "The one that killed James wasn't Edward. It was me."

"Impossible! You are lying! James wouldn't have been brought down by a HUMAN." she retorted back, saying human like it was an insult.

"If you say so..." you replied as you walked into the open area between the two groups, well within striking range. You brought out your blood sword again and that broke any self control of the two that were there. This, along with your comment, made your group smile. They had teased your human like scent at times. But knew all to well, with your blood sword drawn, two unfocused vampires didn't stand a chance. Just as they came close enough to strike, you swung your sword and cut them both in half with little effort. With that done, you put away your blood and turned to them, holding out a hand. "Shall we go? The others will have been waiting..."

"Don't break a swet by any means." Edward said almost at the same time as Jacob did. They all laughed then came over to be teleported back down with the others.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: The battle.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"So, what do you think?" Belle asked as they explained that they planned to get married after graduation, then she will be turned.

After the Battle, the Vulturi came to 'check on the newborn vampire problem'. However, unlike the movie, they weren't able to get as much under their skin with you there. They still remembered what you could do, or at least what you showed them. If they had been just a few minutes earlier, they'd be more educated. Suffice to say, they were far more respectful, once you backed them down a little. However, they still noticed Belle's... lack of immortality. She had told them that 'the date was set' and that seemed to be a good enough answer for them. They parted soon after, mostly to get away from you. The Cullens liked you even more for that, although Carlisle asked that you be careful. They didn't need to be on the bad side of the Vulturi. If he only knew that they would end up there in a little bit anyway. Currently however, they were in the middle of informing people of their impending Marriage. They valued your advice, which was a welcomed change to things. They even made an effort to bring in as little drama as possible.

"I think you two are destined to be together. There are too many reasons why you two should be together. Some of which you don't know yet. But I can see them clearly. Not to mention, I can't imagine you two tying the not with anyone else. That would just be... weird," you answered comically, to which they smiled.

"I am glad you approve." Edward stated.

"I just wish Jacob would come around." Belle sighed. Edward was about to comment on it but you both stopped him with looks that held his words where they were, still in his mind.

"It is a good thing to be concerned about one's friends. Vampires and Werewolves may not get along, but both sides get along with Belle. You are connected with her, now in a more serious manner, so you will have to deal with them in the nice sense, wither you like it or not," you said to Edward, then turned to Belle. "Don't you worry about it. He will come around. You are too good of a friend to him, for him to just turn his back to you after that point. Besides, if there is one thing that Wolves and Dogs are good at, it is being Loyal."

"I suppose you are right, again..." She said with a better but not completely healed spirit about the whole thing. "Thanks Caleb, for everything. You have been a really good friend and peacemaker at times. That means a lot to me. Even if you weren't a Vampire, you would be well worth the effort of getting to know." She complimented with a smile.

They both smiled at this. It meant a good deal to hear her say that. You had been concerned that they just saw you as a 'big brother' like figure. A person or thing that could protect and correct them. It made your feel good that wasn't the case.

"Now, about the wedding..." Edward started, to which you sat up at attention. "If you wouldn't mind, we would like you to do background stuff. Like protecting the wedding, us, making us feel warm to any that would touch a Vampire. This is a wedding after all, and people might get close. Sense there will be... well non-educated people there, it would help if we could enjoy the evening without that hassle."

"I am sure that it would a hit regardless, but I will do my best to make it as smooth as possible. I may have to read your mind on the day to make sure that I am doing everything the way it should, is that ok?" you asked to both of them.

"Of course!" they said at the same time and without hesitation. That also meant a lot to you. They trusted you that much... it felt really good.

This indeed was a very good Vacation.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Talk of Marriage.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
To get close in this story I decide to pretend I am a abused boy that just moved in next door with an antisocial raging drunk as a father. I enter the story a week before the dad dies. During that week I befriend Conner and Grace. The day that their father dies and they decide to leave town I take a stroll and confront them while they are packing the boat. As I round the bend to their private dock I notice that they are packing the ship full of food and water. I run up to them and ask them what's going on. Conner then tells me to just keep on walking and that. They are running away to another village where they will start over. I then shock them by revealing bruises that I made using the make up skills I had acquired through the vampire blood line, something I never thought I would need. I then explain that if their running away I want to go too. After some debating they let me join them.

That night we are in the middle of the ocean on our small boat when a massive storm sweeps in. We are rocked back and forth as the boat struggles not to break under the pressure of the waves. As we are standing on the open deck clutching the main mast for dear life, the boat breaks in half! I then decide that I will save one of the twins. I wrap my arms around _____ and hold on for dear life.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Continue

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content: I grab onto Grace because she is a girl and Conner is probably a stronger swimmer. I just continue to hold onto her as I am pushed and pulled my the angry monster the ocean has become. I am pushed and pulled by the merciless sea until I feel someone grab the collar of my black cloak I was wearing. Even as the mysterious person dragged me up I held onto Grace hoping she would not be claimed by the sea a second time. After my savior pulls us into his small dinghy I am startled to look into his blue eyes and to see a small flame burning in his pupil. You stare at each other until he breaks the silence by introducing himself as Lorcan Furey. You introduce yourself and Grace and tell him that you had ran away from home and accompanied Grace and her brother Conner as they fled from tax collectors and an orphanage. He listens to your story as he paddles the dinghy in a random direction. You then ask him is he is a vampirate. He turns to you shocked as he ask how you know about them as they are almost forgotten to most land dwellers. You then explain that Grace's dad told you ; This is a shanty that was sang for many years even before the great floods in 2022, one about the monsters of the sea that have become a little known legend in this year 2045. Here it is "I'll tell you a tale of Vampirates, a tale as old as true. (Verses 1 - 3) Yea I'll sing you a song of an ancient ship that sails the ocean blue...... That haunts the ocean blue." I finish reciting the poem and I realize that we are surrounded by mist that is so thick that it blocks out the stars even to my vampire sight. As I look into the mist Grace starts to wake up, mumbling about not wanting to go to school today. As she sits up and takes a look around an ancient galleon with leathery bat like sails that pulse with an unknown energy appears out of the mist startling her and Lorcan. Although I think Lorcan was more startled about. Me. Facing this so calmly.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Grace

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content: As we arrive on the deck that is painted a blood red color Grace fully wakes up and wonders what's happening. Lorcan then leads her to her new room and then locks the door from the outside. After locking her inside, he takes me to see the captain. As I step inside a dimly lit room I see the captain sitting in a chair next to a bed of coals. He is a sight to behold. He wears a mesh face mask, black clothes, and a thin leather coat that pulses with the same veins of energy running through them. As Lorcan tells the captain about how Grace and I ended up here the captain intently stares at me. After Lorcan's explaination, the captain dismisses Lorcan. As I get up to move, the captain whispers into my head to sit back down and that he wants to talk to me. I sit back down and asks him what he wants to talk about. He then asks me why I'm so calm about this situation. He explains that while everyone else is like an open book to him he can't see anything about me or what I'm feeling. I then explain that I have accepted that my life was going to be different after I left with the Tempest twins on that yacht. Also, a ship of Vampirates is better than my abusive father. After that explaination he dismissed me by saying that he will be keeping an eye on me and that I have to stay inside mine and Grace's cabin at night.

I quickly take off her clothes without looking and then find a nightgown sitting on a chair nearby. I grab that and slip it on her. After that I took off my clothes and found a pair of black leather boots, a black shirt with a red ruffle in the middle, and a pair of black cotton shorts. After changing into my new clothes I waned around the cabin. I realized that the bed was engraved with intricate designs, calligraphy in an unknown language, and bizarre patterns. After thinking a bit I place my rune on Grace I case if one of the crew members threaten her. After that I pulled up next to her in the single bed and went to "sleep."
