choices: Helping Jake explain things to Belle's father.
Helpinng with raising the little one.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Really???" You asked as you looked at all of them.

The next movie, per say, had went along just as it was suppose to be. Even if you didn't really care to keep the timeline at this point, it was useful to do so anyway, in this case. That is because people acted like you'd expect, rather than leaving you in the dark. Then again, with you playing peacemaker most of the time, you had a lot of stuff you didn't know about as well. Most of the time, they respected you enough to not bring over too much drama stuff. But they couldn't help it, this was the Twighlight series after all. This particular case, both the Vampires and the Werewolves had come for your advice and hoped that you would back one side in their quarrel with each other.

"It is our Baby. When Belle wakes up, she should be able to see her own child!" Edward declared.

"She should be allowed to live." Jake agreed, in a rare moment of support to his least favorite Cullen. Of course, that was a matter of opinion, you guessed.

"IT... is unnatural! A demon! The Cullens are one thing. This... Creature!... is too much!" Said Sam. It was unclear if all his hostility was against them as a whole, or part of Jake as well. Since Jake wasn't following his orders as the Alfa and all that. To be fair, that probably wasn't easy on a K-9 species like them. Not to mention, he had a slight superiority complex. Not as much as normal Vampires did, but big enough to play a factor.

"It is natural," replied Jasper, which got a round of hissing and growling. All of which was prying on your patience. Even more so when they started another round of arguing and confrontation. They would ever threaten to harm each other, but they knew better around you. Particularly on your land. You had planned on waiting until the calmed down. but that would not be a short wait... which irritated you even more. To your credit, you waited about an hour before budding in.

"ENOUGH!!!" You blared. This silenced all of them, some out of fear, others because the outburst was a borderline order to the k-9s in the group. They turned deathly silent as they saw the irritation appear in the form of your eyes glowing red and you flexing a little bit. You closed your eyes and composed yourself before speaking further. Taking a few breaths before continuing with, "The Baby stays."

"But Caleb???" Sam asked, distressed that his last attempt at rectifying this to his liking was going up in flames. He couldn't do anything himself, since Jake had imprinted on the child. However, if you ordered it, Jake himself would have no choice but to follow the order.

"Unlike normal Vampires of this place, the cold ones that you wolves have such a biased against, this one was born. She has a beating heart, a more desirable smell, she grows, and she LIVES. I do not take part in the slaying of ANY innocent life. Out of all the Vampires in the world, SHE should be the one you all can tolerate the most." You started, backing the almost feral looking group of werewolves. Then you looked towards the Cullens. "As for you all. You should know that this child will take loads of explaining. Tread carefully, for most people, as evidence to the situation we have here, will not take kindly to her being born like she was."

"What do you mean?" Edward asked, in a drama filled emotion. Thankfully, Carlisle headed it off and silently explained it to him in a way you didn't have the patience to achieve. You were glad that at least one of them had a head on his shoulders, sort of speak.

"You expect us to accept this... child?" Asked Sam, as if asking if it was an order.

"No, I expect that you will not needlessly kill her, like you were planning on doing. You can treat her like you treat them if you wish. Just know, that I will probably protect her more than harm her. Fair warning..." you warned, glaring at them a little, causing them to quiver.

"Very well." He answered. To that effect, they didn't want to be around the Cullens any longer than they had to, so they bolted as soon as Sam told them they could. Jake stayed though, as the Cullens plus him seemed to have something to say.

"What is it?" You asked.

"Belle, she is..." Edward started but you nodded in understanding, before he could finished. "... You knew? You know?"

"Indeed. Having a Vampire baby is no small feet, especially for a human. The little girl could tare the womb open on its own if she wanted, but she didn't. Either way, it is bound to have a toll on the Mother, even more than usual. In normal cases, the Mother is the stronger of the two, the Baby so fragile and all that. In this case however, the Baby is stronger than she was. I assume that you have already changed her?" You responded and asked.

"Yes, she lies in a bed." Carlisle responded for the emotional Edward. "She isn't doing well and we don't know if she will pull through."

"She will." You said bluntly, after closing your eyes and concentrating on the signal you were getting from the glyph you had put on her. You knew the Movie, so you knew she would be. But, course of habit, you checked anyway.

"You are sure? How do you know?" Alice asked, this time. Being the person most like a sister to Belle, she was also quite concerned. She was, after all, the one holding the little one at this point.

"That glyph I put on her. Is like a beacon in times like this. It feeds me intel on her status and health so I know if I need to intervene. If she was dead, as in never coming back, then the glyph would disappear and I would know." You replied as if stating the weather. They all stood silent for a minute, then shrugged comically.

"We should get used to this kind of thing at this point." Jasper stated stoically, but it was still slightly comical. "If you aren't worried, neither should we."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Drama.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
Things were moving along quite fast. Perks of letting things go on as they should... anyway, Alice had seen the Volturi come and all that. The Cullens and wolves were preparing. The only difference was that they waited to tell Charley for a little bit. You had convinced Belle that it was a good idea and Jacob was ready to reveal himself. They all had some concerns about you doing so, as you were planning, however, since you weren't part of their family officially, Charley wouldn't be targeted after learning of a hybrid like you. So you and Jacob had just arrived at Charley's and were meeting him in the woods, for secrecy.

"So, what is this all about?" Charley asked.

"Well, it is about your daughter, kind of..." you stated.

"Belle? You've heard from her? How is she?" Charley asked in rapid succession. It was clear that he was very worried about her. He kept looking between you and Jacob for the answer.

"She is fine, more than fine actually!" Jacob stated. He really didn't believe that, as he thought Belle being turned wasn't the best thing in the world. However, he understood that it was far from bad either, and it resulted in Renesmee being born, the one he imprinted onto. Charley seemed to get better and more excited all in one.

"Well, where is she? Can I see her?" he asked, to which you raised your hand so he knew there was more.

"I don't mean to be rude, Mr. Swan, but it is a bit complicated. We can't tell you everything, but we can prep you so you can see her today, if you are willing to listen and keep an open mind." You responded as Jacob started to get nervous and Charley started to get more insistent.

"How can it be complicated? She is my daughter!" He almost blared.

"Indeed, however, she is involved with something, while wonderful, it is also very need to know. It is one of those, tell you but have to kill you things. Literally. So, we as a group have decided to give you a taste of what is happening, so you understand that there are certain things that she can't and won't tell you... and that you should not ask about. If you can do that, and trust Belle, then we can take you to see her right now." You responded. He seemed to follow you rather well. Even though he was not very happy about it. His law enforcement background seemed to help with this.

"Ok, do what you need to do and say what you need to say, so I can see Belle." he almost commanded. You nodded then did the same to Jacob, to which he started to strip out of his clothes. "Uh... what are you doing?"

"You should've been shown this a long time ago." Jacob said as he removed his last article of clothing. Before Charley could come back with any type of comment, Jacob transformed into his wolf state. Without his gun, Charley's only move was to fall backwards and backpedal until his back was against a tree. He started to calm when Jacob laid down in a very nonthreatening pose.

"W-what just happened?" Charley asked you, not risking a move that might invoke a reaction from the very large wolf in front of him. However, he noticed that you were just standing there, as if in no danger. Not strange for you, but definitely strange for him, at the moment.

"He turned into a wolf. What does it look like?" you answered comically, then decided to add a little to ease him a little. "Don't worry, he is still Jacob. Same mind and all, thus why you are still alive right now."

"Jacob?" Charley asked the wolf slowly, then started to get up. He eventually went over to the large wolf and pet him. He then backed up and got closer to you. "So, are you a large wolf too?"

"Not exactly." you said, nervously. His thought process was distracted as Jacob went back and put his clothes back on.

"Then what?" Charley asked, still keeping an wary eye on Jacob.

"Well, I am... I am a Vampire." you said, the word seamed to have a similar effect than Jacob's transformation had, just less animated. Strange, you hadn't felt this nervous in a while.

"You got to be kidding?" He asked, partially in shock.

"Look, I can't tell you much more than that. I can't even show you, which is weird. I can lift a car to prove it. But that is about it. We are not saying that Belle is or is not a Vampire... or a werewolf.. We are showing you this to make you understand." you stated.

"Understand what?" Charley asked.

"Think about it. If there really are people like us out there and Belle is somehow accepted in any way by a group similar to us, they would want the secret to stay a secret. The governing body would keep a lid on it, at any cost. So, if you asked too many questions and found out something you weren't supposed to, even with our help, what do you think would be their reaction to it?" You asked, helping the wheels spin in his mind.

"They would... not be happy..." he started then thought hard on it. "I see what you mean. If Belle is involved with a group like this, even an honorable one, she would want to see me, but not want me to know anything that could get me killed or worse."

"Exactly! She cares about you a great deal!" Jacob responded to which Charley eventually nodded.

"Very well, take me to my daughter." he both agreed and commanded.

"Happily!" you responded with a smile. You both led him out of the woods. There was a quiet for a while. You let him think, as he had a bunch to think on. You eventually made it to his car, and before getting in, turned to him, then bent down and lifted it off the ground. You put it down and winked at him as if to say, "Told you so."

This would be an interesting day of explanations and reunions.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Helping Jake explain things to Belle's father.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Are you ready for this?" One of the more battle prone vampires asked as you all waited for the opposition to arrive. There were quite a bit of 'red eyes' around, as Jacob liked to call them. Some had heard stories about you. But, as a long lived race like theirs, they attributed those to rumor and whatnot. You found this strange, but understandable.

"Not necessarily thrilled, but itching to get started. I don't really get into the whole slaughtering people underneath me thing..." you answered with a sigh. Most of the new Vampires laughed it off as a sign of weakness to you. The Cullens however nodded to you in understanding.

"Will a fight be necessary?" Belle asked, hoping that wherever Alice was, she would be bringing something to help, or someone.

"Not really, but it is necessary for us to think that it is. So just keep fighting in your mind and 'the plan'," You responded to which she nodded and gazed at the area that they could all sense the incoming Vampires coming. It wasn't long before they showed themselves and walked, prideful, into the clearing.

Then began the talking. Full with drama and baiting from both sides. Carlisle, again, was the only clearheaded and relatively drama free person in the conversation. You steered clear of it, until they addressed you that is...

"And what of you? You support this?" Aro asked you in a baiting fashion. However, you didn't really find a reason to figure out his deception. Instead, you just decided to answer openly. There was no reason to lie... about this anyway.

"Yep," you answered bluntly.

"So, you whole heartedly admit to opposing us." Aro stated in more of a statement then a question.

"I told you once before, I am not connected, but I will protect them and you have been warned." You answered, letting go your eyes so they could step back slightly from it. It was a clear threat to them. The other new ones, even in the Volturi, seemed to laugh at this. However, those that had seen your power, were NOT laughing.

"Will you protect them forever?" Aro asked. You thought hard about this answer. You were intending on leaving after the series ended. However, their world would continue. So, if the only reason why they weren't attacking was you, then when you left, they would not hold back. On the other hand, maybe there was a way to leave and keep them in line.

"No. I will be leaving very soon. However, I will visit. It may be in a few days, or in a few centuries. However, if they aren't alive and well... You, Aro, will be the first I slaughter in retribution." You stated with a fake but equally sarcastic smile. This seamed to get him to sweat bullets.

At that point, the movie progressed as it should. Alice's arrival included. You knew what Aro was seeing was probably more... drastic because you were there. They argued a little more than the movie though, again, because of you. His thought that there was NO danger rang hollow when you had clearly threatened them. Aro had probably seen your ugly side in Alice's vision and was trying to settle his followers down.

"He is only a child, a weak child!!!" One said as he took a few steps closer to fighting, the wolves reacted by snarling. "AND they are in league with werewolves, our natural enemy!"

"So, you think I am weak, do you?" You asked, in an ominous voice. Your patience was being strained from the extra 2 hours that this was taking. The constant insulting was not helping either. With that decided you let go your full Vampire power. Your power almost exploded out and swirled around the whole field violently. You made it so that no one was injured, and your side was barely effected. However, the previously laughing and doubting lips were now quivering with the rest. "I don't have the time or patience to teach mere infants like you how to breathe! Attack or retreat, you have 30 seconds to decide or I will decide for you and wipe you all out!"

That last little bit, plus a little fire erupting in places because of your power was enough to cause them to scurry away like the rodents they are. Some actually tripped over each other to get away. You opened a section for them to retreat through and they did so. When you felt that they head sufficiently left and were staying away, you calmed and toned down your power to your normal human like presence. They rest of your side were looking at you as if you were a time bomb.

"What, too much?" You asked in a childlike tone. This seemed to snap them out of the temporary shock they were in.

"No, I think you just bought us a few hundred years before they try something like this again." Carlisle responded with a smile. "I honestly wish we knew you earlier."

"Us too!!!" Renesmee exclaimed and threw herself into your arms. She hadn't known you a long time. But, being closer to her age and not her parents, you were able to connect with her easier. You all laughed and started back to peace and quiet... well as much as it got in the Twighlight series....
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: The final confrontation.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Are you sure you have to go?" Belle asked.

The time after the confrontation was more or less spent donating your land to a neutral ground idea, where the werewolves and Vampires could both meet in peace... hopefully. For the moment, they agreed to the truce. The joined alliance against the Volturi could also be part of their appreciation for each other.

"Unfortunately, yes. Then again, I have been away from home for a few years. It will be good to get back." you answered back. The large group that had gathered to see you off was there in bulk. It made you feel good. It was a rather... interesting and relatively relaxing vacation. They seemed to all understand the position you were in. It was one instance that the drama filled side actually helped. If anything, they knew the value of a family bond.

"Are you ever going to tell us where you live?" Edward asked for the rest of them. They had been hounding you on that one as well. "What if we need you, again?"

"Some secrets are better left uncovered." you answered. You knew that revealing the typical movie reality would only harm the situation. Perhaps if you did it earlier, when you had time to deflate the situation, but now... not a good idea. You then went over to Renesmee and knelt down to meet her eye to eye. "I am sure you will be told this many times. But you are one special girl. Take it from an equally if not more different Vampire... Different is never a bad thing. You are going to do great things, I just know it."

With that you stood and nodded to her. Belle, Edward, and Jacob seemed to like the little peace of advice you gave. It wasn't often that you got to give advice like that to a hybrid vampire. It felt strangely... good. Plus, you felt that, in this drama filled realm, she would feel the feeling of being different one time or another.

"Thank you for allowing me to stay in each of your territories." you said finally, to mainly Carlisle and Sam. You would've included Jacob in there, but as Sam was the Alpha, or original one in a sense, you figured that the comment would filter down and up to the necessary people of consequence.

"It was a pleasure." Carlisle replied.

"An absolute honor." Sam agreed with a nod.

"Alright, I got to go. You all play nice now." You said comically, then after exchanging smirks with each of them over the comment, you turned and opened a portal.

You figured that it would be displayed as just another unexplained ability that you had. With them in wonder of the ability you used, you stepped through and started your travel back, making sure no one was following you. You weren't sure if anyone could follow you, but it was best to be careful. You were getting a little better at this portal thing. Although you guessed that it would take a few decades before you would be as good as Mr. Vale was at it. A ping of sadness hit you as you remembered that large man that was your first and hopefully last person that you would drink dry. Sure you had drank animals dry, and evil vampires. However, those were both evil, non-sapient, and fake relatively speaking. Mr. Vale was the first that you did of secure definition. He was a good person, and you had drank him dry. You knew that it was his choice, you had set him free by doing so, and it was ok morally. But you still felt a bit off from it. However, something inside you said it was ok, so you clung to that.

There was enough time to think and debrief from things before stepping into the real world again. You stepped through to the familiar setting of your family room in the basement. There was no one there and, so you checked the date and time on a nearby computer. It was about a week before you usually got back, and it was about 1 in the morning. So you didn't fault people for not being there. You saw a spider notice you, then scurry off, probably to inform Eve and others. Either way, you were back and safe.

Home sweet home!!!
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Leaving.

choices: You arrive in a calm manner.
You go full power and bust your way out.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You didn't want to be too obnoxious about getting back early. Waking everyone in the middle of the night would probably NOT be a good idea. So you sat in your chair and waited. You found it strange that you couldn't feel anyone in the house. There wasn't even that many spiders in there. But you were content in waiting for them. You thought that one of them walking in and seeing you there would be a great surprise. So, you waited, and if they didn't arrive by tomorrow then maybe they were Up North or something and you would take a quick run up there. As you waited, you began to think on the things you would need to brush up on upon coming back . School was going to start, events in the world, wars, police stuff, Vampire Clan stuff, and... THEM. The first few you thought about, but that last one... not so much. You didn't want to ruin your homecoming with thinking of THEM. So you put it from your mind. However, things don't always go the way you want, and a little messenger was about to pop your calm bubble.

"Sir, Mr. Vampire... sir?" Came a small voice from a 2 foot spider that crawled into the room. Actually it was a rather quick entry, which slightly surprised you. Mom was getting use to spiders but was far from having one do something like running down the hall like that.

"Before I get to the point of being out in the open, where my Mom can see you, what is it?" You asked pleasantly.

"My apologies, Master, Mother needs to speak to you as quickly as possible. She said to tell you it is about your family, and it is urgent!" He said as quickly as he could.

Without too much wasted time, you bent down and picked him up and teleported, almost at the same time. This slightly put the spider on edge, but knew better than to act out. If you wanted to kill him, he would let you, as a loyalty thing. But you didn't. So you just teleported you both to Eve's throne chambers. At your sudden presence, the spiders in the room hissed at a possible intruder, then as they saw it was you, gave some room and chattered happily. Eve was on her spot, or throne for lack of a better description. She was either resting or sleeping. But the moment you cam into view, her legs shot out and she bolted for you. The spider you teleported with scurried off in wake of his giant Mother coming so quickly. Eve grabbed you with her mandibles and hugged you tightly liked she always did. Although, as she got bigger, it looked more like she was trying to eat you, from an outside perspective.

"Oh, Caleb, I am so sorry, and happy, but so sorry I failed you!" She almost cried out. This concerned you. She was 'hugging' you pretty hard and she was shivering, not to mention her statement.

"It's ok, calm down. Tell me what happened." you said calmly. She slowly let you down and backed up, after you petting between her eyes a few times. She purred at this, but was still distraught with whatever she needed to tell you. She calmed a little more before she responded.

"Your family, they have been taken." She blurted out.

"Taken...? What do you mean?" You asked, suddenly very serious and concerned.

"You know, those Kohlers, the magic users?" She asked, as if jogging your memory.

"Yes?" you responded back.

"Well, they didn't take too kindly to your little bluff when they searched and found that the Reaper in question was not there anymore. So, they watched your family for a little bit. When they say Brad and Kelsey in their true forms, and heard magic talk, they took them." she explained.

"Them, you mean Kelsey and Brad?!" you asked, not liking where this was going. You were secretly hoping that it was the case.

"No... well yes... but not just them. They used their influence and grabbed your whole family, EVERYONE!" she cried out. You took a few steps back to catch yourself. You didn't know what to think or do at the moment. "I am so sorry Caleb! I promised to keep your family safe, and I couldn't do it. They even killed the hell hounds that you placed to protect them. I couldn't protect them, your family, my family!!!"

It took a while to get yourself under control and composed. THEY, had took YOUR family? You were so going to have to deal with this. But you couldn't do this in vengeance... ok, maybe part of it. But you couldn't afford to just go in there and start slaughtering people.

"Eve, it is ok. You did what you could. I don't blame you. However, I need your help to free them. Can you do that?" You asked, trying to get the emotional spider back on track.

"Y-yes, I can help. I WILL help!" She stated, with a great deal of conviction.

"Ok, I need to know where they are, how and when they were taken, why no attempt was made to free them, and why people didn't drop what I am at this point. I can't imagine that some of my younger cousins and siblings would not say something like that, especially since the Kohlers usually torture the people they abduct like this." You asked/stated.

"We tried to go get them, but a mage's house is not a small thing to do that too. As it stands, even if all the k-9 allies and insect allies were to come together, we wouldn't be able to get into a well occupied Mage's house. The Kohler's have all their family there. They were taken about a month ago, they used very high level magic and threats of people they already captured to take them." Eve answered dutifully.

"And why hasn't someone dropped my name yet?" You asked. They had previously stated that if the Kohlers knew who you were, they would 'beg for your forgiveness'. So you were wondering why they were still being held.

"All of us tried, at one point or another. But, they want proof. Since you were gone, they said that we are just trying to deceive them and they couldn't be wrong. As they put it, 'an example must be made'. That damned arrogance of theirs, wont allow them to see anything past their own conclusions." Eve almost hissed out.

"Well then, I suppose I should go give them a visit then, shouldn't I." You stated, rather than ask.

"You want me to come?" She asked.

"No, if they push me, I will pull my protection from them, with the Reapers. I don't want you getting caught in the feeding frenzy." you answered.

"Thanks, Caleb. I am glad you are back. We all missed you. Despite needing you for this whole thing, I still missed you regardless. We all did!" she stammered out, ending with brushing her face against your body. She then backed up and looked seriously at you. "Ok, please go teach those Kohlers a lesson!"

"Count on it!" you declared, with a smirk, then teleported away to save your family. You didn't know how you would handle it, but one thing is for sure. The Kohlers.... they were not going to forget this day.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Bad mages...

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content: You decide to take a calm yet fun approach to this. After debating in your head you slowly approach the door, ring the doorbell, and RUN! You make it into the street and then turn into mist to see what happens. You notice barriers drop from around the house as the butler walks out onto the patio. You then flow up to him and then .......
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You arrive in a calm manner.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
On your way there you had to decided what and how you were going to do all of this. At first you wanted to just go all out and bust down the door. It would certainly be easier so just slaughter everyone. You remembered what King had said. If you were at full power, it didn't allow any magic to be done in a certain area around you. However, you didn't know too much about that, so you didn't want to risk it. Also, you weren't too interested in slaughtering everyone. After all, they weren't evil, just arrogant. Despite your bias against that kind of thing, it wasn't grounds for genocide. So you decided to teach them a lesson. You didn't like it, that it would require you to tell them, or more accurately show them, you are a vampire. However, odds were that your family already tried telling them that. So, with that decided, you appeared at the end of their yard, knowing that going in as any type of supernatural force would set off every magical alarm in the place. You had also stopped at home and filled belly and reserves with as much blood as you could stand. You had a feeling that you'd be needing it. Being at full power for a long period of time was draining enough, but fighting as well and holding back would probably be more than just a little blood to power. With everything ready, you walked to the door.

You could feel now the magical barriers, both in front of you protecting the house and around the yard. Maybe you could sense them because your body knew what to look for now. Either way, you had a feeling that it would be best to play the week card. Just until you found your family. You needed to make sure that all your family was ok, and all that. Starting off might put them in danger. So you went up to the door, despite some new eyes watching you, and knocked. It wasn't long before the Butler came to the door and opened. You wondered for a moment, why they would just open the door. Then again, they probably had a few too many charms and barriers up to prevent people and otherwise hostile forces from forcing their way inside.

"Ah, the last arrival." The Burler said out of turn. He seamed to catch himself and posed to restart. However, you knew what he meant. You were the last of your family to be brought there. They must've thought you were in hiding. Seeing you knocking at their door must've been.... interesting to say the least. "Mr. Konel, welcome back. The Masters have been expecting you."

"So it would seam." you answered with a little bow of respect. You didn't really respect him, but you wanted to maintain a calm, composed, and respectful manner about you. If they were going to act out against you, it wouldn't be for any rudeness you did. He ushered you in after that and had you stand in the same room as you and Kelsey did before. However, unlike before, they didn't wait to talk. You were surprised by this actually. You thought they would at least give you a chance to explain yourself. Their curiosity must've been tripped. But you were hit with something. From your torture experience from them before, you knew it as a gravity spell. It basically forced you to face plant on the floor, with an audible 'thud!'

"I have to admit." Started Mr. Kohler as he walked down the stair and stood above you. The spell was so strong that you couldn't move even enough to touch him, despite him being only a few inches away, not unless you went full power at least, and you weren't ready for that yet. "... I didn't expect that you'd come here of all places. I thought you would go to the police and we'd have to use our connections to get you here, or something equally as futile."

At this you tried to talk. You tried to tell him why you were there, and what a mistake he was making. You wanted to give them a chance, but your vocal cords were clinched somehow. At your attempt, there was pain from yet another spell.

"Did I say you could talk? No, I think not. Your family has not learned their place. They even won over some mythical beings. Which is no doubt because you spilled information about my family. Information that we expressly imprinted on you NEVER to tell. Yet you still defied us, your superiors. We will... teach you how much of a mistake that was. Although, I am not without mercy, I will put you with the rest of your family, reunite you with them as it were. They are a bit worn out at the moment." He mused and instructed, the last part with a smirk, as if proud of their work. The whole time he was speaking he used a self gratifying and arrogant tone. As if only they mattered and they were on top of the world. "Beth, be a dear and ESCORT him to their cell."

"Yes, Daddy!" Beth said as she came into view. She gave him a little kiss on the cheek then kicked you in the gut hard enough to send you across the room. It must've been a magical kick to be able to do that. She then continued to do that, kicking you down stair, through hallways, and finally into a cell. "THAT was for telling me that there was a Reaper around when it wasn't."

With that, she closed the door and a magical field activated over the bars. You were almost instantly swarmed by hands and arms. You soon found that they were the loving, if not highly battered arms of your family. With the magical field around the bars, the spells on you were cancelled. You stayed in a helpless condition until Beth left the room. After that, you got up to address those in the room.

"Caleb!" Kelsey called as she hugged you so hard she nearly crushed your back. At this point her full Succubus form was out. You had a feeling she did that to help their case, well it didn't, apparently. But it was still nice to see her and embrace her. "We all missed you!"

"Sorry I left with all of this happening." you apologized to her and around her, as she wasn't letting go yet. She backed off a little to give you room to address everyone.

"It's ok, we knew you would come for us when you got back. It wasn't like you knew they would do this." Grandpa Konel said.

For the next little bit, it was basically a heal and catch up session. You would heal their wounds and then take a little blood for your escape option, while talking and exchanging stories. Theirs was just like Kelsey and your time with the Kohlers the first time, except they didn't let them go yet. You wowed them with things from the other realms and they liked that you had gotten stronger. However, eventually, you got to a point that got you a bit mad. Cassy. As Sarah held her newly born daughter for you to heal, you saw that not even Cassy was saved from the torture.

"They have gone way to far with this one." you said as you healed her, making Cassy laugh at the weird sensation, making most smile as a result, then back to your serious face. "They are lucky that I have an aversion from killing people on a whim."

"True, but I don't think anyone would mind of you added a little something extra to whatever butt kicking you are planning." Mom said, slightly spiteful but with the approval from the room. She loved kids, and that her only grandchild was tortured so young, didn't do any favors for the Kohlers.

At that moment, the door opened to the cell block and a few Kohlers came in. Apparently they did this to get people to torture. One would get the person, while the others handled crowd control. It had been a few hours since you arrived. But you were in no mood to entertain them. All your family was now healed and you were ready to get out of their, they shared that feeling as well, obviously.

"You, it is your turn!" Said a man, probably Beth's uncle, as Beth was in the group as well. He was pointing to your Mother.

"I don't think so." you said as you waved everyone back, away from the door. They knew things could get very chaotic when you were at full power. Yet they hadn't seen it for a while, and you had gotten a lot stronger since then. Brad was next to you though. You nodded for him to get back and protect your family if needed. He nodded and went to them.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You go full power and bust your way out.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Get out of the way, Caleb." Beth said with a flick of her hand. You felt a spell form and an impact hit you. But, unlike before, you had no intension of reacting like a human. So you let it hit you, and it didn't make you budge an inch. she tried a few more times, and nothing. They took notice of this. You were glaring at them intently, making some flinch from it, and you didn't even have your Vampire features out yet. "What the heck!"

"You, have gone way too far this time. I brushed off when you tortured me and Kelsey because we could handle it. But now you target my family and think that I won't retaliate... Well, you thought wrong." You said, trying to control your breathing so you didn't lose control of yourself.

"Why should we care if you fight back?" The Uncle said in an arrogant tone. He didn't even give you time to answer as he used a spell and it cut you soundly in two. "There, anymore heroes that..." he started, but then was caught dumbstruck as your two haves started to come together again, as the mist brought them and mended them together again. "That in the... What are you?...":

"As they have said, I am the Vampire!" You said as you connected. With this said you didn't wait for them to understand. You let loose your full Vampire power.

At this your appearance changed like it usually did. The energy you were emitting shattered the bars around you. Now that Magic was no use inside the area you were in, you could destroy or make anything you wished, unlike before. You could guess that the whole house was experience the same effects as magical alarms were going off everywhere. People with you were almost as scared as the people that you were against. It wasn't every day that they say their loving family member and friend turn into... this. The entire area was riddling with all the effects that you could do. Throwing things, increasing gravity, causing static discharges, fires in other areas, and much more. But you kept your group safe from such things. Then you started walking towards the door.

"Wait, we..." The Uncle started. Bt you had no patience for it at this point. With a wave of your hand, you through the group, along with a crippling and dumbfounded Beth, to the farthest point of the room and the landed on each other in a messy drooling heap of people.

"Let's go." you said to your family as you nodded for them to follow. They had broken out of their shock and started to realized that no matter how scary you got, you were still Caleb. So they followed as you blew the cell door off its hinges and started walking down the hall that Beth had kicked you down just a few hours ago. Sucks for them that they didn't make you wear a hood or something like that. Every Kohler that tried to do or say something ended up in a drooling heap in a corner somewhere. You also added a nightmare session you had developed so they wouldn't forget what happened and your vampire form would haunt them for a few days. Eventually you got to the front door to find a group of older individuals bowing to your group as you all approached. Apparently they had finally realized their folly and had come to respect you, and perhaps beg for your forgiveness. Mr. Kohler raised his head in a very pitiful expression to start talking. But you weren't going to let him. With a wave, you pinned all them to a wall. You were running out of power, so you had to make this quick.

"I don't care what you have to say. I don't care what your reasons were. I really don't care about you mages at all. In fact, I don't care to the level that I am calling a situational open season on your family with the reapers. If they sense any magic from any one of your family, no matter the age or reason, even in self-defense, they have my blessing to come after the offending mage, but no one else. I want nothing to do with you, your family, or your kind. I swear, the next time I hear of one of you, even touching one of my family or someone I find value in, I will corral every Reaper in the world to your family and make sure they know that it is meal time. LEAVE US ALONE!!!"

With that, you sent them across the room like you had so many others that evening. When you all got outside you scaled back your power and heaved a sigh of relief.

"Well, that's over now."
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Do it calmly.

choices: Football, a new and equally unfair sport for you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You almost fainted when you got home from rescuing everyone. They and you underestimated how much power it took for you to go to full power. Although, it was well worth it. You also knew that there was a few things to work on. Getting your full powered form to last longer than an hour would take some heavy duty condition training. But that was for later. For now, you were relaxing and enjoying the time with your family. They each thanked you and you all had a decent amount of Q&A time with each other. A few wanted to know how your time in the Twighlight realm was, while others just were wondering how powerful you had gotten, in the aftermath of you showing your full power. Eventually, it was just you and Kelsey. Eve would've been there, and you did visit again... a few times. But she was WAY to big for the family room at this point. So, it was just you and Kelsey.

"So, how was it really?" Kelsey asked.

"How was what?" You asked back, not sure what she was referring to. To be honest, should could've been talking about anything. Your realm visit, your power, your diet,...

"Being that powerful. I mean, I know you are always really strong. But being so strong that nothing can touch you... it has to be... exhilarating." She clarified.

"Well, it was... kind of. However, it was also a bit draining. Not just in the usual blood usage sense. When I am that way, my human life, the one I hold onto so hard, seems to be move away even more." You responded, a little somber about it.

"Is that bad? I don't mean to be insensitive, but you aren't human anymore. Why do you want to hold onto something that doesn't apply anymore?" She asked, confused.

"It is hard to explain. It is one end that you, perhaps, will never understand. I suppose that it would be like you turning to human. Regardless how well you adjusted to your new life, you would still miss the old one. You wouldn't want to say goodbye to your Mother, just because you changed species. Same here, I want what I had before. Maybe not in physical stature, but the concept of it. I want the love of my family, the wonder at seeing new things, the enjoyment of seeing my Niece being born. I don't want to loose that. As a Vampire, it is possible to look at everyone and everything as just food or objects. I don't want to do that... does that make any sense???" You asked, bouncing around different topics.

"Yeah, well I guess I understand as much as I can. You're right though, I couldn't imagine the change that you have undergone to get the way you are. What you miss, what you don't, and everything in between. I almost wish that I knew you before you were turned, just so I could see the difference. Then again, if I had known you sooner, I probably wouldn't be the same person I am now." She responded.

"Yeah..." You answered. You didn't mean to do it, but you accidentally put a little contemplative memory recalling in your voice. You knew she heard it, in hindsight. Too late to hide that fact now.

"Uh, oh, I just hit a bad memory, didn't I?" She asked. You hadn't done it often, but every once in a while she hit a raw memory from your past. Sometimes you shared it, sometimes you didn't. But per her offer to help you through things, you tried opening up to her. She and Eve were your closest friends, but she was by far the closest out of those two. Eve understood that Kelsey would be. There was no jealousy between the two. At times they got together themselves to hang out, without you. You were glad to have Kelsey there all the time to help.

"Perhaps a little one, not that important thought. I had forgot about it, until now." You answered, indicating that you didn't really want her to hear about it, but she could tread if she wanted, just to be careful. She knew your little emotions and their tells quite well. It helped being a mystical being. Her perception was higher and she could pick up on small things to tell your mood.

"Well, judging on what I was talking about, you probably have a memory of me before I remember meeting you. And judging on the tone you used, I probably didn't make a very good impression." She said, a little guilt creeping in her voice.

"No need to worry about it. I have put it in the past, where it belongs." You stated, putting on a smile and trying to change the subject. "So, you coming back to school, now that the Kohlers aren't going to be a problem?"

"Yeah, my Mom said that as long as you are there with me, she will allow me to attend. Thanks for that by the way. Home school is not nearly as exciting as it sounds." she answered with a smirk. You knew she meant the amount of people around. Despite the drama, she liked being social, even with humans. She also liked being admired. Most girls would be offended by being ogled all the time. But that was kind of a Succubus thing. They were just naturally sexually attractive and took great pride in it.

"Yeah, Colin, Dani, and Tou will be happy you're back!" you winked.

"Yeah, almost forgot about that..." she mock cringed.

"Hey, they aren't that bad!" You joked.

To be fair, they weren't that bad. Kelsey was just used to a more hands off and less formal approach when dealing with humans, that weren't related to you. Sure some of your family members admired her as a woman/girl. But they were like family to her, and her to them. She took the odd crush inside the family as a good natured teasing moment. She even helped a few with girl problems and advice. One of the more nerdy cousins didn't have a girl to ask for homecoming. So she went with him and made his night. Like really, what High School girl can compare with a succubus of any age?

"I suppose not." She said with a smile. You were both looking forward to another year at school. From all the weirdness of the summer, you both were craving the slow paced norm of a school year.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: R&R.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Why in the world would I do that?" You asked Luke as he tried to convince you to join the football team.

Mr. Havel was your school's wrestling coach. He was VERY successful in that respect. Sent people to the State Tournament every year, and every year at least one placed, with the occasional 1st place. The team was defending conference champions for 6 years in a row, and he went out of his way for the team, students, and the school in that area. He was also the gym teacher, which made the wrestlers his unofficial favorites in the classes he taught them in. However, he was not the best MORAL character to follow at a Christian school. So you were grateful but just not as connected as some of the others. He got particularly peeved when you had to cancel the state tournament on your end. You would get as far as the Regional tournament, win the whole thing, then say you couldn't make it to the State. What he didn't know was that you were busy with Summer training and Vampire stuff during that time. So, without a "good" reason, he was a little put off. However, you did win them a bunch of matches and whatnot, so, after a very long talk, and no persuasion from you, the two of you came up with an understanding. You would make every Wrestling match you could, including normal, invites, and tournaments and he wouldn't press you when you said you couldn't make it.

He had also been trying to get you into football. As he was the most successful, results wise, at the school. The School asked him to coach their high school football team. It might also have something to do with the fact that the school didn't like spending extra money, so they double lots of the teachers in other areas. So, this is where you were now. Mr. Havel new that of all the people he knew of, there were only two people that you listened to in situations like this; Kelsey, and Luke. So he put you two in a quiet room, at Luke's request, and was having him talk to you about it.

"Why not?" Luke asked back.

"Why not? Really? Even putting aside how royally unfair it would be, even when I am holding back. And that I could accidentally snap someone in half from a simple twitch in the wrong direction. I would be in the middle of the spotlight for everyone to see. Meaning I would have to say no to not only wrestling scholarships, but football ones as well." You replied, with a look that indicated that Luke knew that already.

"Ok, that was a stupid question to ask I guess. But, Wrestling you do for fun and as a form of training. Why can't you do the same with Football?" Luke asked. Unlike you, he was already signed up and ready to go. He had been practicing with the team and all that too. Technically, the time to sign up was over. But they REALLY wanted you this year. Luke was the only person out there that knew why in more detail.

"And what would I be training while knocking humans on their can over and over again?" You asked, not really getting it. You could've just read his mind. But you induced that would be rude to say the least and told your family that you would refrain from doing that, unless the situation called for it. They differed to your judgment for that.

"You said that you had to practice with your full power right?" Luke asked.

"Yes???" you asked and answered back.

"Well, what if you go full power underneath a helmet where no one can see you. If they remark on your eyes you can say you got contacts to freak people out on the other side of the line. You can fog your face mask like you do to hide anything else. As far as your other... stuff you can do. You can use power to control things, like the wind and noise in the area. That with the restraining and constant drain should help with your training, right?" Luke answered and asked.

"You've been thinking about this for a while, haven't you?" you asked rhetorically. He just nodded and smiled, as he saw that you were coming around. "Ok, I will do it. But same rules as my wrestling. I can't do summer practices. Those started in August, and I am still in other realms at that time. As long as you all can handle that, I suppose I can do a lineman job in football, while training I guess..." You replied back, Luke's eyes getting wider and happier with every word you said. Mr. Havel was pacing outside and looked in the window every once in a while. But at this, you saw a wide grin on his face too, as you both came out of the room.

"So, Luke talked some good sense into you?" Mr. Havel asked and complimented at the same time.

"In a way. I am still insanely busy in the summer. I won't be able to make the practices then. But if you can deal with that, I suppose I can deal with a lineman role or something." You answered.

"That is good to hear! I still think you would make a killer running back, with all the speed and power you have. But I will take a little more defense and offense from you as a lineman." He answered with a slap on the back. "Now, if you will excuse me, I need to get ready for class and practice. Thanks again, both of you."

"No Problem..." You and Luke said at the same time with a wave, indicating that you were still brothers, and close ones at that.

"Yeah, see, I am helping!" She said, giving you a kiss on the cheek too. She pulled back and blushed herself at the sudden action that her body probably did on impulse. 1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
It was a normal day, or rather a rather pleasant normal day. Nothing really was going wrong. You were walking around the city as you did from time to time to make sure that Dracula was doing right with his job to have is people not run wild and doing crimes. To your joy, you hardly caught anyone doing anything like that. In fact, the city was enjoying less crime than it did for a VERY long time. In the middle of your rather pleasant walk, you were interrupted by an unforeseen impact to your chest that sent you flying back. You had no doubt what it was, a sniper round and a rather large one with probably an explosive round, because the hole it left in your chest was about a foot in diameter. It took out all your organs at once. You were fine, as it wasn’t any bit of silver, but you stayed down in an apparent dead state. You wanted to find out who or what did this, and why.

“Confirming target down.” Said a man that had just stepped into the alley, now dirtied with your blood. He was obviously some kind of agent, of what agency you didn’t know. “Send cleaner.”

After this point a few men came around and began to ‘clean’ the area, and you. You were slightly impressed by how they were able to do their work. They put you in a tub and started a process or ‘cleaning’ you. They were about to inject things into you, but saw that your heart would be unable to circulate it, since there was a huge hole in your chest in place of a majority of your organs, including your heart. So they set about melting down your body in acid. You of course weren’t really melting, you were just making it look like it was working while turning your body into mist so fine that you entered the body of the ‘agent’ that was residing over the event and probably the one that shot you, judging by the sniper rifle he was putting away. Anyway, as you entered his body you hoped he would bring you to the one in charge and not to some place random.

You were a bit lucky that he did exactly that. You observed everything around him/you as he went to a secret bunker of a base, through security, and to a debriefing of some sort. He entered a room with a single man in a chair behind his desk and stood, waiting to be addressed.

“Michael, I take it that you were successful?” Asked the man.

“Yes sir…” he responded. You were slowly seeping out of his body at this point. While being in someone else’s body was a good way to follow unnoticed and get some extra blood for your trouble, it was also a pain if done too long.

“What is it?” asked the man behind the desk.

“Sir, I didn’t see the point of this mission.” He stated then continued. “I can’t understand why this… boy was a threat to anyone. The most aggressive thing I saw him do was hit someone on the football field perhaps a little too hard, but was quick to help them up.”

You silently gave the man props. He was following you and you didn’t realized it. This human was good.

“As it turns out, he was deeply involved with the Vampire clan. Birkhoff was able to crack their system and found him in their files. Not much, but enough to indicate that he was well protected and involved.” Said the man.

“Ok, is there anything else sir?” asked Michael. You read into his mind and noticed that he obviously didn’t like killing children. That won him some more points with you.

“No, you may go.” Said the man. You stayed in the room to see what happens next. You took note where the devices in the room were. You would need to secure the room if you were to speak to this man. It wasn’t long before he picked up the phone and made a call. “Yes, it’s me.”

“Percy, did you do it?” asked the other man. You recognized his voice as one of the Beth Kohler’s uncles, Frank if you remembered correctly. His voice was highly anxious.

“Relax, we took care of it, like I said we would.” He replied with a smile that you wanted to smack off.

“And you are sure no one will know of this… arrangement. My family would kill me if they knew, not to mention some of the other forces out there.” He asked, very nervous. You really didn’t like the Kohler’s at all, but at least it wasn’t the family that had ordered this, just one of them.

“Frank, you don’t need to worry. We specialize in keeping secrets.” He replied while you saw in his mind that he was preparing a file on you and this whole thing to put on something called a ‘black box’. “Now I believe you owe me something, your knowledge of magic.”

“Just one thing, how did you kill him?” He asked.

“If you must know, an explosive sniper round. His chest was no longer there, along with his major organs, then disposed of the body by melting him down with acid.” Percy revealed, which got a gasp from Frank. “If you didn’t want to know, you shouldn’t ask.”

“Tell me you used silver, like I requested.” Frank gasped out.

“There was no need. We got him.” Percy said with an air or arrogance.

“You fool! He is probably there now! You have killed us both! He will not be happy! He is…” Frank exclaimed but you interrupted him by starting to form your body in the room. First a hand that took the phone from Percy’s now shaking hand. You sealed the room and made all electronics useless, except the phone you now held. Percy’s eyes started bugging out as your body formed from your mist. You held the phone to your head.

“You’ll hear from me soon.” You said to Frank Kohler then hung up as you fully formed in the room. You took a spot floating in the air, in a reclining position. “You know, I was having a rather pleasant day before you people decided to interrupt it with a bullet.”

“I…I… W-what are… who are you?” Percy stuttered out.

“I am the boy you just ordered killed.” You stated, making him sweat.

“Sorry, I didn’t know…” he started to which you just cut him off.

“I already know that. I take great pains to keep myself hidden. However, that leave us with a problem doesn’t it? You are now revealed yourself as an enemy, or at least one that would kill innocents and children. That is a problem; while I can handle a bullet in the chest, my family can’t. So now they are in danger. What do you suppose I should do about that?” You stated asked.

“I… I swear that Division will not pursue you or your family.” Percy stated, suddenly realizing what a problem he had. “And the Vampire Clan.”

“You are missing the point. I care not for human concerns besides that of my family and friends. While I make sure that the Vampire Clan isn’t stepping on my toes, I don’t rule them and don’t care if you slaughter all of them, or not.” You started, then lifted him with your power to which he started sweating a great deal. “I can read your mind. Your little black boxes don’t bother me. That is a human concern, so I have no problem killing you to secure my family’s safety and I don’t trust you to keep your word. It seems like killing you would be the easiest way to prevent you from being a pain later.”

“Please, I can be of use to you! I can!” He exclaimed.

“I don’t believe you. However, unlike you, I don’t overly enjoy killing people. So shut up while I find a way to deal with you and keep you alive.” You said then went into deep thought.

It was hard enough for you to kill in other realms when you knew the people were evil and wouldn’t have any ill effects. But in your own realm, you had no knowledge of what would happen if you killed someone so high up in the government, or whatever branch this ‘Division’ was. Besides the potential world war that those Black Boxes could create, he seemed to be holding many strings that would go unchecked if he was killed. Then Kamper had an idea and whistled twice. A few spiders came up from areas of the room and stood on the desk as well as a hell hound. Percy’s eyes bugged out as he saw them, not so much the spiders but the Hell hound was not something humans liked to see, and didn’t even know they existed.

“I have an… alliance with spiders and Hell hounds to name a few. THEY will keep an eye on you. If they find you mentioning me or my family in any capacity that spreads my information or danger to them, they will communicate it to me and deal with you on the spot.” You explained then nodded to the Hell Hound to which it roared then dove into Percy’s chest, causing a bit of pain then looked as if he was absorbing it until it was gone. “He will be in you for a very long time. And not to worry, he is invisible to human scans and will keep that switch in your heart going if he has to kill you.”

With that you dropped him onto the ground, he crumpled to the ground then wearily got up.

“Silenced Percy?” Michael asked, not as scared as Percy but still highly on edge.

“You impress me. Even with me holding you blink away from death, you still ask about someone else. Anyway, I’ve implanted a Hell Hound in him. If he so much as types a key stroke about, to, or against me or mine in any fashion the Hell Hound will tear him apart very painfully and very slowly. Now about you…” You answered and moved on. “I implanted the Hell Hound into him because I don’t trust him. However, from your mind, I can see that you are a different person as far as trust is concerned. I don’t think I have to keep an eye on you, do I?”

“I… No, you don’t.” He answered.

“Good, I would hate to send something dark and dangerous to deal with you. So, this is what I want. You and this… “Division” will leave me and my family/ friends alone and I will leave Division alone and not order your or any other’s death. But if I find that letting you two live was a mistake… well then I will have to clean house… understood?” You asked.

“Yes we…” Percy started but you clenched his throat and he squawked at the sudden pressure, gasping for air as well.

“I wasn’t talking to you, Human.” You bellowed at him with a glare then looked back to Michael.

“Uh… yes… WE will not pursue you or your people.” Michael said out.

“Good.” You stated then let them go. Michael landed on his feet while Percy, once again, slumped to the ground, this time gasping his throat and coughing. Shortly, they both were on their feet and looking to you, wondering if you had anything else to tell them. To that you started disappearing again, Michael’s eyes bugged out as this was the first time he had seen you do that. “Word of warning, this was me asking nicely. Betray the small amount of trust I have in you at your own peril.”

With that you disappeared from the room and zoomed through the air toward where you felt a Reaper. It sensed you and tried to flee but you used your power to surround it, then formed in front of it. It was obviously scared out of its pants…. If it had pants. But either way, it was intently listening. Even an almost soulless creature like this had enough sense to know that you wanted something from it, because even a glancing wind with your energy in it could kill this thing. Its life was in your hands. As if to further beg, it bowed to you so you didn’t need to see its rotten looking face that almost made you hurl as soon as you saw it.

“I have a meal for you.” You stated, your voice making the creature shudder, both in excitement. Without using any Vampire energy you sent it a mental identification of Frank Kohler. “That man has a great amount of magic energy and has proven to be unworthy and my enemy. You are to go and have your fill of him and him alone. However, leave his health untouched and a very small amount of magic left in him. I want him to remember what he lost and how. Understood?”

The creature nodded without looking up. It must’ve known that it was unsightly for most of everything else. You had even heard rumors that they didn’t like looking at each other. It also screeched a type of affirmative screech. You slightly cringed at the sound. It was like nails on a chalkboard. With that you let him go and he rushed off to do your bidding. You followed to make sure it knew that he was not to cross you. You slightly marveled at how it just bypassed the magical barriers around the Kohler house and went straight for Frank as he was trying to leave the house, probably to run from you. He dropped his things but was too late to do anything as the thing grabbed him and started sucking the magic out of him. As you suspected, when Frank was forced to look into the face of the Reaper he hurled. But since the Reaper was holding him, he hurled all over his front. When the Reaper was done it dropped him and sped off, to get as far away from you as possible. As grateful as it was for the meal, it didn’t have any plans to stay anywhere near you.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“You seem excited!?” asked Kelsey as you all got off the plane.

You and your whole family, including Kelsey and her Mother, had received tickets and pretty much free everything to go down to Orlando Florida to a very nice Walt Disney World resort named ‘Old Key West’ for a week along with Annual passes and a bunch of stuff to make any excuse for going a moot point. You had a suspicion that Percy was the one behind it, but as this was far from attacking your family, you let it slide.

“Well of course I am. You know, I’ve been working, fighting, training, and all that. Even as a child I’ve never been here before, but always wanted to.” You replied as you looked around at your uncles and Aunts trying to settle down their kids.

“But Disney promotes the use of Magic. While most of that is in movies, I would put money on the fact that they have some form of magic user here. And for them to not attract Reapers or not have problems with them… they must have a very impressive form of it and defenses.” Kelsey replied, knowing all too well that your dislike for magic, due in no small part to the Kohlers, was very high.

“I know. I also know that a great deal of the show that isn’t magic will be lost on me because of my mind and body’s habit for looking to the flaws, it might deter some entertainment out of it. But I am here to have fun and to nerd out a little bit. Let’s just have fun as humans. If they by chance have magic here, I am hoping that they have a system that lets people like us have fun as well. An organization like them can’t be this big without having ran into mythical beings before. So, being so known for hospitality, they probably have that covered as well.” You replied, almost begging for her to have fun as well.

“You’re right about that.” Brad said to which you Kelsey’s mother just nodded in agreement as she moved along. “Disney has had a long standing relationship with most, if not all, types of beings. Even King has gone there once or twice. A great deal of people with actual abilities go there then stay and help make Disney… even more magical, real magic. Trust me, having someone that is adept at magic perfecting a magic show is much more efficient. You will not be disappointed.”

“Really!!! This is going to be the best ever!!!” Isaac replied. He was excited beyond belief about going to Disney. But now hearing that there was actual magic there made it all the more exciting. He then went over and started spreading the word, which made the recently calmed kids go into a frenzy again.

“So. How relaxed are we allowed to get?” Kelsey’s Mother asked with a wink to you that meant she probably wanted to have some Succubus fun. Kelsey just shook her head. Sure she had those urges too, but aside from wanting to impress you with her restraint, she was still a teen and was embarrassed about her Mother talking openly about sensual or sexual activities.

“Take it easy. I am guessing that Disney has measures in place to keep both their guests and their employees relatively safe. It would really stink if our fun and relaxing time was cut short for that reason.” You answered in a concerned tone.

“Don’t worry. I know that full well. I tried many years ago to have ‘fun’ here, Succubus style. Let’s just say that there are very compelling reasons why I will not be indulging.” She said. It was lucky that she dodged the graphic terminology because one of your younger cousins heard and came to ask her a question.

“Do you mean Mickey will keep magic people in line?” He asked.

“You bet he does.” She said as she stroked his cheek, making him blush and rush off excited as ever.

It was an easy trick for her, but one Kelsey was just learning. Not only could a Succubus compel people in a non-slave manner by kissing them on the cheek instead of lips, but they could invoke certain emotions but just their touch. It was something to do with their body heat and pheromones being injected into people. While their lips were the most potent form of this, only following their private area, they could with training make their touch do a very small version of this. You had allowed them to do so on your family only to help with their training to resist attractants and such… and as long as they didn’t go too far.

“Ah, Mom...!” Kelsey moaned in an irritated tone that all teens had, then she continued to walk with you to begin a much deserved family Vacation.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Amusement parks are for Vampires too...

choices: Dumbledore has a gift for you!
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Excuse me, Sir, Can you come with us for a moment?” Asked one of the Disney employees or ‘Cast Members’ as they were called. He and a few others were corralling, mainly the non-human members of your family.

“What’s this about?” You asked, Kelsey’s Mom and Brad seemed to know what was going on, but weren’t stressing, so you weren’t on edge either.

“You’ll see. They are known partially for hospitality for a reason…” Brad answered.

You all were brought into a room with a table of people sitting at it and a large pentagram looking mark on the floor. One might assume that it was just another magical decoration that Disney seamed to thrive on, but you could tell that it had magic in it.

“Please, one at a time, step into the circle. It will let us know who and what each of you are so we can properly provide for your every need. If we have questions, we will ask them now so you can enjoy a wonderful and magical time here at Disney!” Said an old looking man at the center of the table. Honestly he looked like a real time version of Dumbledore from Harry Potter, complete with the robes and everything. You could sense great amounts of magic from him, which put you on edge and wondered if he was in fact Dumbledore. After all, you could travel to other movie realms, why not someone else…?

“Ma’am…?” The old man gestured to Kelsey’s Mother. She strode into the circle with an aura of pride. When she reached the center and stood still it started to glow and more symbols appeared and seamed to float in the air, before coming to rest on the tablets the group of people were holding at the table. Some mumbled in an approving manner and one younger young man followed her form as she exited the circle. “Ah, Ms. Dremer, welcome back! I trust you will have another enjoyable time in this land of Magic!”

“Oh, I plan to!” She stated as she settled by the exit door, waiting for the others.

This happened in a like fashion many times, then Brad entered.

“Mr. Kitsune, it is rare we have someone of your stature here. But seeing as you helped build this place, we will afford you every comfort available. However, we must ask, why have you returned? We thought you left to be on the K-9 council. Have they let you go???” Asked the old man.

“Not at all. I was given a task.” He replied.

“What task would that be?” The old man asked.

“In short, to do whatever this one says.” Brad replied as he pointed to you.

“Why would…?” The old man started amongst the murmuring of the others, but then he seemed to suspect something and nodded to which Brad exited the Circle, leaving only you at the entrance, looking nervously at the circle. “Don’t worry, young man, it won’t hurt you.”

“I… just don’t like magic very much. I don’t trust it.” You replied, still not really relishing whatever magic was at work here.

“They you travel in strange company. A Kitsune like Brad has much magic at his disposal….” The old man stated and the others chuckled at, to which you glared at them and they seemed to cut their laughter short.

“Uh… My friend here has been on the receiving end of some… misbehaving mages in the recent past…” Brad explained, to which they seemed to change from a nervous comical response, to a pitiful one.

“Oh, I see. Well, rest assured, we are not here to harm you in any way. This circle will only allow us to better serve you, one of our honored guests. It couldn’t harm you even if we wanted it to. Please, trust me, if you don’t trust the circle…” The old man said.

“Then what is your name?” You asked. “So I can rip your head off if you decide to imprison me for torture or something like that.”

“My name is Dumbledore… Ah, I see my name has you thinking of the movie, doesn’t it. Well, I was placed here by a lovely and deceptively young lady with a thing for blood… if that helps…” Dumbledore said. This confirmed that Miss. Isibelle had brought him here from another realm to reside in this world and probably protect or help protect Disney. Even if Disney wasn’t associated with Harry Potter at the moment, Miss. Isibelle still had put him here for a reason.

With no further objections, you stepped into the circle and went directly to the center. They seemed to be used to that response. It did seem that every mythical being in the world had a deep respect, appreciation, and fear of even the term Vampire. But the Circle didn’t glow blue like it did with the others, instead it turned red and exploded with symbols that made their way to the tablets. This made the people at the table, very nervous.

“My goodness!” Dumbledore stated in partial awe, and partial delight. “So, it is you, at last. Lady Isibelle had said she would be passing soon. I wondered when we would have the pleasure of meeting!”

“I hope that is a good thing… The last person from… another realm that was waiting for me on the order of Miss. Isibelle ripped me apart…” You stated and asked.

“Goodness no Boy!” Dumbledore gasped. “If anything, you will be treated like royalty while you are here. I guarantee, by the time you leave, you will no longer be frightened by Magic, but be delighted. I will make sure of that!”
