“I’m sure I’ll be seeing you again, at school at least.” You said as you headed for the door. Your tone was less confrontational than before. You opened the door and walked out into the main hall. You looked one way to see her father, jaw dropping at you coming out of HIS daughter’s room. Followed by fear that his previous treatment of you had earned his daughter a premature end, then more fear that he had inadvertently made you an enemy of his family. Which reminded you, these idiots might not have made a full on enemy of you, but there was one group that had.

Throughout the meeting and all the law making, there was one thing, a governing force of sorts, that you had inadvertently taken out of play… magic, more specifically the mages. The Kohlers were, apparently, all related. You wondered what type of redneck joke would dictate marriages and kids if they truly only had kids with other Mages, which were ALL family. Then again, of all the weird things you had been introduced to as a Vampire, that was probably up there with the least weird things. However, when you had restricted them from magic, you had unintentionally restricted ALL the world’s mages. Meaning they couldn’t keep eyes on predator groups effectively. Unfortunately, you had to patch things up with them. This was going to be a pain…
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Be as civil as possible.

choices: You give them full power back.
You want them watched and limited.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You took back ways to get to the Kohler’s suite. You still had to sidestep many predator factions and were not really liking all the butt kissing that was happening. You really hoped that it wouldn’t translate into your normal lives. Eventually you got to their suite and proceeded to knock a few times on the door after a heavy sigh. Not many liked being around the Kohler’s area which, for once, you didn’t mind. You felt them moving around but magical barriers were preventing you from feeling too much. Still, it was about 15 minutes before someone opened the door.

“You interrupt the great house of Kohler. Whom may I say is at the door so they can…?” The butler of sorts started before even opening the door fully. You just glared at him as he started then almost choked on his own words as you stood there. They might’ve been blind to who you were last time you came knocking, but that definitely not the case anymore.

“I assume that you weren’t about to say something to the affect of coming in to enjoy milk and cookies, correct?” You asked in a very suggestive manner with an ever present glare at him, your red eyes glowing. You were on you guard in this place. While you didn’t protrude your fangs or escalate your power to cripple them, you stood ready to do so if the so much as uttered a single spell word. The hostility was obvious to this man.

“I… I… Uh… I…” He stammered, barely taking a moment to breath, almost passing out. But his profession and training for that seemed to take over and he calmed himself. He must’ve realized that if there was ever a time to be at his best, this was it. It was time to give out as much hospitality as he could. “Master Caleb, would you like to come in Sir?”

“Depends, are you guys going to torture me again?” You asked bluntly.

“Certainly not sir! We will do no such thing.” He assured with a great deal of sincerity.

“How could you know for sure?” you asked skeptically.

“Sir, no one in their right mind would slight you, especially now. Please sir, you will come to no harm while here. I will bet my life on it.” He assured, almost sweating as he said this, offering his life to his assurance.

“Very well. As it is, if I have to fight my way out, I will not stop at not killing people like I did last time. That is your one and only warning. So, you best be very sure before you invite me to come in again.” You verified with severity of a very real death threat to not only him but others as well.

“Yes sir… Please follow me.” He affirmed as he gestured inside.

You sighed, as if getting ready for something very strenuous, then walked in. You felt the barrier as you passed it and felt the effects of many spells. Thanks to your ring you were shielded, wither they were good or bad. The Butler quickly closed the door and led you to a meeting room of sorts. It looked to have lounge chairs and couches around so that as many as 20 could very comfortably speak amongst each other, more depending on how comfortable they wanted to get with each other.

“I will go and fetch the Masters. Please make yourself comfortable Master Caleb.” He addressed and requested with a bow, then headed off as you nodded.

You watched him scurry of and closed the door. You looked around and the found a spot on a chair to the side and started to think heavily on what was going to happen, and what you intended. You weren’t sure if you liked the idea of having them run completely free, but shackling them only put everyone else that weren’t predators at risk. As much as you didn’t like them, or magic in general, they did keep the others in check and that would make your role easier as well as your family safer. But flashes of torture and what they did came through, making you ring your hands a bit and let some of your power leak out. Your eyes still were glowing red as you waited, you hoped not that long.

Your power began effecting things in the room as it leaked out. The plush carpet was pushed down so hard that it felt and looked like cement while bugs and almost anything else that you didn’t normally watch out for were flattened by the sheer weight of your power. Then, like a light switch, as soon as the door opened again, you became aware of your surroundings and dialed it back in. You had no doubt that you probably just set off more than a few magical alarms, but that didn’t bother you right now. You simply glared from where you sat as people came in. There were about a dozen in all, including the Butler, whom was told to go, to which he bowed and left, closing the door behind him. You felt him wait just outside to be called.

In the room was Beth’s Dad, her Mother, Her Grandfather, and few older people that looked to be from different nationalities but all had the same family scent on them as you took stock. Lastly, Beth herself was in there. As each of them looked for you they all eventually saw you from where you sat, glaring intently at them. So much so that they each shuttered under the feel of just your gaze. You could both see and smell them sweat at this and they didn’t dare budge an inch.

“Sit…” You ordered, then realized that even if they were by far your least favorite people, they still deserved respect as elders, and the respect of their station. You were raised to respect your elders so you very forcefully put in, “…please.”

They didn’t have to be told twice as they did so, the room came together a little bit so they could converse easier, as if it guessed what they needed. You had no doubt that it was some sort of magic, which made you not ease up on your glaring. You still didn’t know exactly what you wanted to do with them, as you were understandably conflicted. You just knew that they would be back in power in some capacity.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Make friends with at least some of them.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
“Caleb… I can’t even begin to say how sorry we are. The way we treated you, your family, we should not be alive. I would not have been as generous. For the lives of my family and myself, I thank you.” Mr. Kohler said as if he practiced it a thousand times.

“Honestly, every word you say makes me want to rip you in half.” You said bluntly. He started to sweat and hold his breath. “I forgave you for what you did to me. That, sure, it sucked, but I’m a Vampire, I dealt with it just fine. Of all the things that have pained me, it wasn’t that bad. Didn’t give me a great opinion of you and magic in general but I dealt with it. But what you all did to my family, even when they dropped my name? That… is hard to look past.”

“We are all deeply…” Mrs. Kohler started to which you glared specifically at her, making her turn silent.

“All I see when you open your mouths is the possibility that what comes out of them could be a spell that will cause pain to me or those I love. So, keep that to a minimum while the wounds are fresh.” You strongly suggested. “I don’t really care if your apologies are genuine or not. Because I don’t really think they are. I do think that the lack of power and the Reapers are causing you to grovel, and there isn’t really anything you can say, at the moment, to convince me otherwise. So, until I can trust some of you, cut the small talk please.”

“Yes sir…” Mr. Kohler replied. You could see Beth not believing that the same kind kid she sees at school all the time was so… hard at the moment. You were not someone she recognized and it scared her very much so. If you had to guess, you thought that they brought her in here so you would have some kind of connection to her moving forward. Honestly, you couldn’t see around it. She… wasn’t completely brainwashed by her family… yet. So, she might be the best option as the person to talk to after this point. In fact, that was your first idea, and it would start right now.

“Beth…” you called, causing her heart to stop for a second then beat like a race horse.

“Yes?!?” She peeped out. Both her parents went wide eyed at what you could possibly want with their daughter.

“We both know why you’re here. So, I’ll be talking with you specifically from now on. So, get to the front… please.” You more ordered then requested.

“I… Yes… Sir” She stammered, then made her way to switch places with her Father. “Yes? Caleb?”

“I so much wanted to be just be rid of you all. Better than then constantly looking attacking mages everywhere I or my family go. Now that I know I can have dragons, the thought crossed my mind in a very real sense.” You explained, making her shake as you rolled out the annihilation of her family and people in front of her as a viable solution you were considering. “However, after days of listening to laws and what not, I realize one thing. As much as I dislike you all, and magic in general… there is an order… a balance that can’t be filled by any other. Sure, others have magic, but not like you all. That policing force both clams me, and frightens me. So, my question to you is, if you were me, when faced with the choice of keeping my family safe or the world, what would you pick?”

“I… I guess, the world. No world… my family would be alive but… not happy, I guess…” She stammered out as eloquently as she could.

“I agree, which brings me to how to deal with you, and your family. In my anger, I overreacted, but understandably so. Either way, the balance your family provides needs to be restored. I hate myself to say it, but I NEED your power. But how do I go about doing that and still keeping an eye on you?” You agreed and asked, still glaring at her. She turned to her Father who was about to advise her, to which you glared at him instead, shutting him up before he could speak. “You had your chance at relations with me, I will deal with Beth, not you. At the very least, SHE has some potential to bounce back. I don’t see that coming from you.”

“I… I… I don’t know.” She sighed at an answer, but a sigh of fate. She wasn’t wise enough to come up with something like her Father could, which is why she was going to ask him, but with only her dealing with this, the fate of her family, she didn’t know what to do.

“Neither do I. So, I will do something against every fiber of my being. I so much want to just wash my hands of all you, or put you under the rule of the dragons or something… but that is not what I’m going to do.” You revealed, to which they all, especially Beth were paying very close attention. “I am going to give you all your power back. You may govern as you see fit under the law.”

“What?!?” Beth asked, the rest of her family not believing their ears. “You are serious?”

“Very serious. As serious as I am when I say this. If I have to deal with you all again, ever. I don’t really care what the reason is, I will end you. I will be talking to the dragons and others to work to have a backup plan ready if that is the case. You can use magic without threat of the reapers, but you are on paper thin ice. I don’t need much of an excuse to kill you all, as I already want to do that. So, yeah, you are free to use magic, but you best watch it.” You answered, spelling it out for them very clearly. They were both happy and deathly afraid at the same time. What manner of governing would make them safe from you? What would make them live past their next spell? “One more thing.”

“Y-Yes…?” Beth asked.

“I only deal with you. Not your Father, not your grandfather, not your brother or super wise person that you all go to or something like that. No, just you. So, as far as I am concerned, you are the new head of your house. If I see something or request something, I will tell you. If your family doesn’t listen, well, they better hope it isn’t THAT important, because if it is… then there is a good chance you all die.” You said, making them feel dread and confusion.

“That… I… I am in charge? You want me, in charge?” She asked, not believing it.

“I don’t care, but it would make sense.” You answered, then started to get up, then got up in respect as well. “Now, I’m leaving. You all do what you want, I have already given the reapers the order to stand down. You may start using magic immediately, as much as you dare to that is.”

“Yes, I… we understand” Beth responded with a bow that everyone followed. As if on que, the Butler opened the door for you then led you out. As soon as you were clear you were able to breath easy again, then traveled back to Kelsey. You were beat, and needed a long overdue nap from all this. You both hoped that the Kohlers would mess up, and that they wouldn’t. Either way, the consequences would be something to dread and look forward to.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You didn't want to know where you were going. Helped with the mystery of it all. But you pleaded with them to make it a vacation spot, more or less. With en emphasis on no magic and no silver. But they could pick something like Harry Potter, it was hard to tell. There wasn't a whole lot of ways to mess with you in the day to day life. As much as they would love to please you, they were still your family. So teasing and pulling pranks was not out of their skill set. Suffice to say, you walked through the portal then into the new realm. Almost immediately you felt yourself falling.

"Great, I portal into midair," you said to yourself.

You were now falling but that wasn't the weirdest part. From one look you recognized where you were. The landscape of Pandora from the movie was easily recognized, if not then the huge stinking mining equipment that you saw. The weird part was the air. You assumed that the air was not useable, but the movie didn't really explain why it was like that. You were not suffocating or going into shock by any means. Quite the opposite. It was like you just got an adrenaline shot at max dose. Your body started to overflow with power. You felt like you could do anything. Which probably wasn't the best mindset to fly. Cause, as you did, your overflow of power made you accelerate too fast and made you plummet into the ground at an insane speed. Fast enough to cause a crater and knock you out. Not the first time you had been knocked out. But it was the first time you were knocked out by... well you... You didn't know what was in the air, but it was not a hindrance to you, unless it would force you to do stuff like that all the time.

As you dreamt, you couldn't help but be grateful to your family. Pandora might have been a hell for humans that were normal. But for you, it appeared like it would be quite the vacation spot. You had a bunch of questions. Like if the blood of the animals here was also as delicious as the air was. There was no silver here, not the same sun to hinder you, and best of all no magic to touch you. You would have to thank them when you got back. But, for now, you had to wake up and get acquainted with whomever you felt around you. With that you woke and felt around, while still lying still. You didn't want to give whomever it was around you any form of control before you were ready. So you probed out and felt like you were in the more normal air than the stuff you were breathing before. You felt humans around you, but a few things were off. Fist was it was too sterile, like a hospital or something. Next was the gravity. You could feel the difference and it wasn't horrible. Although, it would not be your ally in remaining normal. As you started to listen to the conversations around, you got the feeling you were in a scientist's lab, kind of. Just peachy. That is what you needed, being poked and prodded by curious humans. So with that you opened your eyes to let them know you were awake. Although the suddenness of your action made an observing assistant fall back with a crash.

"What is going on?" asked a familiar voice. Must've been because you watched the movie. It was confirmed when Dr. Grace Augustine was looking down at you. "Ah, you are awake. Well considering that you should be dead, you look to be doing great."

"I suppose I have you to thank for that?" You asked then lifted your arms to see that they were free of restraints. "And the fact that the military force hasn't locked me up yet?"

You took a quick moment to make sure your abilities were hidden, they were. It seamed that you had spent so much time hiding amongst humans, that concealing yourself had become second nature, natural, and almost effortless. Helped in this instance. All the samples they took would reveal nothing about your other side.

"That would be me. You crash landed in our little compound. I convinced the powers that be, that you were launched from a faulty escape pod and that it protected you from the impact. But only I and a few others saw that wasn't the case." Grace replied as she gazed over your, as if dissecting you with her eyes. She was a scientist after all. Even if her moral center was higher than most, she was still curious by the unexplained.

"Can I get up?" You asked in a tone that was asking for permission. She seemed to like the amount of respect you were giving her. But she was confused why you were asking, until you glanced at the wires and tubes they had you hooked up to. She nodded then started taking them off. That was strange to you. You expected her to want to have then attached to record any and all moves you made. She must've had a different method, or was to occupied by her other work to bother with a strange human. You sat up and faced her from the bed you were on. It was one of those test and observation beds, so you were more or less eye level with her. "Thank you Miss..." you started then looked at her name tag. You had a feeling that just knowing her name off the bat would not be a good idea. So you made a show of looking at her name tag before continuing. "... Grace. It appears like I owe you for that."

"I'm just glad you are ok. Although, I am curious about you to say the least. So are the others. I got you out of there, but they will look at the security logs before long and notice that there was no escape pod. I figured you could get your feet before the grilling started... and perhaps you could start with explaining a few things to me. If nothing else, I would like to be well informed on whom I decide to help." She answered, in a very well practiced demeanor. You took a quick check on your power level to see if you could risk trusting her. You were full up from the feeding before you left. The impact made a small dent in that supply, but the air seemed to have helped in that regard.

"Of course, what would you like to know?" You asked then looked around to all the observing faces. "Perhaps somewhere a little more private?"

"Ok, sounds like a good idea." She agreed then escorted you to a smaller but cut off room. You could sense the cameras and things like that still working. They would be recording this. Then again, they probably didn't have many places in this place that wasn't recorded in some fashion. On your way to the room you looked around to get a feel for what was happening.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"So, even though this room is empty, am I to assume that other people will be coming by soon, especially from what I just told you?" You asked. In a very short conversation you had told her a very cut down version of what you were and why you were there. Mainly that you are a Vampire that can thrive in the open air and that was there for vacation. She asked some verification questions but was in partial shock mode at the moment.

"Uh, yeah, probably," she answered truthfully. She was pacing while you stood there against the wall. You figured that more people would come in and they needed as much room as possible. So you just reclined against the wall for the moment. You hadn't told her much about your power. "So, you could probably break out of here if you wanted?"

"That is a fair guess," you answered as you watched her. She continued pacing before her thought process was interrupted by the door slamming open. The room filled with a few armed soldiers with large guns, followed by Miles Quaritch (The chief of security guy). Seems he liked the whole military force thing. Their guns were trained on you, except his. He stood there by an almost flabbergasted Grace. "Figured you'd be listening."

"Well, aren't you something special. Coming here for vacation is about as much of a true story as my good graces." He replied with a tone of superiority as you could expect.

"If you don't believe me, than why the firepower. If I'm not a Vampire, then I am a harmless little kid," you almost teased back.

"A harmless kid that crash landed without so much as a hanky to help him land," He put forward, looking like he thought he had the upper hand. "I would really like to know how you managed that."

"I already told you... or more accurately, Ms. Grace here. I am not about to lie just to fit your conclusion," you replied. Grace had taken a position against a side wall to give the entered men some room. She, unlike them, had an idea that you meant what you said. That meant she didn't want anything to do with opposing you. Smart human.

"Colonel Quaritch, this 'boy' hasn't done anything that requires your attention. If you are that sure he isn't what he says he is, then he is my responsibility and I will take him under my wing." Grace said with as much authority as she could muster. You didn't know why she suddenly wanted to protect you, but you were ok with it. The question was, if Colonel Quaritch would go for it. You had more or less insulted him pretty good.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You arrived before Jake Sully.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Fine, but whoever and whatever he is, he under YOUR responsibility. If he gets into trouble or gets stuck out in the jungle don't expect me to lift a finger to help. I would just as likely shoot him as order a force to rescue him." Colonel Quaritch said with a certain angered tone about him as he glared at both Grace and you. He then quickly motioned to his men, who hustled out of the door. You could sense that they didn't know why a small boy like you would need such a treatment. But you also had helped them accept that regardless WHAT you were, it was Grace's problem now and they wouldn't interfere. When the Colonel left he slammed the door behind him. Grace gave a sigh then sat in the chair that they had pushed so carelessly aside.

"I didn't think he would do that." she said, then seemed to remember what you said you were and sat up a little as you sat in front of her. "You didn't do anything about that did you?"

"Hold up." you answered then spit a saliva needle at the recording devices. When you retract it, the needle would heal the things that it destroyed, even the walls and cameras. She saw this then looked to you with confusion. "Saliva needles. My saliva has healing properties but I can shoot it in a needle if I wish. Useful little things, and I don't like showing idiots like them what I can do. To answer your question, I might've made them more compliant with leaving me with you instead of shooting me."

"Really? You really are a Vampire, aren't you?" She asked, more to be clear than any lack of trust. You let your eyes glow and grew your fangs, then retracted them. She straightened when she saw this. "Have you altered my mind as well?"

"No need. You already are more than acceptable the way you are. You are more curious than threatened or scared. I don't have to worry about you taking a gun out and trying to kill me. Those others though..." you said as you looked to the side, as if looking at them through the wall. "...I have no intension of helping them with destroying more of this planet."

"You... How do you know what they are doing?" She asked.

"Sorry, that is one secret I have to keep to myself. Let's just say that I am not from around here, or the Earth you know." you answered.

"Would explain why you can survive in this planet's atmosphere," she relented.

"Actually, I have no idea why I can. This is a new place. Sure I've... watched things from afar, but I have no idea why this planet's air effects me in such a way. It is actually acting like adrenaline for me. I am not sure if I can control my abilities outside in a way I could in here. But, from what I hear about this place, a little extra strength isn't necessarily a bad thing." You answered in a tone that made her relax and think at the same time. You were right, her type of person responded well when you gave them a problem to solve, even it you didn't care if it was solved. Truthfully, you liked the way you felt outside.

"I see..." She started as she thought then she brought herself back to the issues at hand. "... well, since you are a vampire, you are probably needing blood right?"

"That would be nice, yes. Do not fear though, I am physically incapable of turning anything I bite and I don't have to feed from humans exclusively." you answered with a smile, but had to add the last little bit when you saw a fearful glance and your eagerness to feed.

"So, you aren't going to... you know?" She asked as she gestured to her own neck.

"Not unless you wanted me to. I have a very strict no tolerance policy on feeding on innocents without there permission. Although, if you want me to use my abilities, then I will need extra blood to fuel them. Just FYI." you answered, making her sigh in relief at that fact.

"Well then, let's get you something to eat!" she said with perhaps too much excitement. Now that she knew she was off the menu, she seamed eager to watch you feed. She led you down the hall and through the compound. You could tell when you were in her section, cause of all the science stuff. You observed as much as you could. It was a vacation after all, you could gawk and big toys or fun stuff. She noticed your looking around as she led you. "You know anything about biology or any of the other sciences?"

"Sorry, not too much. I know a great deal about blood flow and some of the organs that regulate it. But what I know is mainly instinctual and dealing with my interaction with them. Like listening to a heartbeat to determine if someone is lying, excited, or various other emotions. People's scent as well. But not very much about what you are talking about." you answered as you moved out of the way of someone carrying some expensive looking equipment.

"Then how do you know most of this stuff isn't harmful to you?" She asked.

"Well, so far, I only have 2 major weaknesses. Neither of them are anywhere near this planet. That and I am immortal. So a bullet to the head... minor annoyance. That is if I let it go into my head in the first place. No offense, but a human with their toys aren't my concern and don't even rank on the danger level." you answered, trying not to offend her as you said it.

"Well, I am starting to actually like you." Grace replied with a smile and you returned one. She opened the door to a lab for you then got a bag of blood from a fridge. It was blue though... well kind of blue. "Try this."

"What is it from?" You asked as you looked at the bag she gave you.

"A sample from one of the tribe we've been to. Let's just see if you can drink from things that are on this planet, or if we have to get you human blood when you are hungry." she answered. She seemed like she was dissecting you with her eyes. She was obviously excited about watching something new. You shrugged then drug your fangs into the bag. Your eyes immediately went red as you tasted the surprisingly amazing blood. The bag was spotless in seconds upon this new taste. You couldn't believe it, but it was just as good as human blood. "Good?"

"Uh, yeah... It is just as good as Human blood, which is really hard to beat. Best thing to describe it is if you have two favorite food like Pizza and Chicken. They are obviously different in taste, but still both your favorite. This blood is, tangy and got a little bit of a kick to it. Very refreshing." You answered with excitement that only fueled hers.

"Yes, I think I will like you very much." Grace thought out loud. She was acting like she had just found a new toy. But you could tell she was slightly worried that she just gave you a new sapient food source that she also liked as friends. But that was for later. For now, she was just getting started, you'd expect.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: He leaves you with Grace.

choices: Get to go out before Jake gets there.
Meeting Jake Sully, both human and Avatar.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Are you sure about this?" Asked another doctor that was escorting you to a door to an outside compound of some kind. Grace had already linked with her Avatar and had offered to show you around. Even though you had Grace's confidence, that didn't go to far with some of the others. But perks of being the boss in your area, what she said goes. She budded heads with some people around her level of authority or higher about you. She actually asked you to help her convince them of letting you roam free, out there or in their visual range.

"Yep." you answered with a smile. They had their masks on and had one ready for you if what they thought happened.

They opened the door and your body was already reacting to the air. As you took steps outside, you couldn't help but let some of your powers go. Your eyes turned red on reflex and you could feel the adrenaline like feeling again. You had a hard time not just bolting as fast as you could. Your senses were in overdrive as well. Yes, you would enjoy this vacation if you could feel like this all the time. You walked a little bit into a grassy area then closed your eyes and just took in the feeling for a while. Breathing in deep breaths of the... delicious air. They Doctors and guard soon realized that you would be doing that for a while and you didn't need the other mask they brought out, just in case. So they left you in your little bliss heaven you were currently occupying. You didn't know how long you were just standing there, but eventually you were pried into reality by a voice.

"Hey, Caleb, you ok? I've been looking all over for you." Said the voice to which you looked its direction. It was coming from a large blue creature that you knew to be Grace's Avatar.

'Dang, the movie really doesn't compare to being in contact with these things,' you thought as you looked at her. She was a little off kilter at your gaze.

"What?" you asked.

"I was going to ask you that. But more immediately, why are your eyes glowing?" She asked as she bent down to look at them. Yep, they were still huge up close. Huge and Blue. Then again, small compared to King and some of the creatures you've met. Still, the fact you'd be communicating with them was interesting.

"Sorry. The air, it is like supersizing everything in me. Like adrenaline for my Vampire side. Let me see if I can tone it down." you answered then closed your eyes to concentrate. When you felt like you had limited yourself enough you opened them again. "Better?"

"Well, if you want glowing eyes, you can. But yeah, this is better for now. Still a bit red, but not glowing anymore. You know, for humans, this air is highly toxic. How is it the opposite effect for you?" She asked.

"I don't know. Best guess is that it contains some nutrients that my body craves in the same way I crave blood. That, and I'm not human so... there's that." you responded. You started stretching a little bit, trying to get the kinks out of your body and restlessness. "Dang, I feel so powerful right now."

"Well we can talk about that as we walk. Although trying to talk to you way down there..." she joked as she stood up.

"Yeah, yeah. Laugh it up blue girl." You replied back as you started walking. She showed you some fields of food that were for the Avatars and tribe people, if they ever came there. You were still having a hard time moving so slow. But you figured that it was good practice for later. She showed you the fence line and talked about the jungle beyond. You had to refrain from jumping the fence and running off. There was something else as well. It was as if there was an immensely powerful being somewhere very nearby, but you couldn't pinpoint where exactly.

"So... now that you've seen the place, for what I can show you like this. How do you like it?" She asked, as if your expressions weren't enough.

"It is amazing here. I can't believe there is so much. I can't wait to go into the Jungle and stretch my legs a little bit, sort of speak." You responded.

"Why not now?" She asked as you both made it to a makeshift basketball court. You gave her hopeful but confused glance. She waved for a large basket ball, to which the players threw her one. "I mean you aren't allowed to enter the jungle, but you can run around for a bit. That is if you can handle as much as you said you could."

She said it in a challenging tone as she dribbled the ball clumsily a few times. She was, after all, a Scientist, not a pro ball player. She did this a little bit as you walked onto the court. She played around you a few times till she settled in front of you, between you and the hoop.

"Well come on. Don't leave a girl waiting." She said as she bounced you the ball. It was large, obviously, but you easily caught and palmed it.

"Alright, you asked for it." you answered then started dribbling. She tried to swipe the ball but left her legs more open. You dribbled it through them, as the thing was too big to fit through your legs, then easily made a quick shot. The others around were watching with great interest. Egg heads...

The first few were like that. Mixed with some jumping and running, just to see where your muscle flow was. A few times you jumped too high, which they marveled at. You then sped out of the court on accident. But now you were done experimenting on holding back and was able to dominate on the court. Usually you wouldn't, especially with a girl. Just good manners and all that. But you wanted to make sure she knew that you were in no way at risk if you or she wanted you to go along with them when they went into the jungle. A few times you dunked the huge ball in the really tall hoop. After a while you all stopped and invited the others to play as well. You were still the best player with all them there and trying really hard. You had never really liked the game before. But you had to admit, it did take all your minds off things and bring them together. A few of the guards and what not watched as you took the huge blue guys and girls to school. When Grace had to catch her breath and you were still barely starting was the point you sensed she understood, as well as the others you would be hanging around for a while. But only Grace knew that this wasn't even a small amount of your power. Either way, from that moment on, they wouldn't bother you about going outside again. Now, the next step would be going into the jungle. But they had to wait for security clearance for that, and the Colonel didn't like you very much. So that might be a while.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Going outside, meeting Grace's Avatar.

choices: You ask to stay in the jungle.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Now, remember, be careful..." Grace said as you all flew out to the jungle. It had taken a while for the Colonel to agree to letting you out of the base. In the end, he figured that if a big animal ate you, while you were out here, than that would be one problem fixed for him. In that sense, you were glad that he didn't like you very much. As for Grace's comment, is wasn't for you. You had demonstrated, through tests and trials, that you could more than hold your own pretty much anywhere. However, she didn't think that having you fly around would be a good idea. You assumed she was right... so you just jumped really high.

"How are you doing, little guy?" asked the pilot. Her name was Trudy. You were glad to meet her right off the bat. You even helped her with her bird more than once. She was the unofficial babysitter for all the egg heads. When they needed to be flown into the jungle, she was the one to do it. To be honest, she was the only one that COULD do it. Something about "the flux" messing with the instruments and whatnot. She was an excellent pilot and you respected her for her increased morality, amongst other things. But regardless how many incredible things you did, she continued to refer to you as "little guy"... oh well...

"Heck Yes!!!" You exclaimed as you leaned out the "Samson", then sat back down and just looked out the door. "This is awesome!"

"Alright, Caleb, calm down... uh.. a little bit." Grace instructed. Although, halfway through, she realized that it was impossible for you to do that. If you were effected by this place inside the limited exposure human complex, than out here you would be like crazy. As evidence of this, you could barely keep your eyes from glowing "Before you run off and explore, I would like your opinion on something."

"Alright, sounds good!" you answered pleasantly.

It took a little bit, but Trudy finally landed the Samson and you jumped out, even before it completely touched the ground. You sped around a little then waited for Grace, remembering that she wanted you opinion on something. She laughed at your apparent "little kid behavior"

"Ok, this is what I wanted you to see." She said as she pointed to a considerably thick root. "Without me telling you anything, I want to see if YOU pick up anything from it."

You nodded, eager to get this done so you could stretch your legs, sort a speak. You bent down and examined the root. There was a lot of life going through it, even for a human, which it wasn't, it was just a root of a tree. So you slowly reached out and put your hand on it, to connect with it. But when you did something crazy happened. You were use to entering an object or person to see what was inside. But you weren't so familiar with something entering you, forcibly. Truthfully, you hadn't met anything that could do that before. Sure the Mages could restrain and torture you, but not open and enter your mind like an open book. You felt an insane amount of power as the entity searched you, not letting go. However, it wasn't a violent intrusion. More like a loving and understanding one... which you didn't think was possible. I mean, how can someone force their way into someone's mind, and still be gentle and loving? This was just another instance that you felt the inescapable truth. You may be powerful, but there were loads of things that were more powerful than you. It never ceased to humble you in that regard. As quickly as it entered and learned from you it separated, allowing you to disconnect from the root. You fell back and stared at the root with wonder.

"Holy Crap!!!" You exclaimed, as you tried to grasp what just happened. It was so powerful and yet so quick that you were unsure what to make of it, yet.

"What? What is it?" Grace asked. Her expression was very astute and ready for anything you were going to say.

"That is the most powerful person I have EVER sensed. I admit, that I have been sensing her sense I got her. But I didn't make the connection, until now." You answered.

"HER, what do you mean, "Her"?" Grace asked.

"Uh, I believe you and the Locals call her, "Eywa". She... I don't really know how to describe her, and I only touched her mind for an instant. She was so powerful, that she blocked me and entered my mind with ease. As if all my defenses and mental powers were nothing more than tissue paper." you tried to explain.

"That... I have speculated for a while, that all the Flora was connected. But... are you saying that you met "Her"? You met... the planet, I guess you could say."

"In a manner of speaking, yes." you answered, still mystified by the experience. One thing was for sure, you had to introduce yourself properly in the very near future. You had to assume that Eywa had see everything about you, in your mind. From watching the movie, you knew that she would be able to influence and control the things around you, including animals. So, perhaps, she would be giving the wildlife a warning to NOT attack you. You would hate to kill one of them, before you could explain things to her... in your own words.

"This is incredible! We should run some tests and gather samples!" She exclaimed then got to work. You smiled as you saw her joyously, in her own element.

You began to sense the strange things around you. To be honest, you were trying to do that sense you landed. But things around here didn't have the same signature that you had become so familiar with. However, even through the differences, you could sense a few things beyond the ever steady and present presence of Eywa. You could sense movement, blood, a few other things like that, and a few Avatar like creatures that were watching your group. If you had to guess, you would say that they were the Na'vi. For now they were just watching. Probably making sure that the you all weren't intruding too far or making a mess. Judging on how the rest of the humans were doing and presenting themselves, it was a worthy and accurate concern. Either way, you didn't find any harm in them, so you left them be... even if their blood was tempting you.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Get to go out before Jake gets there.

choices: Go find a spot to connect to Eywa.
Go introduce yourself to the Na'vi.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"I am not sure that is a good idea." Grace responded, after you asking if you could stay in the Jungle.

"Look, I really don't like being confined to the base and under the watch of those... gentleman of idiocy," you reasoned. The last part got her to smile. You both didn't like the arrogant attitude of the Colonel and the other people around him. They either wanted you confined, used for their ends, or completely gone. Ironically, they had the same attitude about the Na'vi. That was probably another reason why Grace liked you so much.

"Well, you've demonstrated before, that you don't necessarily need my permission to go out. If I said "no" and you wanted to, you could do it anyway. All I ask is for you NOT to harm the already fragile communication with the Na'vi. I would like to mend things with them if I can..." Grace asked. You knew, as a scientist, she had other reasons as well. But the local population's lives were more important to her than her data and samples. Something that you admired about her.

"I will do my best. If they try to cut off my head though, I can't just sit there and take it. Even so, I will... refrain from any unnecessary activities that would damage relations for you. Like unauthorized feeding and killing." you agreed with some thought.

"Thanks, I appreciate it." She returned as you both walked back to the Samson. She began looking around nervously and it caught your eye. "Strange..."

"What is strange?" You asked.

"Usually I have to sidestep some of the larger and unfriendly life on my little trips. I haven't even heard them, or the small ones for a while now," she explained in a confused tone.

"It was probably Eywa. She touched my mind and read everything about me. If I had to guess, she would've directed all she could away from me, at least until I prove that I am NOT a threat," you induced.

"I suppose that makes sense. And I am really intrigued that you were able to "connect" with her. If you get some more information, you will have to tell me later." Grace agreed and more asked the last part with a eye brow raised.

"Will do," you agreed with a smile up at her. Yep, she was still big and huge. Something you hadn't really gotten used to yet. You both walked back and arrived at the Samson, where Trudy was patiently waiting. When you didn't get in, she got concerned.

"Come on, we don't have all day!" she hollered.to you.

"I'm going to stick in the jungle for a little bit, already got approval," you answered steadily.

"What?! Are you crazy? This isn't a place for kids or humans." she declared.

"Don't forget who or what you are talking to." you answered back as you flashed your eyes at her. "I will be fine."

"Yeah, if you say so. Just... check in every once in a while. I would feel really bad if you died because I didn't have you come back with us." she requested hesitantly. She knew you were not normal, so you having her straiten up and what not wasn't taken lightly. But she still cared about you.

"Don't worry, I can't die, remember? But just for you, I will check in when I can. Probably not for weeks or months at a time. But I'll make sure that you all get the message." You agreed.

With that, they left. Trudy did a double take, just to be sure you were ok. When they were finally out of human eye reach, you looked around and went about your business. You could feel the Na'vi person getting more agitated. You were debating what to do. You could either find a spot to contact Eywa, or address this Na'vi person and start on that road of communication. Both had risks. The likelihood of this one knowing any language you knew was not very likely. But Eywa was so powerful, it was giving you Goosebumps.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: You ask to stay in the jungle.

choices: One of the Na'vi approach you.
You have to find the Na'vi.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You thought about it. But in the end, you figured that it was probably best that you speak to the person in charge, sort a speak. While communicating with the Na'vi would be important, they would not take kindly to a person that looked like one of the "sky people" that was poking around where you didn't belong or was invited. If you had Eywa's blessing, then it was just one more thing in you corner. So you walked for a little bit, not showing anything abnormally amazing about yourself to your Na'vi observer. You were going to find a tall tree, but then you would have to reveal yourself to get up there. So you found a hub of tree roots that were above ground and sat in a meditation posture. You made sure you were out of danger then attempted to connect with Eywa again. Like before, as soon as you did, you felt her awesome presence and was a bit overwhelmed by it. But this time she didn't intrude into your mind. You felt around and entered a neutral space that was in both of your minds, but not intruding on either one. It was hard to do, but Eywa seamed to be helping a great deal. Then you opened your eyes, well inside the connection anyway.

"Greetings..." said an ominous but insanely beautiful voice. Not in the sensual way though. Her voice was like one of those Hollywood star moms. The ones that every boy is in love with, but is also the ultimate Mother. Not overly seductive, but definitely loving and understanding beyond anything that you had heard. She was like a glowing, blonde, and vibrant version of Kelsey, but older. Not too much to look too old. It was like she was at the peek of her prime, and stuck there, immortality you guessed. She was wearing a dress that was the color of the world that was around you. Vibrant hue of colors and glowing lights of sorts that made her multi toned skin look... breath taking. She had a blue hue, like the avatars and Na'vi, but not so much as to clash with her hair or gown. She was a very unforgettable sight, in a very good way.

"Hello, it is wonderful to meet you Ma'am," you said with a bow. You held that position for a moment then straightened. "I am sorry if this is intrusive. I just wanted to introduce myself and express that I mean no harm to you or this world."

"Be at peace, young one. I understand. I have looked into your being and I was not repulsed by what I saw. I saw great power, and a great person behind it. I know that you are not here to cause conflict, but that you don't shy away from it either. It is a position that I don't share, understand, but don't implement myself. I also sense that you are not like most of these "humans" that are here now. There are some that wish good. But most just want to take from me, and destroy me. Even after my chosen people explained things to them, they do not hear, they do not listen. It seams, not to you either. I will protect the balance, but you... You could do more that that." She responded, not moving from where she originally stood. It looked like she was straining to keep this up for some reason.

"You want me to interfere? I admit that was going to ask if I was allowed to feed on those here and if I could interact with them. But are you saying that you want me to effect things more than that?" You asked, slightly confused.

"Yes... I wish for these humans to stop, but I wish for more is for those under me to be protected. I will not ask you to slay the humans. I will merely request that, while you're here, you look out for them and help when you can. They are ignorant of what dangers they face. They are not what you call advanced, but that is what keeps this place the way it is. I keep myself for them, I do not wish for them to come to ruin wither by advancement or war." Eywa responded in the same powerful but kind voice.

"And if they don't want me to be near them?" You asked.

"I will send word and support you. You already feed off my energy, without even realizing it. I will make it known that you are to be trusted and listened to." She assured and answered.

"I will do my best to help when I can. Thank you for allowing me to stay her on my vacation of sorts." you thanked with another bow.

"Go now. I will be watching over you, young one." She said then broke the link between you with surprising gentleness. When you opened your eyes, your entire body and the ground for about 20 feet around you was covered with those white floating things that signified Eywa or "very pure spirits" as the Na'vi called them. Either way, they were all around you. You didn't know if it was because they were pure, or if they held some kind of power. But you felt very calm and peaceful around them. You looked around noticed that the Na'vi person that was around your before was gone. You wondered where they went but was content waiting among the little white things that were making you feel so good.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: Go find a spot to connect to Eywa.

choices: Show her some of your abilities and win her over.
Call out to Eywa and have her help convince this one.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You contemplated what to do for a while, taking in the presence of Eywa threw the many "pure spirits" that were landing and residing around you. You had nor problem staying there while you thought about it. In the end, you decided to wait for them to approach you. Regardless of what Eywa said, you thought it wouldn't be a very wise move to just barge into their territory, especially if you were an assumed human. Grace's Avatars were one thing, they kind or looked similar, but you... not even close. So you waited, and relaxed, taking in the vast area around you. With Eywa's permission to interfere, you were able to observe much more without fear of effecting things by doing so. You felt all the life around you, the strange insects, the interesting animals, and the vibrant flora were very new and very exciting to you. Eventually though, you felt the same Na'vi from before come back, with another. The first one was male, and this one was female. You couldn't tell too much more, other than some minor words. Despite being able to understand a great deal of languages and Eywa directly, you had no idea what they were saying. One thing was for sure though; they seemed enamored by all the "pure spirits" and Eywa's seeds that were surrounding you. The Female came down and started to openly walk toward you, careful not to intrude on the things around her, while the other one watched from a distance.

"The Sky People are not welcome here!" She said after speaking in her own language. She obviously meant it, but not so much as to chase you out with her bow. She was still a little bit away, so you waited till she got closer. She seemed annoyed by this. "Do you understand? Go Back to where you belong!"

"Unless I am mistaken, none of the humans belong here," you said calmly, not disrupting the entities around you. She seemed taken back by this. Obviously, no human had actually admitted that to her before. She had just thought that saying what she did would send you back to the camp or whatever. "I am not one of them, in species or in theology."

She hit a stopping point as the spirits and seeds were too thick to take a step without damaging them in some way. So you opened your eyes at once and they dispersed. It was like the rapid falling of bubbles, but thick ones that could be considered a swarm. The female had a mystified face as she watched them, completely missing your glowing eyes... until she looked at you again. You stood, not that it helped much. She was still huge and blue, even from the distance she was away from you.

"You look like one..." She induced, as she got closer, having to kneel down to make eye contact. Her accent was thick, but understandable. From hearing about Grace's school, this one must've learned English from there. "... thought your eyes, they are different."

"The avatars look like you too. Doesn't mean that they are the same." you replied back. She frowned at the mention of them for a second then thought about it before responding.

"That is true. However, you look much like the Sky People." She agreed, but tacked on the last part. She was still confused.

"Well, you wouldn't understand the term if I said what I am. So I guess I will just describe myself, if that is ok???" you asked then continued as soon as she gave you the nod to do so. She took a upright seat in front of you, still eye level with you... damn these things were big... "The best way to describe what I am is to say that I am a predator version of a human. Humans, or the people you call "Sky People" are my natural prey. But I am more moral than that."

"So... you hunt them, the Sky people?" she interrupted and asked, catching on to key words that she understood.

"Yes, but not for meat. I can eat normal food, but I primarily don't eat them like that. My kind drink the blood of other things. While I can drink from animals and other sources, humans are at the top of the list. However, I know that ending a life is not a very good thing. So I usually drink just enough and let them go." you explained. You paused for a moment then continued. "That is also why I can breathe your planet's air. The Sky people can't because of what their body needs to survive. Mine thrives on what is in the air. I am actually stronger in the open like this."

"Is that why Eywa has blessed you?" she asked.

"Kind of. I spoke to her directly... which is probably why her seeds were all around," you started and saw her shock at this. But thought that continuing and explaining might help her racing mind. "You see, I am very powerful. I was not sure if she would allow or want me to influence the things around me. I understand that this is all her, quite literally. So I introduced myself and she gave me permission to explore and interact as much as I want. In fact, she actually wants me to interact with you and others."

"That is not possible!" she exclaimed, shaking her head then looking to you again.

"The power statement, or the speaking with Eywa part?" you asked back.

"Both!!!" she returned, staring at you now. She obviously didn't feel threatened by you enough to get up and be on guard. But she wanted to observe you very closely. Even if she didn't believe you, there was something different about you that she wanted to find out.

But you wanted to get past this, so what do you do???
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.title: One of the Na'vi approach you.

choices: She takes you to the village, this is beyond her knowledge.
She tells you to leave under a threat of death, that is all she knows to do.
1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
"Look, I doubt you would understand the words I would use to describe what and who I am. The predator thing will have to do. But just so you have a name to go with WHAT I am, here it is. I am known as a Vampire... Anyway, there is no real way to prove that Eywa and I had a conversation. She doesn't really like to interfere in anything that would alter the balance. I doubt I could talk to her again. So, instead I will show you some of my power. If Eywa supports me, than her seeds will gather. If not, then that part is false, fair enough?" You asked.

"Yes..." she said, after thinking about it for a while. It seamed like she was calming down. Yet she still hadn't gotten up from the position she was in.

With that decided, you rose you hand and floated at the same time. You used a bunch of abilities to form an elemental aura around you. You also allowed a few of the more impressive elements, mainly fire and lightning, to dance in decorative designs on your hands. She bolted back when she saw this. Slowly she came forward as she observed the things around her that were bending to your will. Trees were swaying, rock and stone were forming. As usual, the only thing that wasn't doing something cool was the water. It was a very impressive display. Then, just as she came within touching distance with you floating at her eye level now, Eywa's seeds and other things of that nature started gathering. They gathered and bounced around, as if they were dancing with each other in their support of you. The female Na'vi warrior turned and marveled at the grand spectacle. The other one that was watching fell over in amazement as well. She ended her shocked observation by gazing at you again.

"Do you believe me now? I can do a lot more than this. However, I believe this is all that is necessary. Yes?" You asked as your eyes glowed and your teeth were shown.

"Yes, this is very well." She answered. With that you lowered your power level and canceled all the effects you were having. As if on cue, all the seeds and other things that had gathered had dispersed into the jungle. The trees were still swaying, but not from you. They were just residual waving from the awesome power before. "That was..."

She started talking to herself as she paced around. You didn't know what she was saying, but she was obviously having a hard time and arguing with herself. She was young, and probably didn't know what to do in such a situation. She would go one direction and rattle off some words that were, you guessed, not too flattering about you. Then she would walk the other way with a more calm and contemplative persona, as if answering questions she was asking herself.

What does she do?

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You traveled with the young female warrior, who you soon learned was Neytiri. Figured, the first one of them you meet had to be one of the main characters. But you were given permission to effect things. You figured that as long as Jake got the necessary attention when he got there, then you wouldn't have a problem. You both talked as she led you to the village. You further talked about what you could do and she tested your physical abilities by running, climbing, and falling. At one point, you appeared where she landed before she did. She seemed to like this a great deal and laughed about it. She was still huge and blue, but she was a cool girl to be around. She led you further and you began to feel others around you. You weren't going to address it, but they did the same thing they did to Jake... or were going to do to him.

"You really are something else." Neytiri said as you both walked on a sort of path. The Na'vi seamed to in tune with nature and Eywa to make permanent paths in random parts.

"If it makes you feel any better, you are interesting as well. I usually don't get a very good reaction when I feed for the first time," you replied back. She had wanted to see what you were talking about. So she let you attract a large animal and drink from it. She was more fascinated than concerned. It was by far, a welcomed change of pace.

"The Sky People disapprove?" She asked.

"Well, Grace doesn't. But most everyone else have all heard stories about my kind. Most do not paint a very good picture of me. The worst is that Colonel, head of security guy. He really only thinks with his gun." You replied.

"I see..." She stated, but was cut off by a weapon being flung at you. It was something to ensnare your legs. You thought about letting it hit you. But that wasn't something you were interested in. This was suppose to be a vacation. You didn't have to worry about preserving the timeline and whatnot.

As the thing came you jumped just enough to avoid it, but flipped upside down to catch this thing by the end and land while twisting it into a ball and holding it. Neytiri stopped as well but you were already circling around to address the others that were coming into the area. The road around on those horse looking things and circled you. You looked around until you saw the main guy who threw the weapon at you. Once they had stopped and pointed their bows at you. You threw the curled up thing back to him. He caught it easily.

"I think you dropped that," you replied in a stare down of sorts. They shouted and pulled back their bows, just to have Neytiri jump in. She hissed then started talking and yelling back at them in their language. You weren't as impatient as Jake would be. You just stood there in a relaxed state... that was until one of them pointed their spear at you then jabbed forward. They were obviously trying to scare you, to prove how insignificant you were. But when you didn't move, the spear dug into your back and came out your chest. Neytiri looked on in enraged shock. But you just looked as bored as you did before. You looked down at the protruding object then up at her. "You know, if I had any less restraint, I would definitely kick their butt for this. As a favor to you. But I am definitely taking this spear away."

With that said you grabbed the protruding tip and pulled hard enough to pull it out of the warriors hands. You pulled it all the way through you then held it out. With noticeably little effort you snapped it in half, then used your power to burst it into dust. They both shouted and marveled at this. You looked down at your chest and gave an annoyed sigh. Then you used your power to mend and clean your clothes, your body already had dealt with the insignificant wound. Then you crossed your arms and stared back at her, this broke her shocked posture and she started yelling at them with more emotion. She obviously didn't like people she knew getting hurt or threatened. Granted, she only knew you for a very short time, but still...

"Will you come with us?" Neytiri asked as she came from talking with the others. A few more came forward and reached for you, probably to restrain you or something.

"Sure, but you better tell them that they can touch me again, if they are willing to lose those hands of theirs. I let them touch me once with that spear. With that trust broken, they will have to think long and hard before trying it again," you advised as you looked at the two approaching hands of the Na'vi warriors that were coming to restrain you.

Neytiri stopped them with another course of yelling and hissing. At that point she came back and you all were off. She offered you a ride on her horse thing, but you said you wanted to run instead. She laughed as the others laughed at you, then laughed harder when they turned to a shocked silence as you ran... sometimes faster than they were at full gallop. It was unclear what would happen when you got there. You had never been this open before, but it felt good not to have to hide... for once.

1123112111111111121111121111111111111121.content:
You were greeted by pretty much the entire clan. It was a lot like when they brought Jake there, in the movie, which hadn't happened yet. It seemed that you running there helped with the respect level but not the weirdness level. That and they were still bigger that you were. A couple hundred big blue people is a sight when you are among them. You let your eyes glow, as it was hard to restrain them. They also needed to know that you weren't a normal human. Well... technically you weren't a human at all. However, to their eye, you looked enough like one... which was fair. Eventually you were brought before her Father and chief of the Clan. He asked her a few things, some in an angry tone. Then the one you knew as Mo'at came down. You remembered her from the movie. You knew what she would do to decide. You decided to have some fun with it. She walked around you and seemed to evaluate what and who you are, without talking to you. It was so much easier when you could understand different languages. This one... not so much. Then she pricked you and tasted your blood. This would be interesting.

"What are you!!!" she exclaimed as she took stock in what she had seen, felt, and tasted.

"I already answered that. I am a Vampire." you answered and then realized, from the looks on their faces, that they didn't understand. "A predator that lives primarily off of the blood of other living things. I have abilities beyond normal people. Despite my appearance, I am not a human, or what you call "the sky people". I was given permission to interact with you and your people, as well as this world."

"By whom???" asked Mo'at. She didn't seem like she was challenging you. So you didn't see the harm in telling her.

"Eywa. I thought it wise to connect with her. I didn't want to be disrespectful and effect your lives if she had a problem with it. As it turns out, she didn't," you answered.

"You think we would believe that you spoke with Eywa?" asked Eytukan.

You answered by holding out your hand and bringing some of Eywa's seeds and other "pure spirits" to you. You figured that they would respond better to such a thing. Within a few minutes there were hundreds of them floating around and landing on you. Then they disappeared as quickly as they had arrive, back into the jungle and where they had came.

"She said that she would make it known that I had her support. While she won't interfere with things, she has given me the authority to do so." You replied after they were done wondering at what you had just done.

"This... this is hard to handle." Mo'at responded. Neytiri was smiling with the situation. She had taken to you quickly, and she knew that your other abilities would also make them pause and stare in a manner of speaking.

"Take your time, I have all the time in the world." You replied.

11233.content:
You sitting on a beautiful leather couch, couldn't help but think about the choices you where making, the choices that would change your life forever. You didn’t know why you where so eager to accept Ms. Isabelle’s offer, maybe it was because she seemed so Desperate, which for you was a first. You had known Ms. Isabelle for many years now and she always carried herself like royalty, she had a certain elegance that even you a 12 year old could see a plan as day, so maybe, just maybe you didn’t want to disappoint her, or maybe it was because deep down you wanted this power, you couldn’t help but think that maybe you were the kind of person that Ms. Isabelle wanted to avoid giving this power to. You lost in thought didn’t realize Ms. Isabelle staring right at you with eyes that could pierce the very soul.

“Having second thoughts Caleb?” Ms. Isabelle asks with a calm demeanor

You quickly breakout of your train of thought and focus your attention back towards Ms. Isabelle.

“O-Oh no Ma’am I’m just...... not sure.” You never wanted to get Ms. Isabelle’s hopes up but you had to tell the truth. The truth was that you were scared.

“Do not blame yourself for feeling fear Caleb, the life that I’m asking you to have, the burden that I’m asking you to bare is unimaginable. But for all that is good you must be the one to carry it.” Ms. Isabelle says with a gentle smile that seemed to melt away your fear like ice under the blazing sun.

“I-I’ll do my best Ms. Isabelle.” You say with a new found confidence.

“I know you will Caleb.” Isabelle says pulling you in for a hug that seemed to last for a few minutes.

“Know we should begin, for upon midnight my life will be extinguished.” Ms. Isabelle says releasing you from her embrace.

“What do we have to do?” You ask.

“Well all you need to do is..........” Ms. Isabelle abruptly stops talking and stares at the front door that rested in front of the house. You didn’t know why but Ms. Isabelle had a serious look on her face as she did nothing but stare at the front door.

“Ms. Isabelle are you o.....”

“BOOM!!!!!” Suddenly without warning the door burst open, splinters of wood go flying through the air. You cover your eyes as dust fills the air.

Soon the dust starts to clear and 5 men walk through a large hole which stood where the front door use to stand. You with only a glance could tell that these men meant business, each one held a gun, which was pointed at both you and Ms. Isabelle. You could tell they weren’t cops, nor where they detectives, so the question was who where they?”

Soon one of the men step forward. The man in question whore a black leather jacket and black jean pants with thick black boots. The man had a small beard 🧔 and short blond hair, with sea green eyes which were fixed on Ms. Isabelle.

“We’ve finally found you crimson queen 👑.” The man says with nothing short of discuss in his voice.

You look at Ms. Isabelle wondering why the strange man called her by such a name, and what was the meaning behind such a name and the hatred that came with.

“Did you think you were going to be able to hide forever vampire?” The man asks pacing back and forth unable to remain still.

“Hide yes.” Ms. Isabelle says with a sigh 😔.

“Forever???? Alas nothing lasts forever.” Ms. Isabelle says with sorrow.

“Indeed and now we are going to prove that claim, for today is the day you die by our hands.” The man says with purpose as he points his gun right at Ms. Isabelle.

“I already know their is no point in talking with you barbarians so let’s just make this quick.” Ms. Isabelle says standing up and brushing her black dress with both her hands.

“Let her have it boys.” The man in front says.

Without further warning the sound of gun fire is let loose all through out the house. You close your eyes, you couldn’t bare to watch these crazy maniacs commit such a horrible act. Soon the sound of gun fire disappears and you with unspeakable fear open your eyes. What you saw you couldn't believe. Ms. Isabelle was standing right in front of you, and right in front of her in the middle of the air floated hundreds of bullets. You weren’t the only ones in shock. The men who fired the bullets were also shocked from the recent developments.

“N- no how can this be, how could she have stopped all of them so easily.” The bearded man says with a little bit of fear in his voice.

“It truly is a shame that you boys came to challenge me at the wrong time.” Ms. Isabelle says with another sigh.

“You see I’ve had a little bit of blood this evening so I’m. It as weak as I use to be.” Ms. Isabelle says.

You soon remember when Ms. Isabelle had drank some of your blood earlier. It was such a little amount but she could stop bullet in her tracks with such ease.

“Well if you boys don’t mind I would like to finish this quickly.” Ms. Isabelle says with a smile 😊 that was anything other than friendly.

Ms. Isabelle soon vanishes from where she is standing as if she had never been their. H

“AAAAAAAHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!” A scream of pain surrounds your surroundings. You soon realize it is coming from one of the men Armed with guns.

It didn’t take you long to realize why he was screaming. Right behind him stood Ms. Isabelle with her right arm sticking out of the mans Stomach. Ms. Isabelle wore a cold look as if she didn’t care about anything. Ms. Isabelle soon disappears again and this time even more screams echo through out the house. Man after man was killed in some kind of gruesome fashion. They where either stabbed, sliced in Half, or where missing a certain body part and died from massive blood loss. Soon their was only one guy left standing, the same guy from earlier with the beard. He stood completely still as Ms. Isabelle splattered all of his comrades. Tears running down his face and he gritted his teeth. You could tell that not only was he afraid he was angry with himself for being useless.

“And then their was one.” Ms. Isabelle says with a seductive tone as she walks closer to the paralyzed man.

“Y-y-you will never get away with this. A-as we speak more of our comrades are coming this way. You will never escape. So you might as well just kill me.” The man says with certain eyes.

“Kill you?” No, no, no I’m not going to kill you, that would be to easy.” Ms. Isabelle says with a smle as she grew closer to the man. Without warning Ms. Isabelle grabs the mans throat and lifts him in the air. Ms. Isabelle’s eyes soon start to glow red.

“Your punishment is to live. Live in a illusion of horrors and pain.” Ms. Isabelle soon puts the man down and as if he were nothing but a empty shell the man drops to the floor seemingly lifeless.

You had never been so afraid in your life, and as Ms. Isabelle turned towards you that fear soon escalated. Ms. Isabelle’s face was covered in blood, so were her hands and dress. Her eyes flowed crimson red and her beautiful hair was a mess.

“Caleb?” She asks walking towards you slowly. You couldn’t help but back up, and soon you turn around and begin to run towards the front door

“Caleb wait, don’t run away from me it’s dangerous.” Ms. Isabelle says but it was to late. You where gone.

“I have to find him before the hunters do.”

112331.content:
You run, and you don’t stop. The terror running through your vain’s is just to great. Never before had you ever beheld such a vile act, the taking of ones life, and the utter apathy while doing it, you knew deep down you would never be able to look at Ms. Isabelle ever again, not without seeing the apathetic monster underneath.

You wanted to hurry home, were it was safe, from all of this madness. The sun was going down and if that man from earlier was telling the truth than more men with guns were on their way to kill Ms. Isabelle, and you knew from their behavior they didn’t care if you lived or died from the crossfire. Tears fell from your eyes, you after everything that had happened still cared about Ms. Isabelle, you didn’t want her to die, but what could you do, these men were obviously trained in the art of combat, while you were just a child that didn’t know what you were getting in to.

“We finally found her!”

You stop abruptly hearing a noise ahead of you. Someone was coming but who. You quickly look around, trying to find a place to hide. You were surrounded by a myriad of apartment buildings, you were so close to your apartment that it wasn't even funny, you couldn’t be discovered now. After a few seconds of looking you finally decide to hide in the thick bushes that stood beside the apartment buildings as a sign of decoration.
