“Hurry men (Team A) hasn’t responded.” One of the mans said with a rushed tone.

“Don’t worry (Team B) should be close to their location.” Another man said.

It didn’t take you long to understand. This men are more hunters, and each one was headed in the direction of Ms. Isabelle’s house.

A few minutes had gone by and the stamped of hunters had finally ended. You could finally keep going. Your apartment, your home was just a few blocks away, all of this could be over, all you had to do was forget about Ms. Isabelle, forget about vampires 🧛‍♂️, and the responsibility that was yours to take.

You took one step and found that you couldn’t take another. Sweat ran down your forehead as you partook in a inner battle in your head, a battle between right and wrong.

“Oh god protect me.” You say as you turn around facing the same direction the hunter from before had ran towards.

“Ms. Isabelle I’m coming.” You say a you run towards Ms. Isabelle’s house.

It took you around 20 minutes to return to Ms. Isabelle’s house, and honestly it was a lot harder to get to Ms. Isabelle’s house than you remembered. Hunter after hunter was stationed at every street, each hunter making sure to block the way that led to Ms. Isabelle’s house. You with all the craftiness you could muster managed to sneak right past all of them.

You wore a shocked look on your face as you stood before Ms. Isabelle’s house, that was now torched to the ground. You knew at that moment that those horrible people didn’t just want to kill Ms. Isabelle, that wanted to completely wipe her ver existence from the face of the earth. The recharge was quite large, and worse you didn’t know if Ms. Isabelle had been killed from the fire.

“We found her.”

Once again you hear a voice but this time it was coming from behind you. You without wasting time run and hide behind the wreckage of the now destroyed house. Looking through the small cracks of burned wood you see 4 men in black jackets, wearing military style boots running past the house.

“The Crimson Queen had been spotted.” One of the men said with excitement.

“We can’t let her escape, not this time” another one of the men say as they continue to run past the house.

You couldn’t help but feel relieved. Ms. Isabelle was still alive, and you knew just how to find her. You had to follow those hunters.

You follow the men, not to closely of course, always hiding yourself in the shadows when you where in danger of being discovered, and after a few minutes of following the hunters closely you soon find yourself at the Saint Cross Graveyard, which was the graveyard right down the street to were you lived. The men had walked through the iron gates that, to your surprise was completely open. The gates would usually be closed around 7:30, and right know it was pushing past 8:00. You came to the conclusion that the hunters was behind it.

You run through the gates and run Down the brick roads that ran throughout the whole graveyard still falling the 4 hunters from before. You along with the 4 hunters soon make it to the front of the whole graveyard, and what you see brings tears to your eyes.

Ms. Isabelle surrounded by around a 100 hunters was covered in blood from head to toe, and was breathing hard. You could tell from the ripped dress 👗 that Ms. Isabelle had fought a hard battle. You wanted to help her but what could you do. Looking around you could help but take notice of the dead hunter bodies that littered the ground everywhere. You understood that this was a graveyard but this was ridiculous.

You watched the battle from behind a stone statue of a angel, and while watching you fill a strong tug of your jacket. Turning around you see a man with a giant Scare on his face. The man had brown curly hair and wore a leather black jacket with light brown pants and black boots 🥾. The man also gave off a vibe of danger whenever you looked at him. Both of your eyes met and deep down you just wanted to curl up into a ball.

“Well, well, well, just look what we have here.” The man says as he pulls you with him, as he walks in the middle of his soldiers, and stand right in front of Ms. Isabelle?

Ms. Isabelle upon seeing you couldn’t help but reveal a shocked and yet fearful look.

“Now if I remember the reports correctly, they said that a boy was seen leaving the Crimson Queens house .” The man says with a devilish smile as he looks at you then at Ms. Isabelle.

“Release him Samuel, I’m the one you want.” Me. Isabelle says with a stern voice and sharp eyes.

“Oh my, oh my is this the same Crimson queen I know from the pass. The same creature that had killed countless of people, the same vampire that drove people mad from the meat mention of her name.” The man named Samuel says with a little laughter in his words.

The man looks at you for a few seconds.

“I don’t know what your connection is to this boy, but from the look on your face I can tell he means a lot to you.” Samuel says reverting his cold red eyes back to Ms. Isabelle.

“Feel pain.”

You didn’t see him move, it was just to fast, all you felt was the sharp pain in your gut, and the screams of Ms. Isabelle. Looking down you see a large silver knife sticking out of your gut. You and been stabbed. You fall down on your knees one hand in the ground, the other gripping the injury. Where you going to die?

“You bloody fool!!!” Ms. Isabelle screams with eyes glowing red and a red crimson aura flowing all around her body. Waves of crimson energy shoot out of her body a cause every single hunter close by to fall back.

Ms. Isabelle runs over to you and quickly pulls out the knife from your stomach. A pool of blood rushes out from your wound making you feel dizzy. Ms. Isabelle looks at you with concern.

“Caleb hold on.” Me. Isabelle says as she stand up and holds out her hands. You soon realize that you where covered by a crimson barrier, a barrier that protected you both from the hunters.

Ms. Isabelle once again bends down to get a closer look at your wound, and soon she wears a grave look.

“Caleb please listen, I’m loosening strength fast, my time is almost up. At this rate you are going to die, and I don’t have enough strength the heal this wound.”

You knew where this was going.

“You have to make the choice, will you live as the one and only vampire, or will you die.” Me. Isabelle said.

“If you choose to die, then I promise you, you will not die alone my sweet boy.” Ms. Isabelle says, the kindness returning to her eyes with a smile, that almost made you forget everything she had put you through.

It was time for you to decide, at this moment you stood on the Abyss.

“I-I’ll become the vampire, a-all of your burdens, I’ll take them all.” You said with a painful smile. You didn’t want to die so you only had one choice.

“Very well the choice has been made.” Ms. Isabelle says as she brings her face closure to you.

“Close your eyes, this won’t hurt a bit.” She says gently.

You do as you are told and close your eyes, and soon you fill Ms. Isabelle’s cold lips on your neck.

“God forgive me.”

It’s a brisk, wet, afternoon in January, Andrea is having a fundraiser at school. It is a black tie dinner and after dinner there will be a tour of the Art Gallery downtown. The only bad part is trying to sell tickets on such a dreary day. She decides to try her luck at the coffee shop where she works at part-time. When she enters the coffee shop, much to her surprise there are a lot of people who decided to come out in spite of the weather. As she makes her speech, she is drawn to the table in the back. There sits a woman who is dressed in a business style pinstriped corset, a long black flowing skirt that is tight in all the right places, very easy on the make-up, has two-toned hair, and a single signature necklace on. After Andrea finished her speech she walked up to the table in the back to make a formal introduction. When she makes it to the table, the young woman introduces herself, my name is Isibelle Zhtomir, and it’s a pleasure to meet you. I was intrigued by your fundraiser. I myself quite enjoy the chance of wearing my more formal dresses. I’ll buy a ticket as long as you will do me the honors of allowing me to go as your plus one. Andrea was awe struck and began to stutter, she had never had a proposal like that come from a stranger, yet she seemed so familiar. It took several seconds but she was able to give Isibelle her ticket to the dinner. They set up a date so Isibelle could take her out shopping for a dress that would go well with what she was envisioning on wearing to the dinner party.
That meeting was the beginning of a great start to a long friendship. With Isibelle coming into the coffee shop every Tuesdays and Thursdays it was the perfect cover for her real reason. What she really wanted was Andrea. She has become infatuated by Andrea, it was her wit, her charm, and her determination that made her the focal point. They chatted about trivial things, basically it was her way of learning more about Andrea without raising any red flags. When Andrea was alone she was dreaming of freedom from her home life. It was those long chats with Isibelle that made her feel free and she could let her guard down. Yet alone she felt trapped by her mother, who refused to let her grow into a young lady. She will run away if that is what it takes to have her freedom. Her mother stops at nothing to let her know that she owes everything to her mother. Andrea has no other plans, she will get her freedom, no matter how it is offered to her. Andrea wants to prove to everyone that she is old enough to make it on her own. She befriends Isibelle, Isibelle seems to understand her pain of wanting to shake off her past and start anew. Isibelle can sense Andrea’s pain and wants nothing more than to help her see there is hope at the end of the tunnel. She wants Andrea to feel there is so much more to life than working part time and coming from a broken home. She wants Andrea to know that nothing is out of reach, you just have to reach out and take it. They both are in dire need of each other for different reasons. They just don’t know the full extent they are willing to go before they find a positive outcome for both of them. Isibelle must find her replacement and soon or else her body will parish, her powers and wisdom will pass to the nearest life form. There is nothing she can do to stop her body from turning to ash. Her successor is young but just maybe she is strong enough to survive the next 2099 years. She must find another to accept her gift/curse before she dies. This is why the coffee moments with Andrea are crucial. The more she learns about Andrea the clearer her choice becomes. Andrea is only 18 year old, she comes from a broken home and her only joys comes from being a cheer leader captain and her job at the local coffee shop.
Andrea hears her mother’s voice ringing through her head that she will never amount to anything, that all that is waiting for her is a baby and a husband much like her father. This is her lowest point she is dripping with insecurity. She cannot seem to shake her mother’s voice. Isibelle cannot shake the feeling that time is not on her side, she will fail to pass on her gift before the hour glass runs out of sand. She knows her successor, yet it is all about timing. How and when to pass on the gift is running through her head. This takes a great deal of planning and a very soft hand. Soft hands and lots of planning must be done to insure a smooth passing. With every great plan comes great risk and failure. If Andrea fails she will become her mother and work two jobs, one at work and the other as a servant to her husband, who is like that of her father. If Isibelle fails her body will parish and fate will be out of her hands and her gift will be passed on at random.
Isibelle has offered to do coffee at her place on more than one occasion. Andrea’s home life was becoming more than she could bare, so she gave Isibelle a call to see if tonight was a good night to stop by for coffee. Isibelle was more than eager to say yes. Once Andrea showed up, she made two cups of coffee and walked them into the nook. That way they could have a more personal chat about what was on Andreas mind. Both inadvertently tipped their hands, Andrea first, she told Isibelle about her home life was less than desirable. Isibelle told her, she could make all her pain go away by that of a simple bite. She told Andrea of her powers, but that time was not on her side. Andrea realized what she told Isibelle and quickly made her exit. She was lost within her own thoughts that she only half heard what Isibelle said. Isibelle felt that she had ran Andrea off and was not seeing just how vulnerable Andrea really was.
Almost a week has passed before they would meet again. Isibelle came into the coffee shop for her usual coffee and chatter. Andrea walked up and said, a penny for your thoughts. Isibelle was miles away and unaware that she was twisting her hair into a large knot. It was then that they tried to apologize for their last encounter. Andrea proceed to sit down so they could have a quick chat. She asked Isibelle if they could have a longer chat after work tonight about her gift. Isibelle was delighted to know that she in fact did the opposite of what she thought she had done. They set up a time to meet after work at Isibelle’s place. She told Andrea that she had an errand to do and gave her the key so she could let herself in. After work Andrea went to Isibelle’s place and let herself in with the key. Once inside, she found the study, she was amazed by the volume of books that Isibelle had. Some of the books dated back to the 1800’s. She heard a noise that came from the backyard, it was Isibelle, and she went upstairs to change her clothes. She meet Andrea in the kitchen. It was here that both have come to an understanding and Isibelle revealed her true self. This was a huge step with a great deal of vulnerability, she was trusting that she made the right choice. It was a moment of clarity, one that Andrea took in great stride. She soaked up all that Isibelle had to say. She is so eager to learn more. Isibelle has told her everything, they talked until almost dawn. Andrea gets a message from her mother demanding that she gets home at once. So she told Isibelle that she wants to know more but it is in her best interest that she gets home.
If Andrea fails she will become her mother and work two jobs, one at work and the other as a servant to her husband, who is like that of her father. If Isibelle fails her body will parish and fate will be out of her hands and her gift will be passed on at random.

15.content:
Paintings and photographs from every era of development in the history of the respective forms of art and documentation lined the walls of the apartment. Some contained her image and others merely showed the spirit in which she viewed the subject that she wanted to capture. Though these pieces were a mere representative of the body of works that existed in greater amounts elsewhere, they were selected with care to tell the story of her humble beginnings to the mastery of the skills that took several lifetimes to achieve.

         Picture frames contained newspaper clippings from different eras and in various languages. Some were written by others regarding her work. Others were actually written by her during one of her latest lifetimes when a career in journalism seemed to suit her tastes and the photographs were merely a contribution to the work of the male pseudonym she used in the more misogynistic era of the newspaper's history.

         Derek ran his hand along the shelves that housed her books. From century-old first edition manuscripts to more recent vintages, they ranged in subject and style from genuine literary treasures to trashy best sellers.

         "Some of those are mine." Her pathetic voice practically screeched out, breaking the silence of the barely lit room.

         The stench in the room spoke of a body that had begun to fail long before the mind. Upon entering the apartment, many of the would-be caretakers she had hired would always grimace at the smell. They would comment on the clutter and how she needed to get rid of some "stuff". They certainly never longingly looked at the books as though lost in a time and place they had never seen, but wanted to be a part of.

         Standing at five feet, the boy was barely finished with the early half of his twenties, a little overweight, stocky and unsure of himself, with glasses that kept slipping from his brown eyes. His therapist had suggested he do some volunteer work. That getting some human contact with people outside of his work environment would make him feel more alive again. Not content to work with large groups of people, Derek found an ad in the paper.

         At the end of her very long life, Isibelleâs body had begun to show signs of decay. It started slowly, just a year before. Her once long and vibrantly black hair was now so faded as to appear as a ghost. Her skin, once smooth as marble and softer than goose down was cracked and fragile. Her strength failed her and she was confined to the bed for much of the day, resulting in some fairly embarrassing occurrences that contributed to the tapestry of unpleasant odors now hanging in the air.

         If Derek was uncomfortable he showed no signs of it. When his eyes popped out of his head at the sight of the signed copy of The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe, she fell in love with him.

         âOthers were written by the descendants of my many children.â

         Derek came to her side, his face alight with indignity.

         âAnd none of those descendants could find the time to be with you?â He asked.

         She managed a weak smile, no longer able to chuckle at his anger on her behalf. He gently took her hand.

         âMost of them believe I am dead, Derek,â she reminded him. âItâs easier to let them go on believing this, just as it will be for you when you accept the gift.â

         Derek looked up at some of her photos. The ones where she clearly hadnât been shy about people knowing she didnât age a day between her 1800âs daguerreotype and the very last digital photo of her at her very last book signing almost three years ago. Granted, there were some obvious changes in styles and appearances, but there was no mistaking the curve of her nose and the penetrating glare of her eyes. In some photos, she even bore the caste mark she had received during her five century long stay in India.

         âYou really wonât be around?â He asked. The pain in his eyes was sincere. âWhat if I screw up? What if I do something wrong?â

         Isibelle smiled. From the pain in her eyes, Derek could tell it wouldnât last much longer.

         âThen you will have 2100 years to figure it out.â She said. Her breathing became more labored. âDonât think I got it right the first time. I was as nervous as you and made many mistakes that could well have cost me my long life. What you donât read in the books I have written you will have to figure out for yourself.â

         The next few moments were a blur.

1553.content:
You are Isaac Barton, the 26 year old Janitor of the Local High-school. Unknown to most, you are a war veteran and former elite soldier. In the last week of your active service, during the last Desert War, you had suffered a head-shot from a sniper. The quick medical care from your comrades, the helicopter pilot's swift arrival and a near-miracle surgery had saved your life. Yet you could no longer serve as soldier and neither would you ever graduate at elite-university due parts of your brain being destroyed.

You were mustered out with all honors. A war veteran with no stain in his file. It took eight weeks of strenuous physiotherapy and recovery measures, to regain full control of your body. It took three additional months, because you were repeatedly scanned for psychological trauma. You did not suffer one, by now it is scientifically evidenced.

Even before circumstances had forced you into living a simple life, you had learned lessons from both God and the Army. You had seen comrades torn to shreds by landmines, fellow soldiers assassinated by religious assassins in disguise and you always knew, that was the Line of Duty. You had chosen it and part of that was, that the enemy would of course be of a violent and antagonist opinion. Your ego was not crushed or shattered, yours was just transformed.

You had agreed to the divorce, as you did not blame your wife to be horrified with the new situation and how far it would drag her down socially. She was innocent of this and even though it made you cry, you respected her freedom of choice without any proverbial bad blood. Life was no church-chorus and few could bear such an allegorical cross.

You still had support by the veteran program and friends to pay you a visit once or twice per year. You applied for the job as janitor, did rent a small apartment and fluently went into your new line of duty. It was a gift few could perceive, yet while impaired, you still remain a happy man. Two weeks ago the doctors allowed you to restart jogging and workouts. Mrs. Whiteley from down the street had invited you to her bible-group on Sunday afternoons.

The Cook here at school had recruited you for a neighborhood-project, on Tuesdays and Thursdays you deliver food to people who cannot go shopping themselves. Your life had one brutal setback, yet it had more than a thousand blessings. Even the Friday evening Online-Card-Game with beer and fast-food is welcome joy to you. You know that millions of people will never be as blessed as you are and you always do your best, to support your country and your people unconditionally.
1553.title: Participate as Isaac Barton.

15531.content:
Your name is Matthew Layton. You are 15 years old and are ectomorphic in build. Standing at 5'11'' you are slightly above average in terms of height. Your blonde hair is down just past your ears. At home you are a quiet teen and rarely have any outbursts of emotion. Your friend circle is pitiful and this is mainly to do with your aspergers disorder. You were diagnosed upon entering kindergarten much to your mothers dismay. In terms of grades you are a straight A student in all but PE and are slated to be valedictorian. You could easily be doing college work but your Mom wants you to live like a normal child. You are quite scrawny but your mind is sharper than a scalpel and can solve complex logical problems with extreme ease as long as the dont involve emotion. In fact you couldn't get comfortable until that equation you saw on the board in physics for a few seconds before it was rubbed off, was payed out in your book with explanations and examples. In your life you have been called cold and spiteful.

Your family consists of your Mom, Lucinda 38, your Dad, James 39, your twin sisters and your brother. Your sisters are both 10 and are completely identical in each and every way. They both wear light pink dresses and are never seen without one another. There names are Grace and Lucy. Your brother is 7 and is aspergic like you. He was also diagnosed in kindergarten but this time under your fathers orders as he discovered that his father was autistic and so was his brother. Your brothers name is Luke. Your father works as an executive in a large corporation and your mother is a teacher at the local community college. Your father is atheist and your mother is slightly spiritualist.

The story

Your alarm clock went off and you groggily flopped your hand onto the snooze button. Slowly you sat up and got ready to go down for breakfast. You pulled on a pair of jeans and a fall out boy tee shirt. For breakfast your mom had served up some English muffins and fried eggs. "remember Matthew, we've got to visit great aunt Agatha later so dont start any long games." You mom, Lucinda, reminded you.
"Ok, mom." You responded as you squirted ketchup into the breakfast muffin.After breakfast you leaped up the stairs and started playing skyrim.

After two hours of slaying draugrs in ancient Nordic tombs your mother called you down to go see your great aunt. The car journey was about half an hour and took you well out of your comfortable suburban neighbourhood and into the small villages. You great aunt lived in a small cottage beside an old mansion that must be well over 200 years old. You stepped out of the car and stretched. Your sun came outside. She was an old women in her late eighties and was quite spry for her age. She didn't use a frame or have any medical issues. Her enigma friend stood beside her. You had met her before, apparently older than your grandma but she never looked it. Your aunt and her had been friends for years.

As you walked closer to her you noticed that she looked older and exhausted, but still kept her smile.
15531.title: Matthew Layton

155311.content:
The Women, who had introduced her self to you a few months ago as Isabelle, greeted you as you and your family came inside. "Matthew, How are you?" She asked as she lead you inside. "I'm fine." You answer in your usual awkwardness.
"That's good" She said as she lead you into the sitting room whilst your Aunt lead your family into the kitchen. You were a little lost. Why was this women taking you into the sitting room when the rest of your family was in the kitchen. "I bet your wondering why I've separated you from your family? You see I have a proposition for you." She said as she walked you over to the sofa and made you sit down with a firm but not forceful hand. "See I'm a vampire." She said. Your first thought was to laugh but when her eyes shifted from blue to red and she summoned a small flame into the palm of her hand, your face dropped. "There's no need to be scared, I've chosen you as my successor. If you accept this proposition you will have all my powers and complete immortality for 2100 years. What do you say?" She explained. You thought for a few seconds.

"Ok I accept. But one thing.... What's the catch? You inquired. During the whole conversation you couldn't lock eyes with her.
"Clever boy. One catch is that once those 2100 years are up you will die. Another is that you can only make one person live forever. The third and probably biggest one is that you wont be able to procreate whilst in possession of this gift." She explained with a sly smile. You nodded as she said this and considered it for a few seconds.
"I still accept. Immortality even in a limited amount of time is still a very big point in favour and dwarfs the downsides on its own." You confirmed.
"Good, your Aunt helped me organise this and so she can help after the change. We have set up a cover story for my disappearance. We where attacked and you got knocked unconscious and I got kidnapped. Ok?" She explained and you nodded to show you where following.
"Your Aunt has already taken them out for a walk. Shall we begin?" You look at her and nod.
"Yes I am ready." You answer. A single bead of perspiration dripped down your forehead.

"We shall begin." She said as she pulled you close and tilted your neck to the side. "This wont hurt.... Much." Her fangs extended and plunged into your neck. At first you felt a small sharp pain then a rush of pleasure. In less than a second you felt the numbing waves of blood loss go through your mind and you felt your heart stop. She then started pushing her own blood in you through her fangs.

Your mouth was open and gasping in pain as the blood was pumped around your body and just before she had finished your own fangs extends for the first time and your eyes misted into a scarlet red. Then you blacked out.

15532.content:
Mrs. Pennington was sicker than usual this Thursday. Being the last on your list for food delivery, you gladly invested the extra hours of effort. You are certain that most Americans would have done the same. You even waited with her, until the doctor finally had time to pay her a visit.

When you finally departed you ran into Cassia Pennington, the daughter of Mrs. Maria Pennington. With one look you had assessed the situation, and so you helped her carrying supplies into the house. God has his own way to reward the minor niceties. At least that was the thought you got, when smelling the wood of the stairs leading into the cellar.

Even on your walk home you still thought about good craftsmanship, and all the little blessings of life. It helped you thinking less about the Army. Sometimes you missed your unit, and the feeling of being one among equals. Still you rejoiced at the thought that tomorrow there would be another sinful Friday.

Sinful Friday. Fred, Anderson and Mike had liked it, as they had feared you would be too well-drilled to enjoy beer, barbecue, or burgers. You were not. You learned to give others the time they needed to become the best possible person, and you liked your new friends without judging them.

Just six more lantern-posts. And indeed, you were close to home, when you heard a scream for help, and sounds of a struggle. Ruffians in your hood? It was a weird thought. Your body had already reacted, and you ventured towards a badly lit parking lot.

Three muscled brutes were circling a business woman. It was injustice by the book. Like predatory beasts they allowed their greed to guide them down the road to hell. You remembered that Chris Rea Oldie named Road to Hell. It ran on the radio some nights before you were stopped from being a soldier anymore.

You had a pretty clear estimation about your chances here. You even felt that a shadow of darkness was lurking for you. Yet justice had to be done, as allowing the wicked to win breeds only more injustice, and suffering. Maybe you would not be able to save the woman, as brawling versus three thugs had bad odds for you. Yet that was a maybe. The option of abandoning a woman, nearly like giving her as a sacrifice just to save the own life, was no option at all to you.

“No man is left behind.” In your time female soldiers did already exist, and were treated like soldiers. The thought of abandoning anyone in danger was pure dishonor. You would be beaten to death, even when they raped you first, too, before you would even consider it. The trio of ruffians was in position, and the lead-rabid dog had to attack you first. He did.

While far from your maximum efficiency, you had restarted your workouts six weeks ago. Real workouts, not just the gym stuff. The brass knuckle came flying towards your face, just that flinching, or cowering, was not your reaction. You blocked the swing while positioning your feet, and retaliated with a brutal thrust kick, sending the criminal stumbling backwards.

Everything went too quickly for you then. The three ruffians were standing against you. The expression on their faces changed from wrath to something else, just that precisely in that moment God told you something. And that somebody else told you something, too. It was during this moment, when you realized that God and that other person had told you the same, that you lost conscience.

“I am sorry.” a female voice had said to you. One instance before you passed out.

Isaac Barton was killed that night. Even though a different truth does exist. You are certain of this by now. Whatever you are it is no longer human. The ruffians, much like you, had been like peasants on her chessboard. She sacrificed whatever, and whoever, did not further her goal. And you did understand, why she did this to you.

“Because from all the mortals, who I had encountered through the centuries, it was you who convinced me that you would do your very best to be the least of a monster, and not the most of it.” This was her first note to you. An entire library full of lore awaited you. Several houses, bank accounts, apartments, and holdings just as well.

God had tested you, preparing you for your greatest trial by fire. Being a creature of darkness, and damnation, while keeping your faith, and goodwill, intact! From now on it would be up to you, if such faith in you would be a good idea.

info.description:
This interactive will be more modern than typical vampire stories and interactive. I know that I am going to step on some feet with this one but in the end if you like it than who really cares.

Rules:

1) Keep it accurate ------- I don’t want to see things that drastically change a character. For example, you can’t have them be straight one minute and gay the next or kind one moment and ruthless the next, unless that is the character choice you have decided to reveal. There are plenty of ways to subtly change a character but for a straight guy to suddenly make out with another guy, vampirism aside is not ok nor is it ok for a character that has been established as gentle and kind all of a sudden kill his family for their blood. There is plenty of ways to turn the story in that direction if you are willing to take the time and write it. However I am not limiting any of these either. You can make the character whatever you want, as long as it makes sense and is ACCURATE.

2) Keep grammar a priority -------- I know that there are many ways to add to a story and that no one is perfect, especially me. I only ask that you do not add an entry that others will have to decipher in order to read it. Just because you can read “test language” as fast as a book, doesn’t mean the rest of us can or would like to. Also, do yourself and everyone else a favor and use spell check. And remember that some document programs need 2 spaces between paragraphs to make 1 on the site. Take notice on your first entry to see if you need to put the extra space in.

3) Keep it interesting --------- This is a no tolerance policy for this interactive. You must keep ALL additions to be at least a paragraph long (Minimum 3 sentences). Absolutely NO one word or line entries. I don’t really care if you have to write out of your but to make up the extra lines but you must fill at least 3. Even if it is a choice based chapter. Entries like “male of female?” or “what about these?” or “more choices” these are not acceptable and will be deleted regardless of what comes after it. Just fill it with something, anything, Quote a poem if you have to just don’t add those small entries that are only good for taking up space and giving more choices. I like reading your stuff not being bogged down with more choices than content. Also, it goes without saying, but sudden stops will also be deleted.

4) Keep your pants on or off ---------- I will allow ANYTHING as far as content is concerned. However you have to keep it realistic and obeying rule 2. Suddenly having the main character have 15 chapters of sex, drugs, and rock’n roll is not cool. Also, I like certain things as much as the next person but suddenly having a blood sucking vampire swallow someone whole is not ok. You can gradually have him/her gain that ability then use it but not a sudden change that is obviously conflicting to the story.

5) Keep it polite ------ I don’t care who you think you are and if you think you are the best thing since sliced bread. If you aren’t going to take a risk and write for yourself then don’t just rip on someone else’s hard work. I will defend those that write and add properly and I am very lenient with my rules when people ask. But ripping on someone for a difference in opinion, style, religion, race, fetish choice, … is not cool and I won’t even bother listening to such a close minded idiot. If on the other hand you have some helpful advice or compliments for someone I will gladly write you back or pass your compliments along, anonymously if desired.

Other than that thanks and have fun.
